formatted_address: 124 E 4th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: La Sultana

reviews.text: One of the best Hookah parlors in town. Hookahs are clean and well prepared with long rubber hoses to ensure the delivery of cooled down smoke. Great spot to relax and catch up with friends or with the latest sporting events.

Much bigger than it appears from the outside, with a back room and a few smaller rooms for private parties. Great ambience and nicely decorated. 
Smoke pulls extremely well from the hookah, but isn't particularly strong. They have odd shaped coals, and the servers don't know to clear the head properly of ash after a few changes of coals. Often, they would just add a new coal without removing the ashy embers of the old. 
Place is cash only.
Owner was very nice, server was not very attentive. Food was good.
Nice place to hangout . No food though. Some good flavors
Awesome place , excellent service and fantastic hookah.just love it
The best hookah I've smoked.  Good service, nice and quiet place.

formatted_address: 276 5th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Bojkot Club Inc.

reviews.text: Ha! What can I say? I've enjoyed this venue on more than one occasion with my bestfriend. Good times and fancy wines! Champagne and photo ops! Brought in the New Year at this spot. But there was one thing that happened by mistake; they charged my card with someone else's bill and it took weeks to be reimbursed.

This was, by far, the best run speed dating, with best quality people, that I have experienced in the NYC area.  It was hard to narrow down the choices!
I am not very outgoing at parties, but this was fun and the conversations kept flowing for 2 hours.
Thanks!

Asian blues show was amazing, great fun. Some of the singers had amazing voices. I'm so tired out paying hella money on some overrated singers concert. I would rather support a local artist and establishment. Great night out
I came here last night for a quirky date night, and in support of a trans friend. We had a great time, and I would recommend coming back here for fun celebrations.
Bojkot took the time to listen to my situation and gave me a few pointers i can use. i really appreciate the time and help.

formatted_address: 70 W 36th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: The Ragtrader & Bo Peep Cocktail and Highball Store

reviews.text: I came here with 2 other friends with a lot of high hopes and high standards as we had read great reviews and had picked this spot with the hopes of having a nice meal. I ordered a steak and both of my friends ordered a burger. They were very unhappy with their burgers and the steak also certainly did not meet my expectations. I had ordered my steak medium and was given a well done steak, which they were kind enough to re-make for me. But even the second steak wasn't good. The fries on the other hand were amazing. Overall I will not be returning to this place again as I believe you have have much better burgers and steaks at other spots in the city.

The "Ragtrader & Bo Peep" is essentially a fusion of a good cocktail bar meant for larger groups and a speak-easy bar for smaller groups. My review talks about my experience at the "Bo Peep Cocktail and Highball Store" and it only pertains to drinks.

Ambience:
This place has the feel of a speak-easy bar and is well suited for smaller groups. The décor's fantastic with the walls having books mounted on them giving you the feel of a library. There's a small bar with seating although not as big as the one upstairs at "Ragtrader".  There's jazz music playing in the background and live Piano performances in the night

Menu:
Very elaborate with a wide range of cocktails classified under different sections. I chose two different drinks from the "STIRRED BOOZY AND SERIOUS" section and both of them were brilliant. Would highly  recommend "BIRDS OF A FEATHER" was a blend of Rum, Vermouth, Vanilla and Cinnamon and"NIGHT TIME AFFAIR" which had Gin, Vermouth and Absinthe and was served in a Goblet

Service:
Our server carefully explained the different nuances of each section and recommended drinks that would suit our tastes and preferences while answering any questions about the menu. .The service was fast and prompt as well although the drinks might feel a tad overpriced at $16 per drink,

All in all,  a wonderful experience. I'm surely going to be back again for more.

Bo Peep was awesome.  The ambiance feels like you've been transported back in time to an old school speakeasy/lounge.  Live piano, outstanding cocktails and great service made this a memorable night in NYC.  Highly recommended.
Very good food. Good beer list. Huge liquor list. Good wine list. Great wait staff. Would go here again and again. Deviled Eggs were awesome.

It's a good restaurant in my opinion.  What automatically earned it at least a star and a half was the decor; it manages to capture classy and whimsical themes and make them work together in harmony.  Stuff like wood paneling and posh chairs mixed with mannequins sporting aristocratic French fashion.  It really was a great atmosphere to eat in.  The service was good, very attentive to little details and such.  I had a hamburger for lunch, which was tasty but not exceptional.  It's Midtown New York so everything is inflated, but I would say that the price was fair for what I got.  Overall, a great choice for taking someone out for lunch that is both nice and won't break the bank.  I would eat here again.

formatted_address: 20 E 76th St, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: Café Boulud

reviews.text: We went there during Restaurant Week and I can say that it was an excellent choice! Everyone was very polite and attentive. The restaurant is elegant and they have a coat check at the entrance which is essential during winter months. All the dishes were beautifully served and were very delicious (especially the chocolate mousse cake!), the portions are not huge but the 3-course lunch was absolutely enough. Only one small thing that could be improved is the bread they served up before the appetizer—it was rather dry. Otherwise highly recommended!

It was a pleasure returning to Café Boulud after several years since my last meal here. We were treated very well and the food was excellent as usual. I especially liked the halibut and my friend had the duck. Everything was artistically plated and the ambiance was beautiful.

I am withholding the fifth star in this review for a small detail in service. I appreciate the attentiveness of the staff as well and noticed some of the junior staff receive some training during our meal. One member of staff nearly gave me the wrong dish and was openly told off and corrected by a more senior staff member. Another came around serving us bread and after declining, came back a minute later to ask again which was a little pushy. I am confident that the junior staff will gain more finesse with experience. That aside, I highly recommend this restaurant for a special occasion!

This place is the one I like best. I visit a lot of restaurants but to this one I keep coming back again and again. The stuff is very friendly and the food they place on your table is so appetizing. I am always happy to have a decent dinner here. Highly recommended.

🇺🇸   Season Greetings 🎄🎁⛄ Happy  🎁 🎄Holidays  🎄 🎁 🎄& A Healthy Happy New Year   20.  🇺🇸-

the Cafe Boulud located at 20 East 76th Street in the The Surrey Hotel is one of my favorite New York City French restaurants, and they participate in the NYC Restaurant Week program.

The quality of the food at Cafe Boulud is always very fresh and quite good. Perfectly prepared.

1 Salad, 1 Cold Tomato Gazpacho and I Chicken Liver Mousse for appetizer, and all was enjoyable.  My entree  was fabulous as per me.  The Trout, perfectly pan fried on the outside, and moist and tender on the inside.

The dessert of Watermelon Sorbet and Blueberry Ice Cream with blueberries was excellent.

 The staff are friendly and polite to say the least, making me and my guests feel nice and relax all the time.  The tables and chairs are very comfortable.

The decor is nice and easy on the eyes, and in a color of comfort.  

There is a work of art on a wall that my guest and I disagreed on.  And the disagreement was what color is the work of art?

We came here for a Saturday brunch. Although it is certainly on the pricier side, the food was delicious with plenty of options to consider. The menu indicates prix fixe for $52 per person, if you prefer no dessert, you can have it for $45. Or, just order a la carte but unclear what individual prices are (not on the menu). The restaurant is part of the Surrey Hotel, but does lack a bit of the Daniel Boulud touch and ingenuity. Pictures are the cauliflower tortellini and the endive salad. Both delicious.

formatted_address: 14 E 47th St, New York, NY 10017, USA
name: Connolly's

reviews.text: This restaurant is the one I like best. I eat in plenty of restaurants but to this one I keep coming back again and again. The team is very amicable and the food they serve is so yummy. I never miss an opportunity to have a nice meal in this place. I recommend this place with pleasure.
Experiences have been mixed, but positive overall. I wouldn't hesitate to bring out-of-town guests here for a pint of Midtown flavor..
Awesome spot to eat some food when in a rush. Their customer service is fast, rates are convenient, great atmosphere. Would recommend to others

It was late at night and the staff here still took great care of us. We had been searching for a place with the kitchen still open, and my grandmother wanted to get off her feet. It was a perfect stop and very comfortable. Delicious as well!

Great bar area and you have to try the Irish red. Good beer to cool down on a hot day.
Food is decent and bar folks friendly.

formatted_address: 182 8th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: ZiZi

reviews.text:
ZiZi's is a lovely Mediterranean restaurant with authentic flavors, tasty drinks, friendly staff, and healthy portions. Although the location appeared to be quite popular, as it was nearly packed to the brim, the hostess was able to be seated at the bar, and I found the front of the house staff to be as attentive as could be all things considered.

I ended up ordering the Chicken shawarma and a Moroccan Tea Party for dinner and loved every bite and sip of it. All of the flavors are strong and present in the meal just as you would expect from excellent Mediterranean food.

The location is pretty convenient if you're in or around Chelsea, and the prices are in alignment with the area. It was a bit on the loud side, but no more than is reasonable in a hopping spot on a Thursday night.
This new spot is looking like a new hot spot! Tasty Mediterranean dishes, friendly service, and just the right vibe. Coming back to try more of these delicious meals!

I am in love with this place! Went for brunch - need to return soon for dinner. Great decor, friendly staff and most importantly, delectable food and drinks. Inventive cocktail list, yummy and creative food and good prices and atmosphere. Looking forward to making Zizi my neighborhood spot.
Great food, excellent vibe and good service. You won't regret coming, all dishes were very tasty and not expensive.
Great food. Service was outstanding and pleasant! If you are in the area and like Mediterranean food this is your place. Great ambient.

formatted_address: 50 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Villa Cemita

reviews.text: Came here for their bottomless brunch with a group of friends and we were not disappointed! The drinks are delicious and not wasted down like some places. The menu had diverse options and all of the food came out timely and delicious. The staff was efficient and friendly. It was a great overall happy and laid back atmosphere.
Had a great time here for my birthday ! Staff was incredibly personable, fun, and attentive. The food was DELICIOUS as well as the drinks. Highly recommend this cash only gem.
I had the duck tacos and the octopus tacos and both were fantastic. The wait staff was friendly and knowledgeable and suggested the perfect cocktail to pair with our tacos. I will be back

It’s a nice little place, the tamale Benedict’s were delicious. The French toast was pretty average. Service was just fine, nothing great. The only complaint is that there were no signs that it’s an only cash place, nor did the waiter mention anything upon arrival, they have an ATM but for anyone who isn’t comfortable using it, it catches you off guard and creates a problem. Will want to return for the tamale Benedict’s, it’s quite unique and rarely heard of!

We tried something new.

We popped into this East Village bar Tex-Mex eatery.  The menu looked promising.  

The restaurant-bar was exceeding noisy. The crowd was 20s and 30s.  The felt the need to be heard 20-30 feet away.  Their conversations were not that interesting....

The menu looked really good.  The descriptions were good, the food not that good.  It was over priced for what was offered.  

There were tons of bones in the duck dishes.  Please be careful when ordering those.

The land and sea fajitas were mostly chicken, onions and peppers.  It lacked flavor.

The mole was pretty good and rich but the bones and piles of duck skin in the serving crock ruined the experience.

The food was okay but we don't feel the need to return.

formatted_address: 851 Dekalb Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11221, USA
name: Teresa salón Corp

reviews.text: Brand new local but great job. 👍

formatted_address: 118 E 116th St, New York, NY 10029, USA
name: Travertino

reviews.text: Great little spot! Dropped by randomly now it's one of my favorites in the area! Delicious pasta and apps, great staff and a nice overall design. Carbonara (pictured) is amazingly tasty. Nice bar to hang out at also + they do brunch.
The food is constantly well prepared and tasty, cashiers hands over great service. I really like how neat it is and vibes. Worth a try.

The food was spectacular! Felt like being back in Italy eating in great company with a glass of wine and dreaming of a summer vacation.
The staff was very polite and helpful!

What an amazing place! Nice and gentle service that make me feel very comfortable. I'm in love of this tasty food. I really like this Italian place. I'm very impressed with everything, definitely I'll come back!!!
Very authentic Italian dishes! Owner and staff are super friendly, fantastic ambience. I definitely will take my date and group gathering there again.

formatted_address: 933 8th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Rumours Bar & Grille

reviews.text: Went on a Wednesday around 6pm and it wasn’t too crowded; the waitress was quick with seating our group of 5. Drinks are much smaller than what you’d get from other bars but still they were really well made. Ordered just some “snacks” with the drinks — French fries, mozzarella sticks, and fried calamari. Preparation wasn’t too long, maybe 20-30 mins to get. Very small and cozy (little expensive, that’s the city) but would definitely return. Great spot!

Absolutely love this place. Its my local whenever I am in Manhattan. The food is tasty especially the bangers and mash, yum! Damian (hope I spelt it correctly), and the crew who work there are an amazing crew. Always making sure you eat and drink well. Highly recommended, very highly.

Nice chilled out atmosphere to just unwind away from the bus times square area. Food was lovely. The only downside it did take a little while for our food to come out and we had to ask twice for where my girlfriends cup of tea was.
Very nice place with a good menu and not super expensive prices. The drinks were well crafted and the food properly cooked and decently priced. I would recommend this place

Bridget made us feel so welcome and couldn't do enough for us. All our questions she made time to help us with as we are visiting New York for our first time. Excellent service, great food and drinks👍

formatted_address: 57 E 55th St #3205, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Friars Club

reviews.text: It is historical club, If you will have an opportunity to visit this place you will like it
First time visit for a meeting, stunning place. Well run. didn't realize it's open to the public
Extremely classy and elegant. Great food with amazing people
Great meeting place that affords one privacy along with excellent food in an elegant ambience.
I like the club. It's nostalgic and new a the same time

formatted_address: 1649 Park Ave, New York, NY 10035, USA
name: Armonie Pizza Bistro

reviews.text: Excellent service, good portions of food, lasagna was magnificent. Will definitely return.

Family restaurant. Best pizza in Harlem that's for sure. The crust is really delicious. Plus the owners are super nice. Very outgoing and friendly. I can bring my kids without a worry. The pastas and stuff are super delicious as well. No complaints.

I've eaten in a lot of restaurants. Armonie Bistro overpriced small portions not such a friendly environment. I felt like I was being rushed out of the restaurant. I would imagine. It was the oldest outside smoking cigarettes. When entering the restaurant the lady took my order. Never cleans her hands The pizza man never cleaned his hands. When I put it to their attention and they got upset. The worst experience I've ever experienced with me and my family If I could get this a 0 star rating I would
Armonie Bistro was pretty amazing the food was great and the service was just as great. They really know how to treat customers well I will definitely be coming back and bringing a few friends.
That pizza was phenomenal and the service is the friendliest you can find. Nothing else needed to say.

formatted_address: 105 Rivington St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Ritual

reviews.text: Great music by DJ Ella.

formatted_address: 24 E 39th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: The Shakespeare

reviews.text: Cozy little English pub and restaurant. Very popular place so gets super crowded during the weekends. The restaurant does take reservations which is highly recommended if you are visiting during peak times. Good food, friendly staff and nice ambience.

The beer selection is good. Not a lot of selections, but they are worth a look. Small space but adds to the charm of the place. The bad part was it was very warm there. So warm in fact that we only had one beer and had to leave. Needed some ventilation.

The Shakespeare is a great little bar and restaurant. It is like going back in time. The restaurant side is small, so when it is full it can be hard to have a conversation, especially with rowdy finance guys.  The mulled wine is the best I have had and the scotch eggs are fantastic!

This is a great place! The drinks are awesome, the food is simple and delicious. My only stipulation is that the ramp is so steep that I nearly flew to the moon. The 2 steps to get to the inner bar wasn't terrible for me but it may not work for someone who uses a wheelchair or someone who can't step up the two steps. So if you can manage the ramp and two steps, you'll be fine. I didn't use the bathroom while I was there, so I don't know but maybe next time!
Great find. Love the atmosphere.  Found my little standing nook.  LOL.

formatted_address: 230 E 30th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: St Charles Place

reviews.text:
If you have a top 15 things to do in Manhattan, PUT THIS ON YOUR LIST
You'll come for the company, the ambience, and food (all sampled local!) and you'll stay because you'll realize that no other place has treated you so well and made you feel at home.

Hospitality 10/10
Staff 10/10
Eats 11/10
Charles WOW Factor 7/10. He's seen better days
This is a very fine establishment. Service is top notch, and is always a delight to meet people here.
Top notch. Hard to find and hard to leave.

formatted_address: 505 E 6th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Club Cumming

reviews.text: LOVE this place. Came to see a friend perform and it was excellent. Paul Shaffer band leader of the David letterman show was also present. And just before we got here, Michael Musto had a knitting show there.

We got here at Midnight on a Monday. They do a fun music night on Mondays and I loved it! Show tunes and piano! Adult and LGBT friendly. No cover on Mondays. We had an excellent time! Would recommend 100%.

Fun, chill bar - youngish queer crowd, but everyone is welcome, and feels welcomed.
Creative performers, great vibe, cool bartenders!
cosy local bar that surprises every time you go. great staff
Great vibe, the smoke machine and lights give it a vintage vibe. Great, unique performances, community feeling.

formatted_address: 120 Hudson St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Bubby's

reviews.text: So good. This place is consistently very good. The recent redesign makes it more spacious for sure. Do prefer it for breakfast/brunch... that is the more appropriate menu. Pancakes and ‘Abe Lincoln’ are particularly good menu choices. Bloody Mary is great if you’re drinking. Also there is a vintage photo booth machine downstairs. Enjoy!

Met a good friend for breakfast last Sunday...she recommended Bubby's.  Met at 9:30 am - sharp.  After 10 am, the line starts and goes out the door.  Terrific place.  Lively at breakfast with those who love this meal!  Pancakes with fried chicken was suggested - I did not have to think twice about the choice, but I did give serious consideration to homemade biscuits with white sausage gravy - definitely next time!  Superb coffee - rich, dark, strong...we had a wonderful time...food was excellent,  service too!  Looking forward to my next breakfast at Bubby's, and at 11 am when we left - the line was down the block!  That speaks volumes as to how good this little bit of goodness is !!!

Looking forward to an awesome pancakes breakfast with our family (two adults, five year old, newborn) we made our way from Brooklyn to this place. Once we arrived we got told that we can’t bring our stroller with our newborn in. We offered to fold the stroller - no chance. We had to leave without breakfast and a really sad son, who was looking for his pancake feast. I believe this is a cool place but not recommended for families.
I visited this restaurant with my family. we really like their food and their service. Their staff made our experience unforgettable. Definitely recommend it to others.
It was SUPERB to say the least! The atmosphere...the service...THE FOOD....some of the best pancakes and biscuits I've ever had....I will definitely be coming back each and every time.

formatted_address: 1325 5th Ave, New York, NY 10029, USA
name: Maxwell's

reviews.text: Maxwell's was a great experience. Food was quality, service was very good. It did take 300 min for our food to come out, but the wait was worth it.the fish and chips provided a meal and a half. The tuna burger was filling, but lacked cohesive flavors. The chicken sandwich did not last long. Quite tasty! Would definitely go back again. Great atmosphere and just a quick walk from the park
Overall great experience, reasonable price and very good food. I would definitely recommend checking this place out.
Super easy to find. Food was pretty good - the artichoke dip was killleerr good.
Decent vibe. You’d expect a bar / restaurant next to Central Park to have more variety. Menu needs enhancement.
Food is good. Service a bit slower. Loud room... acoustics are not great so 3 tables next to each other makes enough noise as a sports bar....

formatted_address: 520 Court St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Travel Bar

reviews.text: This place has 300+ whiskeys, not a joke. When I was there, the bartender was well versed in whiskeys and was more than happy to help me make a choice. They have the bar to sit at as well as some tables.
Fabulous cocktails and always a great time. Mike and Bill know their whisky!!
The atmosphere is awesome.  The owner and staff are super friendly and helpful.
Great selection, fun drinks, knowledgeable bartenders. Highly recommend
Wandered in by accident and was very pleasantly surprised to find a knowledgeable and enthusiastic proprietor who clearly loves and has an appreciation for his wares. Awesome place.

formatted_address: 134 Reade St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Restaurant Marc Forgione

reviews.text:
Awesome vibe, excellent food all around and great service. Might be somewhat pricier than other similar places but totally worth it.

Tip: everything was delicious but the chicken wings were amazing.

The staff! The drinks! The food! Is all top shelf! Pretty impressive cocktail menu here. More impressive was I couldn't stop after having just one. The food selection is perfect! Not an overwhelming amount of options which is a good sign they do a few things and they do them very well. We had the porterhouse steak for two. It was as delicious as it was beautiful in the presentation. Great appetizers, great wine list, great desserts, great coffee. I'm happy to have found this fine dining experience in Tribeca

Absolutely decadent experience from the moment I walked in the door. The ambiance is beautiful. The service was 2nd to none. Sushi was 11/10. The bartender Christina was completely helpful with the dishes as well as cocktail choices. Jason the front of house manager made my experience top notch. Chef Doug came out table side to assure all dishes were as expected. Will be back and will be referring all friends and family visiting NYC.

Our waiter was great from the start. The butternut squash soup is AMAZING. Also ordered the Brussels sprouts which were delicious. My mother in law had got us a mimosa flight which includes a bottle of champagne and a mixture of 3 juices. Great deal! Can't wait to come back.

This is my favorite restaurant I have ever been to in the world. Whenever I go to New York I absolutely have to go here. Ambience and atmosphere is awesome, is cozy and intimate, yet down home. Food is always fresh with great flavors and presentation. Service is attentive, informed and friendly but not the hovering type. And great cocktails and wine selection. The food is pleasing to both foodies and others who want good food and options.

formatted_address: 1375 Broadway, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Bluestone Lane Garment District Coffee Shop

reviews.text: Interesting location on 37 street. They have upstairs sitting area but I wasn’t crazy about it. I stopped during the week and my latte was good. However, on the weekend, my latte was off. The taste and foam was off. And there was no design.

Great location, but even better people run this location.  I stop in multiple times per week and always created warmly.  Such a nice perk vs how low service levels are for other coffee shops within NYC.  Service and experience are the differentiations that create loyalty, and this location is reliably pleasant.
A great taste of Australia in Manhattan. Friendly staff, great food, amazing coffee all it’s missing from Sydney or Melbourne depending on your opinion is the weather - but this is nyc after all :)

I love Bluestone Lane coffee! Their espresso-based drinks are amazing due to the quality ingredients and because each barista is so passionate about their craft. Meech, Mel, Alden, Jessica and the rest of the team know exactly how to brew and pour each drink so that it exceeds your expectations. They are also so friendly and welcoming each morning. It makes my day! I definitely recommend making this coffee shop a part of your coffee routine!

I happen to think this is an excellent Bluestone Lane location. I find the staff here to be friendly and welcoming, the atmosphere is lovely, and coffee and food offerings are delicious!

There is some seating on the main level, but there is a whole attic seating area up a small staircase. Adds to the cute vibe of this location. 

My favorites are the cold brew (add oat milk!) and the Banana Toast (so good)!

Download their app for a $5 credit!

formatted_address: 107 W 68th St, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Pat's Final Resting Place

reviews.text: Incredible. Amazing. Beautiful. Pat was the best soul. Fly high sweet angel, I'll join you one day.

Pat was a big alpha chad and deserves to be respected with honor and a paper towel vigil.

May he rest in your anchovy pizza.

formatted_address: 341 St Nicholas Ave, New York, NY 10027, USA
name: Maison Harlem

reviews.text: Awesome french cuisine in Harlem. Happy Hour is a steal! Get the oysters!

What a great first time dining experience! We didn't have any reservations but we still tried. Lucky for us, we got seated quickly on a Saturday evening.

The vibe was really chill. Great for a dinner date and drinks or with a group of friends.

The truffle mac and cheese whetted our appetite. It smelled really good. It was sublime.

I ordered the Demi Poulet because I saw the other table being served and the scent just wafted to our table and I just had to have it. Great choice! It was very tender, juicy, and seasoned well.

My Bub’s New York shell steak was cooked Medium Rare. He complimented how the crust outside was perfect!

The serving portions were just right for the price and quality. You won't feel short-changed.

Service was pleasant and quick! Our server was very affable.

Worth trying their brunch menu next time!
Great little bistro Harlem. Delicious food and huge portions! Best French onion soup since my last visit to Paris.
Old French style food. Really good and tasty. The drinks where good too and an excellent staff
Solid menu choices. The food was good. The staff was great and friendly. The bar and restaurant are nice to sit in. The decor is cool as hell and makes you feel right at home

formatted_address: 50 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Emmett's

reviews.text: As far as I know, this is the only spot to get good Chicago-style pizza in NY. It's small and busy, so plan on arriving early and putting your name down. On my last visit, I was pleasantly surprised to learn that they serve excellent thin crust pizza too! We had a thin crust pie as an appetizer and a deep-dish pie for the main course, a combination which I'd recommended highly.
The food is amazing! The restaurant is small and cozy. Be aware it does take 30-40 mins for your pizza to be made. However, definitely worth it if you're not in a rush. Definitely a must try!
Deep dish or this crust are both great. But I go there specifically for the deep dish. Curated wine selection! Very friendly and phenomenal service!

Really nice little place, intimate and fresh. You have to wait for 30 minutes for the deep dish to be cooked, but definitely worth the wait. You can chat, have some hand cooked crisps and try there many beers. Nice staff and you will have pizza to take home and eat later. Yum. Give it some hype

Justin, is phenomenal! Additionally, I arrived in the nick of time to order a delicious burger that he recommended. Justin even assured me that the rat hanging on the curb just wanted to bum a smoke. Philly women definitely aren't use to that! Can’t wait to visit the city again and Emmet’s! 💪🏽

formatted_address: 1321 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: Whiskey & Wine Off 69

reviews.text: Went in on a recommendation from one of the folks from our bourbon/whiskey group and was very impressed with the selection!  Staff helped me pick out some solid recommendations and I was very surprised to see that they aren't one of the liquor stores who mark everything up to the secondary market price!
Joe & Chris are knowledgeable, witty, and over the top friendly. They’ve got a great selection and competitive pricing. We’ll be back to stock up soon.

A slightly fancier liquor store than most, but still has a very wide variety of all different types of alcohol all over the world, so I was quite impressed. Staff was also very helpful and kind. Keep it up

Terrific selection of small batch whiskeys as well as the big mass market whiskeys and a friendly and knowledgeable staff. An ok selection of wines. I enjoy coming in and getting their opinions. Support your local small merchant!
Great wine selection with friendly, and helpful staff.

formatted_address: 225 Liberty St Suite 247, New York, NY 10281, USA
name: Umami Burger

reviews.text: I ordered the Cali burger and amazed how good it was. Than I ordered the same burger 2 more times in same week and they did not put 3 ingredients in my last 2 order which is American cheese and tomatoes and onions that the burger has in it’s original recipe. Food came cold and fries box was half full in my last 2 order. I will never order again.

I had a BOGO deal for their new chicken menu. I ordered their Sam’s Crispy sandwich and taco salad with crispy chicken. There was only one cashier during lunch on a Saturday. She was really nice and calm but didn’t know what the promo was so went to get help. Together they figured it out.

They packaged my salad and sandwich so well- I love the handle where the box fits on top. I ate the sandwich right away and it was Sooo crispy, it blows Popeyes, Bobwhite and Fuku out of the water. The Cole slaw wasn’t leaking out like some sandwiches, and bun was kinda sweet which I liked. I wish I would’ve ordered it Diablo style though. Salad was great and tasty with well prepared ingredients including pickled onions and roasted tomatoes, I wish there was more tortillas crisps though to make it more Taco-y.

I used to eat at umami burger near Greenwich all the time before it closed. All I can say is that it is not the umami I knew. They ask how they want the burger but they never cook it right at this joint. I have eaten here 3 times, despite me saying medium I have always gotten it well done. The truffle fries were not thin and was regular fat cut fries instead of the promised thin ones. 

Garbage compared to the restaurants that were once open. Definitely not worth the 14-15 dollar burger anymore. They never give you sauces unless you ask.

I don’t know what people are talking about when there is service, this is a fast food joint and nobody serves you, you just collect it and go...

This place has gone way down hill. Even when there is no lines or orders in sight, it’s takes forever to get your food. When you do get it, it’s cold! Chicken sandwich was salty, dry and cold. Manly fries was also salty and bacon was so cold you can see the congealed fat. The only thing that doesn’t seem to disappoint is their truffle burger. Staff doesn’t seem to care about quality either, they said the food is “suppose to like that, it’s not suppose to be hot.” Come here if you don’t mind waiting for a burger but stay away from everything else.
Good flavorful burgers, the truffle fries are totally delicious and their house sauces are a must try.

formatted_address: 14 E 60th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Avra Madison Estiatorio

reviews.text:
It’s no surprise that another Tao Group restaurant is well received; however, this one won’t get a fifth star from me despite serving some good Greek cuisine (note that I didn’t say “great”).

My standard for Tao is high, so I’m going to be critical where I feel it’s due and that’s in two areas. The first being the unnecessary tightness of seating upstairs during lunch when the entirety of the downstairs is empty (particularly around the entrance, yikes). For the price (I don’t care that lunch is a prefix), I’m not impressed. While the service was on par, I didn’t appreciate being stacked on top of other patrons. It feels like management is trying to squeeze every drop of revenue from every sq ft of space and that’s not the fine dining atmosphere that the Tao Group usually emits.

My second issue is the food was inconsistent. A delicious grilled steak sat on my table next to an average “fish of the day.” Simply don’t offer a fish of the day if that’s the best you can do. Even the presentation was lackluster. An amazing baklava, perhaps the best I’ve had, was delivered with a pedantic chocolate-yogurt cheesecake.

The nearby competition is too good to not be held to a high standard.

Good... maybe very good, but not great.
A great midtown place to escape. The appetizers were good, homemade pita chips. Main was good but not good enough,  I expected more

We had the most wonderful dining experience at Arva Madison.  Our waitress Alena was superb.  She made such great suggestions and her service was impeccable.  The Halibut was delicious as well as all of the other dishes we tried. The entire night was amazing.  Highly recommend when you visit NYC!

Delicious dinner.  I was with a party of 9.  We shared appetizers and dessert and also had our own meals. The fish was superb and we also had the tuna and salmon tartare. Even the cocktails were great and so were the after dinner drinks. The staff was very nice and accommodating and served us incredibly all night. They have a nice staff to check your coat and umbrella. I personally had blackened salmon and some vegetables. I would recommend trying the olive oil cake for dessert. It has a lemon taste to it.

Food quality tapers off at 5 star plus once you start visiting restaurants in certain areas. Then you begin comparing details of service, cleanliness, and most of all, the quality of clients. Avra exceeded on all respects on Black Friday. Highly recommended.

formatted_address: 151 Atlantic Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Beasts & Bottles

reviews.text:
I hadn't been to Beasts And Bottles since it opened and was pleasantly surprised. Not blown away but dinner was tasty. We had a decent if not inspired endive salad. I really liked the duck with the dates and chestnuts. It reminded me a little of BBQ. My boyfriend enjoyed the fried chicken although he didn't love the Mac and cheese. The Brussels sprouts seemed over fried, but they were still good to eat. Oh, and I rolled my eyes over my boyfriend ordering the milk and cookies, but I had to eat my attitude... and drown it in milk. They're good!

We sat at the bar which I'd recommend over sitting at one of the pokey tables in the window. It was our bartender's first day and he was earnest and charming and took great care of us.

I adore this place! They serve delicious food, their menu is rich, The cook in that restaurant is very experienced, I like a lot tasting all their food. The food is always of high class, the attitude towards the guests  is friendly. I often go to  this place and I was never disappointed.  I highly recommend it.

Everything about this place is beautiful and reminiscent of old Parisian cafes. I've been wanting part this place for years and finally convinced my husband to book a table for Valentine's day. There was a pre-set menu and everything we ordered was delicious. The only reason I'm giving this place a 4 star rating is because of the music. It was giving me a headache the whole time we were there. I would have preferred something more mellow and easy sounding that would have been more appropriate for Valentine's.
I like this restaurant very much. theres a unique ambiance. The meals are marvelous. the service is effective and the crew is very professional. The price is honest. I highly recommend.

was there yesterday, everything was very great. had pork shank and smoked duck for main and 3 appetizer: inked squid, scallops and octopus. squid was our favorite - but all of them were nicely presented and perfectly prepared. pork was pretty good sized and falling off the bone. will definitely be back for more !

formatted_address: 900 7th Ave, New York, NY 10106, USA
name: Trattoria Dell'Arte

reviews.text: This is a beautiful place for great Italian food!! Their service is impeccable and quick. Good selection of wine and out of this world desserts! Good for an intimate setting or for a group of people. And ask about the art. It's great!!!

I loved the things we tried in here. The only bad thing about this place is you wait a lot because they are crazy busy. Other than that food is unbelievably tasty. I think I had the best thin crust pizza in my life.

This place is vegetarian friendly. The margarita pizza was a thin crust pizza and this is one of the real thin crust pizzas  I have ever had.

My friend ordered a watermelon salad. After a ride on a bicycle in Central Park, a bite of it also  felt refreshing!

What a wonderful spot - a full but not boring Italian menu reasonable prices and huge portions with a friendly and knowledgable staff. Great comfort Italian food but also some special things that will appeal to anyone who wants something more authentic or different. Great flavors. The best part is the decor, which features giant human body parts in a white marble style. We tried to sit under the breast but got the ear.

This place is very overpriced. It draws people who have shows to go to nearby (like Carnegie Hall) and charges them ridiculous amount of money for barely mediocre dishes. We tried their lasagna, lobster carbonara, and red snapper. The lasagna was discolored and very mushy and tasted like it had been sitting on the hot plate for hours. The red snapper was OK but on the salty side. The carbonara was probably the best out of the three dishes we ordered. These were all around $35. But the quality only warranted around $20 at best.

The service was poor as well. One of us got seated first, and was waiting for the rest of the group for nearly 10 minutes, but they didn't offer water until we were all seated. Our server was aloof and uninterested in our dining experience. The only time he did seem interested was when he was pushing a tray of display-only desserts to try to sell us even more overpriced bad dishes.

I'd rather practice intermittent fasting than return to this tourist trap.

formatted_address: 9 Maiden Ln, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: La Parisienne

reviews.text: Nice little French restaurant with friendly staff. The salmon sandwich was tasty and the atmosphere was wonderful. I tried the almond croissant  and I wish there were more almond paste in it. Otherwise a great place to go and have a nice meal.
They offer a vast variety of delicious food. I enjoy eating here. Staff members are always welcoming, prices are reasonable and the place is always kept clean.

A truly wonderful French cafe in New York! My wife and I stumbled across this restaurant on our way back from the 911 museum and had a fabulous lunch. Don't pass up an opportunity to have a fresh baked in house chocolate chip cookie, they're spectacular!
This little place had delicious food!  A little bit of Parisienne casual dining.  The cookies were amazing too!  Highly recommend a visit.

I was not expecting much from this place. Originally we had Intended to go to Happy hour at Malt House. Once we saw how malt house was packed, we went right next door and had a very pleasant time drinking wine and partaking in some good appetizers. The wine was great and the food was great. Highly recommend as a place to converse.

formatted_address: Columbia St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: The Valence Shell

formatted_address: 90 Water St, New York, NY 10005, USA
name: Bluestone Lane Water Street Coffee Shop

reviews.text: I got the iced latte. It was DELICIOUS!  Friendly service and good atmosphere! Cute place will def. go back!

Definetly worth stopping into. The cutest little environment, and the drinks are delicious. I get a large iced chai ($4) and I love it. There are a few downtown, and the prices are great!  Like really good!!
Delicious breakfast coming from sweet hands .. loved it 🌸❤
Nice avocado toast. Poor service.

After many different coffee shops around the city I finally found the perfect shop!

Upon entering you can tell from the aroma that the beans have been properly roasted. I ordered a long black (basically an americano), my wife got a latte and our son got a hot chocolate. All of them were wonderful. I will definitely be back.

formatted_address: 276 5th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Vector Management

formatted_address: 260 Java St, Brooklyn, NY 11222, USA
name: Sera Phi

reviews.text: Awesome new hidden gem in Greenpoint. Much needed spot for music and dancing
A new hidden gem in Greenpoint Brooklyn. Great sound and cool vibe venue keeps having special live music events!
Promising new venue!
The owner of this place is really cool. I Can't wait 2 do business with him. If your into good energy and positivity. Call sera phi
Fun place for shows and gatherings

formatted_address: 231 S 4th St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: DOS31 Cocina + Bar

reviews.text: Good Dominican food. Nice atmosphere freindly staff
Nice little place, Latin music and good food. $15 beer bucket if interested
I love the place, the food, the staff,  excellent service and I love Karaoke on sundays so much fun

I've been to a lot of Spanish restaurants and I definitely have to give DOS31 Cocina Bar 5 stars.  If I could give it 10 stars, I would!  My experiences there have been nothing but positive.  The owners are super nice and try to make you feel like you're part of their family.  I enjoy the quality of food - definitely 5-star quality - and the timely service is excellent.  Make sure you go there with a big appetite and be ready to go home with a doggy bag because the portions of food are enormous and their prices are the best around. They also have bottomless drink brunch specials - the dishes are delicious and the drinks are even better.  The best Passion Fruit Mimosas ever!! They also have different events including karaoke Sundays which is always fun for everyone involved, especially the brave customers who take on the challenge.  DOS31, thank you for your SERVICE and keep up the GREAT WORK!!  -  ********** 10 stars from me to you!
I'm glad that they have made the place brighter.  Food is delicious and great customer service.

formatted_address: 43 Murray Street, New York, NY 10007, USA
name: Woodrow's

reviews.text: I wandered into Woodrow's just to grab a quick beer as it looked like a laid back place. I stayed a lot longer than expected after meeting some great new people with interesting conversation. The drinks are reasonably priced and the food is pretty good.

Woodrow’s 

Great spot in TriBeCa to grab lunch. We had the lunch special, a burger with chips, and a drink for $10. Food was actually pretty good for the quality of the food and the area. Definitely coming back for happy hour.

Love this place! I have been twice with friends and family, enjoyed myself both times. It seems to get better each time, the last bartender was amazing! Only thing was I didnt like the food too much but, we didn't go to eat as we had already had food at a restaurant near. I recommend this bar if you want to have a couple of drinks and a good time.

We had our company holiday party here and the downstairs space was perfect for it! The staff was so kind and welcoming, the drink prices were so reasonable for Tribeca, and the food was solid. Great place for a casual event with a big group!

This is a pretty cool bar. They have happy hour specials all day. I enjoyed the rum punch. The people i was with enjoyed the food and I will be back to try their black bean burger next time. Also they have a back area for large groups and the have televisions at the bar along with tables with stools. Overall, this is a cool after work spot for drinks and good food.

formatted_address: 279 Grand St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Maracuja Bar and Grill

reviews.text: GREAT BAR! MET A FEMALE WITH BLONDE HAIR AND A FUNNY NEKLACE SHE LAUGHED AT ALL MY JOKES! 5 STARS!
They don't take credit card and the bar tender acts like I'll run without paying the bill
Cash only. Pool table. Loud but fun.
Google would not allow me to write this review. Marijuana is not simply a bar. It is a family to me, as well as a Williamsburg institution.
Pool table is amazing. Owners are the staff and it's dope.

formatted_address: c/o EastSide Sound, 150 Forsyth St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: SkyHigh Sound

formatted_address: 1123 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10065, USA
name: El Porrón

reviews.text: Great service.  Great food. Albariño is there too. Not cheap and worth it.

This is a very nice spot for a date or a family celebration. The restaurant is candle lit and has a lovely atmosphere. The service here is very good and they explain the menu and how long it would take for your food to be served. One of the waiters even drank the bottle of oil.

I found the food to be expensive without justify the taste. A bottle of sparkling water is around $8 so watch out for that. The paella was okay but it was small, expensive, and took a very long time to make. The rice also stuck to the cast iron. We tried both the paella valencia ($32) and the seafood paella ($34) and they tasted pretty much the same.

However I loved the calamari. It was exquisite and surprisingly soft without being chewy. Honestly, it was the first time I had calamari this good.

This is a nice restaurant.  Good vibe and quite busy for an early Saturday dinner.  The food was good (not great, but not bad, right in the middle), we just ordered 5 tapas.  The service was great and very attentive.  For the price, I didn’t think it was a great value, it was on the pricey side for the type of quality.  There were other items in the menu that looked interesting that we would like to try if we return.

I've been coming here for the last few years and it remains one of my favorite restaurants in NYC. I usually stick to drinks and tapas, but the entrees are outstanding as well. Beyond the quality of the food, the atmosphere is always lively and feels authentically Spanish. Finally, the service is top notch; you almost feel like a guest in someone's home. You will not be disappointed!
Great selection of tapas, with a cozy environment. The service was superb with a myriad of drinks to choose from.

formatted_address: 316 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Pappardella

reviews.text: Not bad... maybe yesterday was an off day as my past couple of times there the food  and service was better.. yesterday the food was a bit bland and the service was... not great. Always love  the atmosphere,  it's a nice neighborhood restaurant that's been there forever so i want to be kind,  give them a shot.. again yesterday probably an off day,  in the past would've given them a solid 4.

Ordered two pizzas for take out. $40.  Waited ages for collection and pizza was worst I’ve had in NYC - TINY and lacking in any flavor. Have had far better pizza at a fraction of the price.  Other reviews suggest this may be a good place to dine in, but don’t get take-out!

The food is AMAZING quality and price for the area that it's in! The waiters are nice and the place has such a nice ambiance to it! The portions of food are just right; small enough that you can handle a 3-course meal while not feeling overly stuffed. The latte is really good, and the food options are pretty fancy. The food and the restaurant and the music they play had a really rustic Italian feel to it! 11/10 would definitely come back. ♥️
The food was great! My friend has celiac disease and got a gluten free menu with lots of options! We both loved our food.

I visited pappardella last fall and  loved everything about this restaurant. The food was perfectly cooked and presented. The hostess was a joy to meet. And no doubt an asset to the restaurants employers. No matter where my hotel will be situated on my next visit, I'll be making an effort to eat at this restaurant again.

formatted_address: 502 Grand St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Mcondo Los Tacos

reviews.text: This place has the best nachos ever! Literally have never had anything better and I order here so much that my Seamless account sends me weekly notifications reminding me to order again. Keep up the great work!
A fine establishment with tacos and alcohol need I say more.... bartenders are fantastic. Food is delish. I had fish tacos but ate them b4 I could take a pic! Highly recommend this place!
My firt time nd from now on my place🤗🤗😘 I have the nacho plate Delicious and the margarita good....was looking for a place like this around my neighborhood...
I love the nachos here. They are something special. The food here is just really good period.
It's above average Mexican food. Which means I would return, but there is better. Staff is very friendly and nice though!!

formatted_address: 141 Broadway, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: OTB

reviews.text:
I was fine with my cocktails here, but nobody else in my party was and honestly - none were worth the time. 

Everything seemed pretty cheap though, and the accoutrements were beautiful. The lime is especially lovely. I'd go someplace else next time, but this is an acceptable option if nothing else is open.

A great local bar and diner, named OTB (I was told) because it's in the site of a former off-track betting office. 
I went on a Monday night, and was lucky enough to take advantage of their $1 oysters, plus a hot chicken sandwich (fried chicken in a bun), plus a beer.  
The staff were welcoming, friendly, great fun to talk to, and also make superb cocktails. A gem!
Typical Williamsburg hipster spot. Pretty cool decor/atmosphere with so-so food. I must say the $1.00 Oysters are a hit and worth coming in for with a drink.
Fantastic service...fast and friendly

Big beautiful space, awesome interior, very friendly staff. This American bistro and cocktail bar was a great discovery when we where walking on Broadway. 

When you order wine, it comes in a small carafe so that you can pour it yourself, which I love. I ordered the escargots with mushroom purée, garlic, parsley and lemon butter. My food was delicious. They have great deals for Happy Hour and Late Night Dollar Oysters.

formatted_address: 24 9th Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Kobrick Coffee Co.

reviews.text: Super cozy cafe and a perfect place to catch some winter sun while sipping a cuppa. Very well laid out cafe with lots of plants giving a homely look and very clean place in general. They have a dedicated water station too. Loos are clean and the staff is very kind and polite. One less star is just because the food wasn't very great but their tomato soup is definitely something you should try.

Kobrick’s new, larger expansion next to their dark and cozy original spot is fantastic. It’s big, bright, has fantastic coffee (my favorite iced latte in the city) and is a fresh spot to meet people or do some laptop work as well. There are tons of seats, with bar seating against the window, 4 2-person tables in the front and room for another 20 people in the back, where they have a swinging chair too. Love the decor, with exposed brick and plants everywhere. Truly a great spot that you will enjoy frequenting for a multitude of uses. Love this place!!
What a unique spot! Drinks were superb and sitting at the bar was an experience! The cocktails are expertly crafted.  I will definitely return during the day to compare the vibe. Overall, LOVED it!

My first experience af Kobrick Coffee was good. I only had a latte with oat milk to go and my friend got an espresso.
The place is very cozy and spacious.
Will go back to enjoy it more!
Cute little coffee shop with two sides. One of which has a bar. Its also Right around the corner from Chelsea Market which is really nice. Ill def be returning soon.

formatted_address: 128 Metropolitan Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Elite Williamsburg Restaurant & Lounge

reviews.text: Amazing calamari and scallops, tender and fresh, cooked to perfection. great cocktails, Peruvian cuisine or influence. Would like to try other things on the menu, the appearance is that of some trendy club, but it is a cool place, very relaxed atmosphere

Friendly staff and gorgeous interior and exterior! The rooftop is spacious and is a great spot to chill and listen to music. This place is going to be the bomb!! Great space for parties, events, friends and family gatherings for all occasions so make ELITE Williamsburg your next destination!!

Had dinner here with my husband and was very impressed. The staff were very polite and attentive and the food was absolutely incredible. I got the rissotto which was delicious and my husband got the chicken dish which was beautifully seasoned. All in all everything was very tasteful. We are definitely going back and recommending to friends!

This is an up and coming hotspot that fulfills the needs for foodies and those interested in getting their dance on. The restaurant and staff are on top of their game. The Peruvian cuisine was exquisite and highly recommend
Excellent service! Very tasty and delicious food👍

formatted_address: 177 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Grotta Azzurra

reviews.text: A truly authentic Italian restaurant. Great food, friendly and efficient service. We were part of a very large group of several tables and they were great! Saw a very large group go to the basement room and were surprised how quickly they got served. Highly recommend!

CHECK YOUR RECEIPT!!!

Waitress did not serve. Snappy responses, and no service! We paid for our check and my husband wanted to leave her cash — so he paid the check using their iPad — he SIGNED for the amount and selected NO TIP.  As we were leaving he handed her undeserved tip and ask for his receipt! She tried to make an excuse and didn’t want to give him the receipt — he pressured her to give him the receipt and guess what? SHE ADDED her 15% tip to the Already signed bill! REMEMBER he selected NO TIP.  So she was going to pocket the cash and take the tip!! Isn’t that stealing???

Food wise — Olive Garden has better food.  Bread was cold and hard — no Olive Oil?? Chicken salty, no table service!, ravioli ok.. but have had better!! Pizza... this isn’t authentic Italian... pizza was doughy and just slapped together!

Bottom line this is a Tourist trap.

Sorry people.  We have traveled the world and have had exponentially better food and service and definitely NEVER had our waitress steal from us!!

I ordered a basic pizza with ham and they dare to charge $20 for that,  by far the most expensive pizza, which would have been fine, but it was also the worst pizza I ever had (in a restaurant). 

The crust was way to dry and crispy, parts were burnt black. I was very small too (in the USA, really, small???). Cheese was too salt, and the dough had no taste at all, very blend.

To top it off, nobody looked at me when I tried to say something, staff was simply not paying attention. 

And then, when I dared not to tip, they exhaled and without asking me why said 'wow, no tip?"
I explained the food was 'not good' (trying to be nice, it was horrible!!) and the answer was 'thanks for stopping by". Another opportunity to improve wasted....

I am just amazed how in a city with so many good food choices, a restaurant like this is able to survive. Probably because they aggressively try to talk people into their restaurant (always a bad sign, I should have known and can only blame myself).

I have to give at least one star in Google which I will give to Peroni, what a great beer!

Food is mediocre but the servers are extremely dishonest. I asked for my check and received a check with a 20% gratuity automatically added to the bill. I did not think they deserved the 20% that they effectively stole from me. If you see Grotta Azzurra run the opposite direction because these are real thieves.

The service was outstanding,  my daughter and I was in NYC for a short trip and decided that's where we would have dinner. We were treated like family from the time we stepped inside. Our meal was delicious to say the least. We would both recommend Grotta Azzurra to anyone looking for a small friendly Italian Restaurant.

formatted_address: 242 Flatbush Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217, USA
name: Woodland

reviews.text: The best part about this place was our waitress Jennifer. She was great!!! She made sure to keep the mimosas coming. So if you go ask for Jennifer. There are some areas I feel like this place could improve on. 1. I think the communication for the staff could be way better. I went on a day where bottomless mimosas was advertised until 8pm but when we got there two different workers said bottomless ended at 5pm. It was quite annoying. 2. When we got there we had to wait for 45 minutes to get in the door and then an hour to get seated. I’m ok with the waiting part but I feel like once you enter the door you should be shown to your seats. My friends had the chicken and waffles. From what I was told it is nothing out of this world but the chicken is crunchy and boneless. My friend felt that the chicken could use more flavor and the syrup was amazing!!

I started going years ago when it first opened. I even rented the space previously for an event.
The food and drinks are both good overall all. The restaurant now seems to cater to a more "trendy crowd" which is not necessarily a bad thing.
I was there this weekend and the music was good but EXTREMELY loud which make it challenging to have a conversation with my friends. The staff was nice but after taking our order our server never returned until our meals were done to check in on us.
I like having the option of good restaurants in BK so I hope these is fixable things.

First time, went with coworkers. Great after work spot! Caribbean vibe, Good food(oxtail spring rolls!!), Good drinks(Rum Punch and Rosemary something) Could use less ice & larger highball glasses needed😁). 

Turned into a club on the lower level. Great music, just more appropriate for 20/25yr olds.
We'll be back for the food and drinks!
Great food. Great drinks. Meals go for almost $20 each. Club-like atmosphere inside. Quiet outdoor patio.

Great atmosphere! Fun place! Great food! Amazing prices! 
Long wait if you don’t have reservations, but totally worth it!

formatted_address: 25 Meadow St, Brooklyn, NY 11206, USA
name: Secret Garden

formatted_address: 314 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: A.O.C. L'aile ou la Cuisse

reviews.text: The restaurant is very cozy and has a great atmosphere. The wine selection is great, but the food is generally average. I try the steak tartar at every french restaurant I go to -- and here it was generally average. The fries and dip (mayo-based)  were delicious! I recommend this place for a meet at the bar for happy hour situation.
A West Village staple with fine French fare.
Great French restaurant, very romantic and staff was very nice and helpful. My pasta was delicious and the Mac and cheese was out of this world! The garden is beautiful.

Charming authentic neighborhood French bistro feel. 

Decor and ambiance reminds me of the off-the-beaten path restaurants in Paris... a place that isn't on Yelp or tourist review sites, but should be.. except that it would get overrun and lose its je ne sais quoi. So let's keep it a secret. ;-) 

Solid menu options with excellent nods to French cuisine. Loved the Poulet-Ratatouille be Merguez de Barbes.

Love that the staff treats the local regulars like family. We witnessed an older gay couple (it is in the Village after all) being spoken to and doted on with such attention and care by the owner, manager and wait staff. It warmed my heart to also hear the everyone say, "See you tomorrow!" as the couple left.

Definitely going to come back and make it a regular spot for us too!

Cute little restaurant in the heart of west village. Lots of NYC locals. Very loud New Yorkers (in good way). The hostess didn’t really know what she was doing but nobody seemed to care. 
The DJ had the volume blast at moments and then go all the way down. Who knows? Clearly a party (a bad one! LOL). 
My risotto was undercooked and pretty tasteless. But, my friend told me his salmon was great. 
As an experience i guess you can find similar around the neighborhood, but with staff that has it together.

formatted_address: 63 Bedford St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Snack Taverna

reviews.text: Low key, very cozy Greek restaurant. Great service. Lots of people, but never felt too noisy or crowded. Octopus was fabulous, as was the pork two ways. Calamari was disappointing, stay away. Limited wine option price wise. Keen to go back to check out brunch menu.

Food was good overall. Portion sizes were somewhat mismatched compared to plate prices. Waiter was friendly. Service could have been a bit more prompt though. Maybe a second visit might be five stars.

We tried Snack Taverna for lunch and enjoyed our visit. There were very few guests dining at the time we visited so we got right in. We started with the hummus which was good. The pita bread is great! I had the shrimp soulvaki which I really liked. I only wish it came with a few extra shrimp. My husband had the Chopped Salad with Chicken and he thought it was great. I tried the diet cola which I wasn’t a fan of as it tasted super sweet. However, it was from a local company so I think it’s great that they support the local community. The server was great which I feel is difficult to come by in NYC. He was attentive and checked on us after our food came out. We would return.
Pretty good food. A little pricey at dinner. Not terribly comfortable seating. Wouldn't bring a big group here. Lamb shank is great.
Love their food! Nice and cozy! I had scrambled eggs with baked potatoes and salad!

formatted_address: 2178 Broadway, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Serafina 77th Upper West

reviews.text:
Nice fresh pasta. Pizza was delicious. Ambience is good too. We were a group of 7 people and were accommodated with no reservation. Our hostess was super helpful with the recommendations.
Tiramisu was one of the best I had.

The mushroom ravioli was amazing.  Everything else was downhill from there.   Went on a Sunday evening and it wasn’t very busy at 7pm but the service was ridiculously slow and clearly confused.   I was told the specials twice asked for drink order twice but when it came to order no one came.   No pepper for the salad so after 4 minutes I had to waive someone down.   Then another 5 minutes later the first guy came back with pepper.   No utensils for my desert so I got up and took a fork of a nearby table.  And guess what in about 5 minutes a spoon showed up after I was halfway through it.  Dirty plates left on the table after every course.   Check took forever and had to be asked for twice.

We had Thanksgiving dinner here (4 people) and it was fabulous!  The calamari was the best I've ever had!  So tender.  The turkey was great.  My husband had a pizza instead and really enjoyed it.  Great service!  I highly recommend this location.  Good value also.

The food was well prepared and served quickly.  The buratta was excellent and the Di Serafina was great for sharing. The tiramisu was great and also came fast. The atmosphere was quite nice, although the restaurant was rather empty by 10 o’clock.

It was an excellent restaurant. The service was amazing and it was amazing food for the price. It was pricey though so this is a place to go to for on special occasions. It is a bit crowded so you might have some space issues sitting down and moving around but other than that it really is an excellent restaurant in a great location. I would say that you should come here on special occasions for a good meal.

formatted_address: 170 Waverly Pl, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Joseph Leonard

reviews.text: The food was really good and brought out quickly. We arrived as breakfast was ending and lunch was starting and the waitress was very accommodating for those who wanted a breakfast option and those who wanted a lunch option. There was a price discrepancy between the menu and the bill, but this was also taken care of by our waitress; I just wish it didn't need to be.

Such a cute little brunch and dinner spot in the Village. French toast was divine, not something I’ve had before so this was a nice surprise. interior was rustic and charming, you could easily spend hours in here on a Afternoon of evening with a few glasses of wine and good company. To top it off the staff were lovely too and a there was a extra nice touch with the cotton/linen napkins.

Literally one of my favorite restaurants in New York City. I have been here quite a few times over the years for lunch, brunch, and drinks. I am quite a creature of habit, usually opting for the fried chicken sandwich (don't doubt your taste buds, get it!) but this time I got the burger. It was flavorful and compact, staying in place from start to finish. My friend had the shrimp and grits with poached eggs, which looked absolutely yummy. The playlist is always bumping, so be prepared to sit-dance
I feel like I definitely had the best avocado toast in my life!!!! My friend’s croque madame’s great too. The restaurant itself is very nice and cozy, great brunch spot!

Another great spot by Stulman! Came here for brunch, and the food was great. Service was also awesome and wholesome!

We got: whitefish rye, burger and madame croquet. Recommend all.

formatted_address: 406 8th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Taboo Lounge

reviews.text: I didn't eat but I had some drinks and hookah. Met up with a old friend. Cool vibe. Super friendly staff, decently priced especially since your in manhattan. Would definitely come back again. And theres a jukebox!
I lovvvvve this place! Really chill vibe and Natacha the bartender was absolutely awesome and makes excellent drinks. WHAT A GEM

The service at this place is very good with polite and courteous servers. Hookah is served in a variety of flavors. 

Ambience of the place could improve though.
Cool hookah spot. Everyone is welcome. Friendly staff and good food.
Really bad hookah - only one charcole brick. I don’t expect much from drinks at a hookah bar but worst cocktail I have had since collage. Avoid.

formatted_address: 299 Vandervoort Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Studio 299

reviews.text: I just can't answer that right now.
Bouncers are super rude, ignorant and mouth-breathing. The place is pretty dank and under maintained.
Bad service staff.
Great place to come after all the parties close

I attend Giegling event on December 22nd and it was very very disappointing.  Alarm sounds was going on so often that at beginning I thought its part of music. Aggressive security crew running around  entire time of event with big blinding flashlights and aggressively talking to people. Those security guys have to work in law enforcement  agencies not in the clubs.

formatted_address: 329 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Muse Paintbar - Tribeca

reviews.text: Had a blast with my fam! Tabitha was great. Amanda was helpful. Thanks for being so fun

Fun spot for a business team building activity. Instructors were very friendly and gracious. Beer and wine served on site. Drop in classes available as well as reservations- check their calendar to understand all the different events going on. Good energy.
This was a way better experience than my first visit there. Our Artist Amanda was wonderful. Would definitely love to do another painting with her. Jon was also great with helping us out.
It was a great experience. I went with my colleagues as a work event and thoroughly enjoyed my time. Wouldn't mind bringing my wife as a date night in the future.

Definitely worth trying out for a birthday, coworker team outing, or just s fun night out with friends. In total, I spent $30+(plus) on a ticket and drinks (the studio has a bar and kitchen for small bites for purchase during the paint session). The instructors are nice and go at a good pace for the entire group. Along the way they will educate everyone on tricks and tips to becoming better painters. At the end of it you’ll walk away with a beautiful canvas.

formatted_address: 417 9th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: McGarry’s

reviews.text:
Came here with friends for dinner.
Great service
Great food
Great cheesecakes
Great atmosphere
Great view of union square
We sat outside on on the balcony. There were plenty of outdoor heaters to keep us warm. Friends and I enjoyed out time very much and definitely recommend this place.

This place is a good dive bar. Had a lot of good experiences here. The food is okay and the drinks are okay. It's an okay place. But the staff make up for the okay-ness and make it a 4 star dive bar. They have a backyard area where you can hang out. They have trivia too. In the winter the backyard has a tent to try to keep it warm. The food is worth it and I've met good people here. Definitely recommend it as a local getaway bar.

We came for a night of Buffy trivia by Trivia AD. The service could not have been better. Seriously. Even though trivia in general is famous for people who just order water for two hours and don't tip (just because you didn't spend money doesn't mean they didn't keep refilling your glass! Never mind that you're sitting in the space of a paying customer - I am not going to argue that one. Tip!).

The nachos were very good, and combined with a small veggie platter and a couple of glasses of wine (and a few fries from our friend's veggie burger) happily served two people. The prices are a little ridiculous ($16 for nachos), but I'd be happy if I found myself here for trivia again.
The Food here is delicious. I came here only because of the Marriott BonVoy promotion, and I must say its very tasty. The waitress was awesome as well and accommodating. I will be back.

Good corned beef sandwich and chicken salad sandwich special.  Customers were a mix of younger and older crowd, taking across drink about sports and general events. Bartender Patrick is efficient and good with his pour and friendly

formatted_address: 310 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Club Room at Soho Grand

reviews.text: Pleasant place for the purpose of EXTREME relaxing & unwinding, after a rough day or night...
Lux
The bartenders here were so much fun, lively and cracking jokes while serving expert drinks! We will definitely be back.
There are two different sections. One to the front of the building is what ever, but on to the right is fire. Usually electronic/ house music. Feels like Berlin.
Great decor, great cocktails!

formatted_address: 9th Fl 10001, 37 W 26th St, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Baile de Melao

formatted_address: 142 N 5th St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Fabiane's

reviews.text: I came across this cozy restaurant while walking around today, the food and drinks were exceptional. The atmosphere was great as well. The manager was very accommodating and made our experience great. As someone who works in the food industry I noticed all the effort put in to the little details that made the experience what it was. I will definitely be back on my next visit to Brooklyn.

FABBIII! Is Alive !  Chivalry and decadence are not dead.   Awesome wine selection, Draft beers thank the lord.  Staff is oddly polite,My one concern. Must be paying them too much. Or they love what they do. Get the kiwi strawberry mimosa. OUTSIDE SEATING!!!!
The best burger I have ever tasted. Great beer. Fantastic service. The waiter could understand our Kiwi accents. The decor and music was also very nice. I would definitely come back,

Such a great spot! We stopped by for a quick lunch and they were super welcoming! The food was excellent. Had a delicious chicken salad sandwich and my husband had the most amazing waffle sandwich off their brunch menu. Highly recommend!

I love this place! I've been coming here since I was 13. I love coming here for breakfast usually but I recently passed by for dinner with a friend and It was amazing. It was my first time having dinner since their renovation and I really enjoyed their new menu. Our server was Areterryo and he was amazing & attentive. We tried the kiwi & berry sangria and it was delicious. The ramen pork belly noddle is a must!

formatted_address: 569 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Philip Marie

reviews.text: Rented a private room in this cozy and welcoming restaurant for Valentine's Day. The server was very attentive and friendly. He was so well informed of the menu. I'm not a very adventurous foodie but tried and mostly enjoyed the variety of cuisines offered. The entire staff, down to the chef, was very accommodating! A very lovely and memorable experience, and I got to learn all about the history of the restaurant which was a sweet added bonus.

The Private Wine Room dinner service is a must have experience for any foodie.  Amazing 5 course dinner paired with wines for each course. Impeccable attention to detail w/private waiter service. Generous portions prepared to perfection. I travelled here from NJ as a surprise birthday experience and I would eat here 8 days a week if I could.
Hey its so warm today. I was just walking by the restaurant and saw tgey had outside tables. Lucas the server was great coffee and a chicken pear melted brie sandwich. Perfect for the weather.

Brunch was amazing! I got the Lumberjack. One of my friends got the Salmon Burger and the other one had the Crab Cake Benedict. We all loved our food. Their mimosas are really good. 
Service is good and the staff is friendly.

I came here for Saturday brunch. The food was delicious and relatively cheap for being in Manhattan. The staff were accommodating and friendly. The lady let me sit inside instead of standing outside in the cold while I waited for the rest of my party. I would definitely come back.

formatted_address: 359 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Cupping Room Cafe

reviews.text: Where do I start! The staff was really friendly and attentive. They seated us quickly and always check on our table to make sure we had everything we needed. As for the food....DELICIOUS. Everything came out very nice and was good perfectly..

A nice quaint place to have brunch, but it best to make reservations because it can get very packed unless you like to wait. I went on Sunday and it was like grand central /Piccadilly circus with customers and foot traffic. With all that said, the service was good and quick. I had the waffles with blue berries and strawberries along with pineapple juice.  Nice place overall, but recommended to make reservations.

Great vibe. They are so welcoming to everyone- groups and people with kids. Really relaxed and they came to check up on us quite often. The menu has quite a few choices but not too many as to be confusing. The wait time was not long at all very reasonable

Pancakes are solid not the best. Their stuffed French toast is good but also I’ve had better. Potatoes are also good. Coffee absolutely delicious. The service is super attentive and responsive. The place is super loud but yet going on a weekend day that is expected. Bit on the pricey side.

Nice place with a lot of space in the back!!!
I was very excited to try it because of so many positive reviews. To bw honest it is nothing special, especially the service!
Pancakes were good but not amazing.
Place is not the cleanest but it was a great spot for one time brunch!!!

formatted_address: 208 E 34th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Babylon Hookah Lounge

reviews.text:
Pros- Nice atmosphere, strong drinks. good music on both sides. Great hookah flavor-Pan Marsala. Tasty food and well cooked.

Cons- A $50.00 minimum per person isn't bad, Its actually a good business tactic HOWEVER if you are expecting me to reach a minimum I expect for attentive service and knowledgeable staff.

 I asked for multiple patron shots and for them to be "dressed"... each time the server had to come ask me HOW that was done. Not sure if the bartender didn't know how or what? But quite annoying  if I am sitting where there isn't a table limit and constantly being asked about ordering another drink! I dont wanna order if each time I am asked how to make a simple drink.

A great Middle-Eastern hookah lounge/club in Murray Hill, Manhattan. Great hookah, regular priced drinks (for NYC anyway) good service.
