They are oddly strict about entry sometimes, only allowing people in if they buy a table. And at $750, that's quite a lot. The atmosphere though, is pretty nice, if a little clogged by hookah smoke. If that bothers you, you're not gonna be happy. The entertainment runs the gamut from belly dancers to robots with laser lights on them to DJs playing soca, rock, top 40 etc. Overall, a pretty good time, if a tad pricey.

Ambience is really cool and nice. We were a party of 9 people and some of them were not drinking. They asked us to place an order per person for them to ensure we sit in the bar or place order for two hookahs. After sometime the server came and asked if we are not placing for 40$ per person min, then they ask us to leave the restaurant. Highly disappointed!! BTW they Did 20% gratuity on all orders irrespective of party size. Not sure if it's a NYC thing.

Nice atmosphere for a hookah bar and nice music. The service is VERY POOR! The way to stay and “enjoy” a seated spot is if you are willing to pay 50 dollars plus and keeping your tab open. The wait for a table is very long on a busy weekend night. If you want nice service at a hookah bar, check other places. We got kicked out of our spots because we didn’t keep ordering, and were trying to finish our hookah. The ladies are rude and you have to keep asking if your table is ready. Everything is based on giving them your money at this place! I wish I could give this place 0 stars for lack of empathy and for the above things stated.
Kinda pricey and hookah was meeh. Customer service wasn’t great either. Waited a long time for someone to come fix our hookah but never came. Been to better spots in the city.

formatted_address: 240 W 35th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Cafe Nunez

reviews.text: They only had a "B", not the WORST, but it means something about their cleanliness!! Also, food was just OK,,, nothing great. Wouldn't recommend, nor would I go back!! BUT, the price was very good, around $16 for all you can eat!! Good for Manhattan.

If i could give 0 stars i would. DO NOT go here. We waited 2+ hours. First the waiter went missing. The bartender had to step in and place our food order. Most of the food never came. The food that did come,  was wrong. The waiter came, apologized, and said the cook was DRUNK and took the food back. Asked for a manager and they said there wasn't one. We ended up walking out.

If want authentic Dominican food with a chill and welcoming atmosphere, then Cafe Nunez is the place! Food was hot and delicious and there was enough room for me and some co-workers to relax, chat and enjoy our food. Staff is very friendly and overall was a great experience👍🏾👌🏾

I highly would not recommend this place to No one. Their customer service is horrible. I called trying to place an order and I guess I had bad service. Not only did the representative continuously hang up on me. She accused me of yelling at her when I didn’t say anymore than “Hello Can you hear me”?  And never answered the phone after. I never felt so disrespected while attempting to order food. Whoever the girl was that answered the phone with her broken language needs to be fired. She’s giving their company a bad imagine, I would never attempt to order again.

Very good food, definitely above average service. Would go again, definitely for the food. Lookout for a review on @officialfoodieguide!

Fyi - overpriced drinks (for what you get)

formatted_address: 139 Fulton St # 418, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: Kgny

reviews.text: The food and service were ahead of our expectations. I really enjoyed the atmosphere of this place. Awesome place to take the family out for dinner.

formatted_address: 221 W 46th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Bond 45 NY

reviews.text: Absolutely a fabulous meal. Great service by Luis. The scallops were very good with risotto. But the cheesecake was the best I have ever eaten in my entire life!  Excellent job Bond 45

Horrible and unsafe food preparation. Food is all microwaved like the salmon which I was shocked at. I worked there and never dined there for a reason. Except during training where they force you to taste the food. I was not yet aware of the dirtiness and lack of care. Kitchens are dirty and food is made in the cheapest and unhealthiest way possible. I have seen them microwave a steak which was undercooked. I have seen them microwave fish which was undercooked and returned. It was a nightmare watching them prep and cook food. The kitchen will make you sick. I was offered a manager position after being there for 2 weeks. As you can imagine I ran for the hills. I would recommend trying Carmines or any other well known establishment in the area. I don't know how this place lasted so long. I wanted to post this to warn people. I am not a disgruntled employee as they might paint me. No, no issues working there. Just would never dine there. After leaving in felt compelled to tell people the truth. They also own Brooklyn Diner a few blocks away. Kitchen there is even dirtier as I did one day there as a floor manager. Stay away. Trust me...

This place was incredible! We went back twice just for the Italian wedding soup which is to die for by the way! I highly highly recommend trying this place out. Every single thing we ordered was amazing

Made reservations the morning of and was able to get a later reservation which was fine with us but if your dining in the weekends I would suggest the day before. The staff was very attentive and we were immediately greeted. When we said we had reservations they referred to us by name instead of having to look us up. We were a few minutes early and asked if we would like to have a drink at the downstairs bar. We went downstairs and never left. The bartenders were great (Matt makes an incredible old fashioned) and friendly.  The stuffed olives were very good and were surprisingly firm but loaded with flavor. We split a veal parmigian that we couldn't finish it was such a generous portion. Turns out they have a happy hour after 9 which put a very nice red for under 30 bucks. The bartenders incourged conversation among the patrons and we soon met several fun and interesting people from all over the world.  I really can't say enough good things about this place.

We came here 7 years ago and adored it, was sad to hear they had to move locations- the feel of the other place was incredible and may have had a large part to do with why we loved it.

 They seemed to have transported all their decor and fittings over so it has a nice feel still. 

This time, went for breakfast; food and coffee okay, service not bad.
Overall though not a bad choice for a meal when around Times Square

formatted_address: 399 Grand St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Saluggi's East

reviews.text: Food is good friendly staff and not overpriced 👍
Went for the game. No matter where you sit there is a tv. Nice atmosphere. Friendly staff. Food is good. Beer selection is obscure. No Blue Moon, Bud, Heineken etc. All micro brews. Would go back.
Brussel Sprout Pizza was amazing. Just right amount of mozzarella cheese.  Brussel Sprouts grilled to perfection. Service was great with a smile.
The pizza was very good. Good service. It is suitable for children. You can eat inside or out. It was quite busy.

Great establishment tucked right into the neighborhood.  A real gem with the ability to invoke thoughts of Europe as one approaches at night.  Service as just as you would want it to be for such a small space.  The food is outstanding and the wine list very good.  Overall a real treat for the Richmond District.

formatted_address: 14 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Lucien

reviews.text: Definitely worth a visit! We had the onion soup and the escargots (snails) for starters, which were very good. The highlight was the scallops with mashed potatoes, which was exceptional. Unfortunately didn't get to try their desserts. The portions are a little small though, in true French fashion.
Had a truly amazing time at “Lucien”. The ambience is great, the food excellent, wine list surprisingly good and the service friendly. You can’t go wrong. Recommend the “merguez” and the ribs.
Best food, friendly staff members, constantly great atmosphere. They charge affordable prices and the food quality is fantastic. Kudos.

I meet friends in this place from time to time! This is the best place to grab a bite.  I go there regularly. The meals are excellent, the team is friendly and the rates are good. I like eating in this spot for a rich supper.
Love it forever, great place better food superb wine list. Just perfect ❤️lunch, dinner, coffee anytime is splendid

formatted_address: FDNY Fire Zone, W 51st St, New York, NY 10104, USA
name: shranga la

formatted_address: 190 7th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Merchants NY

reviews.text: Great bar. Lovely people. Good food. Atmosphere feels like a home a way from home. I will miss is terribly. I met some great people there. Sad that it's closing.

I love their veggie burger with fries. It's delicious! The bar has a nice decoration and it is very cozy. My favorite area to have dinner are the underground tables and couches. It's a nice place to with friends or for a date night.
When most places are closing and you still haven't had dinner, Merchants is still open with quality late-night food.

The joint is located in a good spot if you go to the Rubin museum!  I ate the burger and had a seasonal ale.  Both were very good and my date enjoyed your dish also.  The prices are reasonable and the service on point.  Two thumbs up!
Went there for breakfast and lunch. The French toast was amazing, and the burgers are great there as well. Overall great place to eat.

formatted_address: 287 Hudson St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Adoro Lei

reviews.text: I used to live about 7 blocks from Adorie, but never visited. When I was beginning to move, I told my postman who said, "that's right near Adorie Lie--they have the best chicken wings anywhere."  Funny thing is, the chicken wings were great, but the pizza is more the heart & soul of the place with, get this, a wood burning AND a brick over. Spacious place, that often handles a full house, and parties downstairs--and other times is quiet, with loyal and new patrons in at the bar or tucked in to various corners (sometimes beneath portraits of what seem to be lesbian vampires). Charlene is the hostess who is beyond warm and all the staff is cool, welcoming. Menu goes way beyond pizza and (great) sliders. And of course, they handle the to-go end of things well (pizza still hot). My wife loves the Isabella, but there's a good, varied selection.
Nice food and good wine, but happy hour only available at the bar even though the restaurant was empty. The cheese and olive platter isn't worth getting, chicken wings, truffle bites were though 👌
If you are near than you should totally come to this place! The food is awesome and the service is great! The staff couldn’t be any nicer! Totally recommend!

The brick oven pizza, a 16", was reasonably priced at 22$. The dough was excellent and the sauce was good. The problem was too little and burnt basil and over baked cheese. The walnut beet salad and garlic fries were enjoyable. Overall decent place with a nice menu and a nice modern setting. Friendly semi casual staff. Not 5, but 4 stars are appropriate.
This place was great. Food was amazing and staff was really great. Highly recommend

formatted_address: 277A Van Brunt St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Kevin's

reviews.text: Kevin's is old school and charming in its way. I really like the seafood chowder. For brunch I had a whole trout served on greens with two poached eggs with hollandaise sauce and a horseradish cream. You're not going to find this dish everywhere that's what I like about Kevin's. It's definitely more homey than fancy. A real neighborhood Place. The waitress is always very sweet. You can go there on a Saturday night and not be bombarded with noise and people. Not every dish is a winner, but the food is not clever... it's just straight up.
My son and daughter in law had their rehearsal dinner here and also a surprise birthday party. Wonderful experience and delightful people who care. Food and service are the top.

Hidden gem, we love coming here for lunch, simple entrees with a touch of sophistication. Love their chioppino fish stew - the broth is light and flavorful. Love the grilled tuna on toasted challah (comes with avocado). Lobster roll has a good amount of fresh lobster. Lemongrass marinated hangar steak - love the marinade. Portions are large. Half-hour drive for us, but well worth it.
Terrific for Sunday brunch!  Went many times. Just great.
The ambience was awesome and  the service was great. I had to take off a star for all of the shells in crab dishes. I also wish there was more salt in my pasta dish.

formatted_address: 192 E 2nd St, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Plado Tasting Bar

reviews.text:
Great staff -- Angelina 
The food was so good I wish I had an endless stomach!

Try the fried artichoke 

Atmosphere was very warm 

Great date or meeting place

Paella!

Everything was the right size
(Its a tasting menu)

Did not see any kids..
 Its was Saturday night, date night.  Very high on the romantic scale tonight...

Everything was excellent. Service was friendly and attentive. Many items on the menu and was hard to choose! All items were very flavorful and delicious. Expansive wine list. This is definitely a go to place for any occasion. Good pricing.

The thought and attention to flavor and detail at this restaurant are unforgettable. One of the best meals I’ve had in awhile and chef German is a gem. The perfect ambiance coupled with generous, warm staff made for the perfect evening. Will return on my next visit.

The best spot I’ve discovered in a while. It’s a two floor restaurant with the best food you can eat. The smoked salmon is so good, and the scallops are awesome. But the best thing they have is their staff, especially Kelly, thank you so much!!
Amazing food with amazing service, I love the creativity of chef German, definitely my go to spot in the city!

formatted_address: 195 Centre St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Other Half Brewing Company

reviews.text: Finally made it there. Have enjoyed OH beer for a while when friends would bring it over. It was a lot of fun to make it to the brewery and have the beer on draft. So many yummy beers. Cool space. It was hopping on Sunday evening.

Awesome spot and some of the tastiest beer out there. Their stouts and porters are particularly exceptional. Has a great vibe and great place to have a beer. My only complaint would be that it gets real busy, but I can’t blame the crowds for going to such an awesome spot in droves.

We absolutely love this place. They have a wide variety of beer options for any sort of beer lover. We brought our dogs in and were able to get a table in the back that was a little bit aways from the crowds.
Amazing beers! Cool little Brooklyn space. Good music and communal beer hall type bench seating

The beer selection in the other half brewery is great but besides the atmosphere that seem predominantly one race, The staff serving are very rude. The Spanish guy serving beers with the glasses seem to be annoyed to be at work and the blonde hair girl also seem to have a attitude when I asked for a certain beer she just didn’t listen to me and answered a question I didn’t ask. I would NEVER come back to this place or support other half brewery or there products!

formatted_address: 1018 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: Marlow Bistro

reviews.text: Great atmosphere and usually open seating. Very light and good food and cocktails. Try the aged negroni!

We came here for brunch and while
The food was decent I wouldn’t be coming back from the brunch again. It was a super small brunch menu also. They also would put an egg on the pizza for me so I couldn’t even get a breakfast pizza!

I love this lovely neighborhood restaurant.  Always reliable in terms of quality of food and the good service and kind nature of all that work there.  Menu changes frequently based on seasonal availability of fresh and local food sources. Doesn't get better than that!

Wonderful,  bright and cozy spot in the shadow of the Cathedral of St. John the Divine. Maybe best in the neighborhood.  Food is creatively prepared and presented.  Service is warm and unpretentious.  Terrific experience all around.

Don’t hesitate going to Marlow Bistro!  The mesmerizing and excellent prepared menu is equal to the well thought out ambiance.  Whether during the week or a weekend hang with family and friends you won’t feel inclined to eat and run.  Fantastic bar too!

formatted_address: 19 E 26th St, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: BLACKBARN Restaurant

reviews.text: I was gladly surprised how lovely the restaurant is decorated, like a barn but fancy. The food was fantastic. Something I didn't notice when arrived, they have party rooms. We had a great time and definitely would come back. Ah, prices are little bit high, not a cheap place but food is well served and the presentation is inviting to dig in.
It was nice experience for me since it was first time at this place. I like the ambience and its very earthy. The food was very good I just loved the smoked salmon. Overall best place to dine.

One of the best places to eat in New York City if you love food and comfort. The owner used to be executive chef at The Waldorf and it shows. The location is amazing too. You can sit outside and look at Madison Square Park and the restaurant is massive with tons of private event spaces. Awesome cocktails too! Sometimes brunch is too loud and busy though.

Very good appetizers and good cocktails. Open spacious place , so people are not on top of each other.  The pork buns were awesome as were the chicken wings. We were a party of 5  and we were able to have a conversation without shouting. Would definitely recommend for a weeknight.

Great ambiance, great service, great cocktails, but the food was just okay. The best part of the food was the complimentary bread course with a delicious buttery, garlic infused oil. The cauliflower steak was huge and not sliced like a steak so it didn’t have all the flavor I’d prefer. The gnocchi side dish was over-cooked and bland. The mussels and octopus were very good and my fish for two main course was also very good. Overall a fun night with a few misses.

formatted_address: 363 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Kenn's Broome Street Bar

reviews.text: Had an amazing time with family enjoying the burgers and drinks! We made so many new friends that night that we still visit from time to time! The music is great and the vibe of this place is surreal. Lots of locals and tourists but it’s worth the wait to enjoy good company. Can’t wait to head back and enjoy a There great burgers and margaritas.
The waiting queue is really worth! Staff could be more friendly but is efficient when restaurant is crowded. Food is fresh and tasty, many options available, great choice of drinks. A great choice!

This place is a blast! Jimmy is the best bartender in Soho! He made our first visit to this bar a 5star experience!  Make sure Jimmy is around for his famous martini!  
The boys from Canada!
Always a favourite when in NYC. Right in the thick of it. Perfect for pub meals and good bar prices.
Cute and cozy...we stood at the bar...it was noon...we proceeded to drink...the bartender was so chill and nice.  Really liked the vibe in this neighborhood bar in SOHO

formatted_address: 198 E 54th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Crimson & Rye

reviews.text: Came here for happy hour. They have half off select beer and wine and $1 oysters on Monday. Everything was great and service was wonderful. I highly recommend the tuna tacos. Yummm
I had an impromptu meet-up with a friend and this was a convenient spot. We only sat at the bar and did not order any food. Still, the service was on point and the atmosphere pleasant.

Good drinks and great live music, at least on Saturday night. 
For some reason, you have to go into the office building and up an elevator to use a restroom though
Odd bar on the lobby of an office building. Good drinks but weird vibe. Bathrooms are in and office basement and require a security pass.

Always amazing experience, one of my most favorite neighborhood spots. Cocktails are life changing, I believe that they juice all the ingredients for their cocktails in house. Max always goes extra mile to make you feel special, he is a talented mixologist. The fallen rose is my cocktail of choice. Also their bar bites are delicious. Highly recommend.

formatted_address: between 110th and, 2850 Broadway, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: Mel's Burger Bar

reviews.text: Their food is really good. I love their burgers. They also have boozy shakes which is awesome; I love getting a strawberry shake and adding Bailey's to it. Service is good, atmosphere is great, lots of seating and a bar area. I think they also open the front area when it's nice out and that's cool. Location is great. Check it out!

I stopped once for dinner and one for lunch. Burgers are good and delicious. Good selection of drinks. I enjoyed lunch, I set at the bar, bartender was friendly and gave full service, burger (California, recommend) was excellent. Good music and atmosphere. At night it gets super crowded with college crowd and such.

Nothing wrong with the food. I sat at the bar. It wasn't busy and I received extremely poor service from the bartender. My drink came well after my meal. She greeted and served everyone before she even acknowledged my presence. I do give her credit. She gave her friend that sat next to me, great service and he only ordered tap water.🤣
Good burgers, great happy hour deal on snacks. Service is a little slow. Nachos are very delicious

Great atmosphere. Drink special was good. Food was really tasty. Our server was super nice but might have been overwhelmed. He brought water we had no cups. Had to ask. We got appetizers, had no plates. He got dinner had to ask for silverware. So we were annoyed already. Also had no napkins.

formatted_address: 1361 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: Finnegan's Wake

reviews.text: Nice, quiet atmospheric pub. Decent whiskey selection, friendly staff, open late. Haven't tried the food yet, but from what I've seen it's basic but respectable pub fare. Good spot for a late night, after work libation if you don't want to deal with crowds and loud music. Highly recommend
Great gem of old upper east side pub. Good solid food options decent cold beer and a great cozy casual atmosphere. Friendly waitstaff.
This restaurant provides superb service and enjoyable menu. The best place in the city. The drinks and food arrived fast and the prices were inexpensive. I recommend this place.
A great neighborhood Irish pub with a relaxed, casual feel. Friendly, helpful staff. Comfortable, with excellent Irish pub food. Never been disappointed here.
Pleasant atmosphere and great customer service

formatted_address: 421 Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10027, USA
name: Tio Luca

reviews.text: The churros con chocolate for dessert - 💯. You will not be disappointed. I ate from the brunch menu and had a nice omelet and fries. I will definitely be back! Very nice, cozy atmosphere. Great for solo dining and just chilling out and listening to their music.
Everything was great. Service, food and location was super cute. I ate the lobster tostada and the spicy shrimp mini tacos. The tacos were small but perfect size for me. Super delicious.

Always make my 1st ...3rd.  6th  ... definitely last before I head for home...... Tacos are just like my grandma would make if she was Mexican..... ambiance,drinks,and food....A#1 top of world.... Kings of the street
Food was so good.. Great service.. Drinks not too strong but still drinkable. Try these dishes you will not be disappointed.
Cool friendly staff and the food is very good. It’s a cute spot located in the heart of Harlem! Check out their happy hour!

formatted_address: 558 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Winfield Flynn Wines & Spirits

reviews.text: Cancel your other tours, save money, and enjoy a two-hour tasting with stories from the owner of this wine shop. His humor and passion made the tasting so memorable. He is a genuine man who likes to ensure his guests are happy and no pressure to buy and just good to meet people like him. This will be a repeat attraction for us!
Go the Malibu from the store. I feel it's little overpriced but you get what you need. The owners were friendly.

As travelers from another country, we are very experienced in enjoying various wines and wine tasting in wineries or wine shops, but our time with them was completely unique. The place is located in a somewhat difficult place to find, one walks down some steps to a small place packed with wines and a few places to sit. This is a must-visit wine shop!
Great place, very friendly and super fast shipping! Will buy from again!
Nice staff and good selection of wines. I missed a wider selection of wines of Spain, but the ones you have had a reasonable price!

formatted_address: 103 Empire Blvd, Brooklyn, NY 11225, USA
name: Empire 103

reviews.text: Is anyone home? Lights were flashing and window was shattered. Was concerned

Pros: 
1.I am still looking for one... waitress was nice even though she got all our orders incorrect.

Cons: 
1. The restaurant was very hot. 
2. Order was wrong
3. Food was no good
4. Dinner price did not match what the menu price stated. 2 oxtail meals at $12, $2 lemonade well lemons in water (which we were not supposed to be charged). Paid $20 for the food. Tax is exceptionally high at that restaurant. 

Save your money and eat elsewhere...

Before they  was call the buzz now it’s call empire 103 I like going there on a Sunday will that the only time I go 🤣🤣cause for the reggae music 🤘🏽🇯🇲 But every Sunday I go I be feeling like it’s the same music but that the only problem I have with them it’s that they’re play the same reggae music they need to play the new update reggae other then that I ain’t never had a problem when I went
You guys really need someone who can be there to answer the phone about any inquiries pertaining to your establishment at all times of the day not just during party hours it’s unprofessional

Payed for a party on eventbrite and it was $15. Then the line was long and the party was not packed. When I get to the front on the line they said the tickets was $40. This club is very unprofessional and needs to be closed down. I never got my $15 dollars back.

formatted_address: 7 W 31st St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Club Rapture

reviews.text: Invite only club run by two of the nicest people in the world. The music is always cutting edge, the views are epic. The bar has rotating specials that can be... surprising. The cuddle puddle area is sometimes overrun by foreigners, but it’s fun to meet people and hear 6 languages! Highest recommendation!
Okay views. Bartender Drewsky tends to get orders wrong though luckily his wife always saves the night. Recommend staying until the disco ball and Champagne in the morning.

Invite only Speakeasy club - one of a kind in New York City . Resident DJ Drewsky is always on point. Good atmosphere , chic crowd , great music = trappings of a fun night. Keep an eye out for their Thirsty Thursday specials. Their ‘dark n stormy’ cocktail is straight out of Bermuda.
Only complaint being, can be crowded if you get there late.

The hottest new club in Manhattan owned by two of the most genuine people I know. Once you walk into this place you are instantly smiling and that smile stays with you long after you leave. Not only does Rapture provide phenomenal tunes, vibes and beer selection but also a selection of massage tools for those aches after a long night on your feet
Great little secret club. Owners are very friendly and you never have to leave if you don’t want to. That’s definitely a plus in my book. I highly recommend.

formatted_address: 146 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Parish

reviews.text: I love this new spot downtown. The place is clean, the food is delicious, and the staff is friendly and professional.  I gave it 5 stars because I could not find any faults. Good vibes all over

I found out about Parish via Pulsd, when my friends and I were looking for a spot to brunch one Saturday. There was a deal for $29 - one entree + one carafe of mimosas, so we decided to give it a try. We came in with a 12:45 reservation for four, and the place was empty except for one couple dining. It looks more like a cocktail/dinner spot, so maybe not a lot of people know that they serve brunch.

I went with the Shrimp and Grits (with andouilles sausage, roasted garlic, charred scallion, Creole BBQ). I really enjoyed this. The shrimp was cooked perfectly and was flavorul. The BBQ with the grits was a different and welcome update to a classic. The mimosas just taste like your typical brunch mimosa - nothing to write home about.

For brunch, it can be a little pricey if you don't have a Pulsd deal. However, they do seem to have a unique menu, and the ingredients taste really fresh. Plus, I haven't found a lot of good Cajun places in NYC. I wouldn't mind coming back to try out their dinner menu.

This place recently reopened and I must say I really like what they are doing.. The ambiance is dope for a variety of reasons, u can sit and have dinner or u can walk to the back and dance. I ordered the shrimp sliders and to top that off I had the bartender Chris make me a drink.. Both were equally impressive and I will definitely be going back...#GoodTimesInLES
Great food. Nice music. Great location.
Great food and great customer service  and great night life if you not in crowded places.

formatted_address: 70 W 3rd St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Negril Village

reviews.text: A true treat and pleasure to have experienced the dining culture here at Negril Village. Very classy and yet laid back feel and flow to the establishment. Brunch is served on Sunday morning so come hungry and leave more than satisfied. With choices ranging from jerk shrimp to mango BBQ sticky wings you won’t be disappointed. Can get a little crowded depending on the time of day however a genuinely good place too visit if in the Brooklyn area.
Great place! Food and drinks were AMAZING! Portion size is well worth the money! Would definitely recommend! Can't wait to go back!
You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.   Sunday brunch was great.  The DJ was a plus-- the Caribbean music added so much to the experience.
Food was excellent! Our waiter was super helpful and happy (infectiously so). The drink recommendation was really good as well. This will be my first stop when we come back to NYC

Came here for happy hour. It was super allowed and the service was a little slow, but everything else was great. I got the mango and blue cheese salad and it was amazing. My friends got other appetizers on the happy hour menu.

formatted_address: 154 W 13th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Flex Mussels

reviews.text: Easy going ambiance. Had East coast oysters which were all amazing then the special of the day sauce for Mussels. Didn’t make it to dessert with truffle friends and crab guac were great accompanying dishes. Would definitely return for another visit!
Love the donuts. Oysters were nice and clean and came with my favorite mignette sauce. Spicy tequila cocktail was great. Truffle fries were good. The mussels diavolo were awesome and a huge portion.

Easily some of the best mussels and oysters I’ve ever had! And I live to eat seafood. The whole vibe was great, there’s limited but great tasting vegetarian options too (for your vegetarian friends to come along!) , missed the homemade donuts, will have to go back. 
Great atmosphere too! Highly recommend.
Happy hour is only at the bar area. Food is great, cocktail were a bit weak and on the sweet side. Hh oysters are creamy and taste.

Went for Brunch, started w/ fradiavolo mussels - amazing and great bread to soak up the sauce. Had messy egg sandwich and Lobster blat amazing! Best yet to come - so save room... the donuts order 4 or more so many favorites- get the wild blue berry and chocolate for sure! Staff beyond pleasant. Would definitely go back.

formatted_address: 1485 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10075, USA
name: Stax NYC

reviews.text:
The place is fantastic, the drinks are a bit pricey, but their food is Fantastic.
Burger, huge mozzarella cheese, and chicken wings were great. TV everywhere, sports, UFC and Boxing fights are available. Had a great time. Recommend. FYI:  The establishment does charge for live PPV events.

This place is really dope to catch some drinks after work and the food here is amazing. You cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. All of the staff are super friendly and responsive. Also a great atmosphere if you’re into sports and want to watch a game with friends or meet fellow fans of your favorite team there. I always have a good time when I go here.

Fun sports bar. Very nice and friendly bar tenders. The place was pretty large and the foods/ drinks were nice/ reasonably priced.

The bathroom was clean on the day I visited the bar. I will be going again in the future for sure. Oh and try their margaritas, they are pretty nice.

The two bartenders were incredibly friendly and attentive. When asked which sandwich to get, the bartenders made a recommendation instead of just the usual “oh it depends on your mood.”  The pulled pork was excellent. It was BBQ but not so much that it overpowered the flavor and texture of how succulent the meat was. Reasonable prices as well.  Sports on tvs but the sound was not too loud to have a normal conversation. Will definitely be back.
RJ is an awesome host. Drinks were excellent. He was very attentive. The bar is immaculate. We will be back.

formatted_address: 1185 6th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Utsav

reviews.text: Authentic Indian taste, minus typical Indian allowance.  Fast service, helpful staff.  Maybe because I went after peak hours.   No annoying staff that I've experienced at numerous Indian restaurants.  Convenient central location in times Square Area.   Nice view and that's what you pay for.  Good value.

Nice ambience and delicious food. Staff were attentive and friendly. Prices seem ok for NY. We've had nice time and kids enjoyed the dinner.
Though not ordered liquor, menu appeared decent for the selection.

The place is good with decent options to pick from appetizers to entrees. Other than the wait time on weekends and peek hours (7-9 PM) everything is good about the place.
They do have exquisite dinning place for get together and private events. Consider having a buffer time of 2 hours if you're visiting here.

The food was excellent. Mr Rana took care of and served our family’s specific requests. Our family has all tree nuts, milk and gluten allergies . Chef made specific dishes to delight our pallets . Moment we spoke to Mr Rana and his assurances regarding not to worry about allergies and asking chef to make our favorites dishes from the menu was very helpful. Atmosphere was very family friendly.  We had a great evening. Thank you Utsav
Delicious appetizers, tandoori chicken is out of the park. One of the best in NYC for sure.

formatted_address: 32 6th Ave, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Lil Nip-Nip

formatted_address: 1073 Atlantic Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11238, USA
name: Langston Night Club

reviews.text: Could not get a better waiter, after I finished my meal I decided to keep in touch with my waiter. at first we just talked over the phone but as we got to  know each other better we started going out for dinner, I still keep in touch with him
The Best Party in Bk

Got an invitation for libra party for free and i got charge $15 dollars anyways...one drink cost me $18 dollars and the security was rude and ghetto as hell.i would never put a foot on that place again and i wouldn't recommend to anyone one.waste of time and money....not worth it.and music from 90s....this is 2018 upgrade your D.J...the crowd was really ghetto no class..  i guess is because of the location...
The turn up is SO real in this place. Drinks and Drink specials are excellent. Music, atmosphere, crowd one of the livest in BK. Authentic Brooklyn.

I don't give it 5 stars only bc the floor can be so dirty that it ruins your shoes/clothes. My boots got DESTROYED from the nasty ass floor as did my brand new white shirt and red pants. (Yes I'm a crazy dancing drunk) but I've never seen such thick black sludge from a floor before so be careful not to wear nice footwear if youre a crazy dancer. Other than that good music nice that u can get in free before 12 every sat some cute guys, pricey drinks tho but strong n have random calls for drink deals

formatted_address: 116 E 16th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Upstairs @ The Stand

formatted_address: 406 E 73rd St # 1, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: Malaga Restaurant

reviews.text: Loved it!

We have been here several times, and the food is really great. However, this time, the service was atrocious -- the waiters brought appetizers, salads, and entrees at one time and acted like this is the way service should be done. We may try again at some time, after the wait staff might hopefully have been changed.
Awesome
Good tapas and a large variety of them. Pulpo a la Gallega and Almejas en Vino Blanco stood out.

formatted_address: 85 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Somtum Der (East Village)

reviews.text:
So delicious! Ordered the papaya salad with salted egg, pork skewer with rice noodle, and steamed rice. All are really good. Will definitely come back here again to try other dishes.
It's not crowded when I came here on Saturday at around 12.30.

My friend and I were planning for dinner before a show. She called ahead about wheelchair accessibility after finding it in a list of accessible places online and was told by staff it was a go. She asked specifically if there were any steps...

We get there tonight - two steps up and a ramp dug out of the back which was unsafe and unusable for a motorized wheelchair (too short, too steep, no flaps or securing mechanisms to stabilize it across steps). For an independent motorized wheelchair user, impossible to use. Too often restaurants rely on 1: wheelchair access only by request instead of built-in access & 2: ramps that are UNUSABLE for independent disabled people and require pushing and/or lifting the disabled person unsafely past the barrier (dangerous for person and chair, incredibly inappropriate).

We called. They didn't even preemptively get the ramp out or teach staff how to use it. Really messed up our night. Hopefully they'll get a new truly accessible ramp.

Cute Thai place in LES! There are several tables and benches, set up like a communal canteen. I believe Somtum Der specializes in northern Thai cuisine. This meant extra spicy (however the servers will kindly ask you the level to adjust). I love the pad see ew (thick broad noodles) and of course, Thai milk tea. I suggest not sitting at the window since everyone can see you.

Great for dining in or take out (you can place orders for pickup through Yelp). Not the place to go to if you're looking for curry, papaya salads (honestly just their salads in general) are the standouts. 

Some favorites 
- Papaya salad with salted egg
- Fried chicken thighs
- Sticky rice
- Mushroom Salad w/ Mint
- Pad Thai (usually I don't even like Pad Thai but this one is great)
- Beef Skewers

A great menu selection with some accompanying photos to make it clearer as to what you're going to get. Food has been seasoned really well and its clear the place isn't going to the mainstream tastes but more authentic. 

Iron stomachs have a new challenge as several different options of spiciness level are available here. I've visited a few times and could not reach the highest level. My spice fiend of a friend got the highest spice level and has said, "wow, I can't even feel my arms right now".

formatted_address: 1900 Broadway, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Cafe Fiorello

reviews.text: I love this restaurant. We have a tradition of going here before a show across the street (at Lincoln Center), so have had brunch. The food is always delicious, servers excellent. I recommend making a reservation. Bathroom stalls are small, but bathroom is relatively clean. Fried artichokes, short rib meatballs, Bella benedict eggs, superb. Even the focaccia at the table is awesome.

My favorite restaurant. Great food and ambiance. The service is great. You can book a reservation online as well. The restaurant is a classic. A go -to every time I’m in NYC. It’s across from Lincoln Center so it’s so convenient to have dinner here. Their hours are very flexible/available to customers. I have been coming here since I was a kid and the food never disappoints. I love the fried artichokes, the antipasti, famous open face lasagna with veal, veal parm, and the margarita pizza. They have what you need to satisfy you. And the desserts are wonderful. The Made In House Chocolate Mousse and Whipped cream is to die for.
We decided to splurge and go for a really nice breakfast. The decor and ambience is top notch. However, I'm not sure what we got justifies the high prices.
Incredible dining experience. World class food. Impeccable service. Just a wonderful meal. Seafood risotto was the best I have ever had. You won't be sorry if you done here

I call this excellent place once a month because I love the good mood that is characterizes this restaurant. The crew is extraordianrillyremarkably attentive and qualified. The service is certainly fast. Not to mention, the food they prepare is outstanding. I came more than once and I was always satisfied. The rate is honest. I highly recommend this place to to all.

formatted_address: 438 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Norma Gastronomia Siciliana

reviews.text:
Amazing food. The comments about this place do not lie!!! 

The host and our waiter were very friendly, they made you feel like one of the family despite this been our first visit. 

The menu offers a good selection of authentic cuisine and varied flavours. Our food was exceptionally good!!! 

Prices and middle of the range, having said that given the high standard of food, I would expect them to be a bit more. 

Oh, super busy and a small place so be prepared to possibly wait or get in early. 

Norma's will not disappoint!!!

My mom and I had an amazing experience here! The staff was so kind and friendly and the food was AMAZING. If you're looking for good Italian food head over to Norma right now, I cannot recommend it enough!

Go. Eat. Here. Professional and warm staff (hey Gianni!), unbelievably great food, cozy and beautiful. It’s always packed. We go there at least once a week, and love every dish we had. Personal recommendation is Pizza Capricciosa. The menu is just perfect, wide array of original Italian dishes and just the right size of portions. Go now!

Favorite Italian place in the city - hands down. 

Authentic, amazing pizza and pasta and wine, great selection of appetizers. Friendly servers! 

The back patio area is so cute and has space warmers throughout the winter and is nice to be outside in during the summer

The food here is very good , the one thing I look for is a clean environment and the food was made in a clean area. The wrap was very good , best wrap i have had. The quality of the meats were very high as well! Next time you wanna grab a bite try it out.

formatted_address: 633 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10017, USA
name: Docks Oyster Bar

reviews.text: Wow. What can I say? This place is awesome. Food is delicious and service is first rate. I ordered the Yellowfin Tuna and had the Wedge Salad. Food was fresh and presentation was so exquisite. Both were delicious and service was extraordinary. Will add this place to my list of great restaurants.

Went online through Google maps and open table and got a reservation very easily. We were sat upon our arrival. The food was a little shoppe to arrive at the table, but was exactly as ordered. Service was awesome thanks to Danielle C.
Went there for luck with my wife. Both of our main meals where good, but I'm not sure if the price coincided with the bill. Needs some work!! FYI fish and chips are supposed to be crispy..not soggy..
Had a great time here during Happy Hour! Very high quality seafood and well priced wine makes this a real gem among many choices in Manhattan. I'll definitely work my way back there!

Docks Oyster Bar in NYC is a great place to eat. Delicious food which is reasonably priced for the city. Good beverages mixed drinks, wine, IPA. Great and friendly service. Close to Grand Central Terminal.

formatted_address: 2084 Frederick Douglass Blvd, New York, NY 10026, USA
name: Zoma

reviews.text: The food is really good! Its definitely a whole experience to eat with my hands, and they made sure it was a good one. They bring you a warm towel to clean your hands, which looked really cool when the server put the hot water in the little bowl and they grew! The service was very nice and everything was delivered to the table pretty quick. The honey wine was delicious! It was my first time there and I would definitely return and recommend it to my friends! Also, try the red stuff with beef. So good!👏

They do not let two people share a vegetarian main course dish, unless it's a platter for two (sharing a non-vegetarian entree is fine). This is not made clear on their menu online and I have not had this experience in literally any other restaurant in any city. The food was decently good but I just did not enjoy the overall experience of being forced to change my order.

Best Ethiopian restaurant I have been to. 
Wonderful flavors!
The best Ethiopian food in NYC ! Great waitress - Lily is the best : smart, cult, you can engage a great conversation! Food is so tasteful ! You should  come here once a month!

Dinner was delicious!!! If you ever in Harlem and want some 🔥 🇪🇹 Ethiopian food, stop by Zoma and try the fish. Service was excellent as we ordered two glasses of Honey Wine! Me being a fatty, I would have liked bigger portions but the food was savory and remained typical with the portion sizes for traditional Ethiopian food. In any event, you won’t be disappointed!

formatted_address: 35 Broadway, Brooklyn, NY 11249, USA
name: Patrizia's of Williamsburg

reviews.text: This is my Favorite restaurants of all times!! I've been to all their locations but this one is the best one. The vibe, music, Food is outrageous!! Worth every dollar spent. Their Sangria , the lobster tails, the family meal course is the BEST !!! I highly recommend this place. Even for a romantic night out. Love it!!!
Italian Family style restaurant.. great atmosphere with delicious food. $$

The food here is absolutely delicious, fresh and they have a large variety of dishes to choose from. The staff is upbeat friendly and attentive. The layout is tight with the tables very close together but the food is so good that you don’t even notice. Super good vibes here all the time!

I love the food, prices and the ambiance here. I have been coming to Patrizia's for 2 years now and have came here with friends and family to celebrate many birthdays. I came yesterday with some friends to celebrate a  birthday and i understand that Friday evenings become very busy. We ordered from the regular Menu and opted out of doing family style due to different diet restrictions. We ate and were having normal conversation as anyone does when they come out to eat.  During our time there 4 different waiters came several times to ask if we were finished with our food and asked if we would like our food packed, while they saw were were not finished with our meals. Noticing that they kept doing this we opted to order more items so we can be left alone.  We noticed that no other parties were being constantly bothered asking if they were done as they had ordered family style. After a while the waiter who seated us informed us that they had a party of 8 and unfortunately we were asked if we can give up our seats. I understand that the restaurant is busy and if there is a limit to the time someone can come in to sit and eat, this should be noted outside where customers are aware when they are coming to eat here. We enjoyed our food here but we left quite annoyed.

Came here with my husband for a valentine's day dinner. I most say the food it's delicious and the service is great! Even though it was crowded we were taken care of very fast. I reserved this one because the one in Manhattan was booked. I definitely recommend this place to all the pasta lovers.

formatted_address: 235 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Parm

reviews.text: We had a fantastic meal here! While I don’t think the pasta was homemade the food was great and the staff was very friendly. We were with a large group and they were super accommodating.
Food was tasty and amazing. Would recommend. The service was great and our server, Jose, was really helpful and kind! Will come back again.

Good Italian place to eat if you are in the upper west side of Manhattan. The service is very good and the food tastes great. We went to have lunch and it was very quiet. We ordered one pasta each only with water and we ended up paying $23.5 each with tip included. Overall recommended.

Great portion and great service. 
I will come back for my birthday treat!!

I know you could most likely assume it based on the name but this place's chicken parm is awesome.  I don't know how they did it but that chicken stayed crispy and stood up to that sauce and cheese.  I would definitely stop by again if I were in the neighborhood.

formatted_address: 272 Smith St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Cubana Café

reviews.text: Great quality for a very affordable place. Very recommended to go for the late afternoon (3pm-5pm) when they have great deals for food. Food is really authentic, and the service is super kind. Plus, the music is always a good choice of artist, mainly latin music.
This place was great. Food was next level awesome. Service so great, their water was not overpriced, that was amazing.
Went here for brunch. All I can say is they have healthy options. If your looking for something that taste good and healthy, this is the place. Below is a pic of what I ate.

Affordable drinks, very good tasting food. Wish it was bigger because it deserves more customers at once. But I love the personal ambiance because it's a great place to take a date and hear yourself talk.
Delicious food with a cozy atmosphere. Great brunch spot and pricing is super accessible.

formatted_address: 33 W 8th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: ARDYN

reviews.text:
DIVINE on every level...
From the moment you walk in & feel the warmth from Spencer greeting & welcoming you.. to the fun, exciting vibe ... you know you’re somewhere special.
Spectacular service from EVERYONE and the food is absolutely exquisite/incredible/other worldly!
Loved being there and the chef is extremely talented, humble and thoughtful...
Hoping to return soon!!!

excellent attentive friendly table service on V day. nice food presentation. quality dishes with nice sauces. could have been 5 star but was soured by front of house who gave a hard time to give us a different 2 person table though we had reservations like most others. eventually she relented after discussing with host, sincerely apologized and gave us the seating but there was no good reason for it to begin with. will still come again though on a regular day!

Man this was a great meal. Our entire group was blown away. The service was on point and made such great suggestions. We could pick one favorite things because everything was that good. Michelin star is in there future

Food was amazing.. the 50/50 (bacon & ground beef) burger was AMAZING!!! 

definitely coming back with the group.  

Place was clean, bartender/ waitress was very nice and amazing.. they definitely go above and beyond.

They even helped to put on a sticker tattoo. Overall pleasant place to be and the decor is very nice..

The music was definitely in the Zone. Loved every moment i was inside eating and hanging out. Im definitely spreading the word.

We had reservations for dinner for a party of 3.  Upon arriving we were seated at a table in the dining area.  After looking at the menu it seemed very limited (~10 options).  

As we're getting ready to order we see a burger being brought to another table. We asked the server why don't we see that item on the menu?  He told us that the menu for the "bar area" was different than for the "dining area".  

The "bar area" was a few elevated seats with individual, taller tables (not an actual bar), about 5 feet away from where we were currently seated.  The tables were empty.  

Basically - they wouldn't serve us a burger (or any item from the other menu) unless we moved to the taller tables... we asked if we could move to the tables then, and the server said "for a burger?!" in a condescending tone.  

But one of our friends wanted the pasta from the "dining area" menu... so they wouldn't serve us that if we moved to the taller tables.  It was just a ridiculous thing to experience and I don't seem to "get it" I guess this place is just too fancy for us plebeians.

Anyway, the food itself wasn't great.  The quality of the food was good, but the way it was prepared wasn't.  Scallops had sand in them, the broccoli was burnt, some of the food was over salted / over peppered. 

I feel like they could tell something was off since they offered us a complimentary octopus dish.  This was nice since many places don't recognize or attempt to alleviate awkward situations.  We really appreciated this gesture.  

The server also asked us how our food was on multiple occasions and how everything was going - to which admittedly, we said everything was fine to.  This is also because we would never send back food unless it was seriously seriously terrible.  The policies of the restaurant were our biggest issue hence the review.

formatted_address: 78 Clark St #2402, Brooklyn Heights, NY 11201, USA
name: Ozu Japanese Cuisine & Lounge

reviews.text: This is a really good place to have sushi. I always come here to get sushi with my best friend after college. The service is excellent! I will always come back here! It is a lot better than the sushi place which is right across. We were served by Dylan, he is great!

Amazing food and service. Came here for Christmas day dinner and while we were the only ones there the staff were super nice and on top of things. Sushi and sashimi were fresh and delicious. Crispy duck app while not what I expected was absolutely delicious. Miso soup was some of the best I've had and the avacado salad and edamame were also fresh and tasty. With drinks and tip the bill came to $100 for 2 and was way more than enough food. Will definitely be back.

I’ll give this place a 8/10. It’s actually been almost a month since I’ve been here, and I just forgot to review this place. The sushi is excellent. I remember the taste was good. The only thing was that I remember we waited forever for the sushi to come out. We were not very patient, but that wait time failed to meet our expectations.

Friendly staff and good quality food. Have gone there several times with colleagues for just a casual lunch, to celebrate birthday or for large group farewell, and always had great customer service experience. Once we even ordered in advance when we were a group of 20, and all orders came in super quick and completely accurate. Good selection of vegetarian sushi too!

Excellent White Russians and black Russians. The Asian waiters are so lovely and caring and competent. I've never had one bite of food there. But I would definitely go back. They never play obnoxious music in  a loud manner!!!

formatted_address: 161 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Mezetto

reviews.text: A great little brunch spot! The food was amazing and the bottomless mimosas were great! $21 for unlimited for an hour in a half and they kept them coming! Great service; can’t go wrong! The burger and steak hash were amazing!

Came her with some friends on a Friday night. All I can say is portions are small, even by Manhattan standards. Flavoring was nothing special. All in all, an average meal for an outrageous price. Would not recommend. The service was exceptional- seemed to be two people working the entire restaurant, and while service was a bit slow, they made up for by taking good care of my table.

A lovely Mediterranean restaurant. Definitely worth coming here with friends or on a date before special occasions. I highly recommend their muscles with their seafood pastas. They also provide Holiday menus such as for Valentine's.

The food was super delicious and both the mimosas and sangria are solid choices for bottomless. The staff are so kind and accommodating and they are really quick to top off your drinks! I’m so glad we ate here. Will definitely be coming back to try some of the other menu items.

The calamari and the fries were really good. Calamari comes with sauce all over it, maybe you should specify if u want it with it over it, or not. Drinks were fine not too strong. But the service overall very good. Small location right by the train station but nice.

formatted_address: 1535 Broadway, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: The View Restaurant & Lounge

reviews.text: My boyfriend made dinner reservations for my birthday and it was absolutely outstanding!! Food was great! Ambiance was perfect, especially with the rotation of the restaurant. Views were amazing. Wait staff and manager personally greeted us and made us feel very welcomed! Best birthday gift ever!!! Menu was pricey but definitely worth it!! This place rocks!! If I could give it a 10 star, I certainly would have!!

The service was great and our food was impressive. The crab cake appetizer was delicious. The desser menu was amazing. It was hard to make our choices. I can't wait to explore the other part from the menu. We had amazing time and we would be back soon. I want to thank our concierge for recommending us this place. It was amazing.

360 views of "The City That Never Sleeps.'  All while enjoying an amazing buffet. We all were pleased but be aware of the Service Charge on the bill...I missed it the 1st night and double tipped our waitress.  It would have been nice if she told me.  Other than that, we all ate well and came back the next night to dine with friends.

Go for the view stay for the food. the lobster mac and cheese was my favorite thing to eat alongside the strawberry cheesecake dessert. If you get a chance to go during sunset  the view is amazing. a nice way to be in times square without all the noise pollution as you're above it all. have a cocktail and then take it all in as the restaurant slowly revolves So that you may get a 360 view of the city

If you are looking for a great atmosphere, amazing food and the best service, you can find it here. The location is one of the best in the city. I came here a couple of times and I wont hesitate for returning back. I am glad for receiving SMS recommendation from Teddy's guide for this lovely place.

formatted_address: 201 W 75th St, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: West Side Comedy Club

reviews.text: The inside has a nice clean neat look about it. We didn't eat food but drinks are okay. The service was good and not distracting like other comedy clubs. Comedians were funny and different which is good. Just beware there is a two drink minimum.

Great intimate place for comedy in NYC, and who knows, any comic just might stop in to work out their set. Order the queso and you won't be disappointed! Wait service during the show is excellent but not distracting.
The biggest laugh in town!

The manager was really rude. I think her name was Lori? Comedians were really funny, food was good and the club had a nice interior. The waitress was friendly, but the manager was just really snappy at us. Like as my date and I were walking in even. We weren’t heckling or talking during sets or anything. Her vibe was just terrible and she was very patronizing. Kinda put a damper on what would’ve been a great experience. Not sure if I’ll go back cause of her...

Ok. So the reason we go here is: 1). Great comedy; 2). Decent drinks; 3). Service; 4). Food ; So, 1). the comedy is always fresh and first class (we often bring visiting friends from all over the planet and they rave about it so much that we are pretty much obligated with each new visitor)! 2). The drinks are not your average selection as you can order anything from the super hip bar upstairs and they are not parsimonious with their alcohol!! 3). The hospitality began with our host, Lori, and the culture trickles down to everyone on the staff. They want you to have a great experience!! And they take that job seriously!! You will enjoy your night here! 4). Are you serious?!! The restaurant upstairs - Playa Betty, with such a great reputation offers their yumminess downstairs at the club! And, that seals the deal!! Check it out ! Respectfully; Karen & Robert ! 😉👍👍👍👍

formatted_address: 126 E 7th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Giano

reviews.text: To say that the food here is amazing would be a complete understatement. I was with a party of 5 people and we each deliberately ordered something different on the menu to see what the quality of food was like. Needless to say, all of us were floored at how delicious each of our dishes were. Most of these items were things that we couldn't pronounce, but it didn't matter because it was all so tasty. The pictures I've attached to this review should provide some idea as to how good the food was. All of the staff were very courteous and attentive to our needs. An overall incredible dining experience; would highly recommend.
My husband is still raving about this place!  The pasta dishes were to die for and the wine was good.  Minus 1 star because the calamari wasn't very good.  But the pasta still out shone everything
Excellent food! The candle-lit dining room didn't feel cramped, and had a relaxed ambiance. The staff were friendly and accommodating with kids.
Loved this place!  Owner was very attentive. Burrata cheese appetizer was amazing.  The gnocchi were light and melted in your mouth. Would definitely recommend and return next time in NYC!
Great house made pasta.  Wait staff is attentive and knowledgeable. Definitely recommend.

formatted_address: 220 Cadman Plaza W, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Park Plaza

reviews.text: I admire this place! They serve awesome dishes, their menu is large, The cook in that restaurant is a specialist, I like very much eating all their dishes. The food is always fresh and tasty, the service towards the visitors  is efficient. I visit often this place and I not even once was unsatisfied. I recommend it with no hesitation.

Came in quickly and ordered food to go with a large group.  The main server at the to go area was awesome! She was witty and fast paced. The breakfast sandwiches we ordered were great!  And in my opinion the bread roll was the best option.    The homemade hot bbq sauce  was a delicious addition! I wish I had grabbed some extra for later

I LOVE THIS PLACE!! I had breakfast here for the first time.  The grilled cheese sandwich is awesome!! The service is prompt.  The people are friendly.  The service  and food quality have been consistent.  Totally awesome!!
Been coming here for the past week just before school. Always a great experience with the friendly staff and the food is just wonderful.

Normally when we are away from home, we enjoy stopping into an old diner for comfort food. We asked for milkshakes "extra thick" as advertised on the menu. When I told the waiter they were watery he became defensive "I put extra ice cream." The shakes tasted like flavored ice milk. Pulled pork was flavorful. French fries lackluster. Fried chicken breast dry. My son enjoyed his burger. We won't be returning.

formatted_address: 18 9th Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: The Chester

reviews.text:
This was my first time here but my boyfriend comes often and I am normally on FaceTime when he is dining in. The service was exactly what I see him
getting; attentive and pleasant. I had to be at a meeting within an hour and they took our order immediately and brought out our food just as fast. The quality of service didn’t diminish by it being rushed by my request. The seasoning on the shrimp skewers is great. They are full of flavor but not over done with a very light crisp. My boyfriend had a burger paired with shoestring fries that I also enjoyed.

Great outdoor atmosphere when there's nice weather. The indoor bar atmosphere is just "Ok." Prices on drinks are outrageous and wine pours are teeny tiny, but I guess that's what you get at a trendy spot. The bartender was really nice and the music was a lot of fun.

Friendly staff and the food was tasty. However it was desperately understaffed. Our food took ages and things like salt and butter took an age to arrive. My wife's food came cold too.
I feel like a couple more staff would have fixed it all.
For the cost it totally isn't worth it to eat here. 
Drinks looked very good though so don't let this review put you off going for drinks as it was nice and clean, had big TVs and large tables for lots of friends.
This place is great! Atmosphere is perfect for drinks with the girls or for a party! Diana makes THE ABSOLUTE BEST espresso martini I HAVE EVER HAD! ITS A MUST TRY!
Great brunch option with bottomless mimosas! The bartender was great and we enjoyed ourselves very much

formatted_address: 168 Borinquen Pl, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Black Flamingo

reviews.text:
This was my first experience dining at an all-vegan restaurant. Wife and I arrived around 6 PM for early dinner.

The food left us both thoroughly impressed. If the Jam Taco has been overlooked as one of the top tacos in New York, have no doubts: it is undoubtedly one of the best you will find in this area of Brooklyn. I am excited to go back and try all the other tacos. We also ordered the Oyster Mushroom Fajitas and *wow* the texture was incredible and felt like very carefully cooked, tender chicken. I was surprised with how filling the meal was. 

My only qualm would be cleanliness. The suede seating area is understandably annoying to clean but there were visible particles (food? dust? dirt?) on the cushioning of our seats. My wife’s glass was dirty as well. 

Service was relaxed, not over-the-top happy, but still welcoming.

Second time here, really good food both visits ! Some pros and cons tho- Gets crowded around 10:30 on the weekends. Host was awesome ! Sat us quickly. Server very sweet. One tip to management- if you need to clear the tables by 11, communicate that. Instead we were told kitchen closed at 11 not that we had to leave by then. We had plenty of food on the table and were waiting for our second drink- and different server (maybe a manager ?)showed up w the check. Sensible from a biz perspective but not good to make customers feel rushed. We hadn’t even asked for to go boxes let alone were finished eating ! Very rude. Also neighboring tables still had food and drinks on the table. Felt uncomfortable and honestly ruined the experience. First visit was crowded too but never felt like we were being rushed out w practically full plates on the table. Next time I’ll go during the day if that.

Black Flamingo. The music, the atmosphere, the dual environments, the food. When I first began exploring Brooklyn I continuously landed on Black Flamingo. Deep, vocal house & techno for the nightlife crowds is what drew my attention initially, & once I finally moved to Brooklyn it was the personal touch left upon their dishes & cocktails that solidified my loyalty. A staple, a living culture, come to Black Flamingo!
Love that this place is 100% vegan. The food is great. The Strawberry 4 ways dessert was delicious. No matter what your meal is you have to have this Soo good.

I've only been here a few times, so I cant say I've tasted the entire menu yet. but everything that I've tried so far is really delicious. those little tacos pack a very complex and flavorful punch! the cocktails are really amazing as well. we've never had a complaint about any dish we've had. I have yet to visit the dance floor, I hope to do that soon.

formatted_address: 205 Chrystie St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Leave Rochelle Out Of It

reviews.text: So fun!! What a great place. We were here for national tequila day and Brett made us the best drinks. Great atmosphere, great location and great name!!

Bartender was sweet and down to earth. The crowd otherwise was that horrible mix of trying to be interesting but in reality blah. The drinks were okay. I’d come back if someone suggested it probably not on my own.
Love this bar. The vibe is so NYC and nothing beats Daddy do it all ;)

I love this place. It's a great corner bar but it actually has space and great bartenders (with a touch of baudy aesthetic). We run our meetup events here and everyone appreciates that they can grab a beer, some good snacks, and just move around and converse without having to worry about elbowing through crowds.
New York prices for beer and drinks.very trendy crowd at a trendy location. Very cordial and friendly service.

formatted_address: 3 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Olio e Piú

reviews.text: We had our boss's retirement party in their lovely and practical downstairs space with its own entrance.  The food was plentiful and delicious, the staff was accommodating and the 'green' wall, charming.  The event planner, Brooke, was extremely knowledgeable and helpful with organizing the daunting task of arranging a party for over 100 people.  I highly recommend this establishment!

I love this place! The food is so fresh & delicious! The service is also amazing! I’ve been to this place many times but this time my waiter Victoria stood out to me! She was super helpful & very attentive!❤️❤️❤️

Can’t speak more highly of our experience here! The ambience and setting are gorgeous. The staff was so friendly and we never felt rushed as we enjoyed several courses. The food was INCREDIBLE. You cannot go wrong with any of the handmade pastas. I truly wish I was eating it again

The staff is super helpful and give good recommendations if you’re not too sure what to get or if it’s your first time. Our server, Victoria, was amazing! The atmosphere is very intimate and they have a cool pizza oven. Would definitely recommend this place for date night

This place is delicious and authentic! The atmosphere is also very warm with a well-decorated space. I got the risotto and it was phenomenal. Our waitress Victoria was attentive, kind, and very friendly! I can’t wait to come back!

formatted_address: 226 W 52nd St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: SuperNova

reviews.text:
This is probably was my best New Year’s Eve ever! I love the ambiance, the appetizer selection is impeccable to say the least and the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff is perfect.
The NYPD close the streets early and people 'camp' very early.
Times Square is fantastic to see the tall buildings, TV screens and to be a part of something that many people dream about. 
 At midnight the ball drops and a little firework starts! This view is just so beautiful that you forget how weak you are.

We had a corporate summer party here and had a blast. Views of Times Square from the outdoor space were amazing. Bar was great and they whipped up some amazing cocktails for us. Food was excellent. Will be back for more of the views and the cocktails.

The place is beautiful and has a great view. The hosts were very friendly and accommodating. The service was average and the food was good but not great. The drinks were awesome and made strong with great flavor. If you want a great view of Times Square this is the place to go. Unfortunately, if its on New Years eve, it can cost you $11, 000 plus for 3 people if you want a table.

Staff was so friendly and pleasant to chat with. The views are spectacular. The food was delicious. We celebrated my daughter's 10th birthday and stayed at the hotel. She loved the ice cream here! Looking forward to another visit.

This Place is awesome. I highly recommend this venue for many reasons. Their staff, the food, the view and very clean restrooms make this place perfect for corporate gatherings and events of any kind. Book it!

formatted_address: 55 Water St, New York, NY 10041, USA
name: Sky55 bar and grill

reviews.text: It was ok. I had a burger and the it was really good damn near high end. The fried potatoes were too starchy. I could tell they were not blanched.  Had a decent whiskey sour.
The best drinks out there. The staff is great and the food is great. Nice place to spend a Friday night out. If you like it my review please check the thumbs up.
Had a specialty watermelon cocktail which did not taste good... and service in the beginning was terrible...i was my own waitress... nice ambiance.

Bar food better than average. especially chicken sandwiches. Place is a bit tricky to find. Look for escalators coming to sidewalks. Outside of the bar, on the back there is a terrace with nice view of waterfront.
Terrific spot, great drinks, accommodating bartenders and reasonable prices

formatted_address: 87 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: The Firehouse, Engine 31 Building

reviews.text: You are top guys ! God bless you all
Met a guy here some years back and enjoyed the history lesson..
It's a historic fire station — beautifully designed — that sometimes hosts events and dance parties.

formatted_address: 444 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Hummus Kitchen

reviews.text: An intimate little restaurant in the heart of Murray hill that serves some very generous portions of food and drinks. We came for an early dinner and the place was empty so we were immediately seated. The servers were warm and friendly and all our orders came quickly and the food was delicious . The place got very crowded later on. They do have outdoor seating as well.

Interesting place with generous portions and welcoming staff. It felt a little high-priced for lunch (I didn't notice any lunch specials) but the quality was there and they was plenty of pita to match the various dips we ordered. Nice decor and atmosphere.

Used to be a resident around the area and recently back then found this place while heading to Duane Reade. I was alone so only had a chicken hummus but it was a nice choice I made, lol. Glad that I stepped up more in this food adventure in NYC. Pita was something with olive oil.

Went for late lunch/brunch. Food was excellent and thoughtfully prepared. Recommend the turkish sausage and eggs

Staff were very friendly and helpful. Left feeling like the restaurant deserved every penny.
Tasty food, attentive service. Liked the decor. Went for a lunch time meeting, not crowded and cozy feel.

formatted_address: 200 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Altesi Downtown

reviews.text: Stumbled in for dinner and the food was hot, fresh and amazing! Portions were not large but they were sufficient and most importantly everything we ordered was delicious.  Dessert came out nicely plated and warm and the daily special lobster risotto I ordered had large chunks of lobster.

We absolutely love every time we visit Altesi. We were here just last month for Saturday lunch and we decided to go for dinner last night. Love the outdoor seating, service was phenomenal, food was fantastic and the owner is extremely down to earth and literally works just as hard as the staff does! The octopus entrée was so good that we ordered the same dish the second time. The fusilli with clams and freshly made pesto was delicious too. Friday night was packed and the entire restaurant had a really good vibe. Lots of groups and a really good Italian place for dates too. Will definitely be coming back here soon!:)

Very good brunch for the price. Only thing was that if you order the bottleless drinks 5 minutes before brunch you'll be charged for those.  Waiter was very attentive until 20 minutes before the brunch 5 minutes before ordered last round which was our 3rd drink.  That was on the bill didn't dispute but will have second thoughts going there again.

I have been consistently coming to this restaurant for many years. It’s rare in New York to walk into a place that consistently remembers you and is happy you are there. The food is always amazing and the service is perfect. I hope to keep coming for many years.

The service from the servers was awesome. The food was prepared fast & yummy, especially the polpettine. Was not in love with the bread, bread butter & amount of salt added for the fish. The ambiance is intimate and played good Italian music.

formatted_address: 192 Mercer St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Gonzalez y Gonzalez

reviews.text: Came to Gonzalez y Gonzalez for a quick bite. I ended up getting guacamole and chips, the guacamole could’ve been better... it was also very little amount. The chips were good. I also had a margarita which I cant complain about, it was nice and strong enough, not a watered down drink. This is a lively restaurant that turns into a full blown party at night, Super fun!

I honestly really enjoy this place. Small place but it has good music and sound. I've liked all of the food items that I've tried. Live Salsa on Fridays. Bring your dancing shoes and your best moves. I would say it's about a $$ place not super expensive. I would recommend this place for singles and also a great place to go on a date. Get there early and enjoy the happy hour, stay for dinner and then dancing. There is plenty to do. They take cards but I would suggest taking cash for the bar. Bathrooms are kind of far, it's the only knock I have for this place but it's not bad enough for me to take away stars.

Fantastic and fun.  Carlo the bartender is so much fun. We laughed so hard and ate some much. We are now looking to do my friends birthday party in March.  Thank you very much again Carlos. I call him now  CARLITOs Way!!!

My second home! Catch me there on a Thursday dancing the night away. The owner Joe treats his regulars like family. The service is amazing, the food is to die for (personalnfavs are the grilled salmon or steak dish). Get there before 9pm for free entry, after that it is around $10. You'll get a great return for that investment.

I really loved the place, the food was amazing! I had the salmon with crispy skin and my friend had the skirt steak. The drinks were ok and the waiters were beyond amazing, the place got packed as the night progress and we had an amazing time.

formatted_address: 274 4th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Colony 274

reviews.text: The space is amazing...and thenowner Kitty is INCREDIBLE to work with...always lookignnour for her customers and the community. I host my annual Coat/Shoe Drive (Karaoke night) here for the past 7yrs and my donors and I Love it!
Nice atmosphere got a pool table and great food
Yaymaker with Thomas MCLaughlin  we had a great time 🥂

Colony is huge and I was happy to discover that it also has great finger food, live music and karoake! 
Recording artist- Edwin Vazquez
