Went here for a Crab Fest. The staff is SOOOO attentive. And it wasn’t annoying either. If they saw you needed something they’d just do it. Also saw a paint nite going on so might check that out. Overall it was a great experience.

formatted_address: 175 W 90th St, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Blockheads

reviews.text:
Cons: There's needs to be a better waiting area. I arrived before the rest of my party and there wasn't a place forme to wait.
Pros: The drinks are well worth a visit. The server Danni was more than amazing. The drinks and JUST DANNI makes it worthy of a revisit.

Lively, very together and receptive. Came after looking for somewhere to eat kinda late with no reservation available but the service was nice. A bit packed but wasn't really too big of a deal. Food was great and drinks will great to for value(got a patron pitcher for $40). Would do it again.

Typical Blockheads, though this location has more indoor seating than the others I have been to. The outdoor seating when I was there in July 2019 was covered by a sidewalk shed. Indoors can be rather loud, but that's standard at most Blockheads. Drinks were par for Blockheads (a little on the weaker side), but decently priced. Food was good but salty.

Great casual spot. Lots of veggie and vegan options. Nachos were really good. Good prices. Only thing is the unnecessary disposable plastic cups for the sour cream, salsa and jalapeños - could invest in non disposable containers.
Really good food and a great price for lunch. Their mango frozen margaritas are amazing! And it's only $5

formatted_address: 62 W 9th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Casa Apicii

reviews.text:
Food was decent,  ingredients were top notch but the dishes were just a little off. The squid was well cooked but just a little under seasoned and served like warm.  Meatballs tasted great but might have been over worked a bit,  making them a little mealy.
Pastas were decent, however the steak was over cooked. Nice space but also very noisy.
Great small place for private parties.  Specialty drinks are pretty good.

Food was very good, staff wonderful. The decor is nice, and I was delighted to find that I could carry on a conversation with my dinner companion without shouting. The music selection was terrible for the space, though. "Ain't No Rest For the Wicked" by Cage the Elephant did not enhance the romantic Italian dinner.
Delicious italian food. The eggplant was delicious, best described as an eggplant lasagna parmigiana. The branzino was also quite tasty.

The whole experience was amazing. Service was fantastic. All the staff were incredibly friendly and equally attentive. The food was wonderful. The mushroom side dish was very very good but the Bucaniti pasta was amazing. The shrimp linguine was also super delicious. Everything tasted very fresh. Great ambience. Feels classy but in no way over the top. Definitely coming back!

formatted_address: 39 E 58th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: LAVO Nightclub

reviews.text:
If there was zero stars, I would have given to this place. 
Me and my fiance went there and they said if you don''t have a ticket, we will charge you $200 minimum for drinks. I was shock! However, I still accepted as it was a special occasion and I didn't want to ruin our night. We walked in, and the host handed me a paper (receipt upfront being charged $200) PLUS 20% TIP and I haven't even started or settled down. This place will take every single advantage of you. I inquired about why I was being charged upfront while and I don't even have a table or a server. The host had the worst attitude and called security right away to take us out. It was horrible and I would never recommend  neither come to this place again.

Came here with a promoter and bouncer was nice, coat check was good as well. The atmosphere was a lot of fun. The DJ that was there the night I went, played really great house music. There were amazing go go dancers every 20 minutes. My table was paid for. The bathrooms are nice as well. There is plenty of space for people to dance. The crowd is mostly young people as well. People dress pretty well. I am definitely going back on a different night. All in all, I had a really fun time.

I'm from Europe and wanted to visit some nice clubs during my first trip to New York. Thanks to all the reviewers for your information. At least now I know which club I'm not going to visit. I would like to avoid having wannabe bouncers mess up my vacation.

They don’t know where they put the jackets... we were waiting for 1 hour for 1 jacket guys.. and the manager said wait til closing time... i’m never coming back here ever again... it’s crazy how they talk to me...

It had the potential to be fun. I waited for about 30 minutes in the rain to be let in but my husband and friend were not allowed in because they were males. Never officially said that but these undercover bouncers were pushing only girls through. When it came time for my husband to be let in he was given trouble. I was then told to go in and I said I was waiting for my husband and friend to be let in and they questioned why they weren't let in with me?! I left after this because I wasn't going in alone and I was not going to leave my husband and friend in the rain. We were ready to spend money and you lost our business today and our future trips.

formatted_address: 183 Christopher St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Heermance Farm Purveyors

reviews.text: Sounds Like a very Delicious way to start the day or @lunch we must go for a Bite or two

What a little gem!  Great sandwich and soup menu.  From vegan to not.  Fresh local produce.  Stepped up the counter and go, "What can I make for you?"  It's on Christopher St. but way at the west end of it.  Unfortunately off the beaten path, but way worth going a block and half out of your way for!  Excellent food, even better service, and really friendly people.  Will def be back.
I read a review that said this place has the best sandwich. Tried it out myself and... I agree. Strongly recommend this place.
Fresh vegetables grow from there very own farm...great quality
Amazing food and a great place to grab a drink for lunch!

formatted_address: 208 Grand St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Zen Yai Viet Cajun&Pho

reviews.text: This is an excellent Pho restaurant with many interesting choices. The spring rolls were some of the best and freshest I have ever tasted in NYC. We were pleasantly surprised to have this gem in our neighborhood. Well done...!

The food was amazing. That could be the whole review and be worth 5 stars. But it is also aesthetically pleasing too. With a lot of nice little choices, all the way to the floor. It adds to the vibe. 

But honestly if it was a dirty little nook through a broken hole in the wall that was overpriced the food would still make it worth it.

My wife and I split Oxtail Pho and a Banh Mi and couldn't choose which was better. Both amazing. And if we tried the Curry puff app before ordering we may have just ordered a dozen and skipped the meal it was so good.

So delicious. Great atmosphere, fast service, and a menu that caters to vegans and non vegans alike. We tried the summer rolls, vegetable pho, and lychee martini (which comes in a fun stemless glass). Would absolutely go back!

Yum yum! Came here the other day and hot the banh mi from the vegan menu, and a cocktail. Food arrived fast (we only had a short time to eat before seeing a movie) and everything was delicious. My friend had the vegan pho and that looked amazing too.  Will definitely be coming back! The staff were lovely too, our guy recommended this spicy cocktail that was 💯
Beautiful new space in Brooklyn! Fans of the original Sunnyside location. So happy for the owners in their new space. Food is affordable and very delicious. Lots of vegan options too.

formatted_address: 243 W 38th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: INDIAN PROJECT Restaurant & Bar

reviews.text: Great food. Nothing super special or unique about the joint, it's just good food, good service and decent pricing.

Decent place to eat indian food. 
Very close to times square and doesn't require reservations.

Went here for the second time this year and was disappointed compared to the first experience. The ambiance was the same but the food was disappointing. No spice at all, lacking flavor.  Good portions and good price but it's not like we wanted to eat a lot because it was not very good. I know we came late on a slow night but, that doesn't mean the food should be neglected.  Will not return on our next trip. Many other places to try.

It is definitely worth going to Indian Project! The place 
Is very nice and cozy. The food was exquisite and creative. The service was  very quick. Very happy and friendly staff 
You should definitely go there.
Was great! Can’t recommend this enough. Staff attentive, food lovely, really good all round.

formatted_address: 20 Hudson Yards, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Queensyard

reviews.text: Overall I had a great time at Queensyard. The service was great starting from the moment we entered. The staff was very welcoming and made sure that all our needs were met. The food was delicious and well presented. In addition, sitting by the window further enhanced my dining experience. Great place to check out

Tried queensyard for restaurant week brunch on Sunday. Posh British restaurant in Hudson Yards. We were promptly seated and the service was good. For the 2 course brunch we ordered cauliflower salad and kale salad. I feel they were very plain and could use more flavor. For example the kale salad had very little vinaigrette and was a very basic kale leaves, candied nuts and sliced plums. For a restaurant this posh I would have expected a bit more oomph factor to the recipe. Mains were crab risotto and mac and cheese. Good but not a wow dish. We ordered bread to start which was freshly baked (was an extra charge). Best was the Fab cocktail. Perfectly made and delicious. I would be back for more of those and will enjoy the bar.
Great view...food was superb. I recommend the fish. It was excellent. Liver pate was also very nice. The atmosphere was great. Service was okay.

Great view! The service was great from the very first moment and till the end of our lunch. Food is great, but we didn't have an opportunity to taste different dishes, but steak was perfect. And drinks! Their cocktails are amazing. It was great experience. Thank you Queensyard!

Beautiful, spacious restaurant on the 4th floor of Hudson Yards. Dining there made me really appreciate British cuisine (their Fish & Chips are amazing but I recommend also trying the Berkshire Pork Chop, Lancaster Chicken & Burgundy Truffle Risotto). Loved sitting at the bar and enjoying a gin cocktail with the best views of The Vessel.

formatted_address: 342 W 40th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Collage Bistro

reviews.text: great  service ambiance
Montana was wonderful! Came back every morning since Friday just for her! Sandy helped us out this morning and was great as well! 😊
It is a big college many classes of all field's O yes I appove for high school kids go to college Bistro try it out look it up ?
I've had better, & it was a tad over okay
Clean,friendly staff,beautiful collage

formatted_address: 208 E 58th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Bloom's Tavern

reviews.text: Let's get price out of the way. It is not cheap but how many bar restaurants are cheap in NYC? With that said, the prices are fair in the CONTEXT of being in midtown. So when I come here I get excellent service from wait staff or bartenders and I always have a good time. So there is really nothing to complain about and this place deserves the 5 stars it is getting. Keep up the good work!
Irish tavern. Nice decorations on the rooftop and second floor. Happy hour is available, and in general the prices are decent. Very popular; weekends are jam-packed.

Last of the job for all of us n we went there to spend one last time before we go on to new things.  The whole place was us top and bottom. I saw people I use to work with I haven't seen in a yr or two other haven't seen each other in 10+ yrs. It was a great night drinks were great and the bartender was very good under all that madness. ❤ ❤

Awesome bar. I came here twice with a group of 30 people. The communication with the place before coming here was fast and effective, and the service during the event was great. I highly recommend this place.
The staff is really good! Very very tasty food!

formatted_address: 7 E 27th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Leonelli Taberna

reviews.text: Beautiful creative food (loved the octopus!) and reasonable prices. Very nice ambiance, elegant Bar (Happy Hour) – everything is in the right place. Good service also. We had a very delicious early dinner. Strongly recommended!

In the shadow of the Empire State Building, this “on the run” breakfast stop is a delight!  Hot(really hot) coffee, homemade oatmeal with choice of toppings...and (wait for it!). All at an exceptionally reasonable price!! (Under $10). Stop by, have a quick seat, an on the go breakfast. Then Get It Done!!!
Great creative food, high quality. Nice ambience and easonable prices. We had a delicious dinner.

Leonelli Taberna is a popular restaurant in midtown. I have now become quite the regular, mainly because they have the best NYC pasta! Chef Jonathan Benno is quite well known for his pasta, so if you love pasta like I do, Leonelli Taberna is the best Italian restaurant to go to!

As an Italian, I am asked quite often what is my fav Italian restaurant in the city.
Well, I can say that Leonelli certainly is one of the best. The atmosphere is great, intimate and warm.
The food is simply excellent, with high quality ingredients skillfully mixed together to form incredible flavors.
The only cons: every time I come here I eat too much.
Ah, I forgot!, the people and the service here are amazing, always welcoming, smiling and nice!
I love Leonelli!

formatted_address: 244 W 14th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Up&Down

reviews.text: Horrible and poorly managed nightclub. Waited outside for over an hour even though we reserved and paid for a VIP table. MAJOR PROFILING! They pick and choose who they want to let in. Others with VIP tables were able to get in right away but some had to wait. They charge different entrance fees based on how you look. My friends all got charged different fees. They don't have the downstairs bar open, which caused upstairs to be extremely crowded. Drinks are way too expensive. DON'T GO HERE IT"S NOT WORTH IT.
Here for an event, cool hidden Karaoke room and sushi is good too
Best place ever having a parter there soon. The staircase is so cool.

I tried to enter tonight because I wanted to visit the place since so many people talk about it.  First they had no private party or anything because before I called, I already found out everything before arriving because well, being at the door I was going to pay $ 20.00 to enter and in what I am taking out the money came a safety a fat and hairy talking to me badly that I moved and  to take me off the line, I moved because I thought someone was going to happen but it was not like that. I meant that I wanted to get out of the line. I moved and I felt very bad for his treatment because I was very well dressed and willing.  to pay my money for them to be so rude, the truth is a place of great fame but with very bad service of their securities.

Top notch nightclub. Got to see Future and DJ Chase B for a celebrity appearance and performance. Management and the bartenders were great and very friendly. I definitely will be returning and getting bottle service again.

formatted_address: 717 9th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: VIV

reviews.text: We had a lively group of 6, reservations on Saturday at 1pm. Wasn't too crowded but there were patrons there! Great service, good wsd excellent. Sometimes I worry about Thai being too spicy but mine was not, nor did anyone else in our party. The portions look small on the menu but they're a good size, I wasn't able to finish all of my Thai sausage fried rice. It was delicious. We chose this place because two people were vegan, and they had a decent amount of options for them. Everyone was happy, will visit again!

I really enjoy the food and atmosphere
I visited late night after a show. They had a table but they were still pretty full. 
I ordered a drink, something with ginger, which was amazing!
The Tom Kha soup was out of this world. Lemongrass peeks from the rim and the flavors and aroma are AMAZING. I ordered not spicy.

The pad Thai was perfect.
I have to give the waiter a lot of credit, he was very attentive to my dietary restrictions. AMAZING again.

The glitz and the fun atmosphere is definitely worth the trip back
This restaurant offers extraordinary service as well as tasty meals. One of my favourite restaurants around here. The drinks and food arrived fast and the prices are affordable. Highly recommended.

The service was very polite. The drinks were great and the food was just fantastic. I'd highly recommend this place. Their menu was varied enough but not overwhelming. We went for a late lunch/early dinner so I don't know how crowded it gets.

The food was sooo good, but the customer service though wasn’t. Our whole stay we had to wait for someone to take our order, drinks, bill everything. The time my husband & I went the place literally had 4 people inside. So having to wait for someone each time to get something made no sense. Besides that, the place is an intimate/small space, & the decor is lovely. Plus the food & drinks were delicious!

formatted_address: 111 E 7th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Ladybird

reviews.text: cute place. nice tapas like dishes. bun and kale ceasar are must haves. very welcoming and comfortable. attentive service. great atmosphere and design. don't have to be vegan to enjoy.

Staff was very friendly and the ambiance was warm and welcoming. The food was excellent and satisfying. Each dish was unique and flavorful to the last bite. I though the system of marking down the dishes you wanted is a good idea. I would definitely come back. Hope this helps!

We began the evening after being seated 30min late for our reservation, and service continued to be slow the entire evening, especially between each course that was served. However! The hostess and our waitress continuously checked in with us, apologized for the pace of service, and made sure our drink orders were kept up with. The food was also amazing; each course was perfect and not sloppily arranged etc. So!!! Even though the service was not NY paced or timely, they were hospitable and made the evening very pleasant. We appreciated their close attention to us. Would definitely recommend. //An intimate space with an unforgettable ambiance. Perfect representation of the amazing vegan cuisine in NY.

It's a gem in the east village. Delicious food and fantastic service. Love the ambiance too. Perfect for a date. Catch up with a friend at the bar and enjoy their cocktails. Or go late night for the dessert.

I mean there's nothing I can say that you haven't heard. The reviews are true the food is tasty, very good and the atmosphere was perfect. Solid for a date, the staff is friendly and attentive. The food, man, I don't care if you consider yourself a meat eater for life such as I do, everyone should have that fondue at least once in their lifetime. Great drinks too

Ladybird damn good restaurant. I'm going back

formatted_address: 73 Gansevoort St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Bubby's

reviews.text: Came here today for brunch with 3 other people. Everyone LOVED their respective brunch entrees and the mimosa flights were so cool! We were on the wait list so we arrived when told and were seated quickly. Would definitely return.

The biscuits and the pie alone get 5 stars. The biscuits are flaky and buttery and soft, without being too greasy. The pie (Michigan cherry) isn’t too sweet and the crust is firm; definitely get it with vanilla ice cream. 

Braised short rib is heartiness on a plate. The meat falls off the bone; the grits are cheesy and comforting; the sauce has the tanginess of tomato without being sour or too acidic. Good for cold weather.

I've been trying to go from a long time ago and finally did it and it's definitely much better than I thought. The pancakes are smooth and buttery , just amazing and the place in general have a nice vibe. 100% worth it
Amazing place!! Food and atmosphere. 80’s soul music. Friendly staff. Best brunch in NYC thus far. Thank you for a great start of the day!

Awesome pancakes, coffee was good. I came really early in the morning, was asked to wait outside in the cold for 5 minutes until they opened. I guess they could have let me sit inside quietly in the warm if they thought about it. Otherwise a lovely experience :)

formatted_address: 70 Pine St, New York, NY 10005, USA
name: Crown Shy

reviews.text:
I think I already wrote a dinner reservation a year ago -- which was really good.

The secret is that the brunch is also really good, especially for those with a sweet tooth. 

I don't think people have caught on to the fact that they are serving brunch yet since I am still able to make reservations the day of. I live a block away from Crown Shy so I always love stopping in. 

I've had a lot of french toast in NYC. But this French toast blew my mind away. I had brunch here weeks ago and I'm still telling people about it. It's so impossibly  light and delicious. My friend also ordered the donut which was also phenomenal. The omelette was an omelette...but the French toast was a masterpiece.

Can't wait till one of my friends asks me to do brunch again and I can be like "Okay...Crown Shy?"

We didn't have a reservation and were super impressed by the staff at Crown Shy. From the hostess to the bar waiter to the gentleman who waited on us at the table and even the manager who seemed to take an interest in our table too everyone was really professional and very knowledgeable and gracious. 

I really loved the gruyere fritters with the oozing cheese. You have to get them! The olive and lemon bread was stunning I especially loved the stripes and dough it looked beautiful and tasted delicious with the labne on the side. I would have preferred butter only because I'm piggy that way. Other highlights were the pear and endive salad, the carrots with the razor clams, the quail and the short rib which is beautifully presented. We had the sticky date pudding for dessert which almost brought My boyfriend to tears. It was rich and light at the same time which is unusual for that dish. Traditionally the pudding is very dense and delicious but this was much more airy. I didn't think the Apple sorbet really worked on it for my taste. I think it only needs cream. But he wolfed it down. One dish to avoid would be the acorn squash I don't think it had enough personality compared to the other dishes.

The waiters recommendations were accurate. 
Best thing we had were the razor clams. 
The bread a close second. 
Everything else was fresh and clean but not impressive.  
Great space,  lots of room and a pretty nice semi private dining area.

Dined at the bar solo. Had to wait 45 min but there was a very accommodating host who added me to a list and took my coat. Food, wine, and service were all excellent and this meal was memorable. Dining room is appealing. Try the carrots with razor clams, unique and really delicious. Thanks!

Absolutely delicious meal! Even the bread! I would recommend everything we ordered: hummus, carrots, octopus, pasta, and chicken all had unique flavors. We ended the meal with the sticky pudding which was just fabulous! You can’t go wrong at this restaurant.

formatted_address: 230 W 39th St 4th floor, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Actuar

formatted_address: 181 Thompson St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Carbone

reviews.text: Absolutely stunning food, ambiance, and customer service. Every dish was hot, tasty, and served in a timely manner. The place was very busy and is extremely popular due to their excellent food and quality experience provided. The lemon cheesecake is to die for, if you have the opportunity to partake, please do. I will definitely be heading back to Carbone. Hope this helps!

Had a fantastic experience here! From the music to the relaxed atmosphere where we didn’t feel rushed (or cramped!), it was a good time. On top of what we ordered, they also threw in extras here and there (bread basket, pickled cauliflower, salami, Parmesan, cookies) which supplemented the meal. Our check was expensive, but it was actually slightly cheaper than we thought. If you want a special, Italian meal, this is your spot — just make sure to plan your reservation a couple months in advance.

Mario Carbone is an impressive chef for the quality of his cooking and life skills.  he is surrounded by an outstanding team.  it's a real person is it feels in the quality of that cuisine.  I was delighted and honored to have been a driver on the French Riviera.  with a tear to see him go.

Came here in December and loved how everything was so festively decorated. Our server was great, super fun personality. I know everyone says this place is overrated and overpriced, but we thoroughly enjoyed it all! The food was excellent, the experience was too! Gotta go at least once and then decide for yourself. I would happily return.
Of course spicy rigatoni vodka! Carbone was such a amazing experience from start to finish; especially starter was the best yum

formatted_address: 250 Hudson St Suite 703, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Sopexa USA

formatted_address: 103 Washington St, New York, NY 10006, USA
name: St. George Tavern

reviews.text: Had breakfast here the morning. The hotel is great. The pub could be really cool except the wood floors, table and bar all need to be properly sanded and refinished. Just not classy for a Manhattan location. The food is low quality and the staff, while friendly enough, was unorganized and inefficient. Took far too long from when we sat down to when we received a menu and water.  Also, music was too loud (for breakfast), dated and the acoustics for it being a restaurant, we're terrible. I could not hear the person directly across from me at the table, and my parents had to take out their hearing aids because of so much kitchen noise. Lots of potential, however. It's a great old space, but lacks the luster one expects from a downtown Manhattan restaurant attached to a hotel.

I went in for the free hotel breakfast.

Service was good.  Food was very bland.  I'm pretty sure they did not use any seasoning while cooking.  My food came out wrong at first, as well.  Not sure how they handle a busy restaurant, when they can't handle three tables

St George’s Tavern is AMAZING!! Food was delicious. We had burgers, chicken sandwich and cheesecake. Service was fabulous. Colleen and Ray were extremely nice. Must stop by and see them! Restaurant was very clean.
Good place where to eat when you stay in Holiday Inn. I had delicious french onion soup and a glass of tasty red wine.

Took 8 minutes before we were even acknowledged. Once we ordered, it took 30 minutes for the meals to even come out. Mind you there are only 4 other tables in the entire place. Then my meal was entered incorrectly by the server and is taking an additional 15 minutes to come out. Altogether I've been waiting over 45 minutes for my food to come out. The restaurant was absolutely dead. After asking to speak to the manager he only offered 20% of the meal for the mistake. Later changed it to 50% when he saw me on my phone. The food was not worth it.

formatted_address: 77 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Grey Lady

reviews.text:
I came here early on a Friday evening with reservations (recommended).

Things I loved:
- Atmosphere - really laid back and relaxed
- Oysters - at $1 an oyster during happy hour, these were spectacular 
- Clam Chowder - absolutely delicious. I could not stop eating it. If you come for just one thing, let it be this

Things I Didn’t Love As Much:
- Lobster Mac and Cheese: I typically love a good lobster Mac but this one left me feeling unsatisfied. The Mac and cheese was way more soupy than gooey - the cheese did not have any pull. The flavor was ok but not spectacular. The price could definitely be lower. 

Overall, it was a good experience. The clam chowder and oysters were definitely the stars of the show and I would happily return for them.

We got there toward the tail end of Happy Hour so were able to take advantage of the dollar oysters, which were fresh, cold, and decently shucked (just a few bits of shell got through). The vibe is more rock 'n' roll than I expected from the outside, but that was fine. It really emptied on a Friday after Happy Hour ended, and they were content to let us sit and chat and nurse our drinks for quite a while.
Nice little spot for oysters. Happy hour until 7 has $1 oysters, $8 cocktails and $5 drafts. Plenty of seating after happy hour

We gave this place a second try and the oysters were a lot better! Fresh & cold. Great happy hour drink deals like summer ales and cocktails. We will definitely be back. Pretty yummy chowder too. Nice staff and sweet decorations. Quick service too!

Grey Lady has a rustic feel with a cool décor, blue-gray leather couch, classic white-marble bar, a handful of wooden tables and black-and-white photos of ladies in gray.

Located right on Delancey bringing some Nantucket vibes right to Lower East Side

We discovered the Grey Lady randomly while walking around the area. We were attracted to the casual and interesting décor.

Bar was pretty much empty on a Tuesday night around 9pm, and only one dinner table was taken. It was perfect since we were looking for a quiet place for a night cap drink. The bartender (sorry forgot his name!) was very friendly and attentive

We ended up ordering fries (by bartender’s suggestion) and I’m glad we did! Fries were so crispy and delicious!

formatted_address: 851 6th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: The Vine

reviews.text: An enjoyable lunch set in a lively restaurant tucked in the back of the Event hotel. Modern and spacious seating areas that open up to outdoor seating facing the public plaza. Menu consists of generally healthy yet indulgent options. Delicious! Would certainly come back to try out the dinner service.

Love the design and atmosphere, the restaurant is a part of hotel(tricky enter).. food was tasty but very small portion( even for European).. delicious deserts! We were amazed with our waiter, that’s why 5⭐️
Pricy place  $$$
I love the food at this place and great service. The hostess get you seated very quickly and right away there's someone there to help you with your order. Would you recommend to family and friends.
We had a blast in that restaurant. The food was really good. The cocktails were very good. I highly recommend
Delicious calamari. The design is beautiful. Good attention. Romantic vibe

formatted_address: 44 Trinity Pl, New York, NY 10006, USA
name: Wogies

reviews.text: Good food and friendly staff. This was a happy find that I will try again. If they repeat on my second visit then I'll edit this review to 5 stars.
Omg the food here is so good. I felt like we found a gem in downtown.... loved our server she was so nice even tho there was no happy hour on weekend (booo) but yes, I had a great time here

Walked in to a completely empty restaurant, wondered why such a beautiful place would be so quiet. After ordering drinks and sandwiches, I now know why. I originally ordered a Bloody Mary as the waitress stated “we have a full bar” after telling my girlfriend that they did not have coffee... and then I was told 5 minutes later they didn’t have the ingredients to make a Bloody Mary. They advertise to be a bakery, which is what lured my girl and I in to the place, having eaten at a neighboring restaurant and not being pleased the day before. However, this is really just a sandwich shop that sells bread, and tries to make drinks... “tries” is the key word. The staff is friendly, but they need lessons on how to mix drinks. I ordered a Maker’s Mark Old Fashioned and it was quite possibly the worst drink I have ever been served, and it was poured and served to me in a double shot glass... $16 for a drink that should have cost me $5 anywhere else. The sandwiches served were dry, cheese was melted but was not hot. Fries were delicious but oily. Sadly, what could be a great little place disappoints.

I went to try the cheese steak and it was amazing. Shout out to Teddy's guide for recommending me this location. The price for this delicious food is amazing. The staff is working really fast so you won't wait at all. I definitely recommend this location to everyone.
Solidly reliable neighborhood joint with tasty bar food and a professed affinity for Philly sports teams. Consistently friendly staff and food options keep me coming back time after time.

formatted_address: 181 Smith St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Black Forest

reviews.text: They make a nice schnitzel. It's a very good sized portion. I enjoyed the breakfast platter. It's a great place to bring kids. They are also very generous with the community and hosted our plant swap this morning which is very nice. When the weather is behaving you can sit outside. I'd recommend it as a good neighborhood spot.

Staff were all really friendly :) pretzel was really great, soft inside chewy shell perfect amount of salt. Yum!

The sausages were awesome! Nice to have mashed potatoes on the side as well as fries. 

I liked this place a lot. Wasn’t on the list of places to hit originally, but I’d come back if I was close by! And you should too!

I celebrated my PhD yesterday in this delicious restaurant. Well we passed a enjoyable evening and the restaurant was surely one of the reasons for that successful meeting. The crew  contributed in a splendid style, the cooking was extremely good and my guests were very  happy. We shall definitely visit again for more joyful events. thanks very much.

last night was our first time in this place. But It is absolutely not the last. We had great time with the excellent service, with the superb  food and wine and with the honest payment. We will definitely return there again.

I celebrated my birthday earlier this evening in this excellent restaurant. I am glad to say that we enjoyed a great evening and the restaurant was unquestionably one of the reasons for that happy event. The stuff  collaborated in a splendid style, the food was extremely good and my buddies were extremely  delighted. We shall no dout return for more celebrations. Thank you very much.

formatted_address: 95 Wall St, New York, NY 10005, USA
name: BLUE CIRCLE

formatted_address: 1900 Broadway, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Bar Boulud

reviews.text:
1. It is surprisingly "not loud" given the size and the number of people inside. So it is really nice to focus on conversation.
2. Dishes served there are just awesome. No, beyond awesome. 
3. The overall ambience is classy but not in a way that would make people feel daunted. In other words, you can feel all the positive atmosphere while not being overwhelmed by it.

Excellent food, excellent service. The steak was perfectly made with a crisp outside and very soft pink inside. Even the mushroom soup was impressive, with impactful flavor and a near foamy consistency.

Bar Boulud is the perfect spot for dinner before heading just across the way to the Metropolitan Opera House for a show. The menu will force some difficult choices as everything sounds delicious on the page, but you can't go wrong because each dish lives up to expectations. Highly recommend the beef tartar and the almond tarte if you have room for dessert. Come hungry because this rustic French fare is quite hearty and filling!

Amazing restaurant week meal! Absolutely exceptional mushroom soup, cassoulet, and gâteau basque! Lots of other great options, but those were the best that we had. Also excellent wine options. And an attentive and professional server! Really lovely time.
Great spot for a glass of Rose and appetizers. Tomatoes and burrata were a perfect summer evening dish. Good oysters. Crab and avocado toast was delish too

formatted_address: 54 W 21st St, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Slate NY

reviews.text: One of my favorite clubs in New York City. There is never a dull moment. From the assortment of dancers on the main stage and the amazing chaos that comes with it, the downstairs has its own vibe, filled with arcade games, couches, and a mini bowling alley (usually only available for private events) the downstairs is a much calmer scene - just make sure you take the slide to get down there :)

Nice setup, and big. I went for a job fair. It is a nice place to hang. I am however not a bar or club person, so not sure what else to say about it.  It seems to be popular, a lot of their food seemed fried and greasy.

This place is awesome. It offers a lot of fun games to play while having drinks with friends. It's almost like a Chuck E Cheese for adults. It gets a little crowded but they offer a lot of areas for bottle service. There are 2 floors that each have a DJ. The music was absolutely fantastic. The basement has a bar with games and the main floor is a bar with a big dance floor, like a club. The dancers were pretty bad and the guys on stilts with lights on them were even worse. The dance floor was very crowded but my friends and I had a great night. The line outside was really long. It's best to have a table (which have minimums) or be on a guest list so you can skip the line.

My team and I did a team building at slate and we had an awesome time here! There is so many different things to do and a whole bar just for us! There is an upstairs bar and a downstairs Bar where the games are at.. I had the most fun at the mini bowling definitely coming back to this place!!

Came here for an awesome Kidrobot party complete with giant connect 4, a see saw, painting demo and an excellent DJ. The space is beautiful, the food + drink service was delicious and the in-house guys are clearly pros. I would definitely book a private party here ⚡

formatted_address: 2340 Broadway, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: French Roast NYC

reviews.text: Cozy and fun French bistro on the Upper West Side, serving well-portioned and tasty French and American food. For dinner tonight, I had the red snapper - nicely cooked, and the rice that accompanied it was cheesy and amazing. Someone had the lamb dish nearby and the portion was generous and it looked fantastic. Creme brûlée was out of this world. Service was impeccable and friendly. Highly recommend. Food for families and dates.

While a bit pricey, this place was very good. Priceyness is to be expected for New York. The waitress was friendly and the food came out quickly. Neither of us ordered drinks, and the water is given in a big bottle thing so you can just refill your own which is nice.

Waitress was very helpful answering questions. I had the Mexican omelette which was super tasty and the fruit was very fresh.

We met with friends at this place for lunch. This restaurant was recommended to us by a friend.  Well, we were not disappointed. The staff members were extremely nice and we felt fantastic. The food was just great. We had a great time and we will visit this place again. Recommended.

We came to this place for a meeting. This restaurant was recommended to us by a friend.  Well, it was very successful. The staff members welcomed us with a smile and we had a great feeling. The meal was fresh and delicious. We enjoyed every moment and we shall absolutely come back again. Warmly recommended.

Came here for brunch on a weekday and was pleased. My husband had the pancakes and said it was one of the best he’s had.
I had a good enough omelette, nothing special, but good.
Staff was friendly and attentive.

formatted_address: 237 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Bin 71

reviews.text: Nice ambience and very amiable service. The food was crisp and enchanting. Will clearly recommend this place to anyone. Reasonable prices and generous meals. Keep up the great work.

Stopped in for a quick beer and a snack and was very pleasantly surprised! A nice collection of 5 craft beers on tap, and the food was lovely. Got a smoked salmon and horseradish creme fraiche crostini, and it was great! Light horseradish flavor adding to the smoked salmon without overpowering it.

We like a lot going out. Last night we came to this fine place which we didn’t know before. We had a delightful time there with very good meal and a well-trained stuff and a distinguished chief cook. We put this fine restaurant in our phone list  and we shall no doubt visit again very soon. We highly recommend.

Really really really spot on.  If you’re looking for authentic neighborhood chill vibe with the personal touch.  Find yourself to this tiny throwback room to sip on some carefully selected wines or beer.  The food is thoughtful and tasty as well.  Simply really good.

Came there twice, and will never again. While the bartenders were very nice and the place does have good wines, there is very rude host at the front who just ruined the experience for me, twice! I have a licensed service dog with me, and the guy tried trowing us out. Made a scene. Absolutely rude, unkind, oh yeah and did I mention illegal...?!?!

formatted_address: 50 Bowery # Cellar, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Concept

reviews.text:
Exactly what it’s named, a “Concept”. Kinda hard to find and equally negotiating the subway style entry to the place. 
Nice but small event place, its somewhat new to for the area, might turnout to be popular one day. Only  found out about this place , because attendance to a family event. Other than this there isn’t more I can say except that the staff are very friendly.
This place is extraordinary! Great people great vibes great music, something unique that NYC has to offer. Just stop by and immerse yourself in a classy fun experience. "Be there or be square"

formatted_address: 62 Court St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: O'Keefe's Bar & Grill

reviews.text: Cool, traditional neighborhood pub with good quality food and friendly service. Great to meet up after work for a snack or a burger. When full it is pretty loud in there though. Wine list is a bit short, too, but a big variety of beers of course.

I don't know what it was about today but the wings weren't that great. They weren't fried as crispy and got soggy really fast. The mild sauce was a little off as well. Tried the artichoke dip nachos and calamari. They were good. Needed a little salt but nothing much. Ill still come back because the first time was just sooo good. Everyone is entitled to an off day right?

Love everything about this place, been going here probably over 11 or 12+ years now! It's my go to for any type of meals (healthy and that little extra) from entrees, to burgers, three dif types of fries, appetizers to even salads. They have a mix of different alcoholic drinks and frozen as well! I must say, they do have the biggest most enjoyable salad I have ever had with loads of variety that never disappoint..! My other favourite is there mozzarella sticks, that cheese is amazing, no place can ever compare too, a must have if there! 5+ stars all the way!!!
great service and staff . they make u feel like family.  really nice and clean and the bathrooms are very clean as well.  been there twice and really had a pleasant time!
A fantastic pub great food Nice selection of bourbon great ambience go and enjoy

formatted_address: 315 W 44th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Cast Party

formatted_address: 696 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10065, USA
name: Nello

reviews.text: Took my family of 3 here for an early Valentine's dinner. The setting was just right thanks to their spectacular decorations. The food and service was decadent. The pricing in one word, exorbitant, even by city standards. Oh it's across from Hermes? Makes sense

Have been enough time to Upper East Side but never thought of such delicious restaurant in New York. From setup to decoration, you just name it and you have it. Their service is top, the food is great, the music is best. Strongly Recommended!!

Top quality food, great service and friendly staff. Best thing to order are probably pastas, lobster, calamari, crab Salad and the Burrata with cherry tomatoes. I will most definitely be back again. Nice ambiance and great indoor and outdoor seating. Great experience, highly recommended And sure I'll be back soon !

The best Italian food in the area. Hadn’t seen an Italian restaurant better than this one. The food is fantastic and the service is very quick. The staff there is very polite as well. I really enjoyed dining there.

Fine dining at affordable pricing. And the atmosphere is fancy, but not snobbish. Enthusiastic, and fun wait staff.  The food was superior, the wine list was impressive, and the portions were perfect. Highly recommend a visit.

formatted_address: 175 Eldridge St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Lower Eastside Tp

formatted_address: 425 W 49th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Bus

formatted_address: 75 9th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: CORKBUZZ

formatted_address: 166 Smith St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Uglyduckling

reviews.text: Walked in for brunch on a nice Saturday and was seated promptly. There was a brunch prix fix if you do like a 2-course meal with an alcoholic beverage and it’s worth it IMHO. I got the white egg avocado mushrooms with goat cheese omelet (pretty filling and filled with all the right combinations, I lapped them up like a hungry puppy) and my buddy got the sausages and bread where though the sausages were a tad dry (yes I nipped one) but they were tasty with the sautéed onions and buttered toast. The sausages went great with my omelet :) I read about this place and I thought it was a Thai fusion place but it’s not really though it’s a great place to hang and have good food.

Staff here are amazing. They are very attentive and provide exceptional service. Food tastes amazing and drinks are even better. Noelli behind the bar creates amazing cocktails and is even happy to go off the menu as long as she has the ingredients to do so. 5/5 for me! Cannot fault it one bit

Very nice brunch food, really good deal for a cocktail+starter+entree for brunch ($25), and fairly good cocktails. Never seems to be a wait for brunch, and service is very good. Note that I have no experience with other meals here besides brunch.

Absolutely love this place! From good food and drink to great service! Gets busy, so if you can make a resy. They have a brunch prefix that comes with a drink an app and an entree. Really can’t go wrong with any of the menu items. Chicken and waffle hit the spot.

Visited on Saturday noon and we didn't have to wait. They only had hot coffee and cocktails. No latte or espresso related drinks.
Chicken and waffle was amazing. Chicken was well seasoned, tender inside, and crispy outside. It would have been better if the waffle was crispy and bigger.

formatted_address: 513 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Osteria Cotta

reviews.text: We met with friends at this place for dinner. This place was recommended to us by a friend.  Well, it was a winning. we were warmly welcomed by the crew  and we felt fantastic. The meal was great. We had a great time and we will definitely return to this restaurant. Keep it up.

The service here was Amazing! The manager needed to do something to the window behind our table, but was worried about bothering us- it was very minor we didn’t even notice. Because of the minor inconvenience, he bought us a round of drinks and dessert! So very impressed with the service! 
Food was good and the ambiance is inviting. Would recommend.
Love going here. The food is great! I love the rosemary wings - they're a must have! Also love the meatball pizza! Everything I've tried, I've liked.
Great ambience and a good selection of wines! I liked their vegetarian gnocci too, though their arugula pizza turned out to be greener than we liked.
I sincerely recommend this place.  The whole menu is exquisite.  The atmosphere is super nice and the attention excellent!

formatted_address: 135 W 41st St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Arena NYC

formatted_address: 93 Bowery, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Elevate

reviews.text: Awesome spot gotta check it out!!

This is a typical hotel lounge and restaurant - not really anything to boast about. The decor was somewhat confused for a restaurant serving mostly Asian fare - it was a bit tiki lounge meets sports bar. My friend and i got there on the later side of the evening, and there was only one other table occupied. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The portions, although well made, were a bit small for the prices. We enjoyed our time there, and we were allowed to linger over our table until closing time. All in all, I would rate the place as a pretty run of the mill hotel restaurant, but with a very kind staff and decent food.

Subpar service.  Waiter was not familiar with the menu, couldn't tell me when the fish is shipped in, and had to redo my order because they were out of items.  Also took them 45 minutes to serve me edamame (I think he forgot).  I was one of 2 tables being served in the restaurant.  Tuna was good,  yellowtail and salmon were "fishy" (apparently not stored/handled at proper temperature).  I won't be back.
Great happy hour drinks!!

formatted_address: 127 E 27th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Covina

reviews.text: Fantastic spot. Great service all the way around. I'm picky with a full five stars, but this place earned it. Fair prices, great atmosphere and service. Absolutely worth going.

Place that lifted us from mood of annoyed to a happy. 
Waiter was so off with his ability to listen to a customer, didn’t looked he was trying to hear a what we asking at all . 
Manager solved issue with us in blink of an eye, hopefully he will solve issue with that waiter too so less of miss understanding in a future.
Food is great, coffe perfect , sizes of a plates just right and really nice interior. 
Would recommend this place for sure again.

Great food, service and ambiance! Our waiter, Alec, gave us great recommendations and was super nice. We had the spicy honey pizza which was amazing,as well as the rigatoni. The rigatoni with braised pork was flavorful and tasty enough, but not an all time favorite. Im curious to go back and try some of the other pastas. We finished the meal off with sorbet and coffee, both of which were great. I highly recommend!

Overpriced for the food.  One dish had to be sent back.  Rest of the food was good.  The service was ok with the bartender covering our table.  He did the best he could with his many customers.  I did like the atmosphere.

Classy, cozy ambiance + delicious food!! It was easy to make a reservation and we were promptly seated. Food came out hot and well-seasoned. Our waiter wasn’t very attentive but we were assisted by other wait staff who were great.  Drinks were fragrant and artistic.  Def worth visiting again.

formatted_address: 57 St Marks Pl, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Club 57

formatted_address: 1221 6th Ave, New York, NY 10020, USA
name: Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse

reviews.text: 5 stars for staff, 4 stars for food. Staff was attentive and well informed, they never rushed anyone out, so you could enjoy your meal. Steaks were good, not great and at that price they should be top notch. We've been to other steakhouses that were similarly priced and their steaks were phenomenal, these just weren't to that level. I think I should have been clued in when the server offered a large amount of topping options for the steaks. To me that's a red flag that either your steak or your seasonings or your preparation is not up to par. A good quality steak should speak for itself with very little seasonings or toppings.

Went with my husband and it was great.  All the staff was courteous and accommodating from the bus person, hostesses, and especially our server, Brandon.  Though he was busy, we wouldn't have known it.   He took his time with us offering suggestions and giving us individualized attention.  The food of course was delicious.  He recommended the crab cake and it was very flavorful.  He made sure our steaks were cooked perfectly and offered to bring them back if they weren’t as we wanted. We will definitely be back.

To date one of my favorite places not only in NYC but the country to dine in. 
The location is great, the restaurant is elegant, spacious & exquisitely decorated. 
The Staff while dining is quite helpful and accommodating. And the food is exceptional.
The pricing is moderate to high and well worth it. Great place to bring a date, celebrate an occasion, bring large groups etc.

My wife and I had such a great experience here. Paul T was our waiter and he was excellent. He should run a private class on how servers should act and talk While waiting on tables. He was excellent, and I will be coming back. I have no relationship to Paul at all, I do not know him from a can of paint. But he was such. Genuine, nice, pleasant waiter. I told him that I wish my employees were as pleasant as he was. The tomahawk steak, mash potatoes and asparagus was excellent. We also had the octopus for a appetizer and it was delicious! Thank you Paul, my wife was extremely happy. Happy wife, happy life!

Wow!!!  Pricey food but well worth it!  Great service by very knowledgeable staff.  Can be very busy - but that indicates how good the food is!  I had a 45 day aged steak and it was simply delicious!  I was surprised by no sides but when I finished my steak I was fit to pop so a side would have been overkill!  Definitely to be recommended!!!

formatted_address: 222 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Terra

reviews.text: Delicious pasta. Love the lobster ravioli and anything truffle. Great space, small and cozy. Traditional “New York City” service makes it a fun destination. Recommend if you’re in the mood for a tasty traditional Italian dish.

I walked around to find a restaurant or bar that’s open on Christmas Day and they did! The food was amazing - we had a risotto, truffle gnocchi, and burrata which were their specials. I also loved the ambience - high ceiling, long bar counters and tables. I will definitely come back.
This is my GO TO spot for some delicious Italian food. It’s not far from little Italy, but I prefer here better. Every pasta dish has been amazing and my fav is the lamb shank risotto!

Had an unfortunate night here.  Food was decent overall.  Ordered a starter about 10minutes before we placed our main course pasta order yet the pastas came out right away well before our first course.  We then cancelled our starter and they continued to bring it out another 5 minutes later.  Looking around every table had bread (before ordering)  except us so we ask for it (we’re already most of the way done with our entire meal at this point), again looking around every table has oil and vinegar so we again ask for it.   When we get the check the starter we cancelled and didn’t eat was still on there and I was charged for a more expensive wine than what I had ordered - I was so annoyed at this point I just paid it and left.  Overall the experience was just not enjoyable and like pulling teeth, we had a hurdle every step of the way and will most likely never return.

This is such a gem of a restaurant! Authetic, unfussy, and exceptional food.  Incredible wine experience!  Not pretentious at all!  Wonderful and interesting wines that you will be thinking about long after you leave.  Warm, cozy atmosphere and outstanding service.  Love this place and will be back often.

formatted_address: 120 W 44th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Saju Bistro

reviews.text:
Good quality food, well prepared. Service is good and
*They will expedite your service if you have a show to catch.

One of the best French onion soups I've had.  Escargot has lots of herbs and garlic which gives it a leg up on a pretty standard dish. 

Not too pricey for times square.  Would repeat.

i was three times over there, breakfast, drinks and diner while staying 2 nights in Hotel Mela. Atmosphere was great, excellent background music. 
Food and service A+. highly recommend this place!
Service was good, environment is awesome, a quiet place, but still full of people. Taste of food were ok. The pasta with sweet Italian sausage was great.

Services was great and food was wonderful! We made reservations with open table and when my Fiance and I arrived we were seated right away. We order appetizer: french onion soup and escargot, they were equally amazing. Shortly after our entree arrives and again, equal delicious. My fiance had the lamb shank and I had the duck special, both dish were accompanied with a glass of Cabernet.
We had a very nice brunch at Saju before a Saturday matinee. It was not crowded and we had excellent service and a delicious meal at a reasonable price. It is a very nice restaurant

formatted_address: 792 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10065, USA
name: Lilli and Loo

reviews.text:
They have the biggest gluten free menu I have ever seen in my 3.5 years being gluten free! It is so hard to find places with Asian gluten free option. It was amazing choosing from such a big variety of foods for once. Even gluten free spring rolls! They were delicious. So was my main entree. I ate everything since it was so delicious. 
Severs are very friendly and its a nice atmosphere at the restaurant with nice decor. Really a great place!
Ordered sashimi, and they forgot to give me wasabi or ginger. When asked for it, they only gave wasabi. I think they need to be told exactly what you want from them.
Had a very good experience in this spot with my kids. The food arrives rapidly and the service is just great. Prices are affordable.

Visited with some friends and had a great time. The servers were nice and the place looked neat and clean. The lunch specials menu was to the point. The place is quite small, so not the ideal place for big groups. Overall, it was generally nice. 
The Teriyaki chicken bento was alright.

We like a lot to go out. Last night we came to this delicious place which friends recommended to us. We enjoyed a delightful experience there with superb cooking and  an experienced crew and an impressive  cuisine. We put this venue in our phone list  and we will definitely return very soon. We warmly recommend.

formatted_address: 620 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Gyu-Kaku Japanese BBQ

reviews.text: Five stars for this recent addition on the Upper West Side.  Fantastic place to eat with family and friends.  Cook your meat, fish, pork and veggies at the table.  The friendly staff can help with tips and cook times.  Reasonable prices and lots of choices.  We did a package for four and we left the restaurant stuffed.  Drink choices include Japanese beer and house sake that is available warm or cold.  You can end your meal with the traditional American dessert of S'mores.   Will go back.
My husband and I had a great dinner in this location. The BBQ meat is one of the best. Reasonable price and nice service. Highly recommend! Please open more often.
Wow, everything was delicious. All the staff were very friendly.  I'll be back really soon..
The food was delicious and the service was attentive. I just wish they were open more often as I would love to come back.

Good food but never open! Extremely frustrating

This restaurant has some of the best food I have ever had, but I have gone 4 times and only once was it open. Every time I had checked the hours but it was never open. No one answered when I called, either (on a related note, there is no phone number in their website either). Very disappointed.

formatted_address: 629 W 51st St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Club 51

reviews.text: "Good ambience and service "
Amazing space!

formatted_address: 45 W 44th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Sofitel New York

reviews.text: Everything in the hotel is perfect, thus we have the most relaxing weekend. All about this resort points towards relaxation and tranquility. The hotel, decor, ambiance, staff, location, service, and all areas completely top-class. We will be going back here with my family! I know that they would love it!
Enjoyed the Gaby Brasserie at the Sofitel. There won't be too many places in NY, where you can get a 3 course menu for $42.00 per person. Good selections to choose from for each course.

I stayed here for 10 days during my last trip to NY. The location by far was the most important and convenient for me. The rooms were clean, I liked that they had a walk-in shower, however the room was really small in regard to how much I paid for. 
Staff were polite and professional.
Best hotel in Manhattan.  Perfect location.  Best part was the service.  From the minute you walk in and through entire duration of stay, we were treated like royalty.  Definately returning.
Fantastic location. Understated elegance. Nicely appointed rooms with excellent service. Easy access to theatre district and 5th Avenue shopping.

formatted_address: 211 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: The Spotted Owl Tavern

reviews.text: Amazing bartenders! Loved the food and the atmosphere.

Fun bar on the east side. It got crowded outta nowhere and was tough to get to the bar for a drink, but if you can go on a slower night it's a great spot. They have a pool table in the back and a couple TVs for entertainment. Drink prices are reasonable for the area. It's a good spot.
Ideal local bar. Pool table, great happy hour, and friendly bar tenders.
Solid dive with a great pool table in the back.

Enjoyed a nice chicken parm and my wife had spring wrap.  Food was good and what you would expect for the price.  Beer was cold and there is a pool table with lots of room to move around and shoot.  Over all a nice spot to kill some time and enjoy a beer and some food.

formatted_address: 2153 Frederick Douglass Blvd, New York, NY 10026, USA
name: Harlem Tavern

reviews.text: Great place. It was more of a plan B because BLVD across the street was too crowded but it was a very good experience. I went on Sunday when they were playing football on the big screen and everyone was into it, not the place to go if you're looking for a lovely, quiet, romantic dinner but luckily that wasn't my goal that day. Had a really great time i will definitely go back.
The food was good especially the lamb burger delicious. The drinks were awesome too! Great place for big crowds. Would come back here.

Food, drinks and music were beyond expectations! I had a blast on a beautiful Friday night, I didn't want to leave! The DJ was sooo lively,  the atmosphere was intimate yet mature, the wait staff were gun and inviting! The bathrooms were clean and well stocked. Cannot wait to go back!♡

First time here and I loved it! It was a small portion of food but everything was delicious. I had mimosas and they were on point! Our waitress was attentive and friendly. If you are looking for an intimate brunch environment with some live music being played in the background, this is the one! I definitely intend on going back.

Expensive and uninspired. The menu is pretty stock but with the pricing for food and drinks was outlandish. If you serve frozen Sysco items, please price accordingly. I have had better deals at french restaurants in this city. Use fresh food or drop your prices. No one in this area wants to pay these prices for over-processed bar food when there are literally near infinite options a train ride away.

formatted_address: 181 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Brother Jimmy's

reviews.text: Came here for dinner on Saturday night the place was really busy but we were seated immediately and the food came out really quickly after we placed our order. The nachos with brisket were tasty but I wish the cheese was more evenly spread over the chips. The southern Cobb salad was good too. We also got a pitcher of the Flower Power which I would recommend. Overall good experience

Kids Eat for Free is what always brings me back, plus the consistency.  The food always comes out quickly and always consistent.  It's a great place for families to eat, and obviously it's a great place for the Under 30 set of Murray Hill to drink.  The Resteraunt  Part is set aside, and as long as you like 90s music, you are good. There are all shapes, sizes and ages in there and that is a good thing. So much better than Dukes

It has been several years since eating at Brother Jimmy’s.  My wife and I used to love going every week with our two boys.  We walked into the establishment at 5:35pm on a Thursday hoping to eat a good meal before heading to my son’s Doctors appointment.  We had to wait ten minutes for the Hostess to hang up the phone.  After five minutes I asked if we could sit at any table, since we were limited on time.  However I was flagged not to proceed any further. Since we were in a hurry we already decided what we were going to eat and drink before the waitress came to the table.  I ordered Pulled Pork platter with a veggie and an Ice Tea, my oldest son ordered the Fried Chicken with FF Sprite, Brisket Burger with Cheddar and Tatter Tots and a Root Beer.  

The food came in a reasonable timeframe.  The Fried Chicken was nice and hot, the Burger and Pulled Pork were cold.  Since we were in hurry I was not about to wait around for my meal to be heated or the Burger.  But I sure would have been in a better mood had the waitress even offered me a refill for my Tea, especially given how small the glass jars are these days.  I think I will skip Brother Jimmy’s and go somewhere where I know my food will be served hot and the wait staff politely offers the table as many refills as we like.

This place is absolutely one of the tastiest place in the neighborhood. Every time I come to this place I am extremely happy. They keep their high  standard service and the topmost level of food  they offer. You are always happy with this restaurant. Highly  recommended.

Good bbq food. Went for lunch and had the Dixon chicken sandwich (fried chicken). It was tasty, but a little too sweet for my palate. They offer free dining for kids under ten, have bar games, and trivia nights on Monday.

formatted_address: 709 8th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Margarita Bar NYC

reviews.text: This place is a gem! During my last night in Manhattan, we stumbled upon this gem. The food, drinks, and hospitality was beyond any expectations that I could have. We planned on only staying for a few appetizers & drinks and ended up staying for almost 3+ hours! We travel to Manhattan frequently and havent found a spot we would love to return to...until now! Highly recommended!
Nice service good wine choices $ great food Calamari was sooo tender perfect
Great deals on flights. House cocktails were on point too. Bartender was really nice, (I'm sorry I didn't get her name)

The service was absolutely terrible. The water taste weird. Additionally I ordered cheese enchiladas with red sauce. I first received some sort of enchilada with green sauce. Upon telling the staff I ordered red sauce they took it back to the kitchen and replace it with chicken enchiladas with red sauce. At this point everyone else was done eating so I didn’t not even get to eat my entree. The nachos were good though and so was the work ethic id the bus boy.

3 for $5 tacos! And they're good! Wash it down with a strong $7 Margarita made by the friendly bartender. Great staff too. It was very quiet and empty when we went in on a Monday Night. A group of 8 was able to talk and hear each other from across a long table. Definitely a hidden spot.

formatted_address: 115 E 60th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Amali

reviews.text: Delicious and great service! We pretty much got everything on the menu! The $100 salted fish, the $100 steak, scallops, pastas, all the cheeses, etc. It was all great. Some wow dishes, some not,  but all good.

They've got two tables out side and we took one of them. It was perfect. The space is really nice and the good is excellent. It's the melanza spread was really tasty as was the ricotta toast. It's about the right amount of food and not prepared super heavily.

We went there for a company luncheon earlier this month to celebrate one of our member's contribution before her next opportunity, and the service at Amali was terrific. No one from our team ever heard of Amali, but they were impressed with the farm-to-table and also the atmosphere. The restaurant  was also super accommodating, had excellent food that was well seasoned, and the serving sizes were also considerable. We had about 16 people and ended up with some desserts as well. We'll be sure to visit again. :) Thanks so much for the wonderful time, Amali!

Lovely Greek-inspired menu, small wine list with several gems at very reasonable prices for Manhattan. We enjoyed a 1992 Ojai pinot noir (a bit long in the tooth) and a 2012 Evening Lands OR pinot noir.

Food was tasty, staff was friendly.   I ended up having dinner at the bar.  

Ambiance was warm and welcoming and enjoyed the buzzy evening vibe!

Portion size is extremely small for the price.   Be prepared before dining.

formatted_address: 93 4th Ave #1062, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Cargo

reviews.text: nice

formatted_address: 122 Rivington St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: La Caverna

reviews.text: The bouncers are actually the best. They were super friendly.  Who doesn’t want to have a dance party in a cave with grottos and stalactites?
Very cool unground cave design. Had lots of fun with friends. LARGE space for a Manhatten bar/club. Removed a star because it's some of the worst hookah I've had in the city.
Unique cave bar experience. Worth a visit
First time to this place and I will definitely go back.  Very good attention, excellent atmosphere.
Great place with nice music and cheap drinks.

formatted_address: 92 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: SGTS

formatted_address: 126 St Marks Pl, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: East Village Social

reviews.text: Went randomly on a Saturday night. The band or duo that performed were amazing. They had the crowd interact with the performances. Would definitely go back.
The best life music every night. I love this place!
One of my fave chill spots in East Village. Cozy little joint. Beers on tap and always a nice touch when you can catch some live music!
Friendly atmosphere and staff.. bartenders are great.. generally a nice place to unwind..
Nice bar - been going there for the Tuesday trivia nights recently which has been a lot of fun. Happy hour lasts till 8pm and beer/cider is $5 then.

formatted_address: 103 1st Avenue #2951, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Ugly Kitchen

reviews.text: I celebrated my graduation yesterday in this great restaurant. Well we enjoyed a astonishing evening and the place was definitely one of the reasons for this fruitful event. The stuff  cooperated in a sweet way, the cuisine was yummy and my buddies were extremely  thrilled. We shall definitely come back again for more celebrations. Thank you very much.
Great food! Super friendly staff! Would give 5 stars if they served dessert! I love me some sweets!

This spot is my preferred one. I eat in a lot of restaurants but to this one I keep coming back again and again. The stuff is very amicable and the cuisine they cook is so good. I would always prefer to have a good dinner in this restaurant. I recommend this place with pleasure.
Great intro to Filipino food! Delicious food in a casual setting! Will definitely go again need to try the whole menu.

We enjoy hanging out. Last night we went to this excellent restaurant which friends recommended to us. We spent a beautiful time there with excellent meal and an efficient stuff and a great  cuisine. We  added this place in our list  and we shall certainly go again soon.  Highly recommended.

formatted_address: 284 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Craft+Carry

reviews.text: Amazing selection of beer and cider with a really cool and knowledgeable staff! Cool place to hang out and also an impressive selection of beers to take home

Huge selection of beers to choose from. You can sit down and Crack em open there or take them to go. Prices are a little less if you take them to go. Nice bar, table tops & free skee ball. Plenty of TVs to watch too.
Free skee ball, good beer selection, pretty family friendly and prices on par with the neighborhood. A nice spot to work for a couple hours in the afternoon too, when taps are $2 off.

Nice if you’re in the area, but other similar beer varietal shops in the city are cheaper and carry larger selections—if selection/price are more important to you than location, I recommend going uptown to City Swiggers on 86th between 1st & 2nd ave.
Great bar hanging out and experiencing craft beer. Love the skeeball!

formatted_address: 720 Anderson Ave, Cliffside Park, NJ 07010, USA
name: Avo's Grill

reviews.text: We like a lot hanging out. Yesterday we  visited this superb restaurant which we didn’t know before. We passed a delightful evening there with first-rate cooking and a professional stuff and  a professional  cuisine. We  added this place in our list  and we will definitely go again soon.  Highly recommended.

We like a lot eating out. Yesterday we came to this fine place which we didn’t know before. We had a lovely evening there with high-qulity dishes and  an experienced team and  a professional cook. We put this venue in our list  and we will surely return soon.  Highly recommended.

Atmosphere is pleasant with a warm, friendly and welcoming vibe. The drinks are amazing and extremely well crafted. As for the food, I would honestly say it is the best Greek food available in the area at a decent price. I would highly recommend, especially with a group of friends or a first date.

Shockingly delicious and amazing atmosphere! The design is great with modern decor, an interesting bar, and large TVs everywhere.  I’ve ordered delivery a few times already, and each was delicious, but going to the actual location added a star! Each item was properly prepared and had a taste of its own.  I highly recommend the grilled spicy chicken wings!
Got really sick! Had the runs the whole night! HIGHLY DO NOT RECOMMEND! Stay far far far away! Please save yourself. I’m sure they’re cooks DOES NOT WASH THEIR HANDS!

formatted_address: 915 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: P.J. Clarke's

reviews.text:
I usually don't give high reviews to pubs -- let's face it, the food is usually mediocre at best.

But not here.

Seriously good food worth having for delivery if you want. The hamburgers are all excellent, the fish and chips is really good, and most of the appetizers are good too. Even the mashed potatoes are great!

The pub itself is legendary and the staff are all nice -- but this is one of the few pubs that has really good food too!

P.J. Clarke's was very busy and we had to wait about 15 minutes for a table - it was a nice atmosphere.  You just feel at home - like Cheers!  The waiter was very friendly and welcomed us to this place and talked small with us about visiting NYC.  Most of us order chicken pot pie - perfect for a cold night.  It is very good!  The desserts look great and we wish we weren't enough to enjoy them - we hope to be back on our trip but time never runs out but hope to be there on the next trip  ,

3.6The place was very busy and we had to wait about 15 minutes for a table - it was a nice atmosphere.  You just feel at home - like Cheers!  The waiter was very friendly and welcomed us to this place and talked small with us about visiting NYC.  Most of us order chicken pot pie - perfect for a cold night.  It is very good!  The desserts look great and we wish we weren't enough to enjoy them - we hope to be back on our trip but time never runs out but hope to be there on the next trip  ,

Amazing service, went to celebrate my brother's birthday and the attention and courtesy we received from the staff was beyond impressive. And the food was phenomenal. Had the Cadillac Burger and it lived up to its name.  The appetizers were amazing as well as the dessert.

Great place to meet with friends. The food is decent, not great. Hit and miss on the burgers depending on  when you go but this place is all about the atmosphere. You can't go wrong to gather here with friends over some beers. Recommended.

formatted_address: 160 Christopher St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: red light

formatted_address: 210 W 94th St, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: Whispers Restaurant, Bar & Lounge

reviews.text:
There are some things that are off about this place. It’s a little hidden and comes off quite sketchy when you first walk in. 

The drinks and food are decent. I used to go when they had their karaoke nights and I loved going there specifically for that reason. 

The owner is a great guy, always chatting you up and attending to all the clients that walk in through the doors.
The bar tender, Carlos, was friendly and kind!
Good place for watching sports, food could be little better but I enjoyed myself.
Absolutely love this place. Fantastic environment that's relaxed and great music. The food gets a 10 out of 10. Try the shrimp!
Great place to chill on a Saturday night.

formatted_address: 315 Bowery, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: CBGB

reviews.text: Old CBGB’s, today is John Varatos

formatted_address: 70 W 71st St, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Pasha

reviews.text:
We went there in New year which was my birthday🎊🎉🎉 As a Turkey I could tell you that the Manti was delicious! I loved the romantic vibes in the restaurant! I strongly recommend this place!! 
Note: parking might be an issue

This restaurant is doubtless one of the best place to eat in the region. Whenever I go there I am greatly pleased. They manage their very high  level service and the highest level of meals  they give. You can never go wrong with this restaurant. Very  recommended.

Yesterday was the first time in this restaurant. But It is absolutely not the last time. We had a good time with the generous service, with the finest cooking and fine drinks and with the comfortable payment. We will surely visit there in a short time.

Delightfully variegated menu, pleasantly quaint atmosphere. Warm crusty bread with herb-infused olive oil, delicious food. I like Aba, but this food is much better - fresher, not overly salty, thoughtfully prepared by a chef who must enjoy preparing and eating it.
Wonderful neighborhood restaurant. Helpful but discreet service, tasty perfectly prepared dishes. Give Pasha a try when on the West Parkside of NYC.

formatted_address: 924 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: Ranchito

reviews.text: Best location for Spanish Food
Posting this at 11pm on a Sunday, because they are blasting music and keeping the whole block up.
The food is great! The prices are affordable as well, the beer always cold
Excellent restaurant, great place to be.
The customer service is horrible, the food is ok

formatted_address: 172 Waverly Pl, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Jeffrey's Grocery

reviews.text:
I love 
That please
Surprising, smoky and yummy whitefish Caesar salad. The chicken burger was also unique and tasty. The service was excellent and it was easy to get a table for a late weekday lunch. Highly recommended
