Some of the closely arranged seating simply doesn't allow for much elbow room. However, the atmosphere is nice and the food and drinks are good. It took a while for me to be serviced, even though our host was serving the group directly next to me. I would visit again to check out the happy hour, etc.

Excellent food! We don’t often eat in Manhattan but had a great weekday brunch at Jeffrey’s. The lobster bisque was excellent as well as the goat cheese omelette, crab avocado toast and spicy fries. The service was great, too. We would definitely return.
Great French fries and Niçoise salad - easy chill vibes would recommend for a causal meal and drink with a friend. 4-6pm happy hour $1.50 oysters on weekdays too!

formatted_address: 57B Pearl St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Archway Cafe

reviews.text: I like the cozy feeling in the restaurant. Super chill vibe (I think because of the interior design). Me and my friend we're in there chatting for about 2h and 30min. Usually hate iced tea but the server recommend the pomegranate iced tea and it was heaven (you have to add your own sugar which is nice cause sometimes restaurants can add a bit too much sugar). It was super refreshing in a super hot day. Definitely a must try item. I had the rotisserie chicken sandwich and it was absolutely delicious. The bread was nicely toasted on the outside. I like the service here. They were friendly and didn't seem rushed. Price of the foods are easy on your wallet. 10/10 I recommend this spot to anyone. Decent priced food, delicious food, friendly employees.... What more can you ask for?

I like the cozy feeling in the restaurant. Super chill vibe (I think because of the interior design). Me and my friend we're in there chatting for about 2h and 30min. Usually hate iced tea but the server recommend the pomegranate iced tea and it was heaven (you have to add your own sugar which is nice cause sometimes restaurants can add a bit too much sugar). It was super refreshing in a super hot day. Definitely a must try item. I had the rotisserie chicken sandwich and it was absolutely delicious. The bread was nicely toasted on the outside. I like the service here. They were friendly and didn't seem rushed. Price of the foods are easy on your wallet. 10/10 I recommend this spot to anyone. Decent priced food, delicious food, friendly employees.... What more can you ask for?

We were out and about early on a Sunday morning and this was one of the few places that were open. The vibe seemed like it would be nice but coffee and food were nothing spectacular. The baked eggs were not what I was expecting at all, and seemed overcooked.

Overwhelmed and understaffed for the crowd that comes along with a beautiful spring Sunday at the nearby Brooklyn Flea. Food was mediocre. Service was nonexistent. It took a long time to place my order and in the mean time, I simply wasn’t acknowledged. No one asked how my meal was or if they could get me anything. My finished cup of water sat empty instead of refilled. They also don’t have WiFi for customers, so don’t swing by on a weekday hoping to work.
BEST smoked salmon sandwich/salad in the Big Apple, hands down! $13 (egg +$2) will get you half a pound (!) of lox with in fact 2 eggs of choice. Simply perfect!

formatted_address: 425 W 15th St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Bar Suzette

reviews.text: The crepes at Bar Suzette were completely awesome. So much flavor packed into a crepe. They don't skimp on ingredients and the everything is fresh. They have a new vegan menu and it did not disappoint. I had the vegan BLT crepe and my non vegan friend had the pesto chicken. For dessert I had the vegan chocolate, banana, and strawberry crepe. They use Enjoy Life for the chocolate and as I said they do not skimp on ingredients. The strawberries and bananas paired beautifully with the dark chocolate. I highly recommend them and the people there were very nice.

LOVED IT! Haven't had a crepe in years so I'm glad I stopped by here. They have extensive vegan crepe options which is fantastic. I'm a huge fan of savory crepes and pesto so I naturally got the vegan tofu pesto. 10/10 Highly recommend! That crepe was jammed packed with flavorful ingredients, it was definitely a meal by itself. And the fact that I can see my food being made right in front of me was the cherry on top.
I got the apple & brie crepe. It was a good snack food but I would've liked it to be a little saucier? It just seemed a little dry.

This place has a very weird concept, they claim to be a bar but people just go there to eat crepes. The music was loud and the working area was messy and disorganized. I ordered a a sweet crepe, strawberry, banana and Nutella; the filling was good (everything with Nutella is good) but the crepe was overcooked.

Traveled to this place planning to have an authentic crepe suzette and guess what?... They don't make it!!.. how do you name a place after the most famous type of crepe and you don't even have it??
Very misleading... this place is a tourist trap!!

formatted_address: 200 W 70th St, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Cafe Luxembourg

reviews.text: Have been here many times over many years, great room and always great service. Food is consistently delicious and reliable. I’d say they’re a bit pricey for what it is but you know you’re going to have a good meal here.

I had brunch at Cafe Luxembourg

It's a sweet little neighborhood bistro. 

Staff was attentive although they were filled to capacity and with others waiting to be seated. I suggest you make a reservation on busy evenings or holidays. 

Was given their history re the bumcee (pics) on display in the bathrooms, on their chocolates and bill. See my pics. 

Food was good. I was totally in heaven that my fish and chips was served with brown vinegar and (though not gazette) a little paper decor. Took me back to the English pubs. 

Give it a try. 

The End.
A classic that never disappoints. Was there for brunch and had the omelette. It was perfectly cooked to my request - slightly runny. Perfect service. A great place to visit

A long time upper west side standby. Delivers modern delicious french bistro food that stays true to its roots. Avoids modern tropes. Space it tight. But staff is super friendly and accommodate children. Good cocktails.
Wonderful place. Small but not loud. Great drinks. Excellent staff. Had the oysters followed by octopus. Very good!

formatted_address: 156 9th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Worthwild

reviews.text: The food and drinks were great! The short rib dish was delicious. What really made the experience so wonderful was our epic waiter Jennings! I had  forgotten I had eaten here before (thought we were going to a random place for dinner) but I recognized the waiter right away. We had amazing service and great conversation- he was just as wonderful as the first time I was there. A+++ service
Cute refresh of the old Tipsy Parson space. New owners are dishing up a small menu of apps and entrees and great cocktails. Staff is super friendly.

Cozy on a cold night.  Superb service.  Innovative (and delicious) cocktails.  Creative wine list.  And the food...comfort food, but waaay beyond.  Menu is manageable with an emphasis on variety, but not too many options to be overwhelming.  Crab dip was amazing...roast chicken was anything but basic and the mash on the side?!?!  Whoa.  Love this place.

I’m so glad this place is just around the corner from my house... it has such a cozy chilled nice atmosphere, and the food is absolutely delicious as are the drinks! I like the fact that it’s a relatively small menu that changes every season. Owner and staff have always been great. One of my favorite spots in Chelsea, whether I want a full meal or just a chilled drink.
A perfect spot for brunch - relaxed chic atmosphere and fantastic food. Don’t miss the pastries!

formatted_address: 492 Grand St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Abba Bar & Grill

reviews.text: The DJ blasted music relentlessly, handled it poorly and the prices were slightly above average.
Had a good time.
Good service  great to go out with your friends

Fun place to dance and have a good time! If you like bachata, merengue tipico, salsa, latin trap and reggaeton this is the place for you. I didn't like that they smoke a lot of hookah since the smell makes me sick but other than that i had a pretty good time. It gets packed on the weekends.

Really Low class dive bar I would even waste my time so many better places in the area very dirty drinks are poorly made and service is terrible I guess it’s for the local population but if you can afford to go anywhere else please do

formatted_address: 97 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Mancora

reviews.text: The food and service were absolutely fantastic. There's also plenty of elbow room. We ordered a mussles appetizer and then continued to use the sauce with our other dishes: rotisserie chicken dish and seafood paella. You get so much food for a great price. This was hands down the best rotisserie chicken I have ever had in my life. The meat fell off the bone with no effort at all. We were looking for a meal with some balance and a lot of good flavor, this hit the spot exactly where we wanted it to. We will be going back!
Food was good, service excellent.

This pace is a bar and restaurant. I'll say it's an attempt of Peruvian food but there were many key/typical Peruvian dishes that are not on the menu. Nevertheless we ordered a classic ceviche, ceviche de coco and empanadas, that were very delicious. The pisco sour was good too. It cost us $25 per person at happy hour time.

Went with my s/o in February, service was ok, restaurant was cold, and we ordered ceviche and pasta with pesto with scallops. The shrimp, octopus, and the scallops were incredibly tough, and the ceviche was totally too sour for my tastes anyway. Pesto pasta, though obviously not the focus of the menu, was pretty bland and topped with those rubbery scallops almost ruined the whole meal.
Delicious food! Friendly staff, nice atmosphere!

formatted_address: 202 9th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Jake's Saloon NYC

reviews.text: Nice place for a drink on a Sunday afternoon. Sadly, when you have multiple TVs going, it might be nice to be showing a few other games besides the NY game. People from out if town are interested in their teams, too.

A NYC institution! This Jake's, the one on seventh and 23rd, and the one on 57th Street are great bars! They're solid in every way, solid drinks, solid food, solid bartenders. They're like the New York version of Cheers, but in real life. Come by, have a drink or two and enjoy yourself too
This little gem has Tuesday slider specials!  Service is provided by a very dry lady bartender that kept us very entertained by her stories.
Great staff! Gabi is a great guy! Nice drink and the perfect place to chill
Our bartender was wonderful. It was slow and she say and chatted with us for a bit. Really enjoyed it. The bar is just okay, bit I had a great experience.

formatted_address: 345 Court St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Marco Polo

reviews.text: I had a reservation for Valentine’s Day and didn’t have to wait for my table, although the place was crowded! The place was beautiful with the decorations they added. The service was excellent. The food was delicious and can’t wait to come back!

Went Marco polo for my graduation.  Was the perfect spot for the amount of attendees.  We used the private upstairs room. The food was good.  The staff was attentive and friendly.  Excellent location for functions

Me and my family thoroughly enjoyed dining at Marco Polo. We started our meals with appetizers of baked clams, veal meatballs, roasted artichokes, and mozzarella balls wrapped in slices of prosciutto. Every single one of these appetizers was delicious. Our main courses consisted of black linguine with calamari and shrimp, bacalao with a thin tomato sauce and capers, Lobster ravioli, and spaghetti and meatballs. We had dessert, naturally, of tiramisu which was excellent. The service was excellent and the restaurant's Ambiance is very inviting. Go, enjoy, you won't be disappointed.

Service and atmosphere is top notch, but the food is disappointing. Been a few times and it just doesn't deliver the goods. It always seems like it's going to be the best Italian food in the neighborhood and then it's not. Not bad in any way, but not good enough either. I hesitate to criticize this place because I want to love it... but I don't.
Top notch food, service and atmosphere. The seafood is impeccable. Menu is fresh and tantalizing. Don't miss this gem!

formatted_address: 355 W 16th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: PHD Rooftop Lounge

reviews.text: Great views! Very B&T crowd and average boom-boom house music. DJs think that if they turn up the base, they can get people to dance as opposed to playing good mixes to do so 🤔. You also need a dance crowd. Door was  unfriendly too. Is there a reason for that? I only gave stars for the view. Overall, poor experience and we had pre-arranged bottle service...

If you're looking for breathtaking views of the New York skyline, look no further. Even on a foggy night, the views were magical. We went on a Tuesday night to celebrate a birthday. Even on a Tuesday, the staff makes a big to-do about guest lists, being escorted up, and tables. This definitely isn't a low-key place to go hang out. Guests were dressed in hip club attire. The drinks were expensive, but the prices on food were fair. The pinot grigio available by the glass on the menu was phenomenal, as was the avocado toast, which had jalepenos and was pre cut to share. Most other sharing pieces came in threes, so for a group of four, they recommended ordering two. The music was mid-2000s hip-hop, which was a fun throwback. There's a deck open outback for two things: taking skyline pictures or smoking. The crowd poured in around midnight at which point it was time for me to go home!

$600 just to sit down. Not exaggerating. Predatory. Join me in teaching these people a lesson: you can't just charge whatever and expect to stay in business. They list several bottles of wine and tequila for $14,000. These are $140 bottles tops. You can't mark up 100 times. The worst part? No food. They had no food. Only on Wednesdays. Pro tip: if you're going to charge $600 for a table,  order a stupid pie from Domino's and serve that!

It was fun, I came with a promoter and coat check employee was nice as well. They seem to care about the club. The view when you had up the lounge is absolute beautiful. The DJ played really good music for a Wednesday night but there wasn't a lot of people but it was still fun. The whole place is really great looking and there is plenty of dancing space and sit down areas as well. Would definitely recommend coming here and looking forward to coming back on a weekend with friends.

Had our company party here, good company, food and drinks.  Great atmosphere. One thing that could've been better is getting everyone upstairs faster or told our committee planners what to expect, that people with big bags and personal belongings would have to check it and that caused huge long lines for everyonr

formatted_address: 4 E 36th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Arabesque

reviews.text: Beyond excellent food with exquisite flavor. Served piping hot (don’t burn your mouth!) and surrounded by Moroccan themed decor. The staff was very nice and there was also a belly dancer that made an appearance. I definitely recommend any of the tajine’s. Hope this helps!

DO YOURSELF A HUGE FAVOR AND DO NOT GO HERE. 
The atmosphere is good however we were not allowed to enter the lounge where it’s actually decorated. Food was an absolute night mare. Appetizers were 2/5. Tuna tart was okay and shrimp was good. There was some triangular appetizer we ordered, best to stay away from it. As for the Main courses the steak was so dry, it was torture to eat it. The 1/2 chicken had no seasoning and was extremely dry. And customer service, the young lady serving us was absolutely rude, when she asked if everything is okay I pointed out that all the meats served are very dry and she ignored me. Not even an acknowledgement. If the waitress treated us with more respect and tried to help fix the food my ratings my have gotten higher but she truly could not care less. 
Also we went in the intention of a birthday and I informed the waiters it is a surprise yet this same lady came back to the table making a blunt announcement to the person we are trying to surprise. “DO YOU WANT THE CAKE NOW”.  Truly this is a  tragic comedy. 
 When the food and service are good the damage is okay. BUT if you get this, then, honestly you are at a loss, it is not worth it. Save your hard earned money for places and services where you don’t have to eat your steak with water.
Good service, good prices. Great food, music and a great atmosphere. We'll definitely be back here again!

It has a hookah bar in the back which is apparently very expensive. I caught an occasional whiff of it and could hear all the dancing from where I was sitting. The decorations are cute and the ambience is nice. The mint tea was $10 per person, which I consider pretty pricey for the experience. The waiters were very attentive with us and making sure we got what we needed. The food itself was very good and sweet, but the salad was kind of weird since the cheese came in huge chunks and it was not tossed.

5 ☆☆☆☆ WELL DESERVED FOR *EVERYTHING* ABOUT THIS PLACE!

First off, I called to reserve. The person who answered was very professional, friendly, and polite. Gave me all information that I wanted to know. 

I arrived on a Saturday Night and, was "sincerely" greeted by every person who I came in contact with. I was seated by the host and although it took me a while to order, I was always being checked on every 2-3 mins. 

It was my first time in a Moroccan Restaurant, and what was recommended to me was everything I was hoping for to taste! I had the "only Moroccan Red Wine" which was AMAZING! 

And had the Lamb Shank which I TOTALLY RECOMMEND, and the Couscous with Vegetables and Lamb. Portions were ON-POINT, Flavors were exotically delicious. 

There was a Belly Dancer who was SUPER ENTERTAINING and seemed to dance by PASSION! She tried to get the guests involved and dance with her. LOVED IT! Just wish it was for more than 30mins. 

Afterwards, there was a singer with a Moroccan style guitar which was who really made me just want to buy another bottle of wine and stayed practically ALL NIGHT! Had I not been dancing for almost the entire time being there, I would've ordered some appetizers to pick on. But that wine was just so good that I ended up just ordering another bottle instead of food. Oh well, it gives me another reason on top of the MANY REASONS, to return. By the way, the ambience was EXCELLENT as well. 

I cannot stress enough how much fun this place was. I also cannot compare ANY OTHER RESTAURANT (yet) in NYC that could possibly be close to better than Arabesque (generally speaking).

formatted_address: 145 W 45th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: O'Lunney's

reviews.text: This place is the one I always prefer. I visit plenty of restaurants but to this restaurant I  constantly return again and again. The stuff is very affectionate and the cooking they cook is so good. I never decline to have a good meal in this place. Highly recommended.

Absolutely amazing place. It is a stunning building, fantastic food, great value for money and the manager makes sure you feel at home treating everybody like they're special. Would recommend to anybody to go there!

I lived in the UK for 7 years and my girlfriend is also familiar with significant travels there, so before attending Phantom of the Opera we stopped in for dinner and a pint.

A spacious pub with the typical Irish/American decor and a good enough selection of beverages to slake all but the staunchest of Irishmen’s palettes. Enough TVs to entertain a sports fan, but not enough to be defined as a sports bar and that’s not a bad thing because that’s not where this establishment is meant to shine. 

The food is the real deal people! With the usual suspects of classic Irish fare on the menu we decided to go with the classic fish & chips and a traditional beef stew prepared in Guinness. 

The Irish bread is fresh and crumbles with annoying authenticity at the attempt to spread butter.

The fish (Cod like the good lord intended) and chips were spot on. Flaky and white encased in a crispy yet light batter that lets the fresh fish fall apart when broken is without fault. Chips (aka: French Fries) are prepared perfectly with the correct amount of crunch. 

My stew was hearty with a flavor profile that puts most American stews to shame. Tender morsels of meat, potatoes that were added at just the right time to soak in that deliciously thick Guinness broth while maintaining their texture and form. Carrots, celery, onions, et al all working in a harmonious balance that quite literally left me wanting to let it saturate my taste buds a little longer than normal. Then the addition of peas that gave a little pop of flavor with each chew were far more than an afterthought.

Service was also excellent and the draft Guinness did not disappoint.

Well done mates, well done indeed!

Unplanned visit to a really cool place.  LOVED the live music (perfect volume).  Cool crowd.
Didn't eat, just enjoyed the vibe.

Unimpressed.  The food was okay, nothing spectacular.  I read a review that their nachos were really good so we tried those for an appetizer and we were underwhelmed.  In fact, I feel bad for that reviewer if he/she is impressed with nachos like that.

Location is great, in heart of Times Square. Building itself is nice, clean, bar-like atmosphere.

Besides the food being just fair, what makes me give such a poor review was the service. Clearly they hired the young man for his Irish accent alone.  He never once checked back on us and we all needed refills.  Never offered dessert or coffee, which we all would have been up for.  I had to flag him down for our check even though we had all stopped eating a good 15 minutes prior and he almost seemed annoyed that I requested it.  No " how was everything" , no offer for tea, coffee etc.  Can't even tell you his name because he never said it.

And it was not busy, as it was an off hour (2 p.m.)  so that can't be the reason.  I honestly think he had no serving experience and was hired for the accent alone.  

Plenty other Irish pubs around. We see no reason to ever go back.

formatted_address: 207 12th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Frying Pan

reviews.text: Pretty overrated.  It's a beautiful place, but it's usually packed and isn't a great spot to chill and unwind given there's so many people here.  If it had half the crowd, it would be one of my favorite spots to go to.

Great customer service! Francisco and Chrisy were new employees at that time (summer 2019) but were so great to accommodate my company (including my dog) and I.
Francisco, thank you for being persistent, accommodating and super polite.  Chrisy, the manager, she was great making sure customers are happy and getting served promptly, yet somehow, she still found time to stop by and chat to make sure we all are satisfied with the service.  Great experience.  Thank you.
Could be a nicer place if there were less people. I wouldn't walk this far west from transporation just to come here again.
Great atmosphere, tough finding a place to sit during peak but the drinks and food are good. Nice having a live performance and view are a plus
Always wanted to try this place and was not disappointed at all! The food is delicious and the service is fast and everyone is super nice! Had a wonderful experience 💕

formatted_address: 184 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Sahara East

reviews.text: Staff is super friendly and energetic, hookah is well made and the food is delicious! I always get the chicken kebab plate, NEVER disappoints always consistent and fresh. Better than some restaurants I visit.

Great staff.. amazing hookah. It’s probably the best hookah in NYC which is a big thing to say. Lamb Kofta kebab is delicious and chicken fajita is good too. Really recommend this place. I am definitely coming here again.
Great spot with an awesome vibe. Ahmed was an excellent and friendly waiter. Very good food with huge portions at good prices.
The staff was super awesome. Went out with my boys for a drink and found this place. They use coconut coal and the hookah was pulling. Definitely planning to come again.
Food was nice and the place is not over crowded as well, over weekends.

formatted_address: 221 S 1st St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Desnuda

reviews.text: Food is amazing small restaurant but 5 star food be papered to order a lot as food comes in small bites every dish that came out the flavors and food was amazing props to the chef

Desnuda is one of my favorite spots in Williamsburg! They serve The BEST oysters I have ever had anywhere!! And they're only $1 during happy hour and Sunday/Monday all day!
They also have one of my favorite foods - ceviche - in various Peruvian/Japanese fusion dishes. SO GOOD!
I love watching the staff preparing the dishes right in front of you with speed and expert technique.
I would highly recommend this restaurant for happy hour, date night, or just a place to stop to grab drinks and appetizers.
Good oyster happy hour. Fair prices on drinks. Bar staff is friendly and helpful.
Succulent baked clams and mouth watering oysters and the popcorn is a truffle party!
Very good place for seviche, excellent octopus, very good potato with truffle paste, 1$ oysters on Friday before 8pm and fatty belly of the yellowtail...

formatted_address: 457 Court St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Frankies 457 Spuntino

reviews.text: This place is so good it makes me want to move to the neighborhood so I can go more often. We sat at the bar and the bartender helped us pick some great glasses of wine, letting us taste a bit before committing so we could be adventurous with their great list. The food was absolutely delicious. The fresh pasta had a great chew and the flavors were so so yummy!
There was never a more superior BLT. This has the balance of gods. Oh, the beet salad is also amazing.

Really enjoyed their Gnocchi! Fresh and light! May not be very filling if you’re too hungry. The Creme Brûlée was well balanced with a nice sugar crust! Liked that they have local beer selections available.

Returned to Frankies today at lunch around 3:30pm.  There are 4 people sitting in the bar and I asked if they were still serving food.  The bartender said yes and I asked to sit down at the bar or side bar tables.  She stated that they don't serve food in the front at this time and that I had to sit in the back dining room.  Fine.  I sit in the back, there was a single occupied table only 2 persons.  Every table was empty.   I wanted to check some email on my laptop and was told that was not allowed.   No electronics were allowed on the table.   As this was the purpose of my late lunch, I started to leave.  The bartender that helped me earlier thought it was strange that I was leaving and I explained that I was told that I could not use my laptop at the table.  She stated, did the manager tell you that?  I said I am not sure who she was, but I thought it was my server.  She explained that "well, its not that type of a restaurant".  I said there is no one here and its not like I came at prime dinner hours, it was 3:30 in the afternoon and they had no business.  She shrugged her shoulders that was that.  The ownership and staff at Frankies 457 has seriously lost their way and completely tossed any ideas of hospitality out the window.

Disappointing !

Had dinner there last night . Food was pretty good. 
How does an Italian restaurant not offer espresso?  Service was cold and distant. Waiter never asked how we liked our meal . We had to ask for Cheese, pepper etc. it seemed like we were  inconveniencing him . Wines by the glass were overpriced with small pour. Serving Tuscan red in a white wine glass was a convenient way of overcharging, Ricotta cheese cake was dry.Small portions for pasta.  we will not be back. Better value other places.

formatted_address: 35 E 13th St 2nd fl, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Club Cache

reviews.text: Security guard was extremely rude and needs to find another job not dealing with public or requires professional mental help with the bad attitude he exhibits responding to simple inquiries which evidently demonstrated he has a personal complex or childhood low esteem thwarting better judgement. Was visiting from out of town hoping to find a nice club to dance salsa, but never got past the entrance when I arrived with my wife and daughter. Sad that we wasted our time finding this place, but don’t bother to go if the welcome committee remains the same. Very disappointed
Not for everybody the bouncer is disrespectful and the ambiancr is so negative do not come here unless you know somebody. Bouncer are skimming at the door again beware!!!! Never go to go in.

As a Miami citizen who frequents NYC this was a new stop for me. The bachata music was definitely catching, props to the DJ. BUT the location was dirty and the atmosphere was questionable. A woman who was clearly passed the level of consent was being stripped and violated on the dance floor. A group of young men stepped in and took her aside. LUCKILY. I told the bouncer on my way out of the situation and he seemed unimpressed or to care at all. This place needs to be shut down immediately. They do not have enough security/staff. I work in a nightclub and understand these things happen but that is why there are people in place to keep situations under control which they do not have. One word : RATCHET. Avoid.
Enjoy, enjoy & Enjoy. Wow fantastic drinks, cool music and dance. Just love this place
Great Latin club! Reasonably priced drinks, free water and really cool ambiance! Would definitely go again, next time I am in NYC.

formatted_address: 79 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Mermaid Oyster Bar

reviews.text: Was there for their happy hour. The oysters and clams were fresh and delicious! I had the dark and stormy and my husband had the dirty and spicy. Drinks were excellent! Loved the atmosphere. We say facing out and it was perfect for people watching.  The staff was very friendly and my water glass was never empty.  Service was impeccable!

We went for the oyster happy hour, so it was crowded. We had a reservation and were seated right away. The oysters were amazing. The fried calamari sauce was a little salty, but everything tasted good. I am not usually big on spinach dip, but I liked this one with crab. It was a great meal with friendly and helpful staff.

Great happy hour at this place, especially for the oysters. We really had to refrain from eating more than a dozen each! The service was generally friendly. This location is pretty busy and tight on space so best to come early. We look forward to trying the UWS location which is closer to us.

Amazing service. Great food. The four of us sat at the bar. Efficient, friendly and fast service from the whole team. The bartender drinks were perfect. When your martinis are constant in taste, it’s mean quality drinks. It’s a good place to unwind after a busy week. Thank you to all the staff for that great experience.
Great for oysters. Lobster roll was fantastic. Fries a little too spicy. Would recommend it, but be prepared to spend some $$. Typical dinner for 2 around $200.

formatted_address: 212 E 52nd St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Crystal

reviews.text: Fancy shop! I love it! brought a few pieces for my home!

formatted_address: 800 Washington St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Three Owls Market

reviews.text: What a cute little place in the meat packing around the corner from Whitney and the High Line.  Great place to grab something good to eat for whatever meal.  Food is great.  Selection is good.  Staff are friendly and helpful.  It’s a cute little place. I definitely recommend this place!

Visiting the meat packing district? Here's a tip. Avoid the overpriced eateries with long wait times around The Whitney. Discover something real.

What a gem! It's a little deceptive from the street. You might take it for a bodega or coffee shop. Inside, it's fantastic! Contemporary, modern, and clean on one hand. Cozy and inviting on the other. They have counter service as well as tables in a back alcove away from traffic.

The menu is great! They have made to order as well as prepared foods to heat up. All of it fresh, quality, well prepared, and served by friendly people.

We had the chicken dip sandwich... AMAZING. there are lots of delicious market finds here, great paleo snacks and sugar free beverages. The hot food is fresh and delicious. This is a great neighborhood spot for lunch, breakfast, a coffee, or a meeting!

Three Owls is clean, fresh cuisine at its best. It manages to be both warm and elegant at the same time, a lovely place to sit and enjoy a lovely meal or snack. We tried everything. There were a few particularly great highlights. The rotisserie chicken was cooked perfectly. Our crushed cucumber salad was delightful. We had help picking out an amazing new wine from the staff. Everything about the place shows a level of care and attention I see all too rarely in the city. LOVED it. Can't wait to go back.
The sandwich board out front said World’s Best Hot Chocolate. They weren’t kidding!!

formatted_address: 499 Grand St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Cafe Argentino

reviews.text: This restaurant is unquestionably one of the most attractive place to eat in the area. Every time I visit this place I am absolutely glad. They manage their very high  level service and the highest level of dishes  they offer. You can never go wrong with this restaurant. Very  recommended.
My fiance had the Tomahawk steak and he loved it.  All the food and service was great!! Definitely coming back.

Warm service and inviting ambiance. I was lucky enough to come when they had some flamenco singers and it was very lovely. I would say to stick to their appetizers because their main courses were a bit too pricey and not really worth it.
Friendly staff. Place is clean and pretty nice. Food was good too. If you like meat, you should definitely go there.

I went there for lunch with a coworker and they still had the brunch menu, which includes free coffee or sangria. Really free (with any order) and not just New York City "oh you didn't meet the criteria so you get to pay a surprise ten dollars" kind of free. The empanadas were amazing. Hands down. The French toast was to die for. I'm only writing this review so I'll be able to find it again.

formatted_address: 5 Gold St, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: Giardino D'Oro

reviews.text:
What a fantastic place! Great food! Had a sirloin steak and spinach. Delicious! We can highly recommend this place. Very nice place, great service and clean. Would love to come back!
Had a table for a party of 6. 
they serve salami as an appetizer plus a bunching Parmesan cheese.

The atmosphere and service were great. If your looking for a wonderful experience then this is the real deal. The food was good but I think it didn't live up to the rest of the experience.  You will have an exquisite wine list and the bar too is well stocked. Should be a 4.5.
Some of the nicest steak I've had in NYC in an upscale Italian restaurant with elegant vibes. Thr waitstaff were professional and made me feel like family. Would definitely go back!

Great service and atmosphere. A great New York steak house. I got the filet mignon for around $52 which was very delicious. The garlic mashed potatoes were to die for at $12. I would recommend to anyone wanting a fancy meal. We went for lunch at 2 pm, and we were the only ones in the restaurant.

I have been here many times with work colleagues it's usually a larger group and I love to order the fish special whether it's the sole or the branzino with a side of their freshly made pasta. Other people have had the steak, the lamb, clams, etc. It is all good. They have great wine, desserts and excellent service.

formatted_address: 643 Broadway, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Sweetwater Social

reviews.text: Awesome time. Had my wifes birthday here for a bar crawl stop. Everyone was cool as s@#t. I even hung with the bouncers while finishing my cigar and I didn't want to leave. Cheers to Sweetwater Social!

Went here this past weekend to celebrate my birthday with my friend. We contacted Shaun the owner weeks in advance to reserve the Red Room (private room) for our celebration, and he confirmed. When we arrived on the night of our party, it turns out he booked another party in that room, and reserved the open space of the bar in the front for us instead. The fact that we had confirmed these details in the previous weeks to find that he had ‘confused’ his communication with another party was extremely disappointing. In fact, we chose to celebrate our birthday here because of the separate and private space…

While Shaun did apologize and offered us a complimentary bottle of rose, it still kind of sucked that this happened. Since the room was booked until 11pm, there was nothing we could do but hang out in the open area instead and make the most of it.

What I didn’t really like was that Shaun kept trying to advocate for the shared space in the main part of the bar as the ’sought out’ area of the bar. The reason we wanted the private room was because it was a private space, and the seating arrangement was a bit better - not as spaced out as the open area room (which has couches here and there, and not everyone could sit.) Also, my friend visited the bar a few weeks in advance to check out the space - and preferred The Red Room, which also influenced our decision to book this room.

Regarding drinks, cocktail drinks are GOOD (~15 each). My friends ordered this punch with a flame, it was very tasty. However, my friends pointed out that the bartender was judgmental when they asked for a Long Island Iced Tea….

Even though we were pretty disappointed that we could not get the private space when we had reserved it in advance, we were still able to have a good time. Also they did not charge a cake fee, which was nice and we were able to store it in their fridge. Not sure if mixups like this happen often, but BEWARE if you are planning to reserve the private room here.
Good cocktails but super warm!!!! Place needs better airflow. Was kind of loud too on a Fri night so be warned. I've seen it quieter on the earlier part of the week.

First of all, they overbooked my friend’s private room and we didn’t get to use it. It was unfortunate but we did get comped a free drink because of it. Lol the waitress shamed me for wanting a Long Island Iced Tea. I mean yeah it’s a trashy drink but look it was a Friday night after work I was ready to get wasted. The drinks are strong though, maybe too strong because my friend had to send hers back but then we got a free one. Overall a very nice place.
Great staff, quick service, and music is lit! Will definitely come back.

formatted_address: 545 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Prospect Bar and Grill

reviews.text: I really enjoyed this place. It is very spacious and cozy. We were greeted and seated as soon as we walked in. Our server was very attentive. They have one of the best mac and cheeses in Park Slope but I highly recommend eating it there, it does not taste as good in a take out container. The buffalo wings and chips with charred tomato salsa and guacamole were both delicious as well. I had the steak with mashed potatoes and the steak could have used more salt and seasoning, the fat could have been trimmed off better as well, next time I go I will opt for the burger and fries which looked delicious.

Have been coming to this bar for a few years now and love both the bar and the sit down area. They have the best mac and cheese I've ever had and their chicken fingers are delicious! You always receive great service no matter what part of the bar you're at. And we love Chris!! He's the best bartender there! Everyone is awesome though! Definitely a must do in Park Slope.

I went here to buy some food, mainly. First, the food is really tasty. I had a Bison burger here. It was a big plate that was very filling and had plenty of vegetables. The two people I came with ordered fish and something chicken related. They were both happy. I can also say the beer is great (most of which is craft or craft-like). Best of all, the human factor is superb. I really liked the bartender. He has a great personality and is very chill. I think his name is Chris (?). Anyway, I recommend this place if you are looking for bar food and for a great selection of beers. I'd say the beer selection is even better than some of the local bars around here. All in all, great experience!

A pretty nice and cozy place to just sit and relax. Food is good also. Got the Blackened Catfish which was tasty. The Jalapeno Margarita was banging. My server Ricky and the rest of the staff was very friendly. I will definitely come again....

I’ve loved this place since it opened a few years ago. I mostly come for the food, but the bar area looks great - spacious and clean and the right balance of casual and classy. The food is what keeps me coming back. The brunch is great - love the French toast. Dinner food is several steps above standard pub food. My wife loves the roast chicken, and I’ve enjoyed their burger. The fries are quite good as well. Their chicken finger appetizers with the sweet chili sauce are definitely kryptonite for my waistline too. Portions are great and I usually end up taking some home. Wait staff is good - sometimes they have a lot of tables on what seemed like a quieter night, but if you’re not in too much of a rush it’s really no big deal.

formatted_address: 9 Maiden Ln, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: The Malt House

reviews.text: What a gem we found in NYC for brunch.  Very nice laid back atmosphere. The food was awesome, the braised rib Benedict was beyond this works. They offer an unlimited brunch drink option and it is definitely work it if you plan on having more than a couple of drinking with brunch. The bartender was awesome and the drinks really hit the spot made with very fresh juices and definitely not skimping on the alcohol, we will be back next time we visit!

I absolutely loved the Buttermilk chicken nuggets and the fish tacos. I had the fish grilled and ate with the flour tortilla and it was perfect. I would definitely recommend to others to get the fish tacos. When I went, it was night and they had all the candles lit and it was very romantic and cozy there. Even when I took the food home afterwards, it was still amazing. Also the service was very welcoming

The Malt House, as expected, has an amazing and large assortment of delicious craft beers. The bar in general has a great selection of everything. The food is always amazing and delicious. I recommend the Wagyu blend Burger, but you really can't go wrong with anything. The environment is very chill and is a nice place to hang out. I can get loud but it's usually not as crowded as most bars. If you go towards the back, there's stairs going down to the basement bar lounge, which is a much more relaxing scenery if you can get a table.

Fabulous experience all around: service, food, atmosphere, everything. Glad we found this spot while visiting. Definitely a must go when in the area.

Recommend: fish tacos and any cocktail! Fish tacos came with charred cabbage, black beans, Chipotle sauce, and salmon (which i ordered fried). What a masterpiece!

The food here was great and the unlimited drink deal for brunch was unbeatable. Was able to switch between drinks as much as we liked, which most places usually don’t allow. 

If you’re in the financial district looking for a great boozy brunch spot I wouldn’t look much further than this spot!

formatted_address: 39 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Wogies

reviews.text: Great food and drinks, but somehow The check is always close to $100. Amazing to be able to sit outside though.

Everything is pretty good at this place. I'm addicted to the crazy Kate's wings, buffalo chicken tenders. Their cheesesteaks are out of this world. I normally get my things to go, but it's always lively and a friendly atmosphere; especially during any playoff season.

In Philadelphia they say "Pat's or Gino's".  I say "Wogies!" Love the chicken cheesesteak sandwich, and can always catch a Philadelphia game (or even Pittsburgh). This is a dive, but when its not too busy, its its perfectly enjoyable to just hang for a sandwich and a couple beers.  Come early, or late, and in the summer, grab an outdoor seat. The sandwiches won't disappoint.
Great wings, great cheese steak, and lots of other great fried foods. Good beer too. They were very accommodating for our party of 10 celebrating a work event.

This is a nice cozy place. They have a great menu with lots of variety. They have a few TVs. The booth we sat in actually had 2 TVs, a larger one up high
and a smaller one at head level. The service was great and the prices are good too. I had a cheesesteak and waffle fries with cheese. I can't wait to go back and try some of the other menu options.

formatted_address: 454 Van Brunt St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Hometown Bar-B-Que

reviews.text: DELICIOUSLY GOOD! This restaurant really has the best food offerings that you could have imagined. It would be my third time now to try this restaurant, and the people working around here always satisfy me, especially for the service and the foods that they provided. A truly wonderful place to dine together with your friends or family. Highly recommended!

So delicious! I went here late on a Friday night and most of their meat options were sold out. I was a little disappointed at first, but what I had made up for that. The mac and cheese was awesome! They have pinto beans as a new menu item. Try them! They're so good. The wings were good, but spicy. If you're not a fan of heat, I'd order something else. The brisket was tender and the BBQ sauce complimented it very well. I can't wait to go back.

The food was SO good, absolutely delicious. The brisket was so tender and flavorful, the mac and cheese was so good. Everything was delicious! And we were so full, we had to take the rib home. Don't underestimate their rib, their ribs are like a foot long and at least three inches thick, but still so delightfully yummy!

Great bbq food at reasonable prices. The space is huge with plenty of seating. Seems to have live band performances sometime. You order at the counter. The brisket is their staple, but I really enjoyed the pull pork. I recommend coming with a couple people to try as much of the menu as you can or make multiple visits.

This is an old friend that had a genius idea And made a dream come true. He made  the ultimate barbecue spot. The brisk the wings it just melts in your mouth. We even have Christmas parties happen here that’s how good the food is.

formatted_address: 1120 6th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Bluestone Lane Bryant Park Coffee Shop

reviews.text: This became our go to coffee shop. Oat milk options, cold pressed juice and avocado toast for breakfast- great Aussie place, they even have vegemite!
Cute Australian coffee chain. I had the iced mocha and it was delicious. Some seating here which can get occupied quick. Must try!

Beautiful location with lots of light and plenty of outdoor sitting. My latte was amazingly delicious and absolutely gorgeous. My husband couldn’t say enough good things about his mocha. The foam was silky and smooth. Barista was very friendly and did an amazing job with both drinks.

Waitress was a stone cold non customer friendly robot who couldn’t even understand the Aussie dialect.   After 40 minutes of waiting for 3 basic toast meals I questioned her on how long was the wait for our basic meals. She was so blank faced that she walked off without a reply to not even acknowledge a response. 
The “ must be “ manager  then stepped in to apologize For the delay and refunded our money. 
It wasn’t about a refund. 
It was about service and customer satisfaction. 
Terrible first impression. 
I’m an Aussie from Melbourne and this place does not represent Melbourne in anyway. 
We received a third world welcome from the big apple. 
Total disaster.

So hard to find unless your a local, we nearly gave up. Find the sign for STK and it’s opposite. 

But once you get here, a delicious menu of goodies and great coffee.

formatted_address: 79 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Cafe Katja

reviews.text: First and foremost, Cafe Katja has excellent food. The setting is intimate and their menu consists of authentic Bavarian meals. The beers are great and this is coming from someone who does not enjoy beer. I had the Spaten 0.3 L; if I wasn't driving home I would have gladly enjoyed a Stein. I loved the liverwurst and the homemade pretzels are delicious but a bit small. One pretzel is for about 1-2 people. Their homemade mustard is excellent but very spicy so be careful with your portions. Overall, I plan to return here again in the future.

Austrian cuisine. The food is very good but the service is great. They have a special menu to celebrate Oktoberfest which is really good. Portions are Germanic (huge) and is reasonable priced. The Mexican guy waiting on us was superb and very helpful.

I love this place! They have splendid dishes, their menu is large, The chief cook in that spot is well trained, I enjoy a lot eating all their dishes. The dishes are consistently fresh, the attitude towards the guests  is good. I often go to  this place and I was never unsatisfied. I recommend it with no hesitation.

Great neighborhood restaurant serving up German and Austrian classics. Nice and cozy interior. Food is delicious and well-prepared. Service is friendly, though the beginning could have been a little more attentive and consistent. Nonetheless, had a great experience and would certainly come back for another drink and meal!
Wonderful service and delicious schnitzel! The pretzel is small but worth it. For dessert, the chocolate cake is to die for!

formatted_address: 318 Van Brunt St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Brooklyn Ice House

reviews.text: Cash only place in Red Hook that serves decent food at decent prices out of a small kitchen. The place isn’t all that big, but that’s not a bad thing either. Good selection of draft beers as well as beer and shot specials (my go-to). All of that is great, but my favorite part would have to be the bowl of candy near the door with skittles and sour patch kids for when you leave.

Don't trick yourself looking from the outside. Once you get inside you will find a cozy, lay back and cool atmosphere to enjoy drinks, food or be in the backyard with friends. There is no push from the bartender to get drinks every time, no drunk people yelling, good spot with music, tv and special event. This has become our place and we had a great time everytime we show up. Don't expect to have a waiter checking on you all time time because the bartender is pretty much the one who run the tables when they can, still they are always available and helpful for whatever you need. Prices are very affordable including for drinks and they got special and happy hours. 

Highly recommended place if you want a classic old school bar in a cozy warm place in a safe environment to eat or drink.

I had the pulled pork here. So delicious.  My cousin had the veggie burger and she was delighted with it.  They also have back area too which is pretty cool.  You have select bars that do have a back area to hang out in.
A straightforward bar bar. They serve a tasty and cheap Frito pie. A good place to spend some time during the day, don't know what it's like at night

A true Red Hook gem, and an unparalleled place to spend a Sunday afternoon. These guys have everything you want in a day drinking spot: awesome burgers and wings (especially the wings), cheap beer/shot specials, board games and a jar of candy by the door. Spend an afternoon at this place and you’ll wanna come back again and again.

formatted_address: 210 W 118th St, New York, NY 10026, USA
name: The Cecil Steakhouse

reviews.text:
I've been a patron for years and I'm always more than satisfied with the service and food.
The staff are all super attentive and very accommodating [always a plus when they remember you]. The brunch and dinner options are excellent. Never had a bad dish. The happy hour menu is extensive and reasonably priced. I really can't rave enough about this place.

Cecil Steakhouse is a hidden gem. My wife and I didn't realize how nice it was inside. The bartender was experienced enough to create specialty drinks on the spot. His skills and service definitely impressed us. We credit the establishment for offering fresh garnishments with their drinks. That's not something we're use to at other local bars in Harlem. I've rated Cecil 4 of 5 because I felt the service could have been a little better organized. The staff was a little overwhelmed with our family gathering in their private room. Other than that, I'd recommend to friends and family.
Oh man! What a Saturday to remember. Prices are not bad. Great customer service and good live entertainment. We go on Saturday nights. There are two band sets. The food is outstanding!
Loved everything about this restaurant. Valentines Day wouldn't have been great without going here. Great place to have a date. The staff was excellent, thank you all.
For my first time going I had a great experience. The food was delicious. I liked the layout, decor and the music was a good mix. I would def go back to try something new.

formatted_address: 36 Central Park S, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Harry's New York Bar

reviews.text: Bartender must have called out sick and they had the janitor fill in, what a joke.  He addressed my daughter and I as gentleman, not once but twice. Asked him what style beer Sam Adams Cold Snap was and he tells me Boston Lager, when I asked again he muttered something incoherent. What a joke.
It is a small place, but it is very nice. The bartender was very personable and nice. It's a little expensive, but it's quiet and classy.
BIG$$$ FOR LITTLE FOOD AND NOT THE BEST DRINKS..............
No clue why Google is asking me to rate this place because I've never been here.   Looks nice though!

Awful customer service. We were informed that we could have room service from Harry's bar whilst stopping at the park lane hotel. However when I rang through to order, I was greeted with an unpleasant member of staff informing me that they do not do room service and then hung up the phone.

formatted_address: 178 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Pangea

reviews.text:
This is a nice, intimate setting with a cozy vibe.  I was there for a jazz concert by the amazing David Raleigh. While I didn't order any food, I did have 2 of their amazing signature drinks that had me kinda tipsy, lol.🍹  Gotta say, I've been thinking about it ever since!
.
.
I ❤NY

Wow. What a wonderful old ny kind of nightclub. Sidney Myer was a great entertainer. Beautiful art. Great wait staff. Great audience. What a joyful night. I had a smile on my face from beginning to end.
Our absolute very favorite place to go for dinner in the East Village. Great service, delicious food, and the staff and owners are always welcoming and warm. Love Pangea!
We enjoy a meal at Pangea often. We always have great service and delicious meals. Especially enjoy their watermelon and feta salad and their steak and frittes. Pasta always delicious too.

Always constantly great. The food, the service, and the hosts.  I love this place! Now that Pangea has regular cabaret nights, it makes it even more fun to come with your friends or out of town visitors. You will be talking about the evening for months to come because it always holds surprises and unexpected moments. The drinks are big and the price is small. Well worth a repeat visit.

formatted_address: 113 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Mehanata Bulgarian Bar

reviews.text: Mehanata Bulgarian Bar is my new favorite spot in NYC. Already recommending to everyone I know. This bar is unique and you will find another like it in Manhattan. This bar truly appeals to everyone especially those that need a break from the concrete jungle every now and then. Bartenders are awesome at what they do. The offer many types of cocktails and we can't forget about the vodka ICE CAGE!  Forget about dating apps and get your butt down to Mehanata. Live life.

Interesting eclectic mix of people you'll find here. Way way different (and better) vibe than dance spots in meatpacking... music is more international, guys aren't grinding up on you. I don't dare to enter the ice box but it looks fun?

Came here with a group of friends, there's an upstairs and downstairs so plenty of space to come with your crew!

Great club to stop by with friends! Have been a few times. Cool vibe inside, and they often play Reggaeton which is unique.

Removing a star because I got roofied one of those times (drinking my girlfriend's drink), so keep your eyes open.

P.S. the coat-check is cash only!!

I got there for my birthday last Saturday with thinking I'll have so much fun that I used to have before at this place. I was completely disappointed and embarrassed for my friends. First of all and most importantly, there was no dinner menu that it's shown on their website. I had cancelled my reservation for dinner from an other restaurant just because of this wrong information on the website and misinformation the gentleman that I talked on the phone gave me. As a dinner they only have 3 different kinds of burger (very small and tasteless) and Bulgarian sausage with a few slice of fries and coleslaw in a to go container for $10. Besides that, there was no Bulgarian live music. There was a decent Dj playing Latin music. Don't get me wrong. I love Latin music but if I wanted to spend my birthday with listening Latin music, I know much better places to go and they have also really good food. We were there until 11pm with a hope that might have live music but nothing. The other floors were already not open. Some of my friends were seriously sleeping. We just had to leave to go another place. I gave 2 stars just for the old good times that I spent there and the cozy atmosphere they still have. Sadly, I don't think I will go back again.

Very fun place to have a few drinks and let lose on the dance floor. Love the decor. It has three floors which is also nice, need to check out the top which appears a bit smaller.
 The bottom floor looks nice has a stopped pole a bar also and a "ice cage" where you take shots. Some that you pay extra for.

formatted_address: 481 8th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: radio city music hall

formatted_address: 475 W Broadway, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Dos Caminos

reviews.text: We had the best bartender/waiter (and I’m so sorry, but I forgot his name). He was extremely attentive and made great suggestions! There are millions of restaurants in NY, and I definitely like trying new places when I go, but I’d definitely return here. The food was great, it’s in a great location and the restaurant/staff were wonderful! I highly recommend this place!

Very good low key Dos Caminos restaurant.  The staff were very nice.  The chips were really good. The burritos were enormous. I couldn't come close to finishing mine. My husband and daughter wisely chose baby burritos. The salsa and garnish station was a nice touch.  The only negative was the panhandlers.  One was stationed at the door and the other was working the dining room.  Otherwise, a very nice budget friendly restaurant with good food.

Ran into this place by accident and glad we did. Great atmosphere and decor. The food is outstanding.  Drinks were also strong and refreshing. Definitely recommend given that you honestly get your money's worth.

It's a bit pricey and the staff could have been more attentive. The drinks were great but the food was bland. 
I had the margarita of the day and it was great. A bit spicy too which is just the way I like it. The nachos with guacamole (with two avocados) was enough for 6 men. The enchiladas de queso was okay, not great, and the portion was way too small for an entree.

Foods are great and it offers a great ambiance for sure—especially the outdoor seatings. But what’s all that for when the service is simply disappointing if not out of line? Our table (of 7 persons) ordered 3 coffees and 2 of them had flakes in the liquid. Our server didn’t seem to care much about it and rolled his eyes in front of us with an annoyed tone. We had to give up asking for new ones obviously and I felt so bad for my friends who came here because of my recommendation.

formatted_address: 222 W 23rd St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Chelsea Room

formatted_address: 570 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: The Mermaid Inn

reviews.text: Great atmosphere and delicious food! The grilled northern salmon is a great success! The Tuna dish my friend had wasn't bad either. Only point off for the French fries, they were slightly cold.

This season restaurant was packed to the gills with patrons (sorry, bad pun) but in a good way. Festive and lively atmosphere. Quick and frequent staff attention. Excellent dishes. Perfect evening of winding down with friends after the long holiday season.

Absolutely fresh and on spot. Kale Ceasar salad different with a superb dressing, the pan seared cod on a bed of greens was perfectly cooked and simply plated and last but not least the clam linguine was perfection...beautiful sauce that just worked.

The restaurant itself is beautifully laid out and decorated in a timeless style. Professional and efficient staff from start to finish.

This is the go-to place for me whenever I’m craving for oysters. I have come here for happy hour for 3 years. The happy hour menu here is just perfect, with the combination of good price, nice wine selections, and delicious food. 
Their happy hour is 5-7 everyday, but if you don’t want to wait for too long during weekends, try get here as early as 4:55. 
Oh and they have lobster combo every Sunday night which I don’t think is on the menu. Ask the server if you wanna try.

This happy hour is probably the best happy hour I've ever encountered! Delicious, fresh oysters and beer for a very good price! We tried a couple of things on their menu, and everything was delicious! Service is very friendly as well. Reservations are recommended!

formatted_address: 265 E 78th St, New York, NY 10075, USA
name: Pil Pil

reviews.text: Cozy atmosphere. Shared seating. Interesting decor. Service was very attentive. The food was very good. It was recommended two tapas for each person to share. That was perfect. We got there early in the evening, but as the night went on, it got busier and the tables filled up.
The service and food is outstanding.  Shared seating, but still easy to have a private dining experience. Good wine selection, priced a bit high, but there are enough choices.
Favorite date spot! Every dish we've tried is amazing, especially the mac and cheese croquettes. Great service and vibe too, always busy here but a good crowd. Can't go wrong!

Loved Pamela and Jerry. They both made my dining experience great!! Kudos to the chef. The food is amazing and they always make sure we feel like family. The space does require assistance with wheelchairs so please call ahead of time.
Exlent place for good Tapas and wine, highly recomended.

formatted_address: 42 Avenue B, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: POST

reviews.text: Excellent brunch. I had the garden grits which unfortunately were cold, but tasty. I really think if they heated the plates and used a smaller deeper dish it wouldn't be a problem at all. My server did check in with me, but I didn't say anything about it because I hate making a big deal of things, so that was my fault. Really fresh ingredients and very nice and funny staff. Will be back for sure. Looking forward to trying their dinner menu. Thank you!
Good food, okay coffee.  Great setting, slightly awkward when you're the only one in there.  But overall I'd recommend it - the biscuits were fantastic!

Visited for breakfast and the waitress and staff were very friendly and accommodating. The food was excellent, had the post breakfast and the bacon biscuit. The biscuits are amazing and the potatoes and eggs were quite tasty. The food and staff were on the money and I will be back again to finish the menu. The biscuit and gravy with chicken sausage was also tasty. A must to to go back here once again.

I love this place. Delicious drinks and salads, fresh biscuits, and gluten free options for my girlfriend. All of this and it’s somehow cheaper then a lot of nearby breakfast places of worse quality. Strongly recommend!
The biscuits and gravy are amazing. Highly recommend having it with their hot sauce. Their seating is kind of limited and tight so would recommend going with smaller parties.

formatted_address: 920 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: The Tang

reviews.text: This place provides extraordinary service as well as enjoyable menu. The best spot ever. The food came out quick and the prices were affordable. Highly recommended.

Just had the most amazing meal here.  First off, the restaurant is gorgeously elegant which makes the dining experience that much more memorable.  It’s not a large space but it is thoughtfully laid out.  I love the bar area in front overlooking Amsterdam Ave.  And the hand painted wall murals are beautiful.  Almost every angle of this restaurant is Instagram worthy.

Does the food live up to the décor?  YES!  So happy we got to come for a food tasting.  We ordered quite a lot of food (for two people) when we were here. We ordered the fried pork buns, roasted eggplants, scallion oil noodles, pineapple fried rice with shrimp and the veggie summer roll. 

The fried pork buns were amazing.  The braised pork belly melts in your mouth.  This was by far my favorite dish of the night.  The roasted eggplants were another great dish.  The soybean paste and bonito flakes really helped to elevated the eggplants.  The pineapple fried rice was great and I loved the shredded pork garnish.  The scallion oil noodles had great flavor.  The dish was smaller than I was expecting but the noodles were wonderful.  Cooked right and not overdone.  The summer roll was okay.  We ordered it because it looked like it was a new addition to the menu.  I think this dish was overshadowed by the fried buns and roasted eggplants. 

We also ordered desserts and got the fried buns with condensed milk and a scoop of the lychee ice cream.  The lychee ice cream was surprisingly forgettable, but the fried buns were a winner.  It had a thin coating of caramelized sugar and had a nice crunch as you bit into it.  It did not need the condensed milk dip, in my opinion. 

I definitely want to go back and try more of their menu. Or possibly just order 10 plates of the fried pork buns—they were the bomb.
food is very good, but the chair is really uncomfortable.
Amazing food and really friendly staff. I highly recommend this place! Definitely a new favorite date night spot!

Loved everything I’ve tried so far. Quiet enough to have a conversation. The chicken noodle soup was great for my winter cold. And I love those stools even though they’re backless. Where can I buy these chairs?

formatted_address: 206 W 23rd St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Jake's Saloon

reviews.text: My favorite local spot. I work down the street and it's my go to for an unwind at night. Friendly staff and good conversation always. Food and drinks don't disappoint, I always come back.
Excellent food, a great place to watch sports (we watched the US women's world cup finals here!), really swell service, and just good vibes all around. Highly recommend this hidden gem
One of my favorite places in the city.  Classy and distinguished yet incredibly friendly place.  Staff always willing to go that extra bit.
Good food and beer's.  Excellent barman and the owner,  Jimmy,  is a great host.  Lovely relaxed atmosphere.  We thoroughly enjoyed our visit.
Several locations. I would give a 5 if they sold mozzarella sticks. The burger and onion rings are amazing. When in NY you need to try a burger at an Irish bar. A true Irish ☘️ Bar!!!

formatted_address: 109 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: A Summer Day Café

reviews.text: Really delicious!! The brioche sticky bun for a little appetizer was SO GOOD!! Perfect balance of sweet and savory. The avocado toast was really delicious as well! Loved the poached egg on top!!! The buttermilk waffle with cannoli cream and lemon marmalade was very good as well! Definitely recommend this place!!! Check out the photos!

Polite staff. Concept was weird. They weren’t serving food at 4:30pm. Place was practically empty. Ordered tea, appetizer, and chocolate cake. Only 4 appetizers on the menu, so we got this French onion dip that came with 4 small baguette slices of bread that were stale and harder than the graphite asteroid from the movie Armageddon. Chocolate cake was dry and gave us a stomach ache. Don’t see this business lasting too long.
Very cute cosy place, nice food and service,, relax

Really fun, lively spot. There for the 2nd night of their opening and lovely for exactly what the name would suggest — a summery day. Really nice seafood, good cocktail list. Will become a regular haunt, as well as its downstairs sibling restaurant, the bbq speakeasy.

We visited the cafe for a late brunch and it was okay. The Short Rib Mac and Cheese is really more of a Short Rib ragu sauce over pasta. Not bad, but not Mac and Cheese. We also ordered fries, which were well cooked and came with this DELICIOUS ranch dill sauce, but they portion it like they're afraid to give it away. Then there was the cinnamon buns, which I felt would benefit from being warmed up so we decided to bring that home. Unfortunately, once home and warmed, I was the only one who would eat it. The caramel sauce and hazelnuts are good but the dough is exceedingly salty. Almost like pretzel dough. Sort of strange. We also ordered the Lobster roll (which I liked but my husband, who likes lobster, could have done without all the extra seasoning and toppings) a burger (which was good but impossible to eat because the bottom bun was mush) and a fried chicken sandwich that was okay. I will say that the turmeric quinoa dish is delightful, if that is your jam. It does have cauliflower and cherries in it and my husband couldn't have been LESS impressed if he tried. To top it all off our waiter seemed generally annoyed by our existence. Which is what it is, but was certainly more glaring when paired with a overall 'meh' meal.

formatted_address: 40 N 6th St, Brooklyn, NY 11249, USA
name: Fabbrica | The Factory

reviews.text: Went a Fabbrica on Christmas and the service was awesome! From the bar to the floor,to the kitchen! The team makes the food even better! Highly recommend

My friend and i randomly decided to stop here to get something to eat before making our way to relax by the pier. This spot has a rustic edgy feel that i like and outside seating for the gorgeous weather that is on its way. Yesterday was one of those days hitting high 80s. We settled for pasta and it was very good. I definitely plan to go back and try out one of the pizzas being that they have a stone brick oven. I also noticed passing by in the evening, it was crowded and very inviting. 👌🏾

We went here for an early dinner on a Sunday and it was not that crowded.  The space is large with a warehouse like a vibe, With pretty loud music playing.  The menus all are on ipads, And mine was not working so had to get another one.  I saw another person at a different table whose iPad wasn't working also.  Personally I'm not a fan of the iPad menu because you have to keep going back to try to look at the different sections, It's a lot easier just to have a menu With pages.

We got the calamari and the burrata for appetizers.   Calamari was decent.  Burrata  Was very good and came with delicious fresh small heirloom tomatoes with a nice crusty bread.

Got the aperol spritz for a drink.   It didn't taste quite right And wasn't as good as others that  I have had.

For dinner my husband got the rigatoni with sausage and peas in a cream sauce, Which was utterly delicious.  I got the penne Al forno,  Which I felt was lacking flavor and salt.

The bill for the both of us was about a $100.

We stumbled into Fabbrica for a quick bite, after wandering from a nearby exhibit in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.  Its atmosphere is laid out in an industrial setting, serving Italian fare. Prices are reasonable, and expected for city dinning. The lunch hour provided a welcome quietness that aided us in winding down from being out all afternoon. 

I ordered the Chitarra al pomodoro fresco which is basically a fancy way of saying, ‘I like the homemade spaghetti, please.’ For my beverage I opt for the homemade lemonade in lieu of a spirit. My friend got the Prosciutto pizza. For my taste buds the spaghetti noodles were al dente perfect! While the sauce left much to be admired. I felt it was a bit on the watery and bland side. Probably the cherry tomatoes made for a more watery like sauce?  To stave off the watery blandness, I added some parmigiano cheese in hopes it will solve the salt issue to no affect. Then again, I like my salt! So for all I know the salt level was probably as high as a salt tank but my taste buds are desensitize to it. The lemonade was on point. It was a perfect balance of tart, sweet, and refreshing all around. 

Overall, Fabbrica provided for a nice lunch, I will definitely go back to try out their Polipo appetizer, another fancy way of saying, ‘The octopus appetizer.’
My wife and I were in the neighborhood and decided to try this place out. The service was great, and the food was phenomenal! We had the carbonara and the ravioli and they were delicious.

formatted_address: 20 W 39th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Men of Sapphire NYC Male Revue

reviews.text: Is so cool

I absolutely love this place. The men are so sexy. The shows are so fun. The bunch is way more amazing than you would ever expect... French toast, fresh omelets, salmon, bacon and so many delicious things. But of course the most delicious thing are the boys.  Be on the look out for Liam who’s a total babe. Also Valentino is a real cutie. There’s something for everyone for sure.

It's a really good venue for wedding as long as you can limit the amount of guests to 70 people or less. They don't provide the arch so after painstaking planning and doing the flowers ourselves, you can see in the picture how we were able to put in a 6ft tall arch into the 1st floor of the restaurant.

Had a great and fun time with the Men of Sapphire. Romeo the MC made it very fun and welcoming. The Brunch was delicious and the male hotties were a great part of my dessert! Drinks were flowing and the music was on Point! Had the greatest Lap Dance from Dynamite! A must see!!

I went to the grand opening with two friends and we all had a blast! The performers are flown in from all over the country every week. They were very sweet and welcoming and the acts were creative and upbeat. I got a dance from the very talented Charly from Atlanta and it was well worth it!

formatted_address: 8 W 58th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Pomona

reviews.text: We are traveling for the holidays and stumbled across this hideaway restaurant. It wowed us from the stair way entry to the cuisine served. I ordered the Artic Char and it was so balanced. For dessert, we ordered the Baked Alaska and the Chocolate Mousse Espresso and, without a doubt in my mind, the chocolate mousse was off the charts. Everything was beautifully presented and wonderfully made! Thank you, Pomona!

Pomona is absolutely fabulous!  The atmosphere is hip and modern, but also perfect for those seeking an intimate dining experience.  The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and extremely accommodating.  Every dish our server recommended exceeded our expectations.  The cocktails were wonderful as well.  I highly recommend dining at Pomona!

Amazing food, great ambiance and service. The Savage Lounge is a great place to dance and have drinks with friends. Had my birthday party there this year. Also must try the truffle fries and the desserts!
Could go on and on about this place. Everything is well executed. The food was remarkable and cooked to perfection and the decor is incredibly tasteful. All in all a wonderful experience.

Wow! Not that I really Follow the whole Trendroid Celebuloid Star studded venues in NYC (I can always get in on any night, ahem...) BUT... The food here is something whacky! How do they offer such an amazing menu and afford Billionaires Row's sky high rents? It don't make sense! What does make sense is your bill at the end of a decadent meal! I work in the area and this is downright cheap (even the Halal Carts are pricey) come for lunch because dinner stacks up quickly... Speaking of quickly, after a few drinks we found ourselves in the depths of the restaurant in their Secret speakeasy (Remember the Celebs comment? Well...) Called Savage. It was Fierce! The bartender made certain I could only recall snippets of the night and Crowd (Bravo. Well played).. I plan on returning, hopefully to leave with more of a story (too many spots and fuzzy memories) than "I saw that guy from that show. Or lady from that song"... I shall keep my wits and update this review soon... Shhhh!!!

formatted_address: 442 Court St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Abilene Bar

reviews.text: One of my favorite hangout spots in the neighborhood. It's a decently priced bar with a great happy hour special. The fries here are amazing and the bartenders are all so personable and friendly. Everyone from families to twenty-somethings to older crowds hang out here. This is one of my favorite spots to hangout with friends or bring my laptop to get some work done on one of the comfy couches. I no longer live in the neighborhood but I have been back since-- that's how much I enjoy it!
Great bar with awesome food. It's not every day you find a place with great french fries OR great onion rings. This place has BOTH. Also highly recommend the Abilene Cubano.
Good service. Decent prices. I'd give it 5 stars if the burgers/sandwiches just came with fries instead of charging more on the side. They cost you nothing!
I love the food me and my daughter had a salad. She took the grilled chicken and I took a house salad. Great service and price was amazing. I definitely reccomend if you want a lunch or dinner.
Wonderful food server was nice a friendly! Will definitely come back whenever I'm in town!

formatted_address: 139 E 57th St Floor 8, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Incredible Hypnotist Hypnosis Services

reviews.text: Richard is amazing. Very professional and knowledgeable. He works intuitively to get to the bottom of your problem. He is a great listener and very comfortable to talk to. Hypnotherapy is subtle yet powerful.

formatted_address: 627 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Baby Bo's Cantina

reviews.text:
Stop everything and get their chicken quesadilla.
One of best quesadilla I ever had!
