The drinks were very good, margaritas.
Lovely ambience.
Staff is nice, can be better.

Same positives/problems as the reviewer below from a week ago. Cutely decorated restaurant, very polite and nice staff, but low quality food and a bland meal overall. Guacamole was genuinely the most bland guacamole I’ve had in my life. The meat in the steak burrito is almost not even steak.

I’d really give this all more of a pass if it had been a cheaper meal, but at $95 for two people, there should’ve been higher quality food at that price.

My friend and I visited here for a quick lunch a week ago I believe, and I was overall disappointed. 

Positives: The place itself is nice - I liked the moody lighting and atmosphere. The decor is fun, interesting, festive and appropriate for a Mexican restaurant. The wait staff we had was polite and efficient - she was running he entire restaurant and the bar so she was busy but she managed.  

They give you the free fresh salsa and chips which were actually on point. Salsa seemed fresh - no qualms with the chips and salsa. If you're looking for somewhere for drinks and chips only, this may be a good choice. 

Negatives:The issue I had was the food. I will be the first to say I try to be positive so trust me when I say everything was good except the food. The guacamole was unfortunately bland (pro tip: was made better by mixing the salsa from the chips with it!). I ordered the lunch special mini beef buritos which consistented of 2 small soggy tortillas with only some sort of meat and some sort of sauce/cheese rolled in them. The rice on the side was over cooked and dry. I took 2 bites of the soppy, wet, mush and couldn't finish it. I did not like the texture or the taste. (Do not recommend). My companion got the pork tacos with the pineapple salsa. The meat was very dry and wasn't well flavored. The salsa on top was good and the saving grace of the dish. She muscled down one of her tacos and didn't want to finish the rest. She also did not enjoy her meal. Twas gross. 

Maybe it was just an off day for them? But I unfortunately would not choose to return based off of my food experiences. There are too many good alternatives in the area to chance it again. 

Conclusion: Good place for drinks and chips. Would not recommend other food. Would not return. ☹️
Phenomenal food, very fresh .great staff very attentive, friendly and accommodating.  I would give more than 5 stars if I could.  Definitely a must see and stay to eat not just the margaritas.

Fantastic Mexican place in Murray Hill. Their brunch is incredible, I've had their brunch enchiladas & burrito 🌯 many times and love it. Their dinner quesadillas are incredibly solid as well and a pretty generous serving. Highly recommend this place!!

formatted_address: 1407 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: Persepolis

reviews.text: The food and service is good. The ambiance is nice as well. This is the third time I go to this restaurant and the staff is friendly. The only reason I give 4 stars and not 5 is that before even I finish my meal the waiter/busboy asked me if I need something else. My response not now and he immediately brought the check, as if telling me get out of here! The restaurant wasn't full or so.

Amazing amazing amazing.  I don't give 5 stars just like that.  I've been in New York for 3 weeks eating as much if a variety of foods as I could and Persepolis was hands down the best. We had 4 different tapas entrees dessert tea and wine.  The entire gamut was tops. Bottle of wine for under $40 and just great food and service. If you are into Iranian/ Persian foods and cultures don't miss it.

Although the restaurant is generally nice, it is an Americanized version of a Persian restaurant. So if you don’t know anything about Persian food, then you’ll probably like it. If you do know Persian food, you’ll know that it’s been modified. However, the food and service is is pretty good. For authentic food, I’ll go somewhere else.
Perfect place for a romantic dinner! Meat 🥩 is the best here! Also hummus and salad was delicious 😋
My first time and a very attentive, personable staff. Food was great.

formatted_address: 64 W 48th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: The Elgin

reviews.text: Love this bar! It is spacious and lively. This time of the year it’s not lacking the holiday decoration either, which is nice. Cocktails are really good and Barry made sure to prepare some pretty awesome ones for us. I also had French Onion Soup burger which was one of the best burgers I had in New York, especially in a bar.

Great food! There were 13 of us heading to a Broadway show hoping to find a place that could seat us as a group. We weren't going to be picky. The Elgin had two large tables in the front which were open so we gave it a chance. I'm glad we did. It was our best lunch of the four day trip. I got the French onion burger which was exceptional. Everyone was very pleased with their meals. The service was also very good.

Went here earlier in the week for a special luncheon with a women’s networking group. Fabulous place and people. The food was great. Service was on point. Owners were attentive and fun to speak with. 

Very accessible and inviting for the handicap.
Beautiful place in midtown away from the hustle and bustle and excellent selection of bourbon and whiskey! Great craft cocktails! A perfect place for happy hour.
Great beer selection and a huge venue. Still gets insanely crowded during the week because it's popular with the post-work happy hour crowd. One of the nicer Irish pub options on the block.

formatted_address: 254 W 31st St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Tír na Nóg

reviews.text: My wife were in the city and while on our way back to Penn station we saw, Tir na Nóg.  My wife said she had gone there before so we stopped in.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The food was good.  The atmosphere was nice and the little book seating was comfortable.  The desert was also good.

We met with friends at this place for dinner. my friend recommended this spot.  Well, it was very successful. The crew welcomed us with a smile and we felt fantastic. The food was just great. We had a great time and we will visit this place again. Recommended.

When here with a party of nine. Restaurant was very accommodating, kids menu shareable plates it was overall good experience.  I had the pork medallion meal which was delicious and the tuna nachos to start.  I would recommend both. This place is super convenient for anyone heading up Madison square garden for an event it is literally across the street.

A very big and authentic Irish pub restaurant with a big range of beers and very good menu. We liked the athmosphere and space. Stuff is helpful and friendly. Food is tasty. What else you can ask from an Irish establishment in the center of NYC! Good for big groups.

I came here on Friday through a recommendation from a co-worker. This place was really hopping.  It is a bit on the noisy side, but it is too be expected for this type of bar/restaurant....and it close to MSG.  Waitstaff is friendly and attentive and service is quick. I ordered the Bronzino and I must say the aroma that came off my plate was pure heaven and it was cooked beautifully. My Berry Good Thyme cocktail also hit the spot. I was also admiring the dishes that I saw on other tables that looked equally amazing. Oh....I will definitely be coming back. 😃

formatted_address: 26 Canal St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Little Canal

reviews.text: Great atmosphere - everyone is here to work, have group meetings or just chill and relax. There's 2.5 sections of the space - one fully indoors where you can order light bites & beverages, one outdoor garden where there are heat lamps, and another alcove space. Love it. Will totally new back.
Irregular layout coffee shop right outside the F train station. Walnut bar counter in a wide U shape, black board with menu, high ceiling. Healthy savory selections with solid coffee:)
Very relaxed and comfortable coffee bar with some soul comforting nibbles

What a prime location to have a business, as the view from the table is postcard worthy. This a cozy spot for a quick bite. The staff are friendly and the tuna sandwich I had was delicious. Ingredients on point! I'll definitely stop by again, when I'm in the neighborhood.

I have been to this cafe for more than 5  months. More specifically, more than 30 times. Today, I went to the cafe as normal. I said: may I have a latte for to go? The employee charged me $5 for the latte that made me a little bit confused, because the latte I ordered before was $4.5. After I paid and stood in the line waiting for my latte, I talked with the employee who charged me: can I ask you a question? Why the latte today is $5? She explained: I thought what you want is old latte that is $5. I replied:  no, I just want regular latte. She said: ok, I can refund you 5 cent. I accepted the 5 cent and continued waiting for my latte. Few minutes later, another employee in the coffee shop gave me the so called old coffee and said something with another employee meaning I took advantage of this old latte. I explained The reason I accepted this so called old latte is just because I do not want to waste food. They already made the old latte, I feel if I do not accept it, they might just throw it or have to remake for me. Old latte or regular latte, I do not care. What I care more is the attitude. Especially, this is the place that I frequently go to. If this is Starbucks, I will say nothing. For you, this is just coffee, is just money. For me, it’s connection with the place that I frequently go to. Very disappointed and sad! I finally went out of the cafe without taking the coffee. Never will go there for sure!

Ps: comments to the owner’s reply! 

Thank you for your replay and clarify. 

First: I found your personal phone number on google. As a registered company, all your information is public on Google. The reason I called your personal phone number instead of the number of the coffee shops is because I want to share my actual experience, as a loyal customer in the past, with the owner of the shop. 

Second, I wrote the review here is not because I want to slam your business. As a once loyal customer, I just felt very sad with my experience and It’s my freedom to share my experience. In addition, you said the review I wrote here slammed your business, but I would say your staff slammed my day. 

Third, you said I ran out of the cafe without taking the coffee! Yes! I did not take the coffee though I already paid it, but have you asked the staff why and can you explain here? 

Last, you said you refund the $5 for me that I rejected. At this moment or before I wrote the review here, I did not receive the money. 

At this moment. All good! Best of luck!

formatted_address: 700 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Bravest

reviews.text: Seems like a great place. The bartender was extremely cool and helpful. Good scene. I'll have to stop through again

I liked this place and will come back for sure, even though food took a while to arrive. The fried cauliflower was delicious but my rice bowl, not so much... i will come back to try others things though. The burgers my friends had looked great. Perhaps I chose the wrong thing on the menu. Friendly staff!
Great food, great selection of beer.  Tommy is awesome.  This is my new favorite lunch place
Great place great beer yep will be back for sure.
Great little bar, tasty burgers and the Bravest ale is a must try.

formatted_address: 54 Thompson St 3rd floor, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Thompson Square Studios

reviews.text: We threw a holiday party at the Thompson Square Studios. Best idea ever! Who wants to deal with the headache and clean-up of hosting at your own home? The staff is incredible and the space itself is gorgeous. Not to mention you’ve got access to their kitchen and stemware – a huge plus. Several guests commented on how much they liked the venue and are now even thinking of hosting their own events there. I also wanted to give a shout out to both Chelsea and John who were a pleasure to work with and made the party run very smoothly. Highly recommend!!! A+
Gorgeous space and Chelsea and her team are fantastic to work with!
Beautiful space with a great vibe- the concierges are amazing.
Amazing ambiance, friendly staff and great space for professionals
I am coming for you

formatted_address: 1063 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Rosa Mexicano

reviews.text: Freshly made nachos, guacamole & tortilla bread. Fast service and delicious food. The bottomless Sat & Sun drinks are a nice plus too

The place is very cozy .
It is quite authentic, they bring you complementary chips and salsa.
The guacamole is done live in front of you in a large bowl .
The taste is very good .
Quality Vs price ratio is very good !
Honestly , it is one of the best restaurants around the area.
I ordered shrimps with rice . 
The place portion was exactly what I needed and the taste reminded me of Mexico.
The staff were super nice (well not all of them , the lady making the bread was so mean to me for no reason , but I understand working next to the oven is not a pleasant thing and perhaps she was tired ) . The waiters were always smiling and welcoming . They kept checking on us but not in the creepy way.
Conclusion: very nice experience, will def be back .

Had lunch here before a performance at Lincoln Center on Wednesday. We had the PBLTA and the Mexican Club sandwiches. Both were delightful- full of flavor. We also had guacamole made at the table, which was spot on to our preference. The restaurant has high ceiling and large windows, and was extremely clean. Everyone from the hostess to the manager to the servers were all professional and pleasant, which only enhances our experience. They were even happy to let us in to wait (and use the restroom) because we arrive 10 minutes before opening. I WILL be returning, as it was such a great experience from the food to the service to the ambivalence.Thank you to everyone at Rosa Mexicano! Don’t forget to check out the wall of divers when you come in!

Great food! Service was alright, a few times had to watch server go by while we tried to wave him down. But other than that it was a great experience similar to my precious experiences in Washington DC.
The place offers a nice range of fresh food. I enjoyed dining here. Employees are always very kind, pricing is affordable and the place is always clean.

formatted_address: 638 Grand St # A, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Blue Angel Wines

reviews.text: Great selection and friendly staff.
Lol go down the street two blocks and pay way less. They wanted 35$$ for a box of wine and I got it for $21 at Richie’s
The best spot in Williamsburg to find great wines and spirits at prices that that everyone can afford -- hundreds of amazing choices at under $20.
Good selection. Friendly, helpful staff. Great prices.
Very helpful and friendly manager

formatted_address: 85 Broadway, Brooklyn, NY 11249, USA
name: Diner

reviews.text: I love this restaurant very much. It has a happy air. The food is great. the service is efficient and the stuff is courteous. The price is honest. extremely recommend.

Amazing service, friendly staff and most of all - amazing food. This place is so passionate about their food - do yourself a favor and read the cookbook on the front bar if you’re having a drink while waiting for a table. It’s beautifully written and got me so excited for the delicious meal to come.

It's not the same restorant anymore. Menu and food are so different! 
I hate to say it , it's not on the same level!   Some dishes are weird and some are overpriced, especially steak! 
For $80 I was expecting to get something outstanding, but it was an average or maybe even below average!
Used to be our favorite our favorite place, but now...
I give it 4 stars because of my good old good  memories! 
New things are not always good!
Guys,  if it works, why fix it.
I wish you well!
Please do something about it, I  don't want you  to fail!
Food was really good. Unfortunately there's only a limited amount of items on the menu.

This was the most disappointing dinner I’ve ever had. I went out to celebrate my birthday and this was my first stop. First off there are no menus. The waiter sits down next to you and writes out the menu on the paper on the table. I’m not sure if it’s some sort of gimmick but it’s just extremely inconvenient considering he writes them in an abbreviated form so when he walked off for us to make our decision we couldn’t make out what most of the things were. Our appetizer was fairly good and we enjoyed that (not sure if we were just that hungry). Then came the mains... THE MOST TASTELESS chicken in broth with a few pieces off cabbage leafs and a skinny carrot and for my husband a BLAND AND UNSEASONED pork chop with an egg on top. My chicken was over cooked in my opinion and I still can’t fathom how they got it so bland. As for the pork chop dish the egg on top and the kale it was sitting one were the only things that offered any flavor. To top off to pork chop basically 60% of it was fat and had to be sent back. That meal was $38. An absolute robbery in my opinion. To sum up my experience I’m going to do my best to tell friends not to waste their money here.

formatted_address: 2315 Broadway, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: 5 Napkin Burger

reviews.text: I sat at the bar for happy hour on a Monday night, it wasn’t crowded. The bartender was nice but dry. The drinks she made were very good. I ordered a slider and wings off the happy hour menu and they were really were better than I expected. The only reason I didn’t give 5 stars is because the glasses at the bar or at least the ones I received, weren’t thoroughly cleaned. I could feel texture outside the glass. It was disgusting. Which really reflects on the bartender not the establishment as a whole.

Lamb burger was not flavorful or well seasoned, nor was it cooked the way I ordered it. French fries soft and warm. Long Island Iced Tea was nice and strong. Service was good from the waiter, but when we called ahead for reservations we were told it would be 2hrs from then. When we arrived 15min later because we were already in the area, we were seated immediately. 🤦🏾‍♀️ Family friendly on a SAT night, lots of kids. Good for eating near movie theater, but would not recommend.

We were a big company and sat on a very big table at the back. It wasn't a busy time so the staff were able to give us all the attention we needed. We tried different Burgers and every single one of them was so delicious and full of flavors. One of our friends couldn't resist and ordered another burger as he finished the first. The cocktails are tasty as well and so are the appetisers. Very positive experience and we'll definitely come back!
Pretty good, won't call it the best burger I've ever had. Burgers are filling.

They have gluten free options which is great. Although not gluten intolerant I avoid as much consumption as possible. Ask about all possible gluten contamination though because the Turkey and veggie burgers contain bread crumbs. Also they coat the fries with something. I had to specifically request it to be gluten free. The food was great though and server was very knowledgeable

formatted_address: 157 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Carroll Place

reviews.text: Long wait time, and because it was crowded, we didn’t get proper service, from waiting 20 min at the bar for seats to getting the wrong order. They gave us a table after a friend decided to leave and the orders were replaced with the correct order. Food was good but overall experience could have been better for a first timer.

If it could go wrong, it did. One person in our party had both her wine choice and her dessert choice "sold out." The lamb burger that she ordered well done arrived rare, and it took 30 minutes to get it replaced. The rest of our party had finished eating when the now hockey-puck-like burger arrived. The ravioli special was so small, there had to be some meal-sharing going on so that person had enough to eat. They should have been told it was a starter portion, even though it was presented as an entree on the menu. The two vegetables on my roasted chicken dinner plate tasted like they had been cooked in a pan where something had been burned. They didn't look burned but they both tasted that way. The service was scattered, at best. When we were told they were out of the white wine that was ordered, they offered to substitute a different, but similar wine. Then the waitress showed up with a red wine. I would not call subbing in a red for a white as a "similar" varietal. Then she acted surprised when we said no to the red. Then we had several different staff members check on us and never saw our waitress again. And sadly, despite all the issues, no one made an attempt to do anything about it. Disappointing, at best.

I come here often  - at least once a month, if not more.  Besides Malt House, around the corner, this place has pretty good and consistent happy hour specials. Pizza for 7.5, sliders, and good pints of beer for $5. Can't go wrong. If you want a proper meal, they have some solid selections. I'm a big fan of their rosemary chicken wings. And when they have mussels, it certainly has been tasty. Bartendars are generally friendly, if not interactive. I appreciate this place. For NYC, they have good prices, for a wonderful decor, and the crowd is always a nice mix.

We did the family style brunch.  They were accomodating enough to covere us on vegan diets and the drinks came in very quickly.  The peach drink wasn't very good, so most of us stuck to the mimosa.  They did let us take leftover food home, which was a nice surprise.

The Tartufo pizza and red wine—a great combo on the brunch menu. Loved the ambience of the place  and mood. For a Wednesday night, it wasn’t packed out, but still was alive and had people there. Nice place.

formatted_address: 37 W 37th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Salsamania Saturdays

formatted_address: 15 W 46th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Emporium Brasil

reviews.text: We arrived at this restaurant for dinner. we heard about this place from many people.  Well, it was very nice. The staff members were extremely nice and we had a great feeling. The meal was fresh and delicious. We enjoyed every moment and we shall definitely come back again. Recommended.

Top notch food and good service at good prices. Very nice place for a dinner in New York, close to the Broadway shows and 5th Ave shopping. Lots of variety on the menu, steaks, fish and a lot of other interesting dishes. The soup of the day was terrific (white bean and chicken the day we were there) and the desserts were terrific. This makes my "go to" list for New York visits.
Very clean and accessible restaurant. They offer generous portions and for fair rates. I liked the food a lot and the waiters were super personal and informative. Recommended.

I celebrated my PhD this evening in this great place. Well we enjoyed a terrific evening and the restaurant was unquestionably the reason for that strong event. The team  participated in a pleasant style, the cooking was delicious and my friends were so  delighted. We shall definitely visit again for more celebrations. thanks very much.
Your regular Brazilian Restaurant in Manhattan. The food is good (8/10), the service is great (10/10), but the price... It's too expensive for simple food! Hence why overall I'm giving 3/5 stars.

formatted_address: 109 E 56th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: American Cut Steakhouse Midtown

reviews.text: Wow just wow we had literally a perfect  meal everything was perfect. The courses came out in such good timing that didn't notice how long we were there for that evening

Great food! Nice big restaurent! We had the new york week deal. 3 courses for 42$ 
It’s the beat opportunity during this week to try those $$$$ sign restaurants.
Excellent service and steak. Also had the Mac n Cheese app. Probably the best Mac n Cheese I've ever had. Highly recommend.

I came during restaurant week and my review is based on that experience. I don't frequent steakhouses and the prices on the regular menu are more than I typically spend on dinner but after the food I had, I could be convinced to come back at full price! 

The dining area is very classy and has an upscale vibe. The lighting is soft and servers are all dressed well. Again, I don't do fine dining at steakhouses often so maybe this is typical but I felt fancy  Service was very attentive and on point. 

For appetizers, I had the braised BLT bite and my friends had the soup. The texture and flavor of the pork belly in the BLT bite was incredible. I would get an entree sized serving of this if it was offered. My friends both enjoyed the soup very much as well. 

For my entree, I went with the salmon. It was cooked perfectly and was my favorite entree of the night. One friend had the chicken and that was also cooked really well and stayed nice and juicy. His portion size was generous. My other friend got the petite filet, which was good, but definitely petite and was a tad overcooked. She asked for medium and it was definitely well-seared and closer to well. Still delicious, but she also preferred my salmon. 

They got the potato skins for sides and I got the haricot vert. I didn't try the potatoes but loved the green beans. 

Two of us got the creme brûlée for dessert and the other got the sorbet. I ate every piece of my brûlée including the mint garnish!
This is an amazing restaurant. The Tomahawk is one dish I would always recommend. Great service, great food, great place to visit and dine at.

formatted_address: 110 E 11th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Amsterdam Billiards Club

reviews.text: A good place to go for some billiards with some friends. Seems like they have events too. I was a bit surprised by the older crowd but I suspect it had to do with what was going on. Seemed like a lot of regulars there. Equipment is in decent shape too. Very big place. Biggest con is price. Pool was very expensive as were the drinks—even by manhattan standards.

This place is really nice on the inside, the staff is very friendly, and the prices are reasonable for games. Drinks are what you'd expect for Manhattan, but not completely unreasonable. I would definitely recommend this place to my friends and family.

A happy discovery when after a late night supper, we were still too wired to home and just wanted a place to relax and hang out. Well-maintained and with great service even at 2 in the morning. For serious and casual pool players alike.

Amsterdam Billiards is a great place to grab a drink or some food and shoot a game of pool. Tons of space, clean, nice tables, as well as good food and drinks at decent prices. Friendly staff too. If you're looking for a place to have a game or three and hang out with friends this is a great choice.

I think I like playing pool here the most. I also like East Side Billiards but I have to admit that the tables are better at Amsterdam billiards. The cloth is smoother and the overall quality of the game is better if you care about your shots.

formatted_address: 255 Vesey St, New York, NY 10281, USA
name: Blue Smoke

reviews.text:
AMAZING service. My friend and I were in town last weekend and found this spot on Yelp. We were initially skeptical because the hostess wasn't super nice to us.. but we ended up sitting at the bar and everyone working was incredible.

They brought us complementary small bites as an appetizer and WONDERFUL cake for dessert. The food was also very good. I got the salmon, and my friend got the swordfish. The menu was also small which I appreciated. Reasonable drink prices too.

We arrive to this restaurant without reservation, it was crowded because of the happy hour they have, good prices, but it was just at the bar so we got a table without problem! Friendly staff, the best, the manager, he came to our table to ask how was everything and he was nice to give us an explanation on the ribs we had and the different spices they put in, he even brought a sample of each so we could smell them! Well done, good service! 
The food was good too, we had the deviled eggs and the sampler ribs with a side of fries, they were all awesome!! A glass of red wine, a couple of local beers, we definitely had a good time! We did not get any dessert though, I was expecting to see the NY cheesecake but they did not have it.
All in all, good place to go, next time we’ll try first the happy hour and then the dinner. ;)

We went for dinner, and loved this place! The restaurant is part of Union Square Hospitality Group owned by Denny Meyer. As the other restaurants of the group, Blue Smoke offers great quality and an attentive service. Waiters give you all the time that you need to enjoy your dinner, and the environment is relaxed and not too loud. We will be back soon! This is now one of our favorite BBQ restaurants.

We were in the area and felt like Barbecue food and found this place. The food is amazing; must try the brisket!! We took the platter that allows you to tastes all their meats and the reordered the brisket and 1 sausage. (Picture below) The staff is super friendly, the music & ambiance are perfect, we really loved this restaurant! I would totally recommend!

Not only was every morsel of food delicious but the staff was wonderful. Our server Nina C was AWESOME!! Terrific atmosphere. This will definitely be a regular spot for me. Thanks again Nina for making our birthday celebration so special.

formatted_address: 19 W 44th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Kellari Taverna

reviews.text: Really nice Greek Restaurant. I have been here several times in the past since I used to work in the area. Food and service is good. A bit costly though, so I suggest ordering from the Prix Fixe Menu. I had one of the cocktails and I must say at $24 it really packs a punch. Lol. Definitely a place to check out.

Kind of disappointed. 
Everything was just fair except the bread was delicious.  The olives were good as was the Greek salad.

We ordered 2 different fish dishes. They both lacked flavor.  Nothing in the flavor profile wowed us at all.
Not used to having a mediocre meal in NY. And it wasn't cheap.

The restaurant decor in the main dining room was nice as was the bar. However they asked us if we wanted to sit in the dining room in the back saying it would be a lot quieter. We agreed to be seated back there but the setting wasn’t nearly as nice. I noticed they seated the older crowd back there. Oh well we will sit at the bar the next time. The fish display near the bar was gorgeous. The pre and post theatre menu is quite a good deal for this restaurant even though the options are more limited.  The food presentation was bland but the food was quite good. The portions were small but actually perfect for what we wanted.

Such hospitality. We came as they just were closing but they still welcomed us at the bar. Was given several tastings of ozo and decided on one. The ambiance was wonderful and the owner himself came to chat with us. Definitely recommend this place just for the staff and hospitality.

Really great place to grab lunch or dinner.  Took clients there for lunch. Went back for dinner.  Great Greek food. Lively atmosphere However  I would recommend that you have reservation. The place is very busy, you have to wait. You can sit at the bar and have a quick bite for dinner if you so choose. The grill fresh sardines you must have with fresh olives and great bread.

formatted_address: 30 E 33rd St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Sushi Sen-Nin

reviews.text: This place is certainly one of the best restaurants in the region. Always when I come there I am exceedingly happy. They maintain their very high  level service and the highest level of dishes  they give. You can never go wrong with this restaurant. Warmly  recommended.
Pretty good sushi with a nice variety and some interesting options. Good date spot.
The place offers a vast range of delicious food. I enjoy dining here. Employees are always very nice, prices are fair and the spot is always clean.

Great attention, good environment. But I would love for more information in the Menu, I mean for someone who knows everything about Japanese food maybe is not important, but I would like for a proper description of the dishes. The is food delicious. But I order according to what I know, and because I didn't had a proper description of the food. The prices are high. That's why my 3 stars: lack of description of the dishes and the prices.
Extremely fresh ingredients, the deluxe sushi set was just amazing. Rolls that we had were top quality too!

formatted_address: 283 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Tivoli Cafe

reviews.text:
It has a nice atmosphere and very popular with the neighborhood residents.  Waiters seem to know quite a few when I was sitting for 3 hours eating.  The spinach salad with chicken was the best I've had in a while. I've been having an urge for the salad for 2 weeks, so will have to break down soon.
Definitely going back for the salad and try something new.

We were treated with such a great amount of respect and care. They made our entire group feel welcomed and important. I brought some out of town family here, because Rolfs was packed and had a huge line, I  so glad we chose to skip the madness and chaos at Rolfs and come here instead. We were not disappointed.
This dinner is great. Very spacious. Escape from the crowded busy city. Friendly staff, and good dinner food. Good ambiance. Recommended

Probably the best restaurant I've tried in Manhattan... Great food and good portion for a decent price, the place was clean and the service would deserve even more than five stars! They understood the importance of treating their customers well! Would definitely come back!
Delicious turkey burger with mushrooms and Swiss cheese - my favorite diner meal done right! With perfectly crispy fries! Cute, comfortable restaurant, attentive service.

formatted_address: 1016 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Casa de Montecristo

reviews.text: Visited today. Friendly staff. 1st time cigar buyer. Had an idea of what I wanted through pictures. They didn't have them but they were happy to show me what they have similar and what is recommended. Needs better ventilation so don't go in if you have asthma or something.. other than that top notch place..

Great vibe in this place. Dark colored walls and furniture definitely make it feel like a cigar lounge. The leather couches were extremely comfortable and the selection of cigars was large. The pricing was a little high, but that's to expect in Manhattan. BYOB if you purchase $20 or more worth of cigars which works out great since there is a liquor store right next door. $10 cutting fee for cigars not purchased there. Three cons were that the ventilation system could have been a little stronger, the smoke floated in the room for the whole two hours I was there. The TV wasn't the best quality, something was wrong where the picture was blurred and doubled, made it hard to watch the game. And lastly, there was no coffee, only espresso.
Nice. Went for a ugly sweater Christmas party. Great people, vibe and just great. The host, Richie did a great job.

Better known as the Cigar Inn as it was when founded, this place has not transitioned well under corporate ownership. The air handling is atrocious and leaves the air dangerously smoky. Some staff have equally bad attitudes. This place is a great idea executed badly. They have allowed the attire and atmosphere to degrade to a level below that of cigar culture. All that being said, this is a popular place that continues to draw people. It is a good value, as it is a BYOB place. You can bring your own food. At one time, you could bring your own music. So it has its upside, but the downside will take a toll on the draw over time.
Well stocked cigar humidor. BYOB with $20 cigar purchase per person. Very friendly and helpful staff.

formatted_address: 330 W 56th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: InviteMe NYC

formatted_address: 596 Grand St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: The Starlight

reviews.text: Bartender was super welcoming.  Ambiance was perfect.   No pretension, just a good time.  I loved the TV aquarium and parogis... and no, I didn't eat the aquarium!
Good bar food, nice atmosphere.

Super retro bar. 
Perfect 80's atmosphere.
Great bar food. Skee ball.
This my go to bar for a good drink and chat with the bartenders. Always friendly and a great vibe. Tell Danny you like bikes and ur sure to get a smile.
Bartender was nice, but empanadas I ordered came like 30 minutes later after I asked. The bartender saved the night though with some shots and good atmosphere.

formatted_address: 11 E 12th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Strip House Speakeasy

reviews.text:
Always a staple in my year, you can always guarantee the food is excellent and service witty but elegant. 

I recently visited the Speakeasy with a few friends. As usual the food was superb, steak perfect. Sides could have been hotter and not such a wait in between courses would be the only two oppurtunities. Service was awesome, she lit up the room and made you feel at home.

Also, I would have loved for this to be a bit more "speakeasy" like, it's more of a little restaurant downstairs from the actual restaurant. I liked the experience but would probably go back the "real" thing rather then the basement.
The place offers an awesome range of delicious food. I loved eating here. Staff members are always friendly, pricing is affordable and the place is always neat.

While the food was good, it could have been better for the price. However my rating is mostly based off of my experience, which can really outshine the food quality. I came very close to walking out and finding something elsewhere.

Poorly named "Speakeasy" is in a basement area of Strip House. The only thing remotely like a "speakeasy" is the curtain at the entrance, and pictures of women on the walls.

Since our reservation was in Speakeasy, I went down to check in - we were about 20 minutes early so I wasn't expecting to get a seat immediately.

I waited a few minutes near the bar/entrance where I noticed a family of 4 crowded & standing around a table. It looked like no one had approached them and they'd been waiting a while. Since no one seemed to be around to seat us (no host stand, no one paying attention to waiting patrons) I figured I'd go upstairs and ask the host there is thats where we needed to check in.

There were 2 women there, and was greeted upon entry which was nice. I let the host know that we were early but wanted to check if our table was available. She started scrolling to search, and I let her know the reservation was at Speakeasy. She stopped what she was looking for and told me I'd have to check in downstairs and pointed at where it was. I told her that there wasn't a host or anything there to seat us. Someone else came up, while there was still another host there, asking about changing to a booth and the host I was talking to started talking to her instead and ignoring that I was still standing there waiting for assistance. The other person could have easily handled it while who I was speaking with assisted me. Instead she chose to interject into another issue.

Frustrated, I went back downstairs to take a better look in case I missed something. Still, no one. That same family standing around the table unsure of what to do and obviously still hadn't been approached.

So I went BACK upstairs and told her, still standing there, that there wasn't a host, we have a reservation for 5. So she stomps around me and leads me downstairs, where she grabs a tablet off of the bar, tells the family who had been waiting that they could sit, and waved at me to follow her.

After seating us she stated she was the GM. I was going to leave but the server was nice and veru prompt which was appreciated. Expected much better service from the GM for a $500 meal. She never came back by to see how anything was going.
Paid so much and the service was so rushed!! Really ruined the experience and the good food. Don't take away my food and drinks before I'm done -- SO RUDE. Bad service.

One of my favorite upscale steak and seafood restaurants. I've been here for birthdays and celebrations and the excellent service remains consist. The food simply melts in your mouth! The scenery gives a romantic setting for couples. The wine selection is very large with various types!

formatted_address: 143 Christopher St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Gaetana's

reviews.text: Excellent traditional Italian in old NY setting. All fresh ingredients, superb homemade cheesecake. Attentive and friendly service. Bar area with tv if desired. Recommend for a homemade Italian meal in a fun atmosphere
Nummy!! Such delicious food. Good service AND they held onto our bag that we accidentally left at our table.
A bit of a dive, good option if some nearby italian spot doesn't have space.
Incredible food, retro atmosphere and genuine care by the chef, owner and servers

Very warm ambiance, old school decor, and hospitality. Great atmosphere all around you, where one can admire framed Sinatra records (Nancy too), plus Bobby Darin, Connie Francis, and more classic crooner memorabilia from their golden age. Art prints, too, and lots of fun decorative touches to catch the eye. Look down at the old black and white mosaic tiled floor, too. Beautiful old piano that I've seen played by professionals who are moonlighting as neighborhood people passing through.  Tasty pasta dishes with classic red and white sauces, and specials like seasonal pumpkin ravioli. Try their perfect pizza margherita. Share it with someone, or you will easily eat the whole thing before you know it. (Marronn'!)  Its marinara sauce is balanced btwn sweet and salty, with well-made mozzarella, and the perfect amount of fresh basil and extra quality olive oil. 
Really, this place oozes Southern Italian-American charm, mixed with local color, flavor, and cool. You can easily find yourself striking up a conversation with the local siting next to you at the bar, and soon you're having fun with locals and friendly staff alike. Everyone is welcomed and feels comfortable right away. Don't miss a chance for a glass of vino, plate of pasta, and to treat yourself to a feast for your senses!

formatted_address: 44 E 28th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Tarallucci e Vino NoMad

reviews.text: Amazing experience! Food is so flavorful and delicious, especially loved the grilled octopus appetizer. The service is outstanding, true professionals work here and ensure that all guests enjoy their time here. Thank you!

This is 100% the BEST place to ever sit at the bar and eat and drink. Angela and Aracely gave us the best service In all of Manhattan. The food is so fresh and delicious and the wine 🍷 list was great. I legit had the best time ever and I will definitely be back!

I visit this superb place often because I love the good mood that is exist in this restaurant. The personel is exceptionally helpful and professional. The service is extremely quick. Also, the food you eat is good. I have been there many times and I was always delighted. The payment is decent. I highly recommend this place to to everybody.

This is such a amazing restaurant. I would like to start off with the manager first walking in. She made me feel welcome. The Batista was very informative and I was fully catered to my wants. Look forward to visiting again.
Dined here with friends at work. Really good Italian food!

formatted_address: 236 W 52nd St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Victor's Cafe

reviews.text:
The food was delicious!!
We made a reservation on Friday afternoon for the same night, when we arrived we had a 5 minute wait for our table of two. Once seated  in the packed restaurant our order was taken and the food followed almost immediately! We took our time to enjoy each course and the waiter paid attention to us the whole time!!! Definitely a great place to attend before a show!!

Reason for going: ♀️/♀️ Date Night

Pros:
Great food/portions with reasonable prices
Good music
Pretty atmosphere/decor for Instagram
Attentive/respectful staff

Minor concerns:
Little to no moving space(they pack everyone pretty tight)
Bathrooms are downstairs which may be a concern to those with mobility issues.
Little loud inside

Overall: 
I would go again. 
Great place for a date, but wouldn't recommend as first date because it is difficult to have intimate/quiet conversation over the music. 
I highly recommend a reservation as the place was extremely packed on a Wednesday night.

📷 @datasianjan
Just fantastic experience! We are a bilingual family with in-laws that don't speak English. Victor's Cafe set up a lovely table for us. The food is updated Cuban Cuisine. Well worth the price!
The food and drinks were delicious. Service was great. Decor and music was good. Was hoping to hear the live band but overall a very good time. I will definitely return.
Sergio was great. Very knowledgeable of the menu his recommendation were good. Accommodated us well with no reservations and on Christmas day..

formatted_address: 569 Coney Island Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11218, USA
name: Red Mist Hookah Lounge & Cafe

reviews.text: Its a well established lounge, affordable hookah prices and the server was really polite. Came earlier with few friends and she explained to us how each flavor tasted. Would highly recommend this place and come again!
The best hookah ever.if you live in New York I highly recommend to go here. Really chill place. Great service

This place has a nice vibe. You can relax and play games with your friends while enjoying a shisha and some drinks. The shisha is well prepared and the service is good as well. However the toilette is terrible.
I loved their mind ice lemonade. Hookah was really good but burned really fast. Over all it was not bad at all and I will be go there again if in town

This place is ok. Everything is super cheap, so not the best quality. 
Definitely not clean because they had rats running around. 
They offer few games like cards, dominos and others but when we asked for the dominos 9 pieces were missing so we couldn't play.

formatted_address: 47 E 29th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Tavern 29

reviews.text: TAVERN29 is amazing!! The food,  drinks, ambiance  and especially the service were all excellent !  I had my daughter's surprise bridal shower at Tavern29 and it was perfect.  I met with Cara initially to see the Tavern and tell her my ideas for the shower.  She made some really great suggestions, gave us food recommendations, etc. On the day of the event, Ray met us early, accommodating our needs and also making great suggestions.   My daughter and all my guests were very impressed and I highly recommend Tavern29!  Great food, great drinks and especially great service! Thank you TAVERN29!!!
Great atmosphere for groups and couples. Excellent service. Utilize Open Table or call ahead for reservations. First floor is most desirable seating at extended bar as pictured. Great food.

Spent a week in New York with my best friend. Out of all the places we had the opportunity to try Tavern 29 was our favorite! Ivy really helped us two small town girls feel super welcome in this huge place. The food is yummy and drinks are fantastic! I would recommend Tavern 29 to anyone visiting NYC. Ask for Ivy!!

Beautiful spot! I went there for a birthday event and  sat upstairs on the rooftop. Great music, atmosphere and people. The foood was amazing!!! I would definitely go back.

Prices are good for the amount of food you get.

The food and drinks (National Margherita Day!) were superb. Our bartender Stephanie was the most engaging I've met. Very intelligent and friendly we hot it off at once. The Hangover Pizza was fantastic. The Avacado Toast had an awesome sourdough and plenty of fresh guacamole. Highly recommend Tavern29 if you're in the area. Ray's Margheritas were the bomb!

formatted_address: 842 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10017, USA
name: Keats Bar

reviews.text: Had a great time here. Awesome happy hour!

A romping good time! Friendly and energetic.stsff in this unassuming UN adjacent watering hole. Also happens to have rather excellent karaoke.  Nothing fancy here just good times, drinks and solid bar food. Great little spot.
Great local bar. We watched the Superbowl there. The patrons were very friendly and they make great drinks.
Great drinks . Host Shawn was great and this one singer Jenn I think her name was amazing
Best outing spot for those leaving the offices early or late evening and want to take a quick one before commuting. Food and drinks are fabulous here. Near to the UN HQ and other missions.

formatted_address: 99 Hudson St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Tamarind Tribeca

reviews.text:
Delicious Indian food reinvented in a modern way. Spice level is perfect and the curries are rich in texture and flavor. 
The ambience is very relaxing and hospitality is amazing. I’d definitely go back if I visit New York again.

We had lunch here for restaurant week. Overall, the food was fantastic. We had one small glitch - there was a piece of plastic in my rice which I discovered halfway through they meal; they offered to replace it, but overall it was a gstill a very good experience. The food was perfectly seasoned and the meats were tender. Dessert was exquisite. Drink menu was expansive as well. If there's anything I would change is that I would want the service to be a bit more personal - don't get me wrong, the service was very good...something you'd expect at a fine dining restaurant; but to me, ethnic restaurants should offer a bit more personal experience. In a nutshell, I highly recommend this restaurant and will absolutely visit again.

It was the first time we went to Tamarind last night for celebrating birthday. We chose veg options of food and the food was drool worthy.  Ambience and service were top notch. Price is a bit on the higher side, but definitely worth for special occasions.We had a memorable evening in Tamarind!

The food here is spectacular! I went with a few friends and we were very happy with the service, ambiance and food. We tried a variety of dishes here and all were really nice! The waiters are very good with recommendations!

So amazing!! A modern Indian restaurant that maintains dishes and tastes of true Indian food. They plate everything beautifully, every dish tastes so good. The cauliflower special is flawless, and the naan bread is amazing. The wait staff is also fantastic, so polite, kind, and well trained. Highly recommend!

formatted_address: 2014 Broadway Between 68th and 69th Streets, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Sapphire Cuisines of India

reviews.text: I had a wonderful  in this place. We enjoyed the great vibes and the meals. The waiters are super amiable. I’m glad we finally managed to visit this place.

Great tasting food, phenomenal staff, good prices: what else could you ask for?!

My wife and I went here with our son and his girlfriend prior to a NY Philharmonic concert, and were absolutely satisfied with the quality and quantity of the food!  I got the Sapphire Mixed Grill (chicken, lamb, salmon, tandoori chicken).  The kabob cooked chicken was incredibly juicy, the salmon was pretty good too.  The lamb was a little dry, but I was ready for that as lamb tends to be dry with it's done this way.  Tandoori chicken piece was very tasty,  ut a little small.  I could have used another piece it was so good!

My wife tried the shrimp shaag and loved it!  Our son and his girlfriend had more traditional items: she the chicken tandoori, and he.... I cant remember!  But I do know that by the end of the meal (during which there was very little talking as everyone was eating!) there was nothing left on anyone's plate!

So go, have dinner, lunch, whatever!  And if you drink beer, have a Taj Mahal.  I know, it's all kinda cliche, but its GOOOOOD!!!!!!
Fantastic service but food quality seems to have come down over the years. It's still good Indian food but it used to be excellent Indian food.
Food was great. Appropriately spicy without being too much. Everything we ate was delicious. The service was meticulous. Well priced and absolutely worth a visit.
This is a delightful place to relax and enjoy a wonderfully prepared Indian meal. The food is excellent, the service is excellent and the decor is lovely.

formatted_address: 301 Church St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Añejo Tribeca

reviews.text:
Environment: The whole environment is great! A good place for chill out, night date or friends hang out! 
Now in holiday season it has Christmas decor, so pretty!

Happy Hour: If you seat on the bar table, you can enjoy the happy hour. But happy hour is not for regular table, which is a little bit disappointed...

Food: The food tastes awesome! I love the crispy fish tacos. The fish is so crispy and sauce is also great!
Felt like the guacamole and salsa combo, which is $22 or $23, is not really worth the price. Maybe next time will order guaca only.

Service: the service I may only rate as 3 out of 5, just as average...nothing special, no surprise.

We did the all you can eat/drunk brunch deal. Pricy at $49 but you get a tremendous amount, both quantity and quality! The drinks were delicious (sampled a big, well made bloody, margaritas and rose sangria) and they're attentive staff never let us go dry. The food just kept coming until I thought I couldn't fit any more, but it was so delicious I couldn't help myself. Truly this was a great brunch and we will be back!
Wonderful experience already planning next trip back. Food was amazing 👌 the service was phenomenal almost like the waiter never left. 10 out of 10 would do it again.

This place has delicious food, very friendly staff, and a nice ambiance. I had guacamole and fish tacos, both definitely worth a try. Two reasons for only 4 stars: it was very loud even before a large group came in, and they took our guacamole to the wrong table initially (which had nobody there yet) and so we didn’t get it until our entrees came out and I asked about the guacamole. Otherwise all around a nice experience. Would return.

Anejo Tribeca was a good experience. The staff is really welcoming, nice and accommodating and the manager himself is very hands on and communicates with the customers throughout their dining experience. He popped in while my group was waiting for the remainder of the group to come in, again while we were brunching and then at the end. He was really kind and also accommodating. The food was good but the french toast was the best. I liked my brunch experience and would probably go back!

formatted_address: 154 Central Park S, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Southgate

reviews.text: I booked this place when my family in law were in town on Seated. First, I booked for brunch. When we arrived, the staff said they didn't have brunch. Second, we were the only people in the restaurant during the whole 2 hours we were there. The menu is small and not unique at all - actually quite bland and boring. The food was not very good for the price. Some people ordered the salad, others pasta, some the fish, and I ordered the burger. No one was very happy with their meal other than those who ordered the fish. I will not be returning here or recommending the restaurant to others. The hotel is very nice though!
A gem inside the swanky Essex House Hotel .A great all American Bar and restaurant with wonderful views of Central Park. Plus awesome cuisine made all on premises.

Really enjoyed this convenient place in the Essex House. It’s an excellent place to relax with a drink and have some of their fresh bar snacks, especially their bottomless mixed nut blend or filet sliders. While the menu is limited, the atmosphere opens up an entire space to refresh after a long day of touring. 

Favorite servers had to be Melvin and Yasser, both ready to take care of anything you need while still keeping up a chill lounge environment.

Walked in and was seated right away. Hostess didn't give us menus and walked back to her station. It happened so fast that I thought she was going back to get menus. When I looked back it looked like she was on her phone at her station. No waiters or waitresses walked by and took our order or even for us to flag down. We left after waiting for 5 minutes.

Could have been an off night, but I wasn't impressed.
Excellent service. Freshly made cocktails and iced tea

formatted_address: Four World Trade Center, 101 Liberty St floor 3, New York, NY 10007, USA
name: Eataly NYC Downtown

reviews.text:
Went here for a quick snack while visiting New York. Very interesting place to walk round with a huge selection of produce all with an Italian theme. Large selection of eating options. We had oysters, jumbo shrimp and pasta. All good.
So why 3 stars? Well we had pizza as well which was rubbish. Seemed to me that they previously had a great product but cost reduced it (cost not retail side) and lost the quality during that transition. Base was dry and hard. Topping so thin you could almost see the dry bread through it.

We had a long wait for our food, starters and mains, including drinks to be honest, overall service was a bit slow that’s evening but our waiter really made up for this and that brought the experience back up. The food was great, all well cooked and full of flavour, the wine was fantastic and the atmosphere was lively. The longer wait for all our dishes was a shame but overall was a good experience with good food and finished with good service as our waiter did acknowledge that we waited longer than we should have. 

This spot is recommended though - food and wine were great and we had a lovely waiter!

Very interesting and fun place to get some dinner and also to walk around! The pizza and pasta restaurant was very good even if the portions aren’t very large. Be aware there aren’t very much pasta dishes without dairy but the spaghetti is an option and it’s pretty good. Worth the experience!

Perfect place to check out a nice Italian marketplace! Fresh seafood fresh meat tons of cheese option .  Highly recommend Burrata!  The many restaurant options are amazing with wonderful views!  Highly recommend this place.  Very vibrant and can get crowded.  Worth it!

For long time wanted to visit the place, we went in lunch time, not a tourist.
The taste was good. We ordered Fusili and raviolis.

For regular lunch, food sizes are too small for the price.

It's a nice place to walk around, lots of options.

Do visit the place and try once.

formatted_address: Buzzer #11, 114 Forrest St Apt 3A, Brooklyn, NY 11206, USA
name: HHH

reviews.text: Awesome people, movies, food and hangouts. Bbq on the roof if you can.
shame about Google Reader, though.
Delicious tea!

This place smelled like orange juice and vomit and every exposed surface was sticky. The air was filled with toner dust that turned the cat black and killed all the computers. And who chose that red color for the walls, seriously.

formatted_address: 665 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: Gennaro

reviews.text: Very nice and cozy place and I was told that the food here is good. After visiting this place, I know why. I had the chicken cutlet layered with spinach, potato and cheese with one of their dark beers. The meal was excellent along with the service. The place was packed with a few tables for 2 here and there. Best to reserve a table if you have a party of 3 or more. Great evening!
Lovely, authentic feeling restaurant. Very large menu and very friendly service. Loved it and will be back! Hard to find cacio e Pepe done right!
We walked in for an impromptu birthday dinner. the staff wasn't only accommodating but kind and helpful. the food.....wow fresh, generous portions amazing. I will return.

Went here recently on a Saturday night.  Place was mobbed, and the service delayed and harried. Seating was uncomfortable. There are simply too many tables in the room.  Food was okay.  We were not informed about the cash only policy until we began to order.  Perhaps there's a sign, but it wasn't clear. Definitely limited our experience.
One of the best Italian restaurants in NYC. Helpful staff and decent menu. Great wine collection. Being a family owned restaurant, food quality has been maintained

formatted_address: 222 Avenue B, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: The Roost

reviews.text: Cozy den space and a really nice set up, with some good coffee and drinks. Definitely should be on the list of spots to see in eastern village
Very good coffee, but limited seating. They have a whole back room I've never seen open even when seating is cramped.

Uncomfortable seats, long wait times, and REALLY inhospitable atmosphere. The bartender was extremely rude to us even though our big group was spending a lot of money there - he blasted music in our ears to get us to leave and when that didn't work he made us move. 

Not sure if we were in on a bad night or what but they do NOT deserve to be "the best place to work from" or any other accolades.

Calling all coffee lovers!! One of the many coffee shops in the city that never sleeps of course. This coffee shop in particular is extremely authentic European style coffees, lattes, macchiatos, mochas, etc.

LOVE! Barista knows exactly what she's talkin about, all the varieties of coffee, and how to make the perfect cup of joe in whatever way you may want it. I was very impressed! The decor makes this place even more inviting. 

Scones delicious and loved that they had a variety of biscotti flavored treats.
Really love the music at this place! Long [cozy] bar that gets super crowded at times, but nice jumping off point at the start of your night.

formatted_address: 521 Hicks St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Vekslers

reviews.text: Food was great. Place was great. Service was great.

We hadn't been back since it opened years ago. There was an article about the best restaurants in Cobble Hill recently so we decided to check it out. I was very impressed by their soup dumplings. The filling was delicious even if the skin was a little thicker than I like. Great flavor. We had a very generous lox platter. We make super crunchy and delicious scallion pancakes. The only sort of week dish was the egg and rice. The duck egg was purportedly soft boiled, but while the i yolk was still runny the white was overcooked and tough. I thought there could have been more sauce on the dish. It was kind of dry.

I love the acoustics in the place when there are not screaming children. It is a popular place for people to dine with babies and children so be warned.

The service was very good.
Simple, clean and nice decor. The burger and fries were great. Didn't think I would finish it but I did. Will be back for more
Stopped with family, Vekslers has great breakfast and a very appealing setting.
Very eclectic, and very delicious, menu. Great vibe from th waitstaff/bartenders. Good beer, and as my partner told me, excellent margaritas.

formatted_address: 57 Pearl St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Love & Dough

reviews.text: Controversial I'm sure- but this is the best pizza in Brooklyn.  And it literally takes 2 min to cook your pie in the fire...adorable spot under the Manhattan bridge
1st time visiting here.  Great service and the best food...appetizers and pizza.  Get there early as it filled up pretty quick the day we were there
I loved the food here. A little pricey but worthy. Great tasting noodles and the dumplings had a really good taste.
Enjoyable fare, portions were okay sized. The online profile said Debit Cards were acceptable but turns out they were cash only. Had to go to ATM at the smoke shop a few doors down.

I haven't been here in four years or so, so I hope you'll pardon the stale review. However, up until recently, this was the best pizza I've had on my life. I got sausage, pepperoni, and olive, and all the toppings were applied perfectly in the correct amounts. The pizza was hot, the crust was chewy, the cheese was gooey, and the sauce was flavorful. The pizza was a tad greasy, but nothing a quick dabbing with a napkin couldn't fix. I'll absolutely order from here any time I'm in Berkeley: it's worth the odd ordering process and hoop jumping.Love & Dough

formatted_address: 131 Sullivan St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: The Dutch

reviews.text: Excellent and friendly service. We went for my girlfriend's birthday and had a great time. They delivered a sparkling candle to the table and also a scoop of ice cream.

Ok, it's pricey. Let's get that out of the way up front. And several reviews complain about portion size. IMO, portions were just right. Maybe the hostesses were a bit aloof, but doesn't matter to me one way or the other. I came at brunch on a Sunday. Res recommended. I chose poached eggs on the menu, because it sounded like benedict. It was, sort of, but it was done in a truly inventive way (pictured), and I loved it. Server was efficient and attentive. No complaints there.

We used to come here when our girls were young - when it was The Cub Room. Layout hasn't changed a great deal. It's still 2 rooms, one a little more dressy than the other. But the new decor is upscale and warm. 

Downstairs there's an incredible private event room. I would seriously consider booking it for an occasion. Overall, IMO, The Dutch is a cut above most other places around Soho.

Great ambiance and food was pretty delicious. Would give it 5 stars - the only reason I’m not is because we ordered the ribs and there was barely any meat, it was entirely fat / dessert was okay. The hot chicken and fried tomatoes were the best part of the meal.

Good experience ! i recommend this place. 
Good restaurant means busy place, so time to wait to have a table. But not too long. 
We have been well welcome. Good point !
Cocktails were good ! well balanced.
Burratta as an appetizer was good.
Hot fried chicken was tender and biscuits were buttery as i like.
The steak was delicious and cooked as expected.
Place to go !

Lovely little place in Greenwich Village. The food was top notch, as was the service. The Hostess was charming and couldn't have done more. The wait staff were friendly and professional and provided excellent service. There was an extensive list of American wines - although as a European tourist the wines seemed to be on the expensive side. (A feature not unique to The Dutch). The food was delicious and one of the best meals we've had in NYC so far. If you're in the area you should definitely check it out.

formatted_address: 88 Reade St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Triraq Trenches

reviews.text:
Always a great night at Triraq! Great for all types of Latin dancing. This is my go-to salsa spot, which is high praise in NYC’s thriving salsa scene!

The occasional Latin fusion nights (most recently Latin-disco!) are not to be missed. The owner is fabulous and often joins the dance floor when a good salsa song comes on. I’ve even been able to catch a dance with him myself! Triraq Trenches is definitely one of Manhattan’s best kept secrets.

The owner works hard to create a fun, family-friendly vibe. I feel like I’m always running into old friends in the trenches.

Only reason this isn’t a five star review is because last time I was there the DJ refused to play the song of the decade, Boys by Charli XCX.

Pictured is one of the dancers hired for a party this January. Great guy.

Exquisite music choices mixed with brilliant dance routines. You may be led to believe that The Triraq Trenches' best offering is its unequaled ambiance, but don't let that fool you -- its renowned glory ultimately comes from its legendary Purple Drink.
Dance floor is LIT. DJ Ru knows how to spin the tracks. LOTS of cuties. Never any beers though...
Went to college with the owner. One of the most genuine and hardest-working people I know.

formatted_address: 14 Old Fulton St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Plums

reviews.text: Fantastic vibes and super personal service. The meals were crisp and delightful. Will easily recommend this spot to my friends. Reasonable prices and large portions. Keep it up.
Norwegian Salmon with Cuscus. Looks pretty and delicious!
I highly recommend this place. The food is amazing and they have happy hour menu for drinks. The sangria is really good! The view (Brooklyn bridge) is also outstanding, especially during sunset.

An amazing experience, from the moment my family and I   walked through the door to the moment we left. The appetizers were outstanding, the main dishes were all delicious and the desserts were out of this world. All of the staff members were attentive and polite. Would 10000% recommend this beautiful restaurant in this beautiful area to anyone.

Was so peacefully and quiet during the 3 on time on this Friday Valentine's that just passed . Food delicious just superb. Servers so cheerful and welcoming. Definitely posting on facebook telling my friends and I'm going back as well !

formatted_address: 295 Grand St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: The Four Horsemen

reviews.text:
Love The Four Horsemen for weekend brunch! They post their brunch set menu on Fridays so you can see in advance what you'll get for $32. I've been 2 weekends in a row and several times before and they've hit it out of the park each time. Bright, rich flavors, surprisingly filling portions, and variety of dishes. There's also always a cool selection of wine available. 
I'd suggest going before 1pm in order to avoid waiting for a seat.
Highly recommend!

It is a lovely small restaurant with vibrant atmosphere. I like the food here, creatively designed, smartly seasoned and beautifully presented. The chef understands complexion of savory and also emphasizes the true flavors of the ingredients. I enjoyed their seafood and sausage most. The flatbread is a little bit below the bar. The only thing I may complain is it is too small. I felt compressed when dining. Since it has limited number of tables, I suggest reservation before visiting.

Once you come here you just want to keep coming back. Wine list amazing, for bottles and glasses. Food for sharing truly great and different. It has an amazing atmosphere, lighting, music, all top notch. The waiters are extremely qualified and know a lot about not only the menu but also about wine. It is definitely something to be done once in Brooklyn.

Came here on a Sunday afternoon for a drink and dessert. There were plenty of available tables but for some reason we were made to wait at the standing bar. When I tried to move over an available bar stool, I was scolded and told to put it back, despite the fact that another couple right next to us had stools at the standing bar. It took another 10 minutes for us to order a drink, which averaged $20 for a glass of wine. Once stools opened up at the main bar we finally got to sit down. I will give them that the olive oil cake with pistachio cream was good, but the attitude and service of this place is in definite need of improvement.

This place is amazing! We discovered it by chance and were pleasantly surprised by our experience. They offer a menu and wine selection which is different from a regular restaurant, and that adds to the experience. Plus, the staff is great, walking you through the dishes and which wine goes better with the meals.

formatted_address: 1055 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: Eats

reviews.text: Filling lunch, good flavors, crisp fries. The only "negative" was the $9.00 for a side of fries and the worn appearance of the restaurant. It needs a major freshening.
Beautiful place, huge portions, very taste food! Highly recommend their sandwiches, they're awesome.

I had found a Groupon to this restaurant before our trip to NYC and read the reviews.

This place did not disappoint! The 2 dozen East Coast blue point oysters were delicious and briny. My husband and I both got the Take Me Home martinis which had house tequila, mango nectar, and fresh lime. I had not known that martinis could have tequila in them.

We also got the Asian Fried Oysters which had seaweed salad, wasabi mayo, and house-pickled vegetables. It had a great crunch and good flavor! I was already full of all that food. My husband also had the crispy salmon filet which came with quinoa and couscous. I had a bite of the quinoa and couscous and it was good. My husband enjoyed the food.

Miguel took good care of us. We happen to be kababayans from the Philippines.

Highly recommend a stop at this restaurant!
Very well kept and accessible restaurant. They provide large meals and for reasonable rates. I loved the meals very much and the staff were super personal and informative. Recommended.
Good place to stop and get some decent food. The service was good and all the people who worked there were friendly and courteous.

formatted_address: 25 Avenue B, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Eastpoint

reviews.text: The Nutella waffles are not the thing to get here. Although the flavor was fine, the thick density of the waffles made them unappealing. If light and fluffy waffles are what you’re expecting, find them elsewhere.

Easily the best iteration of this physical space since Save the Robots. Although Avenida had great food and this is a continuation of that, the service there always sucked. I am so glad that they seem to have overcome all of that to make a great addition to the neighborhood with Eastpoint.

Possibly the best tacos I've ever had. Went last night for the first time, spent a comfortable, relaxing 4.5 hours with friends, drinks well made and reasonably priced. Staff were friendly and attentive without being annoying.
New favorite spot. $2 tacos on Tuesdays. Catch me here on Wednesdays too. Get on their email list for deals!

This is one of my favorite places to eat in the LES. My girlfriend and I come for a pitcher of margarita and some nachos every few weeks. Always the same experience (great!). 

The menu is fairly priced, but come for the happy hour if you want to save a couple bucks on food and alc. 

Thanks eastpoint!

formatted_address: 440 9th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Hudson Station

reviews.text: Food was amazing. Service was terrible at the tables. Only 4 other tables with people at them. Waitress threw the menus down and walked away as we were shown our table.  Took almost 10 minutes for her to come back and take a drink order. Another 10 minutes after that we got our drinks.  Half an hour later our food was delivered. Waitress never came back to check if we needed additional drinks. Bill was thrown on the table  when she saw we were done with not even so much as a thank you.  Very disappointing
$0.50 Monday wings. Huge wings. Wonderful Mac and Cheese at well. Absolute steal of a deal. Will return.

Soda was flat the server did bring out new ones but the soda was just flat period. Beer on tap was not really cold. The food was good. We ordered a bunch of apps to share. I will say I was disappointed with  the cheese whiz on the the nachos.
Great food options! The avocado fries and spicy cauliflower starters were amazing. Plus our service from Angela was 1st class!
Nice place in vicinity of Penn station.  Finger foods were good/ wings/ chicken tenders/ sliders.  Would recommend a visit

formatted_address: 56 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Taco Dumbo

reviews.text:
Wonderful staff and great friendly staff, attentive, responsive and great people! I’m impressed and definitely will be back. Kudos to the manager on deck he came around to check in with tables at dinner time and ensuring everyone is well

Food was amazing and happy hour is a great deal!  The $5 margaritas ($6 for frozen and I recommend the pineapple frozen with hibiscus rum or the watermelon frozen with basil rim) 

Great ambiance and deco and music selection. My first time here and Definitely will be back! Congratulations— great vibe, great atmosphere, great staff and people.

My favorite Taco Dumbo location as of today. My food was packed well so it arrived at my office perfect and fresh.  Service was quick. I tried a variety of tacos and enjoyed each one.  Short rib was my favorite.  Street corn was great.  Will be back...

Great atmosphere, good concept, the food was boring though, missed some flavor. The service was attentive and the decor matches the concept. It is more for some quick bite than a relaxed evening out. More for a drink and a small bite than dinner in my view. Fair price though!

Taco dumbo is my favorite place to chill but tonight the cashier ( girl ) was so rude. I ask for what flavors for frozen margarita then she just pointed in the menu the flavor and I ask for strawberry flavor. When I get my order the guy gave me regular margarita not frozen margarita. I was waiting for almost 20 minutes for my drink. Also, my friend left her phone on the counter and ask the lady cashier again. She said she didn't found any phone on the counter. We keep looking for my friend’s phone so she went to the front again to ask for her phone then the guy gave it to her. The cashier didn’t even ask her co-workers if they saw any phone. 🙄
Great vibes! Awesome margaritas! Amazing happy hour and also family friendly.

formatted_address: 835 Washington St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Sugar Factory American Brasserie

reviews.text: Coming to the Sugar Factory will bring gleaming smiles, giggling laughter, and happy vibes to all guests. Come and enjoy the upbeat mood, delicious food, and candy-themed humongous drinks. This is the place that is not only little kid to adult-friendly, but also a wonderful venue to celebrate birthdays or just a great time with friends. The waiters do an amazing job of singing cool versions of Happy Birthday, as well as provide fabulous service. What are you waiting for?

Checked in on Yelp for free Mac & cheese pops which were delicious - especially the sauce it comes with. I had steak & eggs with a Barbie Milkshake which were both delicious. One friend had chicken & waffles which she enjoyed. Another had the waffle burger which she said everything was good except the actual meat on the burger (it had bacon, sausage, hash browns, etc which she enjoyed). I wanted to try the Brunch for my birthday so I made a reservation. Didn't have such a good experience with the waitress. Left a detailed review on Yelp. Manager reached out to me to apologize so I will be returning to give it another try! Excellent management. Will update my review of the 2nd times a charm.

The ambiance at Sugar Factory is fun and vibrant! My go to favorite drink is the "Lollipop Passion" soooooo good. The mini sliders are excellent, it's a smaller rendition of their signature burger. Our server "Edward" was very attentive and friendly. He knows the meaning of Customer Service. Always a good time at Sugar Factory!

Came here for a party with 14 guests, we were seated on the 2nd floor. We got water within the first 10 minutes but only one waiter for the entire floor and multiple large groups. It took about 25 minutes for them to come take our order and another 25-30 minutes to get our drink order. This management needs to do a better job at distributing their waiter and waitresses, specially since the 1st floor was basically dead. I will definitely not be returning. Outside of the dry ice drinks, there is nothing special about this place and lack luster service does not help it. Really think about the quality of service you want before coming here.
