Extremely disappointing. Food was acceptable, but nothing great. Extremely overpriced but it's NYC so what can you do. Music was incredibly loud for a tiny space.

The big problem: Waiter (Kyle) was borderline incompetent. Restaurant was not particularly busy and service was incredibly slow.  He managed to get a member of my party's order wrong. He tried to charge us for the wrong (significantly more expensive) option. Finally, he made a mistake running another member of my party's card wrong, not splitting the check we extremely clearly told him we were doing. 

I was extremely excited to try sugar factory and I can confidently say that I nor any one else in my party will ever come here again.

formatted_address: 330 W 58th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Sushi Damo

reviews.text: The sushi here tasted so good. Great flavor. Prices were rather fair. Came during happy hour and got some cheap beer as well. The beer was amazing too, really smooth. Highly recommend it. Our waiter was really sweet and answered any questions we had. Focus of servers tends to rest on the people at the bar, but when you’re the only member staffed up front it’s understandable. She was still super sweet and gave us all her attention when she could. Like I said though, highly recommended

Pros:
Tasty Tokyo and Dragon rolls. 
Tasty seafood soup. 

Cons: 
Tiny rolls and tiny portions. 
Soup had only two pieces of shrimp and two thin slices of scallop. 
Seaweed wrap on sushi was virtually undetectable. 
My Togo order took 30 minutes. 
My meal didn’t fill me at all and was nearly $45.
Excellent service and delicious sushi! The sea urchin was exquisite. We had the spicy scallop and spicy crab sushi rolls and they were so yummy. Our server Young was great.

I just went here for lunch, and the food was amazing! Their lunch special Bento Box was very much worth it. The service was very friendly and the seating was comfortable. I would definitely visit again.
Such a great place to drink hot sake. It tastes wonderful!! servers are really friendly and kind. I enjoyed it so much!!

formatted_address: 1 Bruckner Blvd, The Bronx, NY 10454, USA
name: Mott Haven Bar & Grill

reviews.text: Great brunch options with unlimited mimosas! Great lively vibe! Great local gem
Very clean and convenient restaurant. They serve large meals and for affordable prices. We loved the menu a lot and the waiters were very affable and chatty. I recommend this place.
The atmosphere was great!! One of my new favorite places in NYC. The food and brunch hours are great. The manager/owner was very mindful of the guests and took care of us. Will definitely return!!
We love this place. The staff is great, fun and kind, and the food is good. Happy hour rocks, the event space in the back is clut h and hosts cool community events.
I came here for brunch with my family and we all had a really good time. The food was amazing! Will definitely be coming back soon

formatted_address: 17 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: The Fat Radish

reviews.text:
Food: amazing quality food. Everything had a great taste, was fresh and very well seasoned. I recommend the seafood.

Sustainability: supposedly it comes recommended as a sustainable restaurant, but I’m not sure. Nothing particularly screamed sustainable for me. 

Ambiance: intimate and clean environment. Good for a date setting. 

Service: meh, not great but not bad either. 

Value: very pricey and they charge for everything. Charging for bread and butter (although delicious) I find is wrong. I would say it’s💲💲💲not💲💲as Google suggests.

The food was delicious, especially the pot pie. 

However, the service was lacking. We did not see our waiter after ordering, until I walked across the restaurant to ask for the check. Also note they don’t have rose wine, Jack Daniels, or espresso, which is confusing for a restaurant in NYC trying to be trendy.

Ambiance: intimate and clean environment. Good for a date setting. 

Service: meh, not great but not bad either. 

Value: very pricey and they charge for everything. Charging for bread and butter (although delicious) I find is wrong. I would say it’s💲💲💲not💲💲as Google suggests.

Visited this spot while in NY for work. 

I came alone after an especially busy day looking to get a table, and was greeted by the host who put me right beside a couple at the bar. When I tried to give the couple one seat between us, she continued with “ I think that’s your seat right there” not allowing me any real space. I was also facing a brick wall so there was no real ambiance to that. 

My waiter was nice enough - I ordered the duck fat fries to start and then the roasted figs afterward. 

Overall the general lack of hospitality and ambiance is what made me give this rating. We have a Fat Radish in Savannah that had to be one of my all time favorite spots to visit. They definitely do things much better here in GA.

In one word: yummy. Went here for a bachelorette dinner. It was classy, beautiful and the food was delicious. Wine was well priced, food options were variable, unique and satisfying. The kale ceaser salad was the stuff of dreams. For my entree I had the chicken thighs which were great and the dessert options we're the cherry on top of an already great meal. Would recommend for a nice date or dinner out on the town.

formatted_address: 376 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Colombia in Park Slope

reviews.text:
Cozy little Colombian spot in Park Slope! Empanadas are no joke! They are definitely plus sized and legitimate. The coffee isn’t great but the staff is friendly and there is soccer on tv!

Priced reasonably and a great vibe, definitely would recommend and revisit.

This is one of the best restaurants in NYC! I am always extremely happy with the service and food/drinks. The margaritas are delicious. The plantain pizzas are spectacular (cheesy, filling, and something I hadn’t tried before) and they come with a simple side salad made of spring greens that is also very delicious. My friends and I would come here a lot together when we lived nearby. Now it’s a once in a while treat. I highly, highly recommend this restaurant. I hope they can stay forever. It does not disappoint. P.S. The guacamole is a fun experience! (They make it in front of you.)

I got there as soon as the restaurant opened and there were no customers. I ordered empanadas, plantains and a coffee to go. Five minutes of waiting all these middle school students took over the place. They filled the entire restaurant, even the bar. They just order Mac and cheese and soda. Yet the only server had to attend to all of them and serve them first. 45 minutes later I received my small order. The empanadas are good but it should have been first come first served. Don’t ever go there for lunch during a weekday.
Great Colombian food, but choose a time top come other than lunch time.  Local school's kids flood these restaurants at that time,  and service is scarce.
Fantastic vibe. Fantastic food. Fantastic service.

formatted_address: 368 Atlantic Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217, USA
name: Deity

reviews.text:
There is a lot of guys here... i like... oh the art is good too
There is nothing classier than drinking beer and interpreting art while grinding at the same time. :) Enjoy!
There is a cover charge.. usually 5 dollars.

I am now nearly four weeks out from my wedding and I am still riding the post wedding high.  Every part of our day went spectacularly, exceeding our expectations, and a HUGE part of that was because of this venue and all the staff that make the place run smoothly, professionally, and joyfully.  I cannot tell you how many texts, emails, and voicemails we received afterwards telling us this was the best wedding they've ever been to.  How fun it was.  How the layout made it so cool and extra special.  They loved that dancing was separate, making that portion a real party.  And for the guests who don't really want to be out there dancing, they still felt like they were a part of it since the tables are right there in the action.  It was a dream. 
Also, you will LOVE your experience at Deity as much as your guests did!  A few more specifics about our day, as I know I read all these reviews in detail when deciding; we started the day in the Suite getting ready, which was such a beautiful landing space to have.  It is GORGEOUS and just makes you feel luxurious and taken care of immediately.  The staff were checking in all day or answering texts about tiny questions.  And it was so nice to be whisked away up there at various points in the night for some connection time between you alone as a couple.  I think this aspect is something that sets Deity completely apart.  On the night of your event you are given TWO coordinators who are pretty much just there for you.  They keep track of timing and where you two need to be at any point in the night and just allowed us to be more fully present in every moment, not worrying over "what time is it?  is xyz happening?" At any moment I had a question or a thought, they were two steps ahead of me and I relaxed all the more, breathing a deep sigh of relief and gratitude.  Beyond these two amazing coordinators, there's the whole rest of the staff, who are also so kind, considerate, and on top of every little thing.  We had two people who were in a wheelchair or walker.  This was something that caused us a lot of concern beforehand, but Caio assured us they knew exactly how to handle it and to not worry.  And man were they right.  With grace, poise, and open hearts, they maneuvered the wheelchair over various steps, and aided with the chair lift.  My 96 year old grandma said she felt like royalty. They then went above and beyond when at the start of dancing, our wheelchair bound uncle couldn't get a cab as it was New Year's Eve, and the bartender himself walked him and his wife to the hotel!  When we heard of this the next morning, we teared up.  It was that level of kindness and consideration at every point, big and small, that sets this venue apart from all the rest.  
The food and drinks were plentiful and absolutely delicious (the salmon and short ribs are to die for) and kept us happy dancing into the night. Not to mention the GORGEOUS interior and design on every floor.  I loved it from the first time I set eyes on the place, and every guest commented how cool, unique, fun, and well-done our wedding was.  This was because of the team at Deity, not us.  ; )

A beautiful place. I went there for a wedding and it was perfection. I loved the layout of the cocktail lounge, the ceremony/dining hall, and even the dance floor. It may be small but for a hidden gem in Brooklyn it has great atmosphere.

After we got engaged, we knew that finding a venue would be the first thing we needed to do. The venue really helps set the tone of how the event will come together. The owner of Deity, Caio, actually called us personally to follow up on our intake form. This simple act of such dedication and sincerity for his business was a refreshing surprise! We promptly set up time to tour the venue, which Caio promised to show us personally.

It was during that tour that the deal was really solidified. My now husband and I feel strongly about personal connections, and we felt that immediately with Caio. He had such a warm personality. We knew that we could trust him, and that this event would be taken personally as a reflection of his promise. It really made picking Deity a no brainer and we quickly locked in a date, and we are SO GLAD that we did. 

Everything, at every step and turn was truly amazing. I emailed Deity countless times with big and small questions. I am a huge planner, and needed to have every single detail sorted out, and the Deity staff was essentially my wedding planning co-team, it was an incredible partnership! They were more than helpful every step of the way, and even added additional advice whenever they could. When you’re spending so much money, its difficult to feel at ease, or like you can really trust the process, but we really felt that way with Deity from the time we met Ciao, and especially on our wedding day.

And this is all in the lead up to the event! The day-of was so smooth it was almost hard to believe that everything went off so incredibly seamlessly. The entire staff knew exactly what to do, when to do it, and how to handle every single aspect of our special day. We had a timeline to keep to, and they kept everyone on time without us feeling rushed or stressed. Whenever we needed something, or had a question that day, one of our 2 attendees were there to help, making it is so we could really just focus on the day, and the moment. 

There is so much more that we could say, from helping us take special moments for ourselves, to the food and the incredible service, we could keep going on and on!! Truly, from the bottom of our hearts, thank you so much for making the day everything we could have imagined, and even more!!
When ask about the venue, no response when i finally spoke to someone they were rude...

formatted_address: 447 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Eros

reviews.text: Food was very good. The fish of the day was fresh and tasty. Lamp was very good. Went there for lunch. Better than expected for the price. Galaktomboureko was good too, better than many other places.

The decor is nice and sets the mood well for a date night. Menu is extensive and food portions are huge. The pita and bread was still warm when it got to us. The olive dip was decorous. We order the lamb shank with orzo. The lamb was tender and falls off the bone. Orzo was slightly under seasoned but if you eat it together with the lamb it’s quite tasty. We also order the seafood paella (made with orzo). Plenty of mussels, salmon, and scallops! Flavor was really good. Would recommend going around 6 to avoid the crowd.
Good service and good food. Good place for kids on weekends. Nice saltwater fish tank with some interesting inhabitants. Very friendly staff that promptly corrected our bill when we found an error.
Pretty venue, but the service was not up to par. The food was actually mediocre and overpriced. Look else where for great Mediterranean food.

Simply the best Greek in Manhattan. I have been there from. the old location and the new. Decor is tasteful, atmosphere is great, service is professional and efficient. Pricing is reasonable, menu is large and the food... well, like I said, the best Greek in Manhattan!

formatted_address: Ground, 48 W 21st St, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Latin Mondays at Taj

reviews.text: The best spot for social dancers who want a live band ! Great host and great team putting it together ;) highly recommend !

Hands down the best spot I’ve been so far for salsa dancing in NYC... Most men dance “on 1” there so I feel right at home (I’m strictly a street salsa dancer lol). The prices at the bar are higher than what they promote online tho. Nevertheless, this place is amazing- I’ll be there every Monday from now on!
Dance floor is way too small to enjoy dancing.

formatted_address: 2662 Broadway, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: Broadway Dive

reviews.text: Cozy spot. Excellent selection of draft been.  Great bartenders
Great selection of cans and bottles. The people that work here are extremely nice. If you're in the area it's a nice stop for a brew.
Great vibe, welcoming bar staff, and fun decor with some TV options. Check out the upstairs seating
This is such a cool place. The atmosphere is so welcoming and fun. The beer selection is crazy good, both on tap and in containers. I definitely want to make a return trip.

Cozy and friendly to chill in after a long day at work with friends.
Has music box , and not noisy.

formatted_address: 68 34th St, Brooklyn, NY 11232, USA
name: Standard Wormwood Distillery

reviews.text:
Fantastic spirits made in house. They are doing some really innovative things with Wormwood, with their versions of Vermouth, Tequila, Rye, Amaro and Apertivo.

Had a great afternoon here and am loving this stretch of new beverage spots in Industry City!
Great new place.  Highly recommended.  Outstanding drinks.  Great owner Taras and staff Kalle.  Will definitely be back! Thank you

formatted_address: 5 W 63rd St., New York, NY 10023, USA
name: concert hall

formatted_address: 459 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Mexico Lindo

reviews.text: I started going to this Mexican Restaurant when it first open way back in 1972 when I moved into the neighborhood. It was always a favorite of mind. Today I happen to be in the neighborhood and I notice that this Restaurant was still there. I asked my wife we had to stop by and have dinner.  We weren't disappointed it is still a fantastic restaurant with great food great  atmosphere and great staff. If you happen to be in this neighborhood please stop by you will not regret it.

New fav! Immediately upon walking in I felt like I had left NYC. Comfortable atmosphere and great food. The ingredients are colorful, fresh, aromatic and tasty. This is a business that ownership takes pride in operating, and it shows. Will be back 👍🏽

This is a restaurant that I have been coming to since 1986. I , we always enjoy the atmosphere and the friendly helpful staff. Not to mention the great food and the best frozen Margaritas in the world.👍🏼👍🏼🤘⏩
Low lighting ,not to bright but enough to create Great ambiance. Great service and food. Waitress was nice and gave great suggestions on food.
Amasing food. Great price. Beautiful dining area and inclosed terrace. The employees are friendly and inviting. Will be back 100%.

formatted_address: 1000 5th Ave #2F, New York, NY 10028, USA
name: The Great Hall Balcony Cafe & Bar

reviews.text: Very limited and overpriced (even for a museum cafe) menu, extremely dismissive and slow server, and all the food is premade. Save yourself some dollars and aggravation and get lunch before going into the museum.

Good selection of lighter fare and small plates. I had the chicken wrap which was great. The Mediterranean plate was enjoyed by my wife. And my daughter had a delicious club sandwich. They have a tea. Membership is required to enjoy this calm, quiet casual setting.
Overlooking the grand Great Hall, a great place to have a bite and drink before you continue looking at the great art of the Met.
I is such a great place to go! I was here while on a field trip in school, and I gotta tell ya, It's amazing!
Enjoyed some Lychee martini cocktails with my best friend while visiting this museum.

formatted_address: 206 E 67th St, New York, NY 10065, USA
name: Bedford Falls

reviews.text:
Classic pub with for the Upper East Side very reasonable prices. Nice, albeit small selection of beers. Regular pub food. Friendly service. A gem in this neighborhood that is surprisingly underutilized given its vicinity to to 20K students from Hunter College. 
Not sure whether I should advertise that fact because I don't want to see it swamped by rowdy students; but somehow it has escaped their attention in spite of it's long presence in the neighborhood.
Small, cozy and fun.  Super friendly staff.  Eclectic, simple but not overly so menu, with a touch of panache.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!  (FOOD ROCKS!)

The environment and the service was nice. The food not much. We order a big plate to share, it had chicken wings and shrimps and some other things. But honestly they were OK. I didn't really like the wings. They were too spicy and with not flavour at all.
Good fun bar. Missed going to watch Its A Wonderful Life there during the Christmas holiday. Can't think of a better place to watch than in Bedford Falls.

The food is great however I can not remember having such bad service A great example of the service is that we ordered a bottle of wine before our entrees. It never arrived we waited a bit to eat our entrees. After 15 minutes more waiting we ate and never were checked on. We canceled the bottle paid and left. This was disappointing as the food was so good. Next time we will probably get the food to go.

formatted_address: 30 Carmine St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Bluestone Lane West Village Café

reviews.text: Love his little Aussie stop! The nicest people with a grateful posture and happy you are there. We ended up talking to our waitress for about 20 mins and it felt like we were getting coffee with an old friend. Now let’s talk about the food!! If you like a lot of flavor and fresh food, look no further. This is a place that will satisfy all your taste buds.

Nutricious and delicious, good high quality breakfast foods, that's beautiful to boot. Comfortable outdoor seating in the shade. This place just does all the little things right.

The waitress, with an Australian accent appropriate for this Australian restaurant chain, was friendly and quick and there was zero pressure to leave or even hurry. Great place for a day that's easy like Sunday morning

Such a comfortable place to have a quick coffee. My latte comes with a heart. 

It has been a while for this over due review. I was here during afternoon time for a meeting and this place is perfect. There are plenty of seat and we took one of those wood tables. There are also outdoor seating which is great if only in one of the European countries.

Getting only latte really limits this review but they do serve some light meal as well as pastries. I would love to come back for more. 

Service is wonderful. Don't think they rush you if you work here.
Greasiest cafe i have ever been.... place is cute but smell awful.  Don't go if you do not want to smell like oil and fat everywhere..  so gross could not even finish my coffee.. ruined my day

Excellent food, terrible service. Outside seating but super full and slow even at 10:30am on a Saturday. The green baked eggs were excellent and the avocado smash was quite good. A friend had the breakfast bowl and he said it was excellent and seemingly healthy. Outside seating is nice in summer and it's on a great street for people watching. The iced coffee is excellent and the prices are very reasonable.

formatted_address: 24 W 55th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Michael's

reviews.text:
My friend and I order from here all the time- it’s our go-to Italian spot!! The food is awesome- definitely try the duck buns...delicious! The agnolotti is also fantastic. 
Almost as good as the food, the ordering here is top-notch. The staff sure they get your order right, every time and are overall very professional.
Must-try!!!!

So I came here with high expectations for a client dinner. From the beginning it took over an hour to begin our food order. So definitely don't come here if you're starving and want a quick turnaround. For drinks I ordered a sidecar and it was made beautifully. Ordered 5 by the end of the night. The steak was a bit underwhelming and fries plain. The shishito peppers on the other hand was coated in a delicious sauce that I'm still thinking about today.

Stayed nearby and was looking for a nice place to eat nearby. Michael's fit the bill. Great service and good choice of small and large plates. We shared the Mushroom Bisque, Korean tacos and the duck breast. Finished off with cheese plate and pumpkin cheesecake. The food was very good. Good compromise betweensome of the really expensive restaurants in the area and the local bars in the area.

This restaurant is great, we were walking around trying to find a good restaurant, after trying several places with long wait times Michael’s was full but had a waiting area Where we could order drinks and appetizers. By the time we sat down and ordered drinks our table was ready. The service there is impeccable, The people are nice and food came out fast and it was spectacular. I would highly recommend it and will be visiting again.
Fresh summer soup. Sour taste about 3/10. Saltyness 1/10. Sweet 5/10. (Scale used 10/10 very strong taste)

formatted_address: 198 Union Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11206, USA
name: Evil Olive Pizza Bar

reviews.text: Always a great experience here eating buffalo chicken empanadas. Best buff chicken empanada I have ever had.

Attended a party here, last night and had a great time! The place looks like a standard pizza joint, but walk through the meat locker looking door and you enter a moderate sized lounge with space for dancing and a small bar. First, the thing I liked best about the place was the staff. They were all friendly, efficient, and fun. The music was spot on with a great mixture of 90's-00's hip hop, pop, 80's, etc. Props to the DJ. The pizza was awesome. We went back front and got some slices, and I can confidently say, this was the best crust I've had on any NYC pizza (on par with Joe's, which in my opinion has recently gone down hill a bit). The smaller pies delivered to the lounge were good, but not quite as good as the full size slices. I've found that this is pretty typical of most pizza places. Now, I just need to work on convincing these guys to open up a spot in MY neighborhood, as this is a hike, for me. I'd love a great pizza joint/dance lounge on the UWS.

Pizzas are great staff is pretty cool they have specials on the daily but gotta go see what they are from special slices made for the day like burger slices (two pies) single slices lunch time specials those go quick. TV to enjoy some sports, news, or watch FRIENDS ever so often. U can order take outs gotta visit the website for info & check out all the pizza pies & side orders.. Psst also ask about  Geraldines Speakeasy (21& older)
Absolutely love this place! Their salads are amazing! Pasta is awesome and their specialty slices are on point!
I rate this spot. Hidden bar in the back should be utilized more! Great pizza and good people. Local neighborhood joint.

formatted_address: 119 W 56th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: burger joint

reviews.text: Only in NYC can there exist an unexpected gem like this. Reasonably priced,  made to order and perfectly prepared, gourmet burgers are grilled behind a nondescript curtain in a hotel lobby. It is the ultimate underground "word of mouth" experience . Same as in the movie, "The Wizard of Oz" of burgers delivers their results in the most unusual way.  Their simple menu is all about being the best burger and not how it got there. It is small and super crowded  but also efficient (and clean) so the line moves quickly. Dorothy, there is no place like home!

Unassuming, excellent burger for reasonable price. Posters, signatures and graffito on the walls class up the joint. Small but good selection of beer. Burger done right, fresh and extremely juicy. Shoestring fries, hot and crispy. I can't not stop here when I travel anywhere nearby, it's like a black hole.

A fun place that not everyone knows about but yet everyone does know about. The burger and fries were good. The line went fast. But we had a group of 8 and it is not a place for large groups. We were lucky to get a spot.

Great food, quick service! 
Quick tips: This place gets crowded and runs out of seats quickly, call ahead and pick up OR eat your food and free up a table! (Please)
They serve beer if that’s your thing and also make great milkshakes. You get a ton of fries (enough for 2 to share)
Also, don’t forget to tip the staff, it’s crowded back there and they work as fast as possible.

Went on a Thursday around 6pm and the line moved really quickly. I live in NY but still like to do touristy things every now and then so when I read about Burger joint I thought, lets do it!. 2 cheeseburgers with 1 order of fries and a milkshake was about $35. The burger did not have any taste and a plain vanilla milkshake for 9.50 is not something I want to experience again. The place itself had a nice vibe with because it feels like your little secret after school burger joint but, I would not go again due to the lack of taste in everything we had.

formatted_address: 320 Van Brunt St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: San Pedro Inn

reviews.text:
The San Pedro Inn is a perfect mix of delicious food and great atmosphere. This spot will fulfill all of your delicious taco desires. 

I also highly recommend the tostadas as well.

Along with our delicious array of mushroom, carnitas, and carne asada, we also ordered some margaritas that were very tasty and not super busy.

My only gripe would be that a chorizo taco was missing.
Amazing Mexican food and great local beers in this awesome venue. Great for if you're nearby Widow Jane distillery. Really good for lunch. Excellent service.
One of my favorite places to visit after a trip to Louis Valentino Park. It is one the closest bars to the waterfront. The place has a cool atmosphere and a great collection of bar lights.
Great vibes. Love the art on the walls. The chef was lovely and made vegan tacos for me and my friend.
Small authentic Mexican menu. Very friendly vibe. Well made drinks. Good hang or stop off on a night out.

formatted_address: 50 Central Park S, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Contour

reviews.text:
Hope the Reno does no harm to a superb Bistro and Bar. 
Great friendly staff..Eric is the one who makes the revisits so great.
Great meal. Top service.
"Is this really in the Ritz?"
The food is no where near the price or “Ritz” level. The waiter got our order wrong, the salad wasn’t very good, and the main dish we had was weak. Very few vegetarian options.
Great food and immaculate service

formatted_address: 187 Columbia St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Alma

reviews.text: Entered through the bar first and had no idea of how to get to the restaurant. They should handle that. Service was nice. I had no idea the place had a B rating. The plantains were highly undercooked in some parts. The food was for the most part fine but we won't be going again.

I must say I really enjoyed this place.not just for the food and the scenery which were all good but for the service. Came in with our 1 year old and they were really accommodating and friendly. They got us a chair for him and new utensils quickly whenever he dropped any. Overall I really enjoyed the experience and will be sure to come back.

No- the view of this place is not adequate to enjoy fully!! 

Tho Great food, but low and ambience and has a sneak leak of what could have been the most incredible view in Brooklyn

The veggie tacos were good, and the chi glen enchiladas were decent as well

They have quite an extensive selection of tacos on the menu. Their tacos are not your typical Mexican two-bites size, so I would order accordingly. Is it an authentic Mexican food place? Probably not. It is more on-par with Tex-Mex/Cali style of food.

Amazing location right by the river. Best fish tacos, best guacamole, best flan I've ever had! Highly recommend for a nice date or a fun night out with friends. Great cocktails, friendly and extremely helpful staff!

formatted_address: 1230 5th Ave, New York, NY 10029, USA
name: Side Park

reviews.text: Very nice food, mostly Mexican. The wraps are big and very tasty. The salsas are so good and spicy. Service is terrible, slow, and after 10 minutes of taking my order they had to ask again because they ”forgot”  They have a Starbucks coffee inside but it doesn't look like a normal Starbucks.  They have night events frequently so make sure to ask about their artistic events.
The drinks, elote, shrimp or fish tacos, and guacamole are sooooo good!!!😃
Wonderful lunch stop while spending the day at Conservatory Gardens at Central Park.  Highly recommended by a Gardner in the Park.  Food was delicious.  Server was pleasant and efficient.  Good stop.

Food is good but overpriced. 
They don’t open on time in the mornings and they’ve gotten orders wrong but are willing to correct them. 
People are nice but staff is limited they should have more people in staff.

I want to like you more! Lunch specials are $14.50...which is not a deal, and the food is just ok. I had a tamale with corn chowder on top that was amazing once...but alas that was a good year ago.  Fish tasted frozen and never ordered that again.  The set up for ordering is confusing  but there is hardly anyone there (not surprised) so you will be directed where to go.  Positives: They do have starbucks coffee and beer/wine.  The seating area is a great since it is quiet and clean.  When there are events it is beautifully decorated, and if you want to read a book or just sit quietly they don't pressure you to leave.   REALLY WISH they opened the space to  feature pop-up kitchen/food types---to change it up!

formatted_address: 250 Vesey St, New York, NY 10281, USA
name: Seamore's Brookfield

reviews.text: Love this location and the food. Went here for an impromptu lunch without making reservations and despite the lunch hour crowd we were seated immediately . The staff was friendly and welcoming. I ordered the crispy fish taco which was absolutely delicious . They have indoor and outdoor seating.  Love their location and ambience. Will come back.

This was suggested by a student who works here so full disclosure: the poké was comped. Regardless, we liked the vibe of the place (ersatz beach) and the lobster mac and cheese is highly recommended. They have a happy hour ($3 drinks at 3 pm, $4 drinks at 4 pm and $5 drinks at...5 pm!) with $2 oysters apiece so the bar area gets really packed. And noisy. Smokers are allowed in the outdoors area, weather permitting.

I celebrated my nomination yesterday in this great place. Well it was a great evening and the venue was clearly the reason for this successful event. The waiters  contributed in a sweet manner, the meals were appetizing and my friends were extremely  thrilled. We shall absolutely come back again for more events. Thank you very much.

Nice restaurant and the food is fresh and good seasoning.  Shrimps on taco are well  grilled, not dry but a bit hot as I did not know it come with hot sauce😅 

The alfresco area is comfortable and not too noisy or hot.   

Servers are polite and helpful.

This is a swanky seafood restaurant located in battery Park city, Manhattan. The restaurant serves mostly seafood, and I came here the other day for lunch and got outdoor seating. The restaurant is located within the Brookfield mall, but it has a great outdoor seating area where you could have a nice view and enjoy lunch. We ordered the kale and avocado salad with shrimp skewers, and also the lobster roll. Overall, prices here are a little bit steep for what it is. The food was OK, but the best part of the experience was the ambience and the friendly staff.

formatted_address: Lido Lounge, 244, A207, 5th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Lido Lounge

formatted_address: 399 3rd Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Hotel Lyn

formatted_address: 94 Chambers St, New York, NY 10007, USA
name: Racines NY

reviews.text: Terrific spot with a great wine list and some very creative cocktails. It's always a good sign when your server brings you two different wines to taste after you ask for a recommendation. The menu is small, but varied, and I enjoyed everything I ordered. The kitchen also did a wonderful job accommodating my dietary restrictions. Also note that sitting at the counter gives you a view of some of the cooking and plating , which was interesting but it was a little hectic, so I would try sitting at the bar or a table next time.

Went back here after a 4-year hiatus and was blown away. Food was an excellent balance of originality and old favourites, wine list is one of the best in the city and prices are some of the best value in TriBeCa. New top neighborhood spot for me. Go for the lively vegetables, splurge on the steak.

Delicious food. Amazing wine list. Great service. Nice ambiance. The chef pays close attention to the construction of each dish as can be seen with the little details. All dishes were well executed. Waiter was very knowledgeable on both the food and wine. Loved that they had a strong natural wine presence on the list as well. Price is a bit on the higher side but reasonable for what your getting. Would definitely come back.

Our small group met up at the Racines NY for a birthday celebration last week and had an amazing time. Overall, the  hospitality was excellent as was the service by our waitress. The orders among us covered a wide range and  everyone was pleased with theirs. We plan to do this again for the next birthday in our group.
Foods were OK, with no surprise.  Pretty nice wine list.

formatted_address: 995 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: Lion's Head Tavern

reviews.text: Awesome wings and burgers, kitchen closes when the bar does (just gotta keep in mind that later in the evening it'll take longer to get your food as compared to traditional dinner hours). Great staff, generally very kind and considerate! I love this spot and I plan to keep coming back!
All I have to say is WOW! We are visiting NYC and just happened to walk by. The owner was so nice and personable. Burger was awesome and wings also. Just go there!

One of the old neighborhood bars still standing. This is a no nonsense, dive bar with bar food and great beer. The music is diverse and leaning toward the 90s "alternative pop" sounds so I'm happy. Since this place has been here for so long it has a following amongst the people who have lived here before gentrification. The food is basic bar food and reasonably priced. The beer is great and you can't beat the history. There are TVs but they're not "in your face" so you can watch a game or just have a drink. P.S. the bartenders are cute.

The chili was fantastic. Served with nacho chips. 
The tater tots with bacon and cheddar yumalicious!
Service a touch slow. However, not a reason not to go.
Great food, tv on every angle, friendly staff.

formatted_address: 55 W 44th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: db Bistro Moderne

reviews.text: I had a very enjoyable lunch at this bistro.  I ordered 2 courses from the restaurant week menu, and I enjoyed both of them.  For appetizer I ordered chicken liver mousse, and it was just perfect.  For the main course I ordered the original db burger, and it was quite tasty too.  It was very flavorful, but I'm not calling it perfect because it was a little under seasoned to my liking. Overall, this was a very good experience, and I'll probably be back to try other items from the menu.

My experience at DB Bistro was quite nice. I went with my friend to celebrate my birthday and also enjoy the NY restaurant week. I have to say the food was delicious and tasty I ate grilled octopus as a appetizer, duck and my dessert I don’t remember the name but it was delicious they gave me a nice surprise for my birthday with a dessert and a candle definitely I will go back to this place. The service was very nice and polite they make you feel comfortable

Went for restaurant week. Had a reservation and was seated promptly. The atmosphere was warm and comfortable. Noise level was moderate. I didn’t have to yell to speak to my partner and we could hear each other. Service was quick, polite, and efficient. I had the Tartiflette, the Salmon, Chocolate Fondant and a strong cocktail. Everything was cooked well, tasted great, and nice portions. Left full and satisfied.

Chef Daniel is a genius and one of my favorite gourmets. I have never seen a dish cause every diner in a restaurant to stop and stare to see where it would land like they did with the original db Burger. It is simply one of the most decadently delicious things I’ve ever had. Besides Broadway this is one of the main draws for me to travel to New York.
Thank you for making our wedding day so special! We had an amazing feast! Everything was so delicious!

formatted_address: 120 W 45th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Bobby Van's Grill Times Square

reviews.text: Love restaurant week because you try new places. This was a great meal

The burgers are fantastic. The service was wonderful, and I really appreciate the attention that our hosts provided. I look forward to visiting here again. 

It is definitely a great place too meet with clients.

The food is high quality and so is the service. There are plenty of steak restaurants in the city, but Bobby Van’s is always consistent with their quality and service. If you have a large party, I would recommend the seafood platter. The peppercorn crusted filet is just phenomenal.

Fantastic food in a quiet atmosphere. Good service. Prices are a bit higher than most places but then again, there are no peanut shells on the floor, no drunken and boisterous person hollering out watching a ballgame and the food was prepared by a chef and not a line cook that their last job was at McDonalds. Great presentation of the food brought to the table.
They offer a great variety of fresh food. I loved dining here. The employees are always helpful, pricing is fair and the spot is always neat.

formatted_address: 211 Waverly Pl, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Morandi

reviews.text: We went here when we took a weekend trip to NY. It was a Saturday night and they made room for us.  The food was good and the service was excellent. It wasn't exactly what I was expecting but it was such a wonderful experience. I don't know if I would return, but I am very glad that I went.

Lunch was good, pasta had great texture. Flavors were a bit bland but overall enjoyable. The bread they bring to the table was very, very good, always nice paired with olive oil. Prices are pretty expensive for a bowl of pasta and sauce. Sat outside which was nice. Our server seemed really “overworked” even though the place was pretty empty for the 1.75 hours we were there. 

Overall is was good enough but price alone would prevent a revisit, plenty of other spots to try around town

Went for thanksgiving dinner. Cozy place, delicious food. Our server Michael was wonderful — funny, and attentive. Nothing felt rushed even though it was a full restaurant. Food was delivered on time, and each course was wonderful. A little pricey but worth it.

We had a reservation at 900pm on a Friday evening. The group's plans for the entire night was hinged around a dinner for 900pm-1130pm. We got there at 855pm, they told us to wait at the bar for 10-15 minutes. The bar area was already way too crowded, but we chilled and waited for a bit. After 30 minutes of waiting, the "waiting crowd" was still large - and growing. I went back to the host stand where the main guy was walking around as if nothing was wrong. The entire waiting area was growing furious at this guy. When I finally got to the front of the line, the main guy walked off and his assistants kept asking me blank questions and looking at their sheet as if there were some important math problem to solve. After an hour waiting, we were still towards the bottom of the list, cut our losses and were forced to each terrible tacos next door. It appears they overbooked, have terrible management, and then never even apologized for pretty much ruining our evening plans. The main guy was extremely arrogant yet could handle the stress of seating people to their reserved tables. Complete shitshow.

On another note, I saw table staff pour half used wine from a glass into a bottle of wine (after bringing to the kitchen area from a table)...

Morandi is one of those fun New York joints that's open all day, every day. Kinda like your favorite diner. Except Morandi is Italian. The food and drink is excellent and the staff gracious. It can get a little busy on the weekends, so make a reservation to be sure you'll get a seat.

formatted_address: 152 Stanton St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Balvanera

reviews.text: Went at ~1:30 on a Saturday for brunch. Make sure to make reservations as the place is small and was packed. However, the service was phenomenal and our waiter was very attentive. Used the Pulsd deal for brunch and would highly recommend if you’re satisfied with 2 drinks per person. Drinks were DELIGHTFUL and STRONG. Would recommend the spritz and the sangria which were both generous. Definitely would go again.

Great brunch food and good staff attitude. Well priced. I was quite gladly surprised. I would go back. Meats were very tasty. About $16 - $18 for a dish with a nice piece of meat is great for brunch. Only miss: no espresso :)

Empanada - excellent
Pesto Pasta - extremely fresh tasting.
Skirt Steak - very nice 

Service was quick and attentive. Music WASN'T blasting which was a nice change.
Went there for my birthday with my brother. Got the rib eye the ocotpus and the skirt steak. Food was really good. The staff were great.

Nice Place to eat, service was very good. If you go there on Tuesday/Wednesday, you can enjoy a special menu with some entrees for a really affordable price! Steak was very good. Would come back anytime!

formatted_address: 4 Pennsylvania Plaza, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Club Bar & Grill

reviews.text:
My Husband and I had dinner here prior to an event at MSG.  Our server was Ana, and she was amazing!  She seamlessly appeared at the right times.   She was engaging, very friendly and generally on her game.

The food was perfectly cooked, fresh, and delicious, with a good selection.  The blackberry cheesecake was a culinary delight, as was the tuna tartar!

After dinner we were ushered directly into the venue, which was perfect.

I would rate this as a 5 star experience, and soundly recommend the restaurant.

Service and staff were very attentive from the moment we arrived. Food selection for Dinner Buffet ($55) was excellent. Getting there early so not to be rushed worked out well. Would have been 5 stars if not so difficult to make reservations. Will definitely be back!
This is an excellent bar that has pretty good food. The service was ok, but the food took forever to come out. It was really good, well worth the wait
If you are looking for a buffet dinner here can be the place the price is around $55 per person drinks are kind of expensive are additional. Food was great.
Đẹp

formatted_address: 1460 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10075, USA
name: Boqueria

reviews.text: Food incredible and Service was impeccable. The Beautiful woman who booked our party of 14 made sure she came over to greet us and make sure everything was ok. I call that 5 Star Service with the servers and all. We had the tasting menu and it was perfect because you weren't over stuffed like your night was over after your dinner. Ultimate favorites were the Steak w/ Sweet pepper and butter sauce and the paella was incredible..
A busy, bustling brunch spot where you can get really really full with the brunch feast. Not to mention the free flowing sangria. Really a fun spot.

Very delicious food! I was the first time here and I definitely love this Spanish place! Sangria and the shrimps were amazing! But actually I liked all dishes we ordered 😋 
the atmosphere is very nice there, but that’s not a prefect place for a big group, because the tables are small enough. We were together with my husband and it was comfortable 👍🏼

Great food quality and very nice ambiance! However, the service could have been better. We (a group of 4 Asians) encountered a waitress who kinda ignored our request for bread... We requested once, she said she would check with the kitchen and brought us. She didn't actually get back to us. Then my friend signaled her as she was walking past again, she just ignored us. We had to call another waiter.
A bit far of the real tapas from Spain, but close enough to have a good time in a cozy and fancy place. The wines very good.

formatted_address: 51 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Karma

reviews.text: Loved karma but their decor needs a slight upgrade. Staff was friendly and the live dj was great. Hookah and drinks were satisfying. No complaints on that.

Very chill vibes. 

This is the hookah lounge u can go to wearing a jersey dress and fly sneakers.

Okay music, okay drinks. Drinks are watered down, so don’t expect any nice handcrafted Brooklyn-vibe cocktails. 

If u just want to chill, come here, if u want to be classy and wear something nice and surround ur self with high-class, go somewhere else.
Love the vibes here. This is a cool hang out and late night spot. Dj is good. And you're able to have outside here; to sip your wine and chill. That what I did.....had atomic wings delivered lol.
Karma i had a good time! The music, the vibe is incredible nice! I personally recommend ti visit this place.
The staff are sweethearts. The seats are comfortable. The prices are very affordable and it's nice.

formatted_address: 85 West St, New York, NY 10006, USA
name: Bill's Bar & Burger

reviews.text: Start to finish a great experience. Welcoming and friendly staff, plenty of seating including a booth that easily sat our party of 7. The food was amazing (I had a burger that featured on CNN Burger Top 10). Service was fast and attentive without being over the top. Prices were excellent too. Overall a very enjoyable experience that we will repeat on our next NYC adventure. Highly recommended.

This is an amazing restaurant!  The food was delicious.  The milkshakes were really good.  The service was outstanding.  Our food came about 5 minutes after we ordered.  Our waiter, Zaheer, was incredibly friendly and attentive the whole time.  Overall, it was a great experience.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

I sent my friends to this restaurant with my warmest recommendations. I  go to this restaurant often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The the food there is great and the crew is welcoming and cooperative. Whenever we go to this place we enjoy a delightful evening.  warmly recommended.

Bill’s claims that they are among the top 10 best burger places in Manhattan. And I think they are right. The heart attack Chili & Cheese Fries is just stunning!

Great selection of beer and super friendly staff! Everything is fresh and served in a heartbeat!

Visit!

We went here on our last night in New York as it was close to our hotel. Had a great meal each, I had the burger with pulled pork, it was lovely. Our waitress was really friendly and helpful. No complaints at all from us. Would definitely go here again if we ever go back to New York

formatted_address: 1441 Broadway #5015b, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: NewYearsBuzz.com

formatted_address: 246 10th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Bottino

reviews.text:
I celebrated my birthday at Bottino and the experience was absolute perfection. I hosted 65 guests and was a bit nervous about the task but owner Danny came to the rescue and just took all aspects of planning and end result was perfection. He was such a pleasure to work with and had great ideas as to provide a fantastic event. He recommended the DJ, Dawn who provided great music, he offered to order the Centerpieces which were fabulous. The food was delicious and service an absolute 10. The staff were all professional and cheerful.
The private Garden Room was perfect. There was enough room for dancing and my guests all had a festive evening. I couldn’t have been happier.
I totally recommend Bottino for your next party and living in the neighborhood I enjoy the casual atmosphere and delicious food for lunch and dinner.
Bravo Danny
For the win! We happened across this gem after an intense gallery tour mid afternoon. Highly recommend for a casual but quality experience. Staff is friendly and attentive. Will be back.
Tried this place before with my friend and I am addicted since then. I loved the good atmosphere and delightful dishes and beverages. 5 stars.

Great space and food. We were a big group and still we didn't wait too long. We got several different starters, all great. And the food managed to come at the same time for all of us, which we appreciated. We particularly loved the octopus and the shrimp pasta. They also have great cocktails; recommended.

This is a cute Italian spot with pretty amazing pasta located in the Chelsea area. The staff is friendly and attentive and service is great

The restaurant has a back dining room that is really great for private events. I’ll Beyonce is cozy and nice, and they have all these stringed lights in the back.

The salads here are very fresh and perfectly dressed. The pastas are amazing, I’ve tried the tagliatelle with ragu and recommend that. The octopus appetizer is also amazing. My favorite part of the meal was the bread pudding dessert.

formatted_address: 171 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Boqueria

reviews.text: Good food,atmosphere and music.  Service also good. Be mindful of the time you go..I met a friend there on a Saturday and just missed lunch time and had to wait till 5:30pm for dinner.  Just cheese and meat from 4:00 till 5:30.  Very tasty also.

Excellent place! The food was hilarious. 
The Colombian host is very friendly and helpful as well as their servers. I went with my girlfriend on Valentine’s Day and we had a beautiful time! Thank you!
Amazing service, handcrafted cocktails and atmosphere. Best known for their meat plates and happy hour. Nice designer beers on deck and their spicy margarita will erupt your taste buds.

Delicious authentic, high end Spanish cuisine. Tapas were absolutely amazing and the paella was sooo good. Drinks were yummy too. I’ll definitely be back. This is now one of my favorite spots and it will definitely be a go to location whenever I’m in soho. I highly recommend this place.
Good tapas selection. Very crowded Friday/Saturday. Small dinning room with small bar area. Interesting Spanish wine selection. Almost impossible street parking. Nearby garages.

formatted_address: 32 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: 32 Karaoke

reviews.text:
We went for a girls night this last Sunday and it was incredible! Great sound system, song selection and drinks. The fact that you can bring your own food and drinks made the night even better. Some karaoke places I’ve been to nickel and dime you with food and drinks, but not 32 Karaoke. The price per person was extremely reasonable as well. 
We will definitely come back with a bigger group because the rooms can fit more people than we expected. The staff was friendly and helpful as well. 

Can’t wait for the next girls night!!
Lots of music options, vibes and aesthetics are awesome. And you can bring your own alchohol and if not they also have options.
This was a really good karaoke bar. Staffs were nice and very helpful. The price was pretty good and we all had fun . Definitely coming back !
Rooms and bathrooms are clean, the staff is friendly and accommodating. Take the stairs the elevator is tiny. BYOB
Good place.. get your own room and chill out with a long list of songs.

formatted_address: 68 White St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Da Club

reviews.text: My girl said she wanted to go to da club so I took her to Da Club. Had da best time eva. Me n my girl grinded da night away. It was da bomb dot com.
THE club to go to in lower Manhattan. Nothing else compares to the atmosphere, drinks, and music this place offers. Highly recommend.
great venue, even better vibes

formatted_address: 94 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Top Hops Beer Shop

reviews.text: Would have been nice to try the beer flight but the bartender tonight was very rude. I approached the bar and waited  min while the bartender gave someone their check and then proceed to clean up after passing me a few times.  While he was cleaning in front of me, never acknowledging me, I said hello and asked him if I may order with him, to which he replied "Yeah, in one minute, there's a lot going on here" with and attitude as he gestured with his hands to the bar and I guess what he needed to clean up. I said to my friend who approached the bat mid-way through the exchange that I changed my mind and don't want to spend my money here. Before I walked out I let him know politely that he didn't have to be so rude about it I was just asking. To which he told me there was a line. I wasn't aware there was a line, so I asked where the line was. He told "You don't see the line but I do, I know how to do my job and your job is to have patience". I've never been to a bar where a bartender doesn't at least say give one moment I'll be right with you or at least say hi.

A little expensive. However you can over look that for the amazing selection on offer here. On tap or in can you can 100% find something to appease the taste buds. Add to that the great atmosphere and super fun bar staff you have your self a winning spot that everyone who likes beer should have at the top of there lists.
I had been really looking forward to coming here after a long dry January. The bartender treated me like an inconvenience. I won’t be back. Try the one in Essex Market for much better service.
Good selection of craft beer on tap. Wide selection of cans and bottles in the fridge. On the pricey side but good chill atmosphere and free bowl of pretzels to munch on while you enjoy your beer!

Awesome place for some genuinely interesting beers in the Lower East Side. It's a good balance of bar (plenty of space to sit and drink) and shop (lots if choices to buy and leave with). Plus they stock Trooper from Robinsons, so that's a bonus.

formatted_address: 75 W 68th St, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: La Boite en Bois

reviews.text: Went on a date on a Friday night in January. The place is too cramped up on space. Got very loud between 8-9pm. Little space on the table, and uncomfortable seating. I had the smoked salmon, which was okay. Certainly have had better for cheaper. Warm bread pudding was good. We didn't realize that the dinner was prix-fixe for 60/head. Definitely over-priced.

Quaint and traditional French styled restaurant. Warm staff, excellent bread, wonderful comfort food.

Includes a coat check at the front, which was pleasant.

Seemed disorganized.  Missed two of our four orders.  To be fair they explained our waiter was a trainee.  Wish they were more apologetic and less put off.  The food was good.  Cozy atmosphere.  Good for small groups.

Stop! Just go here! This restaurant is amazing... not only is the food great but the customer service was excellent. I recommend the Monk fish soup.  Also, love the garlic green beans. ...La Boite en Bois is a must try.
Went here for my wife's birthday dinner.  We both had a great meal.  We really enjoyed the place.

formatted_address: 29 7th Ave S, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: La Loteria

reviews.text: Excellent happy hour. Food was delicious and well executed. Fantastic flavors all around.

We came here for Saturday brunch and were pleasantly delighted with everything!! The drinks were boozy and the food was delicious! Steak and eggs are a must have! We also enjoyed the guac and salsa appetizer, very tasty!!! The place wasn’t over crowded and our waiter Elese was pleasant and attentive!

Solid modern Mexican food, at reasonable prices. We started with the chips and set of three salsas, all were delicious. I got the vegetable fajitas, which were generously portioned, very well seasoned and delicious overall. My partner got the tempura cauliflower tacos (2 of them) and loved it. Everything had a great balance of spice and flavour, and we left feeling full and satisfied.

Didn't have any food but did have drinks. The restaurant is comfortable and has a very good bar. The drinks were very good and the staff was friendly.  The outdoor seating is also nice. I would recommend.

Nice modern Mexican 🇲🇽 cuisine!!! This restaurant has a nice menu with different options where you can find traditional dishes with something (sauce, size, toppings) that make almost all the plates different. 

- Good guacamole with nachos and three sauces: peanut, jalapeño and Chile de Árbol. 

- Tuna tostadas with avocado and mango pico de Gallo AMAZING DELICIOUS. 

- Duck flautas with mole sauce (chocolate spicy sauce). Very original dish!!!

- The tacos with fish and salmon are very fresh so go down with them. 

They also have nice margaritas with different flavors and the servers were very cool. 

More food and entertainment options on Instagram and YouTube: El Manu Dominguez.

formatted_address: 228 W 10th St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: L'Artusi

reviews.text: My business partner and I had a wonderful experience here in January while visiting NYC for a conference.  We sat at the bar and received incredibly attentive service.  We sent colleagues there the next night and they had the same wonderfully attentive experience.  The vibe was cozy but lively on a cold (thankfully not too cold!) winter night.  The food was delicious - really everything we tried was so good.  Thanks for getting us out of mid-town and giving us an awesome NYC meal to remember!

Had my wedding dinner at L’Artusi almost 4 years ago. The food, ambiance, and service were perfection. Hard to imagine improving on any aspect of our experience. An ideal setting for a ~12 person dinner party.

5 categories, 5 stars to earn:
1: Menu - 1 Star. Went for brunch on Sunday. Good options and availability. 
2: Ambiance - .5 star. Open kitchen feel, small. Basement type feel. 
3: Service - 0-.5 stars. Server seemed hungover. Didn’t really care. No menu tour. 
4: Food Quality - 1.5 stars. Really amazing food. The pork burger was AMAZING. Start off with the pastries. Our party of three shared entrees and it was the perfect way to enjoy multiple dishes. 
5: Would I go back: .5 stars. Yes, but would probably sit at the bar and have a more casual meal. The food warrants a return visit.

We'd been trying for many months to get a reservation here, but having visited I can say there is a reason this place is popular!
Great food, with seasonal influences, and good drinks / wine menu too. The staff were very helpful and friendly.  We had a great time and will definitely be back!
Fan of the menu, ambiance, service, and of course food. Also, the wait staff was very nice. I highly recommend if you like small plates. I have been there also for breakfast/brunch and enjoyed it.

formatted_address: 4 Park Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Wolfgang's

reviews.text: Another great spot for Steak in the big apple. If you are looking for a perfectly prepared dry aged steak, this is your go to address. The wine menu is also great and full of nice little surprises. Make sure you have a reservation upfront, otherwise you might have to wait for two hours for a table.

Classic steakhouse that delivers fantastic steaks as well as seafood. This location is especially beautiful due to the architecture being similar to parts of grand central. You will not go wrong with the bone in ribeye and Broiled lobster (4lbs), crab cocktail, and Wolfgang Salad.

This is absolutely one of the most pleasant restaurants in the neighborhood. Always when I go there I am absolutely glad. They always keep their very high  level service and the topmost level of dishes  they provide. You always win with this place. Highly  recommended.
Good steak, Good service, but be prepared to spend. Only low is the space very small and ceilings very low. Not good if you dont like tight spaces!

I’ve been to many steakhouses. The meat here is no different than Peter Luger’s but the atmosphere was more enjoyable. I still prefer a steakhouse where the meat isn’t pre-cut and designed for sharing, which is why I only offer 4 stars. I was a big fan of the house steak sauce and how accurately they got the cooked level you order.

formatted_address: 565 Gorge Rd, Cliffside Park, NJ 07010, USA
name: Rustica Restaurant & Lounge

reviews.text: What a beautiful place 😻 I believe they opened maybe two years ago. There food was amazing. Lots to choose from with small plates menu. We enjoyed a variety of food from their menu.. CHECK OUT THE PICTURES

Good restaurant with nice staff and a fun interior! Food is intricate and there’s ample parking.  Only issue was when I ordered a porterhouse, it came out well done so we had to send it back. When they brought us another steak, I honestly am not sure whether it was a porterhouse or not. It was definitely not the highly of the dinner.

Dined there last night with 3 friends. We used a Groupon which was a fantastic deal! The appetizers were all AMAZING. We had the octopus, calamari, meatballs, sausage and mussels. But, we didn’t love our main courses as much. My friend had the assorted seafood and said there was no flavor. The dessert was also wonderful as was the ambience and light jazz music playing in the background. We had a very nice server who was also funny :) overall a great experience. Maybe just stick to ordering multiple apps!
Great bottomless brunch. Food was great. Ambiance was like a hip NYC lounge, with an interesting detail everywhere you looked. Dessert fell short of expectations but for everything else 5 stars.

I went to Rustica for an event and I must say it was such an amazing experience the food and the service were fantastic. I must say my two favorites were the main course the blue fin Tuna and the Double Cut Pork Chop! However all the other dishes were also amazing can't go wrong with any of them!

formatted_address: 100 W Houston St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Jane

reviews.text: Nice comfortable place with really good food!  Respectable beer selection, very friendly staff.  I had the pig grits, they were on point.  Came with some smoked ham hock, crispy onions and a nicely cooked egg.  Excellent amber beer out of grass valley.  I would definitely be back.

Jane has the best brunch ever, period! The food is so so good every time, and the service is always friendly. Love everything on the menu literally. All of the Benedict dishes are cooked to perfection, and the popover with farmer’s omelette is just yum. We always order the French toast as dessert for the table to share and it NEVER disappoints. Oh did I mention they never kick us out either? They always let us stay to chat for hours, after we paid, and they even offered us water! That’s why this is always our brunch place of choice!!!!

I have to be honest and say that my first time was for dinner and I was very disappointed. But we gave it a second chance, this time for Sunday Brunch and it was spectacular. Everything was perfect and the menu selections are great. It was so hard that we each picked a dish for our main meal and had the French Toast for dessert. I feel like giving 5 stars but I can't forget my first experience.
Fantastic atmosphere for Sunday brunch. Amazing quality food. Eric was a great server. Creme brulee french toast?? DOPE!

We made reservations for dinner and were seated very quickly on a weekend night. The service was excellent. The big pot of mussels was amazing, and the Kale salad was the best salad I ever had. I would not recommend the calamari though, since ours came out soggy. Overall, really tasty food and very nice waitstaff.

formatted_address: 31 W 52nd St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Taco Dumbo

reviews.text: Super cool vibe and incredibly delicious food. Found this place by accident when looking for a quick bite in the area. The guy behind the counter was very friendly and helpful in deciding what to order. Lots of vegan and dairy free options available on the menu. Try the coconut rice as a side with your tacos, it's so good!
very good tacos and amazing beach vibes. Lots of vegan options and great drinks... Amazing for lunch break (it regenerates you) and for after-work happy hour

Came here for lunch, not a taco fan but wanted to give it a shot. Got the taco salad with chicken. It was okay... pulled chicken atop lettuce with white and red sauce. The place, atmosphere and packaging were awesome but the selection was not the best in that was limited, one could say they do a few things well but I will not be returning. I still suggest you try it out though, you may love it !

Came here regularly as part of work lunches. Tried the impossible tacos, the salad with chicken, and the guacamole. Generally not many people during the lunch hour. 

Conceptually, this place is a souped-up taco spot tailored for vegetarians and vegans. While their impossible tacos are tasty, it is not worth the price of $6 / taco. It served as a nice, quiet place to eat lunch with co-workers.
The plant-based beef tacos and bowl were great, as were the mushroom tacos. Fun decor. A little pricey, but good food.

formatted_address: 42 E 58th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: TAO Uptown

reviews.text: Such a fantastic restaurant. The food is worth the price. Every time I eat here with my wife, it's a delicious meal -- I typically get the orange chicken and my wife the black pepper chicken. Both are absolutely well prepared. Plus, the restaurant has great ambiance for dates and group dinners. Definitely a go-to spot. But suggest making a reservation or getting there early weekdays because it can fill up quickly.

Really great dinner spot! Definitely pricey but the food is really delicious & creative. Had the scallops with rice & it was great. Got to taste the crispy orange chicken which I totally recommend ordering! To top it off, ordered the giant fortune cookie for dessert. The fortune cookie was heavenly. Loved the martinis too. Solid place!

I really don't get the hype. The giant Buddha is cool, but the restaurant itself felt dark and the carpet was dirty. Food quality was on par with a Panda Express. Service was decent. I had a better experience with food quality at the Vegas location. I would pass on this one.

Great place. We tried 7 dishes and everything was tasty, the sea bass was the best dish we had. The banana desert was also very good. Large portions.we were 4 diners and everyone were satisfied. Good service. If i come back to New york Ill definitely return.

TAO has a great layout which immediately transports you somewhere special. A ground floor and mezzanine are located within and include a fair amount of tables all in front of a giant statue. The structures and statues inside are great to look at, the bamboo display was my favorite. We had reservations and were promptly seated and given menus/utensils. I opted for the satay of chicken with peanut sauce. Great appetizer and fulfills the role of being a small dish with great flavor. Much too often, appetizers from restaurants can be as big as the main entree. 4-5 chicken pieces with an excellent peanut sauce. Highly recommend. I ordered the crispy orange chicken. Not much different from any other orange chicken. It was good, but nothing to really write home about. Outside skin crispy and with the rice, made for a good meal. I ordered the giant fortune cookie for dessert. Fruit is always a good idea for dessert. I usually get stuffed from the appetizer and entree, and any heavy chocolate is overbearing. The fortune cookie contains a fortune (yes, shocker I know) and is split between vanilla cream on one side and chocolate on the other. Along with the thick walls of the cookie, this made eating the desert easy and enjoyable. Also highly recommend. Now, I usually don't get tea after a meal however,  TAO had some flavored teas (I believe I tried peach flavor) which went excellently as the finisher to the meal. Settled my stomach and was quite good. 5 stars for a great atmosphere, good food, and good selection of desserts and teas.

formatted_address: 77 St Marks Pl, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: La Palapa

reviews.text: Had a delicious dinner here in the bustling East Village. Amazing menu with lots of very interesting Mexican dishes. It’s quite a scene so I suggest making reservations and it can be a little noisy but I highly recommend it. Service was really good and friendly. Food was delicious. It’s pricey but to be expected in New York City.

This is an update. Been going here for about 19 years and never disappointed! The Pre Fixe brunch has only gone up about $6 or $7 in almost 2 decades with the meals being just as flavorful and increasing in options. It's also a great place for anyone who loves margaritas, as they have many awesome flavors including hibiscus, tamarind, wild blueberry, ginger and many more! They also have great deals like $10 pitchers of sangria and happy hour bar food as well as drinks. Great place for authentic cuisine and a happy, friendly atmosphere! Do yourself a favor and visit!

I loved the atmosphere, it was very cozy with a friendly vibe. You can either just hang at the bar or have a meal at the tables. I brought my husband for his birthday, we both never been here, but as soon as we entered we absolutely loved the way it represented Mexican culture. My husband and I are Mexican and even we were surprised on how authentic the food and the atmosphere was. The only criticism we had was the flavoring of some meats. Although the portion of each meal wasn't too much or too little, it was just right to fill you up. The service was excellent, they were always attentive and very friendly. I'll definitely be coming back!!
Delicious brunch and tasty food all around. I love this place :-)

Really glad we went and checked this place out. Great service! Nice place - a little on the pricey side. Entrees were $20+. What we had were tasty!! Especially loved their chipotle sauce! Frozen margaritas were very nice too! Would definitely go back. 👍

formatted_address: 412 8th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Abakua Latin Fridays

formatted_address: 132 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Iggy's Keltic Lounge

reviews.text: ☘️ Barman was dead sound. Great price on a bud light. Super tunes. Nice bit of character to the place. A great find! ☘️
Good prices and atmosphere.
Great chill place to relax good vibez....
I always have a good time at this joint.  Catch the place early enough and you'll be listening to metal and punk.  Come too late and it gets hip hoppy.  The bartenders are always super cool here.

Came in for a quick beer stayed for the tunes, Armando was an amazing bar person, nice, funny with a wicked sense of music. Would definitely visit here again. Cheap drinks, great service, amazing music.

formatted_address: 10 Hope St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Ten Hope

reviews.text: I liked the ambiance and decor inside and outside. I am sure it’s lovely to sit in a garden area in the summer. Our waitress was pleasant and quick. However food was very disappointing. Tiny portions and expensive. I guess it’s the norm for Williamsburg these days but we were all disappointed in quality and quality of our brunch dishes. I wouldn’t be back.

I loved our night at Ten Hope!  A great new option in the neighborhood.  Great energy and I loved the decor.  We ate and drank at the lounge chairs and sofa, great option for a restaurant - easy to talk to everyone you are with.  Started with the dips and flatbread, then ordered the Scallops - AWESOME, and then the Chicken cooked under a Brick - SOO GOOD!  
Service was on.  Pretty cocktails, really good wine - Loved it!    I highly recommend.

Loving Ten Hope... fav new spot in Brooklyn. I went to a live music Thursday and also to brunch over the weekend (bottomless brunch hellooo!). Really great food, setting and staff. Love it! Thanks guys.
Ten Hope is a great restaurant. The service is great, the food is great and I can't wait to go back there again.

The Worst! Been here twice and both times disappointing to say the least. The SERVICE is ATROCIOUS! We waited 45 mins both times to get food. Ketchup took another 15 minutes. This is one of the worst places in Williamsburg that keeps getting high marks. I guess millennials are too wasted to care about wait time here. I’ll pass.

formatted_address: 34, W 26th St, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Jimmy Anton Social Dance

reviews.text: Best place to dance in NYC !

formatted_address: 570 10th Ave #3001, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Social Drink and Food

reviews.text:
Good rooftop bar with its chilled and colorful atmosphere.
Have been here couple of times and always had a great experience. They have summer movie nights which are absolutely fun (you have to reserve tickets online as they get filled up pretty fast). I love how casual yet trendy this place is. The servers are great and the drinks menu is quite interesting. I like the fact that it's not overly crowded like most other places are (even on a Friday night). I definitely recommend this spot.

This terrace used to be one of our favourite places. Because it’s spacious and has lots of sun on the sunny days, but also because the food used be very good! 
For ex. we used to order the flat bread full of vegetables like eggplants, olives,... comparing to this version - which has only salad on top of thin layer of tomato sauce. The size of tuna ceviche is ridiculous (btw, among the plates to share!!!), each piece of tuna is so thin that all you can taste is the salty ponzu sauce. Only fries are worthy their price. And I saw a cheese platter and I would definitely not recommend it. So disappointed by the quality of the food that we are not returning here anymore.

Social Drink and Food is the rooftop bar of the Yotel.

First and only time i’ve been was raining so i wasn’t able to enjoy the outdoor but the indoor is very cool and colorful.

We ordered a red sangria which i didn’t like (i usually love Sangria) since they used brandy to make it, it changed the taste a lot.

Music was good and there were a lot of people, the view is very nice as well!

We came & set at the table that was not reserved. No one came up to us. We had to call someone over to assist us. The person that came over immediately tried to move us to a different table because there were 2 of us. We asked if the place was by reservations only and she said that no but that the table was not meant for two. We explained that 3 more are on their way & it will be 5 of us and she left. Next person came to us and placed “reserved” sign on the table while we were sitting there and again started trying to move us. This person now said that they don’t allow their quests to sit themselves (contrary to the first person) and that because we sit ourselves they had to move us inside because someone else was coming. We ended up leaving. We used to come there all the time for few years & we are not coming back.
The ambiance of this place was too good. I visited here with my friend and we enjoyed the food. Recommended!!!!! Great service and super costumer service , i'm going back very soon

formatted_address: 81 Hoyt St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Bijan's

reviews.text: Had such a great weekend brunch with a friend! The menu is great and I definitely recommend the Persian omelette and the breakfast pizza! The omelette has dates, which surprising I loved. The breakfast pizza grilled bread was delicious. And the owner is the sweetest! They have a 25 brunch menu with a food item, cocktail, coffee/tea which is worth doing. If you're in the area, come check this place out

Great experience. We went to this amazing place for brunch. An authentic Persian restaurant in the heart of the Brooklyn. Home style brunch and a lot more, took me back to some of my childhood memories... 😋👌The vibe and hospitality is great. You should definitely check it out.

One of the coziest spots in nyc that I have yet to find. If a low light, candle lit, tavern vibe is for you than look no further. They literally have an open fireplace. It's amazing. Great food and an owner who you can clearly tell gives her heart and soul to this place. Not to mention a buy one get one happy hour.

If you’re looking for a place to have authentic Persian food AND good American food, I highly recommend this place. 
I’m Iranian and every time they surprise me with quality and quantity. 
Very generous owner, a Persian couple with amazing menu. 
Do not miss their specials for dinner!

Came here for a Saturday brunch. Such a cozy vibe with fireplace and wooden rustic decor. Sat right down with no wait, and the staff is so welcoming and warm.
