The food didn’t disappoint either! $25 brunch special for entree, cocktail, and coffee was great :)  my wife and I split the Persian Omelette and Pancakes, and both were delicious! Will definitely come back.

formatted_address: 101 Liberty St 3rd floor, New York, NY 10007, USA
name: La Pizza & La Pasta at Eataly NYC Downtown

reviews.text: Great pizza, the crust was my favorite part. It was just a little crispy on the bottom but still a little soft on top, perfectly cooked. A good amount of toppings as well. It was hot when it arrived. Thus, we rest the whole day with a tummy full! Thank you so much for the perfect taste you made for our order! Highly recommended!

We've been here with my friends because we're craving pasta and we wanted more something to eat while having chit-chat. I had the spaghetti and meatballs. The meatballs were very fresh and well seasoned. The mozzarella was enough for a personal pan pizza. It was so tasty! Overall the waitstaff was friendly and the food was tantalizing. The interior was charming and homey. We'll be coming back here again!

My favorite pizza pub!  You've always watered my mouth with your delicious pizza. Especially your 3-cheese pizza ugh!  It tastes heavenly. I like your place as well. It was so clean and fancy. Also, you've served the pizza fast, which I liked the most. I will definitely recommend your pizza pub to everyone.

We went there for my wife's birthday. It was an amazing experience.
The tagliolini pasta was a one of a kind dish supplemented well with fresh shaved black truffles. Pizza flavours gelled nicely with a smoky tomato aroma. It's difficult to explain unless you've experienced it.
Speaking of experience our server gave us all the attention in the world to help us choose the perfect dishes. And we were lucky to get a window view. 😀
Assorted appetizer was good, fried artichoke and radishes being the highlights. Definitely try the Italian cola. It's different.

I had really high expectations of the food in this place but I was kind of disappointed - maybe I chose the wrong items to order. I had the most fancy pasta on the menu with varieties of cheeses and mushrooms and nuts - but it felt a bit bland to me - the ingredients didn’t seem happy together. My friend who got the beef pasta said she couldn’t taste the beef. The dishes had all good ingredients but it didn’t seem like a happy marriage. The best thing I had was their cappuccino and my friend liked the cannoli. Portion sizes also seemed on the smaller side. We got a fancy asparagus dish worth 13-14 dollars and there were barely 8-9 stems of asparagus and just a powder of scrambled eggs - whereas from the description it seemed like there would be atleast two poached eggs on the side. I liked the olives in olive oil though. The service was okay except we had to ask for the free bread - it wasn’t automatically kept on our table. Also our water was not refilled.  

This is a fancy place and for the price I expected better portions and more flavour - unfortunately I didn’t get that. 

This place does not serve halal. They do provide gluten and dairy free options on some of the dishes though so I thought that was nice.

formatted_address: 202 W 14th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Zusik

reviews.text: What is not to love in this food heaven? Everything was delicious. Just perfect in my opinion. Nothing too salty, nothing too greasy, nothing too sweet. If i have to be critical, it was the portion i would pick on, but hey! Nobody said this was Texan serving. We started out sharing because this was our first visit, but i could easily have eaten each order by myself, especially since it was this delicious. I highly recommend this as a must go resto. Calling out the foodies!!! This is a gem right here. Oh and the service was spectacular! We are definitely going back!!!!

Brunch was amazing, portions were really big as well! I loved how they had so many options for brunch, including traditional korean food and fusion food. Employees were also super friendly. Hope to come back soon.

We had a fabulous meal and attentive service. Highly recommend the duck dish. The potatoes, onions and duck all had wonderful flavor. The short rib dish with 2 sauces and mashed potatoes with mozzarella melted on top dish also  over the top delicious. The popcorn chicken, scallion pancake and grilled vegetables also quite good.

Food was absolutely great. All based on the traditional Korean food but bring it to a well-made fine dinning level. One thing to point out is the dish itself are all small size dish. It works perfect for drink sides. But I’ll suggest to order at least 3 dish per person for meal. It’s actually good since food are all tasty.

Legit Korean place. Love the location (West village is unbeatable!) and the vibe here is chill - not loud or rushed like in other restaurants in Korean town. Came here for dinner. The waitress recommended that we should each order two dishes given the smaller portion. Our group favorite was the fried chicken. Liked their octopus salad - very tender. The Old Fashioned and Uni rice bowl we’re both great. I think we could use more Uni in the dish though. Overall a relatively well done Korean restaurant in the neighborhood!

formatted_address: 308 W 58th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Blue Ribbon Sushi Bar & Grill

reviews.text: Experience was great! Excellent service and delicious sushi rolls. However, I'm a bit dissatisfied about the quantity and size of each roll. The flavors were accented correctly, but could use more substance, especially at the high prices they charge for such small rolls. I'd like to see more abundance for a $200 bill.

We came to this place for lunch. This spot was recommended to us by a friend.  Well, we were not disappointed. The staff members welcomed us with a smile and we felt excellent. The meal was fresh and delicious. We had a great time and we will visit this place again. Recommended.

Wow. Blue Ribbon has upped their game. I was never a fan of their downtown location and solely chose this place due to its proximity to a show I was heading to after. So happy I did! The sushi was fantastic and quite a surprise. Service was lacking but if the fish is this good I'll deal with it.  Sake flight was tasty too.

This place is my preferable place.  Of all restaurants I know I love it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to visit this restaurant. when  I want to go to a fair lunchon, this place comes right away to my mind. very good and all sorts of  food and a large list of dishes.great staff, and agreeable spirit. Not less important, the cost is fair. I tell about this place with no doubt.

I sat on their sushi bar last night and I saw sth that I can never put up with, especially in a sushi place. The sushi chefs directly touched paper receipts with their hands in the middle of making sushi and put receipts directly ON THE SUSHI. Waiters then took away the receipts and served the sushi to tables. ZERO tolerance. Even the cheapest sushi bar should not be doing that. And they did that like routine. Those sushi plates covered by receipts just sat in front of the customers sitting on the sushi bar. I don't know what those customers were thinking looking at this. The chefs just didn't care.

formatted_address: 713 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Sachi Asian Bistro

reviews.text: Came hear for a group birthday dinner and had a great time. Good service, great portion size, and good variety of food. My girlfriend and I got the grilled miso octupus and seared duck breast and sushi rolls. Everything was cooked well and delicious. Some people got the fried rice which was kinda disappointing with the lack of veggies but that was out only complaint.

I meet with friends this great restaurant quite often! This is my favorite spot to grab a bite.  I visit this spot many times. The meals are very tasty, the staff is courteous and the cost is reasonable. I like eating in this spot over a decent meal.

Ate here yesterday at the bar during the lunchtime rush.  Was very impressed by how the bartender kept it all together while being friendly and outgoing at the same time.  The green curry was delicious as was the house salad that accompanied it. Prices for lunch are very on point :) will definitely be back!
Great place. Great food and great service.
The food is regularly fresh and flavorful, cashiers hands over excellent service. I love the cleanliness and ambience. Would recommend to others.

formatted_address: 178 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Ciao Vineria con Cucina

reviews.text: The menu and service were beyond our expectations. We surely liked the vibes of this spot. First-rate spot to take my family out for dinner.
Would definitely recommend trying out this place. Awesome atmosphere, yummy food, fantastic customer service. They never disappoint.
The place is first-rate and broad, the meals was delightful and the prices were very reasonable. rapidly, effective service and very attentive staff members. Will definitely recommend this place.

Service was excellent! Everyone was very attentive, I believe that the owner was outside welcoming everyone. It’s a very cozy atmosphere and my lasagna was so delicious! The plate was a huge! The waiter brought out parmigiano to add on top of the lasagna and stopped whenever I told him. Loved this place!
I tried this spot before with my friend and I am hooked since then. I like the fantastic character and tasty food and beverages. 5 stars from me.

formatted_address: 481 8th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Tick Tock Diner NY

reviews.text:
A group of us ate here for the first time last weekend after someone in our group mentioned had been there before. 
Definitely glad we went!
Their menu is amazing, and had plenty of different options! The food was fantastic as well. 
We barely had to wait long at all for our food to arrive at our booth!
The staff were absolutely wonderful and friendly,
would absolutely recommend if you're looking for good food in NY!

Sunday morning and an hour and a half til my train at Penn station and I'm in need of breakfast. Seated fast, like right away. A large OJ is a large OJ. Great selection, served quickly and tastes great! Find the hidden vault and safety deposit boxes. Was this place once a bank? Made it to the train in plenty of time to spare with a great start for the day.

A very good diner! Our waitress (Dora) was the best and had beautiful nails, too. She has such a great personality and really was a wonderful welcome back to NYC for our first meal of the trip.

The food was delicious, service was great, and prices were decent. I'd definitely go back, though I like trying new places, so it may never happen. We talked about going back for dessert, since it looked great, but we didn't get there.
My first time here this evening. Quiet place.  Good service. This is a good diner.  I had the Fried Shrimp, fries, Fried onion rings.  The shrimp was good..they were jumbo.

I absolutely love this diner! Every time I’m in the area I come here to eat. The food is delicious and the portions plenty I can not finish it all. The desserts are mouth watering too. Seating is quick service with a smile and very efficient. I only wish the restrooms were on the same floor!

formatted_address: 156 W 38th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Jimmy's 38 NYC

reviews.text: Not the hottest spot....... music and food was ok. There were no dress code and not a big dance floor to let loose. The health department showed up and shut down the bar and the kitchen for an inspection. NO one could eat for over a hour. (We were not accommodated either) . They also snatched all the hookahs from anyone who purchased it because the health department arrived. It was clear they would have been in violation of the health department regulations. Definitely not planning an event there in the future. Not a good experience.

Was planning on going when I got there friends said they had been searched and the smell of weed filled the air. I am not opposed to weed to each his own but I do not want to feel like I am going to visit someone in jail to get into a bar/club. We will try again on another night but Saturday night was not it for me and my group. Hopefully I will be able to change the rating in the future

I must say that this is one of the best experiences that I've had. This is not a place that you take your 1st date because it's very loud, however for anniversary or a good time it would be a great. I'm going to put a photo of the menu so you're aware of the prices of the food. It is delicious. The DJ is lit. I was dancing during the 30 minute wait and while we ordered food. I danced while we ate. I danced after we ate. It was the most amazing atmosphere. Seating was pretty good. The place is loud but it's for a good time. Not really to intimate but the vibes are the most memorable.

Warning: ladies if you are not secure in your relationship this is not the place to go for you. Every female in there in dressed to kill for the most part. I seen 3 females get mad at their man for wondering eyes. 

If you want a healthy meal the shrimp and grits is good. Not heavy but it will fill you.the chicken and waffles is heavier.  I would go back even when the menu isnt fixed.  You feel like a different person when you leave!
We had a Sunday brunch bachelorette party. Had a blast. Good food, bottomless sangria and mimosas. $30 Hookah. Attentive staff. Good music. Perfect for big groups of friends.

This a great place to get together with friends and coworker after work to unwind and get drinks on a Friday.  The drinks are pretty good and they don't taste watered-down.  Great club atmosphere and nice staff.

formatted_address: 175 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Taverna Di Bacco

reviews.text: Very good real Italian food with a nice Manager (owner?) who remembers his patrons and appreciates them coming to his restaurant. Comfortable dining area and a bar for a drink or quick meal. On a busy street in a great neighborhood in the L.E.S.

This is my favorite Italian meal in the city. The place just does everything right from the cozy decor, incredible attentive service, crafted drinks and the most DELICIOUS FOOD!! Go for the Chef's tasting menu for a steal of $55! The courses are small, but not skimpy. They are rich, flavorful and cooked to perfection. They change often depending on what meat of veggies the chef has in the kitchen. He will ask if there are any dietary restrictions and he accommodated to my no pork, duck or lamb restrictions so well. 

We also had our rehearsal dinner here back in Sept 2017 in the back yard. They made some dishes family style, and some plated. Everyone said how amazing that meal was and my family still begs to go back everytime they are in town!

Best Italian spot in the neighborhood by far. Perfect food, relaxed atmosphere, stylish crowd, incredible owners. I’m allergic to dairy, so the owner went in the back and made me a dish fresh without cheese. Best spaghetti & meatballs I’ve had in years. His wife suggested a wine I’d never tried & it paired wonderfully. My date was impressed as well. Definitely my new favorite spot
Service is nice. I think the food is generally good, but there are a lot of great Italian spots in NYC. The happy hour prices are not great -- $10 glasses of wine that are normally $13 per glass.

Last Sunday, this place is really amazing in Lower Manhattan. I really like working with chef Maurizio at the Cooke Food For Though Gala in 2018 last month. He's an amazing chef, the service is awesome, food is fantastic. I'll come back again soon and this was my 1st time to Taverna Di Bacco. Here are some of these photos from Mikey's 21st Birthday at Taverna Di Bacco and the Cooke Food For Thought Gala at Tribeca Rooftop.

formatted_address: 176 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Nirvana Cafe & Bar

reviews.text: It's ok

formatted_address: New York Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217, USA
name: Pandemonium

formatted_address: 112 Reade St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Holy Ground

reviews.text: Decided to try this place on Thanksgiving for the prix fixe dinner menu.  Seemed a little pricey for a turkey dinner, but was pleasantly surprised.  The atmosphere is that of a 1920's speakeasy with decor and music to match.  The food was delicious and the service stellar.  Overall experience justified the price and I will add this place to my list of recommended NYC restaurants!
Very well kept and convenient place. They offer generous portions and for reasonable rates. I loved the food a lot and the waiters were super attentive and informative. I recommend this place.

Intimate, friendly, tasty. Fantastic spot. A steakhouse speakeasy with an awesome list of cocktails, great menu, and a fantastic knowledgeable staff. We had the ribs, prawns, risotto, broccoli, and brussel sprouts. The food was delicious. Cant wait to go back for the ribeye and beef rib. Gonna bring an army of friends to this spot.

Just a terrific place from start to finish.  Food and ambience were terrific; service was absolutely outstanding. I highly recommend this place.  We practically tried every item on the menu, it was incredible. All around a lot of bang for the buck, a live band too. We definitely cannot wait to go back. Thanks!

This site is my favorite place.  Of all restaurants I know I favor it most. I always suggests to my friends to go to that place. when  I I need a fair lunch, this place comes straightaway to my head. best and   food and a large menu.generous team, and good ambience. Not less important, the price is decent. I suggest this spot with pleasure.

formatted_address: 284 Grand St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Fiore

reviews.text: Wonderful local restaurant for great Italian food. Fantastic service and lovely, unique atmosphere. The food was delicious and I’d recommend this spot to anyone.

I come to this marvelous  restaurant once a month  as I love the special air that is part of this restaurant. The crew is awfuly attentive and professional. The service is certainly fast. Also, the food they cook is first-rate. I have been there many times and I was always delighted. The pay is honest. I highly recommend this restaurant to to everybody.
Really like a 4.3 star place. Food was very good and priced fairly. Service could have been better but the place itself was clean and had a enjoyable vibe.
What a great find! They have a quiet patio in the back, food was delicious and the service was awesome!
Really enjoyed the lowkey atmosphere & the food was really good! Definitely recommend if you’re looking for authentic Italian food! 👍🏼

formatted_address: 627 W 51st St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Club 57

reviews.text: Nice crowd..late crowd...pricey drinks.great space..good music...
FABULOUS

If you like being surrrounded by a bunch of priveledged Asian kids, this is the place for you. They also didn’t card underaged kids and allowed them to smoke cigarettes indoors...

WARNING: completely different venue then a year ago. The space seemed like a renovated studio apartment. Not a “club” by any means.
Cool place to go out for night clubbing. Their music was fantastic. Highly recommended!
Great table service and great music

formatted_address: 111 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Maharlika

reviews.text: This place is my favored. I visit plenty of restaurants but to this restaurant I  constantly return again and again. The crew is very welcoming and the cooking they offer is so fresh and tasty. I never miss an opportunity to have a nice meal here. I recommend this place with pleasure.
Really nice atmosphere. Tasty food. If never had adobo before. It's sad this place is closing but it was great we got to try it before it closes.

I told my friends about this restaurant with my highest recommendations. I visit this place often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The the food there is tasty and the stuff is generous and cooperative. Every time  we visit this place we enjoy a cheerful evening.  warmly recommended.
We had a lunch there, the food was delicious! I think it does not matter which plate you take, everything is good. The waiter was great, really nice. Best Philippine dinner I ever had.

Nice space with with touches that complement the local culture. However, the food was a bit of a letdown, and the ordered dish didn't seem to come together: The pork belly was a little chewy and had a strong acidic-based marinade (not sure if normal), and the side salad felt generic (menu called out watercress). May need to return for evening service and re-assess.

formatted_address: 34-36 W 32nd St 5th floor, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Turntable LP Bar & Karaoke

reviews.text: I had so much fun w party of 10 on Xmas at this place. Staff was fantastic & very accommodating. The selection of alcohol & food is generous. The ambiance of the place is something else, just a cool spot. Of course I can't not mention the karaoke rooms which was loads of fun to the point that I lost my voice.

Reasons for going: Out with friends after work

Pros:
Great prices for good food
Attentive/respectful staff
Never had to wait for a table
Delicious cocktails and good happy hour
Handicap accessible
Clean bathroom
Unique/instagrammable decor

Cons:
None

Overall:
Honestly one of my favorite spots to go after work. One of the best cocktails with persistent quality. The wings are also delicious with a crunchy outside and tender inside. Always a great atmosphere. Highly recommend this place. For more busy nights I would get a reservation. Thanks for the hospitality

📷@datasianjan

We had a pleasant experience here. The seafood pancake is good and the fried chicken is also good. The spicy fried chicken is pretty spicy so be careful if you aren’t used to spiciness. The soy garlic one isn’t truly my favorite, but it’s not bad. The staff is pretty nice and the atmosphere is chill. The prices aren’t expensive at all either.

Had a great experience here. I stepped in last minute to host a meetup since the original host had an emergency. The reservation was for 20 people, of which only 8 people showed. Thank God the people who came were drinkers😏.

I got there early and ordered at the bar. After a while a few more people joined us at the bar. Had a few drinks then we decided to get seated and placed an order for 4 half and half chicken since they take 30 minutes.

Well no one else showed... The eight of us were able finish the chicken and drank a bunch. I hope our drink bill make up for the lack of people's participation. Staff were awesome and even gave us a free bottle of Soju. Would definitely go back. Love the feel of the place.

Best Korean wings I have had in NYC. They make them to order and, if you are patient, order them extra crispy. They are happy to oblige. The calamari is the surprise hit. Fresh and well prepared. Staff is great!

formatted_address: 301 W 39th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Escuelita

reviews.text: The first time,s I went to l a Escelita was in the mid 80,s you see sow meny thing that I expirerients that I can not remember most of them.    I do remember they had a MR. Escelita contest & I remember the. Winner was this Spanish cube  man in his 20,s very quit boy .      Then like in 2 years he had came back every body or almost every body came back they wanted to see him because there was a timer that he had the monster and at that time that's the way they would call (( A.I.D,S )) SOW you know the house was pack,t then I looked to my side and the he was setting in a while cheer. It was horrible seeing him the way he looked . I am sorry l can't go an with the story for some reason. I well keep on with the story some other way.🕯️🕯️P.S.  his name was Georgie🕯️✝️🛐🤒😢😭🙏💔‼️

Now that it is the new home base for Timmy Regisford and Shelter on Sunday mornings, Manhattan once again and finally has a great place to dance to the best music. Go, if you can dance all night long.

When I was going to this club it was trash... still is an the fake security guards kills me a  this is a spot where if you don't  have any place to go then but always have a back up... always great music tho

If I owned a club and hosted an event like Escuelita did last night I never would have managed it with way they did.  This business could have done some positive alignment with a very popular TV show and blew it.  First they 1) advertised a special VIP entrance  if you texted or tweeted them.  It would be free if you entered before 11:30.  However, at 11:05, the line was around the block and when security staff was questioned about the promotion and shown the text message, I was sent to the back of the line with a smirk.  Later the line was solicited regularly by bouncers whose palms you could cross with $25-$40 to get to the front of the line, only to pay the cover charge ALSO upon entry.  

After an hour and a half in line and explaining to the staff more than once that I was press AND was also on one of the performers' guestlists, I handed my business card to the people ahead of me in line when we started talking about my press cred.  THEY flagged a bouncer and explained the situation.  After an HOUR AND A HALF of standing on 8th Ave, I was finally ushered into the club by a ?manager" with many apologies.  However, when I got inside and explained to the man at the desk that I was actually on a guestlist I was still soaked for FORTY DOLLARS.  

For my 40 samolians, I got one number from each of the headliners after waiting almost 3 hours for them to go on.  During that time I tried to find a spot to be comfortable, wandering over a sticky floor and being shoved by more than one aggressive patron who apparently failed to notice I'm not a teenager.  In fact I'm well over 35 so I don't push back too well. 

After the show, the complete lack of organization continued with security shoving me back up against the bar and continuing to tell me to move back.  Um honey that bar ain't goin' nowhere.  Then the way they directed the people in line?  I just kept getting pushed back further.  So I didn't get to thank the person who invited me & put me on their list.  The ?manager? did check in with me a few times during the night and I admit I failed to tell him about the $40 cover.  But he did nothing to insure that I connected with people there that I should have been given much easier access to.  

In short, I will never go back.
Am from bk nd razors its not a gay club but they take u likr u r check it out

formatted_address: 156 Broadway, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Davidoff of Geneva

reviews.text: I'm a complete novice when it comes to smoking cigars but I felt completely welcomed in this space. The owners took time to explain the cigars and helped me and my group select a few. Beautiful, relaxing lounge

Absolutely outstanding and flawless customer service by Hassan Kelliehan! Ordered (from London, UK) these three cigars over the phone for a very close friend in NY and couldn’t  have dealt with anyone better than Hassan. His patience, knowledge and genuine willingness to help and assistance was fabulous and fantastic. Thanks Hassan and Davidoff for your outstanding member of staff and products you have to offer! From London UK

Constantly here, love the place and atmosphere. Natalie is great always takes care of you !. I just wish the ventilation system were better and bigger location for more seats !. Friday and saturday can get packed but still overall great location.

Davidoff of Geneva is a wonderful place to not only relax and unwind with cigars, but also a spot to get a group of friends together to enjoy each others company. The staff is kind, caring and so helpful. Natalie is superb and makes sure that you are always taken care of no matter what.

I would highly recommend this spot for anyone looking for a wonderful cigar experience with a great atmosphere.
Cool spot, but too bright!  They need to dim those lights.  The STAFF - Natalie & Hassan always makes you feel welcome...

formatted_address: 10 Columbus Cir, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Bluebird London NYC

reviews.text: The restaurant is gorgeous. The colors are vibrant and the chairs are comfy. The staff is friendly and will assist with anything requested. The hot chocolate I had tasted like it was a no-frills store brand variety. It was a definitely hard to finish but I was craving the hot chocolate so I took what I could get. The turkey club was nice but forgettable. The cheddar bacon biscuit was the true winner of the morning. The biscuit itself is a bit dry but the syrup delivers a 1,2 3 punch. I would go back for the ambiance and that biscuit.

Came here for breakfast with a view. 

Reception staffs very attentive. Nice bar, nice contrail. 

Had the French toast option, although very sweet, I enjoy it. Ask for extra bacon lol. 

This isn’t a hot option, they have plenty on the menu, including their take on the English breakfast. 

The restaurant is situated on the 3rd floor of the shopping mall. 

Ask to be seated by the window, I’m sure the view only gets better with the seasons.

Stunning space overlooking Columbus Circle with something for everyone—breakfast, lunch, dinner, afternoon tea & cocktails. Great for meetings or dining out with friends or a date. I work around here so I come quite often... it’s so nice to enjoy a refreshing Gin & Tonic after a long day. Their Afternoon Tea is a must!

Super cute and make a mean martini. What more is there to love? Oh the chef having a stash of marmite on hand.

Oysters were plucked straight from the sea and the complimentary, fresh sourdough bread soothes the soul.

Duck kale salad was excellent,
The dressing was light w little sweetness. The duck was well prepared   good firm texture but less flavorful than typical.
The house made butter is fluffy and nice salty flavor for British style baguette, rock solid w soft and chewy inside.

formatted_address: 432 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: UNO Pizzeria & Grill

reviews.text:
Found this place on our last day of our trip and really enjoyed it. The decor is fantastic and had a real warm feeling to it
 The staff were great and very helpful and looked after us while we were there. The food was up there with the best we've had in New York the deep dish pizza was amazing. Would certainly come back if I came out to New York again.

I go to UNOs for a nice lunch after church or right after work for a cocktail and appetizers. 
 The bartenders are professional,  pleasant,  kind and friendly. The pizza,  salads and even the fish are tasty and filling. 
This UNO is kind of my go-to casual (but not fast food) restaurant.

One of my favorite places to get pizza. Good portions, hot food, and great happy hour. Great place to catch any game, they got TVs all throughout the bar. And a good place for date night or meet up with some friends. Definitely come through if your in the area.

My boyfriend and I came in the other day to grab dinner and we we kindly welcomed by the hostess, Rae. She was so sweet and helpful! She answered all of my questions about the menu and we were quickly seated. I forget our servers name, but the service was also great and the food was delicious. We will definitely be back when we are in NY again.

I had visited on a Saturday late afternoon. Very close to museum of natural history. This place was quite full. I ordered for a thin crust pizza , it was tasty. However their specialty is in deep dish Chicago pizza. Staff are courteous.

formatted_address: 140 Schermerhorn St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Black Walnut

reviews.text: Pretty good place. Tor is a pretty good bartender along with all the others but he was there the most. The roasted chicken is delicious.
Trendy hotel bar with an inventive cocktail list. Great happy hour prices.

Shockingly amazing food at an almost deserted hotel restaurant. I was expecting mediocre at best and was blown away. Every course was great and NOT generic. I’d go here again if I was in the area even if I wasn’t at the hotel

Excellent cocktails and surprisingly good food. Ambiance is typical hotel lobby bar, but the decor is nice.

The only issue is the staff. Stayed here for four days and experienced extremely slow service and a generally apathetic attitude from all of the servers and bartenders. I've never been in a hotel bar so seemingly disinterested in serving people.
Great food and service! Small menu but everything we tried was delicious.

formatted_address: 43 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Special Club

reviews.text: What a great spot! I made a reservation for 1 through email, I thought it’d be a hassle but I was met with nothing but respect and kindness. The staff was very friendly and gave me the option to sit at the bar or a table. I eventually moved to a table because the bar has a poor view. The show was great! It was a very talented surf rock band. I hope I get the opportunity to visit again.

From the folks that brought you Tokyo Record Bar and Niche Niche, run don't walk to make a reservation at this new gem. Had a nice loungey LA burlesque lounge kind of vibe. Great live musicians led by Alphonso Horne with decent wine/sake cocktails and fun nibbles.
Great music, great vibe, cozy setting and the wine & cocktails were pretty up there as well. Fun place to go after dinner.

The stage looks a little cheesy, but the rest is pretty legit.  We happened to go on a night where they had some last minute changes to the singer, unfortunately the replacement was fine but not great.  The waitress said they had some really good talent coming through on most nights.  Great little place to taken visitors, I'll probably go again myself.  All the staff were helpful & came by frequently.  

I would get dinner before going & make sure you get a drink before you head down.  If they aren't ready to seat you, they will have you sit in the wine cellar which has 2 large farm tables but it's no fun if you're dry.    We had the ham plate (a nice charcuterie ham) & cheese plate w/crostinis (small brie/camembert)  - note these are 2 separate menu items.  We asked for more crostini's without any issue & it was all tasty.

Overall, we had no issues and everyone was super friendly especially if you are nice to them.  Last tip, the entrance is through Niche Niche & down the stairs.
Loved the vibe and the jazz was killer

formatted_address: 619 St Johns Pl, Brooklyn, NY 11238, USA
name: Rio Kitchen & Wine

reviews.text:
We celebrated a birthday during one of their weekend brunch hours. The staff were very accommodating and keep the table alive!  Our server was very nice and a natural comedian. If I am doing a birthday in the near future, I would think of coming here again for sure. 

They have a nice atmosphere as well. Definitely would recommend.

I ordered a burger and asked for them to omit the mayo but it looks like the kitchen accidently put it on and scraped it off.. it was all over the pickles and on the bun ... I only asked them to exchange the pickles that were covered in mayo instead of returning the whole thing to make it easier for everyone which they accommodated at first.  I wasn't planning on eating the top bun anyway but they ended up charging me extra for the pickles.  When I asked about the extra charge the server who handed us the check was kind of rude about it and kept acting like he didn't understand what we were saying.  

I did ask for pineapples on my burger but was not told it would be an extra charge which would have been fine either way.  When we asked if the charge was for the pineapples we were told it was for the pickles.  Again my pickles were drenched in mayo which I asked to be omitted in the first place as I don't eat mayo. 

It's more about the principle than the extra charge but I found that very annoying and not sure I want to go back.  Our original server was nice hence the 4 star rating  otherwise it would definitely be a 3. The second server definitely tainted the experience for me and my friend.   The decor and ambience was nice overall.

Great atmosphere, came here for a birthday brunch, our server Roma was very attentive and welcoming. He was on point with our bottomless mimosa and timely with the food. The food was great, and the staff was amazing. Been coming here for since they have opened and never been disappointed. It’s a vibe here, love it. Come visit and ask for Roma ♥️

So appreciate that this place is around the corner from my new apartment but we'll worth the trip even if I wasn't a local! I spoke several times to my boyfriend about how I felt like we were in some other location other than bustling NYC. We enjoyed the decor, live acoustic guitar player, drinks, food, and overall price point. Decadent vibes but reasonably priced. Our server Roma was on point and hospitable. Can't wait to return!

Rio is great! They have a great menu with a wide variety of new American options. The brunch is especially good. Staff is friendly and the service is very quick. they have a full bar available as well. Great hidden gem of crown heights!

formatted_address: 710 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: Boilery

reviews.text: I love seafood and the boilery always has a fresh catch. The service is amazing!!! Brandon is very knowledgeable and makes great suggestions on the menu, the drinks make all the taste buds in your mouth dance. The food is so full of flavor ...I did mention it’s fresh!!! I’ve tried other boil spots but they aren’t even worthy of the mention as The Boilery is #1!!! The location is perfect, never a long wait, amazing service, beautiful ambiance. The music played are timeless and classic hits, and the food and drinks are top quality!! The owner Alex he is very pleasant and personable!!!!
The broiled salmon is outstanding.  The service was adequate not as good as the food. Fantastic wine and atmosphere.  The red velvet cake was absolutely delicious.

Been twice already.  Shared a 5lb boil first visit, king/queen boil second visit. Wife had fried combo.   Had garlic butter sauce on both boils.  Well prepared food.  Only little complaint is second visit butter garlic had hella garlic in it that was a bit overwhelming.  Next time will get on side to dip, not have whole boil soaked in it.  Was still good.   4.5 stars.
Great seafood, happy hour appetizers and drinks oh my!

Decent prices and great food, I usually order 1/2 lb of crab at other spots not knowing if I’ll enjoy the food or not but I decided to order 1 lb of crab and I was so surprised by how much I liked it. The wine selection is great as well, thanks for the amazing food and great service !

formatted_address: 803 Washington St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Kava Cafe

reviews.text: The coffee is good and even in the very late afternoon I could taste the croissant was fresh. Well, fresh in the morning. The cafe is somewhat hidden and the music a bit on the loud side coming from the radio, ads included, thus 4 stars. And oh, if I sit at the bar... It would be possible to bring me my coffee, but alas, no. So three stars it is. I'll still come again.
Small but very nice place. Nice, friendly staff and amazing food. But most importantly damn great coffee ☕!
Good coffee and fast service! Also perfectly steamed my almond milk.

When I think about the quintessential neighborhood coffee shop, Kava is my first choice. I live in the Meatpacking and am so happy to call this place my local coffeeshop. Kava is one of those rare, cozy, beautifully designed coffee shops that blends the spirit of the Meatpacking, inspires interaction and has truly incredible coffee. The space is thoughtfully designed to look like a 1960s-cruise ship, and offers a variety of roasts from Colombia & Ethiopia. I almost always order the latte which is the perfect blend of caffeine and deliciousness, but sometimes I also get a cappuccino. Super chill in the afternoon as they have a beer and wine happy hour-- so it's great for dates as well.
Got a delicious keto decaf iced coffee with sugar free vanilla syrup and managed to charge my phone and people watch. Right next to the Highline

formatted_address: 186 9th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Pastai

reviews.text: Came for a late dinner on Saturday as we wanted some homemade pasta. Searched Google and found this restaurant that's opened till 1am on weekends. Am not disappointed. Their pasta is very tasty, and the sauteed asparagus very flavorful. I ordered the lobster, spinach and fried artichoke tagliatelle and surprised to find many lobster meat in it. I would definitely recommend this hidden gem if you are in the Chelsea area.

Lovely little place with delicious food. Not amazing but simple and good flavor. Not five stars because portions were on smaller side, no bread as appetizer like many Italian places, and they overcharged us on bill on accident. Still, we would come again!
Fresh ingredients, fantastic service, food is truly delicious! Best Italian spot in Chelsea by far.
Love it here. Cozy, neighborhood place, excellent fresh pasta and delicious wine. Beautiful atmosphere, great service. They don't rush you. Perfect portions. Highly recommend!

Pastai NYC is amazing. Wow. And the prices are modest. I almost don't want to tell you this place is good because I don't want my new favourite pasta place to become crowded. As is, it feels like a neighborhood spot from the relaxed nature and the prices and the kind staff. Don't find many spots like this anymore.

formatted_address: 11 Times Square, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Bluestone Lane Times Square Coffee Shop

reviews.text: Aussie style cafe chain with very good coffee. The oatmeal and acai bowls are a nice quick breakfast or snack. This locations pumps out orders quick, which is very much appreciated during the morning rush. There's a decent amount of seats but if often crowded on weekday mornings. You can use the Level Up or their app to pay and earn loyal rewards.

Convenient location and reasonable price for standard fare and ample seating. We ordered 6 drinks and they came out fast even though there was just one person running the counter and making coffee at the same time. If you have a sweet tooth the hot chocolate is not for you.
Another branch of Bluestone right in Times Square. Tucked away close to 8th avenue and 41st, and wasn't crowded at all. Had a cappuccino and a lamington. Delicious!
Great atmosphere. There are plenty of drinks to choose. The staffs are helpful and friendly. The view is great, and it is also close to public transportation.

I'm from Sydney and this felt like home... pictures of Bondi on the wall but better than that was the excellent coffee and the awesome selection of gluten free healthy & not so healthy treats! Definitely recommend.

formatted_address: 130 W 3rd St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Fat Black Pussycat

reviews.text: I love this place! It provides a variety of entertainment at any given time. Good eats, good drinks and always a nice crowd and atmosphere! Most importantly security is top notch, friendly but stern! I frequent here often I love it!
Nice spot to grad a drink. Was my first time and I liked the atmosphere. They have a pool table and darts. Amazing chandelier, friendly staff. Will definitely come back

Far back in the days before the dawn of fancy cocktail bars, this place was a heaven for most of the kids I went to grad school with (obviously aged greater than 21 :)). I've been a loyal visitor for almost 7 years and I try to drop by once in a while just to reminisce old times.

Amongst the pros, this place magically seems to have all the space to accommodate large groups on the craziest of Friday nights no matter how packed it is :). I don't recollect ever paying an entry fee to get in but times might have changed. The drinks are fine, service is commendable and the music's straight out of your Billboard top 50.

None the less, a place to have a solid time with a large group during peak hours.
Nice bar. Modest prices. Friendly service and staff. Had an absolute blast sitting here, drinking beer, talking with wife and bartenders.
Like it for friday night.  American pool, darts, some cute cabins for diner and looong bar. What i really like its decorations and huge lamps in interior. Can be crowded time to time.

formatted_address: 781 5th Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Harry Cipriani®

reviews.text: What a place. So authentic and was fun to watch people around me.  The food was somehow different than we had for Italian.  How should I describe it? Hm. You should try. The Sea Bass and the Spaghetti we ordered were fabulous. The Calamari can be better in other places.  Fabulous service!!

I have no idea why people rate this restaurant 4 stars.  Mostly all tourist that don’t know otherwise.  The food is average and the prices are ridiculous. Plan on spending $150 for two people.  The portions are small and as an Italian the food Is below standard.  Save your money and go somewhere else that’s not in this area.   It’s by the Plaza Hotel and Central Park so I guess they think they can charge outrageous prices.  Go to little Italy instead.  You will get authentic Italian food that’s delicious and save yourself a bundle.

Food is 3 stars but ambience and service are 5 stars. The food is very plain and not flavorful. The broccoli had no flavor at all- no garlic, no olive oil, no salt. The fish was good but the veal ragu was watery. For the price, the food should be better. But the ambience and service are excellent!!

Very attentive wait staff. My son was in shorts and their dress code doesn't allow however they provided slacks for him. A little on the pricey side however those were the best French toast I ever had.

Four for food but NYC tipping culture  is obscene.  The waiter had the cheek to highlight the recommended tip options on our bill despite me giving him 20 dollars on a 205 dollar bill. Why should customers pay these restaurant owners to employ waiters. Disgusting

formatted_address: 203 E 10th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: ChikaLicious Dessert Bar

reviews.text:
Dessert course for $19 and $9 for tea. $28 + tip for decent dessert. it is very tiny space so you might not have high-tea/afternoon tea type of luxurious time here. Many people are waiting while you are eating. You feel rushed. 

Also tea quality was disappointing. 
Presentation was great but tea quality was not so great. It’s very unfortunate. Hope staff learn how to brew better. 

Cheesecake was pretty good.

This is such a wonderful place for a date night, girls' night out or any special celebration. It is small but the tight space allows you a close up view as the chef assembles and plates each dish. There are two tables for small groups but the counter seats are the best in the house. The desserts were artfully presented. A definite must try.

Stumbled upon this place and was pleasantly surprised by the whole experience! Loved every single bit of it! We really enjoyed sitting at the bar and seeing how our desserts were being prepared! Will definitely come back and would 100% recommend it to anyone with a sweet tooth!

Where else can you go for dessert and get appetizer, main and dessert set course? This small but cozy place does exactly that. You are presented with menu to pick you main dessert dish (about $28) and you'll be also given an appetizer and dessert. I love the idea of this. Also their cheesecake is awesome!

Absolutely amazing experience.  A little expensive for just desert, but well worth it.  You don’t get to have black pepper sorbet with tomato jelly every day!  The cheesecake was smooth and probably one of the best I’ve had.  I also tried the chocolate tart (delicious!) and despite the location being small it was an enjoyable experience.

formatted_address: 44 W 44th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Forty Four

reviews.text:
We ordered a few starters at the restaurant in the hotel here.

The staff were really brilliant, when we indicated that we wanted to share the soup, it was bought out to us in 2 portion to make it easier which is service that I did not expect!

Between the 2 of us we ordered 3 starters and we were stuffed by the end of the meal.  The food was great and the portions were massive! 

The wine was also very nice, however expensive! So be aware of this if you choose to eat here.

We definitely enjoyed it and thought that the service was very good too.
Nice atmosphere and good food and service. Loved the burger for lunch.
Cool swanky interior decor and pleasant breakfast spot.

Music was too loud. Food was really mediocre. For a veg pasta that costs $24 it really didn't live up to expectations. Had to send the pasta back because it was wayyyyy to salty. Not just a little salty. But like sea water salty. Molto terribile. Nice decor but that's about it.
Great lunch place for a meeting or quiet conversation.  Crazy at dinner time so just go for drinks if you dont need to talk to your companion.

formatted_address: 270 Metropolitan Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Tipsy Scoop

reviews.text: To be honest, I never thought I would love this place as much as I do.  This was my first time there too.  The ice cream flavors are delicious and they have alcohol in it!  I recommend the Mango Margarita, Glenlivet Hot Toddy, or the Santa's cookies and Whiskey. It's a small location but that's not a big deal.  The girl that took care of us was really nice and helpful.  I will definitely come back.

This place was amazing!! Went for the 2 Hr Boozy Sundae Making class and was astounded the ice cream and sorbets were delicious and the staff was super friendly in helping us make choices. So worth it and definitely coming back !!!

The long narrow establishment is was well-lit in the evening when I went--a bright, fresh space decorated with fun, vibrant icecream decor. There are about 10 high chairs by the front for seating. It is very clean and eye-catching. Beside dessert, they sell souvenirs and some candy. I treated myself and order two scoops in a waffle bowl a d enjoyed every spoon and bite. I look forward to treating myself again here.

So excited to finally have a Tipsy Scoop location in Brooklyn!! Love their variety of flavors and the presentation of the final product (very Instagrammable). Extra kudos to the super friendly staff! Whether you’re in Brooklyn or Manhattan, make sure to swing by - you won’t regret it!
My wife and I planned my mother-in-law's 65th birthday here. She loved it so much she couldn't stop thanking us. The selections was great and the flavors were superb. Would definitely this place.

formatted_address: 560 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Sidecar

reviews.text: It was just okay to me. Fried chicken was okay. Kale tasted like sugar was added. My cheeseburger was slightly overcooked... My tap beer was put into a brandy glass. I was told that since the IPA beer was 8 % it was a smaller pour... A first for me.... I'd give them another shot though as atmosphere was nice and service was good.

What a lovely place! The amazing bar tender, Dimitri, recommended the Sidecar Club and I am glad he did. It was very delicious. The meat was piled high, the sauce was just right, and the bread was amazing. Coolest spot on the block!
I love this place the food was good and the ambience was super calm and chill. for those who don’t like kale you should try their kale it’s pretty good. 🥰
Other Half on tap and a filling Gumbo dish is reason enough; fried chicken is a must-try.  Good for small groups.  And cool old Spyhunter cabinet but game not working.
Local spot. Fine place for food or drinks with daily specials and great interior. Brunch is fine too. Much much much Cheaper options in park slope but does a good job at quality.

formatted_address: 228 7th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Chocolateria

reviews.text: What a great, unique place! Delicious and truly unique hot chocolate. All of the pastries are vegan, if you’re into that. Pleasant staff. Wonderful ambiance. Very cozy
Had a great herbal tea but don't remember name. Friend love the hor chocolate. Very cozy in there. Cool bathroom.

Stunning. I’m not sure what other word suffices. Exceptional hot chocolate and pastries, phenomenal chocolates, warm atmosphere and perfect service — plus comfortable chairs in which to sit. If you are in Park Slope, go today. You won’t regret it.

I've been here several times. Imagine coming here on a Saturday and listening to several teenagers discussing philosophy and Kant over $100 of coffee and chocolates.  The patrons are fine and well behaved and there's no rowdiness. If they're wealthy enough to sit around and consume small $6.50 cups of coffee and tea, it's good for the economy and I think it's wonderful for everyone. 

I do always sense some rushed negative energy from the woman who works there - even when there is no line. It's like she wants me to order and get the heck out as soon as possible. I'll walk in and immediately hear her say "Are you ready to order?" and if I order immediately - she'll cut me off and say "okay great is that all?" even if she sees someone with me.

I mean - i'm spending $25 for two cups of tea and two pieces of chocolate but she needs me to order and get the heck out of line within 5-10 seconds! It's absurd. My only conclusion is one I don't want to make. Although I always come in here well dressed...i'm always going to look out of place compared to 99% of the patrons here.
The sweetest staff and balanced chocolate. A great place to hop on WiFi, or indulge your pallet.

formatted_address: 13 E 37th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Café China

reviews.text: I did take out from this place three days in a row. Their service is quick and the price is inexpensive. There is no wait time usually even at lunch time. The atmosphere is great too.

This place is busy !! Reserve ahead before getting here. You won’t be disappointed. I loved spicy chicken and dumplings here. Their mapo tofu is good too. My friend ordered duck tongue and it was relished well. They have a good selection of cocktails too which I would definitely recommend. The staff and servers were pleasant and hospitable. This place will see more of me soon.

Reasonable price, well-done dishes, good service, nice setting. I wouldn’t say it’s mind-blowing (some Michelin one star def do a better job), but it’s pretty awesome! Definitely one of the most authentic and good Chinese restaurant in town

This place is doubtless one of the finest place to eat in the region. Every time I come to this place I am incredibly happy. They preserve their high  standard service and the topmost level of dishes  they provide. You can never go wrong with this restaurant. Warmly  recommended.

From the first moment  you come to this restaurant  team give you an enjoyable feeling. Very courteous hosts, it is a nice restaurant to go out with buddies or with your date. Great  cuisine, professional  chef de cuisine, comfortable  price and excellent  service. Warmly recommended.

formatted_address: 24 E 81st St, New York, NY 10028, USA
name: Sistina

reviews.text: Such a wonderful lunch spot before/after a few hours at the met. Went with our two kids, 5 and 6, and they treated us so well, perfectly splitting orders for the kids, serving delicious specials, and doing it all with some of the best service we've experienced in awhile. Very pleased with our random find of this lovely restaurant

Starved to death after 5 hours at MET and head here directly on a chilly evening. Ambience environment and high quality food. Best mushroom soup ever. Cod fish very fresh and yummy. Good selection of drink too. Drop by and give yourself a treat after enjoyment at MET!

Excellent restaurant!!! Got there 30 minutes before our reservation. Sat at the bar a had a few drinks. Table was ready 5 minutes before our reservation time. Upon seating menu came to the table. We decided to go with a 4 course dinner. Plenty of choices, and wide wine selection. Food was outstanding, really authentic old school Italian food with a modern twist. Servers are very nice and know their menu from A to Z. It's a must go for food lovers. Not cheap but I don't mind when food/service is this good. Thanks Sistina, will be back.

Don’t miss this Italian Beauty just a block from The Metropolitan Museum. 
After a few hours of looking at relics you can devour lovely pasta, prosciutto, bolognese and so much more. 

Pro Tip: 
- listen closely to the daily specials, there are some true gems in there.

I have tried bone marrow in so many places and countries, specially in Mexico where it's a big thing, but the one at Sistina is hands down the best I have ever tried, big bone, with a lot of marrow masterfully cooked and the addition of the truffles gave it an incredible taste, the oysters were superb as well, for main entrees we had the pasta with lobster fra-diablo and the salmon special for that day.... excellent presentation and flavor...we had to attend a concert so we didn't have time to enjoy dessert, coffee or after dinner drinks, the servers were attentive without being pushy.... this restaurant is a gem...
Some reviews say that is expensive, but when you want quality, it has it's price... keep the good job... we will be back

formatted_address: 220 12th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: The Tunnel Nightclub

reviews.text: Event was a scam and it was very unorganized and messy DONT RECOMMEND!!!
good place to enjoy
Good

formatted_address: 520 Henry St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Bar Bruno

reviews.text: Love eating at Bar Bruno when we are in town to visit family. The food was wonderful. Great tacos and amazing soups.  A fun and cozy place. Thanks to Sabrina for excellent and friendly service!
Tried fish and shrimp taco, along with chicken quesadilla. Very tasty with unique sauce. The kale dipping is amazing. Pleasant crew that makes you feel comfortable.

This is a local place. No one is going to come far away to this isolated area. Their Bruno burgers with fries are awesome. Their soups are great. Their fish tacos are great. The menu is small but every item on it is great quality.

I enjoyed it! A little on the pricier side of things, but the environment, service, and food were excellent. I had a very upbeat, attentive server for brunch on Sunday; the coffee was excellent, and their carnitas tacos were juicy and delicious.

The overall grade is a solid A-
Nice neighborhood Mexican spot, decent cocktails and food. Nothing outrageous. Service was fine

formatted_address: 936 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: The Ellington

reviews.text: Food is awesome especially the fries would highly recommend this place and did I mention how awesome their fries are. Service was exceptional, restroom was clean, dining atmosphere was relaxed and refreshing. Prices were  very reasonable. Enjoy and we might see you in there as will be going back for sure.

Waiter was nice and attentive. The wings were yummy though a bit dry, which is why I can't give them 4 stars. The vibe was chill for a Thursday night, which made it easier for my friend and I to have a nice conversation.
cute finger food spot. nachos were amazing, hugely portioned. wings were great, so was the spiked lemonade. loved the candle and dim ambiance.
Great Place. Friday evening with live music. Friendly service and great cocktail and food.

I enjoyed my brunch meal here - the braised pork toast with spicy hollandaise. And the service is excellent, and the prices good by NYC brunch standards. But my family was less than pleased. First, the eggs benedict florentine (second photo below) had an unnecessary spinach-infused hollandaise sauce that doesn’t taste much like hollandaise at all, and isn’t explained on the menu (we had to ask for some of the real stuff on the side). And the salmon eggs benedict had smoked salmon that was a little too fishy - lox would have been much better. The steak and eggs (pictured) were pretty good, but not super special. We really wanted to love this place, especially since the kids walked past here to school for two years.

formatted_address: W 43rd St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Ego Pub Crawl Inc.

reviews.text: It was a good experience, we always had the best care, the itinerary was very complete, in addition to the time they gave us in the places we visited was more than enough, totally recommend traveling with Ego, you may know all the places you want of NY, I would travel with them again

formatted_address: 286-276 Park Ave S, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Guatemalteco

formatted_address: 221 N 4th St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Golden Years

reviews.text: Great looking place. Drinks are adequate but the wait for the food can be quite long.

I finally came here for the first time and it was very nice. Nice bartender who doubled as the waiter (it was a slow time) we got the burger and chicken sandwich and both were very good. And I'm very picky about both, and they we're both good quality meat. The chicken was a bit spicy and the burger was fully cooked (most people ignore my request for well done) and tasted like it was actually made fresh on a grill.  They have a limited menu but it covered enough options and had a few brunch like items on the lunch menu. Nice atmosphere and I'll have to check out the back yard in the nicer weather. A bit pricey but I guess it matches the quality, I'll still go back.

Super chill bar in Williamsburg. Not really a dive bar vibe but very relaxed and a great atmosphere to sit back and catch up with a friend. Service was friendly and prompt. Also, the real MVP is the Oslo Iced Irish Coffee. Delicious AF.

Golden Years is a pleasant bar and restaurant in this part of Brooklyn.  

The music selection was mostly in an 80s and 90s post-punk type of vein, which I enjoyed.  

The bartender wasn’t particularly friendly but was efficient.  

The cocktails were good and the veggie kielbasa was solid, too.

This place was freaking great! My family and I were wandering around Brooklyn one night, trying to catch a bite to eat and stumbled upon this bar. Little did we know that they had great food and a really cool backyard for seating. The staff was very friendly and kind and the service was fast. If I'm ever back in the area, I will definitely have to stop by!

formatted_address: 76 Forsyth St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: The Points Wine & Ale Room

reviews.text:
Great service , friendly , and food is delicious.
Best Mexican food in NY
I love this little place! Very low key. Always a good beer menu. Super friendly staff. Great prices, too. Foosball table, karaoke machine. How can you go wrong?
Found this place while waiting for Spicy Village. Solid selection of beers and the bartender was super friendly.
Great variety of beer, wonderful service and great place to stop by before and after dinner!
Good food¡¡¡¡¡

formatted_address: 117 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Olive Tree Cafe

reviews.text: Great place.  Clean, Great atmosphere. Healthy food. Great service and deserts.  Great Live music on Fridays and Saturdays nights after 9:15 P.M.  If you like comedy. They have a comedy room in the basement.  Here is where they choose all the cast of Saturday Live before they become famous.  Get there early or reserve a table on line.  You'll keep coming back again and again. Drinks are a bit expensive so drink water or soda instead and drive home safely.  Enjoy.✌

I would come back only because of fantastic borscht! 
Steak was cold and tough. Tables are tiny, but waitress brought all dishes together(isnt soup has to be served first, and then entrees?).

Food is great, service is great. I love the silent movies playing in the background and the chalk board tables. I used to come here for the boozy warm beverages. They'll still make them, there just not featured on the menu.

i had nachos and beef borscht.

Nachos - big plate , worth the price

Beef borscht - small, only two chunks of beef.
                           Very few of cabbages, carrot.
                          Meat is very good tho. Not worth
                           The price.

Our waitress was very very annoying.
She came to our table like 9 times!!! Saying if we were done while we were EATING !!
Cant she even see ?? 
It would have been nicer if she just ask us to leave asap if we are not ordering more.
We werent sitting for long and no people waiting to be seated.

Very uncomfortable place to eat.

We love coming to Olive Tree Cafe right by NYU and Washing Square Park. The place itself is a relic of New York. Continuously playing old videos and live bands on the weekend cant be any better. 

Over here we got the hummus platter which comes with all the sides making it a perfect shareable plate. Olives, hummus, tahini, salad and the perfect toasted pita chips. 

Also, came two chicken sewers that for a little extra adds to the flavor of a true Mediterranean dish. They have a full bar as well so best get a drink!

formatted_address: 115 Broadway, New York, NY 10006, USA
name: Trinity Place

reviews.text: The atmosphere was great! Not every day that you can dine inside a bank vault!  Had the turkey burger with a side of fingerling potatoes and they were delicious ... I did not leave hungry.  The staff was very attentive.

Last night, my date and I had a wonderful evening at this incredible restaurant. The atmosphere is romantic, slightly casual but slightly fancy, somewhere in the middle. The service was impeccable especially by our server whose name was Gerson! We could not have asked for a better server.

friendly, attentive service. lively place with good seating options. cocktails were decent. food was good with very generous portions but not evenly seasoned. primarily under seasoned. need salt and pepper shakers on the table. potatoes with the burger were very hard and extremely crunchy.

Hospitality & customer service:  poor.  Not all the staff, just some and definitely the manager!  

Food & location:  good.

I was truly disappointed in how they treated my partner and I while there.  In fact, we cut our dining experience short because of the manager and went to an Italian restaurant around the corner where we had a wonderful time. I will never eat there again......

Patrick H.

Very neat location, old world NY charm, food amd portions were great. Everything was fresh and prepared carefully. Servers seemed stressed with group service but overall it was a very good experience. Would definitely revisit! Toffee bread pudding was A M A Z I N G!!!

formatted_address: 85 E 4th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: The Red Room at KGB

reviews.text: Really fun and unique spot. It’s in the old theater district. First floor is theater (I think), second floor is a bar and if you keep going on the third floor another speak easy bar with live music. The bartenders are very nice too and the place serves some great cocktails.

Located on the third floor of a nondescript building (first floor is a theater, second floor is the KGB bar). This little place was very cozy and has live jazz playing some nights. 
The cocktails were good, but I’d come back mostly for the music and the vibe

Nice and cool place to hang out and enjoyed a few good performances. Actually we ended up accidentally as we mixed the place with the next door “the new york comedy club” (unfortunately Harman Leon preferred to fill in his show than telling us, after checking our tickets, that we should be next door). Nonetheless we enjoyed even if we lost 60$.. Julia Whitehouse was great and very authentic! max white’s story was also pretty good about his friend Nick. Two more guys were also good but unfortunately cannot get their names as it seems that the program changed last minute. Leon’s performance was actually not funny. I’d rather laugh on a Thursday night rather getting anti-racism non funny messages. I liked the style of the club and the mood. Decent prices (we got a bottle of wine for 50$).
is there a red room in new york
We loved the music and wanted to go in but the bartender was so unwelcoming that we could not stay.

formatted_address: 631 Grand St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Thompson Brooke

reviews.text:
"We are touching each other's Bodies, but we are not even acknowledging each other's Soul"

That is the problem with modern day dating. Specifically in NY,  where the dating pool is so huge and competitive that no one really want to settle because there are just too many good choices.  Next one is ALWAYS better, so why settle?

I made history with this date, I had in mind to bring my next date to this restaurant because I loved the restaurant,  the food and their specialty the Mapple French Toast Doughnut. I knew that whoever I brought here, was going to love it too. Indeed,  I impressed him very much. You know, I do my research for my dating game, I make sure whoever I meet, is going to have one of the best time or dates in his dating history, otherwise,  why bother taking someone out, is all about the connection and experience,  wink, wink...

I saw an online article with the picture of their Mapple French Toast Doughnut and it looked tasty so I was very curious to try it. They say "Don't judge a book by its cover" well, I could judge the food by its picture. Omg! Do not die before tasting the Mapple French Toast Doughnut from this place #thankmelater.  This is one of a kind dessert,  it just taste so good and I got food high again, is a unique sweet soft taste, not too sweet just right. For my first visit,  I brought my son here and we both loved it. For my second visit I brought two friends and they also loved it. This place makes me feel at home, the Owner is so cool and friendly,  he welcomed me and my friends.  Carlos the waiter is also great with customer service, I asked him for soft red wine and he gave me one that was just perfect for the night.

The calm Aura of this restaurant makes it a perfect place to have a beer after work (done that), also the fact that  is not overcrowded makes it an excellent place to go.  The lighting at night set the tone for a highly Romantic Aura. My date loved that it wasn't over crowded or noisy as well. So there you go, I just published one of my top local spots for just about any type of meeting.

As for my date, he was the perfect man, Military training,  extremely Smart, 13 years of fighting technique experience,  he is a killing machine without a weapon,  yet not dangerous.  A mindful man, under control with an extreme inner sense of control.  The deal breaker,  he wants children and I don't.

The End.

I had a dinner salad and restaurant week menu. The portion of the salad is more like an appetizer. When I was there it was not busy but the server/bar tender wasn't really paying attention to the table so I would say it wasnt a good dining experience. But it would be great for burger and drink since their food was tasty.
Best lobster roll I’ve ever had! And they have CRAZY desserts- try the French toast donut (pictures) for SURE!

Super glad to have found this spot while strolling Grand trying to find some grub. The bartender, Monika, was super nice and also super talented at whipping up some super creative cocktails. The food was delicious, especially recommend the burger. Lastly, their prices are on point. For the same quality and vibe you’d expect to pay a whole lot, but you can really get fancy here and not blow out your wallet.
Drinks and food were nice. Diana (bartender) was great!

formatted_address: 34 W 46th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Via Brasil Restaurant

reviews.text: We came to this place for lunch. This place was recommended to us by a friend.  Well, we were not disappointed. The staff welcomed us with a smile and we felt good. The food was just great. We enjoyed every moment and we will definitely return to this restaurant. We recommend this place to all.

A bright and refreshing place to sit and enjoy a Brazilian meal. Our waiter was very attentive and he knew the menu well. He recommended a few authentic dishes and we all enjoyed our food. In the summer they have a small area outside that you can sit in for some fresh air.

This place is obviously one of the best restaurants in the region. Whenever I go there I am deeply satisfied. They always keep their high  standard service and the topmost level of cooking  they offer. You are always happy with this restaurant. Very  recommended.

I call this outstanding place every couple of days  as I like the special air that is outline this place. The staff is very welcoming and qualified. The service is extremely quick. Most important, the food they serve is good. I came often and I was always pleased. The price is fair. I recommend this place to to all.

We called in last night and had a really good dining experience. 
Warm welcome on arrival , drinks ordered and now down to the serious work of choosing our dinner. 
So for our starters it was the sausage and potatoes and my wife had the fish cake, both delicious. 
For our mains I had the house special ( the name escapes me ) which was a very deep cast iron pot of goodness full of different meats, black beans  and in a intense sauce accompanied with rice and veg , my wife had braised Brazilian beef in a red wine sauce. Both dishes cooked the perfection and packed with flavour. For desert we shared a coconut flan with prune sauce again very nice. 
The portions are very generous trust me on that. 
Our waiter ( tall chap with grey hair ) was attentive and engaging so thank you sir. 
We really enjoyed  our meal so no hesitation in recommending Via Brasil 10/10

formatted_address: Nanatori Japanese, 162 Montague St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Nanatori Japanese

reviews.text: Cozy and welcoming. The food was great. They have fair prices and good portions. I would recommend the yakitori (skewered chicken) box (comes with rice, soup, and salad). Personally enjoyed it and would recommend

I had a wonderful experience.  Went here last Saturday with a group of friends. The Dinner box special is a good deal because your getting a lot for a good value. The staff is friendly and welcoming. There is a variety of many suhi dishes and other meals on their menu . Next time I am sure I will try their dessert.
Best food, super nice staff members, always good character. They charge convenient rates and the food quality is great. Great work.
This spot is nice and roomy, the menu was delightful and the rates were very affordable. rapidly, effective service and very welcoming staff. Will definitely recommend this place.
Friendly staff and yummy sushi. Clean and prompt service. I come here anytime I'm in Brooklyn heights.

formatted_address: 135 Madison Ave floor 8, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Blender Workspace

reviews.text: I have limited experience with coworking spaces, but my time at Blender was thoroughly enjoyable. The space is beautiful and immaculate, and Scott and his team are effortlessly professional. This is an easy and inspiring place to work, I can't recommend it highly enough!
Great vibe. Not sure if there's another way up but the first time you go the elevator makes you very unsure... But it works and gets you to the spot!

EDIT: There is a new Events Director at this space, Jessica no longer works at Blender. Unfortunately, did not have a good experience with the new management and had to find a venue elsewhere. 

OLD REVIEW: five stars 
Blender Workspace is an aesthetically pleasing, charming and attractive space. My company recently held our Holiday Party at the bar lounge space at Blender. Everyone raved about how great the space was and asked how I found this gem of a venue in New York City. I can take credit for finding this venue but all of it wouldn’t have been possible without Jessica and her team at Blender. They helped with absolutely anything that was needed and was very patient through all the party planning and budgeting. If you are looking for a venue for a company party, happy hour for a client, an event with a speaker, or just want to get some work done and grab a coffee during the day… Blender Workspace is the rare find you’ve been looking for. I highly recommend this space and I recommend even higher the events director, Jessica.

I couldn't be more thrilled my experience with Blender space. I hosted the art and music event Trip N Draw and the Blender team was there to assist me from start to finish - from creating beautiful animations and graphics for promotional materials, to setting up all our AV gear, to arranging the furniture to suit our format. The Blender team was quick to respond to our needs and went above and beyond to ensure our guests had a wonderful experience. The space itself exudes luxury, with its bright natural light with large windows, chic furniture and decor, and expansive white walls. I will definitely be back for more events at Blender.
Beautiful space, decently quiet, great creative vibe and good coffee with almond milk. The $70 drop in day rate made my day in Manhattan work super smoothly.

formatted_address: 27 Broadway, Brooklyn, NY 11249, USA
name: Donna

reviews.text: Really great spot, not too crowded, rustic setting, great food and excellent cocktails. The staff were really friendly and provided fast and efficient service. Will definitely be back!

Came here for happy hour on Friday with a friend and it was such a lovely little spot. I love the decor and the service is really friendly. We got the frozes which were big and not too sweet. They also had a deal on tacos but we weren't hungry so I will be back to try those! Definitely a great place to meet someone for a drink.
Fantastic drinks, a fun atmosphere, and and all-around great place for late night fun. Highly recommend.

Lovely tacos. Beautiful space, but limited standing room. The cocktail menu is diverse and fulfilling. If you plan to host a group, make a reservation. They also have daily specials and DJ night. Again space is limited, so plan ahead!

Just not worth it. Music was extremely loud, making it impossible to hold a conversation- yet it is not a club... Cocktails were too sweet and food was below average. Overpriced, even for NYC, would not go back again

formatted_address: 581 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Mémé

reviews.text: Food was espectacular!!!!!! Everything we tried was better than the previous one!! And service was excellent! I will come back for sure!!

Delicious brunch spot in the heart of the village. Quality ingredients. Service was good and ambiance was phenomenal. Sitting outside was preferred, but there was a wait. Would definitely return for any brunch date.

Super good Mediterranean. Try the duck! Cozy. Reasonable. Very nice wine selection. Tables are a bit tight and can be a bit noisy. But it's fun! Wonderful staff too. Been here many times. Highly recommend.
Delicious tapas with a great menu. Tried the gnocchi, prosciutto wrapped figs and hummus. Delicious!
Meme is always a wonderful experience. Fun and funky ambiance. Great food. Great location.

formatted_address: 58 E 34th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: The Long Hall Pub & Grocery

reviews.text: This is surely one of the best restaurants in the area. Every time I come to this place I am truly satisfied. They hold their very high  level service and the highest level of meals  they give. You no doubt will love this restaurant. Highly  recommended.

A great find. The Long Hall is a top quality Irish pub that is also one of the top rugby bars in the city. My favorite pizzeria is next door and I've been putting off trying The Long Hall for months. But I'm glad I finally did. Great burgers, wings and ale selection.
Awesome food, nice employees, always fantastic atmosphere. They charge fair rates and the food quality is good. Highly recommended.
