We were there for the super bowl 2020 and it was a great experience.

Went here for trivia but also enjoyed a burger too. What was weird is this place apparently takes reservations for trivia?!

I walked in there and basically every table had a "reserved' sign on it. I had to wait and then luckily they said someone called to cancel their reservation so I got their table. But had that not happened, I don't think I would have been able to participate. 

What kind of a bar takes reservations?! This place isn't fancy or anything… just your average bar that also has trivia once a week. I mean I liked it here but I wouldn't go out of my way to make a RESERVATION for this place… I mean it isn't THAT good. 

It's a lot easier to just go to literally every other bar in the city without a reservation and do trivia there. But if you do want to go here, call ahead… otherwise you'll be without a place to sit. 

The burger and fries were fine. Nothing special though.

formatted_address: 1 Front St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Grimaldi's Pizzeria

reviews.text: A great no frills, sit down pizza restaurant. My girlfriend and I we're visiting the city and and trekked down after hearing good things from an old boss back home. Was not disappointed. Makes a great date spot, it looked like we were one of three dates there at the restaurant! Just remember to bring cash.

Delicious brick oven pizza! After a long day of walking and sight seeing it was the best place to end the night at. We got the 16" pizza half pepperoni and half cheese. Super yummy and fresh! Would definitely recommend. Prices very reasonable.

Good place to eat a pizza near the Brooklyn bridge. 
Also nice views to the bridge from second floor. Good quality, huge pizzas, very nice staff and reasonable prices. 
The pepperoni pizza we ordered was delicious. 
Definitely a must go in NYC.

Loved this pizza place! It was recommended by everyone and so we knew we had to go! A little bit of a wait (30 min - 1 hour). My husband and I celebrated our anniversary here. The pizza was really fresh, had a nice crisp crust, and was full of flavor. Also, a great price for the size of the pizza. They only take cash though, so come prepared!

Such delicious pizza!!! My brother lived in New York City for years, and suggested that we go here. We were lucky to get in with little to no wait. The pizza was such a perfect meal to eat before walking around for hours. I would highly recommend this place to all! ♥️🥰

formatted_address: 101 Luquer St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Folksbier Brauerei

reviews.text: Hearty, tasty beer selection. Cool ambiance. Chill and attentive staff. So glad we stumbled upon this place.

And now for something completely different. We came from right from Other Half and wanted something a bit more lowkey. Folksbier gave us exactly what we were looking for.

I enjoyed a very crisp and refreshing Festbier, followed by a tasty Witbier. Lots of dogs came through on that day, which I think the entire group loved. A couple got engaged while we were there too; congrats to whoever they are.

Just something to note, they don’t offer flights. It might not make sense for them financially, so I get that.

The beer selection is good, the atmosphere is laid back and friendly, and the snack options they have on the menu are great. The quesadilla and the chips and guac were delicious. The guacamole in particular was outstanding. Folksbier is worth checking out.

This is the perfect place to start your Red Hook brew tour. 
Always delicious beers and snacks. 
Great low-key vibe. 
Beautiful space.

Friendly staff and great beers. Lot of room to hangout with friends and the ambience is great.
Monday night is taco night

formatted_address: 1390 6th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Davidoff of Geneva

reviews.text:
Rare to be able to sit down and have a fine smoke in New York. Though once you are a client and explore the well furnished humidor, you can sit in their lounge and have a good smoking experience. 
Chris, provides a high level of expertise and an impeccable service. 
Now my to-go address for a moment with a serious cigar in this buzzing a loud city.
The staff and I are very dear friends. Their service is impeccable and the clientele are treated as very welcome guests and regulars like family. This is my home away from home. 🙂
Wonderful spot to enjoy a stick but lounge is small so seating may be tight. Great selection of cigars...not just Davidoff brand.

The staff is very knowledgeable and helpful. They have a nice lounge with comfortable seating, a silent tv for distraction an a large window onto 6th Ave. You do need to purchase your stick there to use the lounge, but why wouldn't you. They have a good selection of premium brands and the prices are what you would expect for Manhattan. If you're a cigar smoker, I suggest enjoying some time here. The accessory and humidor selection is top notch too.
Best place to hangout, friendly staff.  Our cigar chapter had a meet there and had a blast. My trusted guy there Carlos makes sure everyone is taken care of without fail!

formatted_address: 55 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Bluestone Lane Collective Café

reviews.text: A great place for brunch! The drinks are delicious as well as the food. The service is good but the seating is a bit cramped. A great place to catch up with a friend and eat yummy food!

Cute brunch space. Staff is great. AVOCADO SMASH W/EGG- was just average. COTTAGE CHEESE PANCAKES - Supposed to be light and fluffy, were heavy and had a burnt flavor. MIMOSA - Just average.

JACK SCALE 5/10

@AbiteOUTwithJACK
#AbiteOUTwithJACK
Ehhhh. Not bad but not that good either. I really enjoyed the vibe though. Avo toast was average and the sandwich was super dry. Coffee was good. Definitely a coffee place not a brunch place.
Great brunch! We were welcomed by a smiley and accommodating waitress and the service was great throughout. Food was excellent!!

Eh. Service was mediocre. Food was fine. Coffee was good. But everything was soooo expensive. And the shop is very small. Do not come here if you're wanting to do work. I recommend this place for eating and coffee only.

formatted_address: 760 8th Avenue Bet. 46th &, 47th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: The INKwell Times Square

reviews.text: I celebrated Valentine's/Birthday danced most of the night. Everyone was so friendly. Will come back during the summer.

How INKWELL 1st started for me my cousin Dawn had her party there 2 year's ago of June 2017 that's when I fell in love with INKWELL Then my cousin Dawn gave me a party here the same year in August of 2017 The Next following year 2018 my sister Cynthia and I gave a party for my sister Renee and cousin Yvonne the whole entire family was there we loved the food,music old school my thing and the crowd timing, near all transportation NYMTA, NJTransit and etc. and the main thing Guess what you don't have to clean up  I just love this place and I will make sure I tell everyone about it too. And It's Not over yet just the beginning for Brooklyn NY ❤️💪 💯 we're here I/We Family ,Friends,Co-workers and Ex Co-workers 
again We'll be in the house tonight I'm having my 56th Birthday 🎂 🎉 🎈 Party there again tonight 10/11/19 New York, New Jersey and PA in the house I Love It If you haven't experience your birthday here or someone else Party Set it up Now  Try it  Its Beautiful my Cuz Sabrina from New Jersey 1st partying in New York she loved it best place in NY ask somebody 😍🤣

Just celebrated my birthday last Friday with Inkwell at the COPA.  I had a great time and everything I asked for was done with my table location.  Kevin and Sha always make me and friends feel like family. The wings and patties were delicious.  Want to thank the hostess and the bday crew for doing a wonderful job.

We recently celebrated my sweetheart's birthday at The INKwell and we could not have been more pleased. From start to finish, there was an undeniable level of professionalism. Booking the night was easy via phone. They were responsive leading up to the event, as well as afterwards. We were extremely pleased with the service that night and the red velvet cake was a huge hit with our guests. Let's not forget the delicious wings! The music was awesome, as always, and the cosmos were superb. The video link we received after the event was a pleasant surprise. It's nice to know that we can treasure the night for years to come. We had a ball. No complaints at all! A++++
The INKwell is the only place I go to if I want to have a great time.  Snoop and I truly enjoyed ourselves on Valentine's night.

formatted_address: 55 Wall St 2nd Floor, New York, NY 10005, USA
name: Cipriani Club 55 Restaurant

reviews.text:
4.9? I came to this establishment as part of a restaurant week showcase. It was definitely a show case of the low quality of pasta that this place produces. Is ravioli usually drowned in olive oil or is this a New York tradition? There was apparently veal in there, but still didn't taste it by the end. My friend enjoyed the short ribs though - averages out to 1/5. Apparently, the two pieces of  broccoli were quite excellent. Perhaps this should become a sweetgreen. The picture is of the dessert that we were served. Very heavy on the cream, light on any flavour. Note that the darker layers are cake, and the rest is all cream. Very consistent with the rest of the experience. By the end, we thought we were on a prank show, since the food was a joke. 

So I got the receipt. 11 dollars for a bottle of water?
So good. The ambient and tastes are really good. Especially the beer of cipriani was awesome!!
I adore this restaurant very much. theres a romantic ambiance. The meals are great. the service is effective and the stuff is trained. The pay is decent. I highly recommend.

At the first moment  you enter that place  the stuff gives you a comfortable feeling. Very courteous hosts, it is a friendly restaurant to  enjoy with buddies or with your date. yummy  cuisine, specialist  chef, reasonable  price and nice  service. Warmly recommended.

Dead on a holiday evening. Only 2 tables of 2 ppl. 
Atmosphere was cold. I had requested gluten free deserts in advance. Nothing was available.
The food my friend ordered was supposed to be gluten free, until 10 minutes after ordering  the waiter came back telling us that there was gluten in the dish ordered. The alternative took again some time to cook. 
My fennel was very boring and lacked flavour. 
Mimosas were fine. Service was so-so. All in all nothing special and not a place I would visit again.

formatted_address: 34 White St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Petrarca Cucina e Vino

reviews.text: So Edward Hopper style. Relax,  eat well, have a refreshing Cocchi Americano and soda and a bottle from the wine list.
Great vibe at this really nice neighborhood Italian. Had the baby chicken which was really tasty. House white also very decent, so all in all, very happy and would recommend this place.
Nice ambiace, excellent service, very good wine list, and superb food. Highly recommend!

I've had dinner there several times with my sister. It's cozy warm setting with home made pasta, excellent service staff and food. The owner is pleasant and talks with patrons to get feedback. Definitely A GO TO place for fine Italian dining.

The food and fresh sangria were great! As a vegetarian, I appreciated the number of meatless entree items. (Elsewhere on our trip it was difficult to find more than one vegetarian option that wasn't salad or soup). The service was not good, and we were confused by the awkwardness. When we entered the restaurant, there was no host stand or person waiting by the door, and no sign saying wait to be seated or seat yourself. So after a few seconds we just sat down at one of several empty tables. The server comes over to give us menus, and asks if we will be there longer than 1.5 hours since he has a reservation. I thought it was a bit rude to phrase it that way, and we did not intend to stay that long, but whatever. We figured if he wanted us to move tables he could have just asked. We didn't have any problems, it just felt as if we were an annoyance to the staff, even though the place was nearly empty...

formatted_address: 369 W 16th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: TAO Downtown Nightclub

reviews.text: Service is extremely poor. The waitstaff think they’re better than you and treat you as if you you’re not good enough to eat at Tao. The food is alright, but $17 for fried rice??!? I don’t think so. Head to china town for far better and more authentic food that’s less than a quarter of the price. You’re paying for the atmosphere and aesthetic of the restaurant, which really is outstanding. Service or taste of food—not so much. Complete tourist trap don’t waste your money here.

One of our friends guaranteed us all (group of 8 friends meeting after 20years) that this place is something we will all like for sure. We were skeptical but boy he was right. The Thai temple based theme for the restaurant simply floored us all with its beauty. The elevated multi level restaurant architecture kinda brought memories of James Bond meeting a villain in a very elite place. The waitress was very cute and kind. She explained any and all questions about their menu of drinks. She also taught us how to drink a certain Redbull based cocktail. Wish we had reservation for the night club. Little pricey for getting last minute table at 1500$. I’d suggest booking one day in advance would be great to take your girl or friends there. Tao is the best restaurant I’ve been to so far. Just for their theme, it is awesome. Note: we sat right below the statue on the pic. So we might have come up in a lot of other people’s pics inadvertently lol.

I had a horrible time at TAO night club, I went there to meet a friend of mine that was already inside celebrating his best friends birthday who’s a producer and they had me waiting outside for longer than an hour. The bouncers take their jobs a little too serious, one was very rude and grabbed my cousin and I for no reason because he thought “that another bouncer or someone superior to him said that we weren’t allowed to go in”, after another bouncer told him that, that wasn’t directed towards us he let us go and did not even apologize. I thought that he was joking until I looked him in his eyes, I honestly did not even want to go in after that but I didn’t want to ruin the night more than the damage that was already done. I suggest you guys stay away from this place, I don’t want to make this about race but maybe because we’re black they gave us a really hard time.

Definitely a below average club, avoid. Crowd was mostly men, space was fairly small, music was mostly outdated, and worst of all, barman tried the usual scam of putting random drinks on tab (which is not uncommon in New York, be ware). When I argued I never had some of the drinks that appeared in my tab, they immediately removed some (see photos) but not all and I still ended up paying for more than what I had. On top, in addition to the 18% tip you agree to pay at entry when the doorman says you need to open a $150 minimum-spend bar tab for yourself and your girldfriend, they charge another 8% “admin” fee, so you really end up paying 26% on top of your actual bill, keep that in mind. It is also worth noting a small bottle of water (20cl) costs $9 (see receipts) and they don’t offer any tap water. Cloak room also costs another $5 per piece which you might think is ok, but it unfortunately also means that a lot of people will be dancing with their coats on.
The bouncer wad very rude and unprofessional. There were a lot of people complaining at the entrance.

formatted_address: 571 Lorimer St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Zona Rosa

reviews.text:
Sustainability: ✔️there’s an effort to reduce straw waste, but ✖️otherwise see didn’t see much effort to be sustainable. 

Food and drink: amazing food. Loved the fish tacos and seafood special. Would like to see that they’re sustainability harvested, but otherwise very good. 

Service: cold be more attentive, but got the job done. 

Value: on the expensive side.

Ambiance: very cool. Outdoor rooftop seating in the summer, greenhouse style seating on the second floor, there kitchen is in a refurbished car or something. Very tastefully decorated. 

Not my first time and definitely won’t be my last time at Zona Rosa.

Really good spot for a first date. The Good: ambiance is on point. The upstairs is a lot nicer than the downstairs. Margaritas are always good. The bad: food is overpriced, portions are small, and after trying several of their tacos, I can say they are bland. Go for happy hour when items are cheaper.

Went here for the first time with my best friend this weekend. Ambiance is super cute! We ordered the brunch plates with mimosas, food was solid/good but would order again. Staff was friendly, efficient. Flan was delicious, but on the small side for the price.

We've eaten here several times and never had a sub par meal.
Service has been a bit slow on occasion but the food is always excellent.
Everything I've tried there has been good, with some unique twists on typical Mexican dishes.
Great view from the 2nd floor  looking out over Metropolitan Ave.

Me and my gf went to this place on our date night. This is a really cool Mexican restaurant. We were greeted by a very friendly person which gave us a choice to sit upstairs or downstairs kitchen area. We went upstairs and it's really good. It's cozy and we loved the interiors. I suggest going upstairs only if you are a small party. They have a good menu. We ordered vegetarian tacos, vegetarian enchiladas and guac and chips. For drinks we ordered Tamarind Margherita, michelada, lemon and hibiscus mezcal and also don hulio aneja mezcal. One of the best micheladas I had in the US. Their preparation and taste is very close to authentic Mexican taste

formatted_address: 252 W 37th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Danceteria

formatted_address: 1090 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: The New York Basics

reviews.text: I ordered a medium latte and my friends heard it. I was given a small one and when I said that ordered a medium one the person who gave me not the one I ordered tried to prove it was what I ordered. It never happened to me anywhere else. Avoid this place by all means.. there are so many coffee shops around that would give you what you ordered and definitely wouldn't say it was what you ordered
Friendly staff, very good spot for brunch! Loved the food and drinks, and cozy little shop! Will come again!

NEVER AGAIN!

The best part of the meal was the drinks; the food - if you can call it that - was served on polystyrene plates with different coloured plastic knives and forks.

I ordered crêpes which looked and tasted as if they were microwaved, the pesto was anything but pesto; we also ordered bagel omelette sandwich which had a piece of rubber squeezed between two raw pieces of bread...

It was a wholly unpleasant experience and I recommend you never visit here!

My best friend and I quite literally live at this place and treat it like our extended kitchen. It's the perfect spot at all hours of the day. They have a very wide selection of food, and the best coffee. Ask for the Nesfrappe made by Bobby (it's my new favorite). It's a great spot to study - they even have one one outlet in case your laptop runs out of battery. 10/10 recommend!

I absolutely love this place. The food is amazing and the staff is wonderful. Bobby was very accommodating and kind. The Crosby is my favorite I’ve had it three days in a row and I am very picky! Thank you for your great food and service!

formatted_address: Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10030, USA
name: The Dark Tower

formatted_address: 136 Division St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Bacaro

reviews.text: Had dinner here last week. Very pretty restaurant with two floors, though main dining is downstairs. The food was fine, except for the broccoli rabe which was way over cooked. The staff was superior and immediately said they would cook up another batch or take it off the bill. The dessert on the other hand was excellent!!

I had a great solo birthday dinner here a few weeks ago. The cave part of the restaurant is really cool & the staff was very nice and kind. Even when I set my bread basket on fire from the small tea candle on the table (wish I was joking), they were still really nice! Try the meatball appetizer!

A great dinner date or group spot. I was there toasting a birthday but there were several groups that visited. 

It’s an unexpected location because you are seated downstairs and you pass Canal Street. The food is good - steak and duck ragu. I’d prefer the noodles for duck to be wider but the flavor was good as is.

You're paying for the atmosphere (which was really wonderful) not the food, quite mediocre. Very nice people but once again the food isn't anything to phone home about. If you've never had italian food come here.

Interesting decor, small upstairs bar area with a full bar & restaurant downstairs. Vintage doors & hardware with 3 dining areas. I'm not sure about handicapped access. The food was delicious. We were there for a wedding and family style service was perfect! Wine and water glasses were continually filled.

formatted_address: 264 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Murray's Cheese Bar

reviews.text: My favorite place to eat and drink! The variety of cheeses they have is amazing. Cheese fondue is great and also their cheese plates! Their grilled cheese and tomato soup are scrumptious! Pairing their cheese with wine is also great. I've had many enjoyable nights and memories here. Also check their cheese market and I think they have cheese classes too - I'd love to check that out someday!

This review has been sitting there for over a year. I will try to remember this place for a group on 6. 

We have a reservation but two of us were late. They sat us anyway. This is about the second time I have raclette in the city and this is awesome. 

For a group of six, we have everything we needed. Great cheese. Great wine and great host. You can hate melt cheese.

A hopping joint! We made reservations on Open Table for 6 pm for two, and that was the last available reservation until 9:45! And when people came in without reservations, they had to turn them away until after 10! So don't make that mistake! We had their signature Mac and cheese with bacon added and crispy onion pieces on top, as recommended by our Waiter. I am not overstating when I say this was by far the best Mac & Cheese I've ever had!! My daughter agreed! So creamy and cheesy with strings of cheese pulling with every bite! The nice thick bacon was cooked to perfection! It looks like a small serving when the Waiter serves it, but we couldn't finish all the rich goodness!! A not to be missed stop in the West Village if you are a cheese lover like we are!! I would definitely go back!!

I came here with a date. This is the bar/restaurant location for Murray's Cheese Shop. Murray's provides a great selection of cheeses. My family stops at the shop for cheese so we can build cheeseboards at gatherings...

Having said that, I was slightly disappointed. We ordered the pick 5 meats/cheeses board. The cheese and meat was spectacular but the bread they served it on was not. It was hard to bite and chew and not of any quality I would pair with their selections. The prices are also a bit excessive. But, the cheese was so good I would come back for that alone.

Food:5/5
Ambiance:5/5

After watching bunch of YouTube videos about this place, I went to see this place to eat and enjoy the world famous grilled cheese sandwich. It’s one of the best cheese sandwich.

It comes with a side of a tomato soup. Overall dish balances well with cheese and acidity from the soup. 

If you are in New York then you should not miss this place. Waiters were nice and accommodating as we didn’t had the reservation. Lovely place with open bar.

formatted_address: 458 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: The Greek

reviews.text: My gf and I recently went to The Greek for Valentine's day dinner. This was one of the best restaurant experiences we had. The food was authentic and amazing. The atmosphere was cozy and the staff was on point. Our waitress was kind, extremely attentive and knowledgeable. The wine pairings she provided us were unique and matched the food very well.  She made our night and we are extremely grateful. We will definitely telling our friends about this place and we can't wait till our next visit!

Great food.  Was looking for Greek cuisine and we were pleasantly surprised with this place.  Wine list features only Greek wines.  Everything was excellent.  Appetizers and starter plates are quite large and great for sharing.
Had dinner with some friends and this place was perfect. Great atmosphere and even better food. Highly recommend the dips for an appetizer. Would happily go here again.

The Greek is a fantastic restaurant. The food is authentic and delicious. The atmosphere is perfect, combining great lighting and tasteful decoration. We were made to feel very welcome by our host Peter and hope to visit again on our next trip to NYC. Highly recommended!

My wife and I went to dine at the Greek for the first time. I was truly a great experience. Place is cozy and keeps all the greek tradition impact. Food is bright and tasty, desserts were all very refreshing and delicious: ambiance was sophisticated and trendy, music was up our ally. What made our night more special was also the gracious host (Peter) which elevated the level of our experience. snd made it more fun, more original and more interesting. Bravo!!

formatted_address: 22 W 34th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Salsamania Saturdays

reviews.text: We visited with a group friends last Saturday and found the place to be fun but too small. The music in salsa room was very nice yet the bachata room, disappointing: floor and sound.  The customer service at desk was very courteous. Unfortunately, as we exited, I suffered a bad fall due to congestion by exit of salsa room. I was injured in fall. Though it appeared to have been an accident (I have no recall of how I ended up on the floor)  it could have been prevented if an access and exit plan were present. I was offered ice but nothing else by desk personnel. There does not appear to be a response plan in place for such situations.  It has been three days and I am still very achy. I will not feel safe if I went back, so I will not.
They are simply amazing!

Went this past weekend. This dance studio was way too small! Not at all like the old place at the Empire State Bldg. The Bachata side was almost empty because you can't hear the music. The Salsa side is too crowded and the music overpowers the bachata side! The entire place is too hot! I did not enjoy it at all!! I was extremely disappointed! Never going back!

We enjoyed our first Salsa social here in NYC. Yes they could benefit from more space but that’s common in a lot of places. 

Maybe they should use the bachata room as a vinyl room? 

I had some amazing dances and we all enjoyed a great night :)

This place was ridiculously stupid. Worst 30 bucks I spent. There was no segregation by levels even though they invite beginners. Everyone was taught the same thing which was really difficult and fast. They should specifically call out who is the right audience for this class.

formatted_address: 113 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Minetta Tavern

reviews.text:
Let’s start with the positives: the burger is amazing. In fact it was probably the best burger meat I ever had the ambience was great too. Service nice too.
The negatives: the steak was really not great. The price was quite intense too with $200 for two (one burger, one steak, 3 beers, 1 desert, no wine or cocktails). We went to the Polo Bar by Ralph Lauren the day before had an amazing dinner for two in a much fancier restaurant and the bill came in at $110

We sat at the bar and had the classic Black Label Burger with fries...amazing! The meat, onions, and toasted/buttered roll were all perfect.  The ambience definitely made you feel like you were in a classic NY establishment. Highly recommend.

This is the second time that I went to this restaurant and I can't complain about it. We had a little issue with one of our orders and intern the waiter was able to not only deduct that meal but also and gave us two complimentary dishes. We went there for a birthday celebration and they had the most amazing desserts for you to try especially the chocolate souffle. You have to be aware that the price is kind of high because it is very very good food.

Highly recommend reservations as the wait times for walk-ins are too long. Really cozy and unique! Tried the Black label burger, the French omelette, the French onion soup and the chocolate caramel pie for dessert. Food was excellent and service was great👌

Very well kept and welcoming restaurant. They provide generous meals and for economical prices. I loved the food a lot and the staff members were very welcoming and chatty. Will definitely recommend this spot.

formatted_address: 140 E 41st St, New York, NY 10017, USA
name: Public House

reviews.text: This restaurant provides superb service and tasty food. My favourite place around here. The meals came out quickly and the rates were affordable. Recommended.
Had great time , awesome food, lovely staff and music .

Great vibe and great atmosphere. Staff are very friendly. Food was really good, especially for a bar. TVs are located strategically. Also, very close to Grand Central, so location-wise, it's easy to get to. Would recommend it.

Solid option for people waiting for the airport shuttle. The times change regularly (currently the bus is on the hour) and if you get caught out this is a convenient and friendly place to have a quick pint. The space is huge and normally has free seats. It's a mix of travellers and some local business folk. Bar staff a pleasant, prices are standard for midtown NYC (~$8 for reasonable IPA).

Trivia night every Tuesday is the time to go! It gets really packed so you have to leave your personal space at the door but it's good fun and it's not one of those trivia nights where the questions are elementary. You really gotta think about these and that's pretty hard to do when you're loading up on the cheap pitcher deals on trivia nights, lol!

formatted_address: 231 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Vinny Vincenz Pizza

reviews.text: I ate pizza there on a Saturday, after i attended the Flea Market (Church) on 14 street. Surprisingly their Margarita slice was great!  The tomato sauce they use is excellent! The only down side is they didn't make any pizza with toppings other than pepperoni.  If you're in the neighborhood, stop by this place and get a slice.!!!!

The best pizza in the area . don’t regret this pizza place 100 % Italian 
Order online or coming in !!! 🍕

I Iive in pizza delivery heaven on the Lower East Side. Vinny Vincenz is my favorite. Their thin crusted pizza is baked to crisp perfection. Their toppings and sauce are an added bonus. Their chefs and delivery people are very nice. And the delivery is very fast. A testament to them is that they are packed at lunch and after school with local students.

$1.50 plain cheese pizza slices. Specialty slices. Full menu for take out. Very nice decor celebrating the east village neighborhood. Refreshing different look for a NYC (cheap slice) pizza place! Great place to stop for a bite with friends.

Big bite from Big Ben (@ben_shores) of this $1.50 slice on 1st Ave. Good umami and zero flop, fresh, hot and served straight off of the 'fine China of NYC' - @scottspizzatours re paper plates. This might just be the daddy daycare slice of NYC–democratically priced and feeding a sea of children and teens in the after school rush. Solid!

formatted_address: 2723 Broadway, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: Cafe Du Soleil

reviews.text: Excellent and unsuspecting gem! H and I came for a quick lunch at the bar and we were treated to a really tasty and satisfying soup and sandwich. I am not a fan of sandwiches in the US but I was pleasantly surprised at how good it tastes here. They do a proper onion soup and a nice sandwich. Frenchies would approve!
Very cute restaurant with lots of good breakfast/brunch offerings. Love the vibe of this place and the service is always spot on. Definitely recommend if you’re in the uptown area!

We love hanging out. Last night we came to this superb place which we didn’t know before. We had a delightful experience there with exceptional cooking and an efficient crew and a great  cuisine. We put this restaurant in our phone list  and we will surely go again soon. We highly recommend.

went on a Saturday night our waitress was amazing. She helped us with making dinner selections and we were not disappointed. So satisfied we went back the next day for their brunch (yum❤) got the same server 😃 loved our time there. will be back again.

My friend and I just passed by the restaurant. I got recommended by my friend's friend. She told me there is a restaurant when I goes to work around the area and always has a line so I just guess its this place because no place else is crowded.

For was good, service was just ok because it was so much of customer and not enough servers.

formatted_address: 150 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Bhai Bhai

formatted_address: 617 Broad Ave, Ridgefield, NJ 07657, USA
name: Cuban Brothers Cigars

reviews.text: Hole in the wall cigar shop if you can call it that. No inventory and selection. The guy recommended their own brand, save your money. Thing was hollow and terribly rolled and started to disintegrate as you smoked it.
Nice looking lounge, however room fills with smoke no ventilation, eyes burn no need to buy second cigar your smoking everyone else’s.
Great product and costumer service... Anybody who is a cigar aficionado .. this is the place to go.
Awesome customer service ! Cigars handmade
Bad attitude, nothing else to say here

formatted_address: 158 Loisaida Ave, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: East Village Tavern (aka EVT)

reviews.text: Went in for a drink over 1 hour before they closed. Bartender wouldn’t let us in, said they were closed. An hour earlier than their listed closing time. Great NYC service.
Nice bar.. good prices and very friendly crowd!

formatted_address: 204 Varick St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Sound Of Brazil

reviews.text:
Good accoustics, nice spot, nice staff - The concert was a bit short, but that's to be expected from rappers nowadays.

One slight problem, maybe just because I'm french : the place is extremely inconvenient for smokers... no outside smoking area in the venue, each time you go outside the door to smoke you have to go through the bouncer's search again and present your ticket again.

Other than those little logistics questions, for a Manhattan venue the prices are decent and the sound is good. Yes, there's a card payment limit, but then maybe just hit an ATM before entering, it ain't hard.

Me and my girlfriend had a good time we went to go see a youtuber named Domo who performed there Friday night and they had other people performing as well everybody was pretty good my one thing is the bars overpriced and the Bartenders are not very nice, Plus he saw that set my card out miss fielding say anything that there was a $24 limit and we only ordered 2 drinks it came out to $22.

 Other than that great spot to come to with your friends and watch some people put form or get a snack or 2

After suggesting this place to celebrate a friends birthday. We all arrive at 11pm with free invites and was not allowed in till after midnight an then told we have to pay or we can’t get in. It’s tiny inside and gets very crowded and it’s hard to even get anyone on the phone or to respond to your email.

I have yet to get there but attending tonight (11/20/19) to see my son perform.  I have been trying to call for the past three days, leaving messages etc to no avail.  The outgoing messages are giving you information about days back in May ??? wanted info as to what time the doors open and if we could reserve a table, as we have a lot of out of town guests coming to support and obviously it means nothing to them to accommodate you with some professionalism to at least respond.  I myself had surgery and can't stand long - I hope I at the very minimum enjoy this evening smh
About last night at SOBs...the LOVE TRAIN band was FANTASTIC! And this Jalapeno Steak burger was DELISH! Lemon Drop Martini, shaken, not stirred was the best!

formatted_address: 760 8th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Savage Men

reviews.text: I am beyond upset on what happened on our reservation tonight for rent a savage for a private party. If I can give a zero star I would.  I cannot believe the level of disservice and unprofessional treatment we got with a no-show tonight. I had 12 women here to celebrate and looking forward to tonight that came home extremely disappointed.  What upset us even more is that the fact that we were not even notified at all that our stripper was not coming tonight. We waited until 11:28pm to inquire since you did indicate 10:30-11:30 but knowing that he will not show up and not receiving any courtesy call is beyond unacceptable.  In today’s age I am fairly sure that the individual that was coming to our party had a cell phone. It would have been at least a courtesy if we got a call saying that he is late or apologize for not coming due to a car issue. But instead we received such rude behavior. I called at least 4 times and no confirmation or update if someone was indeed coming. The third time I called someone picked up and told me just email us since he cannot deal with me right now since it is too loud and hanged up.  If you cannot talk on the phone and be rude like that, don’t even bother picking up! I had positive experience with your establishment in the past but regret to say that I highly doubt we will be using your services in the future due to this incident.  I hope that you address this issue or you will be losing more customers.

It was a very fun male strip club experience.  All of the male strippers were very talented and hot to look at.  They did all types of dancing on stage and put on a real show.  Ladies, believe me, you will not be disappointed.  There really was something for everyone, no matter how conservative or crazy you and your friends are.  Very fun night!

I felt like I was in the Magic Mike movie but even better because there were tons of Magic Mikes performing! They were all so good! Their choreography was on point! Along with all of the dance routines and performances!

My expectations was that we going to a show, but it tourn out we going to see strippers humping on women. I bout this for bachloratt party and we all were discussed with the way they did that show. If you like strippers shake and jump on you it is perfect place to go, otherwise think twice.

This was such a great night out for us on our vacation in New York City. We decided to have a girls night out on staying at the Marriot in Time Square this was an easy and safe walk. The area is very nice and right near Bryant Park which was fun to visit along the way. We had seen the movie Magic Mike but had never been to a real male strip club before so this was a really fun eye opener. The male strippers were so gorgeous and could really dance great. The striptease acts were remarkable and more then I could have imagined coming from a strip show. One dancer called the Italian stallion was so talented that it was really fun watching him. We got a few great pictures with him and a few of the other dancers.

formatted_address: 265 W 52nd St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Russian Vodka Room

reviews.text: This place has stood the test of time by being consistent, no-nonsense, yet jovial (it's a piano bar at its core!) Vodka infusions that taste like fresh ingredients (garlic dill and pepper is legitimately refreshing) work together with some almost comically high end options to make space for anybody to enjoy a little dark corner of fallen opulence with a Russian sense of both humor and style. The late night food is also a welcome alternative to surrounding faux-diners - both authentic and Americanized enough to work with any palate.

A wonderfully comfortable & quiet place. Live piano, authentic menu, extensive choice of Vodkas.

One of my go to places to spend the occasional afternoon (and evening). 

Super friendly service - all of it at significantly less $$$s you'd expect.

Beware of the 18% tip added to the bill for the party of two! And then the credit card slip provides you with a convenient spot to add gratuity! Horseradish vodka was excellent. Food and service were good. But the bill really left a bad taste!
I love this place, it's become a favorite between my friends and I. Drinks are awesome and the food is great!

Great service, amazing atmosphere, authentic. The live music was lovely. One thing to note, a tip is automatically included when you sit in the dining room but not in the bar (it was so good we went twice)

formatted_address: 79 Clinton St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Clancey

reviews.text:
Great spot for brunch with friends. You will find something for everyone (avocado toast to chicken & challah).

We decided to try it and we were pleasantly surprised. The adult lemonade with bourbon is a hit and my friend enjoyed the Bloody Mary.

This is probably the 5th time I have visited this restaurant in the last six months. Daily drink specials are great and the food quality is amazing for the price! Usually never too busy or loud, there’s only ever been 3 or 4 other tables while I’ve dined there.

Clancey is more bar than restaurant, but it’s a fun bar geared for the younger set that populates the LES and offers way-better-than average food. Enjoyed our shrimp and grits and avocado BLT. Exceptional fries. Cocktails were nicely crafted but lean toward sweet and fruity. Really nice bartender/server was closing for the day but accommodated us without rushing us out.

Brunch was great! The smoked bacon  sweet potato hash was very tasty. Brunch drinks were satisfying. Aperol spritz was superb. We got in to eat at the bar even though we had no reservation. Very happy!!

Went there for the first time about a month ago on a Saturday afternoon. Highly recommend the BLT with Smashed Avocado, Fried Egg, Spicy Mayo and Fries. Executed well, really flavorful. Music was a fun mix but was a little loud. Service was OK, got better when it got busier and brunch was in full swing. Would definitely return but will try to avoid peak brunch time.

formatted_address: 432 Union Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Montesacro

reviews.text: What a wonderful restaurant experience! From the ambiance to the waitstaff to the perfect food. Everything was so beautiful, unique and full of flavor. Can’t wait to go back!

Always a wonderful experience at Montesacro. This is my go-to spot for Italian food. The service was excellent, but most importantly, the food was as amazing as always. Make a reservation or show up early, it gets really busy.

Sat in the garden room. It was lovely! The decor was wonderful and the food and wine we're both very very good. Our server was a little odd but that's no demerit to the restaurant. Take someone you care about, because it'll be a lovely experience. Share a bottle of wine, an app, and some pasta. Share each other's company, and have a wonderful night.

I use to go to this address long time ago when it was Dumont, one of the first cool place that opened in the area, always loved that place with the big patio in the back. I am so glad that Montesacro took over that spot. Food is great, atmosphere is great, stuff is great overall I am going back next week ;)
Don’t worry if you see no one sitting in the front of the restaurant everyone is in the back patio so don’t be hesitant to get into an empty place...
I am vegetarian and they have delicious options. Can’t wait for spring and enjoy the opened patio.

Nice ambiance and good addition to the area. Maybe because they are recently open and still working out kinks but we waited about 50 minutes between antipasti and entree. Our server Nolan was very good and attentive and made up for it. The pizza is really goo li and prices are reasonable. Place reminds me a little of Aurora.

formatted_address: 336 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Fitzgerald's Pub

reviews.text: I meet with friends this restaurant quite often! This is the best place to pass a nice evening.  I visit this place many times. The cooking is of high quality, the team is helpful and the rates are decent. I like meeting in this restaurant for a rich supper.
Bartender Carmack was amazing. One of my all time favorite bartenders for sure. :)
One of my favorite places to go! The food is fantastic and the environment all around is great. The owners and bartenders are so friendly! Highly recommend for a nice place to hangout with friends
Best place ever! Amazing food, calamari were delicious! Extremely friendly staff! Amazing service! Highly recommended!
This is a one of a kind place.  The tenders are real, cool, and awesome. The atmosphere is chill. No need to have any other favorite pub.

formatted_address: 315 W 46th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Vodka Soda Bottoms Up

reviews.text: It was fine, if not massively welcoming.  Drag acts in the rear which looked a bit scary! :)
affordable drinks! If you are on a budget, this is the place to go to with your friends.
Had a good time! Came in from tragic experience  at Stonewall Inn to cheap beer, booming music and fun. DJ accepted my request for a song. I do recommend!
Went on a Saturday night, it was amazing! Music was good, I was able to feel free! And alive. I will be back next Saturday.

The place is amazing and fun.  The staff is wonderful, the drinks are great and prices everyone compared to other bars in the area.  There are multiple rooms with different music which also makes it fun.   Everyone my friends and I go there we are treated like royalty.   I have never had a bad time going there and love it much more the  the other gay bar on the same street.

formatted_address: 61 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Rosa Mexicano

reviews.text: Great place to meet or have a business lunch. Good deals for lunch.  Nice ambience.  Staff and waiters are friendly.  I highly recommend the guacamole they make right in front of you.  You can customize the spice level.  It’s across the street from Lincoln center and around the corner from the Time Warner center.

The best guacamole I have ever had. It is a bit of theatre watching them make it. I have been several times. Each meal is memorable & keeps me coming back. There is such a selection, and the staff are incredibly helpful.

This place is the one I like best. I eat in many restaurants but to this restaurant I  constantly return again and again. The crew is very warm and the cooking they place on your table is so appetizing. I never decline to have a nice meal in this place. I highly recommend this place.
Great service!!! Very attentive,  super friendly and respectful. Food was outstanding plus the decoration of the place... I do recommend this pace for a nice margarita friends and tasty Mexican food
Really good food. Vegetarian friendly. The service was fabulous and it's easier was so awesome. Super warm n nice

formatted_address: 103 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Hayaty

reviews.text: My favorite place to go to. The hookah is amazing, the the games, the drinks and food. Oh yes how could I forget about the DJ! Love the owner, he’s super cool and friendly.

The good: this place is cozy, decent drinks, happy hour-like specials, servics food, doesnt have a dress code most nights (my favorite factor), and had games for a game night with a chill vibe. There are a few other great things about this place. 

DJ Duz, DJ Mr. Famous and others have this place LIVE every time they are on set despite how convoluted the commute there has to be. 

The not-so-great: it's in the most random of locations, not near public transportation. There is very little parking availability, and it's not small, but narrow. Food is a little pricey. 

If it was a place easy to get to, I would definitely frequent more.
Class with a twist hip hop hookah great food awesome music

Best night Club in New York City Eastside check this Club with good music all time make Sure You Party At this Club when u come to New York or from New York good recommendation  Please Check my YouTube Channel @popsidk For The Party Videos around The World LIKE COMMENT AND PLEASE SUBSCRIBE TO HELP ME THANK YOU

The evening I came to this establishment, unbeknownst to us we had to pay in cash at the door. Security was nice and allowed me to stand inside and out of the cold while my boyfriend got cash. Once inside, I enjoyed this spot’s music. Mostly played hip hop. They had a good selection of various Hookah flavors. The food was good. Nothing spectacular though. 

Ladies, it’s basically standing for the most part unless you get a table and bottle service. Wear comfortable shoes. 

I can’t say I would return and I can’t say I wouldn’t return. I had a good time because of the company we kept. We were celebrating a friend’s birthday. 

All in all, if you want to go... go. Miss Lily’s is right next door if this spot isn’t your cup of tea.

formatted_address: 98 Avenue B, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Gruppo Thin Crust Pizza

reviews.text: This place is amazing!! Nice and clean inside. Staff is friendly. They accommodate for large parties. The pizza is delicious and I love their house salad!

Although my experience was overall satisfactory at Gruppo, I have to stop just short of giving it 5 stars. 
We sat at the bar and engaged in some light conversation with the barmaid who normally works at a different Gruppo location. She was courteous, attentive and professional. She even helped us with our orders as my buddy and I had never eaten here but he heard the pizza was great.
I ordered the white personal pizza. That pie came with arugula and added a split of bacon and spicy sausage toppings. The combo of toppings with the white pie and arugula was absolutely delicious.  
Unfortunately I found that the crust itself, although very thin, had very little flavor to offer to my combo of toppings.

I’ve been coming here for 7 to 8 years, the pizza are great like nothing else you can try in NY. Delivery is also quick and service is very fast. There is also no wait time which is rare those days.

Just a quick tip: When you order, Stick to the basics, and don’t start going with overly stuffed custom pies..

Very good thing crust "Roma" bar pizza. The ownersown  a chain of thin crust places all around nyc. This east village location is phenomenal if you like very thin crust bar pizza. Great relaxed spot to share some pizza over beer and wine with friends. The concept was influenced by the owners time spent in the New Haven, CT area. Stop in and tell them @bobspizzatour sent you.
I’ve been here probably 30 times. That should say something. A tip: You can do half base with spicy sauce and half without (that’s how I do mine).

formatted_address: 412 Bergen Blvd, Palisades Park, NJ 07650, USA
name: Hontei Japanese Restaurant

reviews.text: last night was our first time in this restaurant. But It is no doubt not the last time. We passed a splendid evening with the attentive service, with the fine cooking and wine and with the honest cost. We will definitely return there in a short time.

We were seated quickly and our order was taken soon after. The service was great although they mixed up our check. It was definitely different Japanese than we've had before but delicious. I got the eel with rice and my boyfriend got the steak. The portions were large, but the prices were higher so that made sense.
The food and service were above my expectations. We truly enjoyed the atmosphere of this place. Excellent place to take the family out for dinner.
I really enjoy the food and customer service, fantastic area  to my house. The staff members are always welcoming. Would recommend to others.

The environment of the place is fantastic and looks beautiful. This place I'd say is more of a korean Japanese place. Like a Japanese place with a korean take. I think the whole place is run by Koreans. The food however is meh. There were flies all over the place and on my appetizers there was a sticker on the food see pics. I really want to like this place and give it a better rating but it's unfortunately not as good as it looks. I don't think I will be going back at all.

formatted_address: 11 E 32nd St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Bangia 반지하

reviews.text: This place is amazing! Their food is great and the service is wonderful. I love the underground bar vibe and the staff was willing to make suggestions and even give advice as to how the food should be eaten so it's not intimidating to those who aren't familiar with Korean food! Try the Army stew! You won't regret it!
This spot provides first-rate service as well as tasty meals. One of my favourite places around town. The drinks and food arrived fast and the rates are economical. Recommended.

I don’t understand the hype about this place. we ordered the soy garlic and the spicy wings, both were bland. The soy garlic had no taste and the spicy ones tasted like ketchup. The cheesy corn pancake was just ok. Also tried some dumplings and they’re deep fried - probably previously frozen. :( the only thing i didn’t mind was the complimentary egg in the stone bowl 😅

Great happy hour! $10 for their signature cocktails and $7 for sangria. Got busy after 7pm, but we got a table in 15 mins. Food is pretty good. The cheese corn pancake was huge and loaded with cheese if you like that. It filled me up pretty quickly after one slice. Great place to hang out with friends and share food.

My new favorite Korean BBQ spot in New York! Relatively speaking, prices can't be beat. It starts around $26 per person for AYCE (all you can eat), and you get a variety of high-quality meats and soups along with plenty of great banchan that was frequently refilled.

formatted_address: 206 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: The Woo

reviews.text: As I'm trying various restaurants in the NY restaurant week, I was delighted with what Woo had to offer. Simple yet delightful menu. Spinach crepe and croquette just melted in the mouth, such a delight. Bibimbap was also good, better than the other Korean restaurants that I've tried in the mid town. They just have one dessert in the lunch menu, banana custard. Sweet delight in the end. Food quality was good, not too oily or greasy. Service was great, courteous staff, definitely recommend this place for luxurious Korean dining experience.

We met with friends at this spot for dinner. we heard about this restaurant from many people.  Well, we were not disappointed. The staff members were extremely nice and we felt very good. The food was just great. We had a great time and we will definitely return to this restaurant. Highly recommended.

This place was so great! The service was kind, the food was flavorful and the place itself was stylish and clean. Furthermore, they had seafood and vegetarian dishes that I have been hard pressed to find at other Korean BBQ restaurants. If you go, I highly suggest trying the tuna and the shiitake mushrooms. We will be back!

Korean BBQ joint good for couples. Romantic atmosphere with soft lighting and spacious tables so you're not listening to your neighbors conversation. Food was awesome, especially the pork belly, salad and tuna tartare!

This place is my first choice restaurant.  Of all restaurants I know I love it most. I always suggests to my friends to go to visit this restaurant. Whenever  I feel like having a fair lunch, this is the place that comes immediately to my mind. very good and all sorts of  food and a rich cuisine.great staff, and nice vibes. Not less important, the bill is affordable. I sent my friends to this restaurant with no hesitation.

formatted_address: 174 Grand St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Onieal's

reviews.text: For a friendly, relaxed atmosphere in this neighborhood there are few better places. The building itself is beautiful inside with high ceilings and a long wood bar. The seating is open and spacious with one area designed more as a lounge and the other half for dining. Beers on tap were decent and the mixed drinks looked good too.

If it weren't for Google reminding me of where I finished out my debauched nights, I would never have remembered this place.   Fun, intimate, zero attitude, neighborhood bar (formerly a brothel in the 30s) with a real Soho feel.   Great cocktails, polished but not quite 'artisanal', just tasty.   Plenty of terrific eye candy for whatever team you're on.    Check out the platters of oysters, and the calamari!
Friendly staff, cool location, amazing food. Would recommend this to my friends any time and go again. Had the Zoodle dish and it was delicious.

A nice and cosy place. I only had drinks there so I cannot comment on food, but the plates coming out of kitchen looked appetising. Staff pleasant and polite. If you plan to spend an evening here, make sure you have a good credit limit on your card or a bundle of cash. A Cosmo and Manhattan cocktail cost me a staggering 32 USD excluding tip. Same drink where I live is substantially less. Cost of NYC and poor UK exchange rate I guess

I was actually surprised at the food here. From the outside it looks like a dive bar but the drink menu is extensive and the food quite good. However it was also more expensive than I assumed, so stay in the lunch menu pricing.

formatted_address: 367 Metropolitan Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Taqueria Diana

reviews.text: Great food. Helpful employees. Legitimate mexican tacos with mexican soda. Very clean place with a variety of hot sauce. I don't have much to complain about. Hipster crowd. No parking. Price is on the higher end.
Best business model for a restaurant ever. Pay up front and you aren't bothered from then on. Fantastic nachos and margaritas. Top shelf.
The menu and service were above my expectations. I absolutely loved the vibes of this restaurant. Awesome place to take the family out for dinner.
Heard from a friend it's really good so gave it a try. Very impressed with the nachos and corn. Both well done. Will be back

A good place to grab some drinks and eat some Mexican food. Food was good (not bad but not amazing). I ordered 3 tacos and chips. The nachos looked very good so I'd probably get those next time. Order at the counter and they bring the food out to you.

formatted_address: 125 E 11th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: The Marlin Room at Webster Hall

reviews.text: Nice big stage with unobstructed sight lines and not spot is more than, what 20 feet from the performers? Also good attentive bar staff. But damn, ordered a red bull & vodka and gave the girl a twenty and didn't get any change back! (Had to dig out two singles for tip.) SO I didn't drink much! Also, nice coat check area that was fast and friendly. Good sound at the venue, it's pretty cool.

formatted_address: 39 E 58th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: LAVO Italian Restaurant

reviews.text: Food was delicious and the service was great. Ricardo went out of his way to make us feel welcomed and guide us through the menu since it was our first time. We will definitely come back

From the time we sat down it was superb,  the food, is like art.  
The staff treated us like royalty. 
The entire experience  was something  I will never forget. 
I recommend the meatball,  chicken Dominick, and of course the Ribeye,  it is fantastic. 
Desert was a true treat,  from the 20 layer chocolate peanut butter cake to the,  fried Oreo, to dip in  vanilla Ice cream,  as an added treat ginger bread cake with cream cheese Icing.
Truly amazing
We will return again.
Beautiful place, but be prepared for crowds after work. Definitely not a quiet dining experience. Mostly a men-in-suits happy hour feel. But worth a cocktail stop in.

The entire experience  was something  I will never forget. 
I recommend the meatball,  chicken Dominick, and of course the Ribeye,  it is fantastic. 
Desert was a true treat,  from the 20 layer chocolate peanut butter cake to the,  fried Oreo, to dip in  vanilla Ice cream,  as an added treat ginger bread cake with cream cheese Icing.
Truly amazing
We will return again.
Amazing food great service and good atmosphere. Drinks are delicious. Always busy but it what makes it fun. Loved the steak but grilled red snapper was fantastic too

formatted_address: 110 Thompson St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Cocotte

reviews.text: I celebrated my PhD earlier this evening in this great restaurant. happy to tell that it was a phenomenal evening and the venue was unquestionably one of the reasons for that fruitful celebration. The crew  collaborated in a very nice style, the cuisine was extremely good and my friends were extremely  pleased. We shall surely return for more joyful events. Thank you very much.

Amazing, tiny French restaurant with a strong Basque influence.  Excellent food which was executed perfectly.  Fantastic service as well.  My wife and I agree that this was our best meal during our week in NYC.  Even though so many dining options exist in the city, we can't wait to return to Cocotte!

Low key neighborhood haunt. The staff seems to be all French and have a blend of Spanish and French cuisine on the menu. I had the braised pork shoulder which was excellent, as well as the charcuterie.

I visit this lovely place many times a year! This is my favorite place to dine.  I visit this spot regularly. The food is very tasty, the staff is welcoming and the payment is decent. I enjoy eating in this place to have a good dinner.

French restaurant with small dishes on Thompson street , right down the small staircase. Perfect place for a date , the wine list is extensive and the food is delicious. Good portions for sharing , lovely atmosphere and attentive staff . 
It never disappoints; setting salad from a jar , so delightful.

formatted_address: 151 Maiden Ln, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: AC Lounge

reviews.text: Let’s start off with the good. Great and cute spot, the service is great, the drinks are great... I loved the old fashioned on draft. It was delicious. It is on the expensive side, not sure if it was with it. We tried to order churros but the frier wasn’t working. Definitely not a spot to grab a cheap drink.
Great Old Fashioned

formatted_address: 150 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Bhai Bhai City

formatted_address: 330 5th St, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Le Mistral

reviews.text:
Love this restaurant! Great wine and amazing food! We always like to stop by when we’re in the area. We love it so much that  we came here   for my mom’s  73rd birthday! The service was wonderful!
Thank you for making it amazing!

Great atmosphere that happened to have live music playing the evening we went. Staff is attentive and great with families!

Food overall was pretty good. The steak Frites had a lot of flavor while the burger was only so-so. Definitely get the pasta

The food at Le Mistral is delicious. Last night my partner and I went for an early dinner. She had the steak and I had the lamb chops. The lamb chops were tender and melt-in-your-mouth buttery. The steak was seasoned perfectly.
The wait staff was just the right amount of attentive. They were always there when we needed them, but never pushy.
The table next to us was empty, and they even connected it with ours to give us more room.
We'll definitely be back soon!
A great atmosphere with great service and excellent food.  The food was well made and beautifully presented.  The flavors were intriguing in a good way and added to the taste experience.

Incredible live music - bossa nova style. Service was very prompt and attentive. Wide variety of wines to choose from. Cozy and chill ambience. Recommend the chicken dish and mussel pot. No lines no hustle.

formatted_address: 18 9th Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Carte Blanche Cafe

formatted_address: 1166 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10065, USA
name: Felice 64

reviews.text: Wonderful experience. Made reservations for dinner and arrived early so we had a drink at the bar before being seated at our table. The bartender, wait staff, and chef were incredibly friendly and attentive. The food was fantastic and reminded us of our travels. The space was cozy and intimate, and just what we were looking for. A big thank you to Ervis for making our night so great!

Visited NYC for the weekend and did a significant amount of research to find a spot with great ambience and food.  Felice 64 met all of my expectations and I appreciated that the notes I added when booking the reservation were reviewed and accounted for.  Check it out!
Great looking cozy space. The foods pretty good aswell. Definitely a good date night spot
The best I've ever had! Love the ambience.

Great service. My wife and I made a reservation and got to sit outside. Food was delivered at perfect intervals. They actually have a fairly large wine bottle selection with everything from $40 -$200 bottles.

The cheese and wine board was delicious. Both of our pasta dishes were cooked and seasoned well as well. Sometimes pasta can come out fairly bland at restraints but they did a great job of balancing their flavors.

formatted_address: 2578 Broadway, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: Earth Café

reviews.text: Really good food and sunny atmosphere. Try their version of Eggs Benedict- you won't be disappointed. Great place for brunch.

Excellent and quiet spot on the upper west side. The service is good. The food is great! I had the goat cheese panini and it was creamy and delicious! (Thought it’ll be too dry but not at all!). Will be back again!
Great location filled with a lot of sunlight. Very rude staff. I ordered a chai latte which was the worst I have had after paying $5.

Food is really good! Love the location! Although, you will be waiting for a long time to put your order. And, need to be looking for the server to if you need anything.

Other than that the place is amazing.
Loved the decor and simplicity of the ambiance. Great salads. Great coffee.

formatted_address: 293 Church St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: The Drug Store - Tribeca

reviews.text: Coolest place in town. Next Generation Technology. You get healthy drinks here.
The Drug Store is the best place to grab a beverage on the go! It's so easy and the most unique shopping experience in the city. Take what you want / text what you took / get on with life.

The hardest part of getting a drink here is opening the door - it couldn't be easier. Grab what you want, text in what you took, and move on with your life. I grab a ginseng most days on my walk to work.
Perfect drinks to grab and go. There's something for everyone in those fridges.
such a cool concept and crazy convienent. you just walk in, take what you want, send a text and you’re done 🤯

formatted_address: 310 S 4th St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Shalom Japan

reviews.text: Are you kidding me?! This is hands down my new favorite spot. The service team is phenomenal and friendly. The food is literally out of this world. My only suggestion would be to give me a table with my name on it because I am definitely coming back every chance I get!

Everything was delicious!! I’ve been wanting to try this place for a very long time and I was not disappointed. I recommend the Jew Egg and the Tuna Tataki for appetizers. The Tuna Tataki has a black tahini sauce that is really special! My friends had the Matzoh Ball Ramen as a main and said it was amazing as well. The service was wonderful and super friendly. There’s also a cocktail and sake menu. Looking forward to going back soon!
I had a great dinner on the tasting fixed menu. Drinks are ok but beer is better here. Service could be improve (they brought wrong dishes to the table). Overall a 4 start experience.

A very good place for an upscale restaurant. If you're going at night, sit at the porch, it's very nice and cozy. Inside the restaurant is really loud and filled with people. The menu has some kosher friendly dishes which we enjoyed very much.

Such a cute and intimate place. The entrance was pretty tight (with a table right  in front of the door). The food and drinks were a bit pricy. We got sake (10 oz) and some hummus. Sake was pretty tasty like strong wine and served cold. I would recommend to go there for Japanese food with an innovative flavour (willing to pay a bit)

formatted_address: 713 Washington St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Upholstery: Food and Wine

reviews.text:
Very good place !! I recommend it. Only things, the smell... Kitchen is open to the restaurant and all smells spread around..
We started with the lobster bisque, splitter in 2 bowls, easier to share then a salad (was ok). Then salmon and branzino... Delicious !! Loved it !!
And also a good selection of wine !
Grilled calamari was delicious and wine selection was great. Ask the sommelier for recommendations - they were really helpful !

Great cocktails, sadly however the staff insisted on keeping doors and windows open for their own comfort despite the fact that it was 32 degrees outside. For a solid hour I kept closing the door only to be treated like a crazy person that feels temperature in real-time. When I asked about the issue point blank they stated it as because of the smoky tacos being served at the bar. No one was sitting at the bar. No one should ever sit at this bar.
Tiny and intimate--like being invited over for dinner. Loved the vaguely central European menu--the duck confit with red cabbage was spectacular. Hip vibe but definitely for grown-ups.

This place has been on my list for quite a while and it did not disappoint. I recommend the lobster roll and the squid ink pasta. 

It was just really comfortable to sit here and unwind. There wasn't a lot of people when I was there right after work. The staff was attentive. To top it off, I asked for a non alcoholic because I don't drive and they took care of me. See photo.

formatted_address: 145 Loisaida Ave, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Esperanto

reviews.text: I live in the area, with many great restaurants in the east village this is definitely one of my favorites. Great menu with amazing dishes. Fish is fresh and you won’t be limited to empanadas and burritos. Steak is wonderful, staff is great. Highly recommended!!!!

Great place! The food is delicious, live music, and reasonably priced. Staff is super friendly. We got complimentary drinks for unexpected additional wait time and shots for my friends birthday! I would definitely recommend and will be going back.

We went with a bigger group here for dinner. The food was amazing, fresh and something different and new to me! Also their cocktails are very good. Probably one of the best restaurants around East Village!

Celebrated my Birthday with 14 guests today & we Loved It🤩🤩🤩!!!  Ziggy & the Crew treated us like Family.  We had Brunch & were in a private section. The staff was very attentive!  The drinks were great & the Brunch selection was awesome 😎.  We all individually want to come back.  Thanks to the staff for the wonderful time😎😉!
Went with a large party, and we're seated in a semi-private room toward the back. Excellent brunch, delicious cocktails.

formatted_address: 220 36th St Suite B114S, Brooklyn, NY 11232, USA
name: Burger Joint

reviews.text: I eat here a lot since I work in the area. I love how their customer service is always excellent and they keep the place clean constantly. Rates are affordable and they serve big portions.

First of all - Poor service,  we ordered all toppings called the works and all we got was a lettuce topping. We paid $40 for 2 burgers and a chicken sandwich plus fries - not worth that amount  of money. It didn't  taste so special and the fries weren't all that. I wouldn't recommend the burger joint unless you have no other choice. Staff were not customer oriented, came back for ketchup and they weren't  even helpful with showing where I could get them, so I grabbed from the counter.

I was craving a burger today and this one definitely hit the spot. Fresh toppings, cooked to perfection, and the perfect size. The fries were nice and crisp too!!! I would stop back by this place anytime.
Bit disappointed - pricey meal and we could have cooked the same thing at home - simplistic take on burgers. Lacks something. Service was fine, serving were small for the price.
Had a double cheeseburger which was great. Patties are a good size. Very satisfying.

formatted_address: 308 E 78th St, New York, NY 10075, USA
name: Heidi's House

reviews.text: Absolutely delicious and a very cozy feeling. The service was great, the beer selection was good, and the mac and cheese was too die for. Would recommend for anyone wanting a cozy time

I really like this place, it's very relaxed with good wine and beer. I personally think the dining side is slightly nicer for the ambiance. 

The food here is really good while everything is a little on the expensive side it's worth it. 

Staff here are great and always engaging with customers do don't be afraid to say hi.

What a wonderful gem on the Upper East Side. I knew they do not take reservations and that the place is very small, so I came in for an early dinner at 6 pm and the place was about half full. Ambiance is more on the dark side and music was soft enough to have a normal conversation. Not a full bar, but a wide selection of wines and beer. The food was amazing. I had the burger, and I think it is one of the best in the city. Definitely get the cheese on it. I ordered it medium well, and it was still very juicy.  I had the chocolate soufflé, and it was absolutely worth the extra 15 minute wait. I will definitely be back!

It’s a nice atmosphere if you go early, say around 4:30 on a Saturday. I was there when it was very crowded once and there were 5 of us so it was tight. It is a small restaurant but I believe that’s what gives it its charm. It wasn’t crowded when we got there a little after 4 pm on Saturday. The food was quite good all around. The Mac and Cheese stands out. We got it with lobster and I hadn’t had it like that before going here.
Small, intimate, very busy yet you can hear yourself talk... no reservations, however call ahead to put your name on a list. Excellent Paella plus many Mac n Cheese options. Had fun on my date!

formatted_address: 355 W 16th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Bodega Negra

reviews.text:
Really enjoyed this place.

The food was great. Our favorite by far was the shrimp tacos. The lobsters tostada and the pork belly was very delicious as well. The drinks were awesome as well.

The decor is nice. Dim lighting perfect for an evening date. The staff is very attentive and service overall was excellent.

I would definitely recommend this to anyone that enjoys tacos but also wants a upscale experience to it.

Went for Summer Restaurant Week 2019. The decor is beautiful. Our server was so polite and sweet. She explained the different menu items. We ordered the tacos. Surprisingly the veggie taco was great. We also enjoyed the pork. The chicken taco was too salty and the beef was lacking something. We ordered the Don Huevo additionally for aesthetic purposes. Overall great experience and service.

Had a really great time here. Friday night music was fantastic and our waiter was so knowledgeable and friendly. We had a nut allergy in the group and he was great about mentioning what should be avoided or put on the side. We never felt rushed and the food and drinks were all delicious. 

We had the chicken & chorizo fajita (meat was so tender), chicken tacos (tasty, but too small for the price), yuca fries (for a side this was a large portion), sweet plantains (hit the sweet spot). We also had the white dome lava cake dessert.

I truly loved my experience here. We were here celebrating an important event and I had a minor so they seated us immediately. The food was delicious- appetizers, drinks, and dessert. It was a lounge vibe but very chill. 😍
Food was great! The tacos were delicious. The drinks were very good. The desserts were amazing as well. We went for my birthday. This made my special day great

formatted_address: 1 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Sel Rrose

reviews.text: Incredible oyster spot in the LES. Good service, outdoor seating and oyster happy hour. Lobster roll and chips were super fresh and satisfying. Kale salad was light and delish. Cool drinks and great atmosphere. Also lots of bar seating, would totally recommend and definitely will be back
Great cocktails! Nice staff. Amazing interior and delicious food. Ordered scallops
OMG the drinks are Manhattan priced, but worth it! (Usually a roll of the dice) The oyster happy hour was delicious. Definitely recommend and will be back.
Competent friendly bar staff. Excellent oysters indifferently shucked 1st dozen, perfect 2nd dozen.

On a Friday night Sel Rose is a healthy bar scene, just far enough away from the intensity of the lower east side, but still totally dialed in with music, drink selection and ambiance. Negroni variants and a few other cocktail ideas made the menu interesting and made for a good changeup while bar hopping around town. Space is tight at this time though, a group of four at most would be able to hold together inside.

formatted_address: 96 Loisaida Ave, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Alphabet City Beer Co.

reviews.text: Small beer bar and bottle shop serving cheese and charcuterie platters, sandwiches and a few other bar snacks. Twelve (most of them rotating) beers on draft served in two sizes. Plenty of cold cans and bottles to go. Grab a seat by the bar, at the giant communal table, or in an old arm chair. Decent selection of board games, and a big screen for the sports fans. Dog friendly.

Solid beer selection. Great service and variety of light food offerings. Mixed type of crowd from casual to the serious beer consumer, everyone welcome. Families with kids too, without feeling chaotic. Highly recommend!

Great chill place.  Craft beers on tap and more for sale in tans to take away.  The. If communal table makes socializing easy and the nooks of chairs good for lounging.  Friendly bar service and ... bar snack food that's GOOD food! Go figure :)

If you found this review helpful, please thumbs-up :)
Good selection of beers. Cool atmosphere

Awesome spot! Great selection of local beers, beers to-go, and great sandwiches! 

Every Wednesday is vinyl record day, bring in your own personal records and listen to them over an excellent quality sound system while you enjoy a beer and some food.

The atmosphere is very laid back with plenty of room on their massive table or on any of the lounge furniture around. Of course there is a standard bar area for sitting as well.

formatted_address: 460 W 34th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Rocky's Pizza Bar & Restaurant

reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with this restaurant. Very attentive service and quick also. And as you know in NYC  it’s hard to get a good quality quick spot. I went with family and friends. We had pizza, regular and Hawaiian, the pizza was very good. Also had grilled avocado sandwich that was so fresh and very delicious.
