Also chicken parmigiana which was also very amazing. If you are in this area I suggest you don’t waste too much time looking for a place and just come here.

The pizza was very good, generous portions. Our main reason to come in was that we wanted to drink a cocktail in a less crowded place. Good selection of cocktails and the place is spacious and not too loud. Hard to find something like that in NYC and we definitely enjoyed it.

Our first trip to NY and discovered a true gem! This place has incredible vibes, delicious Italian food, and genuine people. Josie gave us first class treatment and made our experience worth raving about to others and wanting to come back for more. Their Lasagna is, IMO, one of the best dishes I had on our entire trip. Highly recommend going to see Josie and the staff at Rocky's. You have a customer for life here!!

The atmosphere and the service here was really good. It was nice to step in away from the NYC cold air. The family got pizza, which was good, but honestly a little disappointing, as it was quite expensive and really no better than the $2 pizza you can find all around the city. I definitely recommend getting anything other than pizza here, but everything else about this place was great.

A good variety of very well made pizzas with an excellent crust. The bar has a selection of liquors and a few essential beer choices on tap. Always friendly and super tidy. The decorum / atmosphere is that more of a bar than of a pizzeria. Equally good for a lunch break just as well as for after-hours.

formatted_address: 200 9th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: The Meatball Shop

reviews.text: The staff at meatball shop is always so welcoming and entertaining! They recently upgraded their menu and rolled it out at this location; so happy we got to try it! The mozzarella, tomato and basil risotto was creamy, delicious and flavorful!! I will definitely order it again in the future. I’m not super adventurous and always order the naked chicken meatballs with pesto and they are always spot on - never a disappointment!! If you love pesto you’ll love this combination too!

This place is really cool.  Its also clever as its just selling you meatballs.  We had a nice lunch and the place was bumping.  Good thing we arrived early as we only had to wait 20 minutes for a table.  By the time we left it had a line out the door.  

Staff are young and edgy and it makes the place really unique.

I have never been here before and one of my friends suggested coming here.

I ordered the classic meatballs over broccoli and damn did it mesh well together. The meatballs were perfectly cooked with flavor bursting from every bite. The spicy sauce added a kick to every piece and paired with broccoli made it a whole lot better.

Definitely recommend this place but it can get pretty pricey when you add more things.
Yummmmmm should say it all! So the large seat is family style. Your very well may not know yourneighbor next to you and that’s fine. It’s NYC enjoy #meatballshop

Had a lovely lunch here. Waitress was really nice. They had a laminated kids menu and a dry erase marker to draw all over it. Nice idea - don't know why I've never seen another restaurant do that! The  food was good and our meal was satisfying. Only thing that will stop me from frequenting this restaurant are the prices. Very expensive with few reasonably priced options. Too bad.

formatted_address: 60 E 54th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: The Monkey Bar

reviews.text: Outstanding food quality and service! Beautiful historic restaurant. An oasis among the very loud city.  Pretty expensive but a great place to linger. Staff, except the coat check lady, are very friendly. Gave the coat check lady a $5 tip and she rolled her eyes. This restaurant is amazing!

Service was impeccable and food was refined and decadent. Cocktails were fancy and handcrafted with a spicy Moscow mule and harvest fizz with fragrant thyme but wine by the glass was not generously poured. The waiter was patient and attentive and our water glasses were never empty. Food came out right on time. All in all, this was a fabulous dining experience that we will eagerly try again.
Nice place, good service. I felt like I was back in the 70s mafia era, loved it.

Elegant atmosphere of a 1920s club with painted mural walls. Service was impeccable and food was refined and decadent. Cocktails were fancy and handcrafted with a spicy Moscow mule and harvest fizz with fragrant thyme but wine by the glass was not generously poured. The waiter was patient and attentive and our water glasses were never empty. Food came out right on time. All in all, this was a fabulous dining experience that we will eagerly try again.

When ever in NYC we always stop in. This place has a fab vibe and is always fun. Great bartenders and staff.  Ask for your cocktail to be made your way and they will oblige. Bar menu is a little limited but the food is good. Enjoy.

formatted_address: 475 3rd Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Lucey's Lounge

reviews.text: cute little bar with a nice space. drink are cheep and there’s free popcorn if i remember! it’s usually a calm atmosphere. good for a date if you want some drinks before or after dinner. friendly staff too.
Nice Small Bar in Park Slope

Great bar that seems like it would be a dive, but it's not. It's a classy little place that seems like it's been there forever, but is still given the care and attention it deserves. Cocktail prices are a little high (~$14), but other than that, it's a great place. Nice comfortable seating in the back and even a cute little patio outside. The bartender also brought us popcorn while we were sipping our cares away on a rainy day. Will definitely be back!

This is a bar with creative and attentive bartenders and a fun variety of mainly local customers. Live Sunday evening music is always good. Having a pleasant Italian restaurant next door is a nice bonus.☮️

Chill spot. There's a couple tables in the back, and a backyard. 
Cool cocktails. You can also bring pizza from across the street inside to munch on.

formatted_address: 120 E 56th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Montebello

reviews.text: Great food, great location, excellent service. Authentic Italian dishes plus some creative nouveau twists, too. Very attentive management and staff. Very flexible to last minute changes in party size and adjusting individual dishes to personal tastes.  Excellent wine list.  Excellent value for the price
Very good. Quality Italian in midtown with a nice atmosphere

Super, super expensive. Bought 3 drinks of Johnny Walker and it was 67 dollars! With tip, 75! It was 3 shots. $23 a shot? Way, way too much for any sane person to pay. Should be $12 Max. Didn't try the food, I'm sure it's great. Just be careful ordering anything and expect to lose an arm and leg. On the plus side, staff seemed nice.

Edit: updated review to be more accurate. Especially since the owner reached out. I respect that!

Great food, great location, excellent service. Authentic Italian dishes plus some creative nouveau twists, too. Very attentive management and staff. Very flexible to last minute changes in party size and adjusting individual dishes to personal tastes.  Excellent wine list.  Excellent value for the price.
Very good Italian food. Reasonable prices. Good size portions.

formatted_address: 45 S 3rd St, Brooklyn, NY 11249, USA
name: Freehold

reviews.text: Great experience, I went during the night time. Very relaxing music, played by an in house DJ. The bartenders are social and attentive to your order. You don't feel pressured to order and they are helpful in offering suggestions to help you choose. The food menu is fairly priced and vegan options are available per request if the menu doesn't suite your taste.

Best spot for trivia! Popular neighborhood hang out thanks to its friendly bartenders and large space, with a backyard that is open during the summer. Surprisingly friendly spot for remote workers (fast wifi), with crowds rolling in at happy hour. Lots of diet/allergy friendly food options. Bring some cash and wander to the back of the bar to impress your date with an arcade game.

As a person who never really sets foot in Brooklyn, I had to attend a meeting here and let me just say, I thought I was in a whole other world. The atmosphere is relaxing and beautiful. The staff is super friendly and the drinks are made just perfect and elegantly. It caught me off guard because when you first walk in, it looks like an ordinary coffee shop only cuter and more chill. Once you go further in, it expands into this wonderfully chill vibe gastropub. The seating, the lighting, the drinks, it's all wonderful. I loved it and I definitely plan to come back.

I don’t often make my way to Brooklyn was over here for a company Holiday party...what an awesome spot! Not a lot of fuss on the outside but very big on the inside. Large space for hanging and a great room for private parties (complete with arcade games and skee ball)

Coffee shop  / lounge by day, and a chill music filled / dj driven / club vibe spot by night.
Really great spot to hang out casually during the day and hangout and have fun with friends at night.
They also do bottle service in the evenings. 
Prices are expensive but about average for this neighborhood in Williamsburg.
Lots of open space and 2 different bat areas with seating and areas to lay Back and relax.

formatted_address: 769 6th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Fabio Crothers Exotic Dancers

formatted_address: 76 Carmine St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: TorikoNY

reviews.text: A wonderful dining experience. I got the omakase, but for the most part diners pick from a list of preset menus and get to taste a variety of their specialties. Chicken is clearly the specialty, and the whole bird is cooked which makes for a unique meal for people new to yakitori. Definitely worth spending an evening here!
Delicious and surprising dishes. Great bar too!

Let's start with dessert. It was amazing. A Sakura mousse over fruits with mochi cookie on top. The appetizers course was good as well. We thought the yakitori courses could have used more unique items. A couple of the chicken pieces were just so ever slightly overcooked. (If you were to be extremely picky)

I'm still thinking about the Black Garlic Ramen, it was excellent. Outstanding umami flavor from the broth, and the noodles were so well cooked, perfectly chewy and glutinous. There ghost pepper on the one chicken yakitori suck was a little much for me, but it was still delicious. Absolutely recommend this place.
Best yakitori I’ve ever had! Excellent sake selection too. Friendly chef and staff. Authentic Japanese cooking.

formatted_address: 229 Court St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Ghang Thai Kitchen

reviews.text:
Once on a Thursday, my best friend brought me here and we had an absolute best time! The food is wonderfully seasoned; I've had the crab fried rice plenty of times now because I go there EVERY time my schedule permits it. I've also fallen in love with a lady there who makes some of the best mojitos I've ever tasted. The only downside is that it is a bit of a walk from the Borough Hall/Court St. Train station. 

Did I mention that they have a cute little smoking area in the back? Beautiful during warm weather!

I dined in and everything was good. I got there about 7 on a Saturday and there was no wait. The appetizers are great and so is the fried rice. The fried red snapper is breaded and a fillet and is OK. The drinks are $12 and not alor of alcohol. Just enough
Seafood cha cha was ok, a bit chewy and salty. The menu looks like very Americanized Thai.
Gluten free options, very helpful, great taste
Nice place. Food aren't expensive. I recommend order noodles soup. Place good for party, dates and family

formatted_address: 95 Pearl St, New York, NY 10004, USA
name: Ulysses

reviews.text: Great place in lower Manhattan! Great after work crowd. Summers out side are awesome. Food and drinks always hit the spot! Oh and the Staff! They are always great and make me and my friends feel like home.

It is a cool place in the historical place in downtown. Cool decor, nice bar, friendly staff. Food is good for the most part. Bar food menu. Appetizers are ok, nothing really special, but main dishes are better. Good burger and short ribs. I would not recommend french onion soup, a little tart to my taste.
I absolutely loved this Irish gem  in the middle of the financial district.  It's super authentic and has a dark worn wood feel.  I didn't eat, but the food looked pretty good...bar food for sure.

Great staff. So friendly. Barman from Tipperary, rain on cobbles outside. Thought I was back in Dublin. We had Irish tapas. Sausage rolls, corned beef sliders, braised beef sliders. All excellent, the favorite being the beef. All washed down with Guinness.  Highly reccomend for food, staff, and atmosphere.

On recommendation from one of the people I met at the gym my friends and I went here. We were really impressed with the atmosphere and enjoyed the music being played. The barkeeps were super friendly. There was definitely a bit of an authentic Irish feel. We would totally have stayed longer if we didnt have other engagements.

formatted_address: 103 Waverly Pl, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: North Square

reviews.text: Reliable neighborhood place, steps from NYU and Washington Square. A gathering place for professors and happy tourists staying in the little hotel upstairs. Nice staff, perfectly fine food. Their veggie burger is yummy.
Wonderful !  Redsnapper was Devine , Wine was mmmmm , and chocolate tart was perfect! I think my salad was the best I've ever had.
Great service. Great food. Cant say enough good things about this place. Highly recommended!!!

Amazing place to eat. I've come here for both breakfast and dinner. The vibe is beautiful and clean. It's a pleasant place to dine. The service is great as well. Their oysters are delicious, filet mignon is juicy, and their desserts are great!
Great ambiance and service.. food exquisite.  Speacial thatnks to Priscilla...

formatted_address: 26 E 64th St, New York, NY 10065, USA
name: Altesi

reviews.text: Lovely atmosphere.  Sliced veal appetizer was excellent. Generous portion. Mozzarella ravioli was very good. Good quality cheese ,not salty like cheap mozzarella. Hostess pleasant and helpful. Try their American coffee, very good.
Very delicious food. Cute, small restaurant. Friendly service, check it out! Looks like they may have a glorious patio for summer

Excellent! The ambiance, food and service were outstanding. My friend had the Spaghetti Carbonara , I had the sausage omelette. The Atom 16 Cabernet was smooth as silk. Great place. Would definitely come back!
Nice Upper East Italian restaurant

First time and won’t be my last. What a wonderful restaurant. I came to this place for dinner under a foodie and friend’s recommendation, what a delicious treat - from the appetizers, freshly home-made pasta, fish options, and even the bread - everything in the menu was perfectly cooked and delicious. Owner is in site and making sure service is at par with the food quality. This is a neighborhood’s jewel.

formatted_address: 382 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: The Saint At Large, Inc.

formatted_address: 2532 Broadway, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: Manhattan Diner

reviews.text:
Best diner I have ever visited. The place is nice and the service is stupendous. Food was delicious, amazing and just delightful and delicious. This is literally the best food I have most likely eaten outside and in a diner. I will keep on coming here. 

Prices are also very reasonable especially with the delicious food you get. I really love this place and I will visit here again. 

Shout out to my girlfriend for putting me on, we will have more dates in here.
I was in search of good pancakes, and I found great ones here. Friendly and fast service, lovely spot to have a breakfast with a friend. Definitely would return for another window seat meal.

Had a solo lunch here before hitting the gym and I have to say I really enjoyed eating here. It was comfortable and the service was responsive. I had a egg avacado wrap that was a monster and delicious. Definitely will eat here again when I'm in the area.
Great food at a decent price with friendly staff...what more can you ask for??? Oh yeah...great air conditioning! Woot!

Service by our Orlando was superb. His personality perceeded  him when he greeted us at the table. Honest evaluations of the menu when asked for recommendations. The PorkChops was spot on the money... his choice ! Moist Juicy  and Extremely Flavorful. The Chicken Marsala was delicious. Highly recommend for a bite after a show at the Symphony Space

formatted_address: 396 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Jaiya

reviews.text: I sent my friends to this restaurant with my highest recommendations. I go their often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The the cooking is appetizing and the crew is generous and cooperative. Every time  we go to this place we enjoy a delightful evening.  highly recommended.

I’m not gonna lie, this place has pretty well seasoned and deliciously tasty food, but it’s so overpriced. $24 for rice is pretty outrageous but that’s what you get for eating in the city. Do yourself a favor and go eat in flushing or somewhere else because this place isn’t worth the high bills at the end. I had the volcanic soup and special sauce chicken which were all pretty good.
Loved the ambience and the taste of food. Great choices for drinks. Ample seating. Staff was good but they could have smiled more.

The Jaiya restaurant is smaller than it appears on television but the food is as advertised.  The lights are dim and the mood is very cozy and low key. It is great for a date night. The wait staff is fast and efficient. The food came right away. It was hot,fresh and delicious. Warning, it is serious Thai chill going on in some of the dishes so if you can't stand the heat be mindful of what you order.
I love this place. The food is fresh and filling. Really cute place!  Can't wait to go there again.

formatted_address: 4160 Broadway, New York, NY 10033, USA
name: Sapito's Sports Cantina

reviews.text:
Great location! Good food! Good service!  I really liked this place.  Was not impressed with the cost for basics at most Mexican restaurant.  No free chip and salsa... fajitas dish does not it come with tortillas.... rice and beans are also extra.  

If u find my review helpful,  please click like.

I was not impressed with the service the food was OK. Food was overpriced , A Coca-Cola glass bottle usually cost 2 to 3.50 we got a mini size bottle and they charge 450 for that-the waiter wasn’t so attentive and looked bothered to help. In other restaurants they usually put two tables together when it’s a big group this individual didn’t even bother to do that we had to do it ourselves when he came to take our order he didn’t ask whether we wanted something else or an additional to the item or anything to drink.After a while another waitress too over his shift.The waitresses were very friendly and helpful was with other people we have noticed but not the one who was with us.

Drinks are great here and the food is ok..I was hoping for better tasting (seasoned)food and was quite disappointed with my tacos and the chips with trio sauce- nothing to talk about. I didnt like the taste of the shredded chicken in the taco and the chips were to hard. The wine was nice and chilled and the tequila sunrise was delicious.

The waitress looked angry she was working. The bartender was nice but didn't give me silverware.  The food was good but non of my salsas were added to my burrito bowl. I'm not sure if they were supposed to be sauces on the side, but either way I never received them. The corn chips were less to be desired.  I think if employees came to work and created an environment they would want to experience themselves the restaurant business would be a much better place.  Take pride in the details.
Not pictured here.  The horchata drink was my favorite thing.  The food was really good the service was also good.  To be honest, everything was pretty good.

formatted_address: 328 Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10027, USA
name: Sylvia's

reviews.text: A Harlem/NYC staple and must-try if you want Soul Food in this city. I've been traveling from Brooklyn to eat here with my family and friends my entire life, and it's still my favorite restaurant! I've seen a lot of changes over the years and for the most part, I think they're all for the better. I miss seeing and talking to Ms. Sylvia as she would walk around the restaurant getting and talking to the guests, and I miss the Gospel Open Mic that used to be next door at Sylvia's Also. All of their fried food (chicken, pork chips and fish) is seasoned to perfection with the perfect crisp. The Sweet and Sassy BBQ sauce is my fave, so I make sure to always keep a bottle at home... but my most favorite food here is the cornbread! 😋 They serve it as a complimentary appetizer, but try not to make a meal out of it so you'll have room left for your actual entree!

I sat at the counter, which is what many locals seem to do. Many seats were available at 2:30pm. Service was prompt but not rushed. I got chicken and waffles with mac and cheese.  Chicken was tasty but not boneless (which I don't mind). Quite good but nothing to write home about; I'm from the south and I've definitely had much better for less. Still, it was an experience. Definitely a buy!

Finally visited the infamous Sylvia's and it lives up to the hype! The food is delicious. Of course, there's nothing to say about the decor. It's basic. No one was hired to make this place inviting. People come for the food and it's ample. For delicious comfort food this is the spot. It's soul food the way you want it to be.

Food was delicious! I had the fried chicken and ribs combo, with mac n cheese and garlic mash. It was amazing. Lovely atmosphere. Would of been 5 stars but I felt the service was a little slow but was still OK.

The was my first time at Sylvia's and it was so good. The ambiance of the R&B music, all the photos, the warm cornbread... all so good! I ordered the cornmeal Whiting with black eyed peas and yams... it literally gave me goosebumps. Definitely worth many more visits!!

formatted_address: 568 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Black Horse Pub

reviews.text: This kitchen is on fire and in a very good way... been coming here for a few years since it opened FOR THE FOOD. Unheard of in bars, at least in my experience. The signature Black Horse Burger (medium) is one of the most juicest and tastiest I've tried in New York and i live here over 30 years...also recommend the Shrimp Salad. A homerun place, oh and it being a pub, has great selection of draft beer and outdoor seating when weather permits.. a little loud at times(understandably being a sports bar) but well worth it...

Chill sports bar on 5th Ave. If you're big on drinks and sports come here and hang out for the night. The staff is great, very friendly, they have a wide range of drinks at the bar. Top shelf galore. The food menu is on point too. When you're in the area come by and enjoy yourself here. I promise it'll be a good time for your people.
Home-style cooking with friendly staff. The staff makes you feel right at home, which is wonderful. The food is good and prices are very reasonable.

The wings and tomatoe soup is awesome. The bartenders are on point. The wait staff however can improve the speed and quality of their service. Kitchen likely needs to be staffed better as food, while super delicious, takes a long time
This is the real Sports Pub! premier league games, college football. Great bar food (the black horse burger is amazing!) Definitely stop by for beer!

formatted_address: 119 W 56th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Knave at the Parker New York

reviews.text: This place is classically lovely. Great coffee and ambience, vaulted high ceilings and spacious seating areas. My only qualm is the presentation of the food. Coffee comes in cups but salad in plastic containers?!?
Very tony coffee shop and bar. Great ambiance and good place to take a date or close friends. Latte is $8 but smooth; dessert is tasty. Pricey but the ambiance, decor and seating make it worthwhile.
The ambiance, decor, coffee, chocolate cake, and cheesecake were all absolutely amazing!

This place is amazing! Absolutely worth paying the $8 for a coffee. I got a cappuccino and my wife got a latte and they were both incredible. Definitely high quality. Can’t wait to come back next time I’m in New York!
The service is sooooooo bad the lady working here is so slow soooooo sooo slow and shes not even busy just standing there doing nothing !!!!!

formatted_address: 123 Havemeyer St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Leo

reviews.text: Fabulous new place with outstanding creative pizza. We had the clam pie and the "hill" veggie pie and they were scrumptious, with incredible crust. Also the side of bitter greens is unusual and great. Order the bread, it is great and come with butter from Normandy that is heaven. The wine list is so creative and ambience is friendly and warm. Finally, the caramel and grapefruit soft serve is so weird and totally wonderful!

I came to try the pizza, but ended up trying the bread & butter as well, and I am so glad I did: the sourdough bread was delicious. A simple dish, yet so satisfying :)

The pizza was also good (I tried the Margherita) but I didn’t think it was outstanding (would get Best Pizza’s grandma slice over this one) but I’d go back for the bread and butter and to try their sandwiches which looked great.

Had breakfast at their bakery.

Great coffee, good sandwiches and pastry pizza thing.

Would have loved a more diverse breakfast menu, or some more of their breads to be available.

I’d def come here again, even if just for a ham and mustard sandwich and an espresso.

Came in here at 8pm on a Saturday night, they warned us there weren’t many tables available so we ordered a pizza and a salad to go. Were quoted 20min wait... we were finally given our pizza at 9pm and they forgot our salad. Had to wait another half an hour and finally walked out at 9:30 with our takeout order. Pizza is cold now. We could have gone to another restaurant, had a meal, and been home in the time it took them to prepare our to go order. It was suggested that we order drinks while we wait but an $8 beer comes in a short glass, not even a pint. Every wine is $14 by the glass regardless of the bottle price. This place is over-hyped and offers poor service for the price. You should switch to table service or figure out how to serve your customers in a reasonable timeframe. Because we had to pay up front, we weren’t able to get any discount or withhold tip for the service provided. First time coming to Leo and never coming back.
So good! We ordered a bunch of slices and everything was amazing. My favorite was the mushroom slice. The service was great! Would highly recommend!

formatted_address: 1000 5th Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA
name: Petrie Court

reviews.text: Very long line, expensive, and with few choices. We primarily wanted a quick beverage break and it took an hour to get a soda. Iced tea wasn't even an option.

Rather than pop out for food we thought we'd give the Petrie Court restaurant a go as we've eaten in two of the other restaurants at the Met.

The food was only okay though and nothing to write home about. The salmon I had was rather dry. Our waiter was very nice and the service was fast though. The setting is nice.

Decided to try this place out since it’s situated nicely inside the MET. Definitely wouldn’t come back here again since the food is mediocre at best and on the pricey side. The salmon had almost no taste and was lukewarm. The only reason why I’m giving this place two stars is because the waiter was pretty attentive and took our order promptly. There’s much better places to eat at around this area, save your time.

We stopped by for lunch at Petrie. From the moment we sat down at the table, it took 25 minutes for our waiter to acknowledge us, another 10 minutes to get our waters and another 10 minutes to get our orders taken. Our waiter did the minimum and did not exchange pleasantries. I ordered the squash soup. It was bland and watered down. Be warned, future visitors! Come visit the cafe for Central Park views only and you won't be disappointed. The rest is mediocre.

It was too hot up there on the roof, there was no place to sit in the shade, and I didn’t feel like ham sandwiches and canned Pepsi, so we went down and ate lunch at the Petrie Court Cafe. Anyway, this was a much better choice. We didn’t have to wait very long, and the atmosphere was superb, a setting worthy of a world-class museum. I had the Zucchini & Mozzarella Panini, which came with roasted red pepper hummus, garlic, and dill cured pickles. Excellent! The coffee was fine. I just can’t understand why there are so many one-starred reviews of this place! Maybe the service reflects the type of customer they are... ?

formatted_address: 117 Perry St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Left Bank

reviews.text: I've been coming to Left Bank for the better part of 2 years. It's def a favorite spot in NYC. The food is rustic but elegant. Cocktails are great. The vibe is romantic but relaxed. I love that it's family owned and the staff is always welcoming and cool. Left Bank is fantastic.

Good food and good atmosphere. We had the avocado and eggs on bread, the salmon and egg Benedict and the Dutch baby. The food was good. 
Better atmosphere and more enthusiastic customer service would take it from good to great

Great west village staple, the burger is delicious with all kinds of cheese on top, would be great to have some brioche options or maybe a pretzel bun as it come in a toasted sliced rustic bread (that is really good too!) I cannot stop eating their fries and the special dip sauce, they follow me in my dreams. The chocolate mousse is amongst the best in New York, drinks are perfectly done and the staff is the nicest lead by the amazing Danielle. Atmosfere is warm and welcoming, feels like a friend's house, great place for a date or dinner w the group.  Definitely a go.

Went for brunch and the whole experience was absolutely amazing! It was Father’s Day, so the restaurant was completely booked. They offered full service at the bar so we had some mimosas, mules, margaritas and food. Drinks were phenomenal, food was exceptional and service was excellent. 100% recommend and I cannot wait to go back and try the dinner menu!

Really delicious organic/comfy food in a French bistro -inspired cute place in the middle of Greenwich village. A very good jazz setlist is part of the experience. A bit pricey with not the friendliest servers, but overall a pretty nice experience.

formatted_address: 173 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Tre

reviews.text: Awesome little Italian place with great service and food.  Had the lasagna and it was delicious.  Service was top notch.  Would definitely recommend to my family and friends.  Will go back next time I’m in the city.
I liked this restaurant . It’s a little small but cozy and chill place. The food tasted delicious and I also liked the staff. They were very friendly and helpful.

While we got great service from our servers, the entrees were overly priced and either under cooked, over cooked or burnt. My dish pictured below was way too Al dente and the bits of bacon that was in the dish was burnt. Not a happy camper when I was forced to cough up around 18 dollars for that dish. Now their appetizers were actually tasty. The calamari, meatballs , bread with hummus dish were all tasty and worth their prices. I would not recommend this place for their entrees.

TRE is one of my go to restaurants because of the great food and great customer service. The service is fast and it's really clean. I recommend it to anybody in the area to check it out, you won't be let down.
Truly huge portions and reasonable. I had the homemade fettuccine with mushrooms and it did not disappoint!

formatted_address: 275 Church St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Da Mikele By Luzzo's

reviews.text: We were walking around and came across this place, we weren't sure at first, but decided to try it and glad we did. It has the wine cellar-type feel. The service was very attentive and quick. I got the margherita pizza and it was extremely good, quite tasty and full of flavor. We also had a salad and pasta, both were good and had nice presentation.
Fresh pizza made to order, they even have gluten free options. Highly recommended for occasions with big groups for a fun atmosphere with awesome decor and food.

I had a good time here, both because of the food and because of the fun atmosphere. We had a party of 25 or so, but we got there around 4 so it wasn’t crowded and we were seated right away. It get pretty spacious, and the interior of the restaurant is beautiful. As far as the pizza goes, it was pretty good and my favorite part was definitely the cheese. The cheese and the sauce were both exceptionally good, but the crust was only alright. That’s the one thing I would change about this place, but other than that I enjoyed my time here!

Okay

Location: Tribeca area, easily accessable via the A,C,E,N,Q,R,W,J,Z&6 subway lines. Parking can be a real pain in this area, espically during the workweek.

The Food: Fairly limited menu. I personally thought the menu was hard to follow, and pretty limited. I ended up going with the fettuccine as the name was recognizable. I was happy with the dish, and thought it was cooked well, however I didn't feel it was worth the $20 price tag. 

The service: Service here was adequate. The server was very nice, but not all that sociable. 

Overall: As long as I'm being taken out here by a vendor, I'll come, however if I'm the one hosting, I feel as if I can get a better value elsewhere.
Amazing pizza, similar to one I had in Rome. Very relaxed vibe and good service.

formatted_address: 66 Hicks St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Jack the Horse Tavern

reviews.text: The Oyster Room is a fave for happy hour. Best old fashioned drinks. Nice and strong and for cheap. Nice food as well. We usually get the fries and a friend bought the Mac and cheese. Amazing.  It's a small room. Come early.

Jack the Horse Tavern is an old North Heights standby, but somehow we had never gotten ourselves there. Last night, we finally went, and found it to be quite good. The staff was very friendly, and the dishes ranged from good to better than that. Particular standouts were the Berkshire pork chop, the risotto, and the sweet potato pie.  We'll be back.
I highly recommend their brunch. Their hours are a bit limited, they open at 5pm on weekdays, but their brunch starts relatively early on Sundays and the food is always on point.
Long time favourite. Love everything about this spot. The mashed potatos are ridiculous as well as the trout salad as well as their oyster bar around the corner

Limited but great  menu for meat eaters and vegetarians alike. Really nice atmosphere, can have a conversation over meal. Wheel chair accessible and they were very accommodating in finding the best table for us.

formatted_address: 125 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Ravagh

reviews.text: Delicious and well-prepared Persian food! You can tell the staff really cares about the experience you have here, and an added bonus was they had fresh, crispy tahdig! Nice wine and cocktail list, too
Nice food. Service is good, food is delicious and not really expensive. My favorite thing was the lentils soup although my kebab was delicious.

The food was good, I'm fact 4 stars but service was just under hence the 3 stars and the restrooms were in need of attention. Otherwise would recommend a visit and maybe I caught them on a bad day. Very pleasant servers but like I said just missing a bit of some energy maybe? But please, you be the judge and again food was very solid.

One of the rare Persian restaurants that serves Kutlet. Although their Barg kabob looks more like chenjeh or shish kana, it is delicious. Cool restaurant where you can enjoy your food while persian music is in the atmosphere

It's Legit.
Seriously - you loite, but ok at the menu, and it feels kinda like "oh, another kabob joint". Then you ask 'em about the line that simply sez. "stews", and they have it all - gormeh sabzi, fesenjan, etc - and they are, to put it simply, *legit*. 
The gormeh sabzi has exactly the right amount of preserved lemon in it, the cherry rice is off the charts, the mast khiar is appropriately rich and cooling, oh, it's all good good stuff.

So go. Take your appetite tho!

formatted_address: 487 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Bustan NYC

reviews.text: Delicious mediterranean food with adorable outdoor seating. They make the bread in house so it comes out steaming hot and delicious. The humus and their signature lamb dish were heavenly. My partner doesn't usually like lamb and even he enjoyed it. We very much enjoyed our meal and will definitely be back again.

Loved this place since it opened. The food is still superb, Happy Hour wine all specials legit, and ambiance more romantic now. Very reasonable prices too. Can't go wrong with any dish though I'm obsessed with anything that includes their bread.

This place was out of this world amazing! So flavorful, everything on the menu was a must have, my group tried so many dishes, so much herbs and spices. So fresh. Also the cocktails blew my mind, all with Israeli twists, amazing! Must go

1. The blonde hostess was super friendly and cute. 

2. Sit outside. It’s amazing out back. 

3. The food is very, very good. No complaints. 

4. Have many desserts. 

5. They have Whistle Pig 10 year. Try it.

Simply a great time. The bartender/server took the time to construct my entire meal from appraiser to dessert pairing each course with appropriate wine. Simply a great meal - the attention was superb.

formatted_address: 886 Gerard Ave, The Bronx, NY 10452, USA
name: Papa Juan Cigar Room Bronx

reviews.text: Atmosphere was excellent. Selections were good. Definitely will visit again and again.
Great service and a good selection of cigars
Small place, but nice and the ventalation is pretty good!
Nice chill spot. Took my papa there to get some sticks begore he went out of town. He loved it
nice place to lounge and smoke a nice cigar, byob

formatted_address: 120 Broadway, New York, NY 10271, USA
name: The Capital Grille - Curbside Takeout & Delivery

reviews.text: This place is amazing. I had an opportunity to dine at the Astor room inside the vault at the basement. Once in a lifetime experience. The food was amazing!!! The least was perfectly done as requested.

I celebrated my nomination last night in this great place. I am glad to say that we had a cool evening and the place was surely one of the reasons for this fruitful celebration. The waiters  cooperated in a pleasant way, the cooking was appetizing and my guests were extremely  pleased. We shall absolutely visit again for more joyful events. thanks very much.

Capital Grill does not disappoint. It’s a regular dinner spot for us back in Atlanta where we live. This time though, I met a friend for lunch. I’d never been in for lunch, so it was nice to grab a burger and see what that was about. Really solid.. as if I needed another reason to go!

Great steak, great atmosphere! If you're looking for an old school steak house, this is it! Our waiter Carlton was excellent! Drinks were made well and the steaks were delicious! Sides were good too and the creme brûlée was amazing
Beautiful place. It was my birthday!! They welcomed me and made my day very special my waiter Jennifer was terrific! Very attentive. This will be my go to spot everytime I'm near wall street

formatted_address: 186 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Gomi Korean Wine Bar

reviews.text: I rarely ever leave reviews, but Gomi is just that good! I absolutely adore this restaurant. Fantastic food at a great price! I stopped by earlier today for brunch with a big group and we were all thoroughly impressed. Gomi is an absolute gem and a new favorite of mine!

This place has an unique personality. Starting by the owner, Rafael, that will welcome you with a big smile and bring you to your table. Cozy lighting and music. Flavorful food. Well selected wine. Awesome place.
A place with Korean-style food, special and too good wine

I celebrated my birthday yesterday in this fine place. happy to tell that we passed a astonishing evening and the place was unquestionably the reason for that outstanding evening. The waiters  cooperated in a splendid manner, the cooking was great and my guests were extremely  joyful. We shall surely come back again for more events. Thank you very much.
Best place to get something when in a rush. The customer service is efficient, rates are convenient, excellent atmosphere. Will visit here again

formatted_address: 72 Henry St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Henry's End

reviews.text: Not once have we ever been disappointed with Henry’s End. They know how to treat their customers well. Food is consistently prepared well and delicious. Had the roast duckling with clementine sauce this time- skin was nice and crispy, meat was perfectly cooked and succulent.

Brilliant! Wonderfully amazing  restaurant we wandered onto. Food was fabulous and the waitstaff was equal to the task. Even when we asked for our entrees to be slowed down so we could relax, and they were delivered 3 minutes later, the owner took care of the situation allowing for us to enjoy a beautiful evening and dinner. Thanks so much to all and we will return for more of the amazing food and ambiance.

My friends and I went into the restaurant because we heard it might be a good place to eat. We go in and notice there is an empty table, so we proceed to inquire about the wait to be seated. I’m not sure who the gentleman was, but he was very rude and stated there is a thing called reservations. My response was that is not how you greet anyone coming into your restaurant. I immediately realized there were no African-Americans in the restaurant. I responded stating his response was very rude and we are first timers coming to the restaurant. He was not bothered by my response. I proceeded to ask is this a reservation only restaurant. There was a Caucasian acquaintance who was bothered by the gentleman’s response also by the look on his face. This was my first time attempting to eat at this place. I wouldn’t ever go here again. Rude and unprofessional!!!!! Those persons I know I will spread the word to them!
Menu was interesting, ambience was nice. Place is small.

We came to this restaurant for dinner. This spot was recommended to us by a friend.  Well, it was a winning. The crew were extremely nice and we had an excellent feeling. The meal was delicious. We enjoyed every moment and we shall definitely come back again. we highly recommend this place.

formatted_address: 605 W 48th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Level 3 Nightclub

formatted_address: 268 West 47th Street, 8th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: The Copacabana Times Square

reviews.text: They have amazing American music dance club at the top floor and Spanish music dance club in the first floor. Their coat check and security check is awesome as they are very near the Times Square. The restrooms were at the top most floor inhabited by literally no one. So ladies, please do take company when you want to use the restroom. The crowd that came was decent but not great as compared to Tao. Some old folks trying to mingle with the ladies could be found but nothing worrisome. If you come down stairs to smoke, please be aware that the homeless there could be asking $20 bills as change. They know that you’d be drunk and could take you for a ride. So have 1 $ bills or 5$ bills just in case.

My friends and I went for NYE (I wanted to stay home, but was sadly out voted), and it was actually a lot of fun and had more space than I thought it would. Not sure what exactly I expected, but all of the workers were nice (for New Yorkers) and the bartenders did an amazing job keeping up with the crowd and being so energetic. Overall it was a great time and not tooooo expensive for a club in Time Square. I’d give 5 stars if they want to give me a discount for next year…

It's s very nice place to dance Salsa, Bachata and Merenge directly at the Times Square. The Salsa Club is in the 1st floor, in the ground floor is a bar/restaurant with latino disco music. Staff was excellent. Security excellent. Music was excellent.

We were like 15 people who went here for Saturday night and we were not sure how we felt about going here looking at the photos. But one of my friend said that he has been here and ilwe will have a good time. We trusted him and went here and had absolutely amazing time. The music they played was nice but more then that the crowd was real nice. Would 100% go back here again
Music was great, upbeat and fun crowd! Spanish music my favorite! Bartenders were very friendly! Easy to get in, would recommend!

formatted_address: 612 Metropolitan Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Northern Bell

reviews.text: My daughter took me there for midweek birthday supper. Loved the little frying skillets of Mac and cheese. Chicken wings done perfectly. Very juicy and we'll seasoned. Portions were generous and staff were pleasant and attentive without rushing us.

Great place to enjoy nice weather on their back patio. Beer selection is good and well priced. Didn’t have a cocktail but they sounded fun. The biscuits & gravy were huge! Would highly recommend sharing them with a friend. They are pretty good for the northeast. I’d also recommend the AM salad. It was so fresh and yummy. I never had granola on a salad but it totally worked!

i absolutely love this place. it's exactly what you need and want for your neighborhood bar and restaurant. everyone who works there ends up feeling like family. they are always open to hosting different events. they even let me bring in my nyc public school students for a holiday feast. they were so welcoming. my kids had the best time grubbing out and playing darts. it was so cute. mike really took care of them. the mac and cheese kills me in the best way. the wings are perfect. i love it here. they really understand community and food and what the people want.
Very busy place!   Love the ambience.   Food list is limited but everything is nicely prepared.   A perfect fit for the neighborhood.
Great beer selection, nice happy hour. Got the Bell Burger, adding lettuce and tomato. Yum!! Really nice ambiance also. Would be a nice place to come do work during the day.

formatted_address: Manhattan Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11222, USA
name: Bethany Diamont's Place

formatted_address: 164 W 75th St, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: 'Cesca

reviews.text: The service and food was excellent!  The pork chop is huge and cooked to perfection.  Chocolate Mousse Cake was excellent.
Excellent dinner. Very good service. Excellent and patient reservation staff. Would definitely return. Great Pork chops (porterhouse) and Duck. Octopus salad (starter) was excellent

I am only giving this one star because zero stars wasn’t an option.  Absolute worse dining experience I’ve had in 20 years of eating in the city, or anywhere else actually. Arrived last night for a 7:30 reservation, and we had a show to go to at 9:30 across the street at the Beacon. I knew we may have some troubles after quickly hearing 2 tables nearby ask for the manager to complain. After 1 hr and 45 min of waiting, we realized that our food was no where in site. We had to leave without ever getting our meals. We spoke to the manager quickly who had a line if people waiting to talk to him. He was very apologetic but had not reasons to give us as to why they couldn’t get the food out. We left and got online for the show and we’re surrounded by people who were all complaining about their experience at Cesca and also never received their main course. Some had reservations as early as 7pm. You would think 2+ hours would be more than enough time. I’ve done pharmaceutical sales in manhattan where my job was to constantly take physicians out to eat and don’t have any stories that I can even compare to this experience. Dozens of people had their night affected by this experience.

First impression is great, nicely dim lighting and good size restaurant, can seat over 150 people.  Greet by a courteous hostess, order a drink and a appetizer.  Waited for about 15 mins before we were seated, right timing, we are ready for the main course.

Ordered a clam with linguini, perfectly cook.  All the clams open up- very fresh.  Love the clam broth infused with garlic,  my favorite

Ordered another drink and a dessert, chocolate mousse, not too sweet, perfect combo with the main course.

Overall, great food and excellent staff.  What can you ask for more

Wow starting to see lots of bad reviews for this place. Used to love going there now we are done with the place. was there over the week end and there were only two other tables besides us. New Management?? They had a rewards program which we had accumulated quite a few points then it just stop I asked the manager about it and he basically said Yep you're screwed program is gone and he seemed annoyed I asked him about it. PS they still advertise it on their website. Anyway food was just fair no way worth the price. there are plenty of other finer restaurants on the UWS I recommend giving them a try and avoiding this place.

formatted_address: 115 E 23rd St, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Gotham Winery

reviews.text: Had a few of their wines at the wine tasting event. The Pinot is a definite winner in my opinion. Will get a few more bottles as soon as we can, to keep in stock at home.
I was recommended to try some Gotham Winery wines from a friend. Bought some from my local store. High quality at low prices with a great selection of wines.😀

Gotham Winery is not your average wine! In addition to having a variety of delicious wine, they pair (hehe) their wine with really fun events  - coming up Equinox spin class with one of their most popular instructors followed by wine happy hour after, and on the wait list for the Northfork wine tour!
Good selection and variety of wines that I tried at Wined up.
Excellent tasting wines. Ordered an entire crate of wines online in NYC.

formatted_address: 146 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Beauty & Essex

reviews.text: Been here for two different occasions in the last 60 days.  The food was amazing both times. If you like taking pics the decor is cute. Dinner was great the food, ambiance and music. Brunch the food was good and I loved how you were able to taste a little of everything.  The crowd is much younger upstairs but if you are okay with that then enjoy.

Beautiful decor! Very elegant but risque at the same time. Food is amazing, and service is good. Went to celebrate a friends birthday, however they charge more than expected for a "cake fee" which seems silly. We brought the cake, and was a decent size party, so its not like they weren't getting a good tip out of it.

Upscale tapas style restaurant. Shareable plates only with exception of a prime meats menu. Very popular restaurant, so make reservations ahead of time. Two bars with an extensive drink menu. Intimate lighting makes reading the menu a bit challenging. Menu covers a broad range of cuisines without being overwhelming. Perfect portions. Food comes out as it's ready. Very prompt. Dessert menu equally diverse but too good to choose just one. Chef-selected assortment of bite-size desserts well worth it.

Three of us stopped in for cocktails at noon on Saturday.  It was busy but soon enough we got seats in the lounge area.  The drinks were good (I had a perfect Manhattan) though it didn't live up to the hype.  If in the neighborhood again I'll probably come back and try the food but I won't make the walk again just for cocktails.

Can’t go to nyc without going there at least one night. Probably have been there half a dozen times maybe more. Also tried their Vegas location. Always very consistent with their food and they know how to do ambiance. The dumplings might be my favourite thing but then again hard to chose when everything is so yummy.

formatted_address: 419 E 74th St, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: Inès

reviews.text: The epitome of neighborhood coffee shop at its excellence. Bright and welcoming both in terms of its spatial setting and the hospitality. The attitude and manner of the male server/manager/owner (I'm not sure) with a beard is a pure delight you would like to encounter at every coffee shop. Delicious sandwich, free wifi, restroom like that of 4-star hotel. What can I ask more?
Inès is honestly great. The coffee and food there are delicious. I go there very often with my friends wether it be for lunch or even after school. Cozy, good music, love it.

Cute neighborhood cafe with simple food, wine and coffee drinks. Went in for quick bite and coffee. Croque monsieur was very salty for my taste so wasn’t able to finish it. I would go back for coffee but don’t think I’ll be ordering any food in the future.
Noce and cosy place. Closed you smell bacon when you leave:)
Great place for a quick, healthy, delicious bite. Coffee’s awesome, staff is friendly, place is clean, music is great. Heartily recommended.

formatted_address: 1624 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10031, USA
name: Grill on the Hill

reviews.text: Friendly neighborhood bar in Hamilton Heights directly adjacent to City College. Lively and vibrant staff, I remember when this place opened in 2015. It brought light to an otherwise unused and dark corner. As a City College employee the last 6 years we definitely appreciate Grill on the Hill. Sadly I was there for a sendoff, I just accepted a promotional title at Corrections Dept and will be leaving CUNY after the holiday weekend. Some of my coworkers were good enough to send me off in style. Thanks for everything G.O.T.H.!
Excellent spot if you’re in the area.  Watch some football grab the $15 bucket of beer, eat some wings, and strike up some good conversation.  Had a wonderful time and will definitely be back

The location and the facade of the bar with the name of the bar somewhat gives me an idea if what kind of crowd I would be expecting and the environment and prices I should expect and then u enter and all Logic and past notions are thrown out the window because it's the exact opposite. The crowd is actually a white suburban college educated middle.class crowd and the prices are pricier than a trendy upscale restaurant.  I paid 8/dollars for a stella, which is more expensive than some fine dining eateries in Manhattan. So with that a person would expect a refurbished chic interior but then once again the total opposite.  So now web are all sitting in a old hike in the wall interior looking line a small college then local. At in upstate NY and old sports some colorless pictures hang randomly all over those cracked uneven chipped walls that surround an average looming bar with a part if the walk fikkd in with colored chalk as their drink menu.  The store then winds out into a hallway into the back room that is painted black completely empty  empty cheap old flat screen tv playing the news over a leather 1991black leather couch that use to be cool and in the corner I find what I was expecting all along.  2/yiung black teenagers in oversized white Ts drinking alone watching TV.  I laughed at the insanity of the start of 2020/and welcome it's twist.
BBQ Wings were solid! My partner wasn't a fan of the dry wings. Decent price for beers. Interested in going back for 0.50 wings on thursday (8 per drink order)!

Went there to watch the US Open Tennis. Beer selection was good, but the Caesar Salad was rather disappointing. The chicken was as dry as shoe leather, and instead of Romaine lettuce, cheap Iceberg lettuce was not used. That's a major fail. Anyway, the people behind the bar were great. Some of the customers there were regulars, so it has the nice neighborhood vibe. I guess people go there not necessarily for the food, but to hang out.

formatted_address: 161 Grand St, Brooklyn, NY 11249, USA
name: Fresh Kills Bar

reviews.text:
Everything about this bar is incredibly well thought-out. The interior design, seating, lighting, and of course cocktails. The inside is reminiscent of the inside of a wine bottle with some of the wall done in Cork and a rounded wood ceiling.

The staff was extremely friendly and quick and the drinks were delicious. They even have low ABV cocktails if you're not interested in drinking too much.
Really high quality drinks worth the $15 bucks each if you're looking for a well made mixed drink.
Awesome bar!! ROXANNE is great at her craft. She is very friendly and was on top of everything. Very mesmerizing how she made drinks that looked so cool!

Imagine sitting in the brain of a perfectionist - you thought you understood what you were getting yourself into... only to find even further attention given to the little things. Great interior, great music, great volume, great selection, great bartenders, great ice, great drinks - with the option to hand over drink choice to the masters behind the bar for a tailored-to-you cocktail. The devil is in the details and this place has mastered the liquor vice. Not overdone or underdone.

The look and feel of this place is really something else. Outstanding drinks to boot! If you got the dollars and enjoy the cocktail bar vibe this is the perfect date spot, guaranteed to at least dramatically increase your chances of getting laid.

formatted_address: 185 Loisaida Ave, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Rumba NYC Bar & Grill

formatted_address: 325 W 11th St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Orient Express Bar

reviews.text: We stumbled across this place a few months back. The staff is extremely professional and attentive. Their cocktail list is excellent. And the bartenders take their tending seriously. But without attitude. The atmosphere is chill and the lite bite food items are great. Even though I want to keep this place to ourselves I'd highly recommend checking it out. Thank you Orhun for providing a fantastic experience on New Years Eve!!
Such a cute little place. Great for a pastry and coffee. The staff is friendly and welcoming. And you feel like your in a small train car. With old luggage all around you.

Nice place to warm up in the Sunset during those chilly, foggy evenings.  The fireplace inside keeps you warm and toasty if you can manage to grab a table in front.  They have rotating drinks deals, and the prices are inexpensive.  A great place to kickback and unwind.  I like the ambiance and mellow atmosphere.  Stays open late (2am) which makes this place a prime spot to hangout with your friends any day of the week.
Good place ! Not a lot is space to seat and no standing up... But good cocktails, well balanced ! I recommend this place

Lovely and pleasant little neighborhood bar, with a tastefully done interior reminiscent of a train car, with posters and knick-knacks from along the route of the orient express (although one may quibble with a few, such as Amsterdam there). The decor and ambiance are what drew us in. On a Monday evening it was quiet and peaceful, an oasis from the hectic city and uproariously loud bars that dominate the scene today. 

Specializing in cocktails, the barkeep sheyan was helpful and unhurried, letting us meander the various options and features like we were buying a car. Reasonable prices for bespoke cocktails, though what had happened to the world that makes me think $15 is reasonable?

Food is mostly Turkish and Eastern Mediterranean, and was a fine complement to out cocktails.  

A gem if you can catch it.

formatted_address: 547 W 27th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: NYC HOT LIST

formatted_address: 429 Rogers Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11225, USA
name: Gold Room BK

reviews.text: Comfy vibe , friendly staff & great food.... BUT there’s no reason I  should go into a restaurant that just opened 4 the day(Sunday Brunch) & the bathroom is dirty it’s a turn off!! Do better b/c better matters!!

The gold room is very causal place to have a good time. I had the shrimp tacos which were very good. The drinks were very good not watered down or anything like that. The staff was very pleasant and very nice. They communicated very well with everyone that was in the place

My family and I stopped in for Sunday dinner and were greeted warmly at the door. Our order was taken and food served without an exorbitant wait.  Everything was tasty.  But the SHRIMP TACOS...WOW!!!  I’ll be going back.

We celebrated my daughter's birthday @ Gold Room and everything turned out great. The atmosphere is chic and relaxed, the food was delicious and the service was top notch.  We had a party of 15 for Brunch and everyone enjoyed everything from chicken & waffles to shrimp & grits. Rum Punch is definitely the best in Brooklyn. Definitely Recommend, stop in and enjoy the vibe.
Decided to try it for brunch since I liked their dinner service.  I would definitely recommend this place for brunch. Nice atmosphere and staff.

formatted_address: 323 Columbia St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Phil's Crummy Corner

reviews.text: I loved the food there n the atmosphere as well but I  want to no if u guys r going to reopen I no u guys posted in August u were closing but when I went by not sure if it was the ending of August or beginning of October I was told that u guys were renovating...Is this true or r u guys closed for good...
The food is good and the people who run the place are great.  Friendly and easy going atmosphere.
Phil is the greatest host from any place I've ever been. Makes you feel welcomed and at home. Delicious food at a great price. A must go to place.
It's like they took a section of PR and transplanted it in Brooklyn. The empanadas were delicious, steak was excellent. Great environment
Awesome puertorrican food! From someone who was born, raised, and lived in PR until recently, this is the most authentic place i’ve found in NYC so far. Great prices too! Plus friendly atmosphere

formatted_address: 485 Johnson Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11237, USA
name: The Holi Lot

reviews.text: Second year at the holi festival and always so much fun
Well spread place, really got the Warehouse feel.
Nice warehouse venue for live Electronica.
This was awesome

formatted_address: 652 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Tambour Bistro and Wine Bar

reviews.text: This place is a gem. Good food and great live music in south slope! Just a few blocks from the prospect ave stop on the R. A great place to spend the evening and enjoy music, wine and farm to table food. Currently on view: lush photography by NYC Artist Stacy Greene

Tambour is fantastic!  We came for dinner and live music last night and were floored by the beautiful ambiance and welcoming staff.  The food is incredible, menu options to appeal to all palates as well as a beautifully curated wine list.  

Our server was attentive, patient and we never felt rushed.  Plenty of time to enjoy the wine, food and live music by Reggie Young which made for an amazing night.  Owners Amy and Nick are welcoming and lovely.  Looking forward to our next visit.

A warm neighborhood great hangout place, reasonably priced and very nicely presented dishes by the young and talented chef. No mixed drinks but a good selection of vines. Lucky for those who can just walk in for a nice dinner and get to listen to local musicians whose music is their passion
Very good food. Nice atmosphere very nice people who work there I had the steak on brunch menus 😊

Tambour is a real gem!  The food, the ambiance....and the music!  If you like live jazz, it is right here in the South Slope.  If you like live jazz without a crowd...it is right here in the South Slope.  The food is excellent, of course, all of it.  Really nice folks too.  Enjoy.

formatted_address: 205 10th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Tía Pol

reviews.text:
The food is worth every penny.  Bring your friends and share everything on the menu.  
Come in during happy hour.  The waitress was really nice and gave us wonderful recommendations. She also let us know that happy hour was ending, but said we could order off the happy hour menu for our first round of drinks.

Truly authentic and delicious Spanish tapas place. Food is exquisite and refined. Our waitress was extremely professional and kind. Flabbergasting. Rates are quite high but relatively low for the area and the quality of service and food. Totally recommend it.

The food was good, it is an indoor place, not open roof. We ordered bunch of stuff, fried fish, steam fish, shrimps, lamb skewers, etc for the table. Would easily need two dished to fill even a small appetite. It is not definitely, you order one dish and you will be full, as i got  deceived with the images, thinking portions are huge. I loved the shrimp's broth, I has like 15-20 shrimps in it.
Super cozy Spanish tapas place in Chelsea. Loved everything I’ve tried here: kale salad with artichoke and white asparagus, tomato salad with tuna, chicken liver, and so on. Would love to come back!
Atmosphere was really cool, service is great and food is served fresh at a timely manner

formatted_address: 217 Nostrand Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11205, USA
name: Sugarhill

reviews.text: When you first walk in they have all these mirrors along the walls leading up to the restaurant. When we got upstairs we could seat ourselves and the tables settings were just beautiful. Sherry waa our waitress and she was so lovely. My husband even asked her to be his auntie lol he's so silly. But the rolls were amazing!! I love bread. The portions are so big for the price and I ended up ordering too much food but it was great. And they gave me a carrot cake on the house for my birthday. My new goto for breakfast in the Bronx.

It may smell like old people but the music is great and the food is good.  The drinks are strong so I had to limit that but I had a great time.  Vibes were relaxed.  Not ghetto or loud.  My type of vibe.
Went there for a birthday party and had a great time.  The food read good.  The music was banging.  It was an amazing night to reunite with family and friends.
Music and atmosphere was excellent. The two female bartenders are very nice but slow. Furniture needs to be updated

The service was good.. Brunch was okay.. Sheila was wonderful.. Ask for ginger ale which wasn't apart of the brunch and offered to pay extra but couldn't get it because it wasn't apart of the brunch menu. But I guess it was okay..

formatted_address: 509 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Jacob's Pickles

reviews.text:
I have been going to Jacob’s Pickles since 2016, and I love it! The food consistency remains the same which is amazing, and which is why I keep bringing people back here. 

Their Mac & Cheese is to die for. Their biscuits are amazing! It’s just so damn good! 

Cocktails are great, different but great. 

Please note, they don’t have small portions, they’re quite large and hefty, you’ll leave out of their feeling guilty that you ate as much as you did, but satisfied and content that you tasted what you did.

Great place for drinks and appetizers.  The biscuits and dressings are delicious.  The food is good but the menu is limited and could use some new dishes.  The waiters and waitresses are super friendly  and quick to serve you.the tots vodka w rosemary and lemonade are to die for. You can't get enough of them super delicious.  Prices are reasonable

A bit of a wait on a Tuesday morning but it’s a popular spot! The fried pickles were great, I only wish the portions were bigger but I can’t say that about the mains! Our biscuit and honey fried chicken dish was huge! Big enough for two and an appetizer. Great atmosphere, only thing I can say is the music is too loud, it’s like a bar on Saturday night but we were there on a Tuesday morning. For sure fun though!

Stopped here after a walk through Central Park. It was our first time in NYC and it was so great to eat somewhere that didn't feel super tourist-y. The place was packed and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. The food was amazing, our server was amazing, the music and the whole ambience was amazing. Would definitely go back.

My favorite place for brunch in the city. Everything here is amazing! The chicken is so good, the pancakes, Mac and cheese... You can't go wrong, seriously. Tip: bring an appetite, servings are humongous! If you aren't a big eater you can share, order an appetizer... Or you can take it home and have a second meal for the next day! Beer selection is also really good, so it's a great spot to have dessert and/or some drinks.

formatted_address: 43 W 46th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Ipanema

reviews.text: Very friendly staff, warm atmosphere. They propose a lot of traditional dishes from Brasil, and the main focus is meat. Rightly so, I should add, since both the quality and the quantity are top notch. Good choice of drinks, honest prices, especially given their location. It can get crowded, and the only real downside of this place is exactly this: being rather small, and with a low ceiling, when it's full it becomes way too loud. Other than that, I'm very happy with my experience here.

The service was friendly and the greetings warm. I really wanted to give Ipanema 5 stars but I couldn’t. The decor and ambiance of the place was very clean and tasteful.. they even threw in some Halloween decorations for the season. I suppose we arrived at some transitional period from lunch into dinner at about 4pm so the food was clearly not fresh. The mussels were dry and flavorless, the rice hard and I didn’t even bother the eat the jumbo shrimp atop my plate. I really do believe this place has a lot more to offer than the meal I had.. you guys just can’t offer stale food no matter the time. I was a bit disappointed if I’m honest. Hopefully I’ll visit another day and my experience will be a bit more pleasurable.

Have visited this restaurant a few times throughout the past twenty years.   This is my first since they relocated a few doors down.  We were excited to return and it did not disappoint.   First off, I suggest a reservation as they're always busy. Our server was friendly and prompt.  The food was tasty, although my daughter's steak was slightly over cooked.  My steak was a bit chewy, but it was a flank steak. Probably won't order that piece of meat again. The paella was as delicious as ever. Wish they didn't get rid of the yucca fries and the potatoes balls they used to serve. Where did the traditional Brazilian cheese bread go?  They have a delicious Brazilian soda, which is a citrusy ginger ale type drink.  It is refreshing and not overly sweet.  In our opinion, this restaurant was fair price for a place in the city.  Our total for three entrees was $120.

This restaurant is so good. One of my favorites in the city. Every time I go there I have the Calamari with the mango sauce. Delicious!!! My favorite main course is the Coconut fried shrimp with avocado and crab meat.
Great service and great environment!
Whenever you are in the City it's worth going to this restaurant.
They also have a nice space upstairs for large parties.

Good food, reasonable price, a real dining experience with food that feeds not just the stomach but speaks to the soul. A restaurant which understands the difference between eating to live, and living while eating. A real refuge in a place where cooking can be more about the profit than feeding people. I will revisit, simply because of the flavour of passion that permeates every bite.

formatted_address: 219 Grand St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Beats Karaoke Cafe

reviews.text: had my 7 year old daughters birthday party here, it was such a great find; you normally wouldn't think of karaoke for young kids but they offer a kids package here. something new that the kids had never done; they certainly had a great time! mind you, the kids party can only be done during certain hours 1-8pm Saturday and Sundays. it was a good price at 9/kid for the first hour followed by 6 each following hour and 6/hr for the adults. i bought my own cake to the party; it was such a delight hearing how my little girl really enjoyed her party.
we had a lot of fun, lots of updated songs every month, try their food its absolutely good. we had an amazing time and everyone in my party is excited to come back!
Great experience!! I was here last week. Staffs are so friendly and attentive. Great song selection and decent food! Definitely come back and throw the party here!
Amazing experience.. I came here last week after my friend’s birthday dinner, and everything was just perfect, I love it!! Totally recommend this place for your birthday party.
It was fun, large selection of songs. Close early 12AM . Sweet potato fries and chicken was really good and the private room is big

formatted_address: 110 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Sushi Dojo

reviews.text:
Delicious 😋 Some fantastic sushi and sashimi. The fish is so fresh and the cuts are amazing. Each piece is put together perfectly.
Ignore the posts about delivery and the music playing, the music is fine!

Very good omakase. Loved the creative sushi and good quality fish. Not traditional, but still good. I would have given it 4 stars if it wasn’t for the sushi rice. It was slightly too hot, vinegary and way too mushy. It threw off the taste and distracted me from the amazing fish.

The best sushi I have had in my life!!! Kelli & Jimmy were great — they were so informative about the specials and geared us in the right direction when ordering. 
Also, I had this sushi catered for a girls trip and it was the best decision I have made. Everyone was completely blown away. 
So so good !!! 🤤

I had the omakase sushi dinner here and it was delicious and amazing. It’s very filling. 15 pieces and a hand roll for $92 and you get very high quality fish. It’s very good value for delicious food. Just as good as Tokyo.

Explosions of Flavor!! That’s the only way I can describe the amazing sushi that Dojo creates daily! Jimmy was a master chef as he put together different ingredients to make new and spectacular sushi experiences. Each piece was a new adventure. Kelli was such a great host! Ask her to recommend the best sake for your meal. She always has the best recommendations. This is my favorite sushi spot! Make a reservation and enjoy the omakase!

formatted_address: 142 Hamilton Pl, New York, NY 10031, USA
name: L' Artista Italian Kitchen & Bar Hamilton Heights

reviews.text: They're new, so I hope they keep up the ambiance, but the best part has to be what's on the drinks menu. This place is different, and each drink has its own little backstory of creation. The bartender makes the drinks with care, so you're not just having a drink, but having one of his pieces of art. Workers are attentive and friendly. Coming  here to relax after a long day is ideal. Such a nice place

I think everyone in the neighborhood should visit L' Argot. The place is perfect for a night out, chatting with friends, dating, etc. I love their food especially their burgers. The drinks are a whole different level, I never had a bloody marry like the one they serve. The atmosphere is positive and the bartender is super cool. Not a loud music, perfect to had a conversation with someone else. The place is clean and organized, I visited the place 4 times already I will highly recommend it

I love this restaurant so much! Can not rave about it enough! The atmosphere is inviting and beautiful, and the staff are so great. My fiancé and I sat at the bar right next to the open kitchen and had wonderful conversations with the chef who was very accommodating to my dietary restrictions. Love that the head chef is a woman, and she even gave us a complimentary dessert, flourless chocolate cake which I can not recommend enough!!!! We will be going back here as soon as possible and hope you do too!

This restaurant is phenomenal!!! SO glad it opened in our neighborhood- great atmosphere and place to be. Would most certainly recommend. Owner is lovely, food is excellent and the passion fruit drinks are spectacular! Best burger in town!
Excellent food and a thoughtful wine list but what really stands out is the staff. Wishing you the best of luck. Amazing addition to the neighborhood!

formatted_address: 66 9th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Gucci Gaines

formatted_address: 98 Thompson St #35, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: ClubHub

formatted_address: 1382 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: Campagnola

reviews.text: We had dinner here last night. I really enjoyed the ever so flavorful crab cake appetizer. As my main course I had a pasta dish. I do not recall the name, but it had scallops as well as mushrooms, olives, and tomatoes. It sounds like a simple dish, but again the flavor was complex. So much flavor! My grandmother had the Shrimp Scampi which was thoroughly enjoyed. For desert we had the Teramasu which also did not disappoint in the least! The staff was very accommodating and friendly. We had a wonderful  experience. 5 BIG STARS and highly recommended!

Campagnola ,Frank and staff really outdid themselves. 
I celebrated a special birthday and they made it magical for me!
Delicious food great service. We all continue talking when to return ! Lol
Must dine at this fine Italian restaurant!

Definitely our favorite Italian restaurant in the city. We go there for every big event in our lives such as anniversaries, birthdays and also to reward ourselves. They welcome you with cheese, bread and charcuterie. I recommend to take the pasta tasting, it already gives you a taste of how amazing they are. Sauces are out of this world and always fresh. We always take different food for main course but everything is good. I love the lamb rack or their steak. The dessert is also very good and fresh. For my husband birthday we had a huge platter of dessert and all our party enjoyed it! Ambiance is perfect and family like. Would totally recommend and we always go back so you should too! You will love it!
Great food in a cozy old-world neighborhood environment. Enjoyed the experience and the food. Worth the trip.
Great old school service and excellent food. Love the vibe here.

formatted_address: 251 6th Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: 4 Way Deli

reviews.text: Great service and the daytime sandwichero makes incredibly delicious sandwiches.
The got one of the best sandwiches in the area. Tasty
The best hands down!💜
Great menu items

formatted_address: 183 W 10th St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: While We Were Young Kitchen & Cocktails

reviews.text:
This restaurant is truly a dream come true! How do I even describe this stunning restaurant- modern, chic and charming! Our waiter was a sweet heart and the service was just lovely!
I had the spicy chicken dumplings- incredible flavors. For my entree I had the while we were young burger which was delicious!
The aesthetic was absolutely beautiful. Pink flowers and gold accents everywhere - very trendy!  
Ended up eating all my food because it was all just delicious!
