This restaurant has the cutest cocktails and the most delicious food you’ll try in NY! Everyone we spoke to (staff) in this restaurant were all extremely friendly! I had the short rib, and my sister had the dumplings and salmon. Definitely a must-try restaurant in NY!

The best experience ever! It was my birthday and we made reservations for a small group but more friends kept showing up. The guys were great because they accommodated all of us despite not having fair warning. It was appreciated so very much! Everyone had such a great time and was raving about how great the food was. The burger is what I got and it was mouth watering. The great prawn and spicy dumpling appetizers were so good, I definitely intend to go back for more. And the drinks! The drinks are all so pretty and tasted even more wonderful. I honestly can’t thank the restaurant staff enough for making this one of the best birthday’s ever!

A wonderful experience I had there with my friend today. I really enjoyed their avacado on toast, and their 'Talk To Me Dirty' cocktail. It was made perfectly! The staff is very polite and attentive. 

I look forward to returning here, and recommending more of my friends to it.

This place is a hole in the wall but the food is amazing!! You definitely need a reservation. Pictured is the Braised Short Rib with a little bit of mash, greens and mushrooms, 2 slices of toast and a gravy. 

The Kale Salad was sooooo delicious!! 

Ordered a carrot cake and thought it was two whole wheat slices of bread. The appearance of the carrot cake is not what you are used to but the taste was dynamite!! 

All and all it's a cool spot to go to "While We Were Young" :)

formatted_address: 1 Little W 12th St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Bagatelle

reviews.text: Great food, started with some spicy salmon rolls for the table - good presentation & very tasty. Then we all ordered different entrees - everything was shockingly tasty & presented very well for an upbeat place. Drinks are amazing. Not watered down, no complaints. You pay for what you get. Great brunch experience!

Had an amazing dinner experience here! The service was top notch and the food was amazing. My recommendations are the Mojito Royale for cocktail, the Gnocchi Truffés for appetizer and the Ravioli for entree.

I was looking forward to our dinner this past Sunday (March 8 2020) and I had actually build some hype around  that evening - not only because it was me that made the reservations but that included my employer and colleagues. Not only was I embarrassed but also highly disappointed on the lack of professional service demonstrated primarily by our server.  Though the food was exceptional the service failed to match.  A word of advice to management -please train your staff adequately to meet today’s basic food service demands.

This is a very fun brunch party. One of the bests I’ve been to! The party normally starts around 1-2pm and goes on! Food was very good. 
The only thing I didn’t like was that there was a policy that we couldn’t get a hard liquor bottle for the table without ordering champagne and the bottles were way over priced!

On Thursday evening following the new year, the crowd was as sparse as I've ever seen.  Under 12 guests, including this writer and guest.  The service was good, although not great, probably due to a language barrier, where the server spoke French fluently, and English to a functional manner, but did not seem to understand "tap water no ice", and poured Evian, subsequently billing us $36 for that.  He did remove it upon request, and was professional, seemed kind, and was attractive.  I ordered the whole fish special, and the $135 was never communicated to me, and while it was delicious, it was not worth that price.  The mashed butter, with potatoes were creamy, indulgent, and rich, and table bread perfect - crisp and satisfying - with just enough flavor to balance the meal.  Another language discrepancy was that I asked "Are my left overs packed?  Is the spinach there." to which the server ordered another spinach dish.  Annoying, but not painfully so.  Based on this, I would recommend Bagatelle, especially for Sunday Brunch, at which point it is a zoo of beautiful people, and loud music, a far cry from the intimate dinner I attended.

formatted_address: 97 Bowery, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Sup Crab

reviews.text: We got the King crab cooked three ways. They used the head part to cook fried rice with. We then chose to have the body cooked with salted egg yolk and the legs in garlic butter. Just one crab (~6.4 lbs) filled the two of us up that we even had leftovers to bring home. Salted egg yolk flavors was reminiscent of a recent trip we took to Singapore, mmm! Great meal, enjoyed with a bottle of wine as those were moderately priced.

We enjoyed the $99 combo - the ghost street sauce was delicious. The wings were also very good. We tried the chili wontons and sesame chicken from their non-boil menu, and those were great. Food came out fast. They have some cheap alcoholic beverages for all day happy hour

Went here for my birthday and I did not leave disappointed.  The appetizers & meals were absolutely divine.  Everything is fresh & flavorful.  Their calamari & scallion pancakes are to DIE for!  So good, my party & I had to order them again after our meals.  Their portions aren't as big as I anticipated, but definitely perfect for sharing - I'm just greedy, lol.  A tad bit pricey, but that's to be expected with seafood.  Besides the food, the restaurant is small & cute.  Very nice vibe & ambiance.  Employees are very nice.  It was hard understanding our waitress (or vice versa) at times because of the language barrier, but she did her best to conveying any information we requested.  She even gave my party coupons to return!  I have no complaints, I'll definitely be going back soon.

Took a while to serve the food, shrimp was a bit hard and could have been steamed a bit longer, but that Tomato Cajun sauce is amazing, the decorations create such a good vibe, and the portions are nice! Kind of wish we went during lunch special since the difference in prices are almost half. Overall a great experience. And, oh, that orange chicken is really really good too.
So delicious!! Highly recommend with a big group of people. The king crab was amazing with the egg yolk fried outside.  Very good service too, they gave us a few free dishes when we ordered the crab!

formatted_address: 1744 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA
name: DTUT

reviews.text:
Cozy cafe with really great coffee, pastries, and sandwiches. Ambiance is upbeat — a curated playlist plays on — people use the space to work, lots of laptops in the space. 

Free WiFi. Bathrooms available. Limited outlets for charging so come with a full battery if you plan on getting work done.

The decoration and atmosphere of this cafe are outstanding. There are lots of different tables and seatings for your work, read, or simple drink. I wish they were a bit less strict on the wifi policy though.
Pretty cool place.  Very dark inside while providing board games and coffee, so a bit split on the type of ambiance.  Bar or coffeeshop?  A bit of both--overall a chill hangout space.

Very average place.  Food is okay, but better options exist nearby.  Beer options have a good spread amongst different style and locales, but don't hard-to-find or incredible beer offerings here.  Seems like it would be too loud/distracting to try and get work done here.
It's a great place to visit and sit. I don't like making orders though because the staff is kinda cold and standoffish. I love the tomato cream soup. It's a must have.

formatted_address: 57 Jane St #5131, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Móle

reviews.text: We popped in without a reservation on a Friday and even though it was very crowded, we were seated within about 15 minutes. Food was excellent! Service was very attentive. It's loud and you sit very close by other patrons in case you're looking for something low key - this isn't it. Highly recommend it for anyone looking for really good Mexican.

Sadly nothing special. I’ve visited twice and the only aspects that I’m a fan of is the outdoor seating option. Chicken fajita is a pass and the guacamole needs more flavor.  I’m not saying that the nearby Dos Caminos is any better, but they do have a large drink menu. 

Oh how I wish this was great!
Wow! Just wow! Exceptional food,  fresh-juice margaritas, and great service! Huge portions so go hungry!

Came here on a super cold day. Very easy to get a table. Service was very attentive, the bartender was also serving. We got the shrimp and steak tacos. As well as the chicken soup which is not in the photos. 
The soup was amazing, very flavorful, just wish there was more in there, the ratio from ingredients to broth was very off. Way more broth than we wanted. 
The shrimp tacos were ok, lots of lettuce and salsa not enough shrimp. 
The steak tacos were amazing! Great portions and wonderful flavor!

The chips and fresh guacamole were delicious. My burrito bowl was good, but the chicken was a little overcooked. The service was fast and friendly. This is a fun place for a quick meal with the option to sit on a patio.

formatted_address: 365 Van Brunt St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Fort Defiance

reviews.text: Great place. Able to score a premium table at 6:45 with no reservation. Got crowded very quickly. Very good food and friendly service. Thursdays are Tiki night. Bar was full and many people were drinking rum drinks in fun glassware. I am more of a beer person so was into the small but well-curated beer list including great local brewery options (Strong Rope and Other Half were highlights). Really enjoyed the skate entree - super good. Service was friendly and fast. Space is tiny with neighborhood vibe. It's one of those great places in NYC that gives you a flavor of the culture of the local neighborhood. Excellent choice for single or couple if you are in Red Hook. Groups and families would need reservations due to small space (in fact, families and large groups should inquire with the manager). Enjoy!
Excellent and tasty. Their Irish Coffee is the best ever! We went for breakfast but I’m sure every meal that comes out of their kitchen is 5 stars. Local flare

A fun brunch spot with a crisp menu, lovely decor, friendly vibes, and tasty dishes. Seems like it’s a spot for drinks too. Had a delicious huevos rancheros with pork chili, and a nice strong cup of coffee. Egg dishes solid all around. Nice naturally bright interior.
Always a great brunch or date spot. Excellent drinks and coffee.

I really enjoyed the interior and decor of Fort Defiance, and it's apparently got a very stories party and history in Brooklyn which are inscribed on the walls, accompanied by nuanced imagery and creative illustrations.

I was with friends looking to nurse a hangover and Forte Defiance was open and had available seating for 3. This was a Friday around 8 or 9pm. 
I had a really juicy delicious bigger, some nicely seasoned potatoes, and a cider. It definitely hit the spot. Another friend that's a fan of seafood had a serving of mussels, and later a serving of oysters, and thoroughly enjoyed both. 
Highly recommend if you don't mind a bit of a walk from the subway.

formatted_address: 637 W 50th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Orbit East Harlem

reviews.text: Horrible staff, very aggressive, over priced, poor music selection by DJ, over populated with males barely any females, very hood, they lie to you that celebrity is showing up just so you can stay. Although it wasn't my event, I was not pleased at all with the service. If you want to have a good time I do not reccomend this place.

I was here for a PSquare performance on Friday. I had an amazing time! The bottle service was great & so was the DJ! The security was amazing too! They were kind & respectful. I feel like security in other clubs I’ve been to are always rude & ALWAYS seem to have an attitude. One memorable experience I had was with Torvald. I believe he goes by “T” He was sooooo nice & helpful. A perfect gentleman! I hope you see this 😂 Thank you soooooo much!
Was pretty dope. Annoying security though. Constantly moving people away from the bar and disrupting the flow of service.
Expensive downtown spot as expected 😂

They had the table place closed that was the only place u could really dance at instead people had to stand around the small as bar space no one was dancing but only doing sing alongs  the drinks was ridiculous $20 for a a cup of henny  then they constantly want u to buy a bottle if not u can't go to the dance floor area when they finally opened it was so crowded people  were standing around sitting around  people acting booshie and uptight  like they caint dance u it was congested standing in one spot with a wack as dj  telling u to buy a bottle every 15 seconds trying hype up this wack as clubSAVE YOUR MONEY AND ENERGY AND OUTFIT  DON'T GO THERE LOCATION WAS ridiculous middle of no were on 11th  ave no trains our anything BULLSHIT

formatted_address: 1492 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10075, USA
name: Mighty Quinn's Barbeque

reviews.text:
Solid counter serve BBQ place. Sausage was very tasty. Baked beans were pretty good, liked the big burnt end piece in there, but the Sweet Potatoes tasted like pure sugar, they were kinda making me sick.

Annoyingly all draft beers were out and wasn't impressed by the canned offerings. Still an enjoyable experience.
Superb atmosphere and very personal service. The food was crisp and delightful. Will clearly recommend this place to anyone. Convenient rates and generous meals. Great work.

I had the brisket sandwich, the meat was very tender but lacking in flavor until I added their delicious bbq sauce to it! This bbq sauce was delicious and really took the sandwich to another level in terms of flavor. I had a side of baked beans that were really good. I found the staff very friendly!

Worth the price (although it’s not pricier than your average UES takeout spot.) The food is good quality and the portions are generous. It is quick, fresh, and yummy. The staff is cool too. They make the corn fritters by the order so that they are super fresh.

Mighty Quinns recently catered a charity event I hosted for the Michael J. Fox foundation and the burnt ends and brussel sprouts were absolutely delicious. Everyone loved them so much and it helped make our event such a success. The team was extremely friendly and helpful. Such a pleasure to work with. Cannot more highly recommend!

formatted_address: 20 W 64th St, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Boulud Sud

reviews.text:
Had the sea bass and peach dessert, both were fantastic. Sea bass was full of flavors and very fresh. One of the best I have ever tried. Dessert was so tasty and not too sweet. 
Service was fast sand great. Will definitely go back.

I went here for Restaurant week, they have good selection. The interior of the restaurant is pretty modern. And their foods were amazing also the service! Lastly the dessert was very creative and fun & tasty!!!

Went here during the 2020 winter NYC restaurant week. Very strong menu and the dishes are done well that it will evoke memories of your travels to the region! The service is very on point and would definitely come back again to host or be hosted.

A real treat. Service was impeccable. Food quality was impeccable. This place is as close to Michelin as I’ve ever seen. The famous chef really brings in unique Mediterranean dishes that tastes amazing. So impressed with this place. 5 stars!
Wonderful foodie experience at great chef Daniel Boulud's Mediterranean restaurant in midtown Manhattan: lovely lunch before an opera matinee. As good as it gets!

formatted_address: 420 E 70th St, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: Jake DiPinto

reviews.text: High quality memeage

formatted_address: 398 Broome St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Sage Collective

reviews.text: Such a lovely place with relaxing and clam atmosphere! Veggie dumplings and Oolong tea cake were delicious. We were lucky to get a private room for the 3 of us. The service was excellent, the waitress kept filling more water for us as we chatting a lot. We had non-caffeine herbal tea, Organic Chrysanthemum which was great. First impression is everything. Thank you for providing a great experience. If you're a tea lover, I'd reckon Sage Collective without any reservation!
Cozy, elegant place with cute collectiona for sale. Service is warm and friendly. Fusion Chinese food are delicious. A bit pricey.

So lovely, the dishes are all really beautifully prepared and the home goods selection is so charming and lovely. The design of the space is gorgeous and the tea selection is killer. Had a lovely afternoon tea for 2 and edamame toast. So happy to see such a great gem added to the hood. :)

Great new tea room with tasteful decor, cozy and peaceful. I was here when it was full but it still felt quiet and zen. The tea selection is great for trying authentic, premium Chinese tea. The food is high quality too, definitely want to come back.

Referred by a friend. Definitely a cozy place to hang out with friends for a couple of coffee. Their coffee is really good! I like their food as well. Tried mushroom toast yesterday, really yummy. Never seen that in other places.

formatted_address: 166 West 4th Street, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: The Taco Shop

reviews.text: Brunch is the way to go here. The menu is exactly the same as dinner, and you get to pick and choose all the food you would ever want to try for $20 for 90 minutes.  For an additional $16, you can have unlimited drinks.  We came on St Patrick’s Day where they colored their margaritas green. Service was impeccable and prompt, and all the food was delicious.  We had all of the tacos, tamales, and quesadillas.  Don’t forget dessert. The churros are a must!

As soon as we walked in we asked for a table at the end because it was cold near the door, the server asked us if we had a reservation and we said no so he/she denied us yet the customers after us were asked the same question with the same answer and were still seated where we had asked for. I felt like they discriminated just because of our appearance. This person missed out on a really good tip because we ended up going upstairs where the service was excellent and every customer was treated equally. The WORST experience made me leave with a point of no return.
Burrito is way better!!
The food here is delicious and the margaritas are great too. I took away one star because the place is just so tiny. It's nice for an intimate dinner for two but not great for groups.
Great happy hour deal for 3 tacos and a drink. Good taco selection and flavor.
FABULOUS guacamole! Wonderful margaritas and a good variety of tacos.  Small, quaint, great service.

formatted_address: 135 W 42nd St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Aureole

reviews.text: So wife booked it and I always comply without question until she mentioned it wasn't her first choice. WELL IT SHOULD HAVE BEEN!!! usually the service doesn't transcend food this good but in this case, the service is the first thing with mentioning. It was incredibly attentive but just the perfect amount, not overbearing in any way. Extremely courteous. Now the food, it was perfect! We had veal cheek and scallops plus a few apps. It was all prix fix. Well worth it before a show. Very good experience.

Was so excited to go here-  went with a group of 8 people and started out great as  the wine service was lovely. I soon felt the wait staff needed more training since  I told the waiter I'd like a salad with dressing on the side and he  told  me "Oh they don't put too much dressing on the salads." Since I dine out often in New York City  I know how I like my expensive meals ! I also found the salad very disappointing as well as the entire meal. I was hoping the part of my meal I had wrapped to go would have been fine but they doused it with dressing so I had to throw it in the garbage.I'm sorry it went down this way. I wish it had been better.

Quite a bad experience - booked the restaurant for my dad's birthday for 6pm . We arrived and they overbooked the restaurant that day : as a result 30 minutes later we chose to leave (since we had a show at 8pm). The host was quite rude and said "don't worry - no matter if you write a bad review or not - we'll be just okay".    This is a great example of how NOT to do customer service : (1) screw up reservation for multiple guests on an important date (2) act non-chalant and not own up to the mistake. I suggest people to save their time and book another restaurant instead.

We ate here last night and we were very excited to try this place.  Heard great things.  Not that night.  Started off well, server was attentive at the beginning, until I received my single batch bourbon full of ice, it wasn’t a cocktail.  Then, we sat with dirty appetizer dishes until after being looked at for the fourth time, me pointing to our dishes, then we waited for over 30 minutes after they were cleared.   No server or anyone to check on us or server assistant.  We didn’t see the server again.   If I going to spend $3 or $300 like last night, at least ask me, how everything is?    Disappointed.   Food was good, service was not.   Maybe $300 wasn’t enough for good service?

This is a great restaurant, at least on Thanksgiving. I can’t speak to the other days, but on the holiday it was enjoyable. I had to take off a star for the price. For 2 three-course dinners and 4 cocktails, it came to $448 with tax and tip. I found that to be way too pricey for what we had. That said, what we had was good. The dinners were $125 each. They were worth $75 each (salad, main, dessert). Service was also terrific. It’s an excellent experience, it’s just a bit over the top in the pricing department. Previously, our Thanksgiving dinner was half the cost and just as delicious.

formatted_address: 265 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Sant Ambroeus

reviews.text:
Great espresso martinis and good service

Didn’t eat anything but based on observing other people’s tables, food looked great.

Would absolutely come back for a meal! 

Cool decor (see photo)

One of my FAVORITE places in the city! The atmosphere is great here (either super calm and quiet or incredibly live and bustling), and everyone is quite kind. The food is really good, and they have one of the best gluten free pastas in the city. The coffee and hot chocolate, however, are the real stars. So, so, so good. At least stop in for a coffee if you're in the neighborhood.
You aren’t coming here for food, you are coming to sit on the patio and people watch. For that it’s great and at a perfect spot.

Absolutely fabulous food and amazing organic Italian wine that was just delicious. Staff was really friendly and we felt right at ease.
Great time and great food and drink. We will be back.

This is a really beautiful space with outstanding food. The coffee is brilliant and the pasta is fantastic. Enjoyed a long business lunch with attentive service and limited interruptions. There was no rush to move us out - we had a great experience. Will definitely be back.

formatted_address: 20 W 33rd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Turntable Chicken Jazz

reviews.text: As far as Korean fried chicken goes, this place was just okay. Not the best, not the worst. The flavors were pretty good, but for the high price point and "hip" vibes, I was expecting something a little more exciting flavor-wise. The portions were also rather small. The hush puppies were just okay too. The "coolest" part was definitely the decor and the beer tower. If you're looking for a more authentic Korean fried chicken experience, you'll find far better options at other establishments in K-Town! I'll definitely be going elsewhere next time.

It was okay... The decor and ambience are great. Amazing music playing and lots of jazz themed decorations. Not exactly what I think of when I think Korean food but I didn't mind. The food was not bad but definitely a bit over priced which I'm sure you'll notice just by taking a quick look at the menu.

So we just left this place for our friend's birthday.  7 of us went.  We spend a couple of hours here and maybe under 600 with the gratuity included.  Food was ok, better than I thought.  But service was not helpful.  From a simple request by 1 person that they were dissatisfied with their drink (yes, we know, you already made it, and the person tasted it) to change to another one.  They had to ask 2 people, and then said no because you tasted it.  They could have been more accommodating with a single request.  We asked for a birthday candle at the end.  They said they could put it in a short glass.  But only if we bought more drinks.  Really?  This is the quickest way to lose 7 potential repeat customers....which they did.  

My final review...food isn't good enough to deal with they service quality and rudeness.  Stay away.

A hidden gem at 33rd St, right behind the Empire State building, the chicken is amazing, specially the spicy one, the rice...oh my God! The best I have tried in the town, staff is very attentive and kind I don't drink, but, my friend says the margaritas were great... The atmosphere is very nice and all the jazzy environment and the decorations makes this place a very unique one in the city. Highly recommend!!

The food was amazing. I was with a group of girls and we shared all the dishes and everything was so good. My favorite was the soy dumplings😋😋. The chicken fried rice and wings were delicious. The atmosphere was very cozy and comforting. Loved looking at the art on the wall.

formatted_address: 2418 Broadway, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Cibo e Vino

reviews.text: A lovely spot for lunch. We were able to sit outside on a gorgeous day, and our dog with us was no problem. The salmon was delicious, perfectly crispy skin. Everything else looks great as well. A great spot to people watch too.

Was ok. Nice staff, decent meals and an interesting menu and wine list.
Salad dressing was too salt though. Why not let the customer choose to add salt themselves, right?

Quaint,intimate Italian restaurant. Super staff. Great service.Buratta very good. Served with wedges of radiccio, candied walnuts and a fresh olive oil. Won't disappoint if you are looking for that local spot.
Love this place!! 🥰 really good service! Food delicious
Would absolutely recommend trying this spot. Great character, tasty dishes, great service. Great work.

formatted_address: 172 Rivington St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Black Cat LES

reviews.text:
I came here with a group of 10 to get coffee and had a great time.
It's probably a much better place to just get some work done without being bothered. There's ample seating and light jazz music playing in the background. As for the staff, the guys who tended to us were pretty sweet and the coffee was well-made. My personal recommendation would be to get the "Shot in the Dark".

A welcome addition to the list of glowing places in the neighborhood

Really cozy and comfy place with a relaxing ambiance. A nice place to get work done while sipping on delicious coffee and munching on great treats and sandwiches. Their ham and cheese sandwich was amazing and the staff is really kind. Definitely a nice place to chill or relax on a cold winter day or a blazing summer afternoon.

Nice cozy cafe.  They had decaf latte and I was able to stay for 30 min or so without feeling like I have to rush or anything.  It was a Wednesday night, last day of July in 2019 around 2030 and the place was about 1/3 full.  It has a free WiFi too, no password needed.  The AC was the right temperature and the music volume was low so you can talk without screaming.

I love BC LES!  I go often for their Friday night comedy show.  It's FREE, and a fun way to begin a night or end a work week.  The space is rustic, the cookies are huge and delicious.  The weekly comedy show is worth the trip, man.  The comedians are friendly and awesome.  Sure they are working new material, trying out bits.  It falsely makes me feel like I'm a part of their process, lol!  Just Go!  Laugh and have a good time.
Cheap, cool, casual and fun spot! Open mic comedy nights. Regular comedy nights. Great bar, café and seating. I go here regularly.

formatted_address: 9 E 38th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Japas NY

reviews.text: I have been to this place twice (well three times but one time was just a walk in on a Saturday which was a bit crazy, the other two times were reservations for rooms) and both times have been exceptional! My usual place was booked and we called this place. At first they said they were also booked but after speaking to a manager we got a great room for 12 people, crazy amounts of food, bottles of our drinks of choice, almost every song we wanted to sing and their music selection system was so smooth and you could also use your phone to send songs to the system. The second visit was even better than the first with happy hour room pricing. I think I found my new place!

First time going and absolutely loved it! The food was ready within 10 minutes of sitting down and the drinks about 5 minutes after. The only downside is that the food comes once. However, the drinks are unlimited. Very professional staff and when the bell was rang they came within 60 seconds. The room was big enough to fit probably 20 people but our group only had 9 so there was more than enough space for everyone. For the songs, downloading the app makes everything so much easier! Our group had a great time and we will definitely be returning soon!

Karaoke love. I have been to this spot a few times and have always ended up having a great time. I grab a drink and a microphone and let the good times roll. My party has ordered their appetizers, which are quite delicious as I've sampled some pieces but I've just truly enjoyed the ambiance. Everybody loves everybody when there's music and alcohol involved LOL!!!
Amazing song choices! I made last minute reservation and they worked with me to make sure everything was good! Great food and drinks 👌

The fun times had to end at 1:30am...host would not add an additional hour to the room, staff needed to go home 🥴🎤🍻.  The room was very clean and the place supplied sanitary microphone covers 👍, $23 pitchers of Sapporo, $10 per person per hour for the room. Very large selection of songs and it was quick learning curve to navigate the device to enter, skip & delete entries.

formatted_address: 15 E 3rd St, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: The GlitterLoft

reviews.text: Pure awesomeness.

formatted_address: 22 W 8th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Amelie Wine Bar

reviews.text: In love with this cute french bar/restaurant. Good choices of wine. Workers were kind and social. Sat at the bar during Happy Hour. HH was great! Tight place but what place in NY isn't. I would definitely come back and try more wines.
Amelie is quite lovely! I found my eyes wandering a lot to check out all the design quirks around the room. The room itself is dimly lit with a soft, red glow.
best place for a good bottle of wine

Had a great brunch here. The charcuterie was great. I wish my steak would've been seasoned a little better. It was a tad bland. Everything else was very good. My cocktail was very good. The servers are very attentive and personable. They were chatting with regulars and were making an effort to get to know new customers.

I love Amelie! Just come early if you want to get a spot for happy hour, I've been turned away a lot (normally a 30+ min wait during happy hour) but the wine flights are worth it!

Happy hour is only in the standing room so it can be crowded and loud since its so popular- If you want to experience Amelie but don't want to risk not getting a table, try their Upper West Side location!
I am simply in love. This has become my new favorite go to French place, with a cherry on top: they use Creekstone beef! *halal alert*

Disclaimer : you gotta do this place right ! Tapa style and skip the entrees , load up on appetizers.

Oysters from Maine were fresh and perfect With the vinegar and lemon. The watermelon gazpacho was a little bit underwhelming especially after two nights of me dining at Mercado - the little Spain by Jose andres in Hudson yards . However, it held its own which is worth a lot. The warm glob of pistachio crusted goat cheese really stole the show here And honestly I felt like every subsequent dish one upped the previous one, Ultimately culminating in an explosion of delicious hot and cold delight. The molten lava cake was hands-down the best dessert I have had in the country. Add to that the fact that you can customize it with whatever gelato flavor and it comes in a swirl of strawberry and creme Anglais . I would give it a 6/5 for texture and flavor and temperate - all being optimized in one perfect desert.
The cappuccino as a pallet cleanser was also very good with the desset.

formatted_address: 25 Cedar St, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: Koyzina Grill & Bar

reviews.text: One of my preferred places to eat. very good location, well kept, and very good customer service. Very good job!
They serve big dishes and for convenient pricing. very nice owner. Great work.
good variety of lunch options. I particularly like the back, I am not sure how it is called, they have great mixes of rice, vegetables and meats.
Place is closed, Koyzina Kafe is on the corner

formatted_address: 65 E 54th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Cellini

reviews.text: I first took my girlfriend to this restaurant over twenty years ago. Now married, and three kids later, we return each time we're in NYC.  I have sent numerous family members, friends, and clients to Cellini and have always heard rave reviews back.  In fact, my brother, who lives in Pennsylvania, is going tonight.  The food, service, and atmosphere at Cellini are great.  I love this restaurant and I highly recommend.

Food is 7/10. I like the fact that the dishes were balancedly seasoned (not too salty), the desserts (tiramisu & ricotta cheesecake) were also light & not super sweet. The price was reasonable for its quality & location.

The restaurant was clean, cozy & the staff was kind & attentive. 

Nothing too spectacular, but not a bad option for a nice Italian dinner kind of night.

Never order online from here. We first ordered a couple of entrees and they left one out. Fine, I'll just call and reorder it. No big deal right? Well, in the second order, they again forgot something. I mean come on guys, GET IT TOGETHER!!!! Seriously. Ridiculous. Never ordering from here again.

Old New York with no pretense. We enjoyed each other's company without feeling rushed. We were let alone by an attentive staff who were professionals able to read their clients. The good food was a compliment to the pleasant ambience

Overpriced Italian restaurant, food was bland, stale and the service was terrible.  The desert was old, you can taste that it was in the refrigerator for a long time.  I also lost my AirPods there and no one wanted to help.  I called and they said call after lunch we are busy, I call after lunch then they said call tomorrow because we are busy.  Then I call the next day and they said sorry we can’t help you.  Their service one the phone was just as terrible as in the restaurant.  Never again, I don’t recommend this place.

formatted_address: 137 Grand St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Granyette Wine & Spirits Inc

reviews.text: Great to notch service and great selection of everything...and awesome looking store
Good spot. Amazing selection. Love the wood smell and the wood look. Very well price and clean.
Amazing spot/prices. Friendly staff. Best part it smells woody, looks expensive/sophisticated.  Highly recommend. Very cool place to buy bottles and bottles and bottles.  👊👍
Great spot. Knowledgeable staff and terrific selection.
Friendly and helpful staff

formatted_address: 3534 Broadway, New York, NY 10031, USA
name: El Morocco Theater-Night Club

reviews.text: In my birthday bash party I didn't get my champagne that they offered me by phone. I didn't like that part, but over all it was a excellent club. ;-)
This place is very small nd ratchet on top of that the lil lady in the ladies rest room tried to charge me 2 dollars for a mint nd a squirt of lotion lol smfh crazy

El Morocco is one of the hottest clubs in the city. it has a great bar and the dance floor is big enough. djs will mix in bachata, salsa, merengue, reggaeton, and hip hop alll night long. the inside is beautiful and there's always a lot of dancing partners around. just make sure you go after 11pm when it really heats up...
Sweet box that what it is.. inside smells like arm pits
nice club

formatted_address: 1450 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: Mel's Burger Bar

reviews.text: The best burger I’ve had so far in the Upper East Side. The burgers are very juicy and cooked to perfection. They are very reasonably priced (burger and fries or side salad about $16/17). They have good drink deals as well with a beer and shot totaling $7. Would highly recommend to friends and will be back again.

Place is good. Good is not the best ever and it’s def not bad or less than good. Do you want a burger and tots? Come here. Will you enjoy and maybe not remember? Possibly. Solid 4 stars.  
Other notes : great service. Solid beer list.

Amazing experience yet again at Mel's. I ordered the Mel's double double with garlic fries. The food came in a timely manner and it was great. The service was great as well. This place has a great bar atmosphere and I highly recommend it

You'd think a place with "burger" in the bmw would have exceptional burgers but that isn't the case. They're good, sure, but not as good as I expected.

The staff was great up until we weren't asked if we wanted another beer when both our glasses bone dry in the late afternoon. So there goes one more star for lack of consistent service.

On a trip to nyc, my little brother and his wife suggested this place for us to go check out. I’m always willing to try something in regards to food so I said just lead the way. 
We took the train and walked during what was an unusual heat wave for winter in the north. After arriving we were greeted promptly and sat down right away. We came on a Sunday and wanted the unlimited brunch drinks, I started with a Bloody Mary because they are my favorite and then kept with the mimosas because frankly they are drinkable to a buzz like amount without getting fat fingers from sodium. The service was awesome and my drink was never empty.
Of course we had to have some food since we were brunch drinking to that level, I decided on the eggs Benedict they were simple but very delicious. This is a cool location, it was pretty packed since it was football Sunday but enjoyable and a place I would return to

formatted_address: 474 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Thyme & Tonic

reviews.text: This place has now gone vegan. Overall, service was good and the pancakes we ordered were well prepared. Lots if space for strollers and kids. Drawback was the music was a little loud and sounded like I was in a night club.

I got the salmon avocado bowl and it was delicious! I love their ethos on using fresh ingredients. The menu labels what’s vegan, vegetarian and gluten-free. Their server was really friendly. The seating, both indoor and outdoor, and the vibe were great.

False Advertising. 
I came for a grilled chicken sandwich. 
I got a chicken salad sandwich, with 2 slices of apples and a dry bun that tastes like it's been sitting in the freezer for too long. Atleast give me enough chicken to fill the whole bun. Also the latte was straight milk, STRAIGHT MILK. $15 for a sandwich and $5 for milk is a tad much. Do better please.

I loved this place! Went for brunch and got the vegan huevos rancheros and was totally blown away by how delicious it was. Cute atmosphere and friendly service as well. Can’t wait to go back and try more of the vegan options (there are tons!)

Avoid at all costs. All of the food arrived cold and way under cooked. I offered to pay, “whatever they felt was fair.” And was charged only $33 for the drinks so that part is encouraging. I hope they sort it out.

formatted_address: 127 E 23rd St, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Wild Child

formatted_address: 686 6th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Battle Hill Tavern

reviews.text: Me and and my wife being vegeterians decided to visit the place. They serve excellent pizzas and were very particular regarding our being vegetarians,They even suggested having honey with our pizzas , first time we ever had that , and it did taste interestingly delicious !It's part of Grand Walkerhill hotel where we were staying.The prices are a bit expensive but the atmosphere was very nice and view from the top is excellent.We liked it so much to go there twice during our visit to Seoul,

Great pizza and great service. 💯

We loved this place so much that we went back twice in the same week. The salad is amazing. The drinks were boozy enough, and the pizza was unreal.

We did the spicy honey pizza and I low key wanted to go back for a third time but I felt that the staff would start thinking negative things about my ability to make healthy choices.

The staff was awesome by the way. You can tell that this is slowly becoming the neighborhood hangout. 👍
Pizza was delicious. The waiter while I was sitting down asked for a tip and stood over me while I fumbled for my wallet. Bit rude, but okay.
Great beer, food and service

The pizza is still great, but the service was very unfriendly. We ate at the bar and I felt like we were bothering the bar person by coming in. There were only 2 other people in the place. It will put me off going back.

formatted_address: 1365 38th St, Brooklyn, NY 11218, USA
name: Imperial Sweater Inc

formatted_address: 111 South St, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: Fish Market

reviews.text: Omg this place. Can’t stop thinking about the crispy fried rice. Excellent dive bar with quality fusion American-Asian food. Jeff & Momma are the best 🙏🏽
For the love of the dive!! This spot is legendary amongst my office. Unassuming but awesome. Loy patrons, lots of regulars and incredible owner who always keeps it fun.

A very lively place serving great seafood with Asian twist. Can't beat a $18 lobster special. The owner (I think) and servers go around pouring shots of whiskey everyone. Lots of fun.

Still no idea how to open the door.

Great spot with an unexpected complete and utter dive atmosphere. Walked by this place a few times before heading in and am glad I did. Awesome service and terrific crowd and staff with good food and limited but sufficient drink options. Stayed a bit later than expected because it was such a great time. Can’t wait to come back again.

I knew this was a dive place so I expected the aesthetic and crowd. The service was great. The oysters are some of the worst I've had this year. And the "best dish" recommended was the chicken curry. The rice was clumpy and the chicken was just so-so. Curry had a decent flavor but not enough liquid to wet the rice. I love dive places but I won't be back here.

formatted_address: 127 Grand St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Le Botaniste

reviews.text:
Food wise, this place is really good, plant-based food, very healthy, clean, quality ingredients, natural wines, awesome vibes.

Two things we didnt like: The ordering process is a bit intimidating. It’s not clear how to order or what goes with what - we made our own bowl, ended up being kind of expensive because we added toppings. 

Have been back a few times, because even my husband who likes meat loves this place.

I don’t know what to say! By far the worst vegan restaurant I ever visited. The food looks good but lacks good flavor. I am not sure how they were able to miss up almost every dish! The male staff is truly unhappy person and not friendly, the female staff are good! The location and ambiance is far.

BEST PLACE EVER!!! The scene is amazing and the food was honestly one of the best lunches I’ve had. The portions are huge so it’s definitely a place that you’ll feel full after and could take some home. If you have a special diet (gluten free, vegan), there are a ton of options here. Definitely check it out!
Feel like walking into a pharmacy in French. Experience is pleasant and the food is not bad but not my type though
Amazing vegan place. So many options and such a great quality and service. Can’t wait to come back again and try more things 🥰

formatted_address: 155 E 42nd St, New York, NY 10017, USA
name: The Capital Grille - Curbside Takeout & Delivery

reviews.text: Love it here! Went to dinner with friends here for the first time last night and I would definitely recommend it to everyone. The customer service is so good the waiters are so nice and accommodating. The food taste so good I truly believe Jesus himself mashed those potatoes. I have officially moved this up to the #1 spot on my list of fine dinning restaurants. If you’re going on a date and want to impress them or even celebrating this is the go to place.

You definitely shouldn't miss out on a visit to Manhattan. I travel at least once each two months to NYC, and this is one of my favourites for dinner. Last week was the restaurant week and I made a reservation here.  The food was spectacular as always, and that classy atmosphere so magnificent...
The staff were very friendly and helpful. My teammates were delighted.
It's always a safe bet!

Wonderful setting, great ambiance, most things excellent but a couple of noticeable weaknesses. Wait staff was top notch, when they were physically in front of us. But they seemed to forget about us. Also, my NY strip had a seasoning I didn’t care for. I’d rather they let the meat speak for itself. I would try this place again but I’m in no hurry to rush back.

Enjoyed immensely! My first experience with  this place. Excellent the Food is absolutely delicious, I also really liked the interior decor of the place. You must try the it. This may be the best restaurant in nyc.

By 8:30 on s Saturday it was barely full.  In days past it was packed to the gills at prime times like this.  They may have outpriced themselves with $53 entrees and pricey wines.  The food was very good and the service was well paced for our leisurely meal.

formatted_address: 857 Atlantic Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11238, USA
name: The Social Butterfly

reviews.text: Great music, good atmosphere, it's just the spot to be at
Lots of fun! Great DJ. Lovely atmosphere
Cover charge is pricey but I really enjoyed the time I spent at the club. I would definitely go back
My club and I was in NY for visit we had a great time. Much love to The Social Butterfly for showing us a good time. From Royal Disturbance AC, TC, SC Club thanks
I just celebrated my birthday at The Social Butterfly and I had a blast, the owner Albert and his team made sure I had everything I needed their service is top notch. And the music was on point!

formatted_address: The Rooftop at Pier 17, 89 South St, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: R17

reviews.text:
Sometimes the "experience" at a restaurant begins before you even arrive. For R17, I reserved a table using an online service, specifying that we wanted to be seated away from high traffic or drafty areas. In my experience many restaurants/hosts/hostesses simply ignore requests like this. R17 didn't! They had a table by one of their two fireplaces ready for us on arrival and double checked to see that it was good by asking us to take a look, first. Excellent start! 

So we built on that great start with a waiter that was really good at answering questions. We had the salmon, curry mussels and the chicken.  The chicken was moist the curry sauce for the mussels was literally finger-licking-good and the salmon was awesome! I can't remember what our drinks were but I remember remarking that mine tasted really good! 

The design and decor is beautiful. After dinner take a walk around the perimeter of the roof and take in the sight of The Brooklyn Bridge and promenade. Make sure to take pictures the view is amazing all around. It does get window out on the water though so beware of that and bundle up if you step out in the winter. 

Bottomline: This place is awesome in the summer but I have a feeling I'll be coming back in the winter. You should too!
Upscale bar. The cocktails are amazing. They offer some food, but they are like tapas, for sharing. And they are so good. Can't wait to see the place during summer time.

Pier 17, with R17 at the top is really nice. The entire Seaport District is something to see and enjoy. We enjoyed our view of the Brooklyn Bridge during our lunch on July 3rd, however, the menu selection was limited and very pricey. R17 is nice, and I'm sure even more special at night. The staff were really great, friendly and attentive. The drinks were reasonably priced and the muffin burger was epic!

Genuinely fantastic food, I was impressed both lunch times I've been here. It can be a little hard to find, but it's very worth it. The english muffin burger and Cod were both way above what I expected.
Loved the rooftop and has amazing views. Outdoor and indoor options are available. Drinks are good, staff was amazing!!

formatted_address: 315 10th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Death Ave

reviews.text:
Pretty good drinks. Often very loud. Outdoor space out back for events. Edit: Owner wrote a pretty snippy response to my original review because I didn't post it in a timely manner.

I've worked in 10 Hudson Yards - about two blocks away - since 2017. My team had several events here, and this strangely aggressive interaction is pretty typical of the kind of service and interactions we had with the manager and owner (wait staff were always great). Even though I would avoid death ave for events I still enjoyed dropping by after work occasionally. I'd kind of forgotten about the reasons behind the event thing. I'm writing a more complete review to hopefully help other people avoid a frustrating experience.

The specialty cocktails - especially the banana-infused bourbon when it's in stock - are quite good but very expensive. There's also an attached in-house brewery which is decent. The food is fine but overpriced.

Not worth the 1 hr wait time and the price. We were a large group and were expecting good food at the end of 1 hr wait. The cod salad I got was mediocre at best, with the cod tasting stale. Henry, my dear friend who got the cod tacos felt the same. Some of my team members didn’t even finish their meal as you can see in pictures . Henry (again) didn’t get his glass of water. All this when you are paying premium prices!

This place rocks! Food was amazing! Drinks...just as good! Atmosphere and servers.... outstanding.  The selection of food was unique and seems to have been carefully crafted. Everything we had was tasty!! Loved it.

Best craft beer in the city. Every time, the perfect pour, the beer is always crisp, fresh and unique. My only complaints are that their beer selections tend to be concentrated on one style every time I go (out of six offerings, four are of the same kind) and invariably they are out of one or two beers, leaving limited options.

Cosy craft beer bar with decent dishes.
Friendly attentive staff who have good knowledge about the beers and food.
The prices are on the higher side but you do get good quality drinks and food for your money. So treat yourself!
Week day evenings are the busiest since it is a spot for after work drinks. 
Would recommend the truffle fries for a snack or the tacos are also great! The portions are not so big so order accordingly.

formatted_address: 259 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Baker & Co

reviews.text: We went there for brunch, the food were amazing, drinks are excellent! We have sangria with secret ingredient, perfect for brunch! Outdoor seats are nice and they have heating system, even in winter still warm!
Great happy hour - $6 wines and $8 spritz. Murray’s cheese is worth the snack, comes with bread an EVO. Baker & Co also has a great brunch!

Always great with wonderful flavours and familiar but new dishes prepared with fresh ingredients. awesome place for dinner or brunch with wonderful service and consistency with quality and beautiful presentation in the food.

Good authentic Italian food! The lasagne is delicious! Good variety of pastas and appetizers.
Did not like the sangria, but there is a fair variety of wines. Good food quality and presentation. A very nice atmosphere with friendly and helpful staff.

Has a bright garden/patio area that makes this a good brunch spot. No liquor license so only beer/wine options.

Good portion sizes, side of bacon was thick cut and a good option to share.

Frittata, eggs Benedict were massive, and the small pizza was another good option to share.

Don’t overlook this spot.

formatted_address: 208 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Caffè Bene

reviews.text: Poorly customer service, garbage behind the counter I asked for a double shot of espresso on my late and I did not get. I ask the gentleman if it was a double shot late he gave me an attitude and said to his co-worker " what's up with this guy" just not professional. What keep the customer caming back is the way we are treat. So sorry to tell you that you just lost one customer. You have to realize that the customer is always right other wise you going to lose your business.
Amazing place........ Amazing food ... And loyal staff.. love their service.. not so expensive and you can find good food here... Love to visit again...

The cafe means well but needs a good amount of work to improve their standards. Little bit towards the greasy in terms of food preparation. Coffee is a disaster: even long black coffee filled to the brim with 6000 Centigrade burned coffee. Allow 20 minutes before starting to drink it, not to mention the over spilling.

Very pleased with the service, and the food we ordered. Staff is extremely pleasant, and welcoming. Our order was prepared promptly, and everything we ordered was hot, delicious, and the servings were generous. Requested to share one large dessert, and the barista had the kitchen prepare two smaller dishes for us...a nice gesture, and it was appreciated.  would definitely visit this restaurant again.
Really nice surprise for a first time visit. Good options at the Restaurant and a really good serving for dinner. Acai Bowl and burgers were very good, worth another visit!

formatted_address: 23 W 32nd St f4, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Anytime Karaoke

reviews.text: Place is fun but be careful or you will get ripped off. They charged a drink minimum fee + all drinks we had + 30-40% tip on top along with other fees. We confronted the manager, cops were called and magically our $850 bill went down below $400. That tells you everything you need to know about the way this place operates. Don't be afraid to stand up to the managers if you are being charged for things that don't make any sense.

Finally, Korean tapas and bar with quality food and quality service. If you previously had bad experience in K-Town on your Friday night-out, come visit.

Please note they cannot take reservations on Fridays and Saturdays. It's usually 20-30 minute depending on when your parties arrive. They must all be here for you to be seated. Except occasionally, the General Manager will feel truly feel your pain for you to be starving while that one fashionably late friend really doesn't seem like they're gonna show up. That's what happened to us. He was generous to have us be seated to eat and drink while the friend hurried her way here.

Must:
1. Surf n' Turf (pork-based seafood soup with crispy rice) my favorite
2. Popcorn chicken (with squid ink) yes, really.
3. Bossam because what else?? BOSSSAAAMMMM!

They really have a specified, signature menu that only has about 20? Items, I was so close of ordering EOM (everything on the menu).

The servers, including the General Manager, are very dedicated and you can see it in their service and in the taste of food. 

There's pride.

I really take that seriously and put it into account when I write reviews on Yelp or Google. I will definitely come back and am excited for my next visit.

Question is, will you be developing new menus? I'm so intrigued!
This place is on fire 🔥🔥🔥 best experience ever I had.  song list, English, Spanish, Korea and few others..  we’ll definitely come back again! Cheers!

The soju and their food is incredible! Cheap prices for the soju. Had their popcorn chicken and fried snail. Others I was with had the need tartare and the fish ball soup. Everyone loved the good. Will definitely come back here!

Has a good spot, private and fun.
Only suggestion is to have more songs or find a way to let people use YouTube.
(they have a different program / app)

formatted_address: 99 Prince St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: The Mercer Kitchen

reviews.text: Visited during Restaurant Week for lunch. Truffle pizza was amazing! Service and staff was top notch. Will come back with the Mrs. For date night for sure!

Lunch was full of pleasant experiences, chill vibes and even better food.

My buddy suggested this place after a long morning trail and we decided to take a drive into the city. He actually never dined downstairs (where you have to make reservations for) and I personally have never dined here before, so we were in for a treat.

The ambiance was light and intimate. The natural lighting sets a beautiful tone and gives a great open feel all while still being "underground".

The staff is friendly, prioritizes properly and professionally courteous. The fire times of the kitchen we're faster than I thought to be honest. Typically I would like the meals paced, but we were starving and requested it to come out all at once, so it worked out perfectly in the end ~

I had the Plant-based Mercer Burger. It is super rich in flavor and gets better per bite. The non dairy Pepper Jack Cheese melts in your mouth and the texture holds its own as it would of an actual cheeseburger. Although I would say, definitely save some room for dessert because that Carrot Cake with a freshly brewed Cappuccino is something else.

I don't know about dinner, but it's quite the place for a nice lunch with a friend.

We came here on a second night. Reservations are a must because this restaurant has been packed with a young, professional crowd. The atmosphere is really cool with a fairly simple menu. Everything we ask is great, except for the very salty monkfish sauce. This is a restaurant you need to try in Soho

This restaurant is doubtless one of the most attractive restaurants in the neighborhood. Anytime I come there I am exceedingly pleased. They always keep their high  level service and the highest level of dishes  they provide. You always win with this place. Highly  recommended.

The food and service was very good at Mercer kitchen. We had a party of 10.  We had appetizers, meals, desserts, cocktails and after dinner drinks. Everything tasted terrific. Personally I had the lentil soup and rigatoni and meatballs. We finished off with a variety of deserts such as cheesecake, chocolate cake and a crumble type pie

formatted_address: 245 W 29th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Wild's Playground

formatted_address: 168 West 4th Street, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Tio Pepe

reviews.text: Went there for brunch with a friend. The service was attentive, staff are friendly, and we loved their Spanish food! We ordered a salad and paella, big enough to share by 2 female. Definitely will go there again for dinner!
Warm friendly service, the waiter was able to describe and recommend entrees.  The food was delicious.  (The Margaritas too!) A restaurant I would surely return to.

I have gone to this restaurant since 1993 and the staff is very friendly. The food and drinks are delicious. The atmosphere is relaxing and when they have the availability to open the front up it’s like an open area eating. The back of the restaurant is bright and clean as well. Just a lovely place to visit.
Manager and Servers are nice. I love the food.

Best of the Best Vegetable Paella! I was searching for a good vegetable paella for years and I finally found it here! The atmosphere is nice. Service is great! Dont forget to try Guacamole! They made it in front of you, which reminds me of the good time in Mexico!

formatted_address: 475 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Tarallucci e Vino

reviews.text: Great food, with nice selection of fresh produce at lunch time. Worth visiting also in the evening for a nice glass of wine. Staff are very pleasant, & remember details, like your order from your previous visit. The interior is fresh, full of light. Thoroughly recommend.
Impeccably delicious pasta!

Nice atmosphere but we wouldn’t have even gotten a seat if a table didn’t get up when we came in and I guess they don’t have a wait list. The only other table was reserved for the entire duration of our meal which was weird. Like we arrived and ate and left before that table even showed. Either way the food was good. Not the best I’ve ever had but good. The only reason it gets four stars is the prices for pasta. I get they make it in house but the portion was insanely small for $30.
Quaint spot. PERFECT for a date. Suggest it to your significant other, ladies! You won't be disappointed.

We had just finished wandering around the American Museum of Natural History and decided to look around the neighborhood for a quick bite to eat.  So we walked two blocks up and came across this diamond.  It so happened to be the perfect food for our last meal in New York.  It is on the corner with floor to ceiling windows making it nice light and open inside even though the size is a little quaint.  The hostess was very friendly and accommodating.  We choose to sit at the bar because all the tables where full and we had time restraints with our departing flights closely approaching.  The barista waited on us and were very attentive.  We had the gnocchi and the meatballs that were on the menu at that time, it appears that the menu has changed since then so I am not sure what the items were called on the menu.  We had a Bellini and mimosa as our appetizer, a lovely glass of red with our meal and an excellent cappuccino to accompany our Italian cookies.  It was a very delightful experience.  If I lived here I would come here often and it is nice to see that they change up the menu for the seasons. Overall the service was excellent the food delivery was prompt the pricing did not break the bank.

formatted_address: 1065 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Fusha Asian Cuisine

reviews.text: Wow!! This restaurant is a must visit if ever in New York,NY. A small place but, with an upscale Asian Fusion menu. Staff was welcoming, service was prompt everything on key.  Couldn't make up my mind want to order so, I ordered a little of "Everything" Fusha Asian Cuisine ! ..food was delicious and beautifully presented. All I can say I had a fabulous lunch. Highly recommended it.
Such a great atmosphere and the apps and food were great! Food portion and price were great.

I told my friends about this place with my warmest recommendations. I  go to this restaurant often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The the cooking is appetizing and the stuff is very friendly and cooperative. always when we visit this place we have a splendid time.  I warmly recommend this restaurant.
I honestly enjoyed their dishes and customer service, fantastic location next to where I live. The staff members are always friendly. Would recommend to others.

The food and prices at this eatery are well worth it. Although it's a bit of a walk from the subway and other things in the area, it's well worth it. I've been there about 5 times and I keep going back because it can't be beat in most areas. The service, taste, all of it are top notch.

formatted_address: 1159 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10065, USA
name: Milk & Hops Ramen Bar

reviews.text:
We had a great time at milk and hops ramen bar. Milk and hops is known for their great grilled cheese sandwiches, pretzel and of course their beer, but the ramen here is next level. 

This spot has a great vibe. The staff was very friendly and willing to strike up a conversation and help out with beer selection. There is plenty of bar space, a few high tops, and a lot of nice window nooks with seating. 

There is also a great selection of snacks, cheese, and meats in the back.
Nice selection of beers and always changing. The ramen is okay, some of them are very oily (it does say on the menu, which one has added oil) and the meet is often very fatty too. But nice spot

Interesting concept. The restaurant sells items like a store would. Drinks and chips, some of an imported Asian variety. In the restaurant area they had things from a cheese spread to ramen selections. Not combined (obvi) but well done on their own.

My friends and I have lunch at milk and hope on a regular basis. It’s usually pretty good which Is why we go back. Today’s visit left us disappointed when the Spicy Ramen we all ordered came out with over cooked noodles and very starchy broth. We asked the waitress and she replied that their hot plate wasn’t heating well. But if that’s the case give us a heads up or something. I don’t think ill be going back for a while.

This place is relaxing and not too crowded. The ramen is boring here, not recommended. The broth is tasteless. It should be rich in flavor, not in oil. Not to mention that there is mostly just noodle. One piece of meat and one fish cake. I think it is mot worth the price.

formatted_address: 246 W 18th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Westville Chelsea

reviews.text: A delicious, popular spot in the West Village with a nice wood bar, beers on tap, wine, and a splendid market fresh menu. There are plenty of seasonal options for meat and veggies, and savory vegan fare as well. The value was reasonable, and market plates with your choice of many vegetables (including artichoke, cauliflower, garlic kale, etc) can be paired with a variety of proteins. There was a buzz in the air, and the servers were friendly.

Perfect brunch spot for those looking for a rich, but equally healthy meal. Plates are medium-sized making it an excellent spot for sharing. Highlight dishes include the Kale Caesar (add salmon if you want a protein boost) and the ever changing DIY market plate!

Tons of Gluten Free, Vegan and Veg options available!

What a great find! Cozy and friendly. I had the salmon plate, sides were broccoli rabe w/ red peppers and garlic mashed potatoes! All very fresh and flavorful! Potatoes tasted like my own! The salmon was tender and juicy. Lively seasoning in the broccoli!
The brunch was AMAZING (and a lot of food). I am so glad we went here. The food came out relatively quickly (it was packed), and the bartenders/waiters were all very attentive. Can't wait to go back!
Excellent food. Healthy. Fast. This is a great place to eat well prepared, healthy food. Breath of fresh air in a place with lots of not so good for you food.

formatted_address: 522 A Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: BRAD'S BURGERS & BBQ

reviews.text: Now called Brad’s Burgers— this place is pretty unassuming and when it was recommended to me I thought it would be another overpriced tourist trap in New York. It was quite the opposite. One of the top burgers I’ve had in New York, amazing service, and the owner was walking around introducing himself, checking on guests, and meeting people on the street. Clearly a fixture of the neighborhood. I recommend the Oreo milkshake even though it’s not on the menu. I can’t wait to come back and try the barbecue.
Nice environment. Food was good, great portion. Friendly staff.

We walked in here because the place looks super cute and we were so excited about its addition to the neighborhood.
Great decor and menu choices. We decided to go simple and order a burger (medium-rare) with fries from the menu. 
Waited and waited. 
After 25 minutes (!) the burger arrives, completely well done. No fries. “They’re not ready yet”. 
The fries finally arrived after we were done with our burger.
If you think they’d have taken at least our sodas off the bill for the bad dining experience, you’d be wrong!
Had a great experience in this place with my friend. The food came quickly and the service is just excellent. Prices are reasonable.

Best BBQ and wings on UWS.  A good mix of families and couples.  Derrick was the bartender and made everyone feel comfortable.  Plenty of TVs with sports and all
the games. I’ll be back!

formatted_address: 2100 Frederick Douglass Blvd, New York, NY 10026, USA
name: Harlem Food Bar

reviews.text: We had an amazing burger, with a house salad , it was perfect! We are two picky people, and we both loved our food, staff was great. They have an amazing cocktail list and sweet bar. Stop and eat you will be very pleased!

One of the best spots in Harlem. Great drinks and happy hour. The food is also amazing. Some of the yummiest fries
The people there are also so sweet and friendly
Good food and nice to hand out with friends. I love sitting at the bar but space is limited. Nonetheless yall deserve five star.

The service was great. And the food was great. I am going back to try some of the other dishes. I enjoyed the food & the atmosphere. This is a nice little place to meet up with friends, relax, eat and have a drink. Nice place.😋
Really good food..rings were awesome too

formatted_address: 33 W 54th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Mozzarella & Vino

reviews.text:
An upscale place good for drinks and dinner.
We had few wines and the cheese plate and loved it. The ambience is great with soft lighting and classical music (perfect for a date night). The service was great too. All in all a charming place.

This place is my preferable site.  Of all restaurants I know I like it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to visit this place. Whenever  I feel like having a proper supper, this restaurant comes right away to my mind.  Great and varied  food and a rich menu.great staff, and nice mood. In addition to that, the tariff is good. I praise this spot with no hesitation.

Right across the street from MoMA, this little place packs a wallop of Italian culture and cuisine.

There were three tables on the sidewalk, but it was too cold to be outside. It is not a wide place, but it goes pretty far back. The servers were very attentive and the food was delicious. As the name suggests, they have quite a selection of cheeses and a decent little wine selection. Even on a Tuesday night it got pretty crowded during dinner time..

Mozzarella & Vino is a hidden gem in the Midown which serves some amazing variety of authentic Italian food. The service is commendable and staff is very polite. The best thing about this place is that the food is reasonably priced and the staff is attentive. We had the Zucchini fries and the Ricotta Ravioli.

Nice place. Great food and service. My old fashioned was well made and 18bucks which is right for the area. My ravioli was very good. Portions were very small. Deserts were mediocre and overpriced. That cost a star. Get them elsewhere. We will be back but will pass on dessert next time.

formatted_address: 381 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Amber

reviews.text:
Weekend Lunch Special 12-4pm 3 rolls $12. Super fresh fish, very large pieces. 
Food is A++ Service is C-

Service here is very lacking at times. Rude servers who roll their eyes at you and take a long time to get to you; even when the restaurant is empty.

My most recent visit I had very fast service, but the waitress was still kind of rude! The restaurant was empty, I wanted to sit and enjoy the view for a bit.She rolled her eyes at me for not ordering food, after already having eaten 3 rolls and drinking a beer!
Not Amber Kip's anymore. It's "My Friend Duke" now and it's GREAT!

Amber is a delightful restaurant. All of its locations are good, but I like the decor of this particular one and there is a great ambiance in the space as well. Also, the staff are friendly, the prices are great and the food is really good. I've been to a lot of thai places, but Amber keeps me coming back over and over again.

For what its worth, Amber is a pretty decent Asian fusion restaurant that doesn't charge unreasonable prices. Their offerings are nicely portioned and the dishes are usually close in their resemblance to whatever "Asian" dish you are craving. True, a restaurant which offers such a culturally expansive menu usually falls on certain parts but I felt that their food is usually the better if the fusion restaurants in the area. The actual restaurant itself is in a nice location with opening doors to permit people watching on nicer days. The rest of the restaurant struggles to differentiate itself from all the hokey sports bars in the area so expect the usual crowds and atmosphere.

Great food and the happy hour (4-8, I believe) is unreal.  The cocktails are very strong and HH apps are really good too.  Try the spicy Edamame and the rock shrimp tempura if you're feeling adventurous.  The bartender that is often there during the week, Alex, is super friendly and helpful as well.  I go here probably 2-3 times a month with friends or dates, and will continue to do so!

formatted_address: 107 E 34th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Villa Berulia

reviews.text: Very nice place, perfect for dates. Intimate environment. Prices are okay compared to other places in this kind of neighborhood (at least have a 100 with you). Food tasted good. A very welcoming place.
Amazing staff. Great food. Tranquil atmosphere. The wine is plentiful per glass. I cant wait tontakenthe family here for a large dinner.

We came to this spot for a meeting. we heard about this place from a lot of people.  Well, we were not disappointed. The crew welcomed us with a smile and we had a fantastic feeling. The food was just great. We loved this restaurant very much and we shall absolutely come back again. Warmly recommended.

My team and I love to bring our clients here for dinner and they are always satisfied. The menu is so enticing that we tend to share everything from the appetizers to the desserts. The lighting and walls are perfectly set for intimate conversations.
Fine dining Italian cuisine. Taste was fine. Good service, though it wasn't crowded on a weekday for lunch. Can surely go again.

formatted_address: 252 W 38th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Change of Pace

formatted_address: 64 E 1st St, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: La Vie Lounge

reviews.text: I have been here so many times and it gets better every time I go. The service is tremendously good. The food is delicious!
Female bartender was rude but other than that thumbs up
Good
Terrible, terrible place don't go here. The place belongs in the meatpacking district, or New Jersey.

formatted_address: 7 E 27th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Benno

reviews.text:
I got an opportunity to spent my birthday here a few weeks ago. Even though I was a solo diner, the staffs were incredibly amazing, making me feel welcome immediately. I made reservation two days beforehand via email which was quick and easy. Upon my arrival, they took my coat and showed me my seat. When ordering, I asked the staff what he recommended and he said to try the tasting course. It was that moment the journey started. What I though was a 5-course meal became 7 to 9. Keep in mind that each course has a specific wine that pairs with it. While I don't know the names and specific details of what I ate, I will do my best to describe them. But please look at my pictures to get an idea of the courses. The first course was the caviar and clam appetizer. It was my first time eating caviar and I was highly impressed. The sauce complimented the caviar very well. The bread and spread for me to nibble on while waiting for the next course was so good. Another dish I got was flat crepe-like dish that was surprisely filling and tasty. There was a meat dish that came with a slice layer of duck meat that was a joy to my taste bud. By now I was getting full but the courses kept coming. For dessert, the chocolate raspberry mousse cake was so good. While enjoying my dessert, the staffs surprised me with a chocolate cake with a lit candle. It was totally unexpected and extremely nice gesture. I was not able to finish all my desserts, so the staff put them in a box for me to take home.

All in all, a short version of this review is that Benno is amazing. I highly recommend it especially for a nice occassion like a birthday or anniversary. The food was great. The wine selection was perfect pairing for each meal. Have you ever been to a restaurant where the food was perfect, the staffs were perfect, the the meal presentation was perfect, and the atmosphere was perfect...because that is how I define Benno.

Excellent service and great food. The service is on point and someone is always available even while the place is busy. They know the balance between checking up on the customer and being pushy and maintained that wonderfully. The staff is knowledgeable and are prompt to answer any questions regarding their menus. The food was both eye pleasing and wonderfully   delicious. Definitely going there again.

Gorgeous mod restaurant with modern touches. Exquisite staff and spectacular service. Located in the back of the Evelyn hotel. Drinks and wine list was superb. Dishes were phenomenal works of art with taste to match. Pastas and seafood were on point, just wish they were bigger. Every dish was more like an appetizer size but priced as an entree compared to other high end restaurants.
Great food, outstanding service and lovely atmosphere. Dishes were perfectly presented and very delicious. A fantastic experience and highly recommended.

This restaurant is just amazing. Everything you get is perfect to the point. Definitely one of the best restaurants in New York.
Worth every dollar, unfortunately it became hard to get a reservation.

formatted_address: 81 Broadway, Brooklyn, NY 11249, USA
name: Marlow & Sons

reviews.text: The menu is small but has very interesting items. New American with Japanese flavors. The salmon dish was really good and the oysters were nice and fresh. Nice outdoor seating. Definitely on the pricey side so I wouldn't really come here if I was very hungry (more for a drink and something to share). Friendly service.
I admire this place a lot. theres a great spirit. The food is splendid. the service is powerful and the team is courteous. The pay is reasonable. deeply recommend.

Dumplings were delicious and service was quick. There is small green sauce on the table that was delicious!
Skin of Chinese parsley dumpling was new experience and very nice!
I'm going to back soon.

Marlow & Sons is a delicious American restaurant.  

The raw oysters were amazing.  They were pre-flavored with some lemon (and perhaps other stuff) and needed no additional sauces.  They were also perfectly shucked and slid right off of the shells.  The scallops were also insanely tasty, and pleasantly spicy.  The cabbage pancake with bacon, and also the pork katsu, both done in a Japanese style, were excellent, too.  

I’m not sure how often the menu changes, but I’d recommend any of the above if they should be serving them again. 

Recommended!

Great place for brunch. The brick chicken and oysters are good. The menu has limited items but they make their food well.
