I find it interesting that they try to infuse a bit of Japanese taste into their American items. Prices are a bit high though. Service is good. I wish the restaurant was located nearer to a subway stop though.

formatted_address: 1085 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: The Blasket

reviews.text: Solid Irish pub. Good service. Nice upstairs area for larger groups if its not rented out. Never enough seats. Strange set up for hanging up coats in the winter/rainy day.

Comfortable place in a refined Irish bar style. They keep it antique but also updated for 21st century taste. Good beer list and interesting menu with quality bartenders. Not cheap but good happy hour specials.

We just love love love the Blasket! Such a great addition to the neighborhood. Live music on the weekends is amazing and the owners are such nice guys! My only request is that they make a cocktail menu :) but they always create drinks for me when I ask. Get the curry cheese fries!!!
Great little spot, wish it were in my neighborhood. Top notch bar guy, great beers, spotless but not pretentious.  Patronize this place.
Had the fish and chips. It was well done and the sauces were good as well. Enjoyed the atmosphere and would recommend it to others to check out.

formatted_address: 141 Havemeyer St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Little Choc Apothecary

reviews.text:
A lovely, savory, vegan and gluten-free place. They have an excellent choice of tea. They make their own vegetal milk, the latte with coconut milk was great. A vast variety of meal crepes.
All you need for a cozy weekend brunch.
Nice place with vegan everything menu. It looks really nice, cozy and staff are friendly but we had to wait over 40 minutes for two simple crepes that were cold...

I personally don’t like giving 1 star as long as the place is not a disaster but asking us to go back to line after being seated? Pretending we seated ourselves and being rude to the customers for no reason? The server girl was very rude kinda killed our dessert mood. 

The crepes were delicious but sorry, we went there to be happy and killed our mood instead. Shame.

Beautiful place, really enjoyed the seating upstairs. The mushroom crepe with walnuts was very good. The caramel strawberry one was alright. Surprisingly filling though. Great place to order some tea and take a break from the city life.
My new home away from home. Heaven sent. Vegan scones and clotted cream. And an upstairs terrace that is a sanctuary as much as anything else. Great food. Great service. Smiles all round.

formatted_address: 316 8th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: The Chelsea Bell

reviews.text: large place with plenty of high-tops.  good draught beer selection.  Food was pretty good too.  Wife and I split a couple appetizers as our dinner and it filled us up.  Service was a bit slow but other than that no problems.  will likely go back if we're in the area.

We were a family Holiday gathering of 21 people. It was a great environment. Menu was adequate drinks were . Great wine selections . We always like the great Craft beers and Sofia  manage the affair excellently. I highly recommend it. We weren’t given a choice of brunch or lunch but it worked out OK
was here for a fundraiser but bought myself dinner=  I had something delicious- a salad I enjoyed- I live a few blocks away and havent been back but its a good pub- they have game night too

This place was good when it first opened but I don't know what happened to it. Went in for brunch, the place was empty and now I understand why. 

I ordered their chicken and waffles and it came out ice cold, after waiting way too long for it. But why did it take so long, when there wasn't anyone else in the restaurant that ordered food? I sent it back and the waitress returned and said they apologized and to make up for it, they would comp my COFFEE. The coffee was the only thing that came out right and hot. Why would you offer to pay for my $2 cup of coffee when it was my meal that was the problem?

In my opinion, this is bad business. Anytime I have been to a restaurant and a dish came out wrong, the manager took that dish off the bill not a beverage. 

Safe to say, I will not be returning to this restaurant. Definitely not worth it.

Was a nice place to sit down for a bit, watch some sports, and relax.  Amazing beer selection is an understatement!

But 9.80 for a pint of Sam Adams is laughable

formatted_address: 155 E 52nd St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Asian Station

reviews.text: I honestly don't know why this place have 3,5 stars. We loved it, food was delicious, we had wine for happy hours, prices are great, place is very cute inside! Will come back!

Came here the other day for a business lunch and everything at this was sub-par right from food to service. Took a lot of time to flag a server so we could place our order, and our food also took an awful of time to come out. I had the Thai coconut curry, which did not taste like Thai curry at all. My hot sauce request was never acknowledged by the staff.

Surprised to see all the other good reviews, but for me this place was a total let down.

Horrible service!

Food is great, but not worth spending half of your lunch hour waiting for two sushi rolls (to-go)..TWO!..with no update as to when your food is coming out, with no regard that several people have come and gone way after you and no apology or compensation. I constantly order from this place and this isn't the first time they've screwed up, but today was hands down the worst service I've ever encountered. Definitely finding a new sushi spot.
Good price. Decent food. Not to be amazed here but a good daily lunch spot.

Asian Station, where have you been all my life?

There are a handful of places in East Midtown that do overpriced Thai.  People go there because there really weren't any other options.  Until now.

Asian Station has totally raised the bar.  Veggie Pad Thai lunch special for $6, chicken for $7.  They also have plenty of other lunch specials for under ten bucks, and most of them around $7.  They even take credit card payment for such orders.

If you're feeling saucy, they have a bar and waiter service.  Sushi too.  But I know that I'm coming back for the Thai.

formatted_address: 55 Prospect St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Bluestone Lane DUMBO Café

reviews.text:
Cozy place in Dumbo. With so awesome people, working there. And so tasty coffee and sweets. Very popular between locals. And really good place for a breakfast. 
While visiting Brooklyn, and want to see a sunrise lights on bridge or Manhattan - it is good place to take some hot coffee ToGo. And enjoy all atmosphere around

Great coffee. Great service. Great vibes.

Worth dropping by for a sit down or stand up coffee... go on one leg if you like

Fantastic place! Came in early for breakfast, the place was empty but started filling up quickly. The staff is friendly and the food looks and tastes amazing! We got some avocado toast, bacon sandwich, a cookie, matcha and beet latte. Everything was super delicious. They have gluten-free options as well. 

There's another location in Manhattan but it's not as cool. This one rocks!
We only stopped for a cup of coffee and a beer and we ended up eating something. It looked way too good. Tasted good too ❤️ awesome place. Love the vibe and love the food
Amazing place there hot chocolate, hot tea were absolutely amazing. Prices are very good as well. Staff is super friendly and very welcoming.

formatted_address: 100 Stanton St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: September Wines & Spirits

reviews.text: I love going here to drink wines. The choices are unbelievable, and the owners are awesome.  What a perfect place to chill and relax from a stressful day.  The wines that they had was really good and the food as well.  I like the ambiance of this place because it was so cozy and calm. I will surely visit this wine shop again.

From the moment you cross the doorway of this wine shop, you will be transported to a wonderland of wines and the warming smile of the owner, a most gracious host. He is simply a man of the old school, in which tradition, the slow food, and wine movement and compassion for his fellow man are on full display. A must visit!

Forget the usual wine tastings which even at their best seem a bit formulaic and commoditized. The owner is very knowledgeable, personable, attentive, hilarious, and also dangerously generous. Needless to say, it worked out for him as well as we came away with six beautiful bottles. A very wonderful experience!

I went to this wine shop yesterday afternoon. The server was well versed regarding the menu and wine list. I was happy to see he had at least one Sauvignon blanc from the other country. It went well with my meal, and the crab dinner was fabulous too. I highly recommend this place!
Been going for about a decade now! This is a place that feels like home. Wines are on point, price is good, staff is always helpful and the playlist is pretty good too. It’s got the range.

formatted_address: 189 Bridge St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Amarachi

reviews.text: Came here for the first time to celebrate my friend’s birthday.  First the DJ was jamming all night. It was a very cozy atmosphere. Drinks were great and the food was amazing. The wings and salad was some of the best I’d had in a long time. The service was excellent. Servers came to our table frequently throughout our time here to check on us.
Nice ambience, great DJ, good food, great drinks and discount for parking is offered.

For my Nigerian brethren that crave a taste of home in a comfortable part of the city, I recommend Amarachi. Everything was good and I made sure to fill my plate since I didn’t know when I would be back. The prices were very fair as well!

I did not like my food, but my cousin enjoyed hers. We did see a mouse. I didnt say anything only because I'm sure the owners and staff know already. Food was too expensive for not tasting good (my personal opinion). They did have a DJ there for entertainment that played good music. I had to talk much louder to my cousin because of this though. I personally will not go back. Wish I had a better experience as I believe it is a black owned business that I would have continued supporting.

Very lively atmosphere with great food and great service. Came here for a birthday party and was really impressed. Had my first experience with Chicken Suya which was great. Rice has s kick so if your taste buds aren't a fan of spicy foods, stick to regular rice. Yardie punch gave me some ideas to make when I get home. Highly recommend!

formatted_address: 500 E 30th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: The Water Club

reviews.text: Not impressed one bit. The cocktail room was small setup with booth style tables off a two step walk down.... Very inconvenient and uncomfortable when trying to be social and eat in evening attire.. Main room has a door off on the side for smokers.If you decide to have a winter event advise patrons to bring blankets as the door pretty much stays open for the smokers while everyone else freezes... I expected more from the food as my eggplant parmigiana was mush.... complete mush. please explain to me how it is legal to water your liquor down so much *side note I hadn't eaten all day as to running around for the event*  get to venue, had 3 vodka and cranberries before eating and was perfectly fine. Had two more drinks with dinner and still fine.... (note.. I drink like once a month, having a drink or two) I just expected way more for the popularity/price of this place... REAL BUMMER...
Great river views of Long Island City and Brooklyn.  Staff were attentive and food was top notch (see pics of filet mignon and halibut below).  Great place for special events
I had a company Christmas party @ the water club. Beautiful view and nice setting for dining. A lot of finger food to taste.

Beautiful views of long island city. Bread comes as corn muffins scones, sourdough as well as other selections. Dress nicely as you admire the ships as they pass while drinking cocktails and seafood. They also have some memorabilia of nautical historical significance which you can check out while there.
Great place with great food and a lot of fun. Wonderful place for kids, they can play as much as they want with all of these boats. We had amazing time.

formatted_address: 22 W 46th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: St. Pat's Bar & Grill NYC

reviews.text:
Delicious! I was having a hankering for onion rings, so added them onto my meal of bangers and mash. I admit I didn't have very high expectations for this simple dish, but it was fantastic -- slightly crispy sausage, fresh-made potatoes, a little crispy potato garnish and a delicious onion gravy. My dinnermate ordered chicken curry and said it was lovely! Onion rings were tasty, slightly sweet, perfectly battered. All portions were very generous, a good value!

Atmosphere is warm, cozy and comfortable. The dining area, despite having a few muted televisions playing sports, doesn't feel like a "sports bar". The noise level is very tolerable.

The service was also good! Friendly and helpful staff.

We will be back! :)

I really want to rate this place higher, but have trouble doing such. The atmosphere is cozy, warm, and very pub like. There is always some sport on the televisions, and the waiting staff is incredibly friendly. Our waiter, he was from Galway, was kind, gentle, and had a good sense of humor. However, the food is average. It was certainly not bad, but nothing out of this world. Having all that said, St Pats is solid place for a bite to eat and a beer.
I was very disappointed in this bar's happy hour. Granite it's relatively close to times square and that. But it was underwhelming. I would choose a different spot.

Wow!!! This spot is splendid. I just stopped in there on a whim because I was working on the block. Their corned beef is mouth watering and the salad hit the spot and has me feeling energized. Friendly staff from the young lady at the door to the bartender that took my order. Clean atmosphere and delicious food. Do yourself a favor and stop in. You will not be disappointed and I will be making a return visit. Thanks so much for making my stomach feel ooooo so happy! Cheers to the staff.
Fun bar. Reasonable prices. Met some nice people here. Very convenient.

formatted_address: 115 E 60th St 2nd Floor, Manhattan, NY 10065, USA
name: Sopra

formatted_address: 4101 Vernon Blvd, Queens, NY 11101, USA
name: Music entertainment

formatted_address: 16 W 22nd St, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Noah Tepperberg

formatted_address: 166 West 4th Street A, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Burrito Loco

reviews.text: I love when a restaurant really caters toward the solo diner. It is easy to drop off a drink and meal and never come back because we’re not needy. The server here was incredible. Every time my margarita was low, she was refilling it before I had a chance to ask. Service was fast. Food was delicious. Ambiance quiet enough for a good conversation. Then again I was there late on a Wednesday. I can see it being loud on a busy night.
The banana margarita was different and because of that was amazing. The nachos was out of this world. I really recommend this place. I love it
The Guacamole is fresh, made in front of you and so damn delicious!
Amazing staff, awesome drinks and food

Such a warm and cozy place to escape into. I'm so happy I came across it. Drinks were delicious and filling themselves, food was incredible. Spicy which I love and the service was excellent. I could have hung out here all evening. Decor is awesome and the portions are large for a great price. Definitely recommended.

formatted_address: 145 Borinquen Pl, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Lighthouse

reviews.text: Delicious authentic food. Friendly service. Not overpriced. We had an amazing Burrata with roasted Bread dish as a Sunday afternoon bite sitting outside in the sun. Thank you. Will definitely come back again as soon as possible. Stay healthy & strong!

Solid spot for a neighborhood favorite. With a combination of communal tables and four tops you feel the energy. We were there on a Friday night but sat right down. Pickles were wonderful the egg as the hero. Homemade sourdough was delicious (first time I’ve paid for bread). The carrots were nice though we had asked for non-dairy options and these were sitting in a bath of yogurt. (Whoops). We ate around it. Kabobs had wonderful flavor though required more chewing than I was expecting. My wife’s burger was “OK”, so net-net. If you are nearby you will find the choice items and likely return frequently to have them. Not sure you should go out of your way if you need to take a train to get here.

Casual, no pressure to turn the table.  Food was good.  We sat at the bar and ordered dinner there.  The homemade sourdough was amazing.  Started w the hummus, which was deconstructed, but good, all of it was fresh, but I was not expecting to have to mash it up myself.  Wish I had a blender.   I got the chicken sandwich which was excellent.  My friends got the fish of the day and a cheese burger.  Both enjoyed immensely.   I would go back and would recommend to friends.

Our bartender (didn't catch his name!) was amazing.  Very knowledgable on the wine, and very attentive and kind.  Service was good, but it did get busy towards the end of our meal, and we found ourselves waiting around to pay.
The oysters were so bad. Don't know if it was just a miss, or a cheaper selection, but they were not enjoyable.
My friend was going to order the Mezze Platter for around $15, but then our server told us it doesn't come with pita or bread. I don't really understand trying to up-charge on a dip....especially with bread. Kind of a turnoff. 
Burger was good, but I wish they dressed it up with more than just lettuce.
Overall, I think this is a solid spot- and because I live so close by, I will most likely come back. However, I wouldn't seek it out, or go out of my way to come. It wasn't that memorable.
Have gone for both brunch and dinner and the food is great! If you're in a larger party I'd recommend splitting a bunch of dishes.

formatted_address: 521 3rd Avenue, E 35th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Jackson Hole

reviews.text: Eat here 3-4 times a year with a small group of guys. They expanded their menu awhile back, but everyone typically has one of the burgers. Burgers are thick, juicy and flavorful. Always cooked to order. Service has always been quick and friendly. Only minor complaint would be that the restaurant is small and the table layout pretty tight.
Fantastic ambience and very friendly service. The food was crisp and delicious. Will surely recommend this restaurant to my friends. Convenient prices and generous meals. Keep it up.

Very clean and convenient restaurant. They serve large portions and for fair prices. We liked the meals a lot and the staff were very friendly and explanatory. Will definitely recommend this restaurant.

Did a large takeout order. Absolutely horrible. Bread hard as a rock, chicken dry, several sandwiches missing ingredients from their description. I could have when anywhere else and would have been better off. Some breads that we're good had just chicken, zero ingredients they were supposed to.
Went with my daughter. Wouldn't recommended it. It had a nice vibe. I'd like to do it again, just the adults. Burger was really good. Fries was good. Worth the trip.

formatted_address: 167 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: La Mela

reviews.text:
This place is a Little Italy staple!

A MUST GO!  

Don't even look at the menu!  So many people make that mistake... Just order FAMILY STYLE and enjoy!

The staff is attentive and just awesome!  

We go every chance we get.  There are other great places in Little Italy... But nothing compares to this food!

The atmosphere is casual, but a great time!

First time in NY. Restaurant was highly recommended.  They did not disappoint. We were greeted by Alex,  who was very welcoming and friendly.  William our server was also very nice and took very good care of my son and I. We had the spaghetti and meatballs and fettuccine chicken alfredo both plates were delicious. Overall great experience, great food and great staff.
Old style family atmosphere...delicioso!! Strolling musician from table to table& photographer to catch that special moment!! Definitely will return!😘

Authentic Italian Cuisine. The best part about the restaurant is that is one of the very few restaurants open post midnight in Little Italy. It would certainly help if the menus were a bit more informative than just listing out dishes.

Ahhh I loved this place! Authentic Italian. 
Though I also chose to have some sangria 😝 Helpful waiters. Wasnt sure what I wanted from the menu but waiter helped me out. So friendly. So tasty. So filling!
I will definitely return on my next visit to NY.

formatted_address: 768 5th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: The Rose Club

reviews.text: I love this place! I’m giving it three stars because of the remodeling to a Pink nightmare! Change it back to the original Rose Club!! Bring it back to the elegance of red, Persian style that was so Amazing!

Given the pricing this is definitely best as an occasional treat, but they do a great job when the occasion is right. The service is excellent, the Wednesday jazz band is very talented, and the drinks are delicious. I've had Manhattans all over the city and I can honestly say their barrel-aged Manhattan is the best yet (as it should be for $27!). Knocked off one star as some of the furniture was showing some wear and my table was a little tippy, both things I consider a bit improper for such a high end venue.
Delicious sparkling wine and dark spicy chocolates. Have been coming here for years as well.
Live jazz band every Wednesday night. As with other bars and restaurants in the Plaza, the service is top notch. Great cocktails and top shelf selection.

How can you not love the decadence of the Plaza and the elegance. I ordered the old fashioned and it was delicious, they also brought some small snack (peanuts), but the waiter did not check on us a lot. I guess that is okay because you want time to socialize and not be interrupted. But I also do not like to look around to ask for water. I would go back. Expect the drinks to be $25 a person, but it is the Plaza who cares. True NY experience and has to be done at least once in your life.

formatted_address: 243 E 34th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Estonian House

reviews.text: Such a nice house. I went there to attend the 20th Bruce Boyer Chess tournament and woe what a place. Inside is very warm and cozy. The architectural details inside the house are awesome. I highly recommend to visit when you have a chance.
Beautiful lobby and beautiful staircase.
Recently renovated this tiny piece of Europe is located in NYC. Combining old New York and Tallinn. Great staff and manager. Recommend it highly.
Beautiful 3-story Beaux-Arts building designed by Thomas Aa Gray, a Brooklyn architect. Nice, historic interiors.
Lovely and beautiful place.

formatted_address: 40 Broad St, New York, NY 10004, USA
name: Private Angel

formatted_address: 221 Smith St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Leyenda

reviews.text: Great bar! Good vibes! Arturo, behind the bar made our night. What a gem! He was a great bartender and made us feel so welcome!! Will definitely return back! Highly recommend!
Loved Leyenda - great vibe, good food & cocktails...The Christmas  Cosmo was amazing! My husband loved the Tia Mia. The chicken tacos &the croquettes were great.
Leyanda’s food is only overshadowed by their incredible cocktails. A previous James Beard finalist, this cocktail bar is just amazing. Great music, talented bartenders.
Was there last night, Monday night. The place was full and vibe was great. Had few drinks and ate. Really had a great time, the service, people and the place is very good. Definitely will be coming.

They are awesome. It's super festive, the food was delicious, the drinks were awesome, and the service was amazing. We had a group of 10 and the servers were so great. Would give more stars if I could!

formatted_address: 538 Court St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Fat Cat Wines & Spirits

reviews.text: The absolute best wine shop in the Carroll Gardens area. Yes, there are other liquor stores that have been around for a millennia, and others still that their forefathers names are the streets that........I get it. I love it too. But, this place is just straight quality products. Not only have the wines been categorized easily for you, but they have easy to read descriptions, and sometimes even pairing ideas for their versatile wine portfolio. They also rotate stock often and you can always find something new. Want something cold? Ask! They might have it in a fridge in the back. And if you're just not sure..ask. It's family owned and their employees really know their wine too. They play 80's music and classic rock which is a nice change from a soup opera playing in the background. Also, their booze selection is limited because of space but still pretty darn good.
Had the sake I wanted!

Great little family owned wine shop. Small but good selection of wines, sake and Japanese whiskey.  Great selection of Spanish wines..Not your typical fare of the big wineries you find everywhere else. I must agree to the great 80s playlists of the Ramones and Husker Du on the speakers Every time the owner is in. Oh, as to that remark about overpriced and yuppy the guy must have meant to write that review for some other liquor store on Atlantic  or closer to Trader Joe's. You can always ask for a recommendation if you have a budget in mind. They are always eager to help with a suggestion.

They service more wine drinkers than anything. Very yuppyish. They don't have much variety on hard liqour. AND VERY VERY VERY OVER PRICED. You can tell easily that they're overpriced cause the place is always empty. If you're not a white person or some uppity black guy you feel very uncomfortable there. Better off buying from somewhere else.
I said I wanted a good kinda dry wine and the guy knew somehow I wanted a big sized affordable bottle.

formatted_address: 8-08 Queens Plaza S, Long Island City, NY 11101, USA
name: The Penthouse LIC

reviews.text: Such great service!! Food and drinks were amazing. A little pricey but definitely worth it! DJ was legit, view is beautiful and the sparklers were a great touch. Highly recommend for a date or celebration.

It took us 1.5 hours in between each course to get our food. The food was bland and tasteless, and our 6:15pm reservation got us out of there at 10. TERRIBLE. I asked to be seated near a window, was told "no sorry, those are reserved" and later saw other couples being moved there after asking, and then moved again to different tables. The only thing we were offered after our meals being screwed up 4 times were glasses of champagne on the house. The entire establishment is horrendous, the food was not worth the price, not to mention the roooftop heating situation was extremely poor. Do not run a Valentines Day special if you have absolutely no qualified individuals running it. Our waitress, hostess, and seemingly the managers had no clue what they were doing the whole night, the busboys were acting as waiters, and we could not wait to get out of there after paying our check. Even after being offered our 'complimentary champagne' we had to wait 45 minutes to get it. We HADN'T EVEN GOTTEN OUR SALAD AFTER 1.5 HOURS AT THE RESTAURANT. Someone legitimately tried to give us dessert before we had been served our salad and entree. I'm warning you - no matter how gorgeous the views, the service is the worst I've ever experienced in NYC.

Beautiful venue, but not a night to have Valentine 's Day dinner on the rooftop. Its too frigid, when asking for a change of seat our waiter said that the manager said all the seats are booked. Here goes your customer service.  However, the food was great.

Great view, great atmosphere, great seats but guess what if you want a great seat you have to deal with the freezing wind that flows within the shutter windows that they have. We complained that it’s freezing and everyone who came over to our table even said “oh it’s cold here.” We had to basically wrap our outerwear around our feet to keep them warm. Ruined a perfect Valentine’s Day. When asked if there’s anyway to give us any kind of heater, we we’re told “we will try to crack up the heat,” cranking up a old radiator was not going to suffice the situation because we were still freezing. I regret doing my valentines reservation here, this was my first time visiting the business, and I promise you it will be my last and for my friends and family also.

What was supposed to be a delightful Valentine’s Day dinner with my fiancé, ended up being a two hour meal in an ice igloo. This establishment really should not host dinners at their rooftop location when outside temperatures are below freezing. We literally had to uncheck our coats downstairs and sit at our table bundled up while having our four course meal, which took about twenty minutes at a time to be served....Not to mention our waiter, who seemed rather discombobulated, seemingly forgot about our cocktails. We received them mid-meal after we decided we just wanted to get the hell out of that freezing place. I wish I had made a better choice for V Day! Never again!

formatted_address: 8 W 38th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Bigger & Better Thangs Ent

reviews.text:
It would've been 5 STARS. I appreciate the event's. It's been awhile. The music, the crowd, the atmosphere was GREAT! Unfortunately some SECURITY was not. I TOLD the security I wanted to step outside to make a phone call. He told me No. If I left I can't come back. I said to him  I just need to make a call. The music is loud. He repeated once I leave the exit is final. So I said nothing else...i walked out...he followed me...He told the Security outside NOT to let me back in. I paid $25 to get in...i had paid for drinks...I told people about the event...I felt like I was KICKED  OUT . Now I ask you...WHY Bother to STAMP my wrist if I Wll Not be Allowed back in? I didn't make a scene...i just looked at the guard & I left...so...A 3 star rating. Everything else was Great. I hope you find time to improve on security measures...FYI-There was no yelling or no altercation. The situation was JUST handled poorly. A stamped wrist meant nothing.
Mr. Johnson
Awsomeevent

formatted_address: 352 7th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Mustang Harry's

reviews.text: Exceptional service and food!  We ate here before a rangers game at MSG, had a reservation and were seated quickly, given how packed the place was.  They really have a good thing going here- we received excellent, fast and attentive service, especially given how incredibly busy they were.  Our food and drinks came out very quickly and were all excellent!  We had sliders, Parmesan fries and calamari.  We were very impressed! Highly recommend! Definitely make a reservation if you plan to go before an event!

This was such an amazing experience. I did the caesar Salad and wings and it was so so good. The ambiance was very welcoming and our server Sharon was so friendly and helpful. She gave great pointers and assisted us to the best of her ability. Loved every moment and I will definitely be back. Currently in vacation and I highly recommend. Great music as well that gets you moving.

This bar was really nice. They had a pretty decent selection of beers on tap. Staff was friendly and the restaurant was very clean. I went here over New Years and it was pretty low key. Good music was being played as well over their PA system

Sharon our server was amazing, makes you feel like family. Although this was our first time there. The manager, Eric made sure our meal was perfect. I asked to cook my steak a little bit more, he jumped right in and stayed on top of issue. I own a company myself, when we have a customer issue I want to be like Patrick. Keep up the good work and the food was delicious. Thank you. See you soon, we'll be back
Was a very good experience. Lamb lollipops were great! Corned beef was really good as well! Had a really good time hanging out for lunch.

formatted_address: 71 W 47th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Federation Building

formatted_address: 187 Sackett St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Boutique BK

reviews.text:
Chef Matthew and his team catered our wedding in New York in November, and we can't say enough about how happy we were!

We planned the wedding from out of town, and Chef Matthew was responsive and patient through the whole process. The tasting at his test kitchen was a great preview into the care, creativity and quality of the food and presentation. More importantly, he executed this all flawlessly for our reception of over 150 people.

Outside of the outstanding food and service, we loved how flexible Boutique BK was in accommodating our needs and budget, for example in staffing the bar and coat check, and helping us to select glassware and serving arrangement we thought would best fit the venue.

We would highly recommend Chef Matthew for any major event or wedding!
I had risotto here that was an incredible blend of flavour and texture. The atmosphere is beautiful and perfect

I could rant for a long time about the terrible job he did. But I'll try to keep it short. 
Everything at the TWO tastings was amazing. He sat down and listened to everything we requested, made delicious, hot food that we had requested, and everything was set for my wedding of 100 people. 
At the wedding, several pieces of the meals were missing, everything was cold, terribly presented, and disgusting. There were also not enough staff members to serve everything (Even though we had been promised more than he brought) and there was not enough food (Which is especially weird because we had hired him to prepare food for 150 but he said he mistakenly thought we said 300) 
I should not leave my wedding with my wife and go straight to the nearest pizza restaurant. 
Everyone at the wedding that I've spoken to agrees that everything about the wedding was perfect except the food. 
(My wedding planner also says she encountered a lot of issues with him and the way he was acting. But I never experienced that so I can't say)

We recently organized a dinner for 8 with Boutique BK.

The food was excellent and the venue was great.  Chef Matthew took care of all the details (lighting, music, etc.) and everyone in our group loved it.  We never felt rushed and it was a very relaxing and fun evening.

In particular I would like to mention how patient Chef Matthew was as we tried to sort out our event.  We were all over the place for a while with the number of guests and what we wanted, but throughout the process Chef Matthew was very patient and rolled with it as he helped us plan our dinner. 

I would highly recommend Boutique BK.
What amazing time our Mother's Day dinner prepare by Chef Matthew . It was beautiful private room.

formatted_address: 150 Varick St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Club Shelter

formatted_address: 259 West 4th Street, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Sant Ambroeus West Village

reviews.text: I’ve been wanting to try this place for a long time and finally got the chance for restaurant week. We had a delicious meal, everything tasted fresh and authentic, service was good and we enjoyed a delightful bottle of vermentino for $52. Was looking at some of the dishes on neighboring tables, especially the beautiful pasta dishes, and will definitely come back for some of those.

Intimate location with very attentive service. I usually go during lunchtime where often times it is easier to get a table. Straddles that delicate line of having hints of exclusivity without being too much of a scene. The vibe may very well be different other times, but during the day, it is quite pleasurable to dine there. Food is consistently good. Expect to spend a little more than your usual lunch.

Thank you for the great experience and your unparalleled hospitality. I had a dinner Saturday night at the bar, Daniel (the bartender) was very kind and extremely professional, the manager (Alessandro) is very passionate about making everyone happy and he went above and beyond for making my dinner exceptional. The place has a very welcoming atmosphere and a wonderful ambiance. Food is just perfect in every way. Congratulations (from kitchen to the floor) to every one by doing absolutely an amazing job!

This Italian restaurant is stunning! It's easy to see why it gets booked up so quickly. The staff are all very good; knowledgeable about the menu and specials, friendly and engaging but not in-your-face, and they serve the food and drinks quickly and politely. We had a truly wonderful evening here; the pasta is fantastic, cooked to perfection and rich with flavour, which isn't something you expect of just pasta! The menu is huge so there's tons of variety to pick from. It isn't cheap here, but you do get what you pay for, and if it's a special occasion, or you really love past, you won't be disappointed. Book early!! It isn't a huge place and gets full quickly.
We went for a breakfast with my girlfriend and we were a bit disappointed. The coffee was just ok. The food was great though. A bit overpriced. There are way better options for breakfast around.

formatted_address: 1462 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10075, USA
name: The Meatball Shop

reviews.text: The yogurt dill sauce was amazingly match classic meat balls. The kitchen sink I ordered was a great value. 3 different kinds of chefs selection of seasonal sides came with 3 meatballs. These sides were all my favorites so I was luck to get it in May. One disappointment was the lentil salad was frozen in some parts and the meatballs were not warm. In case you had better to ask a waiter to serve them warm!

Does exactly what the shop sign says! We enjoyed a quick bite here on the later side of a Monday lunch hour, and both the meaty and veggie meatballs were moist and flavorful, enhanced by the accompanying marinara and pesto sauces, and complemented by the IPA from their list of brews. The pasta that we had as a side to the meaty meatballs were fantastically fresh.

Love their meatballs. Stopped in for lunch. The bartender did not know what a ceasor was. Gave me a bloody Mary.  The manager was great. Said he was going to have the bartender look into it. Maybe they have ceasors now. See next time I guess.

I found this place on Internet .. If you are one of those who judge the book by its cover you won't go in  but you should 😉 we ordered 2 different plain meatballs . One chicken with pesto and one regular with spicy tomato sauce. And both came with focafocaccia 👌😋

I live in Montreal and whenever I visit Manhattan I used to go to this place. However, the experience I had there last weekend was terrible. I got into the place and my friends and I were sat by a server who didn't even look at our faces. We waited for more than ten minutes and she never came to out table, totally ignoring us. We stood up to leave and she saw was leaving and gave a sarcastic smile, turning her face around. At the door, before I left, I met another server, who had already helped me another time and I made a complaint, telling him I was very frustrated.  I explained we had walked 25 minutes from central park to this place because I really wanted my friends to eat the food and told him I was a repeat customer. Do you know what he said? "I'm sorry, I hope you change our mind and stay." You could clearly see he really didn't care. Well, I didn't stay and and I'll never go back to this place again or recommend to anyone as I did many times before.

formatted_address: 195 Broadway, New York, NY 10007, USA
name: Nobu

reviews.text: The bar was terrible bit the meal was amazing.  I recommend visiting this place.  The food is out of this world delicious!  Go here.  Avoid the bar, but go to the restaurant!!

Incredible meal, incredible service, incredible experience.  The food speaks for itself.  I mentioned in passing that it was our anniversary in requesting that we be moved downstairs.  The host knew as soon as we came down without me asking.  And when we ordered dessert, they gave us this:
This place is worth trying. They serve large portions for convenient prices. Consistently neat and with good vibes. I highly recommend this place.
Affordable prices. Food was good. Staff were nice. Everything came of kitchen was fresh and flavorful.

Residing in the lobby of one of downtown's most gorgeous buildings at the juncture of City Hall and Wall St sections of Downtown Manhattan is Nobu Downtown. Outstanding excellence all around: food, service, atmosphere. Unusual, delicious take on standard recipes; staff is truly professional--attentive without being intrusive and won't pressure or rush you; seating is comfortable, private though there are many tables; decor is big and bold yet proportional to the exceptionally high, exquisite ceilings; and elevators are available within the restaurant itself. This is no typical Japanese restaurant, so be prepared to open your wallet. It is well worth a special treat or to honor your guest or colleague.

formatted_address: 159 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Penelope

reviews.text: As soon as we walked in we were greeted nicely and seated. They even  helped my elderly mom take off her coat and pulled in the chair! Great Breakfast food, coffee and service. Very well priced too!

Great Place super sized platter. Amazing for a great Breakfast... Reasonable pricing. Might get super busy but that is a very sign generally..  so you may have to be a bit patient to be seated but ... Look at the pics...

Went with a friend during a very busy week between Christmas and New Year! Waited for a table for about 15 minutes and it was clearly very busy, but worth the wait.  The staff were so sweet and the service was excellent. The food was as fresh as it can get, eggs cooked just right, vegetables just right and the presentation wonderful. The ambience was great.  Highly recommend this brunch/breakfast spot!

Cutest little brunch spot in the area. Affordable menu, delicious food, friendly service. They don’t take reservations or seat incomplete parties so there’s usually a long wait. But it’s completely worth it!

Great atmosphere, GREAT staff, and the food was oh-so savory! My 1st stop after getting off of my plane from Chicago! On top of that, the owner gifted my daughters with a generous slice of their delicious red velvet cake! Kudos from Chicago!!!

formatted_address: 175 Van Dyke St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Red Hook Winery

reviews.text: I love this place. They're a little out of the way, especially without a car, but it's well worth the trek. Their wines are great, very wide variety of options, all or mostly from NY state, and the wine tastings are lovely, and super reasonably priced (relative to NYC/BK standards). Went here last weekend, $18 for a flight of 4 wines, with generous pours no less, compared to what I've seen at many wineries. And they have several options: all whites, all reds, a mix, a "modern" option for less traditional varietals, etc. Plus all their wines by the glass or bottle, and you can buy them at retail prices to go. We didn't try one of the meat/cheese boards, but they looked awesome. Plus you sit in a cozy little room with a great view of the harbor. Would be perfect for a date. And the folks who work there are super, super friendly and extremely knowledgeable about their wine, but not in a snobby way, more like they're genuinely excited about wine and love to talk about it. Highly recommended!

My friends and I had an awesome wine tasting experience. The staff was very knowledgeable (shout-out to Vince) and the setting of the winery was simple and rustic. The $18 tasting was a great deal for the amount of wine we received!

I had a great experience yesterday at Red Hook Winery. Evan is the best! I tasted some great wines and enjoyed the barrel tasting as well.

Already looking forward to my next visit!

This is a real cute place to hang out and get a little tips with some friends. You e got great views of the water and a nice selection of locally sourced wines. They offer some bites like a charcuterie to soak up some of that vino. The staff is really nice and very helpful. Can’t recommend this place enough. PS, there is no obvious subway line close by, but that’s not the winery’s fault.
Amazing place that produces New York wines mainly from long island . Booked the wine tasting online. We got to try 4 different wines in each flight. Really enjoyed the whites! Really recommend

formatted_address: 299 Vandervoort Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Polygon Brooklyn

reviews.text: Fantastic music. BEST door and security staff. They are all so nice and respectful. Love love this place.

Excellent Place. DJ Joey Bumps really brought the place to life. Many great nights. A+ place that needs more people to stop making it an after hours Place and stop by earlier. He s got the right staff in place now.
Outstanding atmosphere, there was alot of beautiful girls and the music was on point I danced my off had a blast I found my new after hour spot.
Awesome place for dance life! Go in w a good attitude you should be good , however don’t try to come in drunk as bouncers will call you out and not let that person in lol ;)

This disco place great!. Sound is way great.  But service at the bar with barmaids no good.  Rude , slow . Girl bartender rolled  eyes  when she no understand my Accent. And not vey friendly. This place. Food is very tasty. Bouncer men are friendly and they greet you

formatted_address: 331 West 4th Street, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Corner Bistro

reviews.text: Hands down the best burger in the city. I’ve lived here for 20 years and I’ve tried to find something better but nothing is quite like this. It’s perfect because it’s simple. There’s nothing fussy about it. Sometimes it’s so good you finish it and look at your friends and say, “should we split the next one or get our own?” I’ve done both.

There are so many burgers to be had in the city, but very few are this good AND reasonably priced. The burger at Corner Bistro is classic and satisfying - perfect alongside a dark beer. No frills, but exactly what you're looking for if you're pining for a burger. 

Also recommend getting an order of fries to share - pretty large portion and they don't skimp on the burger so it'll be plenty of food. 

It was relatively easy to get a table to sit at for dining between major mealtimes, even on a busy holiday weekend. Maybe expect a few minutes wait for a seat, or order at the bar.

The bistro burger is to die for and it's their signature.  Spot is warm and cozy although they have tables in the rear.   It has been around for over 20 years now and is the same as it was when they opened with the original owner 20+ years ago.  Place has a great theme.  Simple + good burgers = a great time.

I met a smoking hot tinder date here last week and it was an epic time.  We had the cheeseburgers with lettuce, tomato, onion and cheddar cheese.  My date ordered the French fries and I ordered the bowl of chili as a side.  The menu is small and easy, they have beer and liquor up at the bar as well.  We ate out meals with pleasure and the burgers were prepared simple but amazing.  The place was packed and we had a good time, and more.   We will be definitely back for another date, next time I will try the cheddar bacon burger and the fries.  Five stars
This place is literally the vegan version of in and out but better  delicious meals. I'm really happy I was introduced to this place. Will come here again.

formatted_address: 18 E 54th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: San Pietro

reviews.text: Authentic Italian cuisine served by a solid NYC staff and host. Wines selection is spot on and food so good it's hard to put your fork down.

I have been going to San Pietro for years and have recommended it many times to friends and colleagues but from my experience last week it will be the last time that I ever visit the place. I had taken a client out to  lunch who happens to be 90 years old and hard of hearing. He inadvertently ordered the wrong main course and asked for it to be changed, the owner ran over to our table yelled and threw a fit over the request. In all of my years entertaining I had never seen anything so unprofessional especially from a place supposedly this high end. 

It was horrifying to say the least and I could tell that the waiter (who is great btw) was incredibly embarrassed. As I was leaving the restaurant I walked over to the owner and let him know that I didn't appreciate his treatment of my elderly client and his response to me was "this is my house, get out". With an attitude and treatment of customers like that it won't be his house much longer. Needless to say I won't be recommend or returning to San Pietro ever again.
Meh.  Old school atmosphere with a menu that promises classic dishes and beloved flavor profiles. But, at the end of the day, somewhat lacking in execution and service.

If you want an fabulous, authentic Italian experience, this is your place. The staff, the head waiter, the servers and even the bus boys were fantastic. I never press a glad of wine or water. The food was exquisite. The fish and veal specials were outstanding. We had a party of 14 and nobody wanted for anything. There were also smaller, romantic tables. The prices were in line with a fine dining experience. If you want a nice experience woke in NYC, this is a great option.

Was in NYC for business and had an amazing dinner with 6 of my colleagues at San Pietro. The food was wonderful but the dining experience was a big part of the event. I highly recommend you give it a try. Expensive but well worth it. Get a reservation even during the week as this place is popular with the financial folks. And go with the recommendations your waiter will make. You will not be disappointed in anything.

formatted_address: 712 W 125th St, New York, NY 10027, USA
name: 123BSB

reviews.text:
I visited this establishment late night on a Sunday. It was quite but I can definitely see this place being the hot new hangout for a Friday and Saturday night. Capri took care of me. She was attentive and always had a smile. 
I order the waffle fries and fried ravioli. Both were exactly what I needed. I usually don't eat fried food but this was worth it. The side of waffle fries was big enough to share. 
Prices are Great. Establishment is brand new and beautiful. Very Clean. I'll definitely come back and rent the games for a fun night with friends. The menu says it's $2 per game.

This was my first time going and It was my birthday. I had such a great time. The food was good, but most of all the warm welcome was amazing. I would like to thank Stacey the manager for her loving hospitality. This will definitely be my new spot.

Went here the other night with a few friends and had a great time. So many beers on tap to choose from, and you can't beat the view overlooking the Hudson river! Good vibes and great food, can't wait to come back!

Nice Vibe. Great place to go with a large group because a little of everything...chill to the music... play Jenga… watch the game. Definitely get a bang for your buck too. Friendly workers. Manager is very accommodating and cute

Beautiful Spot!!!!! The sliders are delicious, along with the Ribs that fall right off the bone!
Amazing staff and you can drink to your hearts content and not break the bank! Highly recommend!

formatted_address: 2 Times Square, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Olive Garden Italian Restaurant

reviews.text: Olive Garden make it perfect when they have a great guy as your waitress his name Robert W. This guy had the best attitude as soon as he start getting our order. He was very humble, helpful, easy going, great to follow indirect instructions for my wife birthday, paying attention to everything and giving his highest service. He really love what he does and he provide you the best experience ever. From every single place that I went around New York City, he was the top #1. Olive Garden give us the best time ever on this great city and I highly recommend to keep Robert with your restaurant because he make everything possible. A great thanks to him and next time that we visit New York for sure we will ask for him. OLIVE GARDEN a BIG THANKS to Robert.

Olive Garden has been one of the few chain restaurants that I don't have issues with. The bread sticks are amazing plus dairy free! As someone who can't have dairy this is an extreme plus. Bob was our server and he definitely made my visit to NYC better. The escalator leading down to the exit was a nice surprise since I ate so many breadsticks. The confetti margarita is delicious, sprinkles on drinks are my new go to.

Look this is a great place to go for dinner. Location amazing, right in the middle of time’s square. Free unlimited breadsticks and salad with your meal. Service was pretty spot on, our waiter gave us free wine. For the price it was well worth it. Pasta was good but not incredible.

Carissa B amazing server and honestly gave us one of the best service in any restaurant I ever been to. The food is always great but she made our experience top notch. I thank her and the General Manager Mr Garver. 10 stars instead of 5 stars. Would recommend.. she is amazing

Food, service, and drinks was very good. Nice dinning view of Times Square. We dinned on the second floor, they do have an elevator if needed. Prices are reasonable compared to similar restaurants in the area however it's the only Olive Garden we've been to that automatically added gratuity onto our party of 4, guess it's standard practice in many NYC restaurants. no complaints about them automatically adding gratuity since we had excellent service but almost tipped twice!

formatted_address: 121 Fulton St, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: The Ainsworth Fidi

reviews.text: Good ambience but won't go again. Overcrowded and overpriced. We ordered few drinks and were chatting but after 30-40 minutes when we didn't order anything manager came to us with the cheque (indirectly asking us to leave), which I think was very rude of him. So I would say if you're gonna keep ordering stuff then they'll like you otherwise you're not their favorite customer

I kicked off my 40th bday celebration at this place and I LOVED the vibe! The food was delicious and they brought me a sparkler with my bday cake! Very dope. It was a Thursday night and a crowd started to form. I had to go to another event but I would have loved to hang out for a while! I'd definitely go again!

The Caribbean night was great! It's been a while since I've last been here but this time was significantly better. 

One bouncer was being a little pervy though  prevented the last star
A great hybrid of a cocktail lounge / sports bar. 5 stars for the vibe and sports. 4 stars for the food (it is a sports bar after all).
Atmosphere and location is nice. Cocktails are good but the food I had wasn't great, just okay.

formatted_address: 119 South St, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: The Paris Cafe

reviews.text: First time back to eat there in over 20 years. Brought my son to show him a place from my past. The place looks great the bar is priceless. Food was very good and highly recommended.  Plenty on the menu for all tastes. I won't be waiting another 20 years before going back.

This is a welcoming place...with really yummy comfort food. Typically, mashed potatoes that look like a creamy paste taste...well, like creamy paste.  They were flavorful!! The braised lamb shanks were wonderful...I would have liked a wee more vegetable ...just me. Perhaps because it was a Sunday evening, there was very minimal wait staff. Our person was efficient and clearly overworked, being the only server for a large area. Luckily, we were there for friendship and the speed of service worked.
    This place is welcoming and cozy.  If I am again in the tip of Manhattan, I will get myself to The Paris Cafe.

Stopped in here for lunch today. I wasn't hugely hungry and ordered their Paris Chowder, which is essentially clam chowder stuffed with mussels and 1 huge scallop and 1 huge prawn. Perfect for a rainy, overcast day. 

My partner ordered their blackened catfish lunch special. Portions were huge. It was served with fresh mashed potatoes and veggies (cauliflower and broccoli). Everything seemed fresh. Presentation was right on target.

They have numerous beers and wines available (list on chalkboard on the wall). It feels more Irish than French so the name is a bit confusing.

Very cozy place to while away a lunch on a rainy day. Highly recommended.

Friendly service and satisfying seafood. The seafood stew was one of the best I've had in awhile. Considering its location and the atmosphere, it was surprising to see that there wasn't a wait. They messed up our dessert order 3 times though. Solid 4/5 stars

This is one of my favorite places in the city. It also happens to be one of the oldest bars/restaurants in NYC still in operation. The dining room and bar room ooze architectural details that you just can’t be replicated today in the modern dining scene. Good drinks, solid classic meals, nice bartenders. I love coming here because it feels like I stepped back in time 100+ years. It’s particularly wonderful on a cold winter evening. My photos are from late last year, when the Paris Cafe was decorated for the holiday season.

formatted_address: New York, NY 10017, USA
name: Zook Mansion

reviews.text: Nice place, good food. Talked with Zook about my Obamium research and he started funding it, epic! You should totally visit!
Kinda epic. Met Zook there super nice guy!
Good place good guy
10/10 would recomend

formatted_address: 300 W 22nd St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Foragers Table

reviews.text: Foragers table was a recommended by a friend who has been here a number of times. We were not disappointed.  The ingredients are clearly extremely fresh and are very well prepared. The service staff is very friendly and tremendously attentive. From cocktails to dessert we were presented with delicious food and beverages.

Went for brunch... Amazing pancakes... moist and they have a subtle orange flavor that's delicious.  Egg white omelette was excellent too; I like having a side of greens with potatoes instead of just potatoes on the side.  Nice strong coffee too.  

All the ingredients tasted super fresh.  I like that they are all locally sourced; they are mindful of the carbon footprint of their business.  

Great service, food, and atmosphere for a Sunday brunch, really enjoyed.  Definitely will be coming back.
So good I had to go twice in one weekend! Very accommodating for vegetarians and vegans and the service was great! Highly recommend the market also!!

I admire this restaurant! They offer high class dishes, their menu is nice, The cook in that place is a professional, I enjoy a lot eating all their dishes. The dishes are consistently good, the attitude towards the visitors  is efficient. I visit often this restaurant and I was never unhappy. I recommend this place.

Amazing meal. Had the crispy asparagus and I really enjoyed the sauce it came with. The gnocchi was so rich, creamy and delicious. I loved the local ingredients and they even give you a map of where they all come from. Would recommend.

formatted_address: empire state building, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Candidate Collective INC

formatted_address: 17 Barrow St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: One if by Land, Two if by Sea

reviews.text: Food is good, especially the Beef Wellington. But the service is very disappointed. I told them in advance by phone that the day we came was my girlfriend’s birthday and hoped them could help prepare some special thing, like put name on menu or write a happy birthday on dessert. They accepted. But, nothing happened, they totally forgot! It’s not acceptable for a restaurant advertised itself as most romantic restaurant in NYC.

Wonderful historical restaurant. A beautiful charming place to eat with excellent service. We made reservations for Sunday bunch on Mother's day. Definitely a place to celebrate a special occasion. The food was elegant & favor full. (My 16 year old nephew was still hungry after the 5 course brunch)

Came here for a wonderful date. While we were there, we witnessed a proposal (she said yes)! Everything about this venue is flawless. 

The food is incredible! (My date described it as "real tasty.") The seared scallops melt in your mouth and I've never seen such a perfect sunny-side-up quail's egg!

Amazing and beautiful place! Definitely was worth it Ahmed and Marco I believe was our waiter's name they were awesome! Awesome customer service my wife loved her birthday dinner I definitely recommend

Went here to celebrate just after proposing and her saying yes. Possibly the best meal I've ever eaten in just a stunning building with the best atmosphere. Is it expensive? My word yes. Is it worth it for a one of a kind experience. Hell yeah!

formatted_address: 65 Carmine St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Spunto Thin Crust Pizza

reviews.text: Spunto has the best thin crust pizza! Their house salad is also amazing! The happy hour is pretty legit Buy a bottle of wine and receive a complimentary free pizza. This picture is from valentine's day hence the heart shaped pizza

Gosh, this place is really a gem! My workplace orders from Spunto frequently so I decided one day to try it fresh. I got a chipotle chicken inspired recipe which I thought was quite good and fresh. The crust was crispy and a very different sort of thin crust which you'll rarely find around the city. I'm a big fan of cilantro so I really thought it was exceptional (pass on the pineapple). The reason I have to knock it one star is because of the price. A personal pizza with toppings and a soda came out in the ballpark of $20 and I can't be spending that kind of *dough* on a lunch. Nevertheless, the crust and pizza is to dry for so if you got some extra cash to splurge and are in the mood, try Spunto!
Nice environment, attentive staff, and great food! The thin crust pizzas are superb! Reasonably priced as well
Our server was a dreamboat! She was so sweet and extra easy on the eyes! The pizza and beers were great! If you like thin crust, this is your spot!

Amazing pizza with super thin crust. Long list of choices of pizzas and salads. We had traditional Classica and ChickPotle, both were really good. Friendly staff. Popular place, there were no empty seats when we were leaving. Lots of empty meter parking, free after 7. Will definitely be back.

formatted_address: 190 Avenue B, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Ama Raw Bar

reviews.text:
The new best spot in Alphabet city! Food was delicious !! I recommend the 12 oysters, really fresh and at $1/oysters ! Sooo worth it! 
Also the crispy rice tuna, to die for! We also had the  crispy oyster buns and the mellow mussels. 
Everything was delightful, refined and interesting !

Also the staff is super friendly, great vibes and great decor! Will be back a lot for sure!

These guys right here are A1. Best place to stumble upon, I wish them all the success and then some.

Family owned, high class, cozy, personable, and the chef is putting his foot in that food. Some of the best oysters we’ve ever had, the best bao bun I’ve EVER had (fried oyster!), and amazing cocktails to go with it.

Lastly, for the sake of not saying too much, I’ll just say this - book your event here. A nice little lounge that is to die for (The Kiki Room), an outdoor space even, and not far from the train.

I only took one picture because I was too busy having a good time. Go have a good time at AMA Raw Bar!

Great neighborhood spot. Perfect for happy hour oysters & cocktails. They also have a great lounge in the back for private events or just a cool place to have a drink . The raw bar looks great in the room. Can't wait for the warm weather when I can take advantage of the backyard space. This will definitely be a regular spot for me & the crew.

Dropped in for an event here recently and found myself not wanting to leave. Gorgeous space, great staff, really delicious food and cocktails. From the stylish decor to the creative menu you can just tell they put a lot of thought and care into this place. Great energy all around. I definitely appreciate this new spot opening up in the neighborhood and I will definitely be back. Probably way too often!

Super vibey new raw bar that opened up and when you walk in you immediately feel cooler. Had $1 oysters and $6 lychee martinis all night on a Friday which is a great deal. The cocktails were excellent and the lychee martini was not the usual syrupy sugar bomb that other places usually have. Also tried the spicy Palawan (tequila) and their spin on the old fashioned. 

The best thing (besides oysters) was the spicy tuna rice, which had individual little bites with perfectly crispy rice bottom. Only wish it was a tad spicier! Also the seared tuna was served in this gorgeous slightly sweet sauce with a smoky salt. And the crispy chicken bao had perfectly tender and crunchy karage style chicken. Still on "soft open" menu so must go back to try the full thing. 

The venue renovation is gorgeous with dark moody tones. Also they have a cute private event space with a back patio that allows dogs.

formatted_address: 52 A Carmine St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Carmine Street Beers

reviews.text: Great local craft beer store for West Village locals.  Decent variety (though not many of them are priced, so a nice can of beer can run you 4-15 dollars, so you have to ask).  They also have a fun bar vibe, with seats / standing room by the bar, or an area in back with a couple tables.
The beer selection here is world class! Staff was nice and knowledgeable. They even had some cans of Heady Topper. It's a must for every craft beer fan visiting New York.

I dunno where else you're going to go for a very diverse selection of beers from all over the nation in the West Village, but look no further! The dudes working the bar know their beer, have some fine drafts on tap, and bonus points for being integrated with Untapped!

A must stop if you like craft beer!!! With 14 taps and thousands of different craft beers & ciders you are sure to find a tasty beverage to suit your taste buds.
If I could go back tomorrow, I would.
🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟
Excellent selection of unique beers and nice staff. Shame that you can’t buy the beers in the fridge and have there. The draft selections are nice but 99% of the beers there are for take out only.

formatted_address: 251 W 30th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: HustlaBall

formatted_address: 7 E 54th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: SPIN New York 54

reviews.text: Great food,with an Ever changing menu.Excellent, knowledgeable,and fun staff. Excellent beer and mixed drink selection. It's also nice to have Ping Pong, Jenga, and Connect Four to play,while waiting for your lunch or dinner or while having drinks

Great food! Original and delicious!!! You have to check this spot out. They also have great service, I was a walk in, they hooked me up with a seat in seconds. Had perfect service and the best part the price isn't that bad. I left a 20% tip and they are also carbon conscious, trying to minimize plastic waste from their restaurants. Go check it out, you wont be disappointed.

We had so much fun at this place! We had to check out of our hotel early and they let us bring our luggage in, have drinks, and play ping pong for a long time. The staff was fun, entertaining, and very helpful!

I stopped in for a quick cocktail but was so impressed that I stayed for two. They flavors were complex yet balanced. It was between 4-7 so they were also discounted by $3. The bartender, Kimberly, was exceptional. I wish I found about this place before my last night in NYC. I would definitely come back just for the cocktails but I also want to try the food.

The manager at the front desk was extremely rude/dismissive. The bartenders made up for the unwelcoming greeting we received with their attentive and helpful service. The food at the bar was very tasty - especially the pizza. Still, I would highly recommend going to the 23rd street location where there are many more ping pong tables and friendlier hosts.

formatted_address: 1486 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10075, USA
name: Uva

reviews.text: We went to that restaurant because it was not where crowded, it was open till late (1am) and it had good revuewa. And actually? It was amazing! The food, the waiters. Everything was amazing. The dishes came out right on time. The waiter was very nice and made the stay very pleasant. Thanks!

We arrived at this spot for a meeting. This place was recommended to us by a friend.  Well, we were not disappointed. The staff were extremely nice and we felt good. The meal was delicious. We enjoyed every moment and we will definitely return to this restaurant. Recommended.

If you love truffle, if you love pasta, come here. 

This place has a cute backyard garden area that's perfect for date night, and really good truffle pasta with perfectly cooked noodles, all for a reasonable price. 

Service wasn't great but they were busy, and as long as the food is great, then who cares. 

They also have good ricotta on toast with truffle honey. Get that too. It's so smooth and creamy, really started the dinner off well.

It's a beautiful restaurant. The service, especially that of the lady who serves for the terrace in the front is unbelievably efficient and professional; my biggest compliment and respect to the place would go to the server without a doubt. Their foods, however, leave a subtle space that can be further improved. For example, the pear salad was a bit over-seasoned while the spaghetti of our meatball entree was slightly under-cooked.

Good food at slightly high prices. Hostess had a bit of a chip on her shoulder. Didn't have reservations so the wait was about ab hour at 7:30pm on a Saturday. Great atmosphere. Food served well and in decent portions.

formatted_address: 92 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Hotel Chantelle

reviews.text: I felt like a movie star. It was bright, friendly and the DJ played amazing music. Jonathan and Courtney took great care of us. The prices were great. The food was phenomenal. I recommend the breakfast pizza!!

Delicious and amazing food. Enjoyed everything that we ordered. Great music, the DJ that was here was really good. Professional and friendly staff. Service was outstanding. Great location with rooftop and outdoor seating. Definitely recommend this place.

The food was really good, the place was really nicely decorated. They had a live DJ. The place is a little loud But you can still enjoy your time here. I went to celebrate my brother's birthday. If you are going to celebrate a birthday let them know when making the reservation so they tell you about the birthday packages. Price was it was $$. You can come here with a group and have a good time

Cozy rooftop that offers the comfort and atmosphere of a local neighborhood eatery while also delivering the 5 PM on Friday vibe.  You’re here to unwind as a precursor for what’s to come next. The food and drinks are a tick above average, I enjoyed the $1 happy hour oysters, but that’s not what brought you to this establishment. You come to Hotel Chantelle for the feeling it imparts upon you which dances between chic rooftop and local LES watering hole. This is a great option for drinks before dinner or a nightcap before you head home with that special someone.

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! From the waiter (Evert; love love love him), to our food, to the atmosphere, to the music and especially to the drinks. Very good for dates or birthdays. We had a friend recommend to us and we’re so happy we took her suggestion!

formatted_address: 337 E 10th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Gnocco

reviews.text:
Love this place! The food is excellent environment is super cozy and the people are very friendly and knowledgeable !! I have eaten here several times and they never let me down! 
My favorite part of the restaurant is the indoor  garden with A/C it’s super cute !

The margherita pizza is amazing as are the pancakes. The staff are super nice. They helped entertain our 9 month old daughter through brunch. Definitely recommend going. Sit out back in the garden too.

Recently hosted a bridal shower at Gnocco.  I cannot stress enough how incredible the staff and leadership at the restaurant was in setting up, coordinating, dealing with last minute changes, and serving both food and beverages.  Guests had an excellent time and continued to mention how delicious the food was and how wonderful an experience they had from a service standpoint.  I will be back for dinner and will continue to encourage anyone in the city looking for an intimate space to host a small event to contact Gnocco.

Highly, highly recommend!  Brilliantly delicious New York Style Pizza.  Sweet and quaint atmosphere, very friendly staff full of smiles and good vibes.  Our friend used to live next door and brought us here on a weekend trip, it was so great we decided to eat here twice before the weekend was over!  I will always come back to this one it's very good!!
This spot constantly delivers. They have awesome food for affordable rates, there no long wait even when the spot is busy.

formatted_address: 323 Smith St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Gowanus Yacht Club

reviews.text: Close to the subway. Chill and unpretentious. This is always a nice place to catch up with a friend to put a few down. They also have food. I'm pretty sure I ate some food here before and it was passable. Will update when I have a better memory of the food quality
Fun, low-key place for snacks and beer.
A good local watering hole.  It's all outdoor with limited space but it's a really pleasant spot to throw down a couple brews.
Great place to sit outside for beers at great prices. Dog friendly!
amazing atmosphere, super friendly service

formatted_address: 525 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10017, USA
name: 525LEX Restaurant & Lounge

reviews.text: Decent service good burger. Friendly bartender
Steven seemed to be in charge; John seemed to be very green.  Service at the bar was fine for me.  Can't say the same if you're sitting at tables

I stayed at this hotel for a few days experienced myself and observe the staff being super rude to the hotel guests. What a shame. This is not a good representation of Marriott hotels and their high standards.
$9 draft beers.
Amazing burger and fries 100% recommend

formatted_address: 735 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Tuttles

reviews.text: Great Little bar.  Hosted a birthday party for 25 guests, and it was pretty perfect.  Service was great, upstairs  venue was private and just roomy enough.  Food was good for bar food.  A great time... strongly recommend!

A lil expensive, especially for drinks during happy hour, but the bartender is great and knows how to pour a great tequila and soda. There well tequila is pretty decent.

The food was great, stuffed Avocado with shrimp was excellent as were the wings. 

Nice garden for the season, and decent tunes.
We had our office Holiday party here. I highly recommended going here. Great atmosphere. The apps and drinks were great too.
Some of the best food I ever had and they're open late too. And everything is priced reasonably too and the service staff are great.
Absolutely love this bar very laid-back great staff bartender knows how to pour Guinness just right made me happy I will be back she also made a very good tequila sunrise.

formatted_address: 17 E 27th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Men Seeking Men

formatted_address: 409 8th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Pad Thai

reviews.text: This place has first-rate service and tasty food. One of my favourite places in the city. The food and drinks came out quick and the rates are inexpensive. Will definitely recommend this spot.

Everything was good but the servers are super serious about the tips. They literally checked the tips section in front of me where I have them 15% thinking it will roundup the amount, but she asked me it must be 20% atleast then there are 30-40% or even more. I don't know why she was so aggressive about the tips.

Food was okay. I had the thai pineapple fired rice. Requested spicy but chef "forgot" to add spice so I got the spice bowls instead. Attendant hovered around me the entire and I felt like I had a timeline to finish eating and leave.

I love this place. The food is always good, and they don't mind, at least obviously, my food restrictions.  The service is always good. It can get loud on some occasions on account of the space being tight, but overall I enjoy the place. I especially like their choice of music - classic jazz. Very nice.

Being an ardent Thai food lover, this place was a disappointment, and is strictly okay. The table setup is congested and overall needs an upgrade/change. The service was mechanical, but over all courteous.
There are innumerable choices around the area, some really good Thai spots itself. Highly recommend checking them first.

formatted_address: 539 River Rd, Edgewater, NJ 07020, USA
name: Outback Steakhouse

reviews.text: Kathy( the Hostess) very courteous and pleasing she tends to your needs by finding you an available table to make your waiting time easier. The food is excellent! very tasty and fresh. Tables and floor very clean. I love this place I even order take out on week days (I don't cook)🙁

I came in on a typical Saturday night to sit at the bar. Charlie and Lisa were great!! Lisa took great care of bar top and Charlie killed service. At times it got a little busy but the whole team really worked together (including servers sorry I don’t know your names 😅). For dinner I had the Aussie fries, and sirloin with grilled shrimp - DELISH!! I’ve only been to this location once before but this has been one of the best dinners out I’ve had out in a while. Props to everyone keeping it together and getting things done, will definitely be back and recommend 😁.

Madison is an excellent manager who ensures the best for her customers. She is very personable and makes sure her customers are treated life family. I look forward to returning again for a delicious meal.
Food is always good and service is fast with friendly servers.  Parking is plentiful.  Nighttime there can be a long wait, but nearby stores and the river walkway help pass the time.

Great offerings. Delicious appetizers. Today we split the 
Blooming Onion Petals as an appetizer. It was not only yummy but plenty for the two of us. The sangria really hit the spot. Also love the coconut shrimp and loaded potato soup. Today we had very tender Rib Eye steak and the loaded baked potato. Both, as usual were excellent. Service was fast and attentive. Of course they also offer seafood, sides and deserts. We come here about once a month or so. Lots of parking. Nice chairs to sit outside and watch the Hudson river traffic and NYC skyline.

formatted_address: 314 W 11th St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: The Spotted Pig

reviews.text: Every time I visit New York I always make sure I fit time in for The Spotted Pig. Such delicious foods, prepared beautifully. They don’t take reservations, and get pretty busy but it’s certainly worth all the wait! If you are a first timer DEFINITELY get the burger if you can.
