I’ve branched out to different dishes so far and I haven’t been disappointed! Quirky decor and great atmosphere.

I came here twice and both times got their burger. 
The burger is probably one of the best I have had. Properly grilled, juicy, flavourful, just amazing. The Roquefort cheese adds a very interesting twist to the taste. Really good. Even the buns they use are delicious and look good. If you can justify paying $29 (£25) for a burger and chips - you need to try this place. It is a way, way better burger than anything I have had in London. 
I wasn’t a huge fan of their fries (chips) - the shoestring chips are not my thing. They were hard to eat and a bit too oily. YMMV.

I am Italian, I live in the UK, I love food and I love good hamburgers. This is, without fail, the best burger I have ever had. The meat is very tender and juicy, the cheese on top just the way I like it. A burger, to be good, does not need a lot of adds or sauces... this is the proof. Yes, it does not come cheap but... I would go back there immediately! The staff is also very friendly and warm atmosphere. A must go in NY

Cozy interiors, but very very slow service. 

Food is decent. The ricotta gnudi was a particularly good starter. The much-hyped burger is good...but not mind-blowing. The shoestring fries are crispy and garlicky and delicious. I usually am not a fan of bleu cheeses, but the Roquefort added a nice sharp contrast to the burger. The burger itself was also juicy. But overall, it was just good.

We came over for dinner, all had burgers which are praised in reviews. Totally not worth it. 
For a $29 burger I expect the bun to be fresh and the patty to be  succulent, both failed. The burger is nothing more than mediocre at best and all 3 diners at the table felt the same. The fries at a messy side and there is no graceful way to eat them, most left on plate.
The place is cozy and the appetizer liver toast was good though I won’t be coming back...

formatted_address: 1331 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: Bottega

reviews.text: Great place . Had dinner tonight with my family. Manager and staff are on the highest possible level! Food is amazing and prices are very normal for this kind of place! I will come here again and again again for sure!
Great fresh Italian and top notch service
I really liked this place. It was down to earth. The food was simple and good. The servers were friendly.
Nice atmosphere, good food, great service.
Great service! Delicious meal! Generous portions!

formatted_address: 30 Broad St, New York, NY 10004, USA
name: Bluestone Lane Coffee Shop - Financial District

reviews.text: I love their club sandwich here, and I will usually drive out of my way to get one. They also have a great selection of lunch items, smoothies, and of course, coffee. This is a small coffee shop that offers outdoor seating and great service. Either way, I would highly recommend going to this place for lunch or coffee.

Well rounded flat whites with a smooth texture. Friendly barista who knows his stuff. Good place for a great coffee if you wonder around Exchange place. Only drawback - no rest rooms there and but pricier- links with the location (it’s a Wall street anyway).

I've lost count of how many times I've been here.  It's always been a good experience at Bluestone Lane Coffee Shop - Financial District.  Bluestone Lane Coffee Shop - Financial District is there all the time and really nice.  The bacon is F-inf amazing. I've have ordered the off menu burger they offer that is only available for dinner with no subs and to eat in house only and it was perfect.
Almost complete with our week long tour of all BSL’s in Manhattan! The coffee isn’t as consistent at some locations. This one is one of our least favs.
Delicious coffee and friendly service. Just keep in mind it is a very small seating area in an office building rather than a coffee shop to sit in. Still, they make the little seating area nice.

formatted_address: 55 Water St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: SUGARCANE raw bar grill

reviews.text: Really nice place to hangout with large group of people. They have really good sharing plates. Awesome sushi and others tapas like snacks to go with tasty cocktails. They have really good happy hour.  I’ve never been here for dinner but lunch and brunch menus are great! It’s also really spacious comparing to other places in neighborhood or NYC in general.

A perfect place for sushi and drinks near the water. The strawberry basil cocktail is one of the best I've had, and the sushi was fresh and tasteful and so good. We ordered an assortment of dishes for the table and shared them all. Noteworthy are the chefs choice sushimi, goat cheese croquettes, crunchy tuna roll, and the Alaska king crab roll. All so good.

The good: service is good and attentive, food presentation is good, duck fried rice was tasty.
The bad: seating (at least for the row of tables with seating for two) is very cramped, the beef short rib was burnt to a crisp, and the crispy rice sushi was less tasty-crunchy-crispy and more left-overnight-on-the-counter crispy.
Overall, I expected a far better experience for the price paid. I can enjoy the same quality food and ambiance for 2/3 the price elsewhere.

Good menu, raw bar was excellent. Service could have been a bit more informed. We had made reservations, still waited 20 minutes. Overall recommend the place and is in a great area for walking around before/after meal.

We  visited a couple of weeks ago. Party of 12!!! We had a great time. The ambiance and customer service was very good. We. the customers,.. were the best of the best!!!The food was delicious!! OMG!! the Duck and waffle with duck egg The appetizers was very good and filling. Erica did a great job!!! The bartender was very good as well. One of your workers assisted us in taking a few pics for us after dinner. Thank you, very courteous and attentive. I recommend and cant wait to come back!!!!

formatted_address: 270 Smith St between Degraw St &, Sackett St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Union Grounds

reviews.text: $15 minimum if you use a credit card. Nice little bar food menu, a couple a slider specials. 8 beers on tap, 2 beer and shot combos, pitchers, about 15 or so bottled and canned beer, couple of ciders, and red and white wine. Plenty of televisions for sports. Wii bowling is available if you ask. Wednesday night is trivia at 8pm.
Happy New Year! Happy 2019~*
Nice lively place with a good atmosphere.

Went to watch U.S. Open women's finals. After the MMA fight (which they played over speakers), asked the bartender to put on the commentary for the tennis match. He lied to me and said they didn't have the volume on.  Waitress even told me they had the volume on.

Edit: so I asked him to play it over speakers - which technically they didn't do for MMA - he said they just turned volume up. Thought the staff handled it pretty well. Was going to revise review to a few stars higher - but based on owner's response - not happening.

Friendly, inviting and chill.  Vincenzo Rocks
 Music is perfect as well. Love the selection of draft beers.  To my liking and the new draft rocks.

formatted_address: 934 3rd Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11232, USA
name: Japan Village

reviews.text:
There's not much not to like about Japan Village. Other than perhaps some of the prices on the produce, it's a really fun section of Industry City that has something for most people. The food in the restaurant section is diverse and enjoyable. The selection in the market area is robust and interesting. And while it's often busy due to its popularity, it's fairly easy to get what you need within about 15 minutes or so. 

If you're looking for lunch, snacks, or just for a place to browse, Japan Village is a fun place to check out.

Absolutely lovely, the food is delicious and it's very nice to spend time with someone here. The bathrooms are good and there is always room to sit (one of my favorite things about here). The people here are nice and in my experience have never been rude. Definitely recommend!! :)

I lived in Brooklyn all my life until I moved and have seen in a long time. It has changed so much it's beinging to look like Manhattan. Found this place while I by myself taking a tour though Brooklyn. Nice place .the market is very nice  and place to enjoy with family and friends. The only thing in Brooklyn the traffic always sucks And parking the same. Take the train get there faster and it's closer.

Fantastic selection of tasty Japanese foods! The sushi bar is one of the best. The food stands get busy, but you can usually find a seat at the bar or take your food to one of the many seating areas around Industry City. Love the grocery selection too!

Actually amazing place. It's like a food court. I'll find many different stores with different food. Also they have a bar with all sorts of sake and beer. And Japanese supermarket. Will definitely come back for more experience.

formatted_address: 147 Bank St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: NSFW

formatted_address: 540 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Waterfront Ale House

reviews.text: Amazing fish and chips. Can’t beat the $5 pint specials.

Great place to grab a bite before a flick. I think the German fare is on point. Give your self a few extra minutes. It's worth the wait. I didn't find the brisket to be as tender as I'd hoped but it was nothing a craft beer couldn't cure.
I love this place! Great food, drinks, and hospitality. Best chili nachos I've ever had.
The drinks are properly priced and the bartender what absolutely hilarious. Had lots of fun and good conversation. Definitely will be going back again.!
It's a chill atmosphere the drinks are good and the food is good try mac n cheese nice kick to it and music is good

formatted_address: 338 Bedford Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Khao Sarn Thai

reviews.text: We like a lot to go out. Last night we came to this delicious place which friends told us about. We passed a lovely time there with first-rate meal and a nice team and  a professional chief cook. We put this venue in our list  and we will definitely visit again soon. We deeply recommend.

I have been eating at this place for well over 10 years, old and new location. The new location has a more modern vibe, great location. Food has always been consistent, nothing fancy, just great food and good service.
We love this place, they treat you like family, and the food is delicious. The best Thai food I ever had!! We go often for special occasions multiple times a year.
Small portions for the lunch special. I chose the drunken noodles and crispy wontons. The 2 fried wontons were small. The thai iced tea was what you would expect.
Absolutely amazing Thai food! The ambiance is perfect for date night. Fair prices on the food and drinks

formatted_address: 346 Bedford Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11249, USA
name: Simple

reviews.text: Great service, really cool atmosphere, and has a unique feel to it that's different from many other restaurants. Also, the look of the food was amazing. I enjoyed my steak and eggs as well, however there wasn't much steak given.

So, my best friend and I were walking down Bedford when we happened to stumble upon Simple. Walking through the door, we were greeted by an inviting, French/Algerian-inspired cafe. Don't be fooled by the name of this restaurant, because the food is anything but simple. I had the Croque Madame sandwich, served open-faced, and a side salad with radishes. The sandwich was made to perfection, and the salad had so many subtle flavors. The staff was so accommodating and attentive. I will be back.

I love Simple Cafe! The food options are plentiful, high quality, and delicious. I always have a difficult time choosing what to have! We have eaten here many times and its always consistent, which I appreciate. The staff is helpful, friendly, and accommodating. They also have an amazing mango mimosa! Check out their cute little shop before you leave!

The food was good, unfortunately that didn't reflect to their service. When we got the bill with fixed 20% service charged on it, we were surprised because it was never mentioned by our waiter. The worst was the waiter responded that all tables are charged 20% service, while the other table told us they did not get charged on their bill. It was unbelievably the waiter further told us that they charge service fee to certain tables because sometimes people don't tip well. When we asked how do they determine which tables get picked for service fee, he flipped out and just said okay he will refund and walked away... Overall a very unpleasant experience with the service.

Unespected. If you have doubts looking cafe from external,  don't hesitate. The quality of the food is extraordinary. At first glance, buffet seems limited, but there are everything you need. Service is nice and courtesy fare. Thanks guy for all.

formatted_address: St Marks Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11238, USA
name: Imperial Bikers MC

reviews.text: It's a great dive bar bartender Miss Alice is great jukebox great music lot of Blues

formatted_address: 60 Henry St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Bevacco

reviews.text: Dropped in with family after a long day of museums and shopping. We had a great time -wonderful food, super service and terrific atmosphere! Highly recommend it-
Here for late lunch. I rarely review anything. But had the lentil soup and eggplant parmigiana which were marvelous. Although service was “leisurely” deserved 5 stars for the food.
One of the highlights of our NYC trip to find this small, clean, and friendly resturant.  Food was well prepared.  Had a great experience.

It's loud in here. I wonder sometimes how restaurants choose the finishings to the room. This place is very raucous and I have to think it was intentional. If you are looking for a quiet place, this place is not it. 

However, if you're looking for a place in Brooklyn Heights where you can get reasonably priced, well executed and tasty food which to me is not that common in Brooklyn Heights this is a good spot. we had the sausage pizza, the fried calamari, the grilled asparagus, and the Beet and grapefruit salad. The service was swift, the food came out fast. 

It's a shame about the Acoustics because it's too loud for me. But it's a good restaurant.
Always delicious. Plays good jazz. Awesome neighborhood place

formatted_address: 2078 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10029, USA
name: Nightclubs in NYC

formatted_address: 110 9th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: CoBa

reviews.text: Fantastic bun cha and great service

Tried a number of pho places around Manhattan, and this is the first where I can say the pho is not just good, but very very good. Flavorful broth, generous and tasty meats, noodles just right. Friendly staff and a chill atmosphere make this a place I'll definitely return to.
Food was great, friendly staffs. I had Bun Ha Noi and it was outstanding.

I love CoBa! Most of the time I order but if you’re able to come eat at the restaurant it’s a wonderful experience. The staff is very nice and attentive but also will leave you alone if you want to be left alone which I like when I come to have lunch here. The lunch special during the week and weekend is worth it. I would recommend the five spices beef and the fried spring rolls. With the location being here in Chelsea it’s very reasonably price compared to another Vietnamese restaurant just down the block. Give them a try!
Always enjoy Coba, delicious food, calm ambience and around a beautiful neighborhood. Must try are Bun Coba, Arugula Mango Salad, Ribs & Pho! it's so good!

formatted_address: 349 E 13th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Sister Jane Tavern

reviews.text: This is exactly the kind of neighborhood bar I love - the kind with the games on but isn’t an overwhelming sports bar, the kind with good food and drink options that I could enjoy on a Monday or Saturday....
Fun Comedy Tuesdays w Claire Marie and Lee Paul
Okay happy hour but neat place.

Didn't finish my burger (it was bad)

The chili was okay
Fun space with creative happy hour options. The bartender is friendly and warm.

formatted_address: 291 Grand St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Caracas Arepa Bar

reviews.text: The food was ok and order came faster than I expected because the place was crowded. The tomato and carrot soup was the best of the evening, it has a delicious flavor and it was really delicious, but the rest of the food (arepa with beans and beef and the national Venezuelan bowl) it wasn’t so especial as the soup. Good beer. I like the fact that they had Polar beer.

I've been going here for years and years ago, the food was really really good and the prices were great. Now the prices increased and it doesn't even reflect the quality of the food. The food is just okay, like no more wow factor left.
Awesome food! I'm biased though... I'm Venezuelan! Hehe

Well I've never tried Venezuelan food before so we went to  this Venezuelan restaurant in Brooklyn for Arepas. We started off with croquetas and tequeños (deep fried queso blanco sticks wrapped in a wheat flour dough) before moving on to the Arepas. My wife had the De Pabellón (shredded beef, black beans, cotija cheese & deep fried plantains) whilst I had La del Gato (guayanés cheese, fried sweet plantains, avocado & Chicken). We shared a side salad. For dessert I had a coconut tres leche cake whilst she had the chocolate mousse. We loved everything we tried. I Highly recommend this if you're in the area.

Had the best Venezuelan street food ever. One of the highlights of NY
Service was excellent. Lovely music and ambience. Really cozy.

formatted_address: 944 8th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Ivy

reviews.text:
After a concert at Radio City, we decided to back to the restaurant we had dinner earlier. The place was jammed packed, so we decided to go across the street to Ivy.  For drinks and something to snack on. 
It was a group of 10 and the staff at Ivy’s was courteous and attentive. The kitchen was about to close we ordered some appetizer and drinks and they didn’t hesitate to fill our orders. We came from Rochester NY.

Food (burgers) and drinks (coconut run cocktail) were tasty. The New York style pizza was okay, somewhat rubbery. The chipotle sauce and bleu cheese dressing were visible, but didn’t add a ton of flavor. My side was switched by mistake. The servers quickly corrected it. There was a lot of confusion between waitstaff, kitchen, and timing. Our waiter never wrote our orders and kept having to double check who got what and what they wanted. The main dishes were brought a little before the appetizers. For the table next to us, their dessert (ice cream on lava cake) was brought out when they had only begun their entree. Their ice cream started to melt and the cake got cold. The atmosphere the nice.
Location is in good neighborhood. Staff were most pleasant and professional. Happy hour has pretty good drinks. Not watered down like some establishments.

We stopped by as it is a hot day just for a soda and ended up watching the tennis and had a light lunch of quesadillas- so good been told I need to make them when we get back home! Will be back again as I travel to NYC quite often for business- one for the list of places to eat in the evening
Aamazing margarita with Corona 🍻 also they have taco Tuesdays, worth a visit 🌮

formatted_address: 7 W 43rd St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: The Century Association

reviews.text: I was there working a gig. . .not sure if it's open to the public or if you can rent the space out. It's a beautiful venue. . .felling love the first time I walked in. It reminded me of Faculty House at Columbia University; both in architecture and the interior.
So trendy. Great art!
Excellente especial.  Wonderful history of art exciting the heart to care for the EARTH
I was all about the dessert cart

High class exclusive club where you need at least 12 members to recommend you to be eligible for membership candidacy aside from many other requirements. Having a lunch at this historical environment is a privilege. The food is good. The service is good. The ambiance is beautiful. The acoustics is great. The atmosphere is cukture with books, magazines and mementos of writers, actors and New York glitterati. Reading, writing and having private time  for yourselves at the library is another special occasion. What a joy to be part of this ambiance. Lucky for those who have friends to be invited there.

formatted_address: 694 8th Ave 2nd fl, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Retroclubnyc

reviews.text: Spend The 2020 New Year’s Eve party at RetroClub with 10 friends.  My era Disco/Hustle & Free Style Music.   Had the  greatest time that I haven’t had for a long time.   Jeff the DJ knows his music and from the time we arrived till ending everyone was on that dance floor.  The music moved us all & we never left the dance floor.  Jeff plays the best.  Manager & staff - great hospitality.  “We shall be back”.  Recommend this place to all.   Thank you guys for giving us the greatest best time.    “ love you”.    Tina, Tiffany n friends.
What a fabulous party! Great retro music and good time for all! Plenty of dance floor space and a fun crowd! A hidden gem in heart of Times Square, you won’t be disappointed!

Oh.  I enjoy it. Its a great place to hear songs from the different eras.  It takes you back.  I try to go when I can and it's a LOT OF FUN! People are great for connecting with.  I enjoy the disco sets. Awesome place! Price is right too.  The DJ is plays a nice variety from the different eras.

Hung out at Retroclubnyc for NYE with friends and had a blast. DJ played all and didn't even need to make a request - all songs from all eras were there.  We danced like we never danced before.  We didn't want to leave and had such an amazing time.  "WOW" DJ Jeff you really know how to spin it!  I'd like to commerate you for the great music experience.  Bartenders were excellent.  Management came around to make sure everyone was having a great time.  What a nice touch. I cannot wait to return.

Great venue! Downstairs and upstairs DJ spaces. Great decor and environment. There were a lot of places to hang around the venue. A bunch of bars to buy booze. There's usually a line if you get there too early, so if you're debating your arrival time, chill at home for a bit. Do NOT buy tickets at the door! Buy them online as they are way cheaper. The place is usually packed with people and full of fun! Highly recommend for a club and especially to see a DJ you really want to see.

formatted_address: New York, NY 10075, USA
name: 420 Epic Club

formatted_address: 1347, 2nd Av at, E 71st St, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: Il Divo

reviews.text: Beautiful and intimate dining experience with attentive service and overall good food.  Pricey (wines ranged from $14 to $27 per glass, a bowl of soup was $17, and desserts ranged from $16 to $17) and none are noted online.  Their soup of the day was amazing.  I would have been happy with just this for lunch.  The wild salmon was a generous portion, but was very salty.    Nice espresso.
Classy, amazing food

Impeccable and friendly service.
Authentic and delicious, Milanese food. Every dish I have had there, over several meals, fabulous. Wine list  extensive,  mostly Italian wines and for the quality, reasonably priced.
One of the very best Italian restaurants in NYC

Warm cozy atmosphere, excellent food and service. Thank you again to the staff and Christian ..you guys made my night. I really enjoyed..I recommend it to everyone.

P.s We’ll definitely be back .
Long way to go....

formatted_address: 50 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Mangia 57th - Midtown Italian Food & Corporate Catering NYC

reviews.text: The most delicious, healthy, and reasonable self serve salad bar styled establishment. Good value and high quality. I hope this exact concept comes to other large cities!

A nice discovery. When you feel hungry on the 5th avenue and want a quite street, this will be your secret place in NY. A very good service and choice of meals. Clean place and fresh ingredients. A nice and modern decor too. For sure, I’ll be back when I’ll be around.
Bravo!

They have build-your-own salads too, as do many other places, but what is special for us here are the freshly prepared salads and other combinations that they present each day. The hard part is choosing - there must be 30 or 40 each day and everything we tried was really amazing. There are many vegetarian / vegan options that are great (we loved one with shaved Brussels sprouts) but also ones with lobster, octopus, and other seafoods and meats which were a great deal all for the same price by the pound. It’s amazing how this place has kept its quality and improved since we first remember coming some 20 years ago. Hard to beat for lunch of this type.

A hidden surprise.
Initially were looking for a quick coffee, headed off the busier streets and saw what initially looked like a business coffee shop. Turns out there is much more to offer. We enjoyed a breakfast tea and a cappuccino, the coffee was great. This was accompanied by macaroons, which were delicious.

The place is modern but comfortable.
The selection if food behind the coffee area is superb. Although we didn't eat we couldn't help but notice how nice it all looked!

Great selection of desserts and sandwiches. Their macaroons are really authentic and to die for. If you are around the area definitely stop by and try a few of their offerings. You will not be disappointed.

formatted_address: 187 Warren St, Jersey City, NJ 07302, USA
name: Amelia's Bistro

reviews.text: Another wonderful find where one can get good food and wonderful service. Our waiter was amazing and wish I know his name to put it here. I ordered the crispy chicken sandwich which had a good mixture of flavors of honey mustard and coleslaw. The coleslaw wasn't heavy. They Also serve you mini cornbread muffins and mini blueberry muffins which were very delicious even they need the mermalade that came on the side. And the cappuccino was good too. Would highly recommend coming here.

Excellent choice for any kind of meal in Jersey City. Large and varied menu, with many interesting choices. Nice service, good vibe, not overly busy on a wet Sunday afternoon. We tried half a dozen different tapas (which are of non-traditional variety), and selections from all other parts of the menu, and left satisfied with everything we ordered including desserts.

Nice quiet restaurant with inside and outside seating. The waitress was very accommodating and knowledgeable. Food tasted great although on the borderline of being a bit too salty for my taste. The reason I did not give five stars is because this place still uses straws even when they serve just a glass of water. I believe restaurants need to be a bit more green and eco-conscious in today’s world.

Was having trouble finding a place that would accommodate 20-25 people at closing time on a Friday during restaurant week.  Lucky for me, I reached Abel at Amelia's who was more than happy to accomodate our request. Not only that, but he remained flexible as the head count and time kept changing!  We showed up a bit late and had a head count of 27!  The food and service were fantastic, without a single mistake!  We visit this area every year for a convention in February and no longer need to search around for a restaurant. We will definitely come back! Thank you to Abel and his staff

What a hidden gem. My wife and I decided to check out Amelia's due to it being a part of Restaurant Week. Boy, were we glad we did. Looking at the menu, we saw quite a bit that we wanted to try out. So much so that we didn't even take part of the Restaurant Week menu! We even ordered a double of the mango chicken strips (SO GOOD!)!!!

formatted_address: 4615 Center Blvd, Long Island City, NY 11109, USA
name: Sweetleaf Coffee & Cocktail Bar

reviews.text:
Place is very nice and decor is awesome.  The rocket fuel, voodoo child, and strawberry iced tea is excellent.  The service is very fast and friendly.
Rocket fuel is cold brew coffee with chicory maple syrup and milk.
Voodoo child is vietnamese style cold brew, sweet and creamy.
Strawberry iced tea is strawberry puree tumbled with iced black tea.

Cute coffee place with a deceptively rustic interior (the outside looks like a modern apartment building). The coffee was great and the snacks were tasty. Well worth stopping by if you're looking for a caffeine hit in the area.
Great coffee and food during the day. At night its an cozy cocktail bar with fantastic drinks. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly and the small bites are tasty. A real hidden gem in LIC.
The best coffee in LIC! Super fresh and delicious. If you like buying beans they are one of the few that will give you the roast date to show you how fresh these are.
Lovely place. Coffee shop in the day. Then cocktails in the evening. Fab barman who was really fun and knows his stuff. Will be back.

formatted_address: 2268 Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd, New York, NY 10030, USA
name: Harlem Hops

reviews.text: Really nice spot.  Good crowd.  Nice vibe.  I am not a beer connoisseur,  but I enjoyed the ones I tried.  The bar menu isn't extensive, but what they have is good.  Try the pretzels and the pretzel dog.

Great place. Staff was friendly and the bites were delicious! The environment is welcoming and chill. A good variety of beer. There's adequate seating and it's definitely a place to either come with friends or sit and enjoy time alone.

Great beer selection! Bartender was nice and friendly. Atmosphere was good, music was a little loud for midday on a Sunday but we also had a baby with us in a bar so take that with a grain of salt. Didn't try the food but we had a great time there. Will be back for the back patio in the summer!

I learned about this place by pure happenstance. I met one of the owners at my job and she was the absolute nicest person. I finally got a chance to stop by today and it was everything. There's an outdoor area tables that are towards the back and a very long bar. Not long enough that you'll be forgotten by the bartender but long enough that you won't overhear the conversations of people next to you. The whole place is a vibe from the dark tone of the wood to the mellow lighting...even the fixtures were just super inviting. The staff are superb and the food is even better. There were I believe 15 beers in tap and they also had wine. I would definitely  recommend this place to everyone!!!  If I could give more than five stars I would.

A very nice addition to the harlem bar scene. Their specialty is beer, to which Kevin knows all . Not to mention the vast collection of booze. Go and enjoy the drinks and the atmosphere. I will post more pics later.

formatted_address: 236 5th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: ILILI

reviews.text: We’ve been coming here for dinner for over 5 years.  Always a great time, great vibe and great service.  We dropped in recently for dinner with good friends.  The food was good, maybe I didn’t order the right dish, but I thought food could be a little better.  Prices are sky high, but so is every restaurant in this area.  I will keep coming back, I do enjoy it here.

Do you like ambient places with deemed light and  ethnic food? Do you like passion fruit drink that is sparkly or maybe some other exotic flavors? Well, you should then visit this place. We regularly come back there.

Dropped in for an unexpected Brunch on a busy Saturday in December without reservations. Everyone was charming and friendly and could not have been more accommodating! Such a delightful surprise in an often hostile city. The food was excellent as was the service. The decor was glittery and Christmas-y but super tasteful and elegant. What a lovely experience!

Fantastic atmosphere, - cozy and warm woodworking in a concrete jungle. Great staff and service - knowledgeable. Delicious, unique and brilliantly selected wine offerings. Scrumptious Lebo food. I'm no expert on Lebanese cuisine but overall very I'm satisfied with my dining experience. Five Stars.

Fantastic food. Excellent service. The lamb with rice as main course is an excellent choice and always prepared well. The brussel sprouts are a great small course. One of our favorite places for Mediterranean food in New York city

formatted_address: M1-5, 52 Walker St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Play Sport Club

reviews.text: The team from AM Southampton is behind this place. Going to be a new hot spot
Bit of a dive bar feel but great music
Amazing venue real creative and fun.

formatted_address: 350 E 85th St, New York, NY 10028, USA
name: Ryan's Daughter

reviews.text: Very nice staff, good prices, fun games. Great neighborhood bar.
Perfect place and very nice staff!! we will be back

I arrived at this bar for a specific purpose, I was headed to a birthday party for a dear friend. While to my eyes and ears the establishment was a typical Irish pub anywhere in the city of New York, it quickly became apparent that there was a hidden agenda to this place. It’s cool. Not hip, or new age with fake interesting people and conversation. More like the other side of the pillow, comfortable and I want to stay here a while. Well priced drinks, decent can selection and staff that made chatting feel like old friends. I don’t often get up the the UES, but when I’m back, I’d love to throw a few back here and enjoy myself.
Fun! Always fun! Great service. Great dart boards. Highly recommend!
Fun place! Love the casual vibe, eclectic music mix and gilt-framed mirrors. Friendly bartender. The gf and I felt really welcome here and enjoyed our drinks. We'll be back.

formatted_address: 241 W 42nd St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Dallas BBQ

reviews.text: The restaurant is good, the portions are very generous. It was indicated in a review, recommending the baby back ribs informing that was enough for two people. The ribs were very tasty, but this is a dish with not too much meat, which is characteristic for the ribs. Additionally, there was potato, cornbread and some shrimps. The chicken dishes I saw in other tables were really huge. It is a good option, and not so expensive, considering NYC.

Everything delicious. Many people coming but the service to sit you down is too quick. It is a familiar place, beautiful, quiet, you could met with someone and have food eating any delicious food. They are famous for their margaritas. They have two sizes, house size is normal size, if you don’t ask for normal size they will give you a huge size, that it is good but if you don’t drink a lot, it is big amount. But the truth is that you will drink all. Delicious!!

The food was delicious. I recommend the sticky wings, chicken and waffles, or the dinner of the day. The service was outstanding. I work at a restaurant myself and seeing how fast tables were cleaned, reset with the floors swept all under a minute. My experience was overall great, I loved it and definitely want to come back for my birthday.

Food was decent.  Shrimp is only fried.  Not too many vegetables outside of a salad.  No green beans, broccoli etc.  I'm sure there are better options but for being next to times Square it's not a bad choice for the money you spend.

The food wasn’t that good. Got 5 Texas crispy wings. They were okay. My mom got the chicken and shrimp combo. The shrimp was good but the chicken was bland. We spent 45 dollars on some mediocre food but whatever. Service was decent. Got our appetizer before we even got drinks... that’s backwards.

formatted_address: Park Drive North, E 72nd St, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: The Loeb Boathouse

reviews.text:
Subsequent to my sons wedding, we went to the Boathouse for a small luncheon with our immediate family and my new and wonderful daughter-in-law and her family. It was a great experience. The company was fantastic, the appetizers were delicious, only to be outdone but the fabulous main course, and the desert was tremendous. The staff was excellent. They were very attentive to our needs and desires. Service was excellent!

Our group had a wonderful view of the lake from our table but it soon became a minor problem as the sun was shining through the window into the eyes of about half of the guests. It was requested that the exterior awnings be lowered to provide some shade to the affected guests but we were told that the awnings were in a fixed height position and could not be adjusted downward.

The inability to provide shade to our table is the only thing that is stopping me from giving 5 stars. I would gladly return to this facility but I would seek a shaded seating location or a room without a view. In all other aspects, our luncheon experience was superb.

This is a beautiful place with amazing food. We visited on a rainy day in the winter, but were seated by the windows. And even in the rain the views were beautiful! Our waiter was very helpful and friendly. Will definitely come back, hopefully in the summer when there are leaves on the trees and the windows are open!

One of my favorite ways to spend a sunny afternoon.  The key is to order at the counter (prices are MUCH more affordable vs getting table service inside) and bring your food/drink to the outside bar patio. The perfect spot to people watch and enjoy the juxtaposition of skyscrapers and nature.  We had the tuna on rye and an aperol spritz. (Spritz was a little weak but was worth the experience. )

Beautiful view of Central Park boating. Nice restaurant with white tablecloth. Arrive early and sit right in front of the pond. Service was great and waiters were friendly. If it’s a nice weekend day, expect a long wait. You clearly come for the view and the food was alright. Lunch menu can be limited — no salads and not many egg/omelette options.  I got the lox plate. They only have plain bagels and they aren’t the fresh kind from a nyc bagel spot. Tasted like a Thomas Plain bagel. If you are going to charge $28 at least have a decent bagel.

Beautiful restaurant in the middle of Central Park! Amazing food, and aesthetic. We ordered the crab cake which is unmatched! Must try if you go here. The hostess was rude when we entered and was dismissive. We called ahead of time to make a reservation. Also, noticed that the drinks were watered down, however the waiters were pleasant and kind. Ended up spending 350$ here, but slightly disappointed with the attitude of some of the staff.

formatted_address: 456 Johnson Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11237, USA
name: PMC NYC

formatted_address: 333 Hudson St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Westville Hudson

reviews.text: Great selection of all kinds of vegetables, the only thing was that mixed mushrooms occurred to be one type mushroom. A lot of vegan options too. Nice service. My whole family was satisfied with what they picked. It is a spacious restaurant with loads of room.

I can’t believe that I waited so long to check out Westville! As veggie lover, I can’t appreciate more about their market plate concept. Every single bite is delicious. The roasted bbq cauliflower salad was definitely the table’s favorite of the night.

Great food with very friendly staff. Service is quick, and the staff are knowledgeable about food items. Plenty of vegan friendly options available. Good drinks for reasonable prices. 

Can be a bit loud, so may not be appropriate for larger groups who want to chat. But the place has plenty of sound dampening foam around (including, weirdly enough, under the tables) so it's quieter than it would be otherwise.

Recommended.

Been here a few times. Usually crowded here. Need to get here before noon or after 1:30pm. Food here is usually good. Today I ordered the crispy fish sandwich with french fries and an unsweetened tea. It was really good. Their fries are always on point! My co worker ordered a salad and their special tea.
Everything tasted amazing. There is a lot of vegan options in the menu. I loved the friendly and helpful staff.

formatted_address: 304 E 6th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Mayamezcal

reviews.text:
It’s a romantic, hidden gem that has good service and can work for groups or couples. I finally tried it with two friends for dinner. I thought everything was ok for food and drinks but I could find better flavors and prices for the neighborhood. 

If you need someplace on a Sat and don’t have a reservation, you might get lucky here.

Great vibes in this subterranean McCall centric bar. Mezcals are pricey, though, so ask for tastes of what you're considering before you commit. Their cocktails and sours are on par with some of the best in the city.

Really interesting atmosphere. Delicious food. A very extensive selection of Mezcal and Tequila as well as plenty of cocktails to choose from. The service was very friendly and we had a really great time. You should definitely stop in if you have the chance.
Great atmosphere and drinks! Our bartender was the best too. We only got a quesadilla which was yummy but the rest of the food menu looked good. Def loved this placed!
Cool spot, frozen passion fruit margarita is pretty good! On the pricey side similar to a speakeasy

formatted_address: 107-93 West St, Brooklyn, NY 11222, USA
name: Vintage

formatted_address: 117 E 60th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: The Bar Room

reviews.text: Made a reservation for brunch. The server Anna was knowledgeable about the menu and was able to give thoughtful recommendations.  Also she was very funny. The food was delicious, and the cocktails on point. They make a great old fashioned there!  The burger and chicken parmigiana sandwich were delicious. Would definitely visit again!

What a delight experience at the warm and cozy bistro. The varied menu provides something for every tastebud without overwhelming you. The bar is talented offering classics and the new alike. Best of all is the attention from staff and management. Truly a sweet dining experience. You won’t be disappointed!  Thank you Anna and Corrine. You made our visit to The Bar Room one to be treasured.

Bar Room is a very pleasant old world style place to grab lunch. We were there for the first time to get a quick bite while doing some shopping. I'm a big wedge salad fan and the one served was outstanding. My wife had the pork buns and those were fantastic too. The sangria was delicious. Everyone has their act together and the ambiance with the large skylight and hand painted mural made the whole experience excellent. Service was thoughtful and yes, we had a chance to chat it up with Anna although she was not our server. So friendly, says hello to everyone and really makes you feel welcome. Kudos to the management for putting together an excellent establishment. Looking forward to our next visit.

Perfect place!! Great location, ambiance and the service is outstanding. Corinne, Stacy and Anna could not have been friendlier. Not to mention the cocktails that we had were out of this world!! For brunch, our table had the nova toast, chilaquiles and chicken & waffles. Three very different plates, but equally delicious and well executed. That’s no easy feat!! We’ll be returning soon!

Love the ambiance here, old world speakeasy feel with a classy dining room in back with green leather seats, chandeliers and lots of natural light. They have happy hour on weekdays from 4-6pm at the bar with $10 glasses of wine and cocktails. It gets very loud during this hour so if you're going on a first date I'd recommend avoiding this time frame so you can actually hear the other person without having to scream. We split the pork buns and Brussels sprouts, both of which were phenomenal. Portion sizes are big so we didn't need to order anything else. Will definitely be back!

formatted_address: 106 W 73rd St, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Arte Cafe

reviews.text: On God, the best sauce I've ever had in my entire life! They were very accommodating in providing gluten free pasta for me. The atmosphere, wait staff, and food were all excellent.

I made an appointment at Open Table and asked to sit outside. Upon arrival, I was told that the outdoor seating is on a first come, first served basis. It is not crowded, so we got a table we wanted. There is also a beautiful outdoor space behind. The indoor atmosphere is warm and welcoming.

Love this place! The staff was attentive, welcoming, and accommodating. They were kind and were quick to bring out the food. The food was delicious, and the quality and presentation were amazing. I will definitely be returning in the future.

Great find!  Neighborhood restaurant, but they readily gave us a table. Nice service, super food and menu, with desserts to seal the deal!   Enjoyed the meal, surprised there was no cream for the coffee or salt and pepper at the table...else a wonderful experience!

Amazing service by the great Wilson! The watermelon cocktail was to die for. Will go back soon to have many more. For my taste the food could do with a little more flavor (fresh herbs perhaps?), but that's the only comment I have.

formatted_address: 334 E 73rd St, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: Casa de Montecristo

reviews.text: Holy was amazing. She broke down cigars in 2 minutes and it was definitly worth while as I am a new comer to the community of cigars and had no idea what to smoke in that humidor. They have an amazing selection and I even took home some accessories so I can start my personal collection at home.

A well stocked humidor, like this Diamond Crown Natural my hubby is smoking, is only one of the many brands, heritage and boutique, you'll find at Cigar Inn, along with a helpful and knowledge staff to guide you. But if you want to walk in the humidor solo, no problem. They're not like some other places, where paranoid staff think you may be there to lift some stogies. FYI, the vent system at the 73rd and First Avenue branch is down, so you won't be able to smoke there. We were told it will be up soon; best to call before if you plan to buy and puff there.
Great place for a smoke. They have a well stocked walk in humidor with a descent variety of cigars. Prices are regular Manhattan prices. Ventilation could be better though.

Fantastic cigar hideout on the upper east side.  Super friendly staff along with a great humidor and very reasonable prices.  Best part is BYOB while you enjoy a leisurely smoke. They provide the ice and glasses too.  Plenty of comfy seating, several TVs and clean bathrooms. Bonus is that they’re open late. My living room away from home!
Basic knowledge about cigars couldn't be found from the staff

formatted_address: 5 Beekman St, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: Temple Court

reviews.text: Good atmosphere and stylish decor. Staff is attentive and friendly. Food is well prepared and tasty. This time I visited during restaurant week and they had a special prix fixe menu of starter, entree, and dessert for $42. There were plenty of choices as well as the opportunity to upgrade and add on items. The drinks were good too and they gave a rotating cocktail menu with some regular staples available as well.
Gorgeous decor. The environment is added to by the live jazz band. Such an enjoyable experience. Sunday breakfast and brunch here is lovely. An ideal way to start off the week.
Nice place, with unique atmosphere. I liked the food, and live musiс during my Saturday brunch (they have life music every Saturday and Sunday 1-3pm). Definitely will come back!

Superior ambiance and decoration from the floor to the ceiling. The entrance is pleasantly scented with, according to staff, a proprietary fragrance. Lighting is fairly dim. The bathroom feels as if it's a rustic wine cellar. The tables are strong and firm. The seating is spacious to the thin, and accomodating to the more voluminous. 

Excellent food. Every dish I've tried has been cooked, spiced, and presented just right. Staff is friendly and generally non-intrusive. Almost everything here is of the highest caliber. 

Great place for an upscale dinner with a coworker, old friend, or long time date. I've come here multiple times, however I have yet to return with the intent/budget to go all out at once with their tasting menu.

My only issue has been that the hostess clearly treated me differently after declining coat check. (I'm not saying Temple Court does this, however restaurants seem to bumble and abuse fine coats only to expect tips).

Either way, this place has been outstanding since their Fowler and Wells days. Definitely recommended!
Great ambiance! Food is up to par but I was more attracted to the bar area than the food menu. This would be a great place to meet friends for a drink or two!

formatted_address: 536 W 30th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Via Trenta Pizzoteca

reviews.text: This pizza sets the standard for artisanal pizza in NYC. Arguably on par if not better than Patsy's or other well known pizza restaurants. It already looks good in pictures. The actual taste is even better. You don't have to believe me. Try it yourself.

I went to this place in August 2018 to try their pearl harbor drink and ever since I have been here more than 10times and took all my new york visiting friends here. The cocktails are amazing and the truffle fries are an amazing match. Their crab cakes are tasty and the Cauliflower tacos are made to perfection I love the cocktail menu and the place is busy over the weekends and going early will help you get a table.

Thích
Very good Neapolitan-style pizza for about ten bucks. Quick friendly service.
The waitress were really nice to me, and the chef helped me out with a vegan pizza with no problem! Great service!
Nice hole in the wall Italian place, wondering if you can sit up in the gallery which is so cool.

formatted_address: 221 S 1st St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Tabaré

reviews.text: I am in love with this place and every time I go, it does not disappoint me. I completely love the neighborhood, it is a very cozy restaurant, amazing to visit in the summer and sit in the patio. lovely place food is great.
Awesome ambiance, good food and even better service.  it is an intimate setting and the lighting reflects the mood.  Will come back and highly recommend.

Sat at the back and the music was extremely loud, the place was so hot. Service was great I’d say! I ordered mussels which were just okay. We also loved the steak. When we first got there, we were told we needed to have a reservation and were not even given a time that a table would be available. We took a chance and tried again 30 minuted later and there was a table. Odd.

Went there on a Monday evening at around 630 pm, was pretty empty with just one other table occupied.. Was happy hour so ended up getting a a bottle of wine, a cucumber mint Vodka cocktail and some appetizers... It's also got an intimate date vibe

We had 2 fantastic dinners here during our stay in Brooklyn. The food quality was excellent for the price, the service was fantastic and friendly and the atmosphere was quaint and cozy. We will definitely visit again when we are in NYC next time.

formatted_address: 45 E 33rd St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: The Ainsworth Midtown

reviews.text: AMAZING experience! Our bartender (sadly, I can't remember if his name was Jacob or Jason) was just wonderful. Drinks refilled promptly, two-bite check done, food came out in a timely manner, everything was delicious!! Especially LOVED the bottomless brunch deal. Will definitely be returning when back in NYC. LOVE LOVE LOVE!

Came in last Friday with a group of friends while visiting from Georgia. I’ve been to this establishment before and I didn’t receive good service. Having to wait so long just to be asked what I wanted was crazy. This being my second time ever at this restaurant I’m glad to say I received the absolute best service from Nina the bartender. She’s the only reason  I’d come back! She was quick with the drinks, attentive to our needs, and she gave us amazing service. She completely changed my view on this restaurant just with the way she carried herself while taking care of us and multiple other customers.

Typical American Restaurant with fair prices. Especially in New York the prices here are pretty attractive. A Rib eye steak cost $ 40 and a Stella Artois, nicely on temperature they bring you for $ 8.

The sound level is very pleasant, around 55 FB which enables good conversations without shouting.

It’s pretty spacious and the tables are not too close to each other so you have privacy.

The service is good although maybe a bit too fast. They brought me the check without asking for desert or another beer.

This was a great find. Very nice decor.  Pleasant, good wait staff. Really good food. I had the tuna tataki which was very tasty.  Really liked the flavors.  My friends liked their flatbread and Cobb salad. It didn't take long to get served.  There was also a bar and several TV screens with sports events.
Great Terace available and I suggest you have their Mac & Cheese Burger

formatted_address: 9 E 37th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Fine & Rare

reviews.text: Had dinner here last night and really enjoyed it. The service was very friendly, ambiance was great too. We loved the cocktails (ideal husband was my favorite), and their burger was delicious. They also have this awesome, very instagrammable dessert - the sphere. Totally recommend dining here.

What a lovely experience on a Friday night. Our waiter was helpful and attentive. Cocktail menu is extremely creative and the cocktails are delicious. The wine list is extensive. Food was really well presented, and scrumptious. Dessert, the beautiful pomegranate chocolate mousse, was divine.
The cocktails & nightly live music in an elegant setting with a working fireplace is truly ' Fine & Rare'. The food is not quite at the same level. Go for the impressive drinks & stay for the show.
Superb spirits selection. Food is very good too. Jazz stage is also nice.

The best seating , I think, by the fireplace) that would complete an amazing atmosphere of live jazz , great drinks and service this place provides! 
Check their drink menu! Whiskey lovers , that would be a paradise for you! Few lists dedicated to whiskey only ))
Plus, we’ve been told , that you can buy a bottle , and it’ll be reserve for you. So, you can come back and enjoy this bottle later. That’s amazing !

I saw at least three ladders that waiters use to climb at the top of the bars) so , I guess, there d be always a secure place for your bottle )
The drinks are delicious, and waiters provide you with accurate information about them.
Jazz program is always different. Check their web site for the schedule.
Food is good, as well. We had sea bass and truffle risotto ( although , you can have it without truffles , or clams could be added. Up to you). 

Octopus appetizer served in a really nice way.
Definitely try their peach gelato, or chocolate ice cream for desert ! Amazing !  

And ! Be careful with your reservation. I’ve been told not just once , that they wait just 15 min , and then can give your table somebody else.
Enjoy!

formatted_address: 132 E 39th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Sam's Place

reviews.text: Absolutely amazing local Italian spot with a very cozy atmosphere. You're welcomed with a massive heaping of bread 🍞 and room temperature butter 👌.  I had the Pesto Risotto with Shrimp 🦐 and the Tortellini Alla Panna and honestly couldn't tell you which was better.  The food was honestly incredible and we left beyond stuffed.
Cozy little establishment serving an authentic NY dining experience. Food was delicious and perfectly cooked.

Had a meeting over lunch at Sam's Place. As a long time visitor to NY I have to say it's the quintessential NY lunch experience. Old school decor, great food with NY sized portions and NY service with just the right amount of 'confident attitude'

What a delightful Italian restaurant! The service was excellent, the host, an awesome professional, made sure that every detail was as authentic as one can expect and the food as Italian as can be. The atmosphere is of an old, cosy, family type restaurant that you sit next to friends to enjoy a happy meal. A superb Italian restaurant in New York!

Sam's Place is pretty decent.  I thought I was being healthy getting the Chicken Giardiniera, but it turns out it's smothered in butter.  Still, the flavor was good, and most of the people I went with enjoyed their food.  If I'm looking for an Italian spot in the area that isn't super expensive, I'd consider this place.

formatted_address: 116 10th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Avenue

reviews.text:
This club is on point.
There was a nice mixed crowd.
Nice light, and sound system.
The DJ played all the hits.
No problems with the bouncers.
The staff was professional.
Everyone had a great time.

The door staff at this venue are phenomenal. Chris is the best bouncer I’ve ever met in my entire life, so charming and funny. Welcoming face and great vibes every time. I feel like I’m at home every time I’m here. Music is great and it’s always a fun experience. I recommend this place to everyone!!
Never a dull moment. Consistently great DJ lineup. Best staff. Bottle parades a must. Don’t hate if you can’t get in. Try again next time.
Rude staff, and over priced. It’s TINYYYY from the inside and not worth your time or money

There's only one small bar. The place is set-up for table service so prepare to wait for a drink if you don't have a bottle.

To guys: Recommended if you're willing to commit your night to one location. $200-$300 bar tab to be collected at the door. This will secure your stay. 

To ladies: Hit up a promoter and play groupie.

formatted_address: 119 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Odessa

reviews.text: I get to eat here a lot since I work nearby. I got to say the service is always fantastic and they keep the place well organized regularly. Prices are reasonable and they serve large portions.

This place is awesome. They've got cheap diner classics as well as some Ukrainian staples. It's quiet, unassuming, never to busy, the perfect amount of people watching... It's great. 

It's a 24/7 diner that you might not even notice on the street. Perfect for a late night snack or a meetup with friends. 

You might even recognize this spot from the Netflix show Russian Dolls.

This place is an institution.  neighborhood classic.  Never left here unhappy.   Great value for the dollar.  Solid American fare.   Nice people.  What Alphabet City is all about.  Hit it for breakfast. Go to work late. Start your day right
This place is such a throwback!! Go there now, before this icon of Old New York disappears. And order the blintzes. Amazing. Good coffee too.
Old feel,  like when I was younger. Loved it.

formatted_address: 269 Norman Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11222, USA
name: The Place Bar & Lounge

reviews.text: They changed the name to The Kingsland. Place is waaay better now!
Decent bar. Not a bad venue in the back. The live music has surprisingly good sound. Bathrooms were pretty gross and flooded without properly closing locks.

An exceptional venue that has a very reasonable price, a good selection of beers, and makes pizzas for your event all night. The staff is incredibly warm, friendly, and accommodating. I look forward to coming here.

The one located in Bridelwood is very good. I love the burgers however salads are fresh and tasty.Last time I tryed the Grig style with a turkey patty on top.
Not to many calories! But I couldn't order dessert with more than 1000 calories.Impossible!!!
Good food, easy service. Pleasant enjoyable atmosphere

formatted_address: 342 E 6th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Kindred

reviews.text: Just like Ruffian, every wine I’ve had at Kindred is super interesting. And the cocktails are great. And Charlotte is an awesome bartender - welcoming, knowledgeable, and great at describing the wines. I’ve yet to try the food other than the smoked olives, which remind me of, in a good way, eating small hot dogs.
My favorite Brunch spot in NYC- Great team, good vibes, delicious food and cocktails.

Kindred is an awesome addition to the East Village dining scene and it is my new favorite wine bar in the city. They serve a great selection of natural wines and the staff was extremely friendly and knowledgeable. I didn't try any this time but they also have a very creative looking cocktail menu. The food options were great and could work for light bites or a full dinner. It has a super cozy ambiance and is a great spot for a date or dinner/drinks with friends. Highly recommend it!

My fiancé and I just had one of the best meals of our lives here! Everything we ate was the perfect mix of simple and novel, with incredibly refined and complex flavors and pairings. You can tell a huge amount of love and consideration has gone into their menu, and they have impeccably-sourced ingredients. Their wine is also so firrreeee and so are their non-alcoholic drink options. We would 10/10 or 11/10 recommend this place to everyone we know.

Our family of four had a wonderful time at Kindred. The food was delicious, fresh, interesting and flavorful. The drinks are unusual and fun. The atmosphere is intimate and cozy, the staff is super welcoming and the service is great.

formatted_address: 5124 Fort Hamilton Pkwy, Brooklyn, NY 11219, USA
name: DJ Sabroso

formatted_address: 60 W 129th St, New York, NY 10027, USA
name: Lenox Coffee Roaster

reviews.text:
A neighborhood favorite! The coffees are always great, the staff is friendly, and the atmosphere is chill. You can easily get some work done here, come alone and meet new people, or gather with a friend or two. 

I appreciate the latte art effort with to go orders as well!

This is very cordial, and warm setting. I had a cappuccino with soy milk.  My efficacious coffee was just the right potency to cure that mid-day slump feeling. There was a young lady with dreads who helped me to choose a pastry that didn't have nuts in it; this was so help, otherwise I would be having an allergic reaction. The ambiance is very comfortable, low-key, and welcoming. I brought my friend, and she enjoyed the vibe as well. This is a great place to just unwind.
We had a vanilla latte and an oat milk latte with a brownie. It was really great and would come back for sure. One of the best coffee places in Harlem.

Nice little coffee spot that I just happened to stumble by the other day. The area keeps on getting nicer and nicer and nicer. There’s a little spot makes a nice cappuccino and offers you a nice environment to get some work done if need be. If you’ve got the time check out the Jazz Museum next-door

Yass! Affogato here is love! I mean, what's not to love? Normally only a shot of espresso and a scoop of ice cream, this abrogator takes the cake and adds a waffle cone on top of your drink to go. Their coffees and toasts are also of the tasty variety.

formatted_address: 1238 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10065, USA
name: Silver Star

reviews.text: I had just came out from Memorial Sloan Kattering & I was very hungry since I had no lunch today. Silver Star Dinner happen to be on my way to the bus stop. Went in had me a veggie burger was pretty good and a side order of onion rings which happen to be very thin I believe they were the frozen kind. But they were ok since I had no lunch today. The place is clean and they were courteous. But not a place I would go often.
Good service and no wait on a Sunday morning which was great. It's a cozy spot the food, while fine, is nothing I would write home about.
Great place. Delishous food.
Consistent when making your food. Fast and great service.
Grate food and service in old style NYC Diner/Restaurant with extensive menu. A little pricy however.

formatted_address: 11 W 53rd St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Terrace Cafe

reviews.text:
Loved the experience. 
I was afraid to visit here because of low ratings. It exceeds my expectations. 

Staff are attentive and friendly. Knowledgeable. 

Food are pretty good. 
We tried 6 different dishes and there are more to try so we will definitely come back. 

One thing, hopefully they will increase the selections of desserts in the future.
Loved my sliders and the apple dessert. Very busy -‘s tightly packed. Small portions for the price, but I did enjoy.

Super pricey for a cafe, but it's all about the atmosphere. Nice to take a break from viewing the art and grab a quick bite to eat without having to leave and come back. Food was delicious and you got a decent amount.

Great airy restaurant. Of the three restaurants in MoMA, this one offers waiter service and isn't as expensive as the other waiter service restaurant downstairs. Dishes are decent, views are great. A great place to take a break while at the museum.

I was looking forward to the new MoMa and then enjoy a light lunch , they should open at 11AM but they were late . Because I was alone could not get a table , I wasn’t happy but wasn’t big deal I ordered the mushroom polenta which came cold. The waitress was nice , actually she keep trying to have a conversation while I really want to enjoy my warm polenta. The constant intervention by the waitress make me left without having coffee. View stunning food not really

formatted_address: 45 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Aziza Cafe and Lounge

reviews.text: Nice hookah lounge with a good private feel to it, would definitely recommend as a spot to bring your significant other. Owner is very nice with good music selection.

First ones here at 5:30pm on a Sunday. 

Thought it would be a lots more packed. 

I have to say it is a VERY small place, but very clean and nice. 

Great service and hookah. 

Ordered a bottle of Merlot and it was amazing. Only $35. Not bad at all. 

The have many hookah flavor starting from $15 to $35. 

Didn’t see many options of cocktails, so if you’re fine with wine or beer, good hookah, this is the place. Tinyy restroom too

Nice vibe and good music. 

Best hookah lounge in this area for sure. 

Highly recommended!

One of the only places I've ever been where the owner's recommended a less expensive Sheesha :).

Pros:
- Great selection of Sheesa.
- The flavor was strong enough to last for 45 minutes which is not bad at all.
- The owner/ server was proactive enough to keep replacing the coal every 40 minutes [which is a pretty big deal in the Sheesha business]
- Noise-free and meant for smaller groups.
- They have a few vegetarian options as well

Cons:
- A tad too small maybe. Would be congested in case of larger groups.

None the less, certainly a place to visit if you're trying to grab a drink/ Sheesha with a couple of friends

This places is horrible DO NOT GO I was racially profiled. Me and my girlfriend called 6 hours before going to the place. He didn’t say anything about having a reservation. We came and saw how we looked he completely denied us coming in and said reservation only without asking for our names or anything so how would he know if we had a reservation or not. Then denied that we called him and when we showed that we did and then he started making excuses to still not let us in. Then he went to the back made us wait outside in the cold then want to let us in and once we in he keeps talking to my girlfriend in her face continue making excuse then told us that he doesn’t have to serve us . DO NOT GO HERE
Nice and private place just make sure you make a reservation prior to arriving.

formatted_address: 277 E 10th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Brindle Room

reviews.text: Let me start off by saying my Sebastian's Steakhouse Burger was delicious. It's a very no frills burger but it's got great flavor and crunch so if you're looking for a place with a great burger I'd recommend it. I also had the baked cauliflower mac and cheese which was tasty although my girlfriend had the salmon which she said was too salty. The one thing I wouldn't come here for is great service. The waiter/bartender was curt and too the point bordering on monosyllabic. Obviously with my rating that wasn't super important to me but it was worth mentioning.

So I went Friday March 6th and the hostess really made our experience. I didn't catch her name but I want her to get props. We waited a little long for the reservation and had to be seated at the bar so she made it up to us with beers and some free wings. Let me tell you, those wings were amazing and the habanero sauce was like the perfect sauce to me. Spicy and flavorful. The burger was simple but it was seriously quality. Definitely check this place out.
A truly wonderful burger, kind staff, quaint decor, and cold beer. I am a very happy customer.

Went on a Sunday night after not having much luck elsewhere, and saw this and gave it a go and wow!
Super quick service and really friendly relaxed staff; went for the steakhouse burger and it was delicious!
Absolutely melt in the mouth meat and simple, just a bit of cheese and caramelized onions, so so good! That and a side of fries and we were set.

What an ace little find!

Decent spot for food. Not cheap though. 

Friendly staff help out in this tight squeezed restaurant. Waits don't seem to be that long even with the limited seating.

formatted_address: 248 W 55th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Vida Verde

reviews.text: Vida Verde was very accommodating to my birthday brunch yesterday. The hour and a half time alotted to my birthday brunch didn’t start running until My entire party was seated and that was very kind of them. We were just drinking and talking in the bar section until my entire party arrived. The food platters were incredible in terms of portion and quality of taste. The music was dope as well in terms of the selection and volume where it wasn’t loud enough where we had to scream. The interior was very festive and had bright colors. Brian was a very helpful coordinator and I had no problem whatsoever with my brunch. I can most definitely see myself coming back to this place whether it’s for a brunch or just a simple outing.
Took two friends here for their birthdays. Great ambiance. Wonderful service. Great food. I recommend the fried fish tacos. Will definitely be back. Thank you.
Outstanding guacamole made fresh, right at the table!! Good food. Great service. Very good, uptempo vibe, would definitely come back. Only concern, it is a little loud.
Very lively Mexican restaurant with colorful decor and the music turned up! Fun place for drinks and appetizers or a group dinner. The food was tasty and the margaritas were very good.

Peppy and vibrant ambience. Loved the feel of the place.
Being a vegetarian, found decent veggie options and the food was better than what I have had at many Mexican restaurants.

formatted_address: 355 W 16th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Philippe Chow

reviews.text: Chinese restaurant as nightclub. Nicely prepared basic American Chinese food, pretty ordinary. If you are older than about 28, pray to be seated in the side room without 150 decibel music throbbing. Not sure how anyone can enjoy a meal in front of the speakers, much less enjoy a conversation. Nice decor and the smartly dressed staff make you feel like you’re somewhere special.

I celebrated a lifer's birthday here on Saturday. There's a really nice atmosphere that feel upscale. I had the Chilean Sea Bass and a Dunkel. The fish could have been cooked a bit longer, but everything was very tasty overall. We had a really nice time.

Visited during restaurant week for dinner. My new favorite dinner dish is Beijing Chicken, it was incredible! Three of us went and we each ordered 3 different appetizers, entrees and desserts so we could taste a variety of things. Everything was amazing. Also had the filet mignon with string beans, pork belly, chicken satay, shrimp satay and dumplings. Will definitely go back soon for sure!
Fun restaurant! Good food, well prepared and huge portions. The music does get loud and they turn down the lights like a nightclub. A little loud but otherwise good food and great service.

Recommendations: Pekking Duck, Shrimp Dumplings

Hybrid of fun and classy vibe. I would recommend before a night out in the city, birthday, or date. 

The Baked Alaska is also quite a show, but the ice cream was over-frozen

formatted_address: 225 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Bistro Cassis

reviews.text: This is doubtless one of the coolest place to eat in the region. Always when I come to this place I am exceedingly pleased. They keep their high  standard service and the topmost level of food  they offer. You always win with this restaurant. Highly  recommended.

Way overpriced for very average food.  Service was however very courteous.  Waiter was very friendly and pleasant.  Beware however that they charge for water without asking whether you'd like bottled or tap.  This is common at several restaurants in this area so the waiter isn't necessarily at fault.  Would not return here due to the price.

I went with a friend who lives in the Upper West Side, but had never ventured into Cassis. We were there for "brunch," but don't expect millennial brunch scene if that's what you're looking for. We ordered two appetizers each, plus crepes. My favorite thing I had was the French onion soup. The croissant and jelly that came out first was also delicious. I'd pop back in for the soup on a cold day, for sure!

🤮🤮I had the worse experience ever in that place. I went to have lunch with my friend and our toddlers. When I got there my friend wasn’t arrive yet and my child start cry because she was excited to see them. We just came from a 30 days trip so she was missing them and instead somebody come to try to help me if I need something maybe water for her or what they asked to step out. I couldn’t stay there because my child was crying.My friend was coming with her stroller and that horrible man went out to tell her we weren’t welcome there and  we had leave. It never happened to me before and I  was chocked . Look likes they never were child or had one.🤮🤮

 ****Moms we aren’t welcome on that place ***Just letting you know 🤮🤮
Simply great! The escargot are really great! The lamb was the best ever!!! It was all divine. Gogogogo

formatted_address: 53 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Gatsby's

reviews.text: Very cool bar! They have good cocktails, small bites and a great selection of beers. The bartender Jackie is awesome. And all the girls working there are cool and hardworking.
Went on a Friday night for a couple drinks with a friend. I was happy to see it wasn't too packed. And the place had a very cozy atmosphere; Especially in the back.
Perfect place. Kind and polite staff. Good beers on tap.
My Irish coffee was good, not great. Food menu could offer much more variation to the international traveler.  The chicken salad was good, and their babaganoush was outstanding!
Good service nice vibe

formatted_address: 289 10th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Marquee New York

reviews.text: Went there with my friends for my birthday and we had a blast. The music was so perfect. They played the old and new music we really like. We had an amazing time. Everything was in order. We did not wait a long time to get in or drinks. Great times.

Great club with stunning dance floor. Smaller back bar area with booths and appreciate the storage for bags and purses so we could dance! Drinks were ok. Music mix was good. Definitely a fun club to hit up if you know a promoter.

Ten dollars for water. Not even a full size water bottle. My boyfriend broke out in sweat and fainted on the ground. Security was nice and didn’t kick us out thankfully. I’d give 5 stars if this place wasn’t so crowded and a rip off.

My BF has low blood pressure and faints at needles. But ten dollars for water to cool him down? Ridiculous. We should sue.
Amazing sound system and bass. Get a table!

The only upscale thing about this club is prices. I went there for 2020th New Years Eve to see  DJ Kaskade performance . Everything beside the music and special effects was pretty disappointing. It felt like the club was filled multiple times over its capacity. Security was pushing people like an animals to get by. I’ve never got myself a drink or used a bathroom simply because it was to tight to move through the dance floor. And yes , I’m aware that New Years Eve night is tough and crowd can be unpredictable. However , you can definitely control how many people let inside the venue and how to treat guests properly to make them feel at least semi welcome .  3 out of 5 just for good music .

formatted_address: 313 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Piccolo Cafe

reviews.text: Ambient atmosphere, cozy vibes and good food. Perfect find for the evening. We got artichoke pasta and grilled octopus and it didn't disappoint. Bartender seemed like an owner of a place, at least he had really chilled vibes about him. I would gladly come back to this place.

Nice, warm Italian flavors, cosy place with few seats, reasonable pricing. We had the meatball spaghetti and the parmigiana, which very quite tasty in combination with the Montepulciano wine. All in all, a nice Italian treat for couples or the whole family.

We stopped in for dinner on a whim and were absolutely pleased. Cozy, little italian restaurant/ cafe with an old-school feel. I enjoyed the most delicious ravioli dish I've EVER had; stuffed with beef short rib, topped with an amazing sauce and freshly shaved truffle. The owner made menu recommendations and was delightful. I would visit again and highly recommend.
Very relaxing, locals favorite. Pasta is classic.
Great little chef-owned restaurant. The food was on point. the atmosphere was fun and the prices were very reasonable. I will go back.

formatted_address: 184 Prince St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Piccola Cucina

reviews.text: This place did not disappoint! A very good place to eat! Fast and efficient service; especially considering the herds of people that got on the elevator headed up to the restaurant. The view from the balcony is lovely and overlooks the ice skating arena. Best of all were the desserts we ordered to go. The Cheesecake Factory lives up to the hype for sure.

The name says it all... this kitchen probably has a total of 8m2 ... but the working space for the cooks is more in the range of 4m2 😳!!
These 4!! guys are real magicians !!
Food was delicious and staff friendly. 
Make sure you come early or make a reservation because there’s only 30 seats.
Definitely try this place if you’re in Manhattan

Amazing appetizers, pasta, wine, and service. Best Italian food in New York City. Don’t go anywhere else before you eat here. Real, authentic Italian cuisine! Make a reservation though, they don’t take walk ins. Only about 10 tables in each restaurant!

Food here was amazing. The ravioli a ragu was amazing. It was literally one of the best pastas I ever had anywhere I've been. Make sure you order the canolli. It was also the best I ever had. There's very little room, so make a reservation and be ready to be touching the party you come with. The servers are really nice and funny. I would really recommend this place.

Partner and I have been to this location and the one on Spring Street. Always an amazing experience. The small spaces create an unique and familiar ambiance. The service is on point. I believe this place brings the best of Italy in town!

formatted_address: 1359 Broadway, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Wolfgang's Steakhouse - Broadway NYC

reviews.text: Impeccable service without feeling like you are being pressured. Fantastic wine selection with a brilliant sommelier who assisted with choosing the perfect wine to accompany the porterhouse. Amazing quality of steak as well, faultless!
