We've been to other Wolfgang locations all over Manhattan and as with others, this one did not disappoint, taking in fact that this is the newest Wolfgangs in Manhattan.
We were seated in timely manner, greeted by hostesses and managers who gave us table right on time.
Service was excellent, waiters were friendly, with a touch of humor, and food was just amazing!
Sides are pretty big and porterhouse is a must !
Will definitely come back, as this one is closest to us !
Keep it up,

Kevin.

I would not recommend this steakhouse based solely on the service. I took my family in and was stereotyped from the very beginning. We weren't dressed as nice as most of the other customers. Our server was very abrupt and  rude while the table behind us with more affluent looking people were treated like royalty. He certainly did not spend any more time at our table than he had to. We needed our check split and we didnt tell him until he brought the check...which was our fault for waiting so late to tell him...but he first said he wouldn't do it and then did ...but acted as if we punched him in the stomach and split the check as we asked. I will not be back.
Seriously best Wolfgang’s of them all so Th rock star staff and of course awesome food and wine. Love this place!

I Think was a fair experience. I went with high expectations and it is no different than any other Steaks House around. Has a name and It is  a little overhype
I guess I will stick to Frankie and Jhonnie.

formatted_address: 683 Grand St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: LP & Harmony

reviews.text: If I had known that this place had pool tables, I would've bought my sticks along. The bartenders are cool and the place has a great vibe. The pool tables are fun and friendly. I think I found my new water trough.
The BEST spot in town as far as vibes, pool tables, back patio, music, and of course the owners, staff, and patrons! My go-to whenever I'm in town.
Great Friday atmosphere. Good variety of drinks and good prices. Friday poker after 8pm. Will definitely return!

This is a mad bar. Stopped in to use the bathroom and spent 6 hours here for my 40th birthday here and I will never forget it. Such a good night and a huge mix of people. Awesome barman. Just a crazy night. Deffo take a visit.
Nice tables

formatted_address: 245 W 29th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: OCabanon

reviews.text: A great choice if you have a big group. A lot of appetizers/boards for sharing, a great of selection of mains and wine too. If you’re looking for something more chill with one other person, you can also share an appetizer and drink on the high tables near the entrance.
Great place for decent French food.  Everything you order here is pretty good.  Highly recommended

Came here through a Pulsd discount and I was pleasantly surprised by how good the food was. We got the Brie as the appetizer with steak as the main.

The Brie was absolutely amazing. Incredibly tasty and we kept on asking for second and third of the bread just to have more. It was cooked to the point where we still got to enjoy the tasty top.

The steak was also cooked to perfection. The potatoes on the side were also incredible. Lastly, they have this type of steak sauce that paired amazingly with the actual meat.

Overall, this was a great experience and I'm happy I was able to find this diamond in the rough. Would definitely be back!

Well my 5 starts are mainly for the French atmosphere. This is "the" French place to go to when there are any type of French celebrations. I work for a French company and the name OCabanon is very common ;). Went there for the European Cup and it was a very special experience. Felt like being in France. Food was good too!
Had a awesome experience in this spot with my friend. The food comes out rapidly and the service is just great. Prices are affordable.

formatted_address: 6th ave and, W 14th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: House of Intimate

formatted_address: 53 Scott Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11237, USA
name: Studio 51

formatted_address: 808 Park Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11206, USA
name: Hoosier Fight Club

formatted_address: 41 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Rabbit House

reviews.text: Amazing food and creative presentation. Cozy and intimate setting. Portions were perfect and we enjoyed every single bite!

A hidden Japanese tapas place near the Grand St station. 

Chef and the staff are great, and they know their sake.
Their foods are tasty from black edamame to ribs. Taco is tasty too, but ribs are especially tasty. Please try! They also have specials too. 

They also have exhibit by local artists every month, so you will get to enjoy art while eating. 

They are open late, and I frequently stop by with friends after dinner for a late snack and drink.
Excellent food, great staff.  Happy hour sake and beer.  All good.  Food is not really japanese, more like fusion. Some menu are not japanese at all. Excellent food nevertheless.

Delicious Japanese fusion dishes. We ordered the Appetizer Combo, the Cod and the Pot-aux-Feux. The cod was very fresh and we loved the pot-aux-feux. Great selection of drinks and the appetizer combo goes perfectly well with the drinks. The staff is all Japanese and they are very nice. Very cozy place but it’s small so I would recommend to make a reservation.

Our meal here was really something special. The restaurant is very small - kind of an up and coming place - such a great find and exactly what I love about dining in Nee York. We went on a Wednesday evening and were sat at the bar immediately. I believe there were just two women working the kitchen and bar, personally churning out edible art on a plate for their guests. If you’re looking for something different this is the place. Really interesting flavor experience that I feel so fortunate to have had.

formatted_address: 38 W 39th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Calle Dao Bryant Park

reviews.text: Amazing concept of a Chinese Cuban hybrid restaurant in honor of the Chinatown in Havana. Really great idea. Staff and bartender were excellent and very professional. Nice happy hour where I tried Cubano sliders with fried plantain patties instead of bread. Great drinks and really fun decoration inside featuring old artwork and other Cuban style appointments. I will definitely be back. They also serve brunch so that must be very fun as well.

This is a cute place with character and tasty food. The service is good as well. I got the salmon..the sauce is very spicy but full of flavor and my friend got the tofu stir fry entree. We ordered tostones which were a little dry and lacking flavor but the dipping sauce they gave was good..just needed to come with more of it. They offer some authentic and unique options. Overall I would recommend this place and would go back again.

Good food - great portions and delicious flavors. Big fan of their take on the French toast and the salads. Their service was good too. Unfortunately, we did not like their fries. Also, the restaurant is really really loud, so would not recommend unless you’re going for bottomless brunch with a large crew.

The service is amazing. The staff really makes you feel at home and is attentive to your needs and wants! I will definitely be back for another date breakfast. The bottomless is from 11am-4pm even on weekdays for $26 (food not included). The selection for the bottomless is varied and will capture different taste buds. The food was amazing and I definitely enjoyed the pops that arrived at the end of the bottomless were the perfect end to my exploration of the city. If you are looking for a clean, happy, organic, and yummy experience please visit this restaurant! Hope to see you there!

Great ambience with a romantic atmosphere and wonderful Cuban music playing in the background. I recently visited Little Havana in Miami and this place in New York City just made me feel that I am back to Little Havana. Their happy hours are very affordable and the service is top class

formatted_address: 56 Willoughby St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Dining Room

reviews.text: Great food at reasonable prices. Amazing services. Best place to meet with your friend and to chill. Sitting section was comfortable and beautiful. I had spend a great time. Staff were nice.
Great bartenders, food is damn good. Chef's menu is particularly imaginative.

Fast and friendly service, the Bartender Katie was great and super accommodating. Nice place right by the train station. I had some tasty wings and watched Some Football.  All in all in was a very good Sunday. I'll be back again this week.
Nice Bar attached to a Sushi bar, what more can you ask for? And the sushi is fresh and tasty.
Public meeting place for mature adults.  Serene atmosphere.

formatted_address: 35 E 76th St, New York, NY 10075, USA
name: Café Carlyle

reviews.text: The restaurant is so perfect for a relaxed night out. We were made to feel welcome as soon as we came through the door and the atmosphere was amazing! Wood Allen is the best ever!
Incredible experience. A must if you are a jazz fan. Gorgeous dinner. Monday night with Woddy Allen and jazz band
Had a great time here in Cafe Carlyle. Loved their cozy, laid back style with some lovely entertainment. They also serve some delicious food choices in their menu. Will surely come back.
I really like it.  Intimate setting to hear good music..
Superb service, good food and wonderful music

formatted_address: 65 W 70th St, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Shalel Lounge

reviews.text: Cozy little hidden spot, will definitely be going back for a couple drinks. I had the lamb burgers last time and they were really well cooked and seasoned, might be ordering them again.

You will not regret getting down these stairs and find out more about this place... (if you don’t pay attention you might actually not even see this place as there is only their menu on the outside)... the decoration is nice and the vibe is cool - kinda romantic so wouldn’t come here with a bud - the different rooms make it very unique - the music is good - the food is also pretty good - we have been here two times now. Drinks are a bit expensive but I guess normal prices for NYC - although the wine price is pretty fair. Highly recommended.
had a great late night intimate diner with a date and another couple. delicious all around , you can't got wrong. chicken kebab was great. amazing hummus plate

This place was absolutely amazing! Beautiful and cozy, romantic and comfortable.  It was an intimate experience without being too stuffy or dressy. To lounge and nibble with your love, it's pretty nice.

My partner and I decided to try moroccan cuisine and spontaneously ran into this hidden gem. At first I was a bit skeptical, as the entrance was very dark and in a basement. However, the pedals running down the staircase made it very inviting. The moment we walked into the restaurant, I knew we were going to have a memorable experience. Every table and room had candles and pedals around it. The decor also had a hint of rustic and antique to it. We sat in a semi-private room for two, right behind the waterfall. It was a very intimate setting. Everything from the food, drinks and dessert were great! I highly recommend this place for a romantic date fellas!

formatted_address: Freeman Alley, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Freemans

reviews.text:
This restaurant used to be a hidden, kind of a secret spot that wasn’t really known to many people. The words have gotten out since then, and it is now a super popular spot. 

We didn’t have a reservation, so we decided to get there early. We didn’t have any issue getting a table with just a handful of people at that time. The inside was very cozy. Feeling of an old tavern or a log cabin, filled with animals and antlers on the walls.  

They had brunch menu and lunch menu, and you can order from both menu during brunch. We ordered Five Cheese Macaroni and Skillet Eggs.  They both came in a small iron skillet. It was smaller than expected, but I always say quality over quantity. They were packed with flavor, comforting, and made really well. 

We had a nice, relaxing, tasty brunch here. The service was polite and nice, we were well taken care of. The menu is a bit on pricey side, but the quality is super high. I have been wanting to try Freemans for quite a long time, I am glad we finally got to dine here! I would like to go back for more, and try some of their cocktails as well in a near future!

Interesting place to have food.  The place has a wonderful vibrant atmosphere.  The inside and environment is unique.  The place will cram you in and will seat guests in the most awkward placement.  The food needed a little help.  My full breakfast was only half good.  Eggs and mushrooms were fantastic.  The coffee tasted burnt.  The service was too chill.  They’re very sweet but slow to service and bringing food randomly.  Completely spaced out too much.  I would suggest this place for the energy and environment and ambience not necessarily the food.  The artichoke dip was amazing!

Big fan of the atmosphere. It removes you from Manhattan and creates a dining experience belonging somewhere in distant American history. The wood paired with the dim lighting allow you to feel you are in a suburban sort of trance. The food was excellent. The service was just as good. The cocktails were fantastic. This merits a second visit. Five stars without question.

I've wanted to try Freemans for quite some time and when I finally did, I'm sad to say that I was disappointed. I met a friend for brunch, we had tried to make reservations online days prior but there was no availability. I went to put my name down for a table for two when I arrived and was told it would be a 30 minute wait so we deferred to the bar. 

The bartender was perfectly nice but she just seemed to be spread too thin—we had to ask to order, for refills on water, and finally for our check. We split the burger and french toast and each dish was mediocre at best. The french toast was soggy and seemed like it had been topped in whipped cream that had melted by the time it arrived to us. The burger was incredibly bland and flavorless with sad iceberg lettuce and the accompanying fries were equally unexciting.

The bar area in general felt overcrowded. People were waiting to be seated and kept bumping into us or closing out tabs, making it overall a less than ideal spot to have a conversation and enjoy brunch.

The best part about the whole visit was the location: a secluded alley decorated in colorful graffiti and posters. It's a solid option for a photo opp, but I'd skip eating a meal there. I hate to leave a negative review but this was just such a disappointing experience when I had such high expectations of an iconic restaurant.

It wasn't a bad experience, but it wasn't a very extremely good experience. Kind of pricey but if you're into the kind of light snack then this is the place for you, not much on the menu to choose from. The alley to get to the restaurant? if you wanting some great photography. That is their best catch, the aesthetic of the restaurant was on point for its character . love the atmosphere but not a fan of the food, You have to have the acquired taste. But they are very popular with the locals.. the staff was extremely friendly.

formatted_address: 340 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Amsterdam Ale House

reviews.text: The beer selection is truly amazing. Many different styles and breweries. Some regular, some rotating so we can always be surprised. Something for everyone, unless you don't like beer... but wait! They also have whiskey and gin and whatnot so yeah, something for everyone. Will definitely visit again.

Good selection of beers, though it's not really a 'craft' place. Food was excellent, which is why there are 4 stars here. Whether it be wings, nachos, a burger, or mozzarella sticks...you can't go wrong. Definitely a good place to fill up with comfort food and swing a few back.

I was looking for a post work beer at 2am, and unbeknownst to me Wide Spread Panic had just finished a show at The Beacon. While the bar counter was packed to capacity, table service was on point.  Managed to get a couple rounds in great time by a wonderful server.
Good bar with solid food. There's a nice beer selection and there is plenty of light from all the exterior windows to create a nice atmosphere.
A good selection of rotating taps and international bottles. Very tasty pub fare on the menu. Service is very friendly, but can be slow if caught in a rush.

formatted_address: 77 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Oyster Bar

reviews.text: Came here for the happy hour. Ordered a dozen oysters and it took them 30min to get the oyster to us. No explanation, nothing. Will not come here again.

Worth visiting to sample their huge selection of oysters. They are delicious.

There’s a varied and extensive menu of fresh seafood that would satisfy anyone.

Highly recommend.
Love this place
good stuff
Not good

formatted_address: 90 Washington St, New York, NY 10006, USA
name: Clinton Hall

reviews.text: This place was incredible! Awesome environment and friendly staff. They had games to play and a great outdoor area that would be perfect during the warmer weather. The food was really really really good. I had the chicken sandwich and the donuts 😍(shown in picture). My boyfriend had the grilled cheese (on a glazed donut) & tomato soup which he was obsessed with. Great great place that I would absolutely recommend.

Great beer and food! Their buffalo cauliflower is a must have! Even meat eaters will relish this. Chicken wings were good too. They only have cauliflower crust pizza but it was so good.. you won’t realize it’s made of cauliflower! The waitress offered happy hour fries for our daughter even though we weren’t there during happy hour.. friendly service. She had good recommendations for beer and we liked both that we ordered. 
They also have outdoor seating and games which can be fun for kids too. We live close by and have seen people of all ages enjoy it here. 
Highly recommended!

It was a cute little bar/restaurant that has more outdoor than indoor seating and giant versions of games like checkers, jenga and connect 4, but when I went they would rush you to leave if there’s a big reservation. More ideal for a summer dinner. Recommend the donut grilled cheese if it’s still there.

Nice place to stop for a beer. They have a great tap list but my wife and I opted for the local brews which were really solid. I’m the summer I can imagine this place being really cool as they have a bunch of outdoor games.

Overall it's a fun spot, but I wouldn't recommend it for groups. It's not the sort of layout where you can just pull another table over, and the waiter showed up about once every 20 minutes. Decent place to watch football on the weekends. Outdoor and I door space makes it a popular choice when the weather is nice

formatted_address: 221 E 58th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Adonis Lounge

reviews.text:
This places wasn’t bad I actually enjoy myself with my friends for my birthday. The only thing I did not like was when the man I asked gave men a dance he never told me how much it was. So I ended up paying $80 for a dance When they are suppose to tell you that it is $20 a dance
 (PER SONG). The stripper was named Sebastian. So you have to pay attention or certain guys will take advantage (not all but some) . And when i told my friend about it the owner over heard the conversation and accommodated me and my friends with drinks and three free tickets for their other party. Which we appreciated. (The owner is not about ripping people off) But other than that it was a good time.

Love this place ; great vibe.
Owner, staff, and dancers are very friendly.

Complete bull...a stripper pulled my boyfriend and I into a private room without us asking, started dancing, and the next thing l know he's pulled his package out and pushed us down to service him.  At the end, he demanded $100 bucks. I guess we got payed. Live and learn. Stay far away.
Loved this place will go back nice owner

The worse experience at a strip club ever!?! I had my eyes closed the whole time but I did pick up a chick in the parking lot tho, it didn't take me all that long to convince her she was not happily married...

formatted_address: 641 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Gemini Diner

reviews.text: Good food, quickly, with non-overbearing staff.  Highly recommend.

Conveniently located 24hr dinner located near  several hospitals, so if you’re wanting something warm to eat and don’t want to walk for the cafeteria to open this place will do.

It’s not great. The breakfast potatoes were old and cold. The eggs were palatable and the toast was just that, toast. Service is what you’d expect and the coffee is ok. The place has nothing to brag about, but I didn’t leave hungry.

Great corner diner with the usual deep choice of dishes and fast, efficient service. This one is a bit if a Murray Hill institution and it doesn't disappoint. The healthier options for a late breakfast (such as yogurt) are not just after thoughts.
Friendly staff, good service! they have good lunch/dinner deals. Their portions are very big. I cant even finish the half of my plates. Vegetarian friendly and they have several good fish dishes.

I just want to say they are amazing are car broke down and after waiting 4 hrs we called them while waiting for a tow Truck. They walked over to where are car was on the FDR and brought us our food! Thank you so much your the best!

formatted_address: 266 W 23rd St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Counter & Bodega

reviews.text: Excellent service, excellent Spanish food and really good place just to come in for a drink and listen to music. They have great paintings on the wall that you can purchased. They have different artists that display their work I believe monthly.  I can't believe I live  so close and know that this place was here all along. The drinks were really good and prices were great and they have happy hours most of the time. They also have a DJ on board. I really recommend this place to everyone.
Sophie's place is amazing. Food was great, drinks were awesome!!! Service was impeccable. Will definitely be back. I highly recommend that you check out this phenomenal spot, Counter and Bodega.

I liked this place ... I wanted to love it; the food was great and the staff is very nice.

The problem is that it's loud. Like, really loud. Like hard to hear the person across from you loud. And for no purpose. It's a restaurant, not a club or a lounge. So why so loud? Especially at 7:00 PM.

The table next to us complained. We asked our server to lower. Stayed loud.

Oh, well ...
Small place but was very nice. Went with a large party and they accommodated us quickly. Great food! Drink specials were good too. I'd definitely go again.
Good Food & Great ambiance

formatted_address: 2 Pennsylvania Plaza, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: TGI Fridays

reviews.text: Always great times when I visit this restaurant with friends and family. Food is great and can be quiet depending on the time of day. Saddened to find out my fiancé's and my favorite dessert the Tennessee Whiskey cake isn't being served anymore (we would share it along with the brownie). Ah well! Hope it makes a comeback one day.

Decent at best especially for a place located in Penn Station. I went at lunchtime on a Friday and I waited about five minutes before anyone showed me to a seat. The overall look is what you would expect from this chain. It is nothing fancy and needs a bit of remodeling.  My waitress was very friendly and attentive. I waited quite a while before my food was served and the place didn't look too busy when I ordered. Things picked up afterwards. I ordered a Bacon Cheeseburger and Fries and I must say that it was pretty good. My burger was nicely cooked and very juicy. Fries had a bit of flavor too. My Mango Henny Lemonade really hit the spot as well. The prices though were a bit steep. I guess it is because they know a lot of people will stop in before catching their trains for a quick (or in this case not so quick) bite. Overall, I would give this location another chance....especially if I have plenty of time to kill.

Went to grab food between trains. Was not acknowledged at the "Please wait to be seated" sign for nearly ten minutes and had to call the restaurant to be told to go to the bar to place a to-go order.

Went to the bar, was ignored for another ten minutes, then told it would take half an hour to get a salad together.  Had they said this when I called in I would have been fine, but after losing half an hour to this I couldn't wait any longer.

TGI Fridays should revoke this franchise...they are an embarassment to the brand.

It's ok, but while the staff tried, our server forgot one of our drink orders which was needed. The food was ok, nothing to write home about. We ordered shrimp and lobster pasta and potato skins. Generous enough meal, but probably more expensive than it should have been. Our server became interested as we were finishing up. No doubt for the gratuity. It was Ok as an experience, not outstanding
Poor service, starter served with main. Ignorant staff who were abrupt when asking where their tip was..... Top tip! improve your customer service a food quality. Eat elsewhere.

formatted_address: 570 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Anton's

reviews.text: Upscale restaurant, great service, good atmosphere, the food could be better. I ordered an hanger steak and although it was well cooked it came cold. The portion for the macaroni spinach was extremely small. The highlight of my brunch was the dessert! If you are planning on going for a brunch take into consideration that portions are smaller than normal. It's also pricey as well.

Went to Anton’s for the first time last night. Great vibe, beautiful place with outstanding food. The Chopped Celery salad was innovative, delicious and so refreshing. The Spinach Raviolis were so light and exceptional. The Hangar Steak Lorenz with Onions is a must for Steak lovers. The Duck special was phenomenal. Great service and a very enjoyable experience. Will definitely be going back to try different meals.
Love this addition to the neighborhood! Perfect pastas, delicious steak, understated service and a beautiful grownup, classic NY vibe.

Really loved taking my parents to Antons. Upscale place to enjoy oysters or a beautiful cut of beef. The sommelier was incredibly helpful and friendly. This place would be lovely solo (eating at the bar) but a group of 3-4 was ideal for sharing. Highly recommend the liver and heart appetiser! We also had the 2-3 person shared steak special and it was superb.

Four of us had dinner here for a special occasion on Saturday. Things started on a positive note. The atmosphere was nice, we had a full spread (entrees, sides, bottle of wine, dessert) that was all very good, and the kitchen did a good job accommodating a food allergy at our table. 

While service started out pleasant enough, there was a noticeable change  as the meal progressed. When we ordered another bottle of wine for the table—right after dessert, about an hour and 45 minutes into the meal—our party (which included two in their 70s) was asked to leave our table and drink at the bar, which was standing room only at the time. "We can't force you to leave, but others are waiting to be seated," they said. 

We were dumbfounded. After speaking with the manager, we still felt unwelcome and disrespected, so we left. In our collective 200+ years of dining experience, none of us had ever been asked to leave our table at a restaurant while still dining. Suffice it to say, the incident put a major damper on our dinner and the remainder of the evening. 

Good food, head-scratchingly bad service decision.

formatted_address: 714 7th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: R Lounge

reviews.text:
My wife and I stopped in for dinner prior to seeing a Broadway show. Although we had walked past many times we had never gone in. Since it was close to our show, we decided to give it a try. Great decision!! As soon as you step off the elevator, you're greeted with a classy, upscale ambiance. We were greeted and seated right away and our server, Marlene, was there to greet us almost immediately. First, I have to comment on what an amazing server Marlene was! She was very courteous and extremely friendly, and thanked us for coming in. She was extremely attentive and checked on us throughout our meal, many times offering suggestions about what we should try.

We ordered the Giant NY-style pretzel. Giant doesn't quite describe how large this appetizer is! It came out piping hot, served with brown mustard and a cheese sauce. DELICIOUS! For our entrees, my wife ordered a burger and I ordered the chicken panini. Both were good choices.

Unfortunately, between the Giant pretzel and our meals, we weren't able to try any of the desserts. However, based on this visit, we will definitely be back again, and this time we'll save room for dessert.

Amazing views of the heart of NY Time Square!  Great drinks. Decent food with a selection for anyone. One of a kind menu that featured Hot Dogs, Hamburgers, Pizza and NY Style Pretzels. The drinks are just as great as the views!!!

I fully expected the food at this place to be average at best. I figured due to the location and view, that is essentially what you are paying for. I couldn't have been more wrong. Everything we ordered (about half the menu) was absolutely fantastic. I think if they expanded their shareables just by a few more options, this could be easily one of the best restaurants in Times Square. We will absolutely be heading back to NYC and go here. Fantastic food, drinks were very strong, service was amazing, and you cannot beat the views!

One of the best places to view times square. The food tastes good and is not pricey for a restaurant with such views. Definitely recommend it to anyone visiting times square and looking for a place with the best view

Incredible view of Time Square ❣️ I just wish it was opened to the hotel guests as a lounge when the restaurant was closed. Would have been nice to do some work overlooking the glorious chaos that is time square 😁

formatted_address: 321 Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10027, USA
name: Corner Social

reviews.text: Food is decent- pretty much what you would expect for slightly more upscale bar food. I can’t say I’ve tried the brunch. It’s a great place for happy hour and or to watch the game. They have a good DJ Friday nights, though it tends to get really packed.

Great spot for group outings or a date. Decent customer service. Brunch is NOT good but dinner is great. Fun bar scene with great music on the weekends. Typically a scene for an older crowd (late 20s-40s).

While it is a nice social setting, and the crowd is very upbeat and friendly, the  establishment needs  a deep cleaning.  The floor around the bar and the floor behind the bar and the actual bar top was dirty all around.  The table tops were sticky and this is clearly because they're not being cleaned with the proper agents.  All around and gave the feel of a place that was just wiped down with the wet cloth.

Place is so lit. Came for brunch. Staff was very friendly and attentive even though it was packed. Food was pretty good. They DJ was Killin it, I haven't danced that hard in a minute. Would definitely go back.

Dined January 1, 2020
This was the WORSE brunch I have ever had  I should have stopped at the coffee!!  I had the chicken and waffles dish.  The chicken tasted like Shake and Bake chicken from an oven. There was no way this chicken was fried! The waffle was definitely Eggo!  The service and ambiance was good however, I would suggest you save your money and go elsewhere. Only redeeming factor in my opinion,  the mimosas were great!

formatted_address: 91 7th Ave S, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Jekyll and Hyde Club

reviews.text:
Went last night for dinner. Place was definitely not dirty as others have claimed. Service was quick and we were never wondering where our waitress was. We had Caroline and she was absolutely fantastic, thank you for the great service :)).

The visuals were very entertaining, and good luck finding the bathroom lol. They have everything covered to play into the theme.

Food was great no complaints there at all. Really glad I didn't let the negative comments scare me off. Give them a chance, I will be back.

Pro's: Amazing atmosphere, truly unique.
Con's: Overpriced, and generic taste.

Great atmosphere, quality portions, an extremely unique place to either dine or get a drink. But cramped with nearly no room to breathe, and there truly is nothing like watching your fellow patron's constantly bump into each other while trying to enjoy their meal. Also I've had better tasting meals at diners. It's expensive for the generic taste. You could argue that you're paying for the atmosphere. Which you'd be correct, $3 per person on the bill labeled as "entertainment". Oh and be careful not to double tip! Each bill also includes 18% gratitude already added.
It was a fun place to visit and dine in. Food was good and drinks as well. The actors were very engaging and considerate. Definitely would go back again.
The kids loved this place. IT is worth going to entertain. They put a lot of effort into making the ambiance perfect. Food good for the kids but really generic fast food.

Food was well worth the short wait along with being decently priced. Extremely nice staff and very entertaining! Would definitely recommend this place for anyone looking for a nice and relaxing place to eat. Coupled with the beautiful early 20th century atmosphere, this place really is one of a kind. 5/5 stars!

formatted_address: 61 Bergen St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: 61 Local

reviews.text:
These guys really do have it all:
- solid draft / cocktails / wine selection
- tasty bar snacks hot and cold, large and small
- a mini event space up top for (local) performances, variety shows, intimate musical gatherings.

This place feels like it was once a dive bar that cleaned up, shaved and showered, but never lost that local bklyn heart and chill vibe.
The food and service were ahead of our expectations. We truly liked the vibes of this place. Amazing restaurant to take my family out for lunch.

It's a little hide away with friendly staffs, small bites and a good time. The beer selection is good though the wine selection is somewhat limited. I enjoy coming to this little pub whenever I'm staying in Brooklyn. It's a relatively short walk from my hotel and without the usual high price or attitude related to Manhattan.
Got the grilled cheese and tomato soup. Would come back! Delicious
Standard bar. Pretty fine but crowded and hard to get room to bar. Could be more organized but it's a bar so no big deal.

formatted_address: 3157 Broadway, New York, NY 10027, USA
name: Toast Uptown

reviews.text: Everything here was flavorful and done to perfection. The staff was friendly and attentive, which was exceptional because there was only 2 service people available. Ooh and did I mention there is a happy hour EVERYDAY! If you're in the neighborhood stop in and treat yourself.

Whether you are brunching, lunching, or having dinner, this warm spot in Harlem will satisfy you. Friendly wait staff, great vibe, great menu - with GF friendly options.

A great spot to bring an old friend to catch up. Right off the 1 train. One of my favorite places!

The restaurant was amazing! We went for Brunch. I had a Beermosa for $7 and my friend had a Mimosa for $6. I ordered French Toast. It was very thick and fluffy. I initially thought the serving size was going to be small, but it ended up being more than I could eat. Service was prompt and our waitress checked in on us frequently.
Went here with a few friends for happy hour. Margaritas were tasty. Ordered a salad that never came...
Delicious. Self serve water. Pleasant people working, very helpful. Nice seating with ample phone re-charging

formatted_address: 6 Bay St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Van Brunt Stillhouse

reviews.text:
Stumbled upon this gem while waiting for friends in the area. Rather than wait outside in the rain, I went online and found the closest business that was open. 

I stumbled in to the warehouse entrance and followed signs to the tasting room. It’s pretty cute and intimate with some bar seats, couches/lounge seating and dim lights. The staff was super nice and welcoming. 

I had time for just one cocktail, so I picked the Bold Rush. It’s quite bold yet refreshing with notes of ginger and whiskey. 

I’ll definitely keep them in mind next time I’m in the area and will come back for a tour when I have more time.

Van Brunt Stillhouse is a small operation!
I'm no whiskey drinker but BF is and we had a great time. The tour was super intimate and informative. The people that work here are very warm, knowledgeable, and answered all our questions. The tour also included 4 tastings which were spaced out nicely throughout.
The tasting room is the coziest place ever. Really inviting with a small bar and a few areas to sit, chat, and enjoy a cocktail.

Intimate tour with our very informative guide, Seth. Answered all our questions and he put up with our silly shenanigans. Tasting room is also intimate, decorated tastefully rustic and seemed to be a great place to stop in on a Sat afternoon. It’s not fancy but the bourbon tasting throughout the tour allowed us to try the excellent variety of whisky, bourbon and rye they create on site. The cocktail menu in the tasting room was great too. The Amoxicillin was a favorite of our group.

Hidden little distillery. All the furniture in their taproom looks like it's been recycled and handmade. The tour was short and sweet with 4 small tastings. I don't think the tastings even summed up to one shot so you definitely won't get drunk (unlike NY Distilling Co).  The bottle prices were pretty steep and since none of the whiskies we tried really stood out, we didn't bring anything home.

Hidden Gem of Red Hook.
Many people may not realize but there’s actually a cute den with bar in the distillery where you can go to relax and have a drink. They even have board games and things of that sort. Fun Fact: I spent a snowstorm in there and it was so much fun. Apparently a lot of the locals had the same idea and everyone flocked there and it was a great time.

formatted_address: 22 W 39th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Mango Strip Club NYC

reviews.text: Amazing female strippers! They were all so personable and beautiful. What they did on stage was truly an artistic performance. The entire strip club was beautiful and the staff was very friendly. Customer service was also great.

Came here for my boyfriend's birthday party. The strippers were very classy and the strip club was beautifully decorated. Definitely a high-end place. Lapdances were $20 so it wasn't unreasonable. Drinks were well priced and strong. Definitely a fun night and my boyfriend was happy.

Such an awesome strip club in NYC. It's close to everything. The strippers were so hot and the strip club venue itself was beautifully decorated. It has  a dark and sexy vibe to it. Plus the girls were beautiful. Did I mention the strippers were beautiful?

Definitely a great strip club right in the heart of NYC. The strippers, staff and bartenders were all amazing and friendly. Five star service. I would definitely come back again for my birthday next year.
One of the funnest strip clubs in NYC. The dancers here were exotic and beautiful. They were all gorgeous! Definitely worth the time.

formatted_address: 160 Pearl St #1, New York, NY 10005, USA
name: Full Shilling

reviews.text: Lovely old style pub. Staff really pleasant . Pub clean with calm atmosphere.  Food great as was the choice of draft beers.
What a great bar with great service, relaxed place for a drink and conversation. Lots of room inside and very comfortable. Pretty fantastic wine and beer selection.
Very traditional Irish pub, great atmosphere, food and drinks!
Good food.  Bar is crowded.  Always busy.  Beer is always fresh.
The place offers an awesome variety of delicious food. I enjoyed dining here. The employees are always friendly, rates are convenient and the place is always neat.

formatted_address: 33 E 61st St, New York, NY 10065, USA
name: Serafina Always

reviews.text: Absolutely love Serafina. So much history here. The first one that opened on 61st was my first job when I moved to the city when I was a teenager. Great food and vibe. Attentive and passionate staff and the owners are awesome people. Very fun place to hang out and enjoy delicious food with friends and loved ones. Highly recommend.

You can always count on Serafina for an excellent meal with great service. No matter which location, Serafina delivers quality consistently! I especially like the layout of this one since I usually eat at the bar, but still want to be in the center of things.
Great restaurant! You'll always get great food, amazing ambiance, service and music. I've been here countless times and have never been disappointed. Pizza, pasta, apps, salad, everything is amazing!
Great local spot. Food was very fresh and delicious food. Has a small town feel... very good!

This place was super cool in its layout and decor. Had great ambiance. In a great part of town. Food was delicious but portions were SUPER small for the price. Drinks are also crazy expensive. Service was very slow as well.

formatted_address: 225 47th St, Brooklyn, NY 11220, USA
name: Club Love NY

reviews.text: On Saturdays it be lit, lots of crowd & good music. Fridays its okay, not as packed as I thought it would be when I went on a Friday one night. Other than that . . . . . 👍🏽

This place was horrible. I went for a bday party. I just left after being there for an hour. They thoroughly search ppl downstairs, take away everyones personal belongings, but yet ppl are smoking weed upstairs. Taking precaution makes perfect sense, but if I left an hour later what happened to all the personal belongings that you stole from ppl. How is this still allowed? I was pissed because they got some expensive perfume from me. I get to the bar and it's cash only and if you get one bottle you have to stand. Not to mention the min is 750 for a table after they were charging $100 for bottles. The cover is 30 and 40 for men....not worth it.
This place is horrible.  Drinks horrible.  Queue lines horrible.

formatted_address: 35 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Pew Pew HQ

reviews.text: The head office of PewPew, one of the most creative event collectives in the world. They put together the most unique, mind bending, and wild nightlight events in New York City (and beyond, they recently did one in Bermuda!) I've been to 5, and every time I walk away thinking: "That was the best party I've ever been to..."

One of a kind events! With a high level of production along with unique music curation Pew Pew manages to stand out from the crowd in NYC nightlife. The crowd they attract is diverse, welcoming and distinctly unique. Patiently waiting for their next event announcement.

Probably a top-17 night of my life. When the Panamanian sweater salesmen came through to argue for the Federalist papers, I knew I had found home. These were great people, who knew how to put on an event with courage and vigor. Wow. A spectacle of heart. Thank you, Pew Pew, for making New York come alive with the simultaneous whisper - and exclamation - of all we strive to be, and given enough Pew Pew, all we should be. Thank you and cheers, gentlemen.

formatted_address: 17 Clinton St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Rizzo's Fine Pizza

reviews.text: Rizzos is the BEST PIZZA in all Manhattan they always make fresh pies. The service is wonderful even if they have a lot of people to serve they get the job done well and fast. The price is worth it you won't regret coming here.
Delicious pizza! Ready quick, you can also get beer or wine at the take-out side in the seating. good value!
Really excellent! Staff is great, quick and the pizza was quality. No wait on a Friday which was nice too ;) the Burrata salad is a dream.

I honestly think Rizzo's has the best sauce in all of New York City. Rizzo's round slice is a classic, even though their square slice is their traditional since 1959. It's also worth trying their aumma aumma. If you stop in, make sure to tell them that Bobs Pizza Tour sent you! They have both a slice shop and a restaurant side with a bar serving wine and beer.
If you are in the LES this is a great spot to grab a slice of some pizza and a drink. The thin crust Sicilian pizza is pretty great and so.is the staff.

formatted_address: 513 W 27th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Ovest Pizzoteca

reviews.text: I celebrated my PhD this evening in this great restaurant. Well we had a astonishing evening and the venue was definitely one of the reasons for this happy meeting. The waiters  cooperated in a splendid manner, the cuisine was delicious and my guests were very  happy. We shall no dout return for more events. Thank you very much.
This place is great. The staff is super nice, you sit and enjoy eating the diverse selection of pizza. You have to come here!
Stopped in for a quick bite at the bar. Service was quick, food was excellent, and definitely going to return as they have a great romantic ambiance about them.

Amazing pizza. Creative cocktails in a warm environment. Service was prompt and food came out very quickly.

Martha pizza was my favorite, the truffle made it. Next was the Piccante pizza, with a great amount of spice that was not overwhelming.
Even though it was busy, we were quickly seated and our food came out fast. Our server was courteous and the pizza was delicious. I would definitely eat here again with my friends

formatted_address: 70 W 68th St, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Joanne Trattoria

reviews.text:
This restaurant is not wheelchair accessible nor is there a service entrance or back entrance.

The private dining room is a cozy space for ~12 but we scarified elbow room to squeeze 14. The ambiance in the back room was nice.

The food was nothing to write home about. Servings were small for $21. 

For Lady Gaga fans, the place does have a certain edge. A NY State license plate hangs that says “Lady Gaga.” A portrait of her Aunt Joanne is a nicely lit focal point when you walk in. A sign says “Choose kids, not guns.”

It was an OK place but nothing I’ll need to go back to after visiting once and checking it off my list.

Came here due to my partner being a huge fan of Lady Gaga. The food was spectacular and the ambiance of the restaurant was just right. Enough for the fans, but not too much to take the spotlight of the restaurant. It was very quiet when we went, surprising for a Saturday afternoon. But the staff were super accommodating. Food came out on time, handed over with smiles and pleasantries. One gentleman even took the time to talk to my partner about Lady Gaga and her father. I appreciated this Alot. Thank you very much

This restaurant is such a cute place. I especially do like the little garden place. The service was good and really wanted to help with everything. They even charged my phone for me! The food is good and isn’t that expensive.

I have bragged to my friends about Joanne's for years, loved the place but hadn't been there in a while. Visited last night, 5:30 dinner, so early side. Food was great as usual but service was absolutely horrible. Our waitress literally came by once in the beginning after waiting 10 minutes, got my drink after another long wait, then never came back. We ordered two appetizers but she never put in our order for one of them. Didn't want it anymore by the time dinner dishes came out so never mentioned it to her, not that she was around or cared anyway. I had to ask for the check. Not sure I will be back and certainly won't be bragging about them anymore. Bummer.

One of the best Italians I have ever been too. The sauce was perfect and they got right what so many restaurants fail to do. The meatball was succulent and tasty. If I ever get a chance to come back to NYC I will make this a regular.

formatted_address: 1 W 59th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: The Todd English Food Hall

reviews.text:
Probably the finest dining experience in The Plaza Food Hall, though seating on high chairs is hardly comfortable at all. We watched our food be skillfully prepared, and it tasted better than it looked - the scallops were perfectly delicious, though the presentation was rather rustic. 
Out of busy hours, the place was nearly empty, and not being met or greeted by anyone upon arrival we walked into the restaurant — and were a bit rudely asked to retreat and search for the hostess. For the rest of the evening, though, service was attentive and even friendly.
What's not to love?! It's all super tasty, the service is great, and there is so much to try! You gotta be ready to shell out some cash, but it's good.

Today my friend  I and came to the city to enjoy the holiday season.
Growing up in New Rochelle and as an adult I live in Rhode Island.
I love to come to the city and share with my friends what a great place it is .
We decided To go to Todd 
English at the Plaza for lunch.
Our experience was Fabulous food was great but Our waiter Kaheel made it more of an experience than just a meal!!
Needless to say we will be back.!

Best,
SUSAN and Evelyn

Service has declined quite a bit, food is hit or miss, which is unacceptable for the amount of money they charge. Everyone in our party of 4 had their food served at completely different times by many different people, none of which asked if we needed anything additional or how we were doing. When we finally did see the waiter well into our meals, we ordered more drinks and such. When only a few things were "delivered", we had to wait for him to pass through to remind him again. They were clearly way too busy for anyone to get a quality experience. Our lunch bill (2 adults + 2 children) was $200+, so we were expecting to have had great service and food to match. Mushroom flatbread was mushy and impossible to pick up and eat. What a shame, this being our 3rd time there, it's been getting worse and worse each time. This was the last time for us.

This place always confuses me. The front always acts like they are very exclusive and full, even when there are alot of seats open. If you are a single, you can't sit at a table, but must sit at a counter. I think the tables are communal. Got sat at a very awkward counter that was a corner and rounded, so I was sticking way out. It is hard to get your waiters attention when sitting at a counter also.  Generally, love Todd English restaurants, and have been to many of them. Not sure about this one. Ordered the rigatoni bolognese. The bowl it comes in makes it feel very small, compared to when you see this sprawling salad served to the person next to you. The bolognese sauce is interesting in flavor....tastes like maybe there is nutmeg or something a little non traditional in it.  It was good, but the flavor is a bit tinny, reminding me of spaghettios, and didn't have a rich tomato bolognese flavor like many others I've had in my lifetime. Also, this bowl of pasta will set you back $17, and this is at lunch time. I would maybe go back, but order something different.

formatted_address: 270 West 43rd Street, Lobby Level, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Foundry Kitchen & Bar

reviews.text: The decor looks classy and the seating is varied so you get to choose the level.of comfort you desire. The wait staff was very nice and helpful. Our waiter was very attentive. The chicken quesadilla tasted home cooked (I was hoping it would be better than I could make myself). The Kobe beef sliders were very tasty. I ordered the chicken pot pie and when it came out it looked great but let me down with the flavor. The puff pastry on top tasted delicious but the chicken was very dry and there was not enough cream sauce to keep the flavor consistent. I barely ate half of it. All that being said, everything was overpriced. Each fountain soda was $6 and our total bill was over $130. Just not worth it to me.

I'm glad we went to the restaurant in our hotel despite all the negative reviews. We received great and our waitress went above and beyond with her service. We were able to get a table because of her after a long day of exploring NYC. We ordered the chicken fingers and fries, (great) and the shrimp appetizer (great) and the pizza (okay). We only ordered beers but they were cold and refreshing. The view is okay from the windows and the big screen was playing the college game we wanted to watch. Great experience!
Apps were wonderful: hummus platter, quesadillas + guacamole with plantain chips but dessert left a lot to be desired.

This place is not good in so many ways. I am convinced the only reason they are open is because it’s the only place you can use the mandatory resort credit when staying at the Westin. The first time I tried lunch and when I went to order a beer I kept getting told they were out of things. They essentially had nothing on their beer menu. For dinner I ordered a cocktail which seemed to missing the key ingredients it listed and the red snapper for dinner (with butternut squash) was impressively tasteless. The food is not good and would not recommend this place.
Food was just ok at best. They charge $18 for a glass of wine that normally is 12 a bottle. Service was not good either. Not going back there.

formatted_address: 179 W 4th St, Between 6th and, 7th Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Down the Hatch

reviews.text: Really nice local spot to chill and enjoy yourself.  Great music.  You'll definitely meet a lot of people.  It's very friendly.  I can't forget about Sam the bartender.  She's awesome!!  So if you get her as your bartender make sure you tip her well.  😀

Loud and cheap. Generous happy hour for the area. To my knowledge, associated with a network of similar bars (Three Sheets, Hair of the Dog, The Gin Mill) around town. It's an after work spot with beer pong and bar food. I'd recommend the tater tots.
Great bar ambiance. Still a great vibe after 20 plus years. Wow. Wings however have really fallen off. Very fatty and tasted like they were cooked with old oil

Place is small...bartender was taking the lemons with his hands , peeling the plastic of the straws and putting in drinks, handling money all without gloves. Please give the customer the straw with the wrapper on and use thongs to pick lemons. 3 stars because the wings were good.    No place to sit and eat ....ate standing up....

Overall great drink and food prices for the area. And yea, is small so gets packed quick Sat/Sun...but never been an issue. Love all the bar staff. Except. The "total bro" rocking Patriots gear and backwards hats acting like he's still in college...he's a tool and not good at his job as a bar back. Everyone else puts in effort for locals and regulars and he just gives attention to females and is too obsessed with himself to he good at his job. Such a joker

formatted_address: 227 E 56th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: CheckMate

reviews.text: This is a ok place for full swap couples no single ladies as we wanted for our first dive into exploring no guy but place is ok for those looking to full swap young to old. Was also very empty for the price charged
Hands down the best club in nyc , pretty couples, clean and very upscale.
Great vibe and music

Fun for all of us! We went as a couple with our favorite girlfriend to check out the people and had a really great time. It's funky cool, and clean.  The staff is fun and sexy also which is always important.  Epic DJ and great bagels. We made some good connections and hope to get back there soon.  Thank you to the Sexy Madonna Lady in the back!!!
I really enjoyed this club!!!!! Th staff was nice and helpful. I think I found a keeper in this place!!!!!

formatted_address: 165 W 86th St, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: West Park NYC Open Mic

formatted_address: 180 9th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Qanoon

reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful. We live nearby and the scents that drift out of this restaurant have transformed our neighborhood and tempted many. Having said that we tried it and loved it.  Of particular note is the sumac chicken. Probably the best chicken I've ever had and we'll be back
Amazing place to try Palestinian food! We split a few of the appetizers instead of getting mains. Everything was excellent. Staff was helpful. Great atmosphere.

If you are looking for authentic Palestinian brunch food and experience go to Qanoon. The food is made with care and love and the restaurant is beautifully decorated and very inviting. I love everything about Qanoon.

Delicious food! I came here with my friends for a birthday brunch- we got the prefix brunch option and everything was amazing! Great friendly service also. I recommend the Knafeh. Definitely coming here again :)

I have traveled and lived in many Arab countries,    so I know the food pretty good and I can tell you that this restaurant is one of my favorites. Summarizing:

Staff:  Natives.   This is important to me because that means the food is original. 

Food: Excellent, very original food presented in a very nice way.   Enough quantities. 

Atmosphere:  Cozy.  Not stuffy. 

Service: very friendly, professional and accommodating people 

Price-quality ratio: not bad,  keeping in mind that this is not a fast food place. 

Cons: Not recommended for babies/stroller. 

All in all, recommended and we would go back soon.

formatted_address: 505 8th Ave, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: The Tailor Public House

reviews.text:
The food here is awesome and cheap for being in Midtown Manhattan. The staff was welcoming and was on top of their game. Sports were playing on the television, but was not overwhelming because it was muted. It has a beautiful atmosphere and vibe.

We were able to watch the marathon while we ate. We were not a fan of the french toast. The crust was too hard.

Sometimes it can be hard to find a place to grab a drink w/ coworkers and friends in the midtown area. Many of the bars are packed to the gills and can become very uncomfortable. Tailor House is a good option because the place is physically huge. Upstairs and downstairs areas can accommodate huge crowds without feeling overwhelming. The food is simple but top notch. The service is also very good. They also do a good job setting atmosphere. The decorations are very festive for holidays which is appreciated.

I've set up several events for my community here. They are by far the best place I've worked with! They are wonderful, accommodating, efficient and all around amazing. We have had 3 parties and a Christmas social so far and all of them a great success. I love the easiness of the location as well, members from all over the 5 boroughs can easily make it. Yey to more parties here!

Went into this bar recently to see if we could have seats and watch the Boxing, there was a young women who welcomed us and nothing was to much trouble. 
Really lovely place and food was banging! 
Will definetly recommend 👍

Great location to eat if you are on the way to an event at Madison Square Gardens. The service was good, but a bit slow at times, but the restaurant was very busy. The food was good and I would definitely easy there again.

formatted_address: 194 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: El Camion Cantina

reviews.text: Love this place have been coming here since it opened 10 years ago and to me it is pound for pound the best brunch in nyc which is a bold statement. They have never changed their prices or who they are, the food is delicious and they give you a free drink with brunch.. if you are in the east village do yourself a favor and come here
Friendly staff, delicious Mexican food, and lovely selection of tequila. Good place for a boozy brunch.
Food was fantastic. But the wait was horrid, to get seated and the food. Even the drinks. But the food really made up for it. I recommend you come try this place sometime.

I thought it was very good and reasonably priced. I had the chicken tacos and the tilapia tacos. Both were very good. Service was also very good the ambience was nice. I would definitely go back. I would give it a 4.5

Oddly, although I have lived in the neighborhood a very long time, never went in until recently.  Went for a late dinner but think it would be better for a brunch.  Dishes are Mexican fusion and I found the flavors good but a bit "delicate" for Mexican (compare it to Zaragoza a block away).

formatted_address: 156 E 2nd St, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Supper

reviews.text: As for real Italian food, I think this one is actually authentic!!! Loved the menu and the range of food they offered. The service was good too. Please remember that the restaurant accepts ONLY CASH! I didnt know about this until I got there but the food made it up for it! Definitely will be going there again! I really liked the environment too which brings in old authentic lazy Italian summer days even in the middle of winter! Lastly, I loved their song selections!

This incredible meal started with the bread and white beans in olive oil they put on every table, a fabulous start.   We had the buratta mozzarella and garlic bread as appetizers which were delicious.   For dinner Veal Parmigiana and Veal Milanese, again both amazing.   Thank you for a wonderful experience.

My favorite Italian spot in all of the city. I find myself craving their spaghetti a limone at random times of the day. I have gone out of my way just to eat here and love every minute of it. It’s a dark & cozy nook of East Village that’ll want you coming back for more. The food is amazing. I’ve never had a bad meal here. You must get the burrata—it is life changing.

Cozy Italian place with an outdoor and indoor seating area. Tried a few different dishes now and most of them are tasty and have good sized portions. The drinks are just average though. Remember to get some cash when you dine here since they don’t accept credit cards.

I’m pretty fussy with my Italian food. The place was pretty trendy looking. The loss of stars come from the pasta, which was standard supermarket pasta (not made fresh) and the noise in the kitchen. They were so loud we could barely hear each other talk at times.

formatted_address: 1325 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: 5 Napkin Burger

reviews.text:
We have been here a couple of times and each time was a good experience. We come here for lunch and brunch and enjoy the variety of the food selection. 

The burgers are definitely value for your money. The buns are soft and fluffy and the burger tastes good. We have tried the egg and bacon cheeseburger for brunch and it was delicious. 

This location has outdoor seating and great for families. The service might need a server or two more.
Great burger restaurant, plenty of choices in the menu. Prices are reasonable and staff is very kind and polite. Atmosphere is quite spacious and not too loud. Delicious desserts! Will be returning.

Excellent! The owner puts forth great pride in his restaurant. I witnessed him swapping out french fries to go because the customer was late to pick up the order. He removed the fries and told a worker to replace them with fresh crispy fries. Who does that?

Came to this location for the first time ever last night and was just as impressed with this one as all the others! But for the first time I tried the truffle burger which was absolutely incredible and cooked perfectly medium rare!   Bartender was friendly and outgoing which is always a plus will definitely be back

Saw the review some had posted, along with the pictures of the menu, so we had to try it. Food was great!! Had the Spinach/Artichoke Dip, 5 Chedder Bacon Burger, sweet potatoe fries, and an awesome  Cranberry Margarita! Superb!!!😋😋

formatted_address: 494 4th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Gueros

reviews.text: Right in the sweet spot. Good, inexpensive food, great music (a little loud but fun).  Excellent margarita (large pictured).  Crowd is great, staff friendly and efficient.  Have a brisket taco.
Very good margaritas, unique tacos- fried chicken taco, brisket taco, mushroom veggie taco. Staff is also very friendly and warm. Love it!

Ate here before seeing a show at Bell House. Great guacamole and excellent tacos. We had 4 different ones between 2 of us and they were all good. Friendly and attentive staff. Margaritas on point. Great pre-show spot.
Awesome new Mexican spot in Gowanus. Great tacos, enchiladas and cocktails.
The best tacos I've eaten outside of Mexico.

formatted_address: 228 W 72nd St, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Gebhard's Beer Culture

reviews.text: I love going to this place for happy hour. They have a good rotation of beers on tap which is nice. The staff is friendly and the bar food is good. For the location, the prices are great.

Gebhards was great! Enjoyed a few bar snacks and a couple rounds of drinks! 

The pretzel was a little hard but for a bar snack was really enjoyable at the time. 

Beers and drinks were all tasty. It of course is a preference thing when it comes to beer but order what you like and maybe try a new one as well.

Come for trivia, grab a score card, and enjoy an evening of trivia as you drink your beers!!
Stopped here for pre-movie drinks and grub.. conveniently close to the Lincoln Square AMC. The tots and sliders were excellent! Good beer selection, but pretty pricey drafts.

As should be obvious from the name, this is a beer oriented venue. They have a good variety on tap and in bottles. I was also pleasantly surprised by how good the food is. Specifically, the tacos, but it's not like I could try everything on the menu (though I wish I could). Anyway, I was going to write about the beer. The beer selection is excellent. Will definitely come back here next time I'm in Manhattan.

Seems like a dope place when I walked in. Great selection from what I could gather. Place wasn't packed, but I couldn't get service. 🤷‍♀️ Stared at a menu for about 5-10 before bouncing. Will be awhile before I have enough money to walk back in their door again. If I do. Theyz pricey. There's no shortage of them types in the city. 💯🍻

formatted_address: 155 E 52nd St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Gu Japanese Fusion Sushi & Bar

reviews.text: I celebrated my nomination earlier this evening in this great restaurant. I am glad to say that it was a outstanding evening and the place was surely one of the reasons for the happy celebration. The waiters  helped in a pleasant style, the food was delicious and my friends were so  glad. We shall surely come back again for more joyful events. thanks very much.
Upscale sushi and dining experience in a casual setting. Beer and wine are about half price for happy hour. Emma was a lovely server!
super yum fish and special rolls, excellent udon and very good and quite long Happy Hour! Cozy atmosphere and for mid-town an A plus!!

What can I not say about this place?  My wife and I were staying round the corner, out of town from Scotland and happened upon this place.  It really is a real jewel in the NYC dining scene.  The sushi is some of the best I have ever tasted. I highly recommend the Godzilla Roll and the Suzuki Carpaccio. Mata was our server and he was wonderful.  Attentive but not persistent and he was just a genuine nice guy who cared about the work he does.  It showed.  Well done to all the crew at Gu.  You have a great thing going.

One of my favorite sushi places! My boyfriend and I come here all the time because the food is amazing and they have the best happy hour deals in the city. The wait staff is always so nice and are very accommodating to my gluten free preferences. Highly recommend!

formatted_address: 150 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: !NACIREMA

reviews.text: Bouncer let's us in, bartenders let us order and take our credit cards, 5 mins later manager kicks us out because it's a 'private party'. Get told we can't finish our drinks, we need to pay and leave. Avoid at all costs.

formatted_address: 140 Washington St, New York, NY 10006, USA
name: View of the World

reviews.text: Definitely a hidden gem. Great food,  great drinks, and great service. Perfect blend between casual and upscale with fantastic views. My wife and I had a post Valentine's dinner and could not be happier with our selection. The family style entrée are definitely a great value so come hungry.

Delicious food, friendly and very attentive staff, reasonable prices. we ordered lasagna, whole chicken and a cob - big family portions, we were full and spent less than $200 with drinks and tips. And yes, the view is amazing!

This place is great. I didn't know this going in but it's mainly an appetizer place with a lot of choices to share. They are smaller sizes so for larger parties you'll need to order more than 1. They have sharable entries that are delicious and impressively large. I recommend taking a peak at the menu.

 The views are downright amazing of course. It's 20 stories up and it faces the freedom tower which will be in full, amazing view the whole time

Came here with my two suite mates for dinner right before the start of classes, and it was so fun! There was no wait to get a table (probably bc it was a Monday night) and the food was so good. We ended up getting two small dishes and one dish to share, and we were all so stuffed at the end. The waiter was very nice to us, and he even offered to take our picture for us. When we came down from the restaurant back to the group floor, the hotel lobby boy gave me his number, which was a little peculiar, but other than that, it was a very fun experience. Would def go again.
I highly recommend you visit here and ask for a seat on the terrace. It has amazing views of the 9/11 memorial and the new world trade center building. The food was also really delicious!!!

formatted_address: 127 Atlantic Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Colonie

reviews.text: We had a lovely meal. Flavors incredible. Service delightful. We had a reservation that did not come through and the manager honored it anyway. It’s fun, it’s great food, it’s warm and friendly and a wonderful evening. Sit at the “chef’s counter”And have even more fun!

The food here was absolutely great for me. My husband also enjoyed his thoroughly, although he said his shrimp and grits didn't have the Southern kick he's accustomed to. I ordered an off the menu side of eggs with my pancakes and it was no issue. A thing though is that their portions are not that fitting for the price. That juice is absolutely freshly squeezed. ! Our waiter James was so awesomesauce as well as the chef with gray hair, so sweet. It's a small but seemingly great tasting many, presuming everything is as good as what we got. Also, the staff is so diverse and it's refreshing and beautiful. Go to Colonie.

I went to Colonies with friends to celebrate. Absolutely amazing. The drinks were superb, the food was incredible, and service and hospitality for excellent. If you are looking for a special night out hit up Colonie.

Cute place to get brunch with friends. Gets packed immediately after opening. Food is good but not everything meets your expectations. Like the pancakes are not actually pancakes but like a bundt cake. Also skip the Turkish Eggs and go for a scramble instead.
A very trendy and popular spot. Relaxed atmosphere! Superb food and good coffee. The perfect spot for breakfast and brunch. The staff were wonderful!

formatted_address: 177 2nd Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Quantum Brooklyn

reviews.text: This is a great spot to switch it up from all the Bushwick and Williamsburg clubs. The talent that comes through is amazing and on there way to the top. The intimate space allows you to get fired up with your favourite performer. See you on the dance floor!

This place used to be Analog and I have to give them credit, they really spruced it up when they rebranded to Quantum. There's new lighting, the ceiling lighting have better effects, the led screens are high def (no longer a projector). The sound system also seems to be thumping. However, when the main act came on, they just cranked up the bass and it muddied out the highs and mid.

What's worse is that this place has a MANDATORY coat check and that the credit card tab minimum is $24. I've never heard of such a thing, it's ridiculous. This place will get crowded if it's sold out so be prepared for that especially when trying to get to the bathrooms or to the bars on opposite sides of the floor.
Great sound system but the lighting looks soooo tacky and dated. Wouldn’t come back except for a few DJs that I love. Thankfully better venues seem to booking most of them.

Be careful if you go here. I gave the coat check guy a 20 and he claimed to have given me my change back even he clearly had not. He was a tall Hispanic kid with glasses and snap back. He smiled knowingly at me because he knew he had stolen from me. Very dishonest person.

Getting to location was kind of shady, I never thought I'd find a spot like this here. Came here for a corporate holiday event. Going in, there's coat check and they were super nice. It's a pretty good size venue. The DJ there was playing pretty good music, there were also people on stilts and go go dancers as well. There's a bar on each side and people serving apps. I had a fun time. Interested in coming back during a weekend to see what it's like.

formatted_address: 302 Metropolitan Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Extra Fancy

reviews.text: Good music, nice atmosphere, and delicious food. The buffalo cauliflower was so good. I will definitely be returning.
Great space with nice service. Tasty food. Awesome drinks

Great food. Smooth atmosphere and music. Been here a few times over the past 3 years and was never let down. Lobster bisque fries is a must and exclusive of Extra Fancy. Love the deviled eggs. A must catch it the oyster happy hour.  I cant help but O.D. on those Oysters. Loved the old school hip hop music night. Does that still happen, it's s been a while since I've been there and caught it. Prices aren't too steep for great food and good drinks. A must do when in the area or for a pregame before a night out! 😉
Everything was great. I had my children with me and they treated us so well

The best valentine day I ever had.
Great food - drinks and staff.
Can't wait to go back again.

formatted_address: 109 E 22nd St, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Hawksmoor New York

reviews.text: Can't wait for the opening.
Apenas está en reconstrucción, está quedando muy bien

formatted_address: 33 Avenue B, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Poco

reviews.text: This place is famous for their lobster mac and cheese, but I am vegan, and their vegan mac is something to rave about as well! It was crossed and busy the day we went so we ate outside, but probably for the best because it seems like a lively and loud in place. Which nothing is wrong with that if that's your vibe.

The vibe here was AMAZING!!! Boozy brunch is the best time to go - you get bottomless sangrias, mimosas or bloody mary. Music was awesome!!! The food was mediocre but i would definitely come back for the atmosphere and bottomless drinks 🤣
I would suggest definitely making reservations otherwise you could be waiting a couple of hours.

Came for brunch. Such a fun little gem! Our waitress kept the sangria coming (they are the definition of bottomless brunch). Food was amazing and great portioned. Never felt rushed. They starting going off with the music! 😍😍 recommend big time

The place was beautiful, music was excellent and the food was good (a little overpriced, but good). We were in a large group for a birthday party. My biggest issue came when we had to pay for the meal. We gathered all of our money (cash only) and 3 people counted, because it was almost $1,000. The waiter convinced us that was wrong and we were $40 short. We all recount again add the $40 and he came back AGAIN!! At that point we felt taken advantage of and I let the waiter know I would not give another penny. FYI - our original bill was $936 and he was given $952 even though 20% gratuity was built into the bill. 

I will never go back.

I found the place a little bit controversial as the service is great (Angel was AMAZING) but the food is really not good. We order poached eggs with chorizo and our eggs were literally boiled eggs, chorizo we couldn’t even see in our plate, I noticed that the table next order the steak, eggs and cheese sandwich which wasn’t look at the best as well. The bottle less is worth it, the amount that you will drink will make worth it for the food. Would I come back for food or dinner? Absolutely No, just because of the food. 
The place is super cool, facing the streets, they have large doors which can be open during the summer, giving a lot natural light to place, which I absolutely loved it. Our waitress was 10 out 10, very attentive, top service, constantly checking if we were ok for drinks, she is a great audition to the team. I absolutely loved the place shame the food were not good.

formatted_address: New York, NY 10029, USA
name: Casa irapuan nova york

formatted_address: 236 W 54th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: The Three Monkeys

reviews.text: This bar and restaurant was a great fi d on a Saturday night.  We hit this place just right and were able to get seated immediately.   Fun place.  Fun NYC crowd.  Efficient and friendly staff.  We needed a quick bite before heading home to CT and the staff accommodated our time pressure.

I had THE BEST time here!! I found it on a whim and am so glad I did!! The environment is so relaxed and the music keeps you in a good mood the whole time! The DJ was spinning some nice tracks the whole night. The selection of beers is awesome and definitely make sure to try the Irish Penicillin drink! It’s the best 🤤🤤🤤 Not only are the drinks good but the food is  made fresh and delicious! If you haven’t been here you need to make it happen! I will definitely be back!

Nikki is a great Bartender! Very personable. And she knows a lot about the beers they sell. Thanks for a great Christmas Eve Drink. Their food is pretty good too if you are looking for a quick bite! 
Thank you! ❤️❤️
Loved their roasted cauliflower and pita. They have a good selection of cocktails and beers as well! Plenty of seating space and a quiet ambience maintained.
The food was delicious!! Get the chicken wrap! Our service was great. We were seated quickly and the best thing of all was their play list!

formatted_address: 461 West St #23rdST, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Calle Dao Chelsea

reviews.text: Food was amazing! Came here with my girls for a weeknight ladies dinner and was pleasantly surprised with the ambience and food. I had the chicken and yellow rice and the rest of the group had the 5-Spice Skirt Steak. We then had the Coconut Cake Flan and sparkling rose to top off the meal. No one left a crumb on their plate so guess we all enjoyed! Will definitely come back.
A great date night location. The food was amazing and the service was kind and friendly. I recommend ordering the Beef and Broccoli.

Dropped in during happy hour, and perhaps we caught them a little early, as the initial service was a little slower than expected, but once they were organized in the moment they really were wonderful.
