We enjoyed the Yucca fries and some plantain with a dipping sauce.  Prices for happy hour were excellent, so we’ll be stopping by from time to time.  Very nice people with a nice atmosphere and space for fusion.

The service is very pleasant and the drinks are strong.  I have to say that while the bao were really tasty, they were tiny.  I was still really hungry afterward while my friends had paid the same price for significantly more food.  My suggestion to the restaurant is to add two more bao (they're extremely simple to make) or turn the bao dish into an appetizer.  The skimpy salad did nothing to make the meal more substantial.

Highly recommend! Delicious food, refreshing drinks, excellent service, and an upbeat atmosphere. Steven made our experience delightful. He was very prompt and attentive. The grilled chicken sandwich was made perfectly with a fresh aioli and ciabatta bread. This is also the perfect place for satisfying your brunch needs. The bottomless brunch option is a fun way to spend a Saturday or Sunday afternoon with friends. Will definitely return to this location.

formatted_address: 116 E 60th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Ivy Lane

reviews.text: We had an outstanding experience with Ivy Lane and the staff are really professional. My wife and I were looking for a restaurant in the city to host our daughters first birthday. Our friend recommended we check out Ivy Lane. We took the family out for dinner to try the food a service before booking. After dinner we knew this was the restaurant for us. The food was impeccable. The service was outstanding. Ultimately, we decided to host our daughters first birthday for 70 people at Ivy Lane. They immediately set us up with the event coordinator Amy, and she is a true professional. She was on top of every detail. We were worried that they wouldn't be able to handle so many people at once, but I was wrong. Fernando and Amy are amazing! The party was a hit. People can't stop raving about it. Everything went smooth and everyone left very happy. Thank you to all the staff. I will definitely be back for dinner and I highly recommend this restaurant.  The Gnocchi and pappardelle are amazing!

Excellent experience at this newly opened spot on 60th st. Friendly staffs and delicious menus.  Seemed like they had very interesting cocktails to offer as well. We liked the beef tartare and squid ink gnocchi very much. Can’t wait to return. Highly recommend.

The place is newly renovated and looks nice. For the price I expected more from both the location and the food. Me and a colleague shared a ribeye for two that was definitely not big enough for two people even with ordering two sides. Awkward! I got Chinese food on seamless after our work dinner.

Food and service were outstanding. A little noisy as not a whole lot of room and you are sitting close to other diners but will return as the NY Strip was outstanding and the small plates were also great. Price was reasonable for Manhattan with a causal feel.
Great cocktails, lots of options to chose from. A very diverse menu. The beef bibimbap was on special and was amazing, and the bone marrow  was interesting in presentation would recommend.

formatted_address: 575 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Hudson Hound

reviews.text: This place is great and spacious, the food was delightful and the prices were very economical. quick, efficient service and very affable waiters. Will definitely recommend this place.

Great atmosphere, fantastic food.  A warm, friendly place with hearty comfort food.  The drinks were delicious, and the staff was extremely courteous.  Can't recommend enough.  

There were a lot of children here, who were a little loud.  I'm not sure why, because otherwise it was a very classy and adult place.  But besides that, I loved all of it.
Great Irish feed
Fun local spot. Great beer selection, and tasty bites. Good place to meet some old and new friends alike and spend some time unwinding

We have loved this place from way back when it was known as Dublin. The fish and chips are the best anywhere. Irish soda bread is perfect with their lovely soups. I'm so glad the risotto is back on the menu. It's a friendly neighborhood place with a wonderful bar and welcoming service.

formatted_address: 512 W 42nd St Dept Lohan, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Lohan Club

formatted_address: 64 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: The Meatball Shop

reviews.text: I liked the atmosphere of this place, it has a cozy vibe and perfect lighting for dining. The food was good. We had the mozzarella balls and the meatball hero with the beef/pork meatballs, tomato sauce and provolone. They had a drink special, not sure of the name of it but it had tequila and it was good! The service was great, our server was very friendly and helpful. I can't wait to go back and try out some of the other menu options.

Servers at this location are AWESOME. You always feel like you're at a friend's place. However, the last three times I've been here, the meatballs didn't sit well.  Quite salty. Sauces are okay, but you can tell they're made quickly and have a lot of sugar/acidity to them. Portions are more than adequate, but expect to feel your dinner sitting like a block for several hours afterwards.
Very affordable and friendly little shop. Our food was prepared super quickly. Who  ULL I’d be a great place to grab lunch as a local or tourist.

The vibe of this place is awesome along with the staff and of course the meatballs! I had the beef with classic sauce in a bowl with mashed potatoes & mushrooms. Everything was delicious and my buddy and I had a good time eating there. Staff was super friendly and tunes were perfect! I’d eat here again for sure.
Oldie but goodie! Been here many times in the past but haven’t been recently. A friend was visiting and we had dinner here. The spaghetti stuffed meatballs were filling! Definitely delicious.

formatted_address: W 44th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Bar Building

reviews.text: It's one of the many places I enjoy in the Capitol of The Planet - New York City!
In an out
Siempre la comida esta deliciosa!

formatted_address: 949 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: The Calaveras

reviews.text:
A charming small space with delicious food. I love their corn soup, steak tacos, and authentic offerenda. 

Everything we ate was delicious. When ordering tacos for sure get three instead of two.. they’re small but SUPER QUALITY. The corn soup was even better than i would have imagined. This place was a little pricey for our typically low low budget but it was worth it!

One of the best mexican restaurants in NYC. I know that we can find more and more mexican food options in this great city but to find a really authentic and delicious food it's a challenge. Well, that said please visit The Calaveras and don't think that the place is just what you can see from the street, there are more space downstairs as you can see from the pictures and the chilaquiles with steak are woooooow 😋😋

Nice cozy place. Has a small up stairs bar but the real place is downstairs. Feels warm and not like a basement. 

Simply decorated and has a good looking bar. Small outdoor patio like space. 

They are pretty new so things might change but the service was good and food is recommendable.

What a great restaurant. The food was delicious— flavorful but also healthy, my salmon was perfectly prepared. Indeed family friendly but still bustling and enjoyable if we didn’t have kids there. The margarita hit the spot. We’ll be back!
Great Mexican restaurant with good drinks and nice service. I can recommend the vegetarian Empanadas and Hibiscus Margarita.

formatted_address: 320 W 36th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: TGA NYC

reviews.text: First time eating at TGA.  Was amazing!  Enjoyed the food, atmosphere and service. Drinks were made to perfection. Sister had a delicious watermelon mimosa made from freshly pressed watermelon.  Waiter was very attentive on our table.  Offered his opinion on different things on menu that we might enjoy.  Also, located next door to the Crown Plaza hotel.  Very convenient if u need a nice place to stay.  Short walk to Time Square area.  Rate it 5 star.

We visited this restaurant with a group of friends. It’s not in a high traffic area and we had to seek it out. The restaurant is pretty and well kept. The server was friendly and patient. We ordered chicken and waffle sandwich, crab cake sliders and wings. Everything was good, just wish it was a little more flavorful. My favorite was the crab cake sliders.

Not bad. I had a really good dish, it was their half chicken with mashed potatoes and veggies. It came with a delicious sauce. I wanted their lamb ragu but it's being taken off their menu. Service was very good. Their options are pretty limited I think, it was hard to decide what I wanted. Also pricey.
Great environment, food and staff.  Prices are reasonable and decor is modern.  The only thing I did not care for was co-ed bathrooms.

Fantastic ambiance, perfect stop for a luxurious meal after a day in Manhattan during the holidays. A distinguished selection of appetizers and entrees. Vegetarian, vegan and gluten free options. While selective, the menu has something for everyone. Smaller portions leave room to savor each course. Dessert satisfies the palate and finishes off the experience. Don't forget to try a signature cocktail and take a group picture.

formatted_address: 150 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: The Russian Tea Room

reviews.text: A quaint landmark restaurant with great character. The place was empty on a Sunday, but filled up eventually creating a more lively space. The green and gold atmosphere is paired with authentic Russian tradition. Be sure to look around for some of the more Russian-influenced customers, complete with oligarch-style tracksuits and women in fur hats. Our server, Vladimir, was friendly and knowledgeable, serving traditional Russian tea with cherry preserves and Stroganoff. The warm hospitality paired with the sheer honesty about personal preferences on the menu really brings Moscow to you. I felt like the only thing missing was a picture of Putin on the walls!

The Russian Tea Room is the stuff of urban legends of a time when high society would dine here before or after performances at Carnegie Hall or other theatres. Opulent decor on par with the lavish style of Czarist Russia.  Beautiful main dining room in rich colours, event spaces on ascending floors such as the Bear Room featuring art glass ceiling, dancing, juggling bear and a tree sculpture resplendent with imitation Faberge like eggs adorning the branches.  Tall chimney glasses protect wedding guests from dripping wax in the Bear Ballroom.  The Hearth Room featuring inlaid floors and tortoiseshell effect panelling is also another event space available for special occasions. Legendary NYC dining and watering holes such as Elaine's is gone with only a few spots like Tavern on the Green, Bemelmans, and 21 Club still around.  I know many critics say that the food and service is not what it may have been once, but I found it to be very good and it was a chance to experience the magic of old New York.

Amazing building, worth going just to look at the art work and curios.
But food very average at best; this is not "fine dining" in any sense of the word.
And the price/quality ratio is very low; there are many other places in NYC that offer much better food at much lower prices.

It's a special place in New York City. Went for afternoon tea with my husband for our anniversary.

The 3-stars is reflective of:
The server was not very warm, nor friendly - very Russian? 

Also

Unfortunately there was a table with two children who were very loud and running around the table. I understand it is a public place but when I am spending $200 for afternoon tea, I expected a server or a host to ask them to a least request they calm their children down.

Drinks we fantastic... but a little heavy priced.. 3 cocktails and tip is $100... so for that.. I’d doubt I’d go back. But it is very good. The bear fish tank on the second floor was pretty cool to look at though.

formatted_address: 23 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Jia NYC Beer, Wine & Sake Restaurant

reviews.text:
This place will surprise you. It’s fairly small, for about 15 people including 5 seats at the bar. Interior represents the vibe of East Village. Lots of small souvenirs, photos make you feel like inside a friend’s house. Especially if you’re welcomed by the owner, Christine, who will carefully guide you through the menu and suggest the best dish for your type of hunger.

The food... I didn’t expect it to be so tasty! And my expectations were high. Sweet potato fries were the best I ever tried in my life. The beef salad had so many elements that combined together made for a surprising experience. And prices are absurdly low for that kind of food quality in Big Apple.

This place is perfect for having a meal out in a comfortable home-like environment, when you just don’t feel like cooking home or want to surprise someone visiting the city.

Last tip: try the pork belly dish. Didn’t get it myself but heard some very good recommendations.

This place will surprise you. It’s fairly small, for about 15 people including 5 seats at the bar. Interior represents the vibe of East Village. Lots of small souvenirs, photos make you feel like inside a friend’s house. Especially if you’re welcomed by the owner, Christine, who will carefully guide you through the menu and suggest the best dish for your type of hunger.

The food... I didn’t expect it to be so tasty! And my expectations were high. Sweet potato fries were the best I ever tried in my life. The beef salad had so many elements that combined together made for a surprising experience. And prices are absurdly low for that kind of food quality in Big Apple.

This place is perfect for having a meal out in a comfortable home-like environment, when you just don’t feel like cooking home or want to surprise someone visiting the city.

Last tip: try the pork belly dish. Didn’t get it myself but heard some very good recommendations.

Jia brings "home" cooking levels up with creative dishes prepared to perfection! The pork belly was simply awesome. The salmon was tasty, not over- or under-cooked. The brussel sprouts with cranberries exquisite. The pulled-pork sandwich and sweet potato fries were a delicious combination. The bread pudding was arguably one of the best we've ever tasted. And the pumpkin pannacotta the perfect finish to a seasonal fall dessert. Portions were perfectly sized. Nice selection of beer and wine. More than just a small LES restaurant, the owner treats all guests like family coming "home".

Such amazing service and a beautiful cozy location not only leaves you full of amazing food but full of love. I have never walked out of a place so full in my life. Each item on the menu is bursting with flavour. I highly recommend a visit. If you are lucky you will get a window seat on a beautiful day the front window right up!

This place will surprise you. It’s fairly small, for about 15 people including 5 seats at the bar. Interior represents the vibe of East Village. Lots of small souvenirs, photos make you feel like inside a friend’s house. Especially if you’re welcomed by the owner, Christine, who will carefully guide you through the menu and suggest the best dish for your type of hunger.

The food... I didn’t expect it to be so tasty! And my expectations were high. Sweet potato fries were the best I ever tried in my life. The beef salad had so many elements that combined together made for a surprising experience. And prices are absurdly low for that kind of food quality in Big Apple.

This place is perfect for having a meal out in a comfortable home-like environment, when you just don’t feel like cooking home or want to surprise someone visiting the city.

Last tip: try the pork belly dish. Didn’t get it myself but heard some very good recommendations.

formatted_address: 3206 3rd Ave #1, The Bronx, NY 10451, USA
name: Club Sociale

formatted_address: 9 W 53rd St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: The Modern

reviews.text: Definitely a good place to eat if you're in the area! There's a parking garage right across the street which is not too pricey. It's about $3/hour. I usually get the blackened salmon and a strawberry lemonade. The salmon is perfectly seasoned and the lemon sauce it's served with is so good! The mashed potatoes are the bomb and not too salty at all. I also recommend the red velvet cheesecake. You can't go wrong with that! Ambiance is nice and you don't have to dress too fancy. I recommend this place for birthday dinners. Beware though: they do not take reservations

I finally experienced the Kitchen Table at the Modern!  Amazing! Each course was beautiful and delicious and it was so personal meeting everyone in the kitchen and having the opportunity to really watch how all of it was prepared. I was able to walk all around in the kitchen and ask questions and see things up close. Staff are extremely attentive make you feel like the center of attention. A really special dining experience for someone who loves culinary artistry as much as I.

I heartily recommend this restaurant to you. The quality of service they provided was amazing! Their foods and drinks were excellent. They deserve great ratings! I can't wait to visit this place again with my family and relatives. Thank you very much for your outstanding assistance and food. The best of the best in town.

We were shown the menu and taken orders before seating so the food came immediately as we sat down which was so convenient of us. The venue was impressive! I couldn't ask for more! Everything was great especially their staff, they accommodated us professionally and well-mannered. Thank you so much for the genuine service.

One of the only times I've truly been impressed by the execution of a caviar dish. The plating at the Modern, was definitely some of the more impressive preparations I've had. Technically sound dishes well balanced with textures, and flavors. The definition of a once in a while treat.

The decor of the restaurant is very unique, with the outer windows going directly into the sculpture garden of the MOMA. With interior decorations stark white as ballerinas throughout the restaurant. 

I don't know if I'm a repeat customer to the Modern, but I certainly don't regret the first visit.

formatted_address: 137 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Mazaar Lounge

reviews.text: Absolutely loved this joint. Very lowkey, for a Wednesday night. Service was A1. Hookah A1. Couldn't ask for more to be honest.
Good music! Variety of hookahs and drinks
Drinks weren't good & very pricy everything else perfect though
I went on a Saturday afternoon at 6pm, it said it was open on the website and it was closed. A waste of a cab !
get here before they charge you and entry fee other than that ... I enjoyed the hookah and the drinks here

formatted_address: 52 Stone St, New York, NY 10004, USA
name: Stone Street Tavern

reviews.text: Good spot to get some few drinks after work. The food is pretty good here as well. My only negative experience is how they make their old fashion here. It's not that great and they put cherry instead of an orange peel and it comes in a small glass with tons of ice and charge 20 bucks for it. I get that it's FiDi and the prices are competitive and I don't mind the price if it's good but I was pretty disappointed. Other than that, overall my experience was good.

Tasty food in a great ambiance of a small tavern from the Financial District. It can be noisy (great place for drinking beer while watching sport events on screens) but you will find some tables to have quieter discussions. We ordered salads which were generous with lot of flavors. Staff is very friendly. Great time for a lunch (and probably evening and dinner)!

Albeit expensive, I must admit that I very much enjoy the food. First of all, the benches outside is a big plus for the restaurant. The staff very friendly. The food is phenomenal and I love the jar that your drink is served into. The French fries seasoned! In my book, that was raised the bar to a higher level. To detress and relax from the office, go eat there for lunch. You will not regret it!
Nice discover. Great food and nice ambient. We had the main lobster, tuna sandwich and grilled chicken with pesto.

There for a Christmas party. The atmosphere is lovely, old New York. In the summer, this is the only block where you can legally drink outside. (Although that doesn't stop anyone in the South Street Seaport area.) The food was very good. I'll definitely return to try the restaurant's regular menu. The staff were gracious and helpful, taking care of all the guests. I highly recommend this place and look forward to visiting again soon.

formatted_address: 1367 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: Cafe Evergreen

reviews.text: Reserved a table for 12 for my birthday. The staff was so sweet on the phone and very accommodating. We were seated right away when we arrived, and attended to immediately. Great selection of dim sum, and good noodle dishes as well. Very reasonably priced. Will be back!
Superb ambience and very affable service. The food was crisp and delicious. Will absolutely recommend this place to friends. Reasonable rates and generous meals. Keep it up.
The most amazingly delicious gluten free menu! The dim sum were full of flavor, light and not too doughy.  The egg white and minced beef soup was delicate, yet filling and delicious.

If you look past the somewhat sterile decor of this place you are in for some great dim sum. They have a ton of dumpling options it's hard not to go overboard ordering. They even have gluten free ones which we tried as well and they were surprisingly good!
This spot is worth trying. They have large portions for affordable prices. Regularly clean and with great character. Highly recommended.

formatted_address: 123 Washington St #51B, New York, NY 10006, USA
name: Wingcraptel

formatted_address: 1890 Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd, New York, NY 10026, USA
name: Osteria Laura

reviews.text: The food is excellent and so is their great Italian wine, their Italian chief came out to meet us because we asked if he had a moment to meet us , we wanted to tell him how delicious  our meal was , he was very nice and even explained some of his cooking techniques. He also suggested a desert . The salad was so fresh , our meal was like homemade. I highly recommend this restaurant. Staff is very attentive.
Great food and excellent service! We  were also surprised with a birthday dessert.

What a wonderful dining experience! Every staff member was beyond gracious. We went with two babies and toddler (who has severe food allergies) and they were so accommodating, double checking everything and sending the chef out to specifically speak with us. Great for both families and date nights. The food was outstanding. So happy to have this gem in our neighborhood!
Very good food and nice staff! Italian food with lots of variety to choose from! Don't forget to ask for the red house wine!

I was scouting up in Harlem and decided to have a nice dinner before jumping into traffic.  Was quite happy with the tagliatelle with a meat ragu.  A fine dish it was.  And the chef was imported directly from the Puglia region of Italy!  What more could one ask?  The staff was sweet and attentive.  Would gladly return.

formatted_address: 794 Washington Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11238, USA
name: Shane's Brooklyn

reviews.text:
Great restaurant.  Caribbean Vibes.  The food was delicious.  Cinnamon donut waffle is a must try.   Wow. That was delicious.  No syrup needed.  The whiting was seasoned so well.  I would definitely go back.

Update:  I went back.  I still loved it.

This is a beautiful black owned business with homey high quality food! Brilliant art work and friendly staff. Food takes a while to come out and it is WELL worth the wait. This is a great local business that I feel awesome supporting not only because it’s delicious but because we have to support local business in the neighborhood! THE GRITS AND FISH AND THE PANCAKES ARE AMAZING!

We LOVE black-owned business!!! The food was INSANELY DELICIOUS (even though I ordered a simple breakfast), and definitely worth the wait, which, was very very long. They even have it on their shirt “fast food is not good, good food is not fast”. If you have some time it’s definitely worth a try!!

My first experience with Shane's was back in 2016. My niece was college bound and her mom reserved the downstairs for her send off.  The food was fresh and well prepared. I've been back several times since then and appreciate the consistency in good food and service. The staff is friendly and professional. It's rear in BK but so appreciated. Today, I invited some friends to experience the same and Shane's did not disappoint.  Thank you so much!
SUCH A WARM & WELCOMING STAFF... BEAUTIFUL ENVIRONMENT... AND AWESOMELY DELICIOUS CUISINE... I CAN'T WAIT TO RETURN AGAIN... AND AGAIN... AND AGAIN...😋❤

formatted_address: 442 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: The Gin Mill

reviews.text: Jack and Jason are great. They always provide amazing customer service and are extremely friendly. I even witnessed Jack dealing with an unruly older couple visiting verbally assaulting him and he handled himself in an extremely professional matter as the man hassled him rudely. Always a great experience!
Great friendly service, half off whole bar till 8 pm but there is always a daily special that makes revisiting fun and exciting. Big space for groups, awesome bar food and  great music.
Everyday cheap prices and attentive wait staff.  Left my card overnight and it was still here... Good people.  TY!

They offer happy hour deals basically out of any reasons you can think of—which is coming from the true spirit of running a bar, I personally think. Beers taste how it’s supposed to be, and the foods are attentive to the classic while boasting their own touch.

It's the sister bar to Jake's dilemma. Together they are part of the sprawling ny best bar syndicate. A familiar atmosphere or beer soaked wood, big screens, load music, drinking games and off peak specials draw throngs of college types. Food is consistent pub grub. Come for half priced pitchers but ask for a glass, those plastic mugs take cheap too far. Maybe you'll get lucky. It's where I met my wife!

formatted_address: 34 W 32nd St fl 12, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Space Billiards & Karaoke Bar NYC

reviews.text:
I have never been to the karaoke bar so can't comment on that. But I actually really like the top floor pool bar. They have a decent number of tables available but it gets busy so be prepared to pull up a chair at the bar and wait. 

Staff are not the most helpful but there is nothing to complain about.

Best time to go is during happy hr for the special price on pool tables! Went on a Friday and surprisingly wasn't at all crowded during this time, which I enjoyed - it was almost like having the place to yourself! By 8-9pm that's when it picks up, more people, louder music, very good vibe/music (90s, 2000s, today's top 40, hip hop, pop, r&b). Drink menu has tons of options so if you're like me and never know what you want, it's good to take a peek at it!

Cool vibes, average price for the city. Wasn't  very packed when I went and food service was fast. 

I definitely recommend their soju! Their mango one was delicious.

Overall a great time...they would intermittently come to clean our plates and drinks from our pool area. The waiter did try to take my half full bottle of beer...luckily I managed to save it!

I mean the place was nice enough, but it's a decent amount of money per hour ($25 when I went) and it was super loud. I get that's some people's cup of tea, but not typically an environment I want to play a game like pool that requires concentration. Probably great for a younger crowd who want something to do while drinking, and larger groups wouldnt be too bad for the price per hour.

Went on a Friday night around 10ish and it wasn't too crowded. The wait for a pool table wasn't too long and we got drinks in the meantime. Around $35 per hour for a table for four. The service was great! Very accommodating. Decor was cool,space themed.

formatted_address: 2249 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10029, USA
name: Yave Tequila

reviews.text: Great Place, Great Prices & Great tasting Yave Tequila!
Best tequila !!

formatted_address: New York, NY 10119, USA
name: 1879 Club

reviews.text: BCTV. ORG

formatted_address: 80 Grove St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: The Monster

reviews.text: A tip top gay venue in the heart of Manhattan! It is like a pilgrimage coming here, this place and the people who fought for gay rights in 1969 brought about the gay rights we enjoy today.  A truly historic venue!

Many handsome guys are very good at owning their bodies. Great place for thrilling entertainment and new sensations.
Very often promotions take place here, and you can always get free cocktails and a separate room for an hour. To do this, you need to register on 909gay,com, create a profile and just show it to the administrator. I got lucky. I loved this place and will come again.
Great meeting place bar. Life music was very loud. But met nice people.

Always a must stop for me (a traveler) during the holidaze.  Patrick, our Friday barkeep, was wonderful (our Saturday barkeep Mataeus? was "out to lunch").  Music and camaraderie puts everyone in a festive mood.

What a night it was!
We arrived 11:50 pm Saturday night, but by the time we got to the entrance, it was 12 am. I explained that we arrived before midnight actually, and after giving the bouncers the password, my huge group of about 10 people was able to pay $5 cover charge and we all got in smoothly. I have to admit I’m always wary about unfriendly bouncers, and luckily they were fine. Coat check was $2 (and not mandatory) too, which is a pretty good find compared to most other clubs. 

My group was unsure about going to a gay club, but I think I converted most of them by the end! The go-go boys are not my thing, and you kind of just get used to it after a while. Funnily enough, some of them in the crowd danced on my female friends and revealed that they were actually all straight ?? 

ALCOHOL: Online it had said $5 Miller Lite and $6 vodka Red Bull’s, but at the bar in the downstairs club, it was $6 tequila/Bulldog gin shots and margaritas, and $6 Budlight or $7 for another beer. Something else was $8. Still great deals though!

MUSIC: Great for the most part! There was some Nicki Minaj, some Rihanna, some Latino music, a couple of songs that were maybe techno (this is when I left). Unfortunately though, it’s crazy LOUD in here, even when the MC was introducing the dancers. Wish I brought earplugs. 

THE BAD: yep, my 3 guy friends whom I brought here all got groped in the back and the front. Also, for a gay club, I’m surprised that my group was dancing the most? There were a few other guys dancing, but nothing like the gay club I went to in Singapore where 80% of the people were dancing—and better than how clubgoers of other places dance.

formatted_address: 202 E 7th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Sake Bar Satsko

reviews.text: I regularly come purchasing some food in this place. I liked the swift service and well prepared food. Great work.
Just the right size to cram all your friends in, drink a bottle of black dragon sake and make some mistakes

Great laid back atmosphere with knowledgeable and friendly staff. Good selection of Saké, plum wine, and Japanese beers. The bar tender was even cool enough to walk us through the right way to do sake bombs. It was great and we had a blast!

I felt quite old at Satsko, but that is not a bad thing at all. Take one of the best sake selections in NYC coupled with an enthusiastic staff who believe in making sake enjoyable for everyone and you have a fantastic sake bar.
Amazing staff, surprisingly good food, and a wonderful atmosphere. This is one of my favorite spots to sit and have a drink.

formatted_address: 201 W 79th St, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Nice Matin

reviews.text: Stopped in for dinner and was pleasantly surprised! Had the lobster forte which was simply amazing and fresh! My sister had the hanger steak which she couldn’t stop raving about. Just a great time overall and so pleased with the food and service. Will surely be back and recommend to our friends.

A nice variety of great, healthy food and great brunch. They take reservations which is a HUGE PLUS because most places won't and this was a birthday celebration than included an 88 year old who wasn't going to wait 30 minutes to an hour for a table. Food was very good and service very nice. An eggs Benedict, a hearty fritatta, a crab Cobb salad and other delicious food.

Danny's management in the front of the house enabled the most brilliant meal to come from the back of the house to our table. I can't remember when cod was ever that perfect combination of crisp on the outside and delicate within. Fresh and flavorful. Every element from start to finish was sumptuous and satisfying. My wonderful date had called ahead to advise Danny of my impossible food allergy to nickel which is in most everything. If they could create such a magnificent meal for me with all of the limitations systemic nickel allergy syndrome brings, imagine what you'll get! Many thanks to Danny for his professional and deeply committed service to his audience.                       Karen Michaels Moss

We like a lot to go out. Last night we went to this excellent restaurant which we didn’t know before. We passed a delightful time there with great cooking and a professional team and a distinguished  cuisine. We put this place in our list  and we will no doubt return soon.  Highly recommended.

I told my friends about this restaurant with my warmest recommendations. I go their often. This recommendation is always successful. The the food there is yummy and the team is attentive and cooperative. Whenever we eat in this place we enjoy a lovely time.  warmly recommended.

formatted_address: 11 Varick St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Girello

reviews.text: Pizza was really good.  I had the meat pizza and the meat quality was good and so was the quantity.  I would recommend the food.  The service was lacking though.  The server seemed to care more about their cell phone then swerving us, and was short when talking to us.
Atmosphere was great, but pizza tasted like it was sitting out and then reheated.
The pizza was excellent very the sauce was thick and the crust wasn't burn, very fresh testing. I thought it wouldn't be good , but you prove me wrong.
Perfectly awful.There were 4 people sitting at the bar and us. The bartender truly could have cared less if we were there.  The people sitting at the bar were friendlier than the bartender.
Nice quiet lunch at Girello, fast friendly service.

formatted_address: 64 Fulton St, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: Cinnabar Pictures

reviews.text: Standout productions, no BS. This is the real deal!

formatted_address: 327 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Fred Sessoms

formatted_address: 2170 Broadway, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: RedFarm

reviews.text: Although it was cool to see Asian food presented in a more New-American/hip setting, the food was just okay, especially given the very high prices. The restaurant was also very crowded. You can get much more in terms of quantity, authenticity, and tastiness elsewhere. However, this place may make Asian (I say Asian because they have Chinese/Korean/Japanese/other Asian offerings) food more approachable to a Western audience who is not familiar with such food with the nice presentation of the food and the hip setting.
Chinese fusion at its best.   The French country ambiance meshed well with the Instagram ready dishes (and they had a taste to match)
One of the best i've had! But it is very pricy! There are a lot of cheaper restaurants that deliver the same quality and service. The crispy beef is out of this world though.
I want to love this place, but at the end of the day it's over priced for what it is. The pastrami egg rolls are amazing. Would go back for that and a cocktail but not dinner.
Amazing Asian fusion with twist of american style Chinese.  Great homemade ginger ale.  Fried rice was amazing along with dumplings

formatted_address: Basement, 50 Bowery, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Green Lady

reviews.text: Bouncers and manager that are extremely rude for a bottom tier club. Laughable.  Make sure to remind them they are bottom feeders on your way out!

Places entrance is pretty cool. Looks like an old subway station entrance. The floor is pretty open for dancing and they do have a VIP section in the back which is weird as you want the VIP with more visibility than most. Bartenders were busy but responsive. Sound is pretty good for the The Florist show I went to. Overall if you are looking for a place to get some dancing in and just enjoy the night this is the place to do it.
Not my cup of tea. Maybe it's just the beginning and there will be improvements in the future

Relatively new club, under the hotel 50 Bowery. You get in free if you stay in the hotel but i think cover is 10$ otherwise. Drinks were relatively cheap at under 30$ for two drinks. Music was weird, a lot of early 90’s hip hop but I don’t think the DJ was reading the room because no one was dancing. Pretty empty at 12:45 when we left!  Good if you want a place to start but not end in China town
Baddddddd.... never coming back. Security guy got all mad that I’m not taking my little jacket off even tho it was a part of my outfit.. ?! Haha . Not happening. Too much problems...

formatted_address: 52 W 13th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Society Cafe

reviews.text:
Enjoyed lunch : we were almost the only people in the restaurant, lovely ambience (loved the black and whites prints adorning the walls), service was delightful and the food delicious and largish portions (for our moderate appetites!). Good vegetarian options! A place we look forward to visiting.

And if you do go to the bathrooms, check out the wall paper!!

Interesting, quiet, and dark bar in the back of the lobby of the Jade hotel. Service was a bit flummoxed and seated our group at a super tight table when totally empty and was a bit confused when we asked to move to one with more room. The starters were all phenomenal though the main course was a bit disappointing. The flatbreads were absolutely amazing and the oysters were very good, served with little bottles of Tabasco. The barraca was also sublime with amazing fresh cheese. The chicken for two entree  was sadly a bit bland. The skin was crispy and flavor packed, but the flavor didn't make it into the meat. Again the service was slow with the dessert and disappeared with the take home food for a concerning amount of time. Cocktails from the bar were pretty good but nothing outstanding.

Grape and Vine is situated inside the Jade Hotel in Greenwich Village, which makes it a little hard to find.  Once you enter the lobby, your senses will be engaged by the warm fireplace and the chic decor. To start off, I recommend the East Coast Oysters.  Follow it up with the delectable Pancko Crusted Chicken, which was cooked flawlessly enough to entrap the spices and flavors.  The greens served as a perfect compliment to the chicken/

This place has pretty good digs and a great atmosphere, we have been a few times and thoroughly enjoy the menu. The service can be slow at times but they are so friendly we tend to ignore it. All around: come eat here, you will not be disappointed.
Very upscale bar and restaurant. Great collection of fine Scotches.

formatted_address: 1535 Broadway, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Crossroads

reviews.text:
I recently stumbled upon the Crossroads buffet offering while visiting the Marriot. I found the buffet to be a great value for the overall selection of freshly prepared buffet items. 
I have taken a  star away because the employees seemed to be completely overwhelmed while the seating hadn't even reached 50% occupancy. Delays on bringing water, coffee or a check to a table of customers who opted for the buffet is inexcusable. 
I will probably return because the buffet was that good. Hopefully service will also rise to the occasion.

Staff very helpful and friendly.  They knew in advance that a large party was expected and they did their best to seat everyone together.  I was a little disappointed  with the buffet.  It was not like anything I saw on their website. Just one short row of food  and desserts, however, the food was tasty!  So many people....a beautiful hotel !
Top notch.  Not sure whats up with the haters about the service....
There service was friendly, but the kitchen was extremely slow even though the restaurant was not crowded. The food was good, but not great.

This restaurant is located in the Marriott Marquis, which is where we stayed. We visited for the breakfast buffet one morning ($36 per person). The buffet included juices and omelets to order. That made the buffet a better value than simply ordering off the menu. The was a large selection of things to choose from and we were in and out in no time. We also attempted to have dinner in the restaurant one night, but were disappointed in the lack of choices to order from. We ended up leaving to eat someplace else.

formatted_address: 435 W 31st St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Bluestone Lane Manhattan West Café

reviews.text: We want here today for a am drink, was very chilly outside and this cafe was a great coffee stop, was warm, smelt great and the staff were super friendly! We have dairy allergies and the start were super friendly when we were asking about dietary requirements! Would recommend.

This place is an oasis in midtown. The staff at this Bluestone Lane really brightened our day. The breakfast burrito will change your life for the better. Tim (the manager) greeted us with a big smile and made sure we were taken care of. Love this place - can't wait to go back!

This is a wonderful little spot in the mess of construction that surrounds it. Always warm and inviting and attentive staff. I love the Aussie Iced Chocolate and the Avocado toast. A surprisingly good combo!

Most air conditioned indoor seats are reserved as table service, even though the menu looks the same as other regular Bluestone Lane coffee shops. It's too muggy to get take-out to sit outdoor here. Missing the relaxing casual vibes I expected. Went to the other Bluestone Lane at Hudson Yards instead.

Bluestone Lane, I have plenty of good words to say about this place... The food is Great! The Service is extraordinary! The decor is absolutely astounding! I am addicted to the Iced Chai latte, Green tea latte, and cold brew. Shotout to Tim and the entire Crew, even the back of the house staff! Come check it out!!!

formatted_address: 626 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Brunetti

reviews.text:
Excellent pizza, good service. They forgot my additions, but it was delicious anyway, and they apologized and billed it appropriately.
(Lucky, though, that I wanted whole wheat crust? More upsetting if I'd asked for gluten free and they forgot that.)

Great location for a pizza shop. I came here for lunch and margarita was $12. The lunch menu had 5-6 more lunch specials at the same price. The place is cozy and I would consider coming back for dinner. The pizza came out fairly fast and it was good. Little burnt on the top but still good. The waitress there was super friendly and helpful.

Cozy location and great pizza. Had a great pizza which came quite fast thanks to the oven which was fired at the right temperature. Everything tasted like in Naples and felt like I was in Italy. Pizza was a bit burnt, but it's artisanal way of making pizza which I personally prefer. So overall definitely worth trying.

Excellent, authentic Italian pizza in a casual environment. Price is reasonable, and service is great. Highly recommend.

Absolutely loved the primitivo red wine they had available for glass pours. The soppressata pizza was also phenomenal.

The restaurant has a nice atmosphere that fits almost any occasion.  Very much enjoyed dinner here.
Love this place! Must must try their original and unique mushroom truffle honey pizza! Better than it sounds and so addicting

formatted_address: 29A Clinton St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Omar's Kitchen and Rum Bar

reviews.text: Omar’s Kitchen did not disappoint me at all! From the moment I stepped in I was  greeted at the door with a smile. Unfortunately we did not make reservations but was welcomed to eat at the bar with no wait time.  From the friendly staff to the diverse crowd, delicious food, and amazing music I felt as though I was back in Jamaica! Omar was very welcoming to his guest, he did not hesitate to step away from cooking to interact with his customers! I truly appreciated my time here. I will definitively will be coming back! Thank you Omars Kitchen!
Nice intimate spot. Drink were small and not strong. Food is full of flavor and lil spice
New hot spot on the block! Pull up and grab you a good bite, dope decor and professional staff.

I live in the area, and they just opened a couple of weeks ago. Amazing spot for food and drinks and great ambiance. Pretty unique for the area and beats Miss Lily’s when it comes to Caribbean food. 

The bar is also nice if you’re looking to grab a drink. Would recommend the thoughtfully spiced rum punch and the glazed chicken wings. 

If you’re very hungry, the jerk chicken is a good half a chicken — and you’ll have no problem finishing it.

This place was so cozy. I was here with my girlfriend and a friend of ours. We were looking for a place at 11:30pm on a Saturday who would take a reservation. This place came up and I am so glad that we chose this place. We got to meet the owner as well who was so outgoing and friendly. 

While the menu was a bit limited (they’re new), the food that was available was absolutely worth it. We had scallops, wings, oxtails, lobster and it was tasty and affordable. Spent around $30 each. The mango and guava-pineapple juice was amazing. I will be back!

formatted_address: 42 Grove St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Buvette

reviews.text: Délicieux was the Food! Cute french cafe/bar. Came here for breakfast. Would highly recommend. The breakfast was so delicious and well flavored. I keep dreaming about the eggs, which are amazing, so soft. The waffle was perfectly sweetened. I would say it's not much of a group gathering place, more for you and your significant other, meet with a friend type of vibe or honestly come alone. I can't wait to come back .

Discovered this place one night as we walked by looking for a bar to hang out in. Newly opened, the bar area is a very nice place to hang out at. Staff and service were great. We enjoyed the small bites, chicken and beer. Side note: Spicy chicken is really spicy but it's also a good kind if spicy that makes you want more. I can't handle spice well but really loved the flavor.

A lovely little hideaway that serves up a delicious weekend brunch... And likely scrumptious meals all around, although I was only there for the brunch. 

There was a bit of a wait, but since summer is at an end, nobody cared to eat outside on the back patio so they were able to seat me pretty quickly. It was a cute little back porch where it would have been easy for the wait staff to forget about us, but they were there and attentive. 

The food was not as expensive as it would seem, but the drinks is what took it over the edge. My own fault as I assumed that the champagne for brunch would be the same cost as a mimosa, but it was not ($19 a glass instead of $13) and they came in the pretty classic champagne cocktail glasses, which feels like a smaller serve than one would hope. It was very nice champagne though and after I got the check I realized why 😜 

Regardless of that, the drinks (including coffee) were wonderful and the food was even more so. I can honestly say I was glad I was there with a friend so that could try more than just my own dish at a go. I can't wait to try all of them. 

I will be back, just more careful with my drink choices next time.

Charming little brunch/drinks place. Staff was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable with wine selections. Food was delicious and the eggs were perfectly fluffy and soft. The space is a little tight (not very accessible for wheelchairs/walkers).

went here for a light brunch. small menu and everything was way overpriced for what it is. $16 each for an avocado toast or trout toast or a waffle. 😮 cute place and good juices but won’t come back since food does not justify the price that you can find elsewhere 1/2 the price...

formatted_address: 150 E 76th St, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: Manhattan Ballroom Society

reviews.text: The Manhattan Ballroom society has one of its locations at the basement of the St. Jean Baptiste church. This location features high ceilings unusual for a basement and spacious wooden floor ideal for ballroom dancing. Stephen Dane provides exceptionally well designed brush-up lessons in popular ballroom dances. The music is a bit old-fashioned but elegant and sweet. The crowd is friendly and giving a chance to dance to everybody.

The Manhattan Ballroom Society is a magical place--a true unicorn in NY.  It is a warm and welcoming community of ballroom dance enthusiasts presided over by one of the nicest people you will ever meet: Stephen Dane.  An excellent dance instructor and just a really sweet guy!  His assistant, Nancy is a true gem.   I have been dancing with them for several months and it has been a lot of fun.  The Friday evening dance lesson followed by an open dance party is often the highlight of my week. Other reasons why MBS is so special: (i) it is very affordable ($20/lesson) AND (ii) you don't need to come with a partner!  It is a round robin format and the more experienced dancers are very gracious and will generously dance with newbies.  This is key for me as my husband does not (and will not) dance and I am a beginner who loves to dance.   MBS has become my new "happy place"--thank you Stephen!

We started with the Manhattan Ballroom Society to choreograph our wedding dance over a year and a half ago. We loved it and instructor Stephen Dane so much that we have kept coming back ever since. They offer private lessons, group lessons, and a big dance every Friday night that starts with a “brush up” lesson in one style of dance right beforehand. The crowd is generally a bit older, but we’re in our 20s and we still love it.

Nice dance floor with plenty of people to dance with. Music is good and organizer of the dance socials are really friendly and make you feel welcomed. They have dancers of all levels and you don't have to bring dance partner.

Steve fully choreographed our first dance and taught us how to do it over the course of three or four private sessions with him.  Our dance was amazing - people still talk about it, and multiple people said we looked like pros.  Steve was so nice and patient with us throughout, even though neither of us had any dance experience at all.  Thank you for giving us such confidence, and for making us look good in front of 150 guests on our big day!

formatted_address: 18 E 33rd St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Captain's Cafe Bar and Grill New York, NY

reviews.text: Great food, friendly staff. Great place to come and get some great food.
Fast and quality kind service. Relaxed environment and great food. Easy lunch!
Great service great food. The owner is great and always humble. Food and drinks are good.
Great local place to grab a drink and enjoy friendly company. Local neighborhood flavor and no frills drinks with classic rock in the background.
Great deals on food and drink, easily becaming a lunchtime favorite!!

formatted_address: 132 Greene Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11238, USA
name: Mayflower

reviews.text: Great, low key neighborhood spot for excellent cocktails. The first few times I went the menu was the same, but last night it had been switched up and was still great. There are 4 special cocktails on the list. The artwork inside is interesting, will leave it at that.

Speakeasy small unassuming bar with amazing drinks, very cool decor and excellent service. Perfect place for cocktails with a friend or two or with a date. Bartender is a master of his craft and can prepare you the most exquisite drinks based on your general taste preferences. A great time!

Excellent tiny cocktail bar for dates or intimate conversations with close friends. I've been coming here for years, mostly during the colder months as the environs are extra warm and cozy.  The best kept secret in Clinton Hill.
Rally nice small space with good drinks
Easily my favorite cocktail bar in Brooklyn. Tucked away, super intimate, great drinks, great soundtrack, fantastic service from Wilson.

formatted_address: 1265 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: Dallas BBQ

reviews.text: Nice portion sizes, I'd expect nothing less from a place that references Texas in their name. Vegetarian/Vegan options poor. Vegetarians can order the tempura or steamed veggies like my aunt and I but other than that they don't offer anything else. Oh sorry steamed rice is also available.  If you are a vegan steamed veg and rice is your only choice as it is literally just steamed no salt is even added. My only complaint is about the bathroom.  The stars is for the food, but the bathroom makes it lose a star. All I have to say is don't use it! And I feel for the employees who have too!!!! But if I were them I'd wait till my break and go elsewhere. Seriously I would. But the food is good and service is okay we had a large group of 20 people on a Saturday and they treated us well.

I like this restaurant! They offer great dishes, they have a nice menu, The chief cook in that restaurant is very trained, I love a lot trying all their dishes. The dishes are always fresh and tasty, the attitude towards the visitors  is helpful. I  go often to this place and I not even once was disappointed. I recommend it to all.

My husband & I visited this location Saturday night and it was amazing. Our waitress whose name I wish I could remember was great. Despite the very busy night they were having, our food was made very promptly. Food was great, drinks were great.

Any other time this place is awesome but today I  had to deal with a host with the most nastiest attitude. I walk with a cane so taking in consideration that I  need to sit somewhere it's comfortable and not inconveniencing other costumer. This gentleman was rude. Waiting to be served is another experience. I've watched them serve other people while I'm still waiting. It will be a really long time before I  come back here again. I wish I could give them a -5 stars.

Very well organised and convenient spot. They offer generous portions and for inexpensive rates. I loved the meals very much and the staff members were super amiable and explanatory. Highly recommended.

formatted_address: 709 8th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Local 6 Hotel Bartenders

reviews.text:
Best relaxing time and more
Comfortable bed
This is the best place ever my local 6 awesome services and members coverage rock on
Grezt

formatted_address: 2 Pennsylvania Plaza, New York, NY 10121, USA
name: Kabooz's Bar & Grill

reviews.text:
Good food and plenty of it.
Ate here before Eagles concert in MSG and what a great atmosphere. Had Eagles tracks playing all evening (they do that for any band playing the Garden), waiting staff were attentive and fun. Happy hour drinks (4 until 6) good value. Busy before concert or game so get here early.

Kabooz’s has been around for 20 years and I love it here. Great drinks, great staff, reasonable prices. The boneless buffalo wings are my favorite snack. Highly recommend eating here or grabbing a drink from the bar if you have time to kill waiting for a train. The manager Marc is super nice as well.

If you are in need of some food before your train leaves, hit this place up and grab the turkey burger. Delicious and better than the other fast food places around. Plus the bartenders are great and friendly.

Great place to stop and have a meal and beer. Nothing particularly special here. Food was better than you'd imagine for a place in a subway terminal. 

Service was great
Seating had room for luggage

Manager was very active
Pretty decent bar and grill in Penn Station. Good place for a quick bite while waiting for your train or event at MSG. Service is quick and the waitstaff friendly. Would definitely come here again.

formatted_address: 372 8th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Kasteli Cafe

reviews.text: Good sound. A little small. Get there early if you want to see the band
Nice quiet environment and the drinks are good, never over crowded
Great little friendly bar with some real characters at a really cheap price.
Amazing staff. Kozy, local bar.
A favorite meet-up spot with lunchtime friends.

formatted_address: 108 Lexington Ave #8927, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Dhaba

reviews.text: This place is my number one restaurant.  Of all restaurants I know I favor it most. I always suggests to my friends to go to that place. Whenever  I feel like having a superb dinner, this place comes straightaway to my head. very good and all kinds of  food and a large menu.generous staff, and good spirit. Not less important, the pay is good. I sent my friends to this spot with no doubt.

They actually gave me perceptibly spicy food (Chicken Phaal) without a long awkward discussion to evaluate whether I was serious and properly calibrated! (I'm not, but not in the direction servers assume.) Very tasty. Strong recommended. The "best of Curry Hill" lists did not mislead me.

two days ago was our first time in this magnificent restaurant. But It is obviously not the last. We passed a splendid evening with the excellent service, with the high quality  food and wine and with the honest price. We will absolutely return there in a short time.

This was our first experience eating Indian food. We didn’t really know what to order but chose well as the menu was fairly descriptive. While the restaurant was full and therefore noisy the atmosphere was good. The food and service was excellent.
Nice decor! Good service. Food was a bit on the expensive side for the price and portion. Chicken items were really good, goat not so much. Fish was so so. Naan was really good, polau rice just okay.

formatted_address: 48 W 55th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: La Bonne Soupe

reviews.text: One of my favorite restaurants in NYC!! Menu has a nice selection of soup, salads, sandwiches and more.  Food is excellent as well as the service. Highly recommend!!
The French onion soup lived up to the hype! Quiet neighborhood cafe with tasty bites.
Wonderful food and service. We both had the prix fix special, baked red snapper. It was well prepared and the scalloped potatoes were great. Chocolate mousse for dessert. Very reasonable price also.

Nice French place just south from central park off 5th Avenue. Small and cozy. Servers attitude is typical New York, could be a bit more polite. Their onion soup is as good as they say and for its location it was really well priced. Give them a try!

One of the best French Onion soups you can find. Everything else is I’ve tried has been delicious. This isn’t fancy, but welcoming and warm. A perfect place for a low key and tasty meal. They also have a good options for children.

formatted_address: 349 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: TESSA

reviews.text:
Amazing Amazing Amazing

The wife and I went out to TESSA for Valentine's Day and I'm glad we did. We had reservations so we didn't have to wait despite them being full. Everything was perfect. The service, the attention to detail, the food and the drinks were all perfect. A must for special occasions and cute dates.
Amazing food and solid wine list! Love their pasta and amarone.

We walked into this restaurant without looking at reviews and it was a very pleasant surprise. The environment was very nice and had a good character with exposed breaks. The staff were friendly and attentive but not intrusive. We got the Octopus which was delicious and perfectly cooked and grilled. The soup was also fantastic. Their wine list was very good as well. All in all I highly recommended this place.

Walked in, sat down at the bar, and looked at the menus. About 10 minutes after we sat down, a party of 20 walked in and stood by the bar while waiting to be seated. The bartender completely ignored us and proceeded to take all of their orders. After several minutes of trying to get his attention and not even receiving a glance in our direction, we walked out. For $15 cocktails, I was expecting better service.

A New Yorker friend organized brunch at Tessa to celebrate old friends getting together after a long time and birthdays. I had the Ultimate Breakfast Sandwich which I enjoyed very much. Also one of their brunch cocktails, a blood orange gin and tonic. The prices for food and drink are reasonably priced and a good value. My companions were equally pleased. The service is very good with attentive and efficient wait staff. The dinner menu looks amazing and I would definitely enjoy a return visit when we're next in the City.

formatted_address: 1109 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10065, USA
name: Tiella

reviews.text: The food here is so delicious and the staff is friendly. It’s a small space which is perfect for an intimate date
A small menu (thankfully) and really good, solid, unpretentious Utalian food. Too good!
They serve large portions and for affordable pricing. nice staff members. Never disappointing.
The dishes were exquisite!
Great service. Parpadello delicious. Next time the pizza. Buffalo Mozzarella for us lactards.

formatted_address: 1 E 35th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Royal 35 Steakhouse

reviews.text: The "regular fries" are actually seasoned with the standard "seasoning" blend you'll find at most restaurants: onion and garlic powder, seasoning salt, paprika, and some extra cayenne or another type of pepper. While the taste is familiar, the mixture is particularly hot and peppery, which lasts throughout the entire bucket. Even if the order cools down during your dinner, each fry is coated evenly and the taste remains constant! The seasoning even gives off a sweet aroma of its own, if you're the type of person who likes to use more than one sense while you eat.

I'm giving this a 5 star even though our 8:00pm reservation meant we got seated at 8:45pm. I don't think it was their fault though. There were two big office parties that just wouldn't leave. Hey it's Christmas so you have to understand. As to the food...holy cow...no pun intended!  My rib eye was "candy". Cooked perfectly. Delicious. And why not when they dry age their prime meats on site for you to see. The sides were generous. I had the full baked potato; weighed a ton and it too was incredibly scrumptious. The server was attentive, knew his menu, spring staff was on the job without being in your face. Superior steak House!!
Great steakhouse priced comparably to other top tier places and they are not afraid to give you a real rare steak. Decor is nice and roomy. Really good orange butter cream cake. I would go again.

This place is my number one place.  Of all restaurants I know I prefere it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to that place. Whenever  I feel like having a special supper, this place comes first to my head.  Great and   food and a large list of dishes.trained team, and pleasant spirit. Also important, the pay is affordable. I recommend this restaurant with great pleasure.

Top Notch Restaurant....
We booked this restaurant last minute on open table. We arrived and were seated immediately.  The staff was awesome. From the hostess to the wait staff. The food was fantastic. The porterhouse for 2, easley feed 4 of us. My family and I had a wonderful time and for sure will be making this one of our regular places to dine when visiting NYC.

formatted_address: 1431 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: Numero 28

reviews.text: Great place to have sit down pizza that can be customized. Never to packed and the wine selection is good. You can request specific wine that is 50% off when ordering a bottle. Great value for the money

As Italian I can definitely say that here you can find the real Italian gastronomic experience. Flavours, smell, taste, atmosphere... every element reflect Italy’s food culture. It’s one of the best place in New York.
Pizza is very good, pasta is prepared very well by a good chef. People inside are very nice. I suggest everyone to go here for dinner.
A very nice and cozy place, Italian accent language and flavor which make it all a pleasant evening. Thank you
Delicious Italian pizza, nice environment and reasonable prices.

Took the family to Numero 28 for a Friday night meal.  The Carbonara was to die for, the Calamari, light and crispy and the Numero Pizza was amazing. Prices are higher than a Pizzaria, but the food, pizza and ambiance are all better also. This is more a full blown Italian restaurant than a Pizzaria.

formatted_address: 700 5th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Clement

reviews.text: The service was quite attentive, and the food was delicious. I was very pleased with the gluten-free bread, and the steak and wine was phenomenal. We arrived just as they opened and had a reservation, so there was minimal wait, and it was nicely lively as our dinner progressed.

Incredible upscale dining experience. Everything was fabulous. We splurged for the tomahawk Wagyu. Also tried the lobster pasta and it did not disappoint. Great for a date night or special event. Highly recommend. The sommalier did a great job as well.

A memorable dining experience. Best Spanish octopus I’ve ever eaten. The rest of the food was outstanding too. Service was attentive, polished, and knowledgeable. Elegant digs. Of course very expensive but very worth it.
Very attentive service and lovely view. I had the pumpkin bisque and kale salad- both of which were delicious and beautifully presented. Would recommend.
Had a sensational meal on a rain soaked night in the city. Exceptional service and wine too. Highly recommend it.

formatted_address: 220 W 31st St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Tracks

reviews.text: The place is one of those special finds where the food is great and the service is outstanding. Drinks are strong and the classic train motif gives you so much to look at while you are eating. They were in Penn Station and now they're in their new more spacious location. Check it out, I'm sure you'll be pleasantly surprised.

Great raw bar and great place to kill time while you are waiting for a train. Friendly bar and timely staff to get you in and out before your train. Rarely a spare seat during and post happy hour, but at the same time you don’t mind standing and waiting.

Great service, excellent burger, good beer selection. Staff was nice and the room was able to accommodate a lot of people. Equally the bar is large and allows for a large amounts of people to walk up and eat. Great place.
Caroline was our bartender and she was absolutely amazing. Thank you so much for your amazing 5 star customer service. You're doing a great job. I will be back 👍🧡
New location, diferent vibe, as usual great staff and food.

formatted_address: 26 Little W 12th St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Tenjune

reviews.text: It's located in the basement which made it impossible to use your cellphone down there. Dance space is small and floor is kind of sticky. Drinks taste average and price is about the standard price in meatpacking. Promoter sometimes will tell you he's promoting Tenjune on the street and you can get free cover(if you are a girl), which might seem like a plus but I still think there are better places in meatpacking you can try out.
A club a dub downstairs in meatpacking that gets you going on a weekend night.  I was there on a Thursday for a private party had no problems. Music was fine.

Came here with a promoter and got free bottle service.  The owner was so kind when another party was rude to us and he comped another drink at the bar.  Its not a super large club, but decently good music, and it gets crazy crowded on Saturdays

Tenjune is in the basement right next to STK. It is pretty big and the decor is sexy. 

We had a private party here on a Thursday night and it was awesome. The drink was kind of weak though but the ambiance is what it is all about. 

They probably charge a lot for cover normally.

Sketchy but overall above average Meatpacking club. Obnoxious door people but they'll probably let you in eventually if you're dressed correctly. Crap drinks but cool vibe and pretty good music. Sure to impress out of town guests.

formatted_address: 120 Cedar St, New York, NY 10006, USA
name: O'Hara's

reviews.text: We were visiting the 9/11 Memorial and wanted to grab some quick food and drinks. Not much to look at on the outside, but the inside had a great atmosphere and tribute to first responders and 9/11.  Our server was very knowledgeable on local beers and super attentive. All of the staff was extremely helpful and friendly.  You can tell they are a great team.  The food was amazing and quick. The beer was so refreshing and reasonably priced. One of our favorite places in NY so far!!

Kudos to you O'Hara's for your commitment, support of fire and police agencies, I don't think I have every seen so many patches in one place. I can't say I loved the food so much (it's a bar after all). The environment is festive and of course there is a  great selection of adult beverages. Go, have fun and while your there raise a pint in support of all the men and women keeping communities safe.

We went here after visiting the 9/11 Memorial and it was the perfect counter point. Every wall and much of the ceiling is covered in first responders patches. The food is classic pub fare, the service is great a bit sassy and very fun. Another example of resilience.

My food was ok. I got the grilled cheese and bacon with sweet potato fries. The cheese was barely melted and the bread was too hard with no type of butter taste. The place was packed though and the bartenders were very busy.  I've had better food on other visits.

We enjoy eating out. Last night we came to this excellent restaurant which friends recommended to us. We passed a delightful experience there with fine cooking and a nice stuff and  a professional chief cook. We put this fine restaurant in our phone list  and we shall certainly return soon.  Highly recommended.

formatted_address: 338 3rd Avenue, 162 East 25th Street, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Dog & Bone

reviews.text: This place is not as advertised. Supposed to be dog friendly but we were immediately kicked back out into the cold for having brought a dog that was NOT a service dog. Allowing ONLY service dogs is not pet friendly... its just the law. I would not recommend.
The very tasty fried chicken sandwich and my wine on ice! A favorite meal there!
The hot dog is surprisingly amazing and the chips is very nice. recommended!
Great bar with great British food but the inside is NOT dog friendly. It must have used to be but no longer is.

Was here 4 weeks ago and forgot to leave a review. My girlfriend and i came because it allowed dogs! Huge bonus and has my loyalty. Great for tea & biscuits! Cute spot, decor and very friendly bartender. Felt like we were really in England.

formatted_address: 62 Carmine St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Codino

reviews.text: Instead of an appetizer we ordered sides.  Great decision!   Truffle mashed potatoes and Brussels sprouts were phenomenal!  I had the special, Cacio e Pepe, which was served from a bowl of cheese, melted and spooned on top of the pasta. Pesto sauce on our other entree was the best pesto I’ve had!  Such a wonderful evening!

This may be my favorite Italian food in the village. Try the secret menu, the truffle gnocchi is fantastic. The Cacio de Pepe and the pesto is very good. Eggplant appetizer is fantastic as well. Otherwise, the menu can be a bit of hit or miss.
Lovely Italian Wine Bar. Atmosphere is fairly loud and cozy. But the food is amazing. Service was also spot on. Good priced food.

I stopped in spontaneously on Saturday and found the atmosphere warm and inviting.  Everyone was friendly and very helpful. Recommend for anyone looking to enjoy good service great food in a relaxed setting.

Good spot for Italian / European food. The appetizers are really delicious, especially the ceviche, the gambas and the eggplant. The mains are not as good (although the pesto pasta was goods so I’d recommend having more appetizers. Deserts are good as well. Really nice, homely vibe with great service.

formatted_address: 99 Park Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Park Avenue Tavern

reviews.text: Food and service is exceptional. We came for a birthday dinner and the poultry was cooked to perfection. Burgers were a perfect medium. Seasoning and flavor was spot on. I am very picky when it comes to food being a cook this place is definitely a go to for quality food. The service was just the right amount of attentive and even the manager came to greet us. I would for sure recommend this spot. They have a decent sized menu with unique dishes and flavors. I also had my children with me and they had no complaints.

We chose to come to the Park Avenue Tavern to watch the Game of Thrones season 8 premiere. We are on our vacation and its alway fun to hang with a crowd in a large city like New York. They have a room in their basement called the barrel room, which has its own bar and seating, also decorated specially for this event. The hostess and waitresses were very accommodating and very on top of a very busy room. Special drinks were crafted for this event and the food was amazing. Everything was hot and cooked to perfection. Keep up the great job.
Cute place. Good food. Very  busy esp @ lunch time. Advise reservations. Had grilled cheese sandwich w tomato soup, friend had flat bread pizza. Would return.

Reasonable prices, we both had burgers which were good but nothing to write home about. The fries were not as crispy as I like. Service was unimpeachable. I only saw the upstairs which was bright and open, my partner said the downstairs was really cool which we didn't realize was even there until we were leaving and he had to use the restroom.
Our favorite brunch spot! We go out of our way to visit here at least once or twice a year.  Excellent food!

formatted_address: 570 10th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: The Green Room 42

reviews.text: I want to give 3.5 stars but will give 4 because 3 would be short changing them. I DID NOT like the unisex bathroom. The stalls are also very difficult to get in and out of. My drinks were expensive and watered down a bit. The snack food I had was good. I enjoyed the venue and the acoustics were great. I came to see a wonderful and talented singer, that was the most important part..and at ringside for a decent price! Buying tickets online was a breeze but could not get the venue on the phone. The run time was an hour, I wish the singer had more time!

The shows are affordable and the food is quite good.  We went for the Boy Band Brunch.  They took our orders before the show started, we ate during the show, and we were settling the check when the show ended.  The show is just perfectly timed.  The Boy Band Brunch was a lot of fun.  It's cheesy, hammy, and beefcakey.... just exactly what you'd want a show like this one to be.  We had a great time and I'm sure I'll be back to bring other friends :-)

Great Christmas show. Location, inside the hotel Yotel in 42 st. We had so much fun. 
I was laughing so hard with the unique performances. Not all of them are in jokes bases, which is good. All the crew was fantastic. I enjoyed every single minute of the show. The performances were entertaining and well executed. The female performances were stunningly beautiful.
Is a great experience, we love it. Keep up the good job guys. Many success to all the team.

This is a great place. A small caberet theater with dinner and drinks.
The show was amazing. The venue is easily accessible by train, car bus or by walking.
The staff were helpful and friendly.
The drinks were good sized and about $30 for two.
I'm excited AB seeing more from this place. Check it out!
#greatshows
Was here for new York got talent. Fried cauliflower was pretty good. Venu is pretty small. Seating are usually first come first serve.

formatted_address: 2nd Setai, 40 Broad St, New York, NY 10004, USA
name: Reserve Cut

reviews.text: Place is very nicely set up. Nice ambience and comfy armchairs. All the food we ordered was delicious. Our waitress took extraordinarily long to get to our table every time we wanted to order, though once we did, the food arrived really quickly. This place is expensive, but worth it.

If you were to describe Reserve Cut, it's just, wow. It is extremely expensive, but once you sit down you start to understand why. From the decor to the service to the food, everything is top notch. After I proposed, my then finance and I ate out here. It was amazing. They provided flowers for our table, glasses of champagne on the house, and even the owner came over to wish us a congratulations! On top of that, the food was so good that close to 7 years later we are still talking about it!

This place is surely one of the best place in the region. Whenever I go there I am remarkably pleased. They keep their very high  standard service and the topmost level of food  they offer. You are always happy with this restaurant. Highly  recommended.

This place is certainly one of the best place to eat in the area. Whenever I visit this place I am truly glad. They manage their high  level service and the highest level of food  they offer. You can never go wrong with this place. Very  recommended.
This place offers first-rate service and yummy meals. My favourite place in town. The food served quick and the rates were economical. I recommend this place.

formatted_address: 1 Wall St, New York, NY 10005, USA
name: Haru Sushi

reviews.text: This place is my favorite site.  Of all restaurants I know I like it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to visit this restaurant. Whenever  I want to go to a superb lunch, this place comes right away to my mind. very good and all sorts of  food and a large menu.courteous staff members, and agreeable ambience. Also, the cost is decent. I suggest this restaurant with great pleasure.
Great place! Fabulous ambience, good food, and remarkable service. They serve very good hot sake.

We came to this restaurant for a meeting. we heard about this place from a lot of people.  Well, we were not disappointed. The staff members were extremely nice and we felt very good. The food was just great. We enjoyed every moment and we will definitely return to this restaurant. we highly recommend this place.

A reasonable menu mixing individual items and lunch specials.  Service was very prompt and attentive. I had the eel dish (unaju) which was attractively laid out on the dish but not especially flavorful
