Great spot for happy hour sushi rolls and drinks! Fresh tasting spicy crunchy tuna and salmon. Perfect for getting your sushi fix before going to other spots for happy hour. Cool atmosphere but bathrooms could be a little cleaner for this area. Overall good spot.

formatted_address: 231 Court St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: June

reviews.text: Such a beautiful little place with super delicious, healthy food, and a great selection of natural wines! Ambience: interior, light, sound all is just perfect. Friendly service too. Loved the appetizers, we tried them all. Will definitely come back soon.

This bar is really a “hidden gem” in the neighborhood. Friendly service and beautiful presentation. While the menu is a little limited, everything from the appetizers to entrees is delicious. My only complaint is that the steak was quite fatty. Of course there is always a little fat on steak, but there was so much on mine that it was hard to chew. Other than that, excellent experience overall.
The lightening and mood of this place is on point. So cute and nice. Perfect for a date or meeting with a good friend. Loved the chilled red wine.

Had a fantastic birthday dinner here for my lady last night. It’s a beautiful spot and the food was delicious and fresh. Special thanks to Ashley for warmly accommodating our larger group (10) and to our server Shannon for her impressive service.

Great cozy bar with an enclosed outdoor area. Good for small groups or a date. We went for the solid collection of harder to find natural wines. Good sized booths and tables to go along with the bar. We would have like a bit more attentiveness or suggestions from the staff.

formatted_address: 67 Clinton St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: The Burgary

reviews.text:
The Lower East side burger was amazing. Basically a pastrami sandwich in a burger form. It’s a bit of a hit but worth it.

I was recommended The Burgary a while back and finally got around to visiting. Gonna add to my list. 

Weekday nights have open bar seating.

service was so good I had to stop eating and review the place. It’s WONDERFUL, OUTSTANDING SERVICE. And FAST I LITERALLY WAITED ABOUT 7 mins for my order. The bartender Clifford  knows his way around the bar. I got to choose a selection of my own music. The VIBES were AMAZING !!!! Would recommend 10 times out of 10

Trendy, small but nice ambience. Love the Totchos and when you get to build your burger. Juicy and the shakes are incredible. Play hip hop, rnb, today's music so it is dope. Never get tired of this place. I feel it's better coming around late afternoon. Also have a TV by the bar. It can be a little pricey but prices are decent. Warning they charge high gratuity even if a party of less than 5 so watch on what you order. Still though food is excellent even for a small menu.
Delicious burgers in a Bar atmosphere with good music selection and drinks. It also has a speak easy in the back. Recommended if you want to try something different burgerwise.

This is a very small place. It may be able to sit 12 people, at the bar seating for about eight and window seating at the front about four. The food was good. Service was ok. Seems the server has a chip on his shoulder. My sister in law asked a question about an item on the menu, his response was i don't know. He should have said, I'll go ask the manager or cook. We had a few questions that were not answered well. We only asked because the menu was a deep red color with black lettering. In the soft lite it was hard to read. With not to good service i feel the tip should be left up to me and not added to bill. I like to think service  was not great because, the server had to double as the bar tender. I'm willing to give this place another chance for the food. Hopefully the service has changed..

formatted_address: 124 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Kingside

reviews.text: Spacious and airy restaurant, modern but with a vintage touch. The ambience is relaxed at brunch, and not too crowded. Food is good, even though a little bit pricey, but I guess it is on the average for the area.

Most amazing place for brunch breakfast and dinner. Everything is manicured from the fruit to the latte. Experience is what this place holds with Class!!! Every visit is a fulfilled desire. The Roof is apart of this location that opens at 4. Penthouse view with a full bar. Drinks are doctored to your needs. Experienced bartending. I feel enamored here. $$$$

Delicious creative menu selections. Hit the jackpot visiting Kingside during National Resturant Month. Great location down from Carneige Hall. Service was great. Hostess not too welcoming. Excited to see they had a spot at LaGuardia Airport. Sure there's also one at JFK.
used to have great brunch with a menu, now its hotel buffet style. Continental breakfast should not be a public 35$ ordeal. After 5 years, never again.

Located at the Viceroy Hotel, Kingside is a really nice place for a drink and a bite to eat. It's not too large so I'd bet there are times when getting a seat is tougher, but I didn't have too much of a problem for happy hour on a Tuesday. The menu is a little on the pricey side but the happy hour deals aren't bad, and the cocktails are quite good.

formatted_address: 45 W 18th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Content Cube

formatted_address: 238 E 53rd St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Club Wyn

formatted_address: 6 E 32nd St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: IchiUmi

reviews.text: I admire this spot! They have awesome dishes, their menu is varied, The cook in that place is a specialist, I enjoy very much tasting all their dishes. The food is always good, the attitude towards the clients  is very good too. I  go often to this place and I was never unsatisfied.  I highly recommend it.

Great variety! Decent rice to fish ratio for sushi, for a buffet. They have an amazing selection, so you can go everyday and never get tired of the place! From hot pot to barbecue to sushi, you name it, they got it. The service is excellent, as well. Definitely a must-visit, but make sure you're hungry! Lunch is $18.95 and dinner is $31.95

This place is great and amazing...but it would be better if the fruits were a little sweet like normal ones because the fruit is kinda blend...and the ice cream and the dessert was way too sweet for me or my dad. But I really like the lemon the most.  😋I don't know why.

Fantastic but rather expensive, and yet worth every penny. So many choices to enjoy and just take your time enjoying and eating. We cooked some of what we ate after a burner and a pot with soup were provided us. Good service they gave us too.

We went there on our list day in NYC. The food and service were great. The place is very clean. Staff are very friendly and helpful. I definitely recommend the place, also at lunch time when the menu is just a little bit different, but still worth the money you pay.

formatted_address: 322 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Da Capo

reviews.text: Possibly my favorite spot in the city. Great cocktails, delicious food (love the chef personally), very kind and fun staff! I truly feel like at home and I appreciate places where the owners are around and are humble and gracious towards their clientele. I blindly recommend it for every night of the week. Oh and last but not least, this place has been a rock for me and has made me feel better through tough times that we’ve all had in this city. Love only :)

This was my 2nd time here, and although the menu has changed in the meantime, the food is just as good as I remember. Ordered the salmon, skirt steak, and the mac & cheese; all were perfectly cooked and so flavorful. Combine the amazing food with the friendly staff, and you can bet I'll be back for more.
Full bar cafe. Excellent service. Amazing dessert options as well as food.

Best cup of mocha I have ever had. Not too much seating besides at the bar, but I got it to go. Wished I had more days in NYC to get this. Enjoy a Sunday afternoon mocha and walk through the nearby Grand Bazaar for a nice date.
Amazing place! The brunch were correctly priced and good portions! Good location

formatted_address: 91A S 6th St, Brooklyn, NY 11249, USA
name: Loosie's Kitchen

reviews.text:
It's a hidden spot that has its own identity that is Instagram worthy during the spring or summer thanks to it's use of the space inside and the cute walk up outside. 

This New American place has some nice choices on the menu but the most eye catching has to be the fried chicken simply because it sounds substantial. 7 pieces of chicken and each seasoned amazingly well that I nearly forgot to dip it in the honey or even put on the spicy sauce right next to it. While 7 may sound a lot, make no mistake this is not a plate you'd want to share. 

Another honorable mention is the appetizer of a potato and basil ... Soup? Either way, the seasoning is wonderful and I'd like to ask for seconds for sure. 

The campfire old fashioned was good but what do you do with the actual chocolate, Graham cracker and roasted marshmallow? Do I leave it for later? Do I have it immediately? Am I supposed to be immersing that into the drink as it was placed on a toothpick above the drink? 

The staff was attentive for sure and the lighting was intimate. Really great job with that. 

So why the missing star? Simply put, it's pretty pricey for the portions it provides. It's a cute restaurant but for some reason I just can't justify the price to portion ratio. Remember those dishes I mentioned earlier?  I shared them with my girlfriend and with the 2 drinks together it came out to over $80 and we were still hungry. 

We ended up going to a second restaurant after that.

Beautiful looking space. Perfect backdrop for the instagram inclined. But the food was on the expensive side for what you get. And still left me and my group hungry. That being said, service was dope. Bonnie is great. Give her a raise. And whoever did your interior is wildly talented. Also my Brown Derby cocktail was perfect. So thanks for that!

This is a difficult review to write. I want to give a 4 Star but the flavor wasn’t up to snuff. Everything was impeccably cooked from a technical perspective but most of it didn’t have the flavor I’d hope for.

The cornbread may be the worst offender. You can tell that care and thought went into its preparation. They even tossed it on the griddle to sear one side. But the bread had zero flavor to it. I wanted so much more.

Same for the biscuits and eggs. The chicken and waffles maybe hit it the best on the flavor with an interesting spicy and sweet fruit syrup and the chicken was perfectly cooked but it could have used more flavor.

Overall I wanted it to be great. And they’re clearly putting a lot of love and effort into it but I don’t think I’ll be going back.

Love love love it here! The food is amazing and reasonably priced for brunch in Williamsburg or in NYC for that matter. Great coffee and atmosphere! It’s gorgeous inside and out. Came back from Europe and this really fulfilled my craving for a little cafe. A bit of a walk form the L but so worth it.
Great place for casual brunch, awesome service. Chicken and waffles amazing, fish sandwich also awesome, fried polenta great too 🤤🧇🍗

formatted_address: 368 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Café Frida

reviews.text: Hey Cafe Frida! I thought the female bartender during my visit was on fire. Her cocktails were great and she served them with so much passion. Your food was great For a Mexican restaurant on the East coast. I loved how most or all staffs spoke spanish. I just thought I should let you know.

You are in for a treat! The service was amazing. The food was very tasty and well presented. I loved the addition of tahin to the salt on the glass rim for the margarita. I'll definitely go back.
Also they have a diverse, delicious, and variety of vegetarian options.
Cool little place next to the American museum of natural history. Good Mexican food. Really nice guacamole and chips. Reasonable price. Nice stop for a quick bite.

Great food, good location, and fast service. Grabbed lunch here after visiting the Natural History Museum. Very happy with everything. The staff was friendly and service was fast. The food was great! My burrito was excellent and my wife had the enchiladas. I'd recommend both, but the menu looked good of great options.
Delicious food, excellent service. Great margaritas! Very expensive for what it is, but that’s to be expected in that neighborhood, and the portions are quite substantial.

formatted_address: 155 E 55th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Shun Lee Palace

reviews.text: The quintessential classic NY Chinese restaurant.  Been here for years and will be here for many more.  Fantastic service, terrific food. You will not be dissapointed
Very well organised and convenient restaurant. They serve large meals and for reasonable rates. I loved the menu a lot and the staff members were super amiable and chatty. Recommended.

Of all  Chinese restaurants without a doubt, this has the most delicious,  unique & different Chinese food. Flavorful,  great presentation & perfect portions. The staff is overly friendly, warm & welcoming.  The decor is aweful!  Is old, bad 80s decor & cheap looking. A good renovation with great Chinese decor will make this an exciting experience ! It is pricey but it's also worth it. Recommend it a lot.

The service was great however it is not really kid friendly restaurant. They do not have high chairs and they did not have a changing table on the restroom, as well as many items on their menu were spicy. 

Overall for just adults the food taste great and the service was excellent. I would restaurant just without children.

Unfortunately the 2 stars wasn't for the food. I give the food we ate an 8. The two stars is for the server. Initially she was okay apologizing for greeting but once my dinner companion came back from the restroom it took longer for her to come back. I chose this place because the options for restaurant week looked interesting. When asked about that menu I was told I don't know what that is but to try and sell me on a 90 per plate was okay. Eventually she said oh the special. She was quick to tell me "everything will come out when its ready" Patrons that were next to use were talked to and greeted quickly. Towards the end I had to ask about the desert which was told to me ice cream or pineapple. If you don't want to participate in Restaurant Week then don't but if you do present that menu along with your everyday menu. My money is just as good whether I spend 42 a person or 90 a person. For future reference parties of two are more likely to tip more than a group of 5 to 10 when gratituty isn't added. I will not be coming back sadly but hopefully the midwest location doesn't act like that.

formatted_address: 702 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: Pio Pio 6

reviews.text:
Delicious chicken! 

Delicious sangria! 

Delicious sauces! 

Wonderful service! 

Wonderful staff! 

I’ve been to different locations throughout NYC and it’s definitely great to see consistency throughout an establishment with multiple locations. 

You must go for their chicken. Super tasty!

One of our favorite places to eat in NYC. Lots of options for carnivores, pescatarians and vegetarians. Love so many of the dishes here. And we love love love the spicy green sauce they give you to add to everything. Ask for extra! Terrific, friendly, knowledgeable staff. We’ve never eaten other Peruvian food, but if the rest is like this, we want more!
The food is nothing short of amazing. The ambient is great and the sangria is freshly made. I come here whenever I'm on that side of town. Great service and nice portions!

Went here the night before Thanksgiving with family. Some of us are not always the easiest customers. One of our number wanted a dish without the sauce—but the sauce is central to the dish. Our server warned us that the dish might no be so appetizing and suggested a good alternative, but when my family member insisted, he got it through and came up with a delicious compromise under pressure in a busy restaurant. I wish I remember that fellow's name! He said he was from Ankara, Turkey.  I'd like to commend him for accommodating us like this. I hope his boss sees this and knows who we're talking about.

Apart from that, the food was delicious and very Peruvian—lots of options from all over Peru. Anybody who knows Peruvian cuisine knows how diverse it is. This restaurant had a good selection. We left quite well satisfied.

I really liked this restaurant! Prices are a little higher than usual but it's really good. I had the seafood and it was amazing. A lot of people come for the chicken as well. Good drinks, good food, great service, they bring the food pretty fast and everything is clean. Good place to come with q date or family if you know what I mean.

formatted_address: 93 Avenue B, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Horus Cafe

reviews.text: Always a great time here! They play good music, very lively atmosphere and specifically, Omar was extremely welcoming and friendly. They also have very good shisha and food. Definitely recommend trying!
Delicious lamb chops out here fellas. The wife ended up digging into it before I could take a picture. Highly recommended!
Great place for Arabic music, sometimes for American music! When we come to the place they put us Russian songs, cause my friends we all speak Russian! Nice and delicious food! Super nice staff!
Hookah was nice. This place only has well liquor. No Honey Jack or Hennessy
Best Salep ever! Pistachio on the top of the milky salep! Try it when it’s winter and cold. Hookah is great quality and little pricy$$$

formatted_address: Park Ave S, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Labyrinth

reviews.text: Wife and I went here last week. We had a great time. It was our first experience and the staff really went the extra mile to show us around and make us feel comfortable. Will return. Can't wait for their NYE party!

Very nice club, extremely clean, attentive staff, security presence was comforting.  Overall a really great place to go in search of fun experiences.  Lockers were accessible, bathrooms were clean and on every floor.  I'd definitely recommend going.  Music was good throughout the night.

The place is nice, but the staff is so rude. Specially the white fat guy that I think is the manager. I went there a couple of time and all the time he was like a pit bull treating customer like trash. The other one is the security black guy. 
Personally I think that there’s a better way to treat customer. 

And also the staff is always playing with the girls who attend to the party instead of let the costumer play. 

I used to go there, but now I prefer to go to other place where staff is nice.
Shy at first then i opened up. I mean open up if u know what i mean. Went with my boyfriend we loved it. Going back soon!!!!

Boyfriend and I went here last saturday night. We liked it, even tho I was skeptical. Met a ton of cool folks. I like that there are 3 different floors to find your vibe. It's really hard to find tho.

formatted_address: 210 Hudson St, Jersey City, NJ 07311, USA
name: Midnight Market

reviews.text: Fun, good food and drinks.  It needed a few more vendors to have more options.  We had some Mexican, Philippine-Hawaiian, Puerto Rican and some delicious matcha tea float.  The portions were good and fair pricing. Great DJ!
An amazing place to go lots of fun lots of energy good people I highly recommend it
we had a great time

formatted_address: 303 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Rare Bar & Grill

reviews.text:
The food is amazing. If you want quality burger then this is a must. Had the lollipop wings and I was surprised how good it was. Now the Jameson burger was delicious not to mention you can add topping, which I recommend you do. 
The only cons I had with the restaurant was the wait time to be attended after being seated and  the AC was so cold my food was cold before I got half way through it. Otherwise I will recommend to others and definitely coming back!
PS. Get the Fried Oreos
"A good burger is a rare find." Rare has great burgers and incredible fries. Very affordable and amazing quality. Juicy delicious and large burgers! What's not to love!

Small burger place with a bar. Place gets busy at lunch time and happy hour so I would suggest getting reservations. My burger and fries were fine but price was high even for Manhattan. Onion soup wasn't anything to write home about. I had a Coke, cheese burger, fries and onion soup. Bill was $38.00 plus tip. If your just looking for a decent burger I'd go to Shake Shack instead.

Ordered fries for our room absolutely disgusting. Weren't exactly fresh or hot and the sweet potato and normal fries were so skinny I'm surprised they could cook them the waffle fries were just about edible. Photos are what we threw away...Gross

Very nice restaurant in Manhattan. They have tasty hamburgers and steaks, as good beers too. The only thing that I didn't like was a light and constant vibration on the floor, that comes from a laundry in the basement. It's not an earthquake, but it shakes.

formatted_address: 9 Barclay St, New York, NY 10007, USA
name: The Wooly Public

reviews.text: Wonderful spot for business lunches! Seem classy while being comfortable. Great decor, not so friendly staff, great food. Love their salads! Good cocktails. I've also been here for a few work parties and if you're looking to rent out a space for an event, I highly suggest it!
The bar/restaurant is spacious with lots of tables. The food and drinks are also nice. Good after work spot.

Decent cocktails and beer choices. Friendly staff and atmosphere. Was there towards the end of the night and they were still bringing out delicious and creative appetizers and friendly service. Despite the upscale environment they have some pretty reasonably priced options as well. So if you're not the twelve dollar cocktail type, you can get a pint of Narragansett.
Nice atmosphere, if a bit loud. The menu looked great and my quinoa bowl was delicious. The waiter even alerted me that it was a little spicy before confirming my order. Very attentive service.
Sitting section was good and comfortable. Great food at reasonable prices. Staff were courteous and greeted us very well. Amazing services. Everything was well organised.

formatted_address: 59-41 Washington St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: photo à prendre DUMBO

formatted_address: 619 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Saint Peter's Church

reviews.text: Heard an orchestra perform. Acoustics marvelous.  Like being inside a resonant cello. And the architecture is amazing. Its a modern jewel all lit up at night

Beautiful church with no terrifying crucifix. Very modern architecture in the round rather than the traditional nave. Quite socially responsive to the community need for clean, well lighted spaces to host special events. Attended the National Domestic Workers Alliance 10th Anniversary VIP Red Carpet for Social Change. Lovely event, truly Christlike people. With churches like this and people like this we have a shot at basic human decency and human rights for all. That' s my story and I'm sticking to it.
Gorgeous modern sanctuary with a TRACKER organ.  Meaningful service with touching blend of tradition and the avant garde.
Should be awarded the most amazing church

I'm here now... Asked pastor Derr how he was doing...his response was "I'm dying soon". I'm still in shock. Feel like I should ask him if everything is ok. I don't want to come back here. Too much anger and stress.

formatted_address: 3114 3rd Ave, The Bronx, NY 10451, USA
name: Flava’s Restaurant and Lounge

reviews.text:
Stacia and Sam (hostess)  were the best ! 

On both experiences the food and drinks were great!

I love the happy hour.. prices are great and the vibe is good ..

I’m bringing all of my friends there so they can enjoy this rare find ! 

Love to see Black Businesses thrive !

This restaurant has a nice ambiance.  Its centrally located and pivotal within the neighborhood!  The staff are attentive,  the food is out of this world.  OMG, you've got to check out this gem in the South Bronx.  The drinks are good and if you're like,  you will be requesting lemon water in hopes of easing the effects of the drinks. A very grown& sexy atmosphere.  I'll be returning soon with family & colleagues.

I had a dinner party here and my experience was amazing. The staff was very friendly and helpful. A variety of music was played (reggae, soca, hip hop). The drinks and food were delicious. I had a great time at this location and I look forward to going back.

Food was good, waited a bit long for our food it was warm/cold. Got overcharged for drinks (they were cute),  and a plastic "to-go" bag while I saw everyone with paper "to-go" bags. For two people we got charged for 70+ dollars 😩 . the music was great , the staff was very nice but we felt outcasts 😂

This is a beautiful restaurant. The server I had is nice and welcoming. (No; it HAS to be said, because not all Caribbean places abide by the laws of customer service. I could tell you some stories!🙄) The food was nicely presented and went down as deliciously as it looks. There is so much yumminess to choose from - on their reasonably-priced menus - that my guest and I had a hard time choosing. Our server had just the right response: she invited us to keep coming back until we’ve tried it all. 😄😄😄 

Atmosphericly speaking, I’d like to give the DJ (not really) a big high five. I spent so much time singing along and dancing in place that I almost had to take my food away with me.😊

The hours are a little short, but I’ll assume that’s just because of the length of time it takes to prepare those foods (and then pretty them up🤣).

Two thumbs way up!👍🏾👍🏾

formatted_address: 95 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: The DL

reviews.text:
This wonderful establishment that has 3 floors of energizing music for everyone to do their typical 2 steps or act like that cool person who you would find on SoulTrain or purchase one of DL drinks and smooth talk that special person.  Whatever you desire, you will have fun at this rooftop place.  The place has a tropical look, so I am guessing it suppose to represent that summertime feel; it worked because I didn't realize it was drizzling outside. I know this place must be a wonderful place to visit during summer 2014, so I know I will be back soon.  

Today was a day for unexpected rain, but it is okay because Yelper knows how to party and represent a company the right way. Let dig deeper and explore this spot out.  The staff is fantastic and makes awesome drinks that hard to refuse to get one more. What did they put in the drink?  Man, I just don't know. If you are a smoker and you want to hang outside to smoke a Newport, I strongly recommend you to visit the 3rd floor where to enjoy the life of the party. IF you need that smoke break, there is a section for smokers too.

The food tastes great and that I will not big up everywhere because no one can beat my mother's cooking. I took a bite into the mini cheeseburger, and boom, two hands already want to grab more.  The spring rolls are wonderful too that I needed to know if I am in a Thai restaurant and not at a party. Checking, checking... Nope, it is the DL spot!  One more drink please, I love this place.

The staff are quite helpful and look to answer any questions you may have.  So do not get shy now, because if you are, go grab another drink and come back once you see rainbow-colored flowers.  We trying to get twisted, sing Bob Marley songs, and yelp!

How would I rate this place:
I would rate this place 10/10 base on today's event.  They don't have a cover charge, which can be better than that!  We are jamming!
Awesome ambience. The rooftop was real classy and kept at the perfect temperature. Wouldn't mind spending all my weekends there!
We had a great time at our event.  A nice spread for dinner was prepared, the staff, and bartenders were attentive,  and friendly.  Thank you all for the great service!
Started off on a party bus. Ended up at DL. DL is a very diverse crowd and I absolutely loved that! We all had a very enjoyable night!

There is fraudulent activity going on in that restaurant. And the manager is in on it. I was there and my card was used multiple times for drinks and food that I didn’t even purchase. When I called and explained this to the manager she called me a liar. I ask her to send me the receipts she did and the receipt signatures did not match. I told her to check her cameras she told me she would get back to me in a few days.  she never did.  I tried contacting her I was never able to get in touch with her..  now that I finally get in touch with her weeks she is telling me that the security tapes are no longer available.

formatted_address: 1491 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10075, USA
name: Calexico

reviews.text: What a great little restaurant!! After visiting the Met with my family recently, we were looking for a place to grab some dinner and took a chance on Calexico.. It was a busy Friday night and there was a bit of a wait (about 40 minutes) but the place was buzzing and we enjoy people watching so it moved quickly.. The staff was super friendly, getting us settled at our table and taking our order.. We ordered a delicious cocktail while we waited and the food came out quickly.. Everything we ordered was cooked and presented perfectly.. The portions were all generous and the prices totally fair.. All in all Calexico is a total thumbs up from my family and me.. I would usually never pick a NYC restaurant blindly off google maps without a trustworthy reference, but I’m so happy we gave Calexico a chance.. We look forward to stopping in again when we’re on the upper east side!!

Calexico is the combination of California and Mexico because it's a city located at the border of California and Mexico. The ambiance is cozy & relaxed and the service was friendly. 

First of all, we tried Esquites and Crispy Brussels Sprouts as starters. The Esquites was delicious and creamy. I love brussels sprouts dishes but I don't recommend to order because the balance of Brussels sprouts and balsamic vinegar was off. 

For entrees, we had 2 tacos - Grilled Shrimp Taco & Chipotle Pork Taco and Carne Asada wet Burrito with both red & green sauce. 

The tortilla they used for each flavor is different and we preferred the chipotle pork with corn tortilla. The grilled shrimp was cooked chewy but salty. The spice with pulled pork was greatly matched with all the ingredients. 

The portion of wet burrito is super huge and the beef was kind of dry but well flavored.
Great spot.  Busy as heck though.  Staff keep up the pace so you aren't stuck waiting.  Everyone enjoyed their food and the drinks were top notch.

Worth the wait! Pro tip, go there for lunch, quicker to get in! Food is always consistent and delicious! Personnel is awesome and friendly! Best Fajitas in town. Start with the guacamole and chips, a margarita and then fajitas and that’s the perfect cambo. The wet burrito is really nice too. They have happy hour from 4-7 weekdays. Totally recommend, we go there as soon as we want Mexican food!

Probably this is one of the very few places in NYC that serve good portions. Staying just 2 blocks away from Calexico is a blessing in disguise. We ensure to go here at least once in a fortnight. We’ve tried almost Everything on the menu and all are delicious.
Nice ambiance and good food.

formatted_address: 42-50 21st St, Long Island City, NY 11101, USA
name: Show Palace Gentlemen's Club NYC

reviews.text:
Walking into the place the girl by the door had major attitude. No worries, I shrugged it off and the $20 cover charge for me and a lady friend. Get inside and I'm literally the only guest inside. But what really makes me give them a 1 star rating is how they don't serve alcoholic beverages and then try to lie and say the beer and wine is reduced. They are selling $50 bottles of grape juice, saying it is reduced alchohol wine but in fact it has all been removed.

No DJ, obviously since no one would dare spend any high amount of money completely sober. We were listening to Pandora (clean version) and not one single dancer got nude despite me tipping everyone who got on stage.

Final verdict, avoid this place. You will enjoy another place that doesn't try to get you to spend your money on fake drinks and high cover charges.

Nothing special! But this place could be way better if owners would take care of it properly. Service sucks.  Bartender is super unfriendly! They sell non alcoholic beer, wine and champagne.  Hooka is horrible.  There is only 3 dancers here, Monday holiday night. The only thing I like in here  are the space & music. Bartender will try to overcharge you. Make sure you will get a description of your order before he charge you!!!

Not a bad place, I went at 9 pm on a Wednesday night  and it was pretty dead which was surprising. 
The staff was pretty nice, most were friendly. 
Only three or four girls were there, but one did tell me it gets much more busy later at night. 

Most of the girls weren’t my personal taste but I can’t fault the place for that. Overall it’s a decent place

Wasn't busy when I was there but considering the time of day and season, it wasn't a huge surprise. The staff that were there were very accommodating. Obviously the no alcohol policy would be a problem for many but that's not on the establishment. Only thing that put me off was a request for a photocopy of my ID when I paid with credit. Aside from that I had a good time.

Overall I liked this place. Admission is 18+. There is NO ALCOHOL INSIDE. Go to the liquor store or come ready to party. Cover depends on the night and there is a 2 drink min (even though no alcohol is served at the bar). Don’t use the ATM in the club ($10 atm fee), pull out cash before you enter. Hands down best club for those under 21.

formatted_address: 930 8th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Chai Thai Kitchen

reviews.text: The space is fairly small and cozy on the ground level but they have a larger upstairs area with tables. Had a really nice time here. Went for lunch and sat upstairs. The food was really good! I ate the Chiang Mai Noodle dish- it was a really good curry sauce with beef and noodles. The servers were all also very nice and on top of it. Will be back!

Disappointed - maybe we ordered wrong but nothing hit us as being very good.  The spring rolls had thick deep fried coating with carrots and cabbage inside.  Nothing to get excited about.  My husband's pork was chewy and not flavored well.  I had one of their house specials in a bowl with crispy noodles on top that took up half the bowl.  Very hard to eat.  The staff was pleasant and the place was busy.

Tiny place - no privacy at all. Tables are smooshed together. My friend and I were sandwiched between two tables. The poor waiter has to acrobatics to even get around with the food, let alone take orders. 

Nothing special about their food. The peanut vegetable Thai dumplings were crunchy. 

The chicken dish gave me food poisoning. I didn’t even make home before it started. 

Wouldn’t go back. There are other places nearby to try.
Never had Thai food before and I loved it. Everything was outstanding from appetizer to entrees. The place is cozy, the customer service is excellent t as well as the drink menu.
Nice calm restaurant with attentive staff. The food is always outstanding. This night I had the Pork Belly appetizer and veggie Pad Thai with a few Tigers

formatted_address: 150 8th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: THAI SLIDERS

reviews.text: Without a doubt the best Thai food in all of NYC!!! I absolutely love Thai Sliders. The Hobo is amazing, and I was told the restaurant owner crafted this recipe herself. The chive cakes are really special as well. Really lovely staff, TI always provides exceptional service!

We had a lovely meal here. We went on a Friday evening at about 9pm and were seated quickly. 
We started with cocktails which were good and not crazy expensive. 
Pork buns for starters were delicious and chicken Penang curry was as good as I’ve had anywhere, which is a big compliment as I eat a lot of Thai food. 
Service was very attentive and the atmosphere is great. 
Well worth a visit.
Absolutely yum, just look at the photos (honey pork slider and chicken pad Thai)

If you enjoy Thai food this place is a must! 

Whilst walking past just we just chanced our luck as it looked really nice from the outside. 

The waitress was fantastic, really polite, friendly and chatty. 

The food was a very good 9/10, having visited Thailand in 2017 this really reminded me of the freshness there. All the food was made to order and they continually came around to top up drinks etc. 

Really enjoyed the atmosphere and did not feel rushed at all. 

5/5

My two friends and I attended a workshop in Manhattan on 12/5/19 and decided to eat at this restaurant for lunch. When we arrived at noon, we were one of the first customers to be seated. Shortly after, other customers arrived. Within 5 minutes the restaurant was full. As the waitress took our order, she kept turning around to the other customers appearing disinterested in our order. She quickly attended to the mostly white customers in the restaurant. We realized that the customers who came after us were quickly served. They ate, paid for their food and left while we waited to be served. We waited for at least 50 minutes before the first entree was presented. Our entire one hour lunch period was over. We refused the meal and the workers were unapologetic about the situation.

formatted_address: 126 Chambers St, New York, NY 10007, USA
name: Mudville 9

reviews.text: Expansive beer list with interesting offerings on draft. The staff were attentive and friendly and the space was well laid out: plenty of varied seating (high tops, regular tables, a long bar). The food is normal Americana pub fare with wings and such and the prices were reasonable. I didn't notice a happy hour special but would definitely return.

Went out for wings and beer with a few friends after work today and it was TERRIBLE. The wings were over cooked and dry. The skin from the wings cut my tongue and roof of my mouth and is still hurting at the time of this review.  I don't know who on the area has better wings but I can almost guarantee it will be better than this place. 

The wings are better at your local bar, wherever you are. 

The service was great. The wait staff was very attentive and didn't forget one request we made. Would never come back but service would get 5 stars.

I walk past this place everyday going to and from work and yesterday I decided to go in with some friends and it was the best thing ever. The servers were friendly and the food was great. Let's not forget the $5 all day drinks were the bomb. The  manager asked us if we mind moving to the next table to accommodate a bigger party and we didn't mind. And because we didn't fuss, he gave us some wings for free. I will definitely be back.
Awesome wings! They also have a good beer selection. Fun, energetic crowd. Can get crowded in the evenings but there's usually enough seating.
Love the $5 all day well drinks! This place has a great atmosphere and good food too!  Definitely a perfect place for after work happy hour!

formatted_address: 246 Spring St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Bar d’Eau

reviews.text: Very expensive drinks which really weren't very good. Nice place to sit, if you set aside the drinks situation.
Low service, and very expensive place. Check the drink menu before order something. And they include service charge on a check. Paid 25$ for mohito and that was not even a mohito
If it’s what you say, I love it, especially later in the summer

My husband and I had a lovely time visiting the Big Apple and staying at Trump Soho.  The experience was immeasurably enhanced by our late afternoons spent in the Bar d'Eau.  All the staff were delightful and lead by the Food and Beverage Manager, Massiel Mendoza. The drinks were creative, delicious and potent.  Some were even sold by the pitcher, which was a definite plus.  Food was also adventurous, tasty and impeccably prepared/served.  Many beautiful people to rub elbows with.  Excellent "deal making" atmosphere.  We will return--
Gorgeous, serious Miami vibes in NYC in this rooftop bar and pool.

formatted_address: 31 8th Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Tavern On Jane

reviews.text: Great brunch spot!!! The had a big selection of pre fix brunch menu that includes a breakfast bread basket, entree and drink. The food came out fast and fresh. I would definitely go again for a solid brunch.

LOVED IT! Definitely recommend the place for brunch. Try their brunch menu. I had the frittata served with coffee, Bloody Mary, muffins, fruits, and soup. All that food for a reasonable price! The ambience was a plus. 👌

Who knew an Irish Pub can not only quench your thirst but, fill your belly with some deliciousness.  Tavern on Jane has a delightful ambiance, a nice selection of draft bears as well as bottled. A very reasonably priced and filling brunch with treats and drinks.  And more importantly,  service with a smile. Yes. Go.

My visit here really surprised me. It looks like a dive bar (and definitely has that vibe if you sit at the bar), but the food is SO good. We ordered a bunch of appetizers, entrees, and sides, and were extremely stuffed but kept eating because it was so good. I'm rarely impressed by how restaurants do brussels and these were perfect. They also served up some of the best risotto I've ever had. We had to wait a bit since we walked in, but I'm very glad we did and would recommend you do the same.
Everyone I have ever brought here has loved it. Food is always delicious, staff is wonderful and the drinks are great. Bonus: they serve food until 1am!

formatted_address: 486 6th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Soigne

reviews.text: The food here is alright. The restaurant is spacious so it’s good for large parties. The service here is pretty slow, we went for lunch when the restaurant was not crowded and we had to wait awhile to be served.

Excellent!   Fine French inspired food, excellent service, lovely ambiance and at a truly affordable price.  The steak (frites) was superb and huge!  Served medium was perfect!  Brussels sprouts yummy!  Lobster ravioli with peas in a pink cream sauce excellent.   Happy hour gets you half-priced drinks, some of which are very creative.  Desserts!  Smoked praline ice cream!  Chocolate and walnut bread pudding.  Wow.  This is a top notch restaurant that will make you wonder if you are still in Brooklyn.  Highly recommend and will return.

This is fine dining with impeccable, unobtrusive service and wonderful food. The chef himself even presented our main course and explained everything beautifully. The lunch set is a great value for this level of food and a great chance to enjoy this space.The chef's table seating allows for a wonderful chance to see the chefs at work with only other 16 - 18 maximum diners in that main area. The food was executed perfectly from the smoked pork to the clam and leek soup and poached lobster. But we really enjoyed the warm, attentive service which was relatively quick but never felt rushed. I'd definitely visit again.
It was great. Group party to celebrate 3 birthdays, even though there was only one patron aside from my Group it was great.  Best time to go and have a quiet and or romantic time is Sunday at 5

Our late-afternoon Sunday brunch was good. It's a corner restaurant-bar that probably looks better at night. The waiter/bartender was a pleasure. He works efficiently, quietly and made a nice Hendricks Gin Martini. The food was flavorful and well portioned. After we ordered, he brought us warm mini-sweetbuns to get our appetite warmed up. The Brioche French toast was nothing to write home about. The Braised Short Ribs and eggs was flavorful and filling. Good coffee too. Reasonable prices. Enjoy.

formatted_address: 566 Nostrand Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11216, USA
name: Amour Cabaret

reviews.text: Came home to visit. 30 dollar cover charge. They don’t take cards once your inside. So you can’t use a debit or credit card to pay for drinks just cash. The ATM charges you 10 dollars to take money out. The vibe was trash and the club was weak. Bottle girls were pretty but rude and unfriendly. Save your time !!! GO SOMEWHERE ELSE !
Hottest Strip Club in NYC , beautiful dancers , great vibes , Awesome VIP section

*$30 Cover
*Ghetto Looking Dancers & Bartenders 
*Weak Drinks
*Low Ceiling So 0 Pole Tricks
*Bartenders More Concerned With Taking Selfies Then Serving Drinks
*Just Drive To Anywhere In Queens Instead

Rude Security Guards
Rude & nasty door people 
30 dollar cover charge 
Drinks weren’t great 
Waste of time
Slider

formatted_address: 731 Lexington Avenue Located inside, Beacon Ct, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Hutong New York

reviews.text:
Really courteous staff and extremely upscale. The soft shell crab was a must. The mouth numbing fried chicken was insane.

The dim sum platter was a pass. Nothing special. The Peking Duck was enormous- enough for a large party in itself.

Really professional staff and a great experience!

I am leaving a review after my second visit. Ambiance is contemporary, corporate and airy. Thought the bar was actually quite beautifully designed. 

Food is refined and served beautifully but it’s timid on the spices. Wished it was a bit more flavorful.  Everything was pretty good but what stuck out was bad Peking duck.  It was served cold w thick layer of congealed solid fat under the skin.  (not even pictured). From half a duck, only 8-10 slices of meat. Whoever said it’s the best duck in the city?! 

Service is very attentive both times. I would go back - just no duck.

OMG! Absolutely amazing experience. They carved my duck right in front of my table and then served it in two different ways. I had soy ice cream for the first time and also order dumplings and crispy shrimp. The flavors were amazing and the service was #1! I will surely be coming back.

High end dim sum with a twist. My favorites were the hot and sour soup dumplings and mochi pork dumplings (the black ones). The flavors are unique and don’t leave you feeling as heavy as with traditional dim sum. The dessert is also a must have - a sesame dessert shaped like a bun with a side of soy milk ice cream. I would definitely come back here for a special occasion.
Absolutely delicious. The food is incredibly creative and good. Great design decor, beautiful people. Trendy

formatted_address: 300 W 23rd St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Asuka Sushi

reviews.text: The food here is amazing! I definitely recommend it. I’ve been to many sushi places and this is by far one of the best. Very close to Penn Station and very spacious.

This is one of my new favorite places. The atmosphere is great, the staff is so nice, the drinks are great and reasonably priced, and the sushi is also great and reasonably prices. I always have a great time here. Love it.

We were looking for a good local sushi spot and found it. Really broad selection of rolls, specialties, and drinks. We went for the Spicy Girl and the Samurai - both were amazing. Samurai was our favorite roll though. Would absolutely stop back here again and recommend.

last night was the first time we came to that magnificent restaurant. But It is no doubt not the last. We enjoyed the evening very much with the attentive service, with the finest  dishes and wine and with the comfortable price. We will absolutely go back there again.

Very nice spot! The sushi was great. The wings, gyoza (pork and vegetables) my only -1 would be the soy sauce was too salty and they only had one option. But since the food was great you didn't need the sauce so much. Will definitely be back!

formatted_address: 208 W 23rd St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Sushi Seki Chelsea

reviews.text: Excellent sushi. Great service. Good sake options. A bit pricey, however. Otherwise 5 🌟.

Sushi was fine, but this place is a scene. Not sure what gives it notoriety but I am not sure it’s the food. It was good sushi, and you will enjoy your food, but it’s not a particularly memorable experience. Order the salmon with roasted tomato and that alone may cause you to disagree!
A wide variety of delicious sushi! Highly recommend to try the spicy scallop hand roll and the tuna avocado salad! Price for two was around $220.

Really appreciate the staff being so kind and helpful. The sushi was outstanding and loved every bite I took! I'm literally obsessed with the black sesame ice-cream I have only had the ones that were completely black of color but the taste was so rich and lovely. Was really surprised to have such lovely food late at night. Thank you so much for this memory!
This place is worth visiting. They serve large portions for affordable rates. Consistently well kept and with awesome vibes. Will come back again.

formatted_address: 282 W 44th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Bus stop

formatted_address: 201 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Jeepney

reviews.text: The food is delicious! Prices are reasonable servers are great. Down side, place can get busy and the servers were a bit spread thin. But that's Sunday brunch in NYC. Overall Great place!

The flavors of the Bicol express were wonderful and bought me back to my childhood. I definitely got my money’s worth as the portion was huge and had to take some home. Between letting my food digest, I had great service from the son of the owner, who offered me Filipino newspapers to read and was very polite and friendly.

This is similar to an average Indian restaurant, however it's Filipino which is unusual in London. Food is good quality and delicious, with some very interesting dishes. We shared three plates and a portion of rice, and a beer each.

I visit this restaurant quite a bit! This is my favorite restaurant to eat.  I go to this spot regularly. The meals are fantastic, the team is professional and the rates are decent. I enjoy eating in this place for a nice dinner.

Food was very tasty and well presented. The place was very small and barely have no place to eat and enjoy your meal. The bartenders were good mixing drinks. But Chris was not that friendly and accommodating but Stefania has a very pleasant personality. The place has a lot of potential if a better hospitality is given. A trait most Filipinos are known for and not like being treated and served by a snobby New Yorker! Service to me is everything. Anyone can cook a good meal but an outstanding service is what makes people go back for your food. We were not check if were ok or if we needed anything after we were serve. Not even offered for desserts or water.

formatted_address: 1483 1st Avenue #1, New York, NY 10075, USA
name: Maruzzella

reviews.text: Excellen food and service at reasonable prices. This was my first visit but I'll return.
AMAZING Italian fare, delicious specials and the only placed packed on Memorial Day, now we know why!!!

Can I just say wow! The food is exceptional and I am highly picky when it comes to my Italian. Amazing sauce. Amazing pasta. Great customer service. Polite and courteous staff as well. Bolognese is my favorite. Highly recommend this restaurant. You cannot go wrong! While it is pricey, it is highly worth it. You get what you pay for!

If I could give Maruzzella's 6 stars I would.  We stopped in at 7:30 on a Friday night, with no reservations, and the staff went out of their way to find a place for the four of us.  

We started out with baby artichokes that were pan roasted in olive oil and served with thin crispy slices of garlic chips and small unpitted olives.  Delicious.  The artichokes were tender and the hearts had that perfect creamy consistency once you started chewing on them, the garlic chips were sweet and mild,  and the olives added the perfect sharpness to each bite.  What a treat. 

Now..... my main course was so tasty and savory that I actually passed up desert because I didn't want to introduce any new flavors to my palette. 

I had the rigatoni cipullo. A plate of perfectly done, al dante rigatoni in a light cream sauce with blended sweet sausage, prosciutto, onions and a touch of cinnamon.  Don't be fooled,  when you see the meat in the description you might think there would be chunks of meat tossed into the light cream sauce,  and you would be wrong.  The meat is pureed with the cream sauce and the cinnamon, creating this silky sauce of love that I wanted to bury my face in.  Instead, what I actually did was carefully slide two rigatoni onto the fork tines through the holes, and slowly savored each bite until there were only six rigatoni left, and stopped, because I was just at that place where I felt like I was floating. Just full enough to be satisfied, and at the point where I knew that if I had eaten the last six, it would have pushed me over that edge where I would have felt that uncomfortable fullness,  and I didn't want to risk anything detracting from how satisfied and comfortable I felt. This was one of the best pasta dishes I have ever had. 

Wonderfully warm and accommodating staff,  delicious original recipes, and extremely reasonably priced.  The trifecta of a perfect meal on the Upper East side of Manhattan. 

P.S. my dinner mates had tagliatelle alla bolognese, linguine alla vongole (white clam sauce), and pasta with sauce that they all raved about, but honestly, as good as they thought their dishes were,  there's just no way they were as good as mine. 

Mangia e divertiti (eat and enjoy)
We were lucky enough to sit outside on a beautiful night and enjoy delicious food.

formatted_address: 85 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Dudley's

reviews.text: Great place to have brunch! The wait can be a bit much because I can tell many people adore this place. The food is fabulous as well as the atmosphere. It's very charming to be in LES while eating here. I definitely think it's a great place to take someone for a date. However, be aware of how noisy it can be and how busy it can get during lunch / dinner time. Otherwise, enjoy enjoy enjoy!! LES is so grateful to have a place like this :-)

The bar looks so so pretty. I had a happy hour cocktail (lavender honeyfield) which was a whole lot spicier than what I expected. Main dishes were yummy but gotta highlight the side dishes that were as delicious as the main! I'd come back for brunch - food was so good.

Chic bar with Australian flavors in the LES. Staff was great. Convenient  to have breakfast, lunch and dinner options. Food is tasty and the cocktail menu is plentiful! No air conditioning in the place.

Went for breakfast. No decaf coffee and no sparkling water to start. Asked for eggs soft scrambled. They were the driest eggs ever. Big breakfast wasn't so big-about a tablespoon of each item. Baked beans were just undercooked navy beans with ketchup. Overall bad breakfast and experience.

I could go back here for every meal!! Last time I got the fried chicken sandwich and this time the hamburger w/ a sesame bun. The salads look to die for and the pear and burrata is also delicious. They make a great espresso martini too!

formatted_address: 85 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Sticky Rice

reviews.text:
It's okay. It could have definitely been better. Everything we tried had too much of something that over powered what the dish was supposed to be like. 

We usually love this dish but we couldn't finish our food. The service was great however and the staff is very nice. The restaurant itself has a very nice mellow ambience which we enjoyed the most.

A very cute Thai place with good vibe, and beautiful setup. 
Albeit, not a large restaurant, some very smart designer maximized the space inside to its best. 
Friendly people, they don’t skimp on the wine in your glass, big pet peeve of mine. A glass of rose is $9, unless it’s happy hour in which case it’s $7. 
We got the prefix happy hour for $18. 
At the time, it included: a spring roll, two dumplings and a chicken skewer; a free beverage; an entree and we picked the vegan green curry. 
It came all at once. But only one order. It missed the skewer. I waited. 
And waited. My partner finished his dish, by the time my food was there. 
The waitress recovered swiftly and offered the drinks we ordered on the house. 
The food, especially the green curry was excellent. People smiley and somewhat flamboyant. 
Bathroom was very clean. Perfect lighting. 
Overall, despite, the food coordination, we loved the place. They comped our second drinks, as promised. This place is a gem. They type of place you keep going back. Check it out. GO!
Spicy thai food and vegetable salad recipe are fabulous

I admire this place! They have first-cleass food, they have a rich menu, The chief cook in that spot is well trained, I enjoy a lot eating all their food. The dishes are consistently of high class, the attitude towards the visitors  is agreeable. I visit often this restaurant and I not even once was unsatisfied. I recommend this place.
Delicious! The best panang curry I've had so far. It's very rich and I love the added broccoli and wild rice :)

formatted_address: Broadway-Chambers Building, 277 Broadway Ste 210, New York, NY 10007, USA
name: ARC

reviews.text: Dengan makanan enak nya

formatted_address: 120 Allen St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: noga nyc

reviews.text: Very cool spot in lower Manhattan! Located in a hotel. Ambiance is very nice a quaint.  Food is dairy and was very good. When we went there were only 3 other people there. Food is very good but portions are small considering the price!

Wonderful little cafe. It took a couple of minutes to locate as the entrance was closed so we asked at the hotel and they let us in. Service was amazing and the food was incredible. 

NB I was there in October and have since noticed it may have closed down.
I very much loved their dishes and service, great location very close to my residence. The workers are always super friendly. Will come visit again.

We went on a Sunday night during labor day when 2/3 employees called out. But honestly, we didn't even notice.  Ariel was a god send. He was our bar tender, host, food runner, AND waiter. The restaurant should be lucky to have him. He made our experience so great. 

The food was delicious. They feature pastas with unique flavored sauces. They have some fish dishes but their pastas really stand out. Highly recommend.
We came for Brunch and were delightfully surprised at our spur of the moment choice.

formatted_address: 75 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Mighty Quinn's Barbeque

reviews.text:
I’ve liked Quinn’s for a while, tried their other locations as well. Unfortunately this particular time it wasn’t as good as expected / what I’ve been used to. 

Tried the brisket sandwich for delivery. Large portions, good price, average taste. Didn’t seem to hold up well for delivery, was already cold by the time I ate. The brisket also seemed drier and less fatty than what I remembered.

Simply perfect place. Beautiful & Yummy food, it's that special nice atmosphere to go to place. When you want to enjoy very good tasting food this is the restaurant. Yesterday my daughter & I, first time visit and we loved it. Staff is very nice and give a friendly home feeling. Menu is fabulous 👌

I sent my friends to this restaurant with my warmest recommendations. I visit this place often. This recommendation is always successful. The meals are fantastic and the crew is very friendly and cooperative. Every time  we eat in this place we have a delightful evening.  I recommend this place with pleasure.
Damn! Our first American BBQ experience and it was amazing. Value for money is on point. Brisket and Burnt Ends are delicious. Would come here again for sure.

I used to work at this mighty quinns location 5/6 years ago but this wont be a biased review 😂 as an employee I would eat a lean brisket sandwich , sweet potato casserole, and corn fritters basically every shift. You can order anything from their menu and you’ll be happy with it. The sweet potato casserole is to die for, contains delicious pecans. Baked beans are also amazingggg. They now have added mac and cheese to their menu which tastes super good with the baked beans, crazy combo but it works.

formatted_address: 214 Willis Ave, The Bronx, NY 10454, USA
name: Caraballo's Place

reviews.text: This is not a bar, I mean no a public place, read the front door ONLY MEMBERS, they may allow to get inside, but they can kick you out at anytime, this is a private party, 3 dollars beer, Owner is the bartender
It's very nice and u spend time with ur friends
If you are looking for a mature crowd with no issues just beer drinking and a pick up pool game(1table)this is the spot. All are welcome but it's primary a Latino location.
Very family oriented place

formatted_address: 135 Atlantic Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Chez Moi

reviews.text: This restaurant is my preferred one. I eat in many restaurants but here I keep coming back again and again. The stuff is very cordial and the food they offer is so yummy. I would always prefer to have a good meal in this place. Highly recommended.
The food was definitely alright and so was the service. Portions were great. !
Nice atmosphere and super welcoming service. The menu was crisp and delicious. Will definitely recommend this spot to others. Convenient rates and generous meals. Good job.

This place is my first choice place.  Of all restaurants I know I like it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to visit this restaurant. Whenever  I I need a proper meal, this restaurant comes straightaway to my mind. good and diverse  food and a large menu.courteous crew, and great spirit. Also, the price is reasonable. I sent my friends to this spot with great pleasure.

There is a wide selection of cocktails, although the wine available by the glass is somewhat limited. I had the salmon with roasted vegetables, which was absolutely delicious. The atmosphere is dim and intimate,  making it ideal for a date night.

formatted_address: 131 E 54th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Bobby Van's

reviews.text: This is amongst the best steakhouses I have eaten at. The Filet Mignon is simply amazing. They have a fantastic selection of wines as well to go along with the high quality food. The staff are very professional, I had a corporate lunch event held here and they did a great job all round from food quality, service, everything was superb. I plan to come here more often for sure!

Last night I hosted a 30 person dinner at Bobby Vans on 54th Street and it could not have gone better! Danny, Chris, Marco, Victor, and Juri were incredible! My guests were blown away by how accommodating and on point they were. I highly recommend for anyone looking for friendly staff, amazing food, and a great experience!
Advance booking recommended. Great ambience and service. Heavy on the pocket

One of my local haunts. The bartenders memory is better than writing it in scripture. Great atmosphere, good steakhouse food, and some of the best bartending/hospitality in the city.

I frequent at least once a week. Would recommend to anyone. Bit pricy, but you get what you pay for.
Nice place, has small bar area, but comfortable, and nice adult atmosphere.  Nice rooms in rear for private dinners.  Food was delicious!

formatted_address: 15 Gold St, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: Felice

reviews.text: Lovely place tucked away in lower east side. Soundtrack was a little all over the place genre wise, so changed the vibe a bit - but lovely classic Italian food! Decor, lighting and seating make for a beautiful ambience.

Lovely cozy Italian place. Brunch was great (comes with a drink), but the pasta even better. Wait staff is very nice & professional. Interior design is elegant & beautiful. Food is amazing & worth the price imo

So lovely when you stumble upon a great restaurant. I came here with a coworker and was so pleased. Medium sized dining room and we sat at the bar. Great service very attentive wonderful menu suggestions. Everything was delicious from the bread they placed on the table even the olive oil was delicious. I had one of the best bowls of minestrone ever and then the pappardelle with sausage. Absolutely delicious!

Fantastic experience. Staff was extremely nice and on top of taking care of us. I had the Gnocchi and it was exquisite. Drinks stayed refilled and food was out promptly. Really relaxed and elegant atmosphere. Would come back again for sure.
The space is sumptuous.  Gorgeous wood tones and dark but just enough light for the tables -- very romantic and stylish.  The food is also excellent.

formatted_address: 206 E 60th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Patsy's Pizzeria

reviews.text:
Excellent pizza and some very good pasta dishes that are decent as well -- but go here for the pizza (or get delivery) -- it's worth it!

I love both the square "grandma style" and the round neapolitan pies -- all the toppings are high quality and in general the service is really good. To be honest, the only reason this isn't a five star review is that occasionally the staff can be a little snippy.

Recommended!
The pizza tasted amazing! Ordered the Margherita with pepperoni. Pepperoni has a nice little kick to it. Must try. Only thing is wish they had garlic knots/rolls.
Excellent pizza and service. The place is busy with take away orders along with dine ins. This was our second Patsy's location in two days. Kids just can not have enough of this pizza.

The food is very good at both locations we've been to (Upper West Side and 60th/3rd). It's a little pricey if you don't get a pizza. $20 for spaghetti and meatballs is s bit much for this type of place, though it is very good. We give this location 3 stars more for the service, though. The last couple of times we've visited, there was only one server on the upper floor, and things were slow. Don't know if people called in sick, but they need better coverage. We saw our server twice, once when we ordered and once when he delivered the bill. Unfortunately,  with so many choices in NYC, we've decided to give Patsy's a rest for now.

We have been coming to patsy’s for the last 15 years and sadly this is no longer the same place. Not sure if this has new owners or what but we will not be coming back. The pizza which used to be amazing was somehow both burnt on the bottom and soggy on the top. Waitress claimed the bar was out of gin (?) when we ordered a martini. Oddly enough it was pretty visible to us when we walked past on the way out. 2 of our orders came out and then we waited 10 minutes for the other 2. If you’re looking at the ratings just know that they are averaging in good reviews from years past. Another once-great restaurant down the tubes.

formatted_address: 48 W 138th St, New York, NY 10037, USA
name: Social Sounds, LLC

reviews.text: Classic Harlem jazz venue. A good, friendly unpretentious atmosphere.

formatted_address: 6 Platt St, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: Ketch Brewhouse & Restaurant

reviews.text: staff was friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating especially for such a large group. Food was top notch and well portioned. The atmosphere had a perfect downtown vibe yet maintaining an upbeat feel. I will definitely come back on my own accord or any future events.

The food here is amazing!!! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The atmosphere was awesome . The service is outstanding!!! They took great care of us. Certainly an instant favorite. We will definitely be coming back regularly.

Over all good experience here. Unfortunately the rooftop bar/place is only open certain days and certain hours.
We had lunch there, and the burger looked amazing (I ordered the chicken sandwich, pictured below), which it was also very good.
Ambiance and atmosphere were good, it was not crowded when we were there and it is nice not to have diners 10 inches from you (as all NYC places do).

Very much enjoyed the chopped salad and the organic Mediterranean chicken. Tasty but lite and very courteous and attentive staff make it a 5 star option for a relatively  inexpensive hotel restaurant.

Nice atmosphere and lively happy hour!

Stayed here for business and had dinner.  Place was very nice, staff very friend and the food was great.  Only reason gave it three stars is that it was my first time.  If able to. One back and it is consistent I would give four

formatted_address: 75 Ninth Avenue, Market, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Cull & Pistol

reviews.text:
My favorite raw bar in Chelsea, maybe even the whole Manhattan! These guys don’t mess around: the service is great (love sitting at the bar), food is amazingly fresh! Love the assortment of oysters and seafood, and the advice that chefs can provide depending on your taste preference. 
Casual refined atmosphere. Always feels fun and welcoming. A must-go if you in Manhattan and love raw bar and seafood.

Amazing! This was the absolute best way to start our weekend in New York. We came in for lunch on Friday to try the lobster rolls and oh my god the Connecticut one is to die for. If you’re anywhere near the area the trip is worth it just for one of those. Also amazing? The service! Everyone we interacted with was so friendly. Our server absolutely took the cake though. Ellen made some excellent recommendations for our wine- try the rose cava!- and then after our meal she made even better recommendations for our day around the city. Thanks so much to her and the rest of Cull and Pistol for kicking off our weekend the right way!

I am just sad I cannot give them 6, 7, or even 10 stars on this review. Their lobster is amazing. It has all the juice, jelly-like texture, and yet extremely easy to gulp down.

Definitely try their clam pasta. You will be amazed by how a different taste come together to play the harmony. Just one warning for that tho: the shell of the clam may be broken during the cooking process and so you will have to watch on that. But the taste just tops over that, so I will always come back here when I have any chance to do so.

Went for their happy hour.  Oysters were amazing. Enjoyed their mignonette sauce and the cocktail sauce.  Had clams as well. Equally delicious!
Helpful, friendly, inviting, staff. Definitely will be back again sooner rather than later.

Great little space in Chelsea Market with a bar, and window seating for people-watching. Situated next to a really cool industrial pipe with water gushing into a well. Neat old building, with lots of amazing shops of varying sorts. Pricey, but it's NYC 🗽😍

formatted_address: 175 Lenox Ave, New York, NY 10026, USA
name: El Encanto De Lola 2

reviews.text: Fresh authentic food and good happy hour from 12-8 on weekdays. 12-7 weekends. Margaritas with fresh line juice. Family owned. Make sure to ask to see the specials menu. Delicious m

Wonderful atmosphere! Great wait service!  Guacamole and salsa were delicious! Tortilla chips were freshly made! Had the shrimp with peas and rice and refried beans! Portion was perfect and filling! A very nice restaurant in Harlem and a great place to go if you don't want to go downtown. Very clean and well decorated! Will definitely be dining there again!
Excellent Tex-Mex food right in the heart of beautiful Harlem. Malcolm x boulevard at the heart of 120th Street. I loved the pork chops. The wait staff was very friendly.!!
Drinks and service stole the show. Food could use more flavor and seasoning. They are really nice people tho.
Wonderful atmosphere, all very attentive workers if you need anything. Good service. The food is great.

formatted_address: 2607 Broadway, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: Regional

reviews.text:
I don't even live on the UWS, but $10 bottomless mimosas along with seriously good brunch food. I'm sold now.

I had the artisanal sausages - buffalo & chipotle chili and rabbit & white wine sausages, with over easy eggs and country potatoes. Both had such clear, distinct flavor profiles - I really can't complain. Delicious!

Great service, mediocre food, tired interior. The waitress was very attentive and service was quick. The food was ordinary. The lasagna was doughy; the gnocchi was bland. Good cheesecake dessert though. The interior is charmless, the walls need painting, and add some candles to the tables (even fake candles would be better than nothing.) The $100+ bill (not including tip) was high for this quality of food.

I went for a brunch and I got the avocado toast Benedict. Dissapointed and definetly I would not come back for the food. The bread was hard and was not really toasted. The egg was fully cooked, it should be soft in the center but it was more like a hard boiled egg. And last (look by yourself, pics below) the avocado was a very thin layer of an already blackened avocado. My guess is that they prepare the mixture early in the morning and when it got to my untoasted toast was a few hours later. I could have pass it if flavor was OK, or eggs were great or something was good... but nope, worst avocado toast of my entire life. Owners are kind, the rest of the service is poor.

The food (as long as you dine in) is FINE. But honestly, the incompetence for takeaway is out of control. We had to call and complain on TWO separate occasions. The first time they completely left the prosciutto off a $14 salad that is literally just prosciutto and melon. The second time, I specifically ordered a salad with grilled peaches and they sent me this wet, inedible mass of red cabbage with 3 sad slices of pear,  zero peaches, and no explanation. So inept. Never again. Go to Lucciola on Amsterdam.
Staff and atmosphere are great. I went against my judgement and got the veal special. It was very tough. Very tough. Not flavorful either. But their other foods are good.

formatted_address: 369 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Benvenuto Cafe

reviews.text: This place is amazing for delivery. Late night or anytime.Great food and amazing service. We ordered some mashed potatoes, and asked them to be customized for our special dietary needs. Turned out to be the BEST MASHED POTATOES EVER! Thank you so much
Good food with average prices
Fresh choices. Staff is very helpful and friendly. They also have a pretty big seating area as well..

It's my first time trying Benvenuto Cafe and it surely won't be my last. I got their Pan Seared Tuna salad and it is hands down one of the best salads I've ever eaten for lunch. I can't wait to try more things off of their menu.
Italian meatballs & pasta fantastic. What I imagined old fashioned NY Italian deli to be like. Lots of fresh ingredients.

formatted_address: 98 Meserole Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11222, USA
name: Europa Club

reviews.text: Amazing vibe and a lot of fun. Haven’t been here in ages but want to come back soon.
Music wasn’t good enough, but the place is nice

Small venue club that caters to both rock bands and dance music depending on what is booked that night. Great view of the stage from just about any area of the dance floor, seats/table areas or even the bar. Can get pretty cramped if the band playing is a bit on the popular side, to the point the room can get too hot from too many people on hot summer nights.  Not 100% sure if it is handicapped accessible since I've only dealt with staircases for the public and stairs available to the load in entrance for bands. Occasionally they do book some bigger drawing bands which you would not expect to play in such a small room, which makes going there much more entertaining.
Hike from the G-Train to drink cheap drinks, enjoy the newest indie band or dance until you drop. Plan ahead to avoid a “dead” night.
Music

formatted_address: 124 Rivington St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Essex

reviews.text:
Love this place. Food was delicious. I was here for the valentine prefixed dinner, no complaints whatsoever. Portions were great, service overall.
My only dislike was the music was too loud for the occasion, was more like a lounge environment than romantic friendly like. I will definitely comeback for drinks.

We went on a Saturday morning, right before noon without reservations, so we had to wait about 20 minutes for a group of 4 to be seated. Definitely make reservations if you can because after we were seated, we noticed the place got packed! It’s probably a great place for parties/big groups since there’s so many seats and space—which naturally makes the place on the louder side. Great service. The Aristocrat was a bit fishy/salty for my taste but still, decent.

Went there for trivia night. Drinks were awesome. Nice and rare selections. Food was delicious but portions were way too small for the price. 
We were seated with 2 other couples/teams. Even though we told the waiter 3 times we are not one party, at the end he brought 1 bill with our combined orders and made it a mess of figuring out who ordered what..
The food was excellent especially the tuna. The atmosphere is even better. It's very spacious inside so you don't feel crammed like in other restaurants/lounges in the area.

Solid boozy brunch spot in the lower east side. We came here with a group of eight, and the per person brunch cost for 8+ people is $10 more than the stated cost per person when there is less than 8 in the group ($49 vs $39). The food was tasty and they were generous with the drink refills (especially the mimosas, which they kept bringing out pitchers of to refill). Everyone in our group seemed to enjoy their food. For ambience, the setup is nice but the music is super loud which made it difficult to chat with anyone sitting more than one seat away from you.

formatted_address: 5100 1st Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11232, USA
name: DSNY BK 7&10

formatted_address: 161 8th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Seamore's Chelsea

reviews.text: The Lobster Mac and cheese is a crowd pleaser. For lunch tried the shrimp burrito bowl which was fresh and delicious. Washed it down with an iced tea.

So, yes, it is a little pricey considering the fare. HOWEVER, the catches are so very fresh. Seared fish tacos are a popular and delectable option ( would definitely recommend them out of the taco selection). Well-balanced combination of tangy, savory and spicy. Ask for their Bronx hot sauce

Stopped in today for lunch with some co-workers. The Mac n cheese and bacon wrapped scallops were phenomenal. I recommend the burrito bowl with shrimp for lunch! Great happy hour here during the summer.

Beach restaurant in Chelsea? Seamore’s is a relaxed and beachy restaurant in the middle of The City with freshly acquired regional seafood from sustainable sources. With a menu that changes depending on what’s available, the offerings are delectable. Staff is fast, efficient and friendly. It's definitely a place to escape to the beach from the complexities of daily life.

Fresh fish daily and good healthy food. Seamore’s is different than other restaurants. It has a  cool modern styling with a warm vibe.  We travel from the UWS to get their fish of the day. Definitely recommend a visit.

formatted_address: 88 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Scarpetta

reviews.text: One of my favorite modern Italian places in New York. It has the great atmosphere and music of a trendy spot but the great pastas that are usually found in the old world joints. The duck pasta ravioli dish was AMAZING! Great wine selection. And always save room for dessert! Similar to RPM Italian.
