Exceptional experience from start to finish. World class hospitality and service, phenomenal food and drinks, perfect vibe and ambience. We were celebrating my husband's birthday and he was so pleased with all. Thank you Scarpetta for making our night special! Big thanks to Martin for being so pleasant and professional - delivering top notch service and making great food recommendations! Definitely will be back soon.

I had very high hopes walking into Scarpetta and it certainly did not disappoint. The building itself and the surroundings are lovely. The meal was exceptional. I had the baby beets and the famous spaghetti which was every bit as good as I hoped it would be. This may have been my first trip there but it certainly won't be my last.

I was skeptical at first as I was told the spaghetti is to die for. How good can spaghetti be? The answer is out of this world! So simple but world class! Great meal with the most special person living the best life

The atmosphere here is so great! It feels luxurious but relaxed, which is amazing. Reason I’m not giving 5 stars is because there were quite a few dishes they’d already run out of, so our options were limited. But the food we did get was delicious!

formatted_address: 212 E 47th St, New York, NY 10017, USA
name: #vicqueirozrecebe

formatted_address: 24 W 39th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Red Velvet Burlesque NYC

reviews.text:
Definitely one of the best burlesque shows in NYC. The exotic cabaret performers were stunning and beautiful. So funny and amazing.
This was my first time seeing this show.  My husband had seen it before.  
If you're easily offended don't bother.  I thought for the most part it was well done. The assistant was a little extreme.  
The acts amaze and leave you wondering how people can do want they do.
TOTALLY RECOMMEND!

My favorite burlesque show experience was Red Velvet. Just go. Seriously, the show is amazing, the women are beautiful and topless and Joanne is amazing! She did this acrobatic thing, where she climbed up two silk banners, and wrapped it around her leg and then tumbled down like 12 feet and caught herself with the wrapped cloth! Seriously, aside from just having gorgeous topless bodies, exuberance and impeccable dance moves the girls are just damn good!

Wonderful strip tease burlesque show and cast very funny too everyone I went with loved it! Audience is included and girls are beautiful. The hosts sings live and is very talented. Seats are stacked well to where any row you sit in you have a great view, comfy too!
Drinks inside are strong.

Very entertaining burlesque show!  You can't go wrong with a show that includes topless, gorgeous women.  There was also some comedy between all the dancing and singing.  They do engage with the audience a bit so if you don't want to partake than sit more towards the back; there's really not a terrible seat in the house.

Red Velvet Stripper Burlesque is by far to most exotic cabaret / Burlesque/ Strip Club I have ever been too. You can enjoy a great show , have a great dinner and get lap dances from sexy strippers. I was visiting nyc and this was exactly what the doctor prescribed. These strippers are amazing !!

formatted_address: New York, NY 10003, USA
name: オルフェウム劇場

formatted_address: 174 N 4th St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: MidiCi The Neapolitan Pizza Company

reviews.text: MidiCi exceeded my expectations. The salad was generous and delicious; the meatballs and the sauce —excellent. Pizza was the best I’ve had in a long time. The place is very spacious and very chill. I’m impressed. GO!

Went for the free pizza promo at their grand opening -- delicious! I was with a friend who usually finds pizza too heavy, and he devoured nearly an entire pie. Crust was light but still doughy, and the sauce had a great fresh flavor. Once we ordered at the counter, our food came out surprisingly quickly given the size of the crowd. Definitely plan on returning soon!
Delicious food. Fun luxurious atmosphere. Nice music.Good drinks selection.  Great chairs and vibe. Highly recommended! The pizzas are awesome (try the bacon and egg pizza...and the meatballs!)

MidiCi has the best gluten free pizza I’ve tasted since I moved to the city 3 months ago. It’s not that typical cardboard nonsense most other pizzerias have on their menu. Ordered the white pizza and added arugula. Not greasy and generous toppings! Staff were really friendly too. MidiCi will be my go-to pizza spot in Williamsburg.
Pizza was terrific. The perfect casual spot with a great vibe. Staff is super nice and attentive. We will definitely be back!

formatted_address: 261 8th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Dallas BBQ

reviews.text: Travelled here from Texas expecting this to be BBQ (after all, it's called Dallas BBQ).  Unfortunately, the "BBQ" here seems to be meat baked in an oven smothered in BBQ sauce.  This was definitely not slow cooked over a real wood fire at low heat all-day as I expected.  So although my expectations were not met, the food wasn't bad - it just wasn't BBQ.  (I must say, the chicken wings at the next table looked quite tasty.) What really got me, though, was that the server put a "no tip added" sticker on the receipt.  I am normally a very generous tipper 20+%, but in this case, I felt compelled to leave less (and I was just dining alone).

Stopped in for a quick lunch and we were not disappointed. We were greeted right away walking in, and promptly seated. Try the guava tsunami if you get the chance! We had ribs, shrimp and a burger and enjoyed every bite. With all that I must mention our server Luna who took great care of us, and the manager on duty Lynval who endured a memorable dining experience! Thank you guys!

Great place if you need a quick bite with a large group.

I’ve been to this place quite a few times.

Most recently I ordered their chicken sandwich.

It was alright, wish the sandwich had more chicken...

I’ve had their sticky wings (their specialty).
Probably my favorite dish so far. The wings were huge and juicy. Probably the biggest I’ve had at a restaurant.

Their burgers are also good but nothing special.

They have a great lunch special, half chicken with a side. It’s $7.99 I believe. Probably the best bang for your buck! Breaded with honey was my favorite.

Make sure you check when the special is available on the menu.

Service is always fast and friendly.

Highly recommended!

A very lively packed place..nearly always it seems. Due to the volume of clientele it is not a fast process getting seats on the weekends as a walkin. Food is good but typical. Drinks are creative and fun.

I’ve never been here, so was SHOCKED by how big everything is (it must be true that everything is bigger in Texas). I ordered the 5 wings, and it looked like 5 whole chickens came out. The drinks are served in goblets. The wings were really good, bartenders were nice and made my special request cocktails.

formatted_address: 613 Grand St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: The Saint Austere

reviews.text:
A hidden gem in Brooklyn !

First time at this restaurant last week. Small but really cute restaurant. The food was amazing I was shocked. Best steak and pasta we ever had., reminded me of Italy. Our waitress Courtney was so nice too I had so many questions about the food. She was so knowledgeable and recommended the best white wine to us. The bartender was great also made my boyfriend an awesome drink. We will be back for sure our new fave restaurant :)
Amazing experience. Had a fantastic time

Fantastic place for a special meal. Had the chefs tasting menu with wine pairing and the courses and the pairings were amazing. The food was so good I didn't even get a chance to grab photos of the meal. Awesome atmosphere, great knowledgeable staff, and the best polenta ever.
Great food!  Lovely service!  $10 pasta night on Mondays.  First experience there, but will be back.
Great ambience and wonderful food. Not too many tables so even sitting at the bar feels intimate. I recommend a reservation on the weekend.

formatted_address: Ground Floor, 167 Bleecker Street, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: The Lantern

reviews.text:
Great place for drinks and food. There's also comedy shows going on, but bar speaking this is pretty good. There's specials every night. This specific night there was a special for $5 hamburgers and buy one get one free draft drinks. They were really good, had a nice chargrill taste to them. If you're looking for a place to hang out for the night after work, this is the place to go. 

I also asked the bartender this night to make me Tech N9ne's Caribou Lou, and after a quick Google search on my phone he whipped this up. He said he made it a little heavy on the coconut, but this was very delicious.

Food, pretty decent for a bar menu. Bartenders are attentive and personable. Comics are subject to individual tastes but ALL talented. If you truly enjoy comedy, you'll leave with tears in your eyes. For a free show with a 2 drink minimum it's outstanding.

I gave a 1 star rating cause there wasn’t an option to give no stars. Was there Sunday with wife’s family. While the atmosphere was nice; the food is horrible . I ordered the jaegerschnitzel. The veal was tougher than shoe leather. Thick and touch and not pounded thin. The breading was crisp but the sauce and mushrooms were terrible. The dumplings were like sponge balls. I’m use to good German food at a restaurant in Glendale, NY. ( I won’t mention the name here) I’m sorry to say I wouldn’t recommend this place to anyone. Sorry but I had to tell the truth. Besides that my stomach was sick through the night and even now on Monday AM still quezzy. Oh well back to Glendale for me when I want German food.

I always love coming here 
 Been here at least 5 times and the comedy is always different and I can have a great laugh. The bbq wings are so good and you cant beat the 5$ frozen margaritas which I always end up tipsy from lol. Was sad that the machine wasn't working last time I went though in February
Really good fries and chicken fingers. Decent prices for the neighborhood. Super casual place.

formatted_address: 379 Union Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: The West Brooklyn

reviews.text: Such a nice place to start the day! I love how it’s both a bar and a cafe - is that like a thing in NYC? Great wifi and service. They also have open mics on Monday!
Quaint, rustic. Good is decent and staff is very pleasant. Perfect little neighborhood spot for your morning java. Could use some more melanin up on the spot, but hey? What can you do? Lol

A wonderful coffee spot with a super friendly staff and of course, delicious coffee. They have a lunch menu of $10 pressed sandwiches and they are very yummy for the price. (Try the buffalo chicken sandwich, you won’t regret it) They have an outside sitting in the back which is fun when the weather is nice! Nice chilled music vibes that are great for studying or hanging out then turns into a fun social upbeat bar environment at night.
Great kombucha on tap, tasty panini. Stroller-friendly 🤗
This place is so cute! They have a movie screen playing in the back and a cute little outdoor area. The pricing on drinks is also really good. I would def recommend

formatted_address: 63 W 54th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Murals on 54

reviews.text: My friends and I are from California and we ate breakfast at Murals on 54 every day. Their breakfast is superb! They have strawberries, blueberries, blackberries, yogurt, pastries, french toast, and various other options. Their staff is friendly, helpful and courteous. Will definitely go back when we're back in NYC.
We enjoyed it... courteous staff ... lovely setting.

Worst service ever. Waited for 3 minutes to be seated, not at busy hours, watching the waiter chatting happily with others after asking us to wait. And very brute coffee pouring- split to our hands. Smashing the dishes on our table.

An African American waitress in the restaurant was quite rude and prejudiced against Indians. We stayed in hotel Warwick for 7 days. Since we had booked complimentary breakfast, we had to face the racist waitress almost everyday. This is the only negative experience we had outside India.
The best value on the breakfast menu was the buffet at $34 after gratuity $42 per person. Servers were on point and very attentive. This is a must do on my list of things to do twice.

formatted_address: Located in the Lobby, 11 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Bluestone Lane Madison Avenue Coffee Shop

reviews.text: My favorite coffee is now in my favorite building! Song and Aussie coffee unite in my heart. How can I not give 5 stars? :)

I love this place!
So happy they opened here and couldn't ask for such a better team it has. I get Matcha green tea with oat milk my favorite tea and once in a blue a snack to go with breakfast. The finger food's and simple lunch selection is great. I like tasty avocado toast and salmon toast so delicious.
Keep up the good work BlueStone lane crew!

I love bluestone lane for their avo toast, well-poached eggs, frothy drinks and pastries! I often visit the soho location on spring street. I used to see a very sweet barista there and we used to chat — he always got my order right but was also such a kind neighbor, just compassionate and always concerned about doing right by others. I am terrible with names and I’m pretty sure his name is Eric?! Anyway, I hadn’t seen him at the soho location in a while and assume he left or something happened. Imagine my surprise when I happened to be near Madison Square Park and fancied myself a chai latte on a brisk, wintery morning. I walked into the lobby and up to the counter at this location. and who do I see but this barista!! He had the compassion to ask me how I was doing and mean it. The teams at bluestone really care and it makes such a difference to any customer’s day, really set my morning in a positive motion! I didn’t have a chance to tip Eric (I am so sorry if that is not his name) because he comped my chai, but I wanted to write this review so in the hopes that he will know how much it meant to me!

The red-haired barista at the 28th Street location was absolutely awful. She was rude and condescending right off the bat despite being approached very politely by my partner and myself. Firstly, she spoke over my partner when he tried to order, wrongly assuming that he wanted the same drink as myself - twice. I ordered an “Aussie iced latte” with oat milk as I can’t tolerate dairy, and she failed to inform me that the drink came with whipped cream in it. I’m pretty sure it’s standard practice when taking an order where someone has requested an alternative to dairy milk to warn them if the drink comes with whipped dairy cream. When I received the drink, my partner apologised as we weren’t aware of this and that I could not have dairy, to which she replied with “you ordered an Aussie iced latte and you KNOW that comes whipped cream.” Firstly, this was stated NOWHERE on the menu. Secondly, she failed to inform me when I was ordering. Thirdly, I AM an Aussie and a standard iced latte in Australia does not contain whipped cream. She huffily said “fine, I’ll make you another one.” Her attitude was so appalling throughout our exchange that I was almost expecting her to secretly put dairy into the new drink (luckily my partner kept an eye on her and made sure she didn’t). Honestly, nothing - not even a bad day - excuses such terrible customer service. The coffee tasted fine but we’ll never be going back. It’s unacceptable to speak to customers so aggressively - she’s an absolute disgrace. Wish I could give zero stars for the worst service I’ve ever encountered in NYC.
It's surprisingly hard to find good coffee in this area. Bluestone lane is hidden away in the building lobby here, but the coffee is worth seeking out. Top notch Americano!!

formatted_address: 524 Court St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Buttermilk Channel

reviews.text: Buttermilk Channel is a warm and charming New York American restaurant in the heart of Brooklyn's Carroll Gardens.  The food is elevated without being stuffy while the service avoids the often pretentious "too cool for school" service found in other neighboring hot spots.  The signature dish is the Fried Chicken and Waffle.  Its tremendously good, but don't let this comfort food staple summarize your thoughts on the total experience.  The rest of the menu is brilliantly executed, thoughtful and polished. Dishes evolve with the seasons keeping it interesting enough to make the trip again and again.

The fried pork chop is the signature of this restaurant, I thought it was well cooked but there was a slightly odd taste to the pork chop, not bad, just odd. It might have been the oil which is was cooked in, thought hard to say without trying it again. All the other did tasted great, the pancakes were light and fluffy, the eggs were cooked perfectly. Would go again and try the pork chop to see if it was just a once off oddity.
First-rate atmosphere and super amiable service. The food was crisp and delightful. Will absolutely recommend this spot to others. Convenient prices and large portions. Keep up the great work.

The food can be pricey but one is entitled to treating oneself from time to time. The apple slices add an interesting texture and a sweetness to complement the bacon and cheese in the ABC grilled cheese sandwich.  The ambiance is good and my compliments to the cleanliness of the restroom.

This is a super homey place. There was a line at opening when we arrived, but everyone managed to get a table. The staff did a great job corralling everyone in one-by-one to keep the air-con under control inside, We saw a lot of families - so definitely child-friendly at least at brunch (there were crayons at the table). I found the place to be a bit dark and I wish there was more natural light. 

The food was rich and buttery. My favourites were the sticky bun, the biscuits (though a bit dense) and the French toast. That French toast with the bourbon sauce was just amazing.

formatted_address: 327 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: All Stars Sports Bar and grill

reviews.text:
Great food great prices!

This looks like a great place to watch a game. Lots of screens. I love how they keep the sound of the game volume up nice and high. It really gives a nice feel of being at a game and being around other strangers watching your favorite team. 

Our server was Jessica from London and she went out of her way to assure we were as comfortable as can be, always attentive to assure our bellies were at satisfaction. 

Wings were yummy and nice and big. Tasted great as well as the burger. Cajun fries were good albeit just a tad salty. 

Normally a place in midtown for me is quickly forgotten since I'm coming from Queens, yet this place seems really interesting and I think it's just the tip of the iceberg. 

Definitely looking to enjoy some more games here.

Like if you found this helpful

This place has an awesome vibe, jamming music (good oldies), excellent customer service by all staff, and the chefs are incredibly talented. Veggie options are abundant, catering to a wider audience which is so considerate. The impossible burger is a must, so please try it! I trust it as a vegetarian! 5/5 Amazing!

the manager was really friendly and that's why we went inside the waitress never came back after bringing the food (I wanted mayo or steak sauce for my sandwich- never got a chance to ask and just ate it) she didnt tell us the refills were extra and ended up paying 30 dollars for soft drinks. chicken sandwich was a processed patty and the worst thing was that the waitress was really rushing us by clearing the table while we were still actually eating

One of the best kept secrets in NYC is this bar. The first thing we noticed was that EVERYONE was  happy. The employees and the patrons. We visited the establishment two afternoons.  Our reason for returning was our waiter Jonathan!!!!  He was the absolute best. Thanks Jonathan for a great time.

Watched the super bowl here, having been in the week before for Taco Tuesdays. Great place, really fun atmosphere, decent food and drinks deals, staff are nice. The manager let me book a table through the Facebook page and seemed cool - and our server was flexible in getting in a couple of late arriving guests when some seats became available. Definitely recommend!

formatted_address: 161 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: No Fun

reviews.text: Best Armenian fast food!! They had a vegan option which Is appreciated, the Chef was very clean and organized. The food is to good not to try ,I live pretty far from where they are but it was worth the trip. Try it out!

No Fun is right. 
This establishment went out of their way not only to profile one of my friends but kick him out for being “too drunk” while he was completely sober then accused my sister for being “too aggressive” for calling them out on their BS.

This was blatant racism. This place is trash and all we came here for was to enjoy the birthday party our friend was hosting, and apparently we can’t even do that.

Don’t bother coming here. It’s a waste of your time. You can find better bars in the area worth your time.

The bartender was nice, but the food was gross. My wings came out undercooked. The bartender was very friendly and brought a new batch out - and those were cooked, yes, but they honestly just had no flavor. They needed salt. I gave them to a homeless guy when we left. Three stars because the service was friendly.
Great vibes and perfect for a late night tapas and drinks. The guacamole was amazing!

The No Fun bar was just that, no fun at all. The bartender came off as very rude and demanded that my group leave a tip when he provided little to no service. The food was not out in a timely manner and I had to pick it up from the bar. Although, the food was good, the poor service is not worth the food. I was wondering why there were few people in the place and now I know why.

formatted_address: 201 E 31st St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: VinoTapa

reviews.text: Excellent (small restaurants) usually better. The happy hour 11am to 8pm on Saturday...that's awesome if you want to make some plans weekend. YOU MUST CALL for reservation  Otherwise you are not going to make it. Also have happy hour weekdays and the food delicious. Definitely I MUST TO COME BACK!!👍🏼😊👍🏼

Best wine bar in NYC!  Extremely attentive and friendly staff makes you feel at home.  Cozy and warm atmosphere, good for groups or dining alone.  Great variety of Spanish tapas and wine.  Mussels, shishito peppers and pulpo are amazing!  No better place!

Very tasteful small plates. I ordered so many and loved them all! The flat breads and potatos are delicious. They were fine with altering some of the dairy ingredients on a few of the dishes, which I was thankful for. Also, they have a small outside area which is dog friendly. Drinks were good too. Definitely recommend!

Food was outstanding!  Our party had the tasting with was amazing dish after amazing dish!  Wasn’t so crazy about the drink, I had the money punch which had an overwhelming taste of bourbon and the mint leaves they put on the monkey glass.  But overall great atmosphere and great food!

OMG. Best tapas ever! Definitely get a reservation though you may be able to squeeze into the bar, we did and met some great people. Locals are the norm. Chef and staff are wicked nice. It's like cheers where everyone knows your name even if you are new. Order the odd sounding tapas, they are the best. Sangria was good, red was better.

formatted_address: 449 W 125th St, New York, NY 10027, USA
name: Palazzo 449

reviews.text: Amazing hospitality. Best bar in town with original cocktails. This is why you should move to Harlem. Now.
2-floor lounge with beautiful people! Very attractive crowd, hip music and nice cocktails. Definitely come if you get an invite!
Better than the best speakeasies in the city! An absolute must!
Amazing lounge; The space is beautifully curated 10/10 recommend a visit
Excellent hospitality and ambiance. Would come again!

formatted_address: 351 E 12th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Ducks Eatery

reviews.text: Nice place, small menu but great service and food! Went with two friends and shared all the food. We had collard greens, the ribs, goat neck and dirty rice. All the food came quickly and was great. Music wasn't too loud either. Although the place can get cramped. Note, the restaurant can be difficult to spot from the sidewalk. Very easy to get to from the 1st avenue L train stop.
I simply love their food. I always get great service here. The place is well organised and the staff members are always kind. Keep up the good work.

Stopped in to kill some time and grab a bite before a work event. The simple rustic aesthetic and friendly staff drew me in and the tasty avocado toast and black tea gave me reasons of plenty to return! This spot is cozy, comfy and serves delicious options for brunch. They also have a decent looking cocktail menu.

Absolutely delicious brunch place! I came here on a recommendation from a server I met in a nearby restaurant and they were right! This is a great place to stop by!
Whatever you do, do not underestimate their maple fries/potatoes those were amazing and my friends and I if we weren't full enough would have ordered an entire plate of them!

Let me start off by saying that of the three dishes that we ordered two were smothered in sour cream or mayonnaise.

the pastrami jerky was tasty but was covered in some sort of rub that was completely unnecessary and detracted from the flavor and texture.

The duck salad was served cold. The duck had the flavor of smoke, but quite gave me and not flavorful. the salad which accompanied it was smothered in sour cream and awful.

The last course was there famous smoked and deep fried chicken. the chicken was a little bit on the dryer side but that comes with the smoking process. However the nore rapper lent and unpleasant and fishy taste to the chicken. It was inedible for me. My partner didn't mind it as much.

formatted_address: 111 Stanton St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: San Loco

reviews.text: All-time favorite spot. I always get the fish quesadilla with their stupid sauce. If you like hot sauce, get this! Very filling!
Great place to grab a drink and chill. Staff is super friendly. Happy hour is a must.
Love the food. A little pricey but well worth it. Everything is fresh and made to order
The margaritas are great. We came during happy hour and got strawberry margaritas. The food was very flavorful and was a great deal!

I've always loved San locos. I used to go to,the one that used to be  on Ave A all the time. This spot was    nice, plenty of tables, and huge flat screen TV. Frozen margaritas are just how remember. I gave a 4 stars instead of 5,only because the beef macho nacho,  was a little wimpy. It was good but not like I  remembered. Still a good spot for some tacos and strong frozen margaritas at an awesome price!

formatted_address: 1291 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: JG Melon

reviews.text: Definitely one of the best comfort food offered in Manhattan. With beautiful and trendy customers. The place has high energy and strong vibration. A must-go restaurant. The cheeseburgers are all the best and tasty. The climax is the chili, served in two sizes. Oh my... what a chili.

Great place to go if you want a quality burger. We just needed a place to eat after visiting the Met, and I'm really happy we stumbled upon this place. Burger was amazing, and the cottage fries were different and delicious. The ambiance is very unique. Great dining experience. Will definitely be back next time I visit NYC.

Just how I remembered it when I was younger (30+ years ago). The bartender was awesome, friendly and had jokes galore. The burger was succulent, and the fries were nice and hot. You must add a side of the in house blue cheese, it's creamy with chunks of flavorful cheese. No reservations ahead of arrival, you add your name to the list with the hostess or wait for a seat at the bar. It's a tight place and probably not ideal for groups of more than 4 people. Better than shake shack and even give guys.

The burger here was delicious! Super meaty and flavorful. The only toppings that come by default are pickles and onions but honestly, that's all you need! I would definitely recommend getting the fries to accompany your burger. Furthermore, the host and waitress were super charismatic and welcoming. Finally, just like many other reviews take note of, this place is cash only.

If you're not familiar with JG Melon, you should be. If you're a burger aficionado or just enjoy a good burger, then JG Melon needs to be on your list of places to experience. It's going to be crowded when you go and the seating is close quarters, but it's all part of the experience. The service has always been very good each time I've been there and if you need to wait for the table it's not too hard to get a spot at the bar while you wait. The tables turn over pretty quickly so don't get dissuaded when you walk in and see it crowded. It's absolutely worth a brief wait to experience their burgers. They have other things on the menu, but I'll be honest I'm not sure what that would be because you don't hear much about anything other than their burgers. Just make sure that you order their twist on french fries - the burgers don't come with them.

formatted_address: 250 W 41st St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Wolfgang's Steakhouse

reviews.text: Extraordinary environment and very welcoming service. The food was crisp and enchanting. Will absolutely recommend this place to my friends. Fair rates and generous meals. Good job.

Went to lunch with work folks. No gluten free menu or options. Asked if they could do rice and beans because they have rice on the menu and beans are a staple in any good restaurant. Nope. If it was not on the menu already prepared, they couldn't do it. This is NYC, right?  Ridiculous. Had to have a salad and a baked potato. The salad was fine, the potato was underdone.  Would never recommend this establishment.

Great NYC steakhouse. Make a reservation - we were there on a Tuesday night and the place was hopping. Not an extensive menu, but what they have is good. Porterhouse for two was delish. Love the bar - see if you can get one of the bar tables in the back. Not a quiet romantic place - more of a noisy, bustling NYC kind of place.

Steak is amazing, excellent wine selection, and great for a team outing or after work drink. Seared tuna steak was alright (but giant!), mushrooms were awesome! Definitely gets loud and crowded, but love round tables for bigger groups.

Lamb ribs were nothing special, three small pieces of meat for 56 bucks is definitely not worth it. The German Potato and Mushrooms ordered as side dishes (15 bucks each) were hot (actually they were just warm) on the outside and cold on the inside, which shows that they just heat the food and throw it on your plate without even trying it.
Service also isn't good, waiters seem to think they are doing you a favor. It took us 10 minutes just to get someone's attention to order our food, and 15 more minutes plus talking with two different waiters to get the check and be able to leave the place. 
Now I know for sure I'm not coming back, you can find better options in NY, even for lower prices.

formatted_address: 25 Broad St, New York, NY 10004, USA
name: Bobby Van's

reviews.text:
Average steak house with not adequate prices. The steak was tasty but not worthy it's 60 USD. You get much better beef in other places. Further, the mashed potatoes had a lot of water. I think it is the way how they made it.

All in all, the prices are too high for what they offer.

I had a great meal in the Vault room. It felt like walking into an old bank vault. The giant door is open with the glass back so you can see the inner workings of the lock. The walls of the vault are all still the old security deposit boxes so it felt very authentic. The steak was really good I got a filet and was very pleased. The bread on the table was warm and delicious and the service was good too. They made the drinks strong at the bar and had a selection of about 10 beers. I know it's a chain so I was hesitant in some ways, but it seems like they have found a good formula to keep each location unique, but consistent in quality.

I guess the guy I met on the street on the way to the restaurant should have been an omen. I was a block away from Bobby Van's and lost my bearings. PS, no cars are allowed in the area. When I asked him for directions, he happily pointed me in the right direction but warned be it "wasn't  very good". First off, the service for our large party of 20, was abysmal. It took over 45 minutes to serve us. The first ones served were finished eating, before the last were served. This was probablyy because they only assigned one waiter to handle our entire table. They brought us out warm plates for the steak but by the time the steak came, the plates were cold.  The last two served, received the following comment from the waiter "you asked for medium well, it takes longer to cook". Yeah, but not 45 minutes. As far as the food, slightly below what you would expect from a top NYC steakhouse. The Porterhouse was cooked perfectly but a little short on flavor. The creamed spinach wasn't creamed. The sweet potato fries were excellent, however, the couple sitting next to us were eating regular fries and complaining about how salty they were. I would say all in all, a solid 3, maybe 3.5.

My experience with Bobby Van's steakhouse was not good.  The Chilean Sea Bass had a strong bad odor.  The dish also lacked the flavor for the price they were asking for.  The bone-in ribeye also had a strong odor that gave the impression that the meat was going bad.  My wife and I had the mashed potatoes and wedge salad which seemed fine.  The service was top-notch and they were completely attentive to our needs.  I have decided that with the sea bass going for nearly $40 and the steak close to $60, this will be my last visit to this Bobby Van's

Holy smokes, get the Groupon for this place!   The steaks were beyond good - definitely larger than the 14oz that was on the menu. Cooked perfectly! Steaks are reasonably priced by NY standards, but very worth it!

formatted_address: 141 Lawrence St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Circa Brewing Co.

reviews.text: Great brewery with a chill atmosphere. Loved the bar stools. We went here to try a beer they had online but they didn't have it on tap. Was recommended a different beer and it was delicious!

Came in on a Monday afternoon. It was MLK Jr Day.
The bar seemed pretty packed. We had no idea it was self seating . We waited a bit to get seated to then be told we can seat ourselves. It seemed understaff with waiters as the one waitress seemed to be taking care of everyone on the floor. She was efficient at doing her job. The flights were really cool, and they have a decent selection of beers. The pizza came out very quick. Nothing too spectacular about the place. My favorite thing about it was the decor. Cool little spot to check out if you’re in the area.

Lively brewery. Packed on weekends. Weekday nights are perfect. Very nice staff. The only thing they should fix is the hinges on their outside door. The door is made of plastic and closes violently loud, disturbing anyone sitting by the very front. They should get hinges that soften the closing swing, in my humble opinion :)
Very much enjoyed this place- great vibe, tasty beer, good food. Servers were friendly and prices were reasonable. I’ll be going back.

Beer was ok. Not the best I've ever had but very decent craft beer. Pizza was just before par. Dough was very chewy and sauce tasted like normal canned tomatoes. Would recommend to come here for one or 2 but many other good pizza places around

formatted_address: 807 5th Ave, New York, NY 10065, USA
name: Knickerbocker Club

reviews.text: A hidden gem in NYC. The food was just incredible!

I had opportunity to participate in one of the board dinners. It is a premium facility and an ancient city landmark. We had dinner in their library. Staff were courteous and helpful. I was privileged to be at this ancient NEw York City landmark.

Background:
The Knickerbocker Club (known informally as The Knick), is a gentlemen's club in New York City founded in 1871.  The Knick's current clubhouse, a Neo-Georgian structure at 2 East 62nd Street, was commissioned in 1913 and completed in 1915, on the site of the mansion of Josephine Schmid, a wealthy widow. It was designed by William Adams Delano and Chester Holmes Aldrich, and has been designated a city landmark.

Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882–1945), President of the United States is one of the notable members — joined in 1903 upon his graduation from Harvard University. Resigned from the club in 1936 amid the furor surrounding his re-election campaign attacks on the "malefactors of great wealth." (Wikipedia)
No-limit cribbage and all the scalded custard you can eat!
Very classy very impressive very eccentric design very cozy!

Great location, good facilities. The club is nice especially during good weather (there is an outdoor section.) Staff is professional. Find a coupon--price is on the high side, although worth it. Join their club and get some breakfast coupons :-)

formatted_address: 196 Smith St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: GATSU GATSU

reviews.text: They just opened, menu is very short, but every food we ordered are about right. The ramen is even better than other Ramen shops’ on smith street. They keep the same decor as previous business, which is good. People here are friendly. Hope they keep the taste and expand the menu.
Came in for a quick happy hour, super happy. Must try the mushroom martini it’s different and delicious. Cucumber salad also a must have.

What a lovely place. The people are warm, the food is delicious, and the cocktails are legit made with love. It’s a wonderful addition to the neighborhood and well worth a trip! Can’t miss. 

Be sure to ask for the background on what you’re eating and drinking; it adds to the enjoyment. I especially loved the Old Fasshun (sp?) and the cucumber app. They should bottle sauce and sell it!
Awesome ramen and Japanese small plates. The tan tan and tonkatsu broths are awesome. Great Smith Street spot. Also great music!
Great liquor selection, tasty ramen broth and a concise menu, nice owners, get the okra!

formatted_address: 10 Columbus Cir, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Porter House Bar and Grill

reviews.text: Truly the best steak in NYC-- cooked to perfection every time. And they have fantastic buttery lobster served out of the shell and excellent sides as well... cheesecake really creamy and simple. Great waitstaff... atmosphere makes you feel like you’re out of town, even if you live in the neighborhood. Magnificent and always consistent... Oh-- great bread too! Huge selection, and always soft and fresh.

We like their lunch set menu - 3 courses and $100 ish for two adults. Risotto was great. It's quiet, large space, clean bathrooms and bar. If they give you seats near the window great view of outside. Great for families or with close friends. I'm sure you can bring a baby and stroller if a young infant, but I know it's good for young and older children too. Nice to dress up a little to match the atmosphere
 Love the bread selection here too.

Like some other reviewers said, the food was good and portions were good but the service was less than stellar. Our server kind of disappeared half way through our meal and took forever to come back to take our dessert orders and then we waited a long time again until someone came by to ask him for the check, and then again a long time before they returned with our card. Steaks were good: we got the porterhouse for 2 and the ribeye for 2. Serving size was good. The creamed spinach was under seasoned and just overall very mediocre. Mash was good but nothing to write home about. Dirty martini was nowhere near dirty. View was good (if you can get a seat by the window). Bathrooms are clean. Cheesecake was bad - not a classic New York cheesecake as the menu says but has a weird coffee flavor. I noticed the table next to us barely touched their cheesecake either. So yeah, overall, a mixed experience.

I celebrated my nomination earlier this evening in this great restaurant. I am glad to say that we had a cool evening and the place was evidently the reason for that outstanding gathering. The crew  helped in a sweet style, the food was appetizing and my buddies were extremely  cheerful. We shall definitely come back again for more events. thanks very much.

Superb place but.... pricy.

The restaurant itself is very nice and chique. We were seated I believe at the best table which gave us a epic view on Columbus circle.

The quality of the food is really fantastic and all the dishes we had here were from a very high quality.

Also the service is top notch: not too much and not pushy at all.

The wine prices is a different chapter. I fully understand the price of wine is more expensive than in the liquor store but here the difference is quite high. Frankly speaking looking to these prices and calibrating this with other restaurants I think it’s too much. This is also the only negative remark I can give because all the rest is fantastic.

formatted_address: 40 E 58th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Tokya

reviews.text: Absolutely love this place! I had the time of my life here! It's not very big but the drinks and music the light show was all on point! The crowd is very mixed.
What a great spot. Food was amazing Chef Taka is the best!!! I loved the music vibe and service. Highly recommended.
Love it! Been here a few times! Great staff, the best music! Time of my life!
Arrived on a thurday night at 7pm after leaving a reservation request on machine and they were closed! What's up? Had left a message for reservation but call was never returned. Maybe CLOSED.

formatted_address: 149 Havemeyer St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Cerveceria Havemeyer

reviews.text: Great place for happy hour!! $2 tacos and $4 margaritas and beers! Come 4-7pm you cannot find something like that in Williamsburg!

Why am i a paying $3 more for Caldo de Pollo soup via caviar delivery, when i get 1/2 the amount as you get at the restaurant, and about 3 pieces of chicken in the soup. Also, adding the tortillas chips in the soup at the restaurant so that there is a layer of mush at the bottom of the delivery container by the time it gets here. What a rip off...my favorite soup to eat in person, will never order it for delivery again super dissapointed

I love their tacos, guacamole, salsa and margaritas. I have been here various times and I loved every single time. I had one waiter be rude to me but I wrote it off as an isolated event and let it slide. I reccomend their happy hour . I wish they had frozen margaritas because their margaritas are delicious and would love a frozen one on a sunny day.  Overall this place is great!!!!
It's comfy. They have a great happy hour, good Mezcal,  friendly bartenders, and family

Went to this place on a Sunday late and the waitress Masha was awesome! We had an allergy to onions she found out everything we could eat checked in us a few dozen times and was never bothered by the 8 times we ordered. Awesome food great customer service and attentive.... New favorite taco spot! Awesome and rad tacos!!! Shrimp ones are bomb!!

formatted_address: 200 E 39th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: City Beer

reviews.text: Fun spot with draft and also to go options. Hard working personable staff,and a mean grill cheese sandwhich to boot

The best idea actualized in the best manner.  Simple but extraordinary. Great staff .great beer. Only one suggestion, renovating the bathroom to allow multiple people to use simultaneously would improve the experience
Great bar! Tons of beers! The bar tender Rob was awesome too. Will definitely be back!
Great service, excellent selection of cans, and the food menu (while small) has some gourmet stuff on it. Definitely coming here again.

One of the best beer bars in NYC. Angel, Tyler, and all the other great folks here will make you feel right at home. Recommendations are always on point. Drafts rotate frequently and feature a wealth of beers from NYC and upstate. Also don’t miss the excellent bar snacks and food, especially if you’re a cheese lover.

formatted_address: 246 W 80th St, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Paint & Sip Studio New York

reviews.text: Amazing experience! Came to see whats going on here with my girlfriend. Really fun. Enjoyed every minute

Great atmosphere. So much fun!
Free glass of wine when you take a class.

Fun place to drink and hang out. The instructor was very chill yet informative. His directions are easy to follow along but visitors are free to improvise and create their own style of painting. I personally had the pleasure of being with a fun crowd to joke around and share snacks with. Be sure to bring a bottle of wine or two because this place is BYOB
Fun lil activity for a date. The teacher was very friendly and showed really good guidance and I loved the fact that we could bring our own bottle.
I came here with my husband on 2/15/20 I had a great time definitely will be back with my friends!! The instructor is amazing so much fun!!

formatted_address: 225 47th St, Brooklyn, NY 11220, USA
name: Club Lust NY

reviews.text: Overall my 1st time going and this place needs to get it in order....drinks r overpriced and flat...the dancers will fight u for the $1 and come on ur a dancer (dance).....but the security was perfect....these guys knew what they was doing....I would come again.lol
Only good thing about this place was the security. Those guys were top notch and people knew better than to mess around.

The best thing here is the hookah. The bartenders cant even make a proper drink and the strippers cant shake it like in Miami. They literally fight a dollar bill I didnt even wanna spend my bandzzz. 

This is the sad state of NY Strip clubs . I will have to go down south for that. The laws make it wayy to hard for NYC a good strip joint.
Had a great time. Drink great and a decent price. And every time I've been here the club was packed wall to wall. Came for powerhouse and had a amazing time. Will come again!
Hookah is good but strippers are very money grabby very few dancing that actually made the experience fun

formatted_address: 28 E 63rd St, New York, NY 10065, USA
name: The Lowell Hotel

reviews.text: Cozy, beautiful and with exquisite interior decor. It's a good idea to have a cocktail and a snack, while the atmosphere just does everything else for you. A good spot to have a meeting or a nice talk with a friend.

Went for Tea in the Pembroke room. Service was just ok. The food while delicious was to heavly based on sweets. Then the scones are given to you at the end.  The cost 75 plus tax and tip 97 dollars. A bit to much for me and i have had tea at many other places
Nice boutique hotel. Tiny tiny reception but in a nice part of Manhattan that's acceptable.

Everyone here greets you and is genuine and very helpful. The location is perfect. The rooms are tiny or ours was #7C We had two twin beds and a bathroom with one sink. No room for luggage storage but they were very helpful and took our luggage and stored it. The breakfast was set in the most pleasant room and was perfection. The wait staff were very attentive and there was lots of hot coffee. The hotel is located on 63rd Street just off the corner of Madison, and given the location it was very quiet outside. Our air conditioner re-set all night, this would need to be adjusted first before another stay. The were most helpful -- that is what stands out at this hotel is the service.
The Lowel is a great spot to meet up with friends when in the area.  The atmosphere in thier bar and common areas is great for small gatherings.  Highly recommended.

formatted_address: 66 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Shorty's

reviews.text: Sandwiches are good and the fries are awesome. A sports bar like atmosphere so you can eat those fries with beer while watching basketball or football games.
Nice place. Good philly cheese steak and beers. Just need to renew forniture (kind of old)

Such a great place for various selected beers.
Also.they have amazing cheese steak and French fries. Two thums up

Had an incredible experience last night. 
We order from shorty’s at least three to four times a month. Best cheesesteaks in the WORLD and above par with those down in Philly.

Last night they went above and beyond... it was my sons birthday weekend and I said he could stay up late on Friday, watch cartoons and order some food from shortys. 

He was so excited to stay up and order food that he wanted to write a comment in the comment box that it was his birthday.

Well when the order came, they wrote happy birthday on his order and gave him some complimentary mozzarella triangles as an extra treat from them.

It was amazing.. they really went above and beyond for us. 

Thanks shorty’s

Great staff! The pork something was kinda bland but their staple Philly Cheese steak was great. I had a beer and for the price, it was in a somewhat small glass, but this seems to be the overall theme all over pricey Manhattan. Great sports watching tho. Rustic ambiance with good ol' school music in the background. I do recommend.

formatted_address: 890 7th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Redeye Grill

reviews.text: Went here to celebrate our anniversary and we had an excellent time. The server gave us sparkling wine on the house when he learnt it was our anniversary which was very nice. Every dish we ordered was just delicious and finger-licking good. Location is amazing, they have a huge seating area, servers were super warm and friendly. All in all highly recommended.
Great place. Loved the casual and eclectic atmosphere. The live piano music was a great addition to our dinner.. Food and drinks were good as expected. Might be a bit on the pricey side for some.
The food is and always has been amazing. The renovations are stunning. Great place to put on your must do stops when in Manhattan.
Great atmosphere, service and food.  The Dover Sole is worth the trip. Cocktails are spot on, although I bit pricey.
Fantastic restaurant, have been going here for 15 years. Food is delicious and menu basic. Great atmosphere and servers. Prix fixe lunch menu is a fantastic value.

formatted_address: 111 Front St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: AlMar

reviews.text:
Great breakfast place that i found via yelp.  Had the cloud egg and it was awesome and  a fluffed egg white like I have never seen.

For dinner it's Italian good bit I have not tried it.

Had a great experience at AlMar. The ambience is super intimate and service is excellent. The crostini’s and pasta were great but portions could have been a little bigger. Will definitely be visiting again!

Stopped here for a quick beer, but seems to be an amazing spot. Their tomato bruschetta is out of this world, simple yet perfect! We also had their catskill pilsner and draft IPA. Beware that paying in cash will save you the 4% surcharge, but the place is pretty upfront about it.
Came here on a Sunday around 3pm and got seated right away. The shrimp salad on the specials was delicious! My friends also enjoyed their meals.

Not recommend to go if you're starving. It's a busy restaurant, you have to wait much longer than you thought. Egg in a Cloud is a small meal, and the spinach tasted horrible. But the other food we ordered, like the Almar, Classico, Old Fashion Breakfast were all great. If you pay by credit card, it takes extra 4%, and they don't allow you to separate checks.

formatted_address: 169 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Lola

reviews.text:
Awesome venue. Probably the most intimate spot to see live music I can think of, especially if you're lucky enough to be up by the stage.  

I saw Mike Baggetta, Mike Watt, and Stephen Hodges.  Incredible performance, great sound. It was like having them over to play at my house, standing right in front of me. I practically had to duck to miss the neck of Mike Watt's bass and got to see all his funny faces while playing up close. 

I will always jump at a chance to see live music here.
Intimate venue. Bartenders & the bouncer were nice and prices were reasonable. Perhaps the only downside was that it was not very crowded on a Thursday at 11pm.

Fun place to see bands. Ecletic Alphabet City decor. They don't have food so be aware. Bartenders are fine for pouring beers, but that seems to the ceiling for their talents - they have signature cocktails but the bartenders don't seem to enjoy making them nor do they do a great job - must've been Management's idea but they didn't train the bartenders. I found that even asking a bartender about the beers is greeted with an eye roll. Not sure if that's because they aren't familiar or don't think questions are warranted?  Summary - worth seeing bands here but stick with simple beers and eat before or after.
Amazing place. I can give 5 stars just for those in USA. ( Berlin scaled )

Awful place.  I went there to see a band, had hard tickets in hand but the guys at the door wouldn’t let us in “because the show is already underway””.  I had a TICKET, so did other people.  The guy in front of me was actually the sax player and kept telling them ‘I’m IN the band!”.  But they didn’t want to let him back in because he had a friend with him.  Seriously???? They finally let us in, just in time for the encore.  This is a velvet-rope type of place now.  Nothing like the East  Village used to feel like.

formatted_address: 121 E 23rd St, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Party Aid

formatted_address: 40 E 33rd St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Spoon Table & Bar

reviews.text: We came to this spot for a meeting. This place was recommended to us by a friend.  Well, we were not disappointed. we were warmly welcomed by the staff members  and we had a great feeling. The meal was yummy. We loved this restaurant a lot and we shall absolutely come back again. Keep it up.

The scrambled eggs here are cooked to perfection, so fluffy and delicious. The coffee is a bit weak and the cappuccino tasted more like warm milk, but the food was great and the portions are generous. The sausage in the breakfast skillet had a nice kick to it, and the potatoes were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside - all the flavors married well. We added smoked salmon to the avocado toast, without it the toast would have been very basic. The chicken and waffle sammie was a hit with the table. The atmosphere was pleasant, however some of the staff was rude and seemed irritated when we asked questions about the menu - our waitress in particular seemed very stressed out and uninterested in actually waiting on us, so that was unfortunate...

Attentive service. We had shrimp and grits and fried chicken and waffles sammie. My husband doesn't like poached eggs so he got scrambled on the grits. Waffles were fluffy. Everything was tasty. We recommend this restaurant!

My wife and I had happy hour bites and beers here. Really cool laid back vibe and some of the best service we had while in the city. On a weekday they have a great happy hour that can serve as a quick stop or a full on dinner. Highly recommend this spot.

We went for dinner at this place before all the restaurants shut down. We were greeted as soon as we walked in, and as it was still an early evening on Monday, not yet busy in the inside.  

We decided some cocktails after we heard they infuse their own flavor to syrup and alcohol, and that their cocktails are all made from scratch! We had Lavender Mill, and A Pear to Remember. They were both really tasty! They really know how to make creative, strong, and delicious cocktails!

We ordered some appetizers: Fried Pickles, Roasted Whole Sardines, and Chicken Pot Pie. They all great, but I was most excited about Roasted Whole Sardines. It looked wonderful, and it tasted as good as it looked! Sardines were so tender and juicy, falls off the bones! Delicious! Pickles were really nice too, and the Pot Pie was packed with flavor, one awesome pot pie! 

For main, we had Manchego & Prosciutto Burger, and Fennel Seed Crusted Tuna Steak.  The burger bigger than I expected, and it was soooo good! It was like a symphony of all the ingredients, producing a melody of balanced, sophisticated, and totally satisfying flavor. Tuna Steak was HUGE! It looked like a giant piece of thick-cut steak! The bed of eggplants and other ingredients were super tasty, they certainly did not take side stage! All the ingredients were very fresh, filling and satisfying. 

We also ordered Herb Gruyere Biscuits + Honey Butter, since I was curious about their biscuit. It was warm, soft, heavy, and came with amazing aroma! It was sooo wonderfully buttery, dense yet light and airy.  I LOVED it! 

Needless to say, we had a great dinner here. All the staffs here were friendly, polite, and courteous. They took a really nice care of us. We enjoyed every bite of every item we had!

formatted_address: 581 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Hill and Bay

reviews.text: Went with a few friends on a Tuesday evening. Ordered buffalo wings, meatballs, signature burger, and the shoestring fries (both sweet potato and classic). It seemed that they forgot the appetizers because after about 25 minutes of being there, still no food. When we reminded them, they promptly brought wings and meatballs over but not cooked well. That being said, burger was awesome and fries were incredible. Half off bottles of wine on Tuesday led to $4 glasses of wine. Good happy hour spot and good food if they don't forget your order.

Signature Grill House Burger is a MUST TRY. CRISPY FRIES AND A NICE COLD BREWSKI!!!
And you are all set! 
Great service. Nice Bar Selection. Very tasty food. Delicious.
I love this place. It's quiet and the food is great. Mostly comfort food. The buttermilk chicken is crunchy and well seasoned. The brussel sprouts are good also. I haven't tried the desserts.
Lovely spot. Friendly staff. Great eats. Good deals on beer. Fantastic

A great place to go in Murray Hill. Nice service and good food. We went on a Sunday, so there were some delicious brunch options. Loved the scrambled eggs with spinach and mushrooms. Also enjoyed the Salmon Soy Salad.

formatted_address: 76 Ainslie St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Ainslie

reviews.text: Everything was great! Food, wine, cocktails, staff, venue, and price amazing. I probably wont cook this summer and just come here everyday!!!
Great atmosphere, food and drinks.  Very reasonable.   Great time had by all.

The Ainslie has become a regular weekend dinner spot for us. We have never had anything less than delicious there. Alex has been our server several times and he is simply the best! Attentive, informed, and so incredibly nice. He even comes over to say hi to my husband and I when he’s not our waiter. We love it there and also like that the menu is always changing while still keeping the best staples on the menu week over week.
Loved the vibe and decor. The food and staff was really awesome also. I would definitely recommend trying this place out.
I don't recommend driving here. Finding parking is what made is very late. It's great for large groups, they have everything else most other bars have. It's a decent place to go to.

formatted_address: 314 Bedford Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: DuMont Burger

reviews.text:
The best burgers in Williamsburg. It’s usually quiet late on weekday nights. Keep it simple with the DuMont 8oz burger and you’ll be good. Edgar is always welcoming and keeps the place clean.

The kitchen closes 30 minutes before the bar, so plan accordingly

Their burger was amazing but little heavy. We had fried pickles and buffalo wings. Wings were nothing special but their fried pickles was lightly bettered, very crispy. We will definitely back for the burger and beer

These guys have been around for years now. Very solid burgers, very satisfying boozy shakes... And my favorite fried pickles in the city (with jalapeños and string beans!!)

Often a very chill vibe. The seating is a bit awkward but in the summer if you can grab an outdoor table the people watching on Bedford is very worthwhile.

DuMont Burger has become a weekly outing for us. We love the Classic Burger and Beer for $10, and the fries are perfection. The staff are friendly, casual and warm.  Cant say enough good things about this lovely little bar that has become a staple in our weekend routine to unwind and slow down a bit! A true gem of Williamsburg.
Certainly a place worth stopping over, the food is fantastic and well prepared, the pricing is convenient and it is constantly clean in here. Kudos.

formatted_address: 308 Hooper St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Fiction Cafe/Bar

reviews.text: Chic unpretentious cool spot for coffee & cocktails.  I was there for a neighborhood happy hour Friday night and loved finding this gem! It is almost like a speakeasy type of bar with its cool portraits and velvet topped sofas. Loved the ambience. Great decor, yummy cocktails, friendly staff, good music and overall great vibe!

The bar was great. Cozy little bar with couches, dim lighting, and an eclectic mixture of aesthetics. Pretty average in terms of prices and drink selection. I only came one night for drinks, but it seems to be a coffee shop during the day. I'll definitely be coming back to give that a shot.
Sweet vibe. Feels like your stepping into a gem, a place that would be hard to recreate. Had the breakfast burrito and it was good but not out of this world.
Come here for a good ole fashion bar/ lounge experience. Plenty of sofas, nooks and crannies. Where else can you throw back an espresso with a whiskey chaser??
Two words. Breakfast burritos. So perfect. Hot and ready for you. And the coffee is great. Always great service.

formatted_address: 796 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Bar Veloce

reviews.text: Fantastic staff...meet locals. Enjoy their great wine selection

A quiet and relaxing wine bar. Features an array of wines and a great little menu for bar bites and salads to accompany your glass of wine.

The staff is knowledgeable and helpful and the food served from the kitchen was perfectly prepared and delicious. 

Highly recommended if in the area and looking to get away from the loud and obnoxious places peppering the neighborhood.

I was only there for a short time but the young beautiful lady, Alicia, was fantastic, super friendly and very attentive to her customers even though it was inventory night and she was very concentrated at her task yet paid attention to every word I said. The sparkling red wine was exquisite...a recommendation by Alicia.
Great spot. Lovely atmosphere.
Perfect spot for me and my girlfriend to grab a late night glass of wine and actually have a place to sit.

formatted_address: 542 W 27th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: The Heath

reviews.text:
A fun little spot that would be suitable for a date. Be warned if you're going to just get drinks, prices are up there but you're paying for the decor and the ambiance. 
There is live music on Saturdays and the band is usually energetic and engaging. 
This is not just a "sleep no more" pit stop.

Astonishing ambiance, dedicated friendly service and super tasty food. The band is outstanding with a glorious singer taking you back to the 20s. The pre fix menu is really valuable. The asparragus were amazing and the fish and chips were perfectly cooked, tender and crispy. The chocolate cake with ice cream is just delicious.

The restaurant of the McKittrick Hotel, home of sleep no more. Fantastic atmosphere, it really feels like being in the 40s! The entrance of the restaurant looks like a train carriage, and the feeling inside is that of an elegant and somewhat decadent restaurant of the early 20th century, complete with a hint of (fake) cigarette smoke. The menu doesn't have many options and is a little pricey, but it's well worth a visit just for the experience. Great live music and singers, and excellent staff.

We had dinner and drinks at the Heath about 3 years ago. Very impressive ambience. The performances were exceptional. The meal (grilled lamb breast) is the best I've had at a restaurant. Fresh herbs and veggies grown on premises. I was unbothered by the costumes and theatrics as it was all quite unobtrusive. Try the radishes!

I loved the feeling of being transported to another era while enjoying some well made drinks, good food and nostalgic music. Highly recommended if you're looking for something romantic and a bit mysterious.

formatted_address: 543 LaGuardia Pl, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Favela Cubana

reviews.text: I celebrated my nomination yesterday in this excellent restaurant. Well we enjoyed a magnificent evening and the restaurant was surely one of the reasons for that successful celebration. The team  collaborated in a very nice way, the cuisine was yummy and my friends were extremely  joyful. We shall surely return for more celebrations. Thank you very much.
New favorite place. Very relaxed atmosphere. Excellent and friendly service. Happy Hour a must. Passion fruit mojitos or margaritas highly recommended. Food is excellent.
This place is amazing- been here a few times and can’t complain about anything. Love the food and happy hour specials, especially the mama margarita. Ricky is the best waiter! Highly recommend!
This place is amazing- been here a few times and can’t complain about anything. Love the food and happy hour specials. Ricky is the best waiter! Highly recommend!

Great little unassuming place with outstanding food, friendly staff and reasonable prices. (The Seafood Paella was fantastic!)
The kind of hide-away dinner spot you’ve always tried to find.

formatted_address: 254 W 54th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Feinstein's/54 Below

reviews.text: Server was SO lovely and incredibly attentive and lovely. Concert was obviously absolutely amazing and star quality; venue itself is absolutely amazing and so fun to be at! Drinks were good and server kept them topped up. But the food was just not very good. Seasoning was lackluster and bland on most dishes we ordered and also received rubbery chicken. Also if you can’t eat dairy there was limited options. Very average tasting food for the $$$. Would definitely come back but in the future I’d skip eating and meet my $25 minimum with drinks & the low cost appetizers.

One of the best dining experiences I've ever had. Service was quick, thorough, and personal. We had not only a fantastic server, but the bar staff was on point making cocktails efficiently and deliciously. We ordered the espresso marinated steak and the Amish chicken and both were absolutely splendid. Room was tight for seating and the instructions about our early reservation were unclear for when the venue opened a few minutes late, but nonetheless it didn't take away from our experience tonight.

I have been coming to for the past 3 years. Last week I returned and I was truly disappointed. The food did not taste the same as it once did. The food tasted so different. It was not enjoyable at all especially for what they charge in this place. Its a shame because its a great place to watch a show but the food is just not good.

We saw Bebe Neuwirth there and she was an absolute charm. The repertoire including works by Sondheim, Kander and Ebb, and Waits was delivered with not only perfect skills but also unique interpretations. To fulfill the $25 per person minimum spending, I ordered Caesar Salad with pesto and Shishito Peppers, and my friend had Spring Risotto. All were surprisingly good. The only complain that I have is the price, but NYC being NYC I just sort of accepted being robbed by various venues.

Very nice old fashion supper club/cabaret.  We saw Bebe Neuwirth in a 1 women show.

Surprisingly the food is very good.

formatted_address: 151 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: BETA SOUTH

formatted_address: 5 Times Square #5, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Red Lobster

reviews.text: This was a lovely dining experience, and a welcome respite from the rain. We walked in and were greeted by the young ladies at the front desk (not the most welcoming I’ve ever dealt with, but not rude or anything), headed to the elevator and from there, directly to our seats. At no point did we have to wait too long, and our waiter was attentive without being overly so. The food was delicious, and of course, who wouldn’t like the biscuits? There’s also a cute little gift shop when you first walk in (or out), with items that are not expensive. I would definitely return here again, although the only real negative - the prices at this location are a little high, but considering the fact that it is in the middle of Times Square, that seems understandable.

What an experience, definitely a must go! The best food I've had in my trip to NY.
The reception was bad, not welcoming at all.
The rest of the service was amazing, very patient and polite.
The food is incredible, I have no words. The portions are huge too, done dishes easily serve 2 people.

Almost a perfect experience. The staff and food can make you look pass the one major flaw of this establishment. The building needs some TLC. The servers are so friendly, funny and thoughtful. The food comes quickly and is cooked to perfection. However, once this location gets renovated, it will be a perfect restaurant in a perfect location.

Had a great experience there. This was the second time I went and it was with the whole family along with my best friend and his family. The place is huge with 2 floors and a pretty layout that's warm and appealing. I prefer a darker lighting style but that's because we were 8 people and couldn't fit in the side booths that are a little more private. Nevertheless the food did not come out cold, it was just as the waitress explained it to me and everyone was very satisfied with the food! Will recommend it to anyone.

The food is just amazing.  Tried their ultimate feast(shrimp, lobster and scallops )mussels and harvest roasted vegetables.  Out of the world !  Can’t believe we hadn’t been there yet.  The food in their TV commercials turns me off but the experience was totally opposite.  Receptionist could have been a bit welcoming - but considering this place is in the Times Square and the food is so great - who cares !  Our server was very attentive and her recommended beverage the Bahama Mama was great.  The place was busy and we had to wait a bit for the food to arrive but she kept bringing extra servings of biscuits which were yummy.

formatted_address: 511 6th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Clubs In NYC

reviews.text: Not good place

formatted_address: 84 7th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Bar B

reviews.text: This small tucked away bar is easy to miss, but it's worth hunting it down. It's a standing room only bar but the wine selection and inventive food options are well worth it. Love the friendly staff as well!

Great standing bar. Can get very busy so get there early before 6pm to get a spot. Nice little and delicious plates  to share with a friend, had about 3 - 4 plates and 2 drinks which came to about $65 plus tip. We got here around 5:30pm on a Friday and it was quiet. It got busy about 6:30pm so it was our cue to move on.
Neighbourhood spot. Every time I go I see locals who are regulars. Super friendly staff and affordable wine. The fusilli is the best pasta dish in the city

Small plates and wine. A hole in the wall ( no seats, all standing only) with great food. The skirt steak was amazing. So good, I had 2 servings. The octopus salad and raw scallops were also very good.
Standing bar, Japanese sake, wines available. Tapas are delicious. Highly recommend.

formatted_address: 358 W 23rd St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Tequila's Mexican Grill

reviews.text: Great place with a welcoming atmosphere. A cool bar in the front opens into a rear dining area. It's very clean throughout. There are a lot of great authentic dishes to choose from and the portions are good. The staff is friendly and attentive. They obviously take great pride in the restaurant. I'm looking forward to my next visit.

Okay Mexican place. Good drink prices and fun atmosphere, but the food is not flavorful and, if anything, is kind of bland. It's not bad but nothing surpasses okay examples of what you ordered, which isn't fulfilling. Prices are a little higher than would be expected, but service is good. Would only recommend if it's late night and you have a real need for Mexican food. 

We did not have seafood, which the staff did talk up. That may be a better food to order there.

This is a great place with happy hour throughout the day on nights and  weekends! A really cool spot.

The food is good and the staff is always nice and friendly. It seems I almost always sit in Eric's section and he is always great.

It is alway a fun time there and it is lively with music but not so loud that you can't carry in a conversation when the restaurant is crowded.

There are television screens for those that want to watch the game.

Visiting from Texas and wanted some Mexican food. This place was great. Cool building, great food, and most importantly - great service. Our server, Andres, was excellent. Very welcoming and attentive, he made thise restaurant feel much more hospitable then most places in NYC.  Recommend for a pleasant meal and people.

0ne of my favorite go to spots. Always great service. The owners are awesome as will very approachable and helpful. Never have to Second guess this place food is amazing and so are the drinks. Clean atmosphere feels like family I recommend this place 100%

formatted_address: 331 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Il Mulino Prime

reviews.text: What an absolute gem! Came here for an early restaurant week dinner on Sunday because I was in the area and was so pleasantly surprised! The restaurant itself is small but beautiful, with exposed brick and tons of light. Our waiter gave us such impeccable service and the food was delicious. He was even gracious enough to swap out 2 red wines in the restaurant week wine pairing because I'm allergic to red. The portions were great and the food was delicious. I would absolutely come back just to sit at the bar too. Overall wonderful experience!

We went during the Italian Restaurant Week - 3 course lunch for $29. The place is lovely and bright. The tuna tartare starter was beautiful and delightfully mild. The NY prime strip main dish was well done, although the steak was a bit too fatty. The truffle mashed potatoes was very delicious. The ricotta cheesecake was fantastic - milder than NY cheesecake.

We enjoy to go out. Yesterday we came to this superb place which friends recommended to us. We spent a delightful evening there with exceptional meal and a courteous stuff and a talented  cuisine. We put this fine restaurant in our phone list  and we will certainly visit again soon. We warmly recommend.

What a find! Walking around SOHO; which has lots of great place and we walked into this gem 👍
Amazing food and great service. If you sit at the bar (which we did) I hope you get to enjoy the services of Eden; best bartender in NYC 😁

Excellent Italian restaurant. Went here for dinner and drinks and the service and staff was great. On top of the extensive food menu, they have a long list of specials. Great atmosphere as expected in SoHo. A place not to miss with family, friends, dates and any occasion. We ordered the Porter House for two. It was seasoned and cooked to perfection. Paired it with garlic mashed potatoes and a Japanese Whiskey. Great night!

formatted_address: Address: 445 Albee Square W, Basement Level, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Schaller’s Stube Sausage Bar

reviews.text: Delicious food and friendly, quick service. I had the classic bratwurst and it and the mustard were delicious. Had the latkes and French fries as well. Former also very good, the latter just average but good enough.

formatted_address: 188 Allen St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Cheese Grille

reviews.text: 4/5 for incredible food. The tomato soup was exceptional. The atmosphere is a little hipster and the music is decent. 2/5 for the service which was generally uninvolved and no credit cards? It’s 2020 - my ticket size would’ve been larger and I would’ve been able to tip the 20% I usually would.

The food was amazing, and the workers were really nice. The environment inside is very nice and chill. I will definitely be coming back here all the time. Only downside is that i would have liked it if they had fried mozzarella sticks.

It’s a really wonderful spot for lunch. Here’s a picture of the crispy goat with French fries - that’s goat cheese, bacon and avocado. As you may be able to see they serve it with a lot of French fries which is nice. Comes out super crispy and hot. It’s terrific and so is the spicy tomato soup. The space itself is open to the street and there’s a little bar by the register as well.

Easily by far one of the best tomato soup you’ll find in New York and for a fair price. For only 3.50 you can get a cup and for 5.50 you can get a bowl!  It’s got a nice little spice to it as well.  The service and setting are a perfect combo to accommodate.  Will definitely be returning here very soon.

This place was worth the adventure through the city.  At the time they only took cash but there was an atm on the corner.  The sandwiches were made well.  The cheese used in the mac n cheese was different but still good.

formatted_address: 160 Broadway, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: Milk + Honey

reviews.text: Unassuming door on the street level takes you downstairs to a large restaurant. Friendly staff and tasty food. The cinnamon pancakes were made and cooked on the spot. The coffee was pretty good too. Not a huge variety of breakfast items but enough to get by.
This place is worth visiting. They serve big portions for reasonable prices. Always clean and with excellent mood. Will come back again.
Great food. Wonderful staff.

This restaurant is the one I always prefer. I visit plenty of restaurants but to this place I keep coming back again and again. The crew is very warm and the cuisine they serve is so tasty. I would always prefer to have a decent meal here. I recommend this place with pleasure.
The food, service, and everything is just bad. It’s not professional and the food is horrible. Tastes like something out of a fridge. If I could give it a 0 I would.

formatted_address: 2447 Broadway, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Wine Place

reviews.text:
My husband and I have decided to take our business elsewhere.
The owner of The Wine Place is plain rude and hostile, offensive and lacking in social manners and absolutely disrespected me when attempting a simple purchase of a Sancerre.  Owner didnt even know that Sancerre is a region in France.  He stated no such town exists,
The owner looked foolish standing there with his hands on his hips like some Army Sergeant barking guttural orders to his staff while they are on their hands and knees stocking shelves
The selection of wines is very limited and the disheveled uneducated staff exude a sleazy low-life vibe.
Kid behind the counter at the register looks like hes not even old enough to drive a car and knows nothing.
