The owner is very nasty,  why do you have a minimum on using a debit card.   
I have been to store numerous times without anyone telling me About this minimum...  nasty nasty
They closed early and turned me away. Too bad.
Great store! Good customer services;reasonable low prices ;Nice selection;really enjoyed it ~

Unethical and lacking in integrity, the poor employees are not empowered to give an exchange to accommodate a customer, and blame their boss, Anthony Kim, instead of taking ownership of their business. Shame on them.

formatted_address: 100 Allen St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Congee Village

reviews.text: The food was well worth the money paid, food was fresh, savory and scrumptious.  The dishes were extremely canto-centric, almost as good as Toronto Chinatown. The service was outstanding. It helps if you know what food groups you like, then have the chef make his magic and surprise you. Not cheap and definitely not for the faint of taste palate. Sorry, no pics , too busy enjoying the meal and company.

Good place to eat with your family at a very reasonable price. It can get very busy at night when there is a special holiday and the wait can be over an hour. On most day (we do come here a lot), the food is tasty but there are days when the food is a little salty but that is on rare occasion. Highly recommend sticky rice with lobster if you are into seafood. Chicken dish with crispy skin is also a must have. Service is ok, not great and all the food are fresh which makes it worth the price. Warning, the rest room is very dirty in this place.

The food was good, especially steamed fish and pumpkin seafood rice were excellent,  but the service was not good. Waiters including captain had no smiles, looked like they didn’t like the job. To me they don’t have passion for their job. When A lady at our next table asked what type tea you serve because it is so good, guess what is his answer. His answer is red tea. This should be a good chance for them to promote their culture and restaurant, but he wasted his chance

The worst service I've had in NYC. Once seated I asked for water and either it went unheard or they forgot. Then I closed my menu and waited and waited for someone to take my order... finally I was lucky enough to catch a gaze of one of the wait staff. No words were spoken, just a glancing nod as they walked away. By the time I said "thank you" I was talking to the waiters back, and they were not busy at all. I also had to flag someone down after I was done eating. I was looking around, empty plate, empty glass. To say the staff was in attentive would be giving too much credit. They are straight up ignoring everyone. The people at the table next to me were also looking around for their server and we gave each other a look of "what is going on with this place, eh?" Finally they had to get up and get a waiter. I wish I would have went to one of the hundred other chinese places but this place "looked" the fanciest. Live and learn. Food was okay otherwise it would've been one star.

Food is worth the money, but unfortunately the service was not welcoming nor professional. From the moment we placed our order, the facial expression of the servers were blunt, lacked inclusivity and seemed almost mad by their voice tone and facial gestures. A group of about 8 servers kept having loud conversations to the point where their volume connotation disturbed our time, we just wanted to eat our food in peace. It would have been helpful for these servers to have been walking around attending costumers instead of laughing and talking loudly in one corner

formatted_address: 216 7th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Zagara

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I had made reservations here because we heard how nice of a place it was and they were right! Delicious food, nice atmosphere. We went there on Valentine's Day and I actually got engaged there!!! The owner was super nice and brought us a complementary drink to celebrate the occasion. Very wonderful management.

We love it here. Amazing food. Ambiance is awesome. Have held company parties here. Giuseppe (owner) is abundantly friendly, knowledgeable of his craft - food, wine and spirits, and being an exquisite host and incredibly hospitable.
We loved this place! The food was very good and came out quickly and service was also great. Excellent pasta and appetizers.  I’d give dessert a 7/10. Highly recommend!

Fabulous food, fabulous fun -- and I had just come from a comedy club.  This place never disappoints.  Recommend any salad -- I had the funnel with orange and olive -- or pasta.  The special lobster with squid ink pasta was a delight.  It was a delicious 2 hour vacation to Sicily.

I came here with my dad for dinner the other night and had a great experience. Our server was friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable. The menu had many options but wasn't overwhelming. Great quality food and an extensive wine list as well.

formatted_address: Brooklyn, NY 11206, USA
name: Aphotic

formatted_address: 14 Terrace Pl, Brooklyn, NY 11218, USA
name: feefs enterprise

reviews.text: This place is great!!
Chill vibes only

formatted_address: 7 Old Fulton St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: 7 Old Fulton

reviews.text: Interesting place! The steak was perfect, the spaghetti with meatballs not so good but overall everything was fine.

The best service and amazing food!! My husband ordered pasta and  it was fantastic. I ordered fish it was delicious. The best service and food for a nice lunch or dinner. It was our anniversary and we had a great time.

Worst service I have ever experienced. We were gonna order drinks and Dessert after our main dish but we got thrown out of the restaurant because new guests have been waiting. So when I refused to pay an overpriced tip I was told to be grateful to be allowed to eat here and that there are not my slaves. So ridiculous.
I've never seen anything so brazen. We were really upset..

Very bad experience. Menu says steak with French fries and vegetables but the server told us they don't have that but he will fixe it just for us ,well you just trying to take "fake" give us extra sir service , same goes for my lamb shank that was pretty good. We ordered medium steak but we got chewy well done with one piece of every vegetable, wine wasn't good at all. Also for appetizers we ordered crab cakes and it was a disaster,frozen boxed ONE Crab cake,with huge pieces of lettuce. Never going back,this is a beautiful place with potential to be good if managed right but most important is Food ,it has to be good!
Interior was beautiful. Late night food was good. Staff were pleasant.

formatted_address: 271 W 119th St, New York, NY 10026, USA
name: B2 Harlem

reviews.text: It's in the heart of Harlem, but feels somewhat hidden and out of the way. As soon you enter, you are warmly greeted and the service is very prompt. The crab cakes were excellent, as were the catfish and porkbelly sliders. Note we went for happy hour on a Tuesday. It was quiet and not too crowded. The drinks were great, at the Happy Hour prices. The music was old school 80s and 90s (we love it). Definitely want to return to check out one of their themed nights (jazz).

My daughters took me there yesterday for a Mother's Day brunch.  The food was delicious a d the atmosphere very pleasant; however, I ordered a slice of cake to go, and I was beyond shocked at what I saw when I opened the container. See photo below. Not only was it a mess, it didn't even taste good.  I hope they were not charged for this.  I will go back again, but no desert!😣

A happy hour worthy to try out (crabcakes, mussels, etc) and pretty good mixed drinks. Staff is pretty friendly too. I was dipping my burger in ketchup, which wasn't a good sign. Other menu options (fish options) seemed great options too. The good vibe at this restaurant and dessert menu to try next time will have us back there!

Few places provide such an atmosphere of welcome-ness. The waitresses were helpful and funny. The food was outstanding rather than outlandish, depending on flavor rather than fanfare. The drinks were fantastic once we got them. If any complaint it is that the bartender is too popular and I waited to long to savor her mixed drink alchemy.
Dinner is very overpriced due to the small portions. Seafood was great and entrees were beautifully decorated, but it wasn’t worth the money imp

formatted_address: 10 Little W 12th St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Dance NYC - Bachata & Salsa Party

formatted_address: 1 Central Park West, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Jean-Georges

reviews.text:
I love this restaurant! I have been to this restaurant 3 times previously over the years. 
Each time its 8 course meal was fantastic and yummy....And different every time.
 It is located at Columbus circle on the upper West side in the beautiful Trump towers in New York City. I recommend this restaurant if you looking for a quiet, classy, mature and non rushed 8 course meal.
Of course,  awesome food!!!
Staff was attentive and knowledgeable. 
Go check yet it all.  :))

After much planning and anticipation for parents of two little ones, we finally got around to visiting Jean-Georges and were ready to enjoy a night alone. Arriving and initial service was excellent. The menu was intriguing and delightful. The food was not what we anticipated after having visited similar restaurants. It was my wife's birthday. In short, she had the oysters and by the end of our meal she had gone to the bathroom uncontrollably, three times. After a couple of days of recovering from that, we attempted to communicate with the restaurant about the experience. They avoided us, ignored us, never returned calls or messages to the point that made me write this review. The food was obviously subpar and evidently contaminated. We explore and enjoy a great deal of restaurants and this was by far the worst. We have never had to complain this way. We have never felt so disgusted with service. Jean-Georges management - service doesn't end when your patrons pay.

Jean George is by far the best restaurant experience in NYC. Quiet serene and beautiful scene. The wait staff moves about the luxurious setting like synchronized swimmers.
The food is amazing the service experience is by far as I said “The best in NYC” well worth the $$$$. You will be treated as if you were royalty.

Absolutely marvelous meals here, twice.  One of the six best restaurants in the United States.  Fortunately, we've never seen hide nor hair of donald trump here, which would've taken away from the quality of our dining experience.  Staff are just plain incredible, coming as close as any reasonable person would expect, to perfection.  Meals with truffles have been especially impressive.  Spectacular.
Great service and delicious food. We had 10 course prefix and all the dishes were superb. Presentation of each course was simply amazing. Very nice experience. Will definitely be back again.

formatted_address: 158 9th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Omai

reviews.text: It’s a nice Vietnamese restaurant I’m Chelsea with very attentive wait staff and a good variety of Vietnamese favorite dishes. My favorite Vietnamese restaurant remains to be in Chinatown but Omai’s convenience makes things easy. It is however much more expensive than any spot in Chinatown.
Really enjoyed Omai.  The service was quick and the atmosphere felt intimate.  The food was really good, I enjoyed everything I tried :)

The quintessential Vietnamese and Asian  neighborhood place. Always wonderfully delish ... sea bass perfectly seasoned  and cooked ... sticky rice that makes you order two bowls even though you swore you'd only eat a little bite. Tuna roll/wrap a  must. Coziest place on a cold night.
Very nice place and really good food.

Five stars for Omai!  The serenity of this delightful restaurant is apparent from the moment you walk through the door.  The noise of the outside world fades away as you are warmly greeted and seated in this this intimate and quiet oasis of a restaurant.  Every bite of my dinner was a “best bite”, from the grilled eggplant starter, to the seafood dumpling soup, from the steamed sea bass to the delectable chocolate mousse with orange sauce.  A reasonably priced glass of Chardonnay and a cup of calming lotus tea rounded out this memorable meal.  Thank you, Omai, for this inspired Vietnamese culinary experience!

formatted_address: 268 W 47th St 2nd Fl, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Las Chicas Locas

reviews.text: LCL is open on Sundays. It is located in a dance studio, with 2 large rooms and a few smaller ones. It starts at 5 pm with bachata class followed by a social. Bachata is played till 9pm, then salsa takes over. Meanwhile some other (free) Latin dance classes are offered. There is a bar with beer and liquors. Attended mostly by regulars, but open and friendly toward newcomers, beginners and tourists. Crowd is in their 20's to 50's, but mostly in mid 30's, with say, 65:35 male to female ratio of various skill levels.
Fantastic salsa and bachata party! Great music and friendly environment

Las Chicas Locas is every Sunday. It's at Dancesport -a hybrid between a dance studio and a club, since it has a full bar. It starts at 5pm with a bachata party (and free bachata class) till 9pm. And then it switches to salsa music till 2am or so, There are also more free latin classes during the night, and extra rooms with different types of music (kizomba, zouk, etc). Music on point, friendly crowd, and floors very good for dancing. Overall a great party!
This place is the best.
La salsa no es una coreografía! Se debe sentir.... la música de verdad fatal, para bailar???? Ni idea

formatted_address: 47 Avenue B, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Lamia's Fish Market

reviews.text: Early Catch menu at the bar offers good food and drink specials. Nice flat breads, trio of ceviche, sardines and pasta. All were great.  We had a question about preparation and the chef came out to answer out questions. Nice customer service.

The restaurant itself is very beautiful, nicely decorated and great vibes. The service for a Saturday brunch was Ok.. even though there were barely anyone there, it was hard to flag anyone down. One of the server staff gave so much attitude when we were trying to take pictures at the open area (where the toilet was) we were respectful and would stop taking photos right away to let them pass. There weren’t even people in that area but he just rolled his eyes so blatantly. Rude.

The food itself was OK. The lobster pancake’s texture was somewhat off - perhaps it’s their style of making the pancake. It was too chewy, a little cold, and chunky. The shrimp waffles were pretty good. Their latte was amazing though, love their coffee.

Overall a pretty OK experience & the food was just alright. Anyway, the restaurant is very very beautiful — you can see pics attached.
Beautiful decor of the restaurant.  Service was good and fairly quick. They have amazing oysters there as well. seafood options were plenty . Would def recommend

Amazing time. The service was great. Had a friendly waiter who was very nice and took his time to answer questions. I had the scallops and was really good. We will be going back for sure, see pics. The appetizers were superb. The wine was a malbec and it was a good recommendation.

A very peculiar and bespoke atmosphere - worth it to dine here just to take in the decor. The food is tasty and prepared well, but four stars because of the poor value for money. Basically small, expensive, but well-crafted plates.

formatted_address: 123 4th Ave, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: East overshoe

formatted_address: 345 Lincoln Pl, Brooklyn, NY 11238, USA
name: 365nightlife

reviews.text: Where BROOKLYN AT...????

formatted_address: 234 Spring St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Altro Paradiso

reviews.text: We arrived early for our table and had terrific drinks at the bar. Then we ordered half of all the appetizers and all were worth ordering on our next visit. The fish bones and came with head (ugh) was likely the best dish on the menu. The pasta and steak tops too!
Super cool ambiance, delicious food and wine/cocktail selection. Small portions but really good food. The Cacio e Pepe was especially good. Very enjoyable experience!

Great menu, ambiance and service. Really good some
We ordered a collection of appetizers to share, the steak and some pastas. Special occasion and a good time was had by all.
We came for New Year's Eve (prix fixe 4 course meal). The food was good, not great, but the staff was absolutely incredible. We would love to go back on a normal night.

It was everything I hoped for and more. I had the arugula salad, cacio e Pepe and the prosciutto (I put it the prosciutto into my pasta and highly recommend you do the same) as well as chocolate gelato and espresso. The wine selection is also amazing! I will be returning ASAP.

formatted_address: 111 E 7th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Night Music

reviews.text:
Night Music is an exotic vegetable fusion restaurant and sister bar to Ladybird located right next door. The lively atmosphere and unique menu is a perfect cohesion. The Menu is 100% vegan and features flamboyant tropical cocktails, and an all-natural wine list.

Food*****
Vegan food does not get much more delicious than this. We got the crispy eggplant lasagna with three cheeses and tomato coconut curry and the naan with garlic butter. The crispy eggplant lasagna was literally heaven on earth--every flavor came through and my tastebuds exploded with delectation! You will be knocked out by the foods they have to offer. Even the naan bread and the dipping sauces it came with was remarkable.

Service****
The waitress was a delight--quicky, informative, and willing to accommodate our needs. The restaurant was pretty busy and she did a good job of attending to us and everyone else.

Atmosphere*****
This gets five stars because the atmosphere is the perfect combination of what all us NY'ers want but anyone in general wants (most likely)--nice dim lighting, comfortable cushioned chairs spaced appropriately away from other tables, candles on the table, incredible smells, and popular 80s music (the night we were there). I have never felt so good with an atmosphere in NYC yet!

Price$$
Moderately priced but you get what you pay for. This is top notch and one of NYC's trendiest vegan restaurants right now!
This spot is a must. We went on a Friday night and it was a great experience. Loved the vibe. Our server was awesome and all the food was delicious, definitely recommend the mushroom buns!

Food was very underwhelming, mis-advertised on the menu (i.e. the fire dish with tofu and rice had next to no rice in it whatsoever)
 
We left feeling hungry and totally ripped off. Extremely overpriced for what it is. I would never come back here.

Wow! That was one of the best dinners of my life. No joke. I'm not vegan - I'm not even vegetarian - but I would be if I could eatblike that every day. My friend and I got an incredible $50 per person 5-course prix fixe that was actually more like 9 courses and left us completely stuffed. The meal included naan and this warm edamame dip (spread?) that was so good, I suspect I will dream about it tonight. We were floored. And there was this chocolate and churro dessert that blew us both away as neither of us are necessarily big on wither of those things, but practically fought over who would get to lick the bowl clean. We both love food and at times we just burst out laughing because the meal was so good and made us so happy that we couldn't do anything but laugh. Also, the staff were SO nice and the music was great. Ugh! I can't wait to go back!
Ravi DeRossi does it again. Food and ambience are next level.

formatted_address: 47 E 29th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Tavern rooftop

reviews.text: Says its open till 4am; closed at 130am
Not at all a great service... however food is good
47 E 29th St
Buen lugar para compartir

formatted_address: 1439 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: THEP Thai Restaurant

reviews.text: How this restaurant gets ignored by the big time critics is beyond me. I have never had a bad experience. Every dish is unique, spectacular, and presented beautifully. The decor is tasteful and lush. The service is always impeccable. The cocktails are inventive and solid. This is my favorite Thai spot in Manhattan.

AMAZING EXPERIENCE!!! When I walked in me & my guest were greeted with a loud & happy welcome! Got seated right away, ordered two amazing vegan dishes the drunken noodles & vegan curry so amazing! So much flavor, asked for spicy & the spice was ON POINT!!! Fresh flavors, veggies just amazing! Food came out so fast & hot! Thank you so much!!! We will be back!! Great business being ran here :)

Thep Thai, we will see more of each other this summer. I’m coming back for the Pop & Bubbles cocktail. The atmosphere is beautiful. It’s
Chic with friendly and energetic staff. I love the setting see my photos. I enjoyed the basil dish with Vegetarian Duck.

This is a cute little restaurant on the Upper East Side. Went to dinner with my family and was not disappointed. The food tasted great and the portion size was decent. The ambience is beautiful, romantic and cozy. The only downside is that it's a little noisy in here so not the best place if you want to talk and catch up. We got the Tom yum soup which was good but I felt that the seafood base was a little too strong for my liking. The pad Thai was great, no complaints! Definitely squeeze the lime over your noodles 😊 my cousin really liked the Thai iced tea if you're into that 😊 service was quick, given the location and popularity of the restaurant there is a wait time which you should definitely plan for.

Love this place! The food is definitely right on the point! Every dish gets its own specialty, my friend told me THEP is one of the most authentic Thai restaurants in Manhattan. I haven’t been to Thailand, but I would still agree with her🤩🤪

formatted_address: 15 Cliff St, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: Hole in the Wall Cafe and Bar

reviews.text: Excellent brunch food and drinks. Happy hr 3-5 with $8 cocktails. Great atmosphere

Great place to have a quick bite for breakfast in the morning. I discovered it using Yelp, and it was probably the best choice I could have made for the area. It's a cute little space, and I definitely would have sat outside if it was not so gross and rainy. I ended up having the chili scrambled eggs as recommended by my waitress. I love the kick that it had to it. I would definitely come back here and eat again.

Went to this spot during my lunch break with a friend. I immediately loved the space!

Our waitress was super friendly and recommended a delicious smoothie. I ordered what she recommended and was blown away. I don't usually order smoothies at brunch but, this one was worth it. I loved the hint of honey drizzled on the fruits.

Also got their most popular dish the chili scramble, and I totally get why it's their most popular dish. Lastly, I got the smoke salmon and cream cheese bagel which came with two huge scoops of guac perfection.

I'll def be back.

A good place for a quick bite in the morning. The food here tastes really good but it's on the pricier side. The only thing I had an issue with was that the place was very smokey and lacked proper ventilation. The staff are great and very pleasant. Finally, they really need to improve their black coffee at least for my taste but that's is subjective anyway.

Fantastic spot!!  The coffee was phenomenal and the food is amazing. Went twice during our 3 day trip to NYC and will become a regular when we move there next month. Highly recommend stopping by even if you just want a coffee to go.

formatted_address: 135 Reade St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Reade Street Pub & Kitchen

reviews.text: I had one of you bartenders allow another patron to tell me I should leave over a conversation that was not in line with their political beliefs. I have enjoyed going to this pub for the last 15 years. Totally different atmosphere, has turn into a total dive bar. It has turned into a total cocaine  head bar. Has become a lower than dive bar atmosphere.
Great late night food. Interior was beautiful. Great selection of food. Everything came of kitchen was fresh and healthy. Affordable prices.
Great vibe. Drinks was good. Affordable prices. Staff were nice and provided great services.

Nice bar in a great location. 
Cool atmosphere and the place is open until 4AM. 
The food was surprisingly good for a bar :)
Went there on a Monday night to catch up with a friend. Nice and quite. Easy to talk to someone.  The bartender was friendly. Fee beer options. Fries were ok too.

formatted_address: 250 Vesey St, New York, NY 10281, USA
name: Del Frisco's Grille

reviews.text: First time visiting this location and the “Grille” version of the steakhouse. The food was excellent and the atmosphere was trendy to the downtown location.  We had the roasted chicken, salmon, Mac and cheese and the Grille Prime Cheeseburger. The cheeseburger was probably the best burger that I have ever had.  As a comparison, it is similar to a shake shack burger but less greasy and includes a Sloppy Sauce that brings it up to another level.  The salmon is very good and so is the roasted chicken.  The mashed potatoes are the best side available.  I did not give this location a five because of the little details that are missed including a wine glass we received was chipped as well as a drinking glass was chipped.  We received to small pieces of bread, prior to our meal, for a family of five.  Overall I would still recommend Del Frisco’s Grille.  As a frequent visitor of the steakhouse location I expected a slightly better service  and would request management and staff to check their wine/drinking glasses before serving.

Went to dinner with a client while in lower Manhattan. I placed a reservation just in case. We were greeted and seated promptly. The service was great, the cocktails were spot on (old fashioned). I had the NY Strip Oscar style and was not disappointed. I highly recommend the Mac and cheese as well. All and all, I highly recommend this location and will be back again.

Came here for NYE, the food was amazing of course, however I was disappointed that the fact there was a New Year's Eve menu wasn't listed on the website. I came, hoping for a specific meal and wasn't able to get it. I'm allergic to seafood so I tried to make sure I knew what I was getting beforehand. The NYE Menu, had a majority of seafood options so I wasn't very inclined to get anything. 
 Otherwise, the service was amazing, despite it being NYE there weren't many people when I arrived. We had our food and went about our merry way. I would definitely come back, I really want to taste their full menu.

Food is always good. Wine is always good. What's not to love!? Love the VIP. Tonight I got the smoke & mirrors which was also great. The calories on the menu throw me off. Ugh. Got the Mediterranean shrimp bowl - lower on the calories, still flavorful!

four stars for service 3 for food.  at these price points would expect better quality.  everyone  had cold fries.  food was average.  fish and chips greasy.  rest of table had burgers and steak.  eggs rolls good calamari greasy.  go have a drink and look at tree but go somewhere else to eat if you want good quality.  used to be good

formatted_address: 369-351 Bedford Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: DJandMCS

formatted_address: 3452 Broadway, New York, NY 10031, USA
name: ROKC

reviews.text: Freaking amazing cocktails and buns. Wow both were so good. They have this cool drink they set on fire too. I think they're known for ramen too and it looked really good but I didn't have it. Pretty small place so there may be a wait if it's a busy time. Worth it though!

Went there for the first time on date night with hubby. The spot was a bit tight and there was a wait (expected for Saturday night). We didn't have to wait long at all and were able to order drinks and enjoy them in their outdoor area. We had the beer cotton candy oysters which we were hesitant about but ended up loving. Their ramen is also amazing.

We arrived at this place for dinner. This place was recommended to us by a friend.  Well, it was very successful. The staff welcomed us with a smile and we felt excellent. The food was just great. We loved this place very much and we will definitely return to this restaurant. Highly recommended.
Came at 10pm, but they were very accommodating! Noodles were worth the wait, shrimp bun was delicious, and the vibe was cozy & intimate! 10/10 recommend

Came here on memorial day and was happy that they were open. I started off with the pineapple cocktail with rum in it, it was very tasty. Order the Kyoto, and it was amazing!! So much flavor! I ended with a spicy cocktail that is served in a green pepper, my spice level was 5/10.

formatted_address: 271 Devoe St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Olive and Devoe

formatted_address: 21-02 Hoyt Ave S, Long Island City, NY 11102, USA
name: EF Queens

formatted_address: 151 W 46th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Havana Central Times Square

reviews.text: Best restaurant ever!! My husband and I stopped here over the weekend and we were very pleased. They were closing and still accommodated us. The hostess was very welcoming. The drinks was amazing!!!! The food was amazing!!!!! I had the salmon, it was the best salmon I have ever had in a restaurant. My husband had the pork chops and he was very happy. We will definitely go back here.

The best Cuban food I've had in a long time. The prices are decent, well worth it. Staff is super friendly, great atmosphere. We've been here twice for dinner in 5 days and plan on going one more time before we leave town. Definitely recommended

I was really excited to try this place, as all of my family recommended it. We got there and there was no wait, unfortunately, our waiter Jonathan took a little bit more than 20 minutes to take our order for drinks and after that it was approximately the same wait to order the rest of the food. We do understand that the place was busy, but still didn’t get an apology from him. We had to ask him for more sodas every time because he didn’t even noticed that our glasses were empty. At the end, we left the tip that we thought was appropriate. We made our way out this place and for our surprise Jonathan went right behind us and yelled at us in the street, if there was anything wrong with the service pointing at the tip.  (Which by the way was true because the service wasn’t good not mentioning other things)  It wasn’t the fact that he asked about the service, it was the way he did it. He wasn’t friendly, he went OUT of the restaurant and then yelled at us without hesitation. He didn’t apologize for anything and as soon as we gave him more money, he left without even saying thank you, even though it was clearly he didn’t deserve it. It is so sad that we had to go through this, when we were so excited to try this place. Definitely never going back.

The service and the food is right on point. My first time there, the food was delicious. The service was pretty quick for a Friday night. The prices are pretty decent and they give you a lot of food for your money. I highly recommend this restaurant, whether it's for a girls night or a date night. The atmosphere is nice.

Food  and drinks were fantastic. The service was surprisingly fast even tho it was very busy. The space is very tight and hard to get around. Very hard to find a seat even in the bar area.  It was however worth dealing with our cramped seats to enjoy the deliciousness

formatted_address: 156 William St, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: Finest Rifle Pistol Club Inc

formatted_address: 240 W 54th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Iguana New York

reviews.text:
Nice place.. nice vibe. Really liked the holiday decor and the holiday atmosphere. The restaurant was brimming with happy faces when we dined Friday evening. 
A wide range of cocktails to choose from - really enjoyed their cocktails.

Food was average. Not too great. The quantity of food servings were very less. For the cost they charge us, they can certainly give more quantities.

We explored both the nightclubs at around 10. Not any vibe as such. Hardly a handful of people - Just a few people dancing to themselves. May be it gets better later in the night.

It was pretty good, met an old friend there in town for a meeting.  We had some apps, and then I had a chicken fajita, he had a steak.  Had a couple of mule cocktails.  Waiter was friendly.  My friend paid the bill, so I can't speak to the prices.  All in all, nothing to write home about.  Went to the downstairs dance area to use the men's room and it smelled like a musty basement in the dance area.  Close to a parking deck, so easy parking.  New Courtyard by Marriott hotel just across the street too, so this is convenient to that, and probably a lot better prices than dining in.

I went here for a birthday party. We were down in the lower level. The drinks were good. The restaurant says is has a dress code but it wasn't really enforced. They have a coat check. $3/item. $15 cover charge after 9pm. I'd probably go again. For dancing and drinks, their food menu looked too overpriced.

I have only given a couple of Five stars. This place had good to more then good food. The drinks were correct and full of what you pay for while maintaining a great taste. The service was spot on, being attentive to the changes to the table while not being annoying. This would have deserved four stars, but the extra attention given by the staff pushed them over. Come for a good meal, bring people you want impress, bring families, bring a romantic prospect. Great place. Worth it.

Went there for dinner and salsa on a Friday night. The food was pretty good, the service was phenomenal. However, the music upstairs (where is supposed to be Latin mix of salsa, bachata music and other) was so loud it hurt to be on the dance floor. Also the choice of music wasn’t good for dancing and there were only few people on the dance floor. It was also impossible to talk, due to loud music. 

I recommend it for food, but not for salsa.

formatted_address: 485 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: George Keeley

reviews.text: Beautiful rooftop bar with fun ambience and amazing food choices! Definitely not family friendly though- loud and your typical hangout for young professionals. We decided to hit this spot before heading to a baseball game and service was really fast and food came out at a reasonable time. The second floor looks beautiful but more for an intimate dinner. The whole roasted cauliflower was delicious!

Good bar, it's all about the vibe. And it's not what can be faked with loud music or pretentious bartender. When it's the right one, you just can tell instinctively. The staffs here are cheerful and polite. Things taste great. People seem to be happy whatever they've been up to--from watching their weekend match to enjoying one's solo dining. It's all thanks to the place that's got the right vibe.

Great place to have a drink with friends or at work. The place itself is small but very fun. Everyone loves the patio and the small tables are perfect for the patio. They have a full bar and there are plenty of seating for a couple. The staff is very friendly and they are always attentive to your needs. If you are looking for a quick place to have a drink or a quick bite to eat you should definitely come here.
Great place for some bar food. Great burger and fries, and some cool bartenders. Open decently late.

Eaten here a few times and whether it’s a burger, wrap, or the appetizers food has always been good quality for bar food.

Buffalo cauliflower is more of a dry rub and then you dip in buffalo sauce. Our table was divided on if we liked it, but I liked it.

Wrap has a good size, but would maybe have had the chipotle mayo on side so I could dip instead of in the wrap. Wasn’t so much that it was soggy but was a lot of aioli in the wrap. 

Most important part - solid beer selection and digital menu lets you keep track of what’s available or running out.

formatted_address: 41 Carmine St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Urban Vegan Kitchen

reviews.text: The outside of the restaurant isn't as inviting but once I walked through the doors, I fell in love with the artwork & photos displayed on the walls. I wish I had more time to see them all. The real display is downstairs. I'd suggest you head down to the bathroom to get the full experience. The staff, customer service and price was great. I took the waiters suggestion and ordered the buffalo tofu with my salad. It tasted amazing. I wasn't a fan of their water or the mini cups they use. Ultimately, I was happy to find a place with healthy food options that tasted good. I'd recommend to friends and family.

Really great place to go for vegan food. It wasn't too crowded, so easy to get a spot.

They offer a vegan version of chicken and Waffles, which is sooooo delicious. You should check it out when you're around.

The waitress are nice to and also open for a chat, definitely worth to go here

Took my boyfriend who's a vegetarian to eat dinner, browsed the neighborhood and came across this spot. The pictures really drew me in, the food looked great! It was as if I went to a regular bar with some good American food. Buffalo wings, burgers, tacos and chicken and waffles? Amazing selections!  Definitely will be back for more. Food was super delicious and VEGAN, so I felt great after! He couldn't remember the last time he had Buffalo wings (probably since he was a kid since he's been vegetarian for most of his life) so it was great to give him that option again but 100% vegan.

Didn't get to try their desserts as we had plans for that, it'll be on the bill next time around.

The place is super cool! Modern with a glimpse of hippie era. Great choice of music- like from the 70's and 80's and very friendly staff.  I've chosen a vegan lasagna. Tasteful but should be a little warmer though. I'd say it was almost perfect. Just try - it's delicious though.

Loved eating here! 
I’ve eaten at many vegan and veggie restaurants...so I’ve had my share of medium vegan food. 

But this place was great. Has the approach of a diner but with a really thought-out and flavourful menu. The wings, and brussel sprouts were a standout. The tofu scramble was also really tasty. Service was lovely too, we were served by Markees and he was awesome. 

Highly Recommend.

formatted_address: 320 E 49th St A, New York, NY 10017, USA
name: Club Usagi

formatted_address: 117 Perry St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Aria West Village

reviews.text: We stopped here for lunch. I ordered one of the specials, the grilled octopus salad. The octopus had been sliced into bite sized pieces and arranged in a beautiful presentation over a bed of salad made with celery, thin sliced potatoes, tomatoes and more. The octopus was tender and cooked perfectly. My partner ordered lobster ravioli with vodka sauce. They kept the sauce simple so that the tortelloni could speak for themselves.

Sat at the bar and the bartender was friendly, attentive, and patient. My experience at the restaurant was great. However, I ordered a Prosciutto and Burrata cheese plate to go and it was half the portion of the restaurant for the same price. At the prices being charged for that to happen is not okay.
Cute little date spot. My favorite dish is the date and bacon wraps!! Incredible food and wine selection.

I LOVE Aria Wine Bar. Their penne pesto, artichokes, and lentil soup are my absolute favorites of their category. As a strict vegetarian (mostly vegan—but I can have small amounts of parmesan cheese), I’ve had many lentil soups—many pesto pastas, and many artichoke dishes. Aria’s are the best. I hope they never remove any of these three dishes!!! 🥰😋😋😋
Had a blast here, outstanding food and very reasonable. Server was super cool....sorry I forget his name. Cool vibe as well.

formatted_address: 248 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Parm

reviews.text: Fantastic home made mozz sticks are superb. Rice flour calamari was crispy and light. I got the eggplant Parmesan as an entree and it was delightful. The sauce with the pasta was perfect. Price wasn’t bad for all the food. I’d take friends here, dates here, family here. It’s not fancy- pretty casual, upscale diner feel, but the food is worth it. Fast and friendly service.

The meatballs melt in your mouth and you don't have to fight with the bread as you bite. Perfect mouth feel. The mozzarella sticks are the best I've ever had - crispy, not greasy and just the right amount of salty delicious.

Had the meat ball and spicy pasta today.  Was not disappointed at all.  The meat was bursting full of flavor and covered (not just sprinkled) with cheese.  The pasta was cooked perfectly,  sauce was tasty and perfect match with the meat balls, which by the way was the recommendation of our server; who was super friendly!

The Meatball Parm with Italian fries were amazing. Was walking by this place and decided to stop in.

Gave it 4 stars because it took a moment for me to be acknowledged but once at a table I had good service.

Highly recommend the Meatball Parm Hero with Italian Fries. More than enough to eat.

Small intimate setting.

Loved the sandwiches here and I wasn’t even hungry, we went sampling different restaurants and this was our last stop. We orders a chicken parm and a meatball, they were both delicious and cheesy, the table next to us had pasta and it looked good but they were not eating so I asked how it was, they said it was good but spicy and since I love spicy food we decided to order one. It was amazing, cheesy and spicy! We didn’t finish it because we were so full but we’ll def go back where we’re in town again.

formatted_address: 533 W 27th St #535, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Scores Holding Co Inc

reviews.text: Getting me a sportsbar!! Woo hoo
Great looking girls , love this place , smhhhh
5 dolla makes you holla

formatted_address: 5 W 37th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Reichenbach Hall

reviews.text: This is doubtless one of the finest place in the area. Always when I go there I am absolutely happy. They keep their very high  standard service and the topmost level of meals  they give. You no doubt will love this place. Highly  recommended.

This is absolutely one of the finest place to eat in the area. Always when I come there I am awfully glad. They keep their very high  level service and the topmost level of cooking  they offer. You can never go wrong with this place. Highly  recommended.

The menu is simple but very good. The schnitzel is a tad thick, the potato salad a bit sweet, but the other salads were great. The beer selection is not the broadest, but all very high quality. The atmosphere is fantastic, very comfortable and spacious. The staff was quick and friendly.
Awesome atmosphere and super amiable service. The menu was crisp and delightful. Will absolutely recommend this spot to friends. Convenient rates and big portions. Keep up the great work.
I prefer this place a lot. theres a special atmosphere. The food is tasty. the service is effective and the waiters are professional. The pay is satisfactory. extremely recommend.

formatted_address: 428 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Sushi Azabu

reviews.text: Delicious sushi, fresh fish, thoughtful service, cozy atmosphere. Definitely not $$, prepare to spend way more, but it's worth it. The tuna tasting is sublime. The fresh tofu melts in your mouth. Leave some room for the black sesame ice cream, you won't regret it.

Prob our favorite sushi place in NYC. They used to have a Michelin star I believe, so def not $$, more like $$$$. But it’s 💯 worth it 😊 we came just for regular sushi dinner but this place is a gem. Will come back and bring friends 🙌🏽 Also, they have sake bar upstairs which has been opened only for 6 months but their cocktails and sake selection is 👌🏼The staff and the manager are very friendly and helpful! Highly recommend
Had a great experience in this spot with my girlfriend. The food comes out rapidly and the service is just great. Prices are convenient.

Came here on a Friday night for nigiri omakase.  Enjoyed the meal a lot.  Shari had good level of acidity and not overly sweet, temperature was just right.  The neta (toppings) were seasonal and prepared very well.  Service was impeccable and tips is included.  The restaurant itself is cosy and would be great choice for a date.  Minor gripe is that the size of each piece of sushi was on the small side, and makes it feel less satisfying when you put a piece in your mouth.  This is common in NYC though, so I think it's an NYC thing.  

For dessert, their Basque Cheesecake was excellent and totally recommended.  Overall, excellent meal and would definitely be back.
They serve big dishes and for affordable rates. super nice staff members. Will visit again.

formatted_address: 575 Union St, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: MIRROR Tea House

reviews.text: Love this shop. All of the beverages had a nice attention to detail and they taste very unique. This shop has a beautiful vibe and you can even catch a live show sometimes.

Very cozy space with surprisingly a lot of room for shows. I watched an amazing composer showcase and the space was perfect for the energy of the performances. The Butterfly Pea Flower Tea was amazing and the barista was very nice and helped me pick out the perfect tea for me. I enjoyed this experience a lot!

Absolutely beautiful space and the owner goes out of his way to help out.
One of my favorite spots in the area.
This place is awesome. Good selections of tea, stylish ambience and they also have some nights with the life music.
Stylish, modern, Japanese, lots of teas and small bites. Sometimes they have some musical performances such as opera in German, piano, violin etc...

formatted_address: 208 Columbia St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Mazzat

reviews.text: Awesome place, very smooth atmosphere, in a quite and classic neighborhood. Food is great, Mediterranean kitchen with a mix of Greek and Turkish flavors. Very nice selection of appetizers, great main course options and specials. Drinks are cold and delicious, Mojitos are out of this world. Basically, everything is just right and perfect. We will definitely be back soon.

I like this restaurant! They provide great dishes, their menu is rich, The chief cook in that restaurant is an expert, I love a lot eating all their food. The food is consistently fresh and tasty, the attitude towards the clients  is helpful. I often eat in this place and I was never unhappy. I recommend it to all my friends.

Delicious Mediterranean food! I heard great things about this place so I came in for the shish-kabob sandwich for lunch, and the lamb was cooked excellently. It was moist and flavorful. The staff was also attentive and accommodating. Everyone in my group was very happy. If you are in the area, I absolutely recommend swinging in here to experience it for yourself.
This is a great restaurant. It is not expensive. Good food and wine. Family vibe and cool staff. The chef is a great guy and always is there for any request.
A gem.  Food is fresh and tasty.  Service is great.  Thoroughly enjoyable.  Perfect place for lunch or dinner with friends.

formatted_address: 59 Reade St, New York, NY 10007, USA
name: Maxwell's

reviews.text: The burger was delicious. I'm carb free this month, so I had it in lettuce with a side of greens. Excellent that that is offered as an option. Restaurant was clean and the booth was comfortable. Service was pleasant. Recommend.

Solid American bar with a local feel which can be lacking in this neighborhood. The tap beer offerings are standard but the space is well laid out and the staff are professional and friendly. Well worth a visit for honest NY traditional bar atmosphere.
Good bartender (Ollie) good food & not terrible prices considering its downtown Manhattan
Good spot, good service.

We were super hungry and came here to eat. We were not disappointed. It was great food and the service was great.

I'm going to go back next time I am in NYC.

formatted_address: 1678 Broadway, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Original Birdland Jazz Club

formatted_address: 58 W 38th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Havana NY

reviews.text: Fantastic Happy Hour menu of great drinks and really good appetizers. The bar service was excellent but the table service, while friendly, was focused on making as few trips to the table as possible. If you didn't think of everything you wanted the moment you sat down you had to wait a very long time to see the waiter again. Menu offers many authentic Cuban favorites but many items within a category (pork, chicken, etc. ) are  similar and made with only slightly different preparations. The dinner plate was crowded with fillers and had only small portions of the main ingredient. Many of the flavors tasted homogenized. Super fun place with some good and some not so good food, drinks and service .

My boyfriend and I went last night for a Valentine’s reservation, we were late but seated immediately which was great. The music was great, the ambiance was great, the food was pretty good just lacked salt. 

We arrived at about 10:15. We ordered pretty quickly,  but our appetizer didn’t reach the table until 40 minutes after we ordered. After the 40 minute wait my fried calamari came to the table Ice cold, I bought this to the waiters attention and he fixed it immediately also offered a round of drinks on the house which we appreciated. Our entree took a while to come out as well as our dessert  (The Tres leches cake is  amazing). Overall I enjoyed myself I just wish it wouldn’t have taken over 2 hours for our meal to be completed.

Had dinner with my wife and a few friends at this location. We were seated upstairs on the second floor. The space was small but not tight.The food was really good. The drinks are strong. The service was fast and friendly. I would definitely  recommend this place to anyone who is interested in having a great meal for a fair price.The parking is curbside and subject to D.O.T rules and regulations. However, there is paid parking just a few feet away.

Best of the best is here!
Absolutely love this place.
The food is delicious. The service is fast. The crew is so kind and super sweet. The atmosphere is so amazing. The drinks are just wow. I have never been disappointed here! Highly recommended.

Favorite Happy Hour spot with the girls. We've become friends with the staff, even those no longer there, we love the food, mojitos and drinks are always great no matter which bartender. Vibe is upbeat and crowd is usually young professionals. We love it! Been returning for a year now! They need to open some Salsa dancing nights  soon!

formatted_address: 491 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Le Petit Rooster

reviews.text: It was a nice atmosphere, with tasty food, at a reasonable price point. The menu has changed a few times since I started coming here but it has never disappointed.
Cozy, candle lit bistro with fresh, local ingredients - food packed with flavor. Attentive and helpful staff. Great wine list too.

We had the croquettes (amazing), the bone marrow (great), the duck magret (good), and the half-chicken (great). I'd go back again in a heartbeat. Great service, great food, good vibe. Great addition to the UWS.

I arranged a family reunion tonight for six people at Le Petite Rooster.  For most of the meal, we were the only people in the restaurant.  You would think we would get wonderful service, being the only customers.  But it was just the opposite. Any time we wanted service, the waiter was nowhere to be found . On a regular basis, we had to ask the busboy to  find the waiter to order cocktails, to order dinner, to order dessert, even to get the check, which was for $366. This was a very  important meal for me and in my opinion the waiter practically ruined it. You can be sure I will never be back, and will convey my irritation at your outrageously bad service if anyone want my opinion.  You need BETTER SERVICE!
John Doyle

Was hoping to like this place a lot more.  I went for lunch and it was pretty dead.  Decided to try the signature dish (roasted chicken) and was not particularly impressed.  At least lunch offered a much better value to dinner.  Ingredients seem solid and venue feels upscale but something is missing.  I may try it one more time in hopes that I went on an off day.  Will update review after my next visit.

formatted_address: 522 6th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Belli Osteria

reviews.text: Great food

formatted_address: 12 W 45th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Point Break NYC

reviews.text: Attentive and friendly bar tenders. The food was to die for. Tried the bacon bellies (bacon wrapped pork belly) and Mac N cheese spring rolls. Not much makes me happy food dance but both of these did. So happy to have stopped by

My friend and I work in the area and decide to reserve a table, meet up and catch up. No issues with the reservation when we got there our table was ready (by the door). Place was crowded so we thought was a good sign. Well our waitress Stacy, was horrible. She did not make us aware of the happy hour menu, took to long with our drinks. At one point I had to go find her and get my drink as she was talking to the bartender with my drink. Almost as if she wanted to let the time of the happy hour run out and charge us regular prices. We then asked her what the tequila boom boom was and she said it was soda and tequila. We said great lets try it. Turns out, when the drinks finally arrived it was seltzer water....when I rectified the drink ingredients, she insisted it was soda. Sorry, I know the difference....
Additionally we ordered the nachos supreme....the order arrived about an hour after we ordered it and it was burnt. The nachos had no flavor.
Won't be coming back.
The vibe and scenery is very nice. The drinks were good. Only down side bacon bellies had no seasoning so the only flavor I got was oil.

What a fantastic bar! My partner and I dropped in while exploring NYC & we're very glad that we did. The service was great, food extremely delicious (and filling!) but at a very reasonable price. Beers were cold and the venue was awesome. We would definitely come back again and recommend it.
Great beach bar environment, lots of TVs to watch sports. Extremely friendly staff. Had good bar food and many great drinks.

formatted_address: 196 8th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Lasagna Chelsea Restaurant

reviews.text: Food was delicious! The service was 5 star! Definitely going back! Was our first time and wont be our last!

The spicy penne a la vodka is a MUST have!! Spicy pasta? Where do I sign? The lasagna primavera was okay. I would deff return for that spicy penne a la vodka though!! It is AMAZING!!!!! Gluten free pasta also available.

I visited here twice while travelling NYC. I really miss the Eggplant Lasagna. Gnocchi was good enough as well.
If I travel NYC again, I'll definitely go back for the Eggplant Lasagna.

We had lovely time at Lasagna! They had a whole variety of lasagnas, as well as traditional pastas and some Mediterranean options on the menu. Staff was nice and welcoming. Perfect place for a family dinner.

If I could give this 10 stars I would! Visiting from Florida , was looking for a local Italian restaurant and found lasagna down the street from my hotel. The manager was more than helpful when I asked questions about the wine list and the food was absolutely delicious! A must go-to!

formatted_address: 326 Spring St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Ear Inn

reviews.text: This is a great neighborhood bar where the locals go to grab a drink after work or something quick to eat. My wife and I visited as we were intrigued by what one of the oldest bars in NYC would be like. Well if you love all that a traditional, cozy, welcoming, local watering hole is all about then stop by for a drink or something to eat. We went here in the evening in search of something to eat but didn’t want to visit a chain or large restaurant. The waitstaff was very friendly and accommodating and explained their daily specials. We settled on salads and that was perfect. By the time we left around 8:30 pm the place was packed. Definitely worth a visit!

A classic. Might look dirty for unaware tourists, but has a rich story and the oldness make you feel you as re in Manhattan in the past. Food is good (awesome vongoles, though), but the scenario is the main course
Stopped in for a few pints... Great atmosphere and the bartender Jason was awesome. Will return..

Unique bar with friendly staff and good food. 
Great place to kick back, relax and start up conversation with a stranger. 

Pro Tips: 
-No calls in the bar, if you want to talk go outside.  
- Don’t even try to order a Pina Colada.

A piece of history on every corner of that building. Beautiful atmosphere, excellent service and tasty food. Decent selection of beers and bar food. Burger was delicious, very unique. It's a NYC must visit.

formatted_address: 116 E 27th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Blue Smoke

reviews.text:
Situated in the heart of the flat iron district, Blue Smoke is one of the best BBQ joints and restaurants I’ve been to.  We split a few samplers and appetizers between three adults and two children. The sampler comes with brisket, pulled pork, ribs, chicken, and sausage. The only complaint is that the chicken, while not dry, was not fall off the bone moist like the rest of the meat. 

If you come here, you must do a buttermilk biscuit and / or the cornbread. I’ve had both and they are amazing. 

This is also one of the few restaurants in NYC that is non-tipping. You’d think the service would lack; however, similar to the food, all the staff were incredibly friendly and pros in the hospitality business.  I will definitely be coming back many more times.

I've been going to this restaurant for a few years new and this past week they changed the barbecue sauce to an old in-house recipe... HOW DO YOU CHANGE THE BEST THING ABOUT A BBQ RESTAURANT???? Unfortunately, its just not the same. Please bring back the better BBQ sauce and don't make a foolish mistake like this! This is your staple!!!
Fantastic atmosphere. Super friendly staff. Delicious food. I couldn't ask for a better experience at Blue Smoke. I will be definitely be going back.

Went here last night (1-25-20). Read loads of great reviews, before deciding to give my business to this establishment. Have to say, I was really disappointed with the food. I don't know it's because I went late (9pm). However, The food was cold. It felt It was sitting around for a long time. The meat was dry. Had it been fresh out of the oven, my opinion would of been whole lot different. The service was good, which is the only reason why I am not giving them a 1 star. The drinks are good too. They give you fairly decent amount of alcohol. Would I give them another try? Maybe, perhaps. 

One thing is certain, don't bother coming here for a late night dinner, that is for sure.

Really friendly staff got us a family table on a busy night. Main course took about 45 minutes to come out. Waiter was apologetic and it was very busy, so no problem. The mixed BBQ was good, brisket and sausage a highlight. Pulled pork was cold, but so much food it didn't matter. Really enjoyable que and super lovely staff.

formatted_address: 135 N 5th St, Brooklyn, NY 11249, USA
name: Juliette

reviews.text: Quite a cute place. Fairly small menu. Quality ingredients, nice presentation. It's got a really lovely calm quaint atmosphere. Pretty tightly packed so you'll probably learn more than you hoped about the eating habits of others, but nothing crazy.

Juliette makes me feel like I’ve transported to a little cute restaurant in Bordeaux. Great interiors and atmosphere. Love the food! If you enjoy seafood - go for octopus as a starter and the scallops or salmon for a main - can’t go wrong! They have a good selection of wine as well.

I adore this place! They serve high quality dishes, they have a nice menu, The chief cook in that place is a real authority in the kitchen, I like very much tasting all their food. The food is consistently fresh, the service towards the clients  is nice. I often eat in this restaurant and I was never discontended. Highly recommended.
This spot is worth trying. They have big portions for affordable rates. Regularly well organized and with great vibes. Will come back again.

The food was good both times I came here.  The service was decent, staff fairly attentive.  My issue however is that there is no changing table in the rest room for babies.  It would be nice to have one of those plastic tables that are attached to the wall.

formatted_address: 170 John St, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: Trading Post

reviews.text: Unlimited brunch was a lot of fun! Great server, Jesse James! Swears it was his name. We had Brussels sprouts and blueberry pancakes as an app (at Jesse’s suggestion) but they were delicious. I had the steak, medium rare with 2 eggs sunny side up, and fries and it was delicious! The burger and chicken salad were good as well. Definitely worth a visit!

Everything about this place, the food, drinks, service and especially the atmosphere. For a real cozy and chill experience try one of the booths or downstairs bar you will not be dissatisfied. Price goes in hand with experience but I would urge you to judge for yourself. Did I mention one of the oldest bars in New York, it gets its name because settlers literally used this place as a meeting spot to trade in the old world. Great history.

Excellent high quality pub comfort food. Service is top notch. We were there celebrating a special occasion and the waiter brought us over a round of drinks on the house! Do try the mussels and can't go wrong with the burger!
Celebrated the birthday of a friend here. Had an amazing brunch here. The service is outstanding. Dane made us feel super welcome and more than took care of us. We’ll be back more often!

Trading Post was very nice. The decor is lovely and atmosphere comforting. The service received was perfect, the waiters were nice and just the perfect amount of attentive. The food was delicious!! I will be returning and I would recommend.

formatted_address: 145 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Fools Gold NYC

reviews.text: One of the coolest bars I have ever been too! Love the interior! The food tasted really good! Really loved the Irish nachos. I will definitely go back there next time when I’m in NYC

Great spot. Staff is incredible and make you feel very at home. Amazing selection of beers and liquors. I’d highly recommend for a great, chill, neighborhood bar. The fish tacos and wings are always filling and tasty. We are big fans of Roger and Kim.

Cool bar space and good draft beer selection. Service was slow, but the crowd was probably more to blame than the bartenders. The Irish nachos were pretty good. The whiskey is overpriced for the most part, as are some of the bottled beers (80 bucks for a bottle, really?). Also, when it gets crowded, it's almost impossible to get to the self serve water jug in a corner near the front. A final note: the bathrooms are slightly bigger than airplane bathrooms.

I came here with my parents for a late dinner at a fun bar, and we got more than we asked for. The atmosphere is great, they have board games and skee-ball and great music that's not too loud to have a conversation. The buffalo chicken tacos (pictured) were amazing, as was my dad's chicken sandwich, and my mom's chili. Great selection of beer at a good price and great service!

I came here with my parents for a late dinner at a fun bar, and we got more than we asked for. The atmosphere is great, they have board games and skee-ball and great music that's not too loud to have a conversation. The buffalo chicken tacos (pictured) were amazing, as was my dad's chicken sandwich, and my mom's chili. Great selection of beer at a good price and great service!
(xpost Yelp)

formatted_address: 86 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Casa Mezcal

reviews.text: The food was delicious if you're into spicy food.I suggest you try the guacamole and the chips. The desert 3 leches cake was extremely delicious I definitely recommend trying that out. The service was excellent and the vibe was relaxing.
Great place for a quick drink and burritos! The only thing that i would recommend to offer happy hours specially Taco Tuesdays!

Casa Mezcal feels like a cute and comfy bistro located in the backyard of a local Mexican church. It’s goth decor and street market style fusion brings immense character and authentic vibes to this LES spot. 

The food was delicious and the portions were perfect. Aside from the lackluster service the meals were served fast. Definitely recommend for birthdays or small gatherings.

Excellent traditional Mexican fare with a modern twist. All fresh ingredients of herbs and spices. Nice cocktail menu with good selection of mezcal drinks. Go earlier for quiet dining or later for lively scene.
Great restaurant. Always a good go-to with friends. The food does come out a little quick, but otherwise the service was good! Not as many good vegetarian options as some other spots, but still good!

formatted_address: 2350 Broadway, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Liondor

formatted_address: 237 W 37th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Joonbug.com

reviews.text:
I attended a New Years party in Baltimore put on by this company and was gravely disappointed. The food was not just sparse it was nearly nonexistent. The organization of the on site staff was severely lacking. The New Years countdown was awful, there was no set up and the DJ suddenly says it’s almost midnight and counts down 8 seconds. the bartenders were not set up properly and drink lines were really slow. 

For all the money I spent on the tickets I had higher expectations. I personally will never attend another joonbug event and don’t recommend to others.

To top it all off, the website makes the claim that they care about their customer but the phone just rings busy and the email is invalid.

Got an e-mail at 4pm on the day of the New Years Eve event in Hoboken that our tickets were canceled. I don't understand how you overbook 65 people and don't tell them until 5 hours before the event. Worst customer service representatives. Never been so disgusted and frustrated with a company.

Terrible, bought tickets for a “block party” for NYE, biggest waste of money. My tickets were not scanned, just glanced at, and the bars did not even check the wristbands we had, they were letting everyone in. Tickets were completely unnecessary.

Purchased tickets to attend NYC 4th of July 2019 event that was
supposed to take place on the South Street Heliport 6 East Rivers
Piers NY, NY 10004 on Pier 6. I bought 7 tickets for $570.29 on June
20th, 2019. On June 25th, 2019 I get an email stating the event had to
be cancelled "due to circumstances beyond our control, the NYPD has
altered its traffic control plan for the South Street Heliport and no
longer allowing the heliport area of the South St. Seaport to be open to
the public" & " Please be assured, that all orders will be promptly
refunded. If you have any question about the refund, please check
your credit card statement. Your bank controls when the refund will be
posted" Today is now July 9th, 2019 and I haven't received a refund or
response as to when I will be receiving my refund. I have paid
$570.29.
Don't remember ever going there

formatted_address: 90 N 11th St, Brooklyn, NY 11249, USA
name: Brooklyn Billiards

reviews.text: Awesome place. Walk past it, looks like a little hole in the wall. Completely miss the pool tables on the back. They usually place some gold music, and love the extremely high vaulted ceilings. The design is awesome. Great place.
Great place to go on a date to. Cool vibes, friendly staff , nice drinks and food. Liked the well kept pool tables. Will come back again.
Not a bad place to relax and just shoot some pool. Pretty relaxed environment. The food is pretty good as well.
Perfect place to kill an hour or two where it is quiet and dark during the day.

No pics today - this place has been open 1 year : all about service ; ambience ++ , the billiard area kind of dark - missing something - blah .... but this place needs a dedicated waiter for the billiard section- felt closetafobic... I cant believe saturday night 11pm and half empty- .... will return in six to see any change.... ( cant believe BK Brewery across the street- and doesn't have all the other options - in their own back yard... ! 
... )

formatted_address: 101 Broad St, New York, NY 10004, USA
name: Anglers' Club of New York

formatted_address: 47 S 5th St, Brooklyn, NY 11249, USA
name: Aska

reviews.text: This place was fantastic from the moment I walked through the door to the moment I left. The atmosphere is relaxed, the chefs are relaxed, and the staff makes you feel like you're visiting a Norwegian chalet in the upper north sectors of the planet. The space is absolutely gorgeous and the perfect size for a place like this. All the dishes are exquisite and have just the right amount of flavor. I left very satisfied. What an enjoyable experience. I'd visit again.

One of the world's must visit food labs! 
Decor and lighting taken from a Rembrandt painting scene, plates take you to a yet to be found out of space planet. 
Dont expect to like all flavors, just enjoy the privilege to experience something truly unique.
I enjoyed every dish which they offered because the chef created a great tasting menu. And they also offered excellent service.

Dining as Aska was like emerging yourself into a deep, dark, mysterious ocean. It was probably the most refreshing fine dining experience I've had recently in New York. Most fine dining places tend to give an air of snobby choreography but not at Aska. Everyone seemed pretty relaxed yet focused. 

The dishes wowed me a few times. Some were experimental, and fantastic. I greatly appreciate the beautiful presentation, which made use of the dish's ingredients. Deep inside every flavor, every color, every combination is an effort to make something truly elegant. 

If there is any criticism I had I'd be the music. It doesn't seem to go with the food nor the atmosphere and often distracting. But I also say this because I'm a picky listener. 

I'd go back to Aska to try a different menu in maybe the spring.

To sum up my experience at aska in one word, I would go with inspired. The Chef is clearly at the top of his game and is striving to push himself to the absolute pinnacle of his abilities.  Interestingly, you can clearly see the Chef's influence everywhere you look and in everything you experience from arriving at the restaurant to departing. Arriving is like discovering a hidden gem tucked away in Brooklyn just across and down and to the left of the Brooklyn Bridge when approaching from Manhattan, the location is stunning and absolutely perfect, it is clear immediately that is no accident. Upon entering the boldness of the largely black interior floods your vision, I would say a minimalistic design by someone that understands how to execute on this style. The black is expertly used to bring focus to the beauty and elegance of simple well executed pieces throughout the space. The quality of the chairs and clear effort that must have went into making them, the sign itself, the menu. Minimalistic designs can be pretty severe in nature, harsh, slanted towards extremely plain, when well executed they bring focus to simple things done extraordinarily well, the beauty of a wood grain, the complexity in the design of a table or chair, the simple yet complex exposed kitchen. The staff, top notch, fun, execute with precision with a common mission of exceeding expectations. We had the chance to meet the chef briefly, as expected, almost a bit introverted, likely thinking about how to infuse magic into his next creation, likely a genius, certainly an impressive, humble, yet confident person, exudes passion. The food, my review is already too long but oh my, to say I was exasperated with delight would be an understatement to the extreme. The food, for lack of a better term, was perfect. If I had one meal I could pick as my last, aska would currently fill that position. One can only hope in a lifetime I can find its equal, if I didn't, I wouldn't be disappointed, as close to the perfect dining experience I've ever had. Thank you everyone at Aska for a completely magical evening, I am forever grateful.

formatted_address: 43 W 54th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Connolly's Pub & Restaurant

reviews.text:
Delicious. Absolutely delicious. 
Me and my fiancee found this place for luck. In a rainy evening we come into the first pub to eat and get repair from the rain, and it was absolutely amazing. 
Best burger we eat during out NY travel

We happened upon this bar thanks to a recommendation.  It was after midnight. We were greeted at the door by a very kind, personable man who made us feel very welcome.  This is a big deal when you are visiting a new place.  Potstickers were really good.  I would go back.

We came to this place for dinner. This spot was recommended to us by a friend.  Well, it was very successful. The staff members were very polite and we felt excellent. The meal was great. We enjoyed every moment and we will definitely return to this restaurant. We recommend this place to all.
Great pub atmosphere, reasonable prices and great food.  Bar staff was friendly and helpful.  Lots of locals, not another tourist trap restaurant.

Great atmosphere and pricing. The only reason I’m not giving it 5 stars is because I asked for my burger to be cooked medium rare and it was well done. Still tasty I was just really looking forward to the burger

formatted_address: 242 E 10th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: PINKS

reviews.text: This gem of a bar is a must if you are in the neighborhood, or not!  Staff is wonderful, attentive, friendly, and make you want to come back. Great tacos and popcorn. The space is unassuming but so charming. My new favorite.
Great food, cool vibe and excellent service.
Great vibe, good cocktails, great food what do you want more from a local bar:)
Good for brunch! I found this place through pulsd. The hasbrowns id say to avoid but It’s a laid back brunch spot with good prices!

Cool atmosphere, great staff, amazing drunk Mexican food. Good drink prices and selection. Only wild card is the number of people. Some times it is packed, others it is empty. I love Rock and roll bingo!

formatted_address: 445 Albee Square W, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Chicks Isan

reviews.text: Not going back! This is my second time ordering from this place. I got the Laab Mu the first time and it was great and the portion was good. I was shopping at Trader Joe’s and decided to ordered the Laab a second time, to go. When I got home,  the portion was literally a quarter of what I got the first time, which was laughable. It was 3/4 vegetables and 1/4 mince pork. Very disappointing because I felt ripped off paying $13.00 for mince pork that was the size of half my palm and majority of vegetables. The Laab is good but just check the portion if you  are ordering it to go.

Chicken wings were succulent and juicy but the seasoning they put on was way toooooo salty. Good heat but they need to take care with the salt.

Potential here.

If you like the real deal and authentic Thai food, then Chicks Isan is the only place. The taste is sOo flavorful and soOo mouthwatering especially the Isan style grilled chicken, grilled pork cheeks, larb moo, papaya salad, and the crispy rice salad! Hands down the best new addition to Dekalb Market Hall.
Their best is fried wings! Others are so-so. Make sure you have tried their wings, no matter which flavor !

Visited Chicks Isan on Wednesday and easy to see that they just opened by how disorganized they were and that everything was served in these containers. Apparently they have a seafood restaurant in the city as well. 

The first dish is called Larb Moo which is minced pork tossed with Thai herbs. According to the menu online and at the location for $9 it’s suppose to come with toasted sticky rice but the person swore that rice is an extra $3 bucks so I got jasmine instead. I did not know nor did the counter person mention anything about heat and boy was my mouth on fire 🔥. If we put my destroyed 🤦🏻‍♂️ taste buds aside the food actually had pretty good flavors. I ended up eating only 1/4 of the dish and took the rest home to let my wife taste the fire.

The second picture is of a fried chicken wing I stole from a coworker they call “Zaab Wings”. Here you get a slight bit of heat on the back end with strong lime flavors. I wish I bought this instead as i was able to actually eat this and enjoy with what was left of my taste buds.

Overall the verdict is that it will be a good addition once the bumps are worked out and they get a control on there heat levels.

formatted_address: 230 5th Ave #504, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: That Night Entertainment

formatted_address: 68 34th St, Brooklyn, NY 11232, USA
name: Standard Wormwood Distillery

reviews.text: one of our favorite producers of local spirits made from only local and organically farmed ingredients hosts in its gorgeous tasting room.  the bar is made from the oak that is used to age the rye.  every time we stop in here we seem to make a new friend.  bonus, the distillery is on site if you want to see where and how the magick happens.  100%
Strong spirits. Friendly people.

Went on a wonderful, in-depth tour and stuck around afterwards at the bar. The owners are deeply passionate and care greatly about their craft, and it shows in the products they make. All the spirits here were delicious; I particularly enjoyed the rye and wermut. The cocktails are also quite good and surprisingly affordable. Highly recommend; if I lived closer I’d be there all the time.

THE BEST GIN EVER!!!!!!  I WISH I COULD FIND IT IN FLORIDA...PLEASE THINK ABOUT SHARING THIS LOVELY SPIRIT DOWN SOUTH....BROOKLYN IS A LITTLE FAR TO DRIVE TO...HOWEVER ONCE I GET THERE I MAKE IT WORTH MY TRIP #4BOTTLESINMYTRUNK....THANKS STANDARD FAMILY

I brought my husband here for the tour and tasting as a surprise. Taras was great and made the experience very personal, answering all of our many questions. Great products and unique distillation process that you'll appreciate more after you've seen it in person.

formatted_address: 320 Atlantic Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: French Louie

reviews.text: A rocky start to our dining experience where we lost our reservation for being just 10 minutes late. The hostess was not even the least apologetic! However, we were quickly seated in the exterior backyard space that is quieter and more relaxing than the interior (dark and rather noisy). Food portions are exceptionally generous, and all dishes are very well prepared and delicious! Will definitely consider coming back again for another experience!

Expensive for a neighborhood restaurant,and this is not French cuisine really, it is more at french colonial. However the staff are young and exuberant which can be fun. Definitely though, the customer reigns here.
