The average meal for 2 will run $150 - $200, and if you order the signature aged cut of beef don't hesitate to send it back, should it be cooked incorrectly.(it is nicely thick)
Not my favorite dining experience.

The staff were friendly and open, helpful and quick and responsive. The dining room was full but it was easy to hear one another and have conversation. The food was creative, delicious, and all around lovely. Would absolutely return. (And looking forward to trying out the patio).
Super cute breakfast/brunch spot. Refined diner vibes. Great food and super pleasant staff! Would return for a brunch date or with the parents/friends from out of town.

From the first moment  you enter that place  team give you an agreeable feeling. Very courteous team, it is a kind restaurant to to go out with buddies or with your date. Excellent  meals, skillful  chef de cuisine, good  price and generous  service. Highly recommended.

formatted_address: 2 Pennsylvania Plaza, New York, NY 10121, USA
name: Noah Tepperberg

formatted_address: 433 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Haru Sushi

reviews.text:
I'm not a big fan of clam chowder but this was really good!
Fresh.  Flavorful.
It says on the menu award winning.
And the price compared to everything else on the menu was good.
The service was pretty friendly.
I'd definitely like to come back and try other dishes.
Loved this place for happy hour! Great prices on rolls (~$5) and they were delicious. $2 off beer and wine was great adn the service was fabulous. Will definitely return!

A bit more expensive than for competitive raw fish Emporia and worth every penny. Truly authentic superb sushi. Across Columbus from American Museum of Natural History. Reservations are a must as the place is popular and tiny. Next door to a Shake Shack if you can't get in😋

Delicious fresh assortment of sushi for the 3 of us. We ordered a very high quality cold sake that our server recommended and it was superb. We sat outside and enjoyed a nice summer evening...i highly recommend this!

I love sushi so had to try Haru Sushi. The location, staff, ambiance & food were all wonderful.  After perusing the menu,  I chose the calamari salad & Spicy Titanic Roll - Salmon, avocado and caviar, wrapped around crunchy spicy tuna with a bottle of Asahi beer.  Great combination of flavors.  Already planning my next reservation to Haru Sushi along with checking out the other 3 locations.

formatted_address: 41 W 40th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Celsius NYC

reviews.text: Cool spot. Eat outside on the sunny terrace complete with heat lamps or inside, at the front row of the skating rink. The menu is slightly limited but varied at the same time, we were all satisfied with our choices. The hostesses were welcoming and we had non stop attention from the waiting staff. A bit pricey but hey... you are in Bryant Park!

What a neat concept to shake the winter time blues in Midtown. Warm up from ice skating with a cocktail, bacon mac n cheese and enjoy toasty seating outside on couches under heat lamps or indoors by the bar. I really enjoyed the service, drinks, food and view while I was here at this very trendy, modern winter bar; however, the prices are way too steep. I get that the place has to make money, but this felt like highway robbery, even for NYC. $18 for a small dish of mac n cheese, $15 highball of whiskey ginger... talk about breaking the bank. We had a great time and wish we could come back, but sadly, that will be our last.

Chic and luxury - this place allows you to enjoy some glamour on white couches under heat lamps while indulging in good food and rinks and overlooking the ice skating rink!

Who doesn't love Bryant Park. Now, this restaurant brings something else to do in this beautiful park. Celebrate a birthday, have a happy hour and connect with friends or just come for the heck of it. Celsius is beautiful themed place and fun to go to, especially during the winter months. The staff here are some of the friendliest in the city and are always willing to ensure you have a GREAT TIME! 

Relatively priced for New York City. It can get packed during the busier hours, especially Friday evenings but if you do get in, you will enjoy a fun night with everyone while indulging in delicious food and drinks.

One of my favorite winter places in NYC. A must visit each year. The service is great. Perfect for a quick bite and few drinks. Love sitting with friends under the heat lamps outside enjoying the view of the ice skating rink !! The best Blood Orange Margaritas !!

Celsius is a pop-up restaurant in Bryant Park - it is nice to sit inside or outside.  They have tables outside with heated lamps and a great view of the skating rink.  The menu is somewhat limited, but they have fun winter themed drinks!

formatted_address: 1113 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10065, USA
name: One Lenox

reviews.text:
Food was delicious. The service was amazing. Atmosphere was fantastic, welcoming, decent lighting, and awesome service ! 10/10!
Would highly recommend. (Pizza in the pic was half eaten before I snapped a pic, so sorry ! )

Solid place for brunch. They're bloody mary's are great! However, you can find a better deal and food throughout Manhattan. The atmosphere, service, and food are an average for NYC, which is good, but nothing outstanding.

I got the Croquet Madame - two pieces of big toast with ham and cheese, plus an egg on top. Filling, but somewhat bland.
I always have a great time here. The food is delicious and the service is too notch. Michele really treats everyone like a friend, even if it's their first time in the bar. Get the avocado fries!
Great brunch value! It wasn't full of heavy drinkers and you could actually have a conversation. It was cozy and warm the french toast was amazing as were the donut holes
Friendliest spot on the block. The owner is the nicest person, very genuine.  Great vibe, food and drinks.

formatted_address: 1234 Park Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: CHIC NIGHTLIFE

formatted_address: 3 E 44th St, New York, NY 10017, USA
name: Azusa of Japan

reviews.text:
The restaurant has a plenty of seats and cosy to stay, but the quality of foods is lower than other Japanese restaurant.
Disappointed with over chooked meats and fries, funny udon soup and a little unusual styles of dishes.
There might not be someone who control the quality of foods and dishes, especially udon soup!

We came to this place for a meeting. my friend recommended this place.  Well, we were not disappointed. The crew were extremely nice and we felt very good. The meal was tasty. We had a great time and we will definitely return to this restaurant. Highly recommended.
They offer an awesome variety of fresh food. I love eating here. The employees are always very friendly, rates are affordable and the spot is always kept clean.

What a wonderful place.
Happened accros this gem in the City. 
#Excellent food.
#Excellentprice
This is the real deal. They didn't not deliver but you can call ahead and they'll have it ready for you. Now that's service.
I really like this place.
The restaurant has a very cozy atmosphere. The weekday lunch special is worth getting for its price! Service is reasonably fast.

formatted_address: 200 E 60th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Anassa Taverna

reviews.text: Beautiful midtown Greek tavern. Wide selection of cocktails and few beers on tap. Good food and wonderful service from the crew. Nice atmosphere. Something to recommend.
Good Greek style cuisine. Small desert menu, but every kind of coffee and tea available. Top notch service.

My first time visiting. I loved the food. Very tasty. My friends and I had the lunch special. It was worth it and we also got some other appetizers to share. The atmosphere was amazing. I will be coming back very soon.
Excellent lunch spot. Beautiful octopus. Generally very tasty food
The veggie chips and tzatsiki are next level. Honestly, everything we ate here was next level. The meatballs too. Loved it.

formatted_address: 163 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Tarallucci e Vino

reviews.text: I love coming here for a quiet night out ordering a lovely glass of wine with friends or roommates.  The bartenders are always knowledgeable with great service and the food is amazing. The only drawback is that the place is super cold in the winter. The bar chairs are metal and the bar top is marble. The heat barely feels like it's on so everything feels even colder than it already is.  That's the only unpleasant thing about this place.

I guess this place is a trattoria. Easy to walk in and hang out. If you want to just chill out at the happy hour, you can do that. Or if you want to have a nice dinner course, they can accommodate you also. The bartender is very polite and attentive. I had amaro at the end of my meal which was very nice. I highly recommend this place.
My wife just had dinner here for the Valentine's day. It's a fixed menu but the food is really dilicous. The service is also very nice.
Great all around restaurant. Really great staff, sexy scene and AMAZING FOOD. I really like the chef special cheese and meat plate. It’s a good amount of food and DONT forget about the octopus

I’m not sure if we did something to offend the woman working behind the bar (medium length dark brown hair) but she basically decided that she wasn’t going to serve us - we had been sitting there for 10 minutes patiently letting her do her thing, continued to wait after she had asked every other customer whether they would like a second drink without asking us what we would like for our first. then we finally asked if we could put a drink order in and she pretended not to hear us even though she most obviously did. Have never experienced anything like this I am entirely shocked. If you are the manager reading this you should have a talk with her because if she hates people this much she probably shouldn’t be in their service industry. I am also a bartender at a busy upscale restaurant, I understand there are hard days but you just cannot behave like that...

formatted_address: 378 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Coppola's East

reviews.text:
Lovely Italian restaurant in Murray hill  with good food portions and nice drinks
The bartender was super friendly and the servers were great too
We got bread and bruschetta on the house on top of the appetizers we ordered so finally we just couldn’t finish our entrees and had to doggy bag it. Everything was just delicious and felt very authentic and fresh. Will definitely recommend.

Great Neighborhood Joint. Good Service. Decent Prices. Stick to the Classic Italian Dishes and the Pizza. It's also on the Seated App so I got back 17 percent! Check out the Seated App and use my code: Peter729 and start earning while eating!

Absolutely DELICIOUS!!! My women and I had a wonderful experience! We order seafood, Lobster, Crab, Shrimp, Fish.. ect.. It was super fresh, flavorful, and perfectly cooked! We order white wine and one of their house special drinks, and it was delicious as well. We will undoubtedly be back! Highly recommended!
Coppola East has really good, traditional Italian food. Their penne a la vodka and pizzas are delicious. Highly recommend. Prices are very fair. Definitely give it a shot.

The food is very good, expensive for what it is but very good, $21 for penne pasta with no meat in it. The restaurant itself has very high ceilings and you can hear everyone else's conversation as you eat your dinner which was annoying. Not an intimate date spot by any means and the service certainly doesn't match the prices, not bad service but if you're charging those prices it should be 5* service especially the wine prices.

formatted_address: 26 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Spiegel

reviews.text: Spiegel is a calm hidden secret in Manhattan. The ambience is welcoming, the food varieties are splendid and filling to that bite and they cater to an array of drinks to indulge any craving. Available to eat also are food snacks to nibble on while you chat away. Good for crowds and elegant for couples. High chairs available at the bar.

Cute and eclectic little restaurant. Very relaxed environment, kind and helpful staff and good food.
Tried something new today, Sabich salad and it was pretty good.
I’ll be back again to try the breakfast menu because it looks delicious.

Hands down one of my favorite local brunch spots!!! Service can be a little slow, but it’s definitely worth the wait. The food is always delicious, service is great AND they sell verve coffee! Highly recommend.

One of the best cafes in the neighborhood. Their service is completely another level from what you would regularly experience at similar kinds. They are organized, attentive yet not pushy, friendly in the boundary of respectfulness. The breakfast and coffee I had were great as well by the delightful glass wall toward the first avenue.
Great vibe! Great costumer service and the food  just leave you with a taste for more! I had the breakfast platter it was delicious! Can't wait to go there again! That's my new spot! Solid 5 out 5.

formatted_address: 243 W 54th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Characters

reviews.text: I loved the beef tacos and the beer. I also liked the fact that their kitchen was open until 3am and it was a good place for a late night snack and drink. The waitress was nice and checked up on us regularly. I didn't think the prices were too expensive. It was also in a good location that wasn't too far to walk from my hotel.

Went for dinner as it was near our hotel. Service was nice. Waiter was polite. Fries had a nice crisp and were salty. Mashed potatoes were instant, had that gritty flajey texture. Iced tea had soured as though it was made the night before or early that morning.

The site is super great as is the attention.  NICOLAS was super friendly with kind and attentive to us.  the food was super good and not to mention the beers.  The best has been that we could play our own music.  We had a great time!
Good bar across/ close to theater ( studio 54)

Stopped by this restaurant after a broadway show. A simple, nice place to get good food and lots of drinks. The place is fairly big, so it is good for bigger groups. The service was excellent, and the servers were attentive without disturbing your meal. My food was good, but not exceptional. The drinks were great. A very safe option on any day. Highly recommend for a nice night out!

formatted_address: 366 Metropolitan Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: The Commodore

reviews.text: This is a dive bar's dive bar, BUT this is also 100% a chicken spot u have 2 try.  Dinner or Brunch you have got 2 try the chicken.... BLACK GRANDMOTHER'S ARE BEING HELD PRISONER GOOD!!

Solid dive bar that's easy to miss from the outside but a cute, delicious chicken filled gem once inside. Would recommend the gin drinks and pretty much most the cocktails - solid happy hour. The seat yourself results in a lot of standing since it gets crowded quickly on the weekends.

Came here for drinks with a group of friends on a Saturday afternoon. It was pretty busy but we were lucky enough to get a corner booth table for the 5 of us. We just got one round of drinks but really enjoyed our cocktails. I had the Bloody Mary, which was good. I think I most liked the Pina Colada that comes with an amaretto floater. We didn’t order any food this time but I’ve been here before and have always loved the nachos.
One of the best pins coladas in the city. Amazing nachos and fried chicken too. Usually hard to get a table or a bar seat but this place is an institution so that's to be understood.

Anyone you talk to who knows Commodore knows the food is way way better than you'd expect. Go for the Hot Breast sandwich. (Only available during the week) Bartenders are nice, friendly and helpful. One if my favorite bars for 10+ years.

formatted_address: 459 Myrtle Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11205, USA
name: Five Spot Soul Food

reviews.text: This place is pretty great. The back area is huge, great enough to host events here. Fun place. I highly recommend 👍🏼👍🏼

This is a very large old fashioned restaurant. It could use a lot of upgrading. They have nice events and the crowd is good.  I've went here several times in the past and really enjoyed myself. My last visit was on super bowl sunday, the meal looked great,  the chicken was very good however the mac & cheese was very oily and tasted off.

Just left about 10 minutes ago and I would NOT go there. The food was horrible. I looked around and saw that celebrities had been there at one point but that’s in 2006. I got the soul platter and the chicken was not chicken. The catfish fingers were not catfish and the Mac and cheese had a funny after taste. I spent $22 bucks on old food and horrible ambience. When I walked past I never saw anyone in there but I wanted to support and it was the wrong decision. I wasted money and to top it off black stuff was floating in my glass of water and I feel nauseous. I am trying to post a photo of the food and chicken.
Nice and mellow location....was here for the "Open Mic & Spoken word" event.
One of the Best restaurant lounge spaces in BK. The waitresses were kourteous, respecktfull & beautifull. Eye highly rekkomend this space for eating drinkibg & social affairs.

formatted_address: 70 South St, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: Industry Kitchen

reviews.text: Wonderful restaurant!  The food is just amazing. You gotta try the rib eye. It's enough for 2-3 people and delicious. Furthermore the place is really nice, with a beautiful view of the Brooklyn Bridge. And there is also a very nice bar next to the restaurant witch I really loved. I strongly recommend!
Amazing place to dine in, very romantic with an amazing view. The food was delicious but the service needs to be improved! Reasonable prices as well!

We came for brunch on Sunday, the food was great, good views over the water and nice cocktails. As Brits visiting New York I have to say, we’ve been surprised by the quality of the service, to date it’s been pretty poor. However industry kitchen has been the exception, the waitresses were really friendly, greeted us with a smile (which has been unusual throughout the rest of our trip) and were very attentive. We’d definitely come back!

The industrial eggs Benedict taste great, but the size was quite small. The drinks are overpriced, and they served our $14 red wine in plastic glasses... weird. The ingredients of the signature pizzas are ridiculous for me. With that being said: the views are amazing (if that is what is the most important...) In summary: I don't think is worth the money unless you really don't care about eating.
The meal was delicious and the atmosphere was very laid back. Great date spot! I’d suggest wearing business casual or something along those lines.

formatted_address: 229 Duffield St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Brooklyn Brewhouse

reviews.text: We visited twice in consecutive nights. Great spot, excellent burgers and playlist, pleasant friendly bartenders. Need to stock Myers or Goslings tho!
Lovely place. For the food they will give you exactly how you want it so know what you're talking about

The mojito and fries were great however my burger was not good. Came out over cooked, dry, cold, and lacked any flavour. On the plus side our server and the management were very responsive to our complaints.

Went here on a Saturday midday, location wasn’t busy. Atmosphere was great. I thought the food was pricey, but I think this is because the restaurant is next to a couple of hotels. The menu says brunch till 4pm. I got there at 3 asked for brunch and was told it ends at 3, so I guess the menu is wrong. All in all it was ok. I would choose something better in the area.
Open space and empty on a Sunday for soccer watching with kids. Nice service. Priced for tourists...20 bucks for eggs and bacon with toast?!?

formatted_address: 3 Hanover Square, New York, NY 10004, USA
name: Joseph's Restaurant

reviews.text: My partner and I are from Atlanta, GA  we spent Valentine's Day in New York City and would like to say that the experience we had at Joseph's Restaurant was amazing. From the top of the staff to the bottom: coat check, host, manager, servers, and especially chef, you did a stellar job. The attention to detail was impeccable. The food and presentation astounding. The ambiance, superb. You set the stage for one of the best Valentine's Days I've ever had. We will be back and thank you so much for the delightful time.

For an Italian restaurant in Wall Street area, this place is pretty awesome.  No need to go to Little Italy when it is this good. If you work in the Wall Street area and crave for Italian food, you must try this place.

Absolutely spectacular! This is my favorite Italian restaurant in New York. I eat here every year for work meetings and have only had extremely good meals. I recommend either the beat salad or caesar salad to start and either the salmon or pasta special for the main course. Everything is cooked to perfection. Most of all, the service is impeccable. Pro tip: reserve one of the quiet private rooms if you have a group. It is one way to make a large restaurant even more intimate.

This place is certainly one of the most attractive restaurants in the area. Anytime I visit this place I am profoundly pleased. They manage their high  standard service and the topmost level of meals  they serve. You surely will enjoy this this place. Very  recommended.
Joseph's is great for a fixed price lunch in Hanover Square. The service is excellent. The waiters are friendly. The stairs are steep which could be a concern.

formatted_address: 1024 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: V&T Pizzeria Restaurant

reviews.text:
The service, portions, and prices are good, but the pizza is bad. I got a small meatball pizza. The sauce was good, although it did not save or redeem the pizza. 7/10. The cheese was okay 5/10. But the crust  ruined it. Completely charred black with no flavor or texture. A good pizza slice isn't supposed to be firm, but their pizza slice head about as much firmness as a piece of toilet paper. They accidentally gave me a serving spoon with a pizza, and honestly judging by the crust it probably wasn't a mistake. 2/10.
Overall, I give it a 4/10. They could probably pass this off somewhere other than New York City, but not here.

Always a great informal atmosphere with great food and service. Reasonably priced, nice for two or a group. We have celebrated here often, pizza is one of best in city. Across from the famous St. John cathedral and interesting small park.

Very disappointing. It smells better than it taste. The meatballs were dry and grainy. I'm not sure what they put in it that made them so grainy but yeah i couldn't eat them. The best thing about my meal was the bread. I wouldn't go back.
It's a nice place to have food with family or friends the pizza so delicious also u can have drinks too amazing

This restaurant is a 70 year old institution has good Italian cuisine for a price you cannot beat. This is not your upscale restaurant but the food is great. I have been coming to this restaurant for years and I will continue to do so.

formatted_address: 214 E 10th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Hi-Collar

reviews.text: A perfect place to chill, to relax or do software jobs. I like this shop because it is so wide and cozy. Yesterday, I was so satisfied with their White Mocha Frappe because it is not that sweet. I like their staves because they were so friendly and fast in doing their task. Huge thanks to all of you! Highly recommended!

My friend and I came in somewhat late, but at least 2 hrs before closing time. The kitchen was already closed, which is respectable. I had desserts with me, and I asked if we could eat it, considering the kitchen was closed. I was told no. We weren't given any information or suggestions for drinks, the pours were stingy (especially considering I paid half the price of a bottle retail, for a single dram), the pouring ceremony seemed phoned in (especially in comparison to other customers) and I overwhelmingly felt like we weren't  welcome. I did enjoyed the quiet, though. I had really wanted to like this place.

This place was fun. Old world Japan with western influences for the decor. Shoji and afternoon tea! Great drip or percolator coffee. The food selection was interesting.  Japanese omelet rice is a comfort food favorite but usually not served at a cafe.  It felt out of place.  Please make a green tea parfait! That would make this place 5 stars! Oh yeah....its not cheap.

Great little place for a flying visit. Ideally situated by bus station. Great coffee, and delicious cakes and treats. I would definitely recommend this café if you want to escape the hustle and bustle of New York City.

I really love the ambiance, and it's been a while since last here so we visited after lunch. We took the filter coffee of the day, but it was sooo strong. The lady offered a softer more chocolaty one which suited us better.

formatted_address: 240 E 75th St, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: B. Cafe

reviews.text: Great food, friendly staff, and the beer selection is incredible. An incredibly wide range if different Belgian ales and ciders. The bar snacks are terrific, the brunch menu is amazing, and the ambiance brings you right to the heart of Belgian tavern culture.

Small bistro-like bar & full restaurant. Accommodating staff, nice selection of food, but limited for vegetarians. Large selection of wines, beers and liquors. Lamb shank was fall-off-the-bone tender. Mussels were good too. Definitely worth trying if you like meats (red & fish).
Got the baked egg special croissant with turkey. Really delicious but cash only!

Really loved the backyard patio! The server was really attentive and quick as well. Our food came pretty quickly. The food was good - I wasn't very satisfied with the french toast as it felt a bit dry to me - I prefer my French toast more moist and fluffy. We got it with ice cream which made it better. The backyard is a lovely space so highly recommend eating out there. Price was just right for the portion and quality of food. Good brunch spot if you're around UES. :)
Quint Belgian restaurant tucked away in the UWS. If you're a fan of beef you should definitely get the carbonnade flamande. Their omelettes aren't bad either.

formatted_address: 33 E 60th St, New York, NY 10065, USA
name: Philippe Chow

reviews.text:
Let me start by saying that Dorin provided 
great service and was very attentive, as well as the rest of the staff. With that being said Philippe's offers overpriced Chinese food that is well prepared with good size portions. The decor is simple in a modern way and  trendy music plays in the background.Highly recommend for lunch!

The place was set up very different from other restaurants. It was pretty cool. Loved the service. I'm only giving it four stars because I truly dislike extremely dark restaurants. That was my ONLY issue. My mom and I went for restaurant week and the portions were big, food was delicious, drinks were amazing. The servers were attentive and friendly.

As mentioned the food is great.  Not sure I liked the upstairs seating.  It's old carpet, narrow stairs and hallway, to get to a small room that's painted red and black.  It just seemed odd and secluded in a not great way.  Would have been nice to be a part of the vibe and ambiance.

So I went to Philippe Chow last night for dinner with my boyfriend. Omg first time there and it won’t be our last. The food was so freaking good. The food arrived quick and hot. My boyfriend also enjoyed his food. Best restaurant ever. I seriously can’t get over how good the food was. I had pork fried rice with spare ribs and broccoli with garlic sauce. I literally just ate the rest of the food and it was even better today. I def recommend everyone to go to this restaurant. You won’t be disappointed and the staff was respectful.

The food is perfectly executed. The sauces are packed full of over the top sweet, savory along with the right amount of spice. The meat is so tender you can eat it with a spoon. I highly recommend taking the trip and enjoying the walk to this place if your in the city.

formatted_address: 540 Park Ave, &, NY 10065, USA
name: The Regency Bar & Grill

reviews.text: It's upmarket, chic, expensive and frequented by famous and infamous guests. Service is friendly, bar has a great range and the food is fantastic. Come during the day for a quiet drink or meal. Evenings it's louder but you can still hear yourself talk. Highly recommended.

Turkey club sounded really good on their menu and when I got it it was 3 layers of bread, turkey, lettuce and tomato and it was very dry. Honestly one of the worst sandwiches I’ve had. I don’t mind paying for food when it actually is quality  but I wouldn’t eat this sandwich again even if it was offered to me for free.  I’ve never been so unhappy paying such a high price for food and I live in NYC! This is literally my first time writing a review but it’s very necessary!
I love food!

I go to this place as a bar only. I know it's also a restaurant, but never eaten there.
As a bar, it's one of my favorite bars in the area. The crowd that frequents is cool. Beautiful people, nice vibe. Like going there whenever I'm in the neighborhood.
Had the burger for brunch, it's very good if you ignore the $32 price tag. Good service. I asked for creamy horseradish and they came up with it just for me. It was deliciousness.

formatted_address: 43 E 30th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Mason Jar NYC

reviews.text: I admire this place! They have great meals, their menu is large, The cook in that place is a professional, I like a lot trying all their food. The dishes are always of high class, the service towards the visitors  is agreeable. I often go to  this restaurant and I was never unsatisfied.  I highly recommend it.
Amazing barbecue and fries!! I would go back in a heartbeat!!! I would recommend this place to everyone, it's a great place for drinks and appetizers!!!
A definite  cowboy country theme.  The music and decor are all country.  A fun atmosphere and good food.

Everyone was very friendly.
Crab cake were on the money.
Grilled chicken sandwich was very good. Tons of French fries.
Buffalo chicken nachos were great.
Atmosphere was relaxing.
Can't wait to go watch Gamecock football there.

I adore this spot! They give first-rate dishes, their menu is large, The cook in that restaurant is a specialist, I enjoy a lot eating all their food. The food is always of high class, the attitude towards the clients  is agreeable. I often eat in this restaurant and I was never unhappy. Highly recommended.

formatted_address: 7 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Metrograph Commissary

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I were looking for a new place to try. I had no idea what to expect, pleasantly surprised by the ambience and food here. If you were just walking by this place, you would not know the inside looked like this. The food here was impressive. Coffee was amazing that I had to have two cups!

Love this place, but I do agree that it's a bit overpriced for the portions and the quality of the food. My recent experience, was not the best. The seared tuna salad was INSANELY salty. I could feel the salt granules on my tongue every time I took a bite. The burrata garnishes are inventive but not necessarily in a good way. Service was fine.

The chimichurri on the steak and eggs is a fresh and lovely complement. The fries were crispy and salty, just the way I like them. The space almost has an outdoor feel with a large skylight in the middle of the floor. But at the same time, a cosy bookstore feel. Nice for brunch, probably not ideal for big groups.
Great food, great service great atmosphere and we will be back for sure. You can tell the head chef here cares about what he/she puts out.

Good weekend brunch set above the theater lobby. It's a good place if you've got time for a meal just before a show. Unfortunately, it's not good enough for me to come back unless I happen to be seeing a show.

formatted_address: 166 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Ferns

reviews.text: Fantastic drinks! I had the Cucumber Collins and my husband had a Moscow Mule - some of the best we’ve had! Cute whimsical atmosphere with a store front that is the its name. A bit of a wait on Saturday night so recommend reservations but overall service was great.

Easily one of my favorite cocktail bars in the city. The decor is super cute, homey & tastefully done. The environment is usually pretty laid back the staff is SUPER considerate. Also, I really enjoy the music played here! 
If you're in LES, 100% go & check this spot out!
Incredibly cute, great for conversation as the music isn’t loud and they have great happy hour!

I absolutely love the vibe at FERNS. I'm probably biased since I live in the area, but it's one of my go-to places when I need a chill vibe with good food. Try their chicken sandwich or burrata appetizer. Can't go wrong with their Happy Hour deals either.

Reviewing as a bar, did not eat here. Oddly enough haven’t been here before but the vibe is great quirky decor with plants, many framed pictures and stringed lights. Small but good selection of drinks in a cozy environment

formatted_address: 49 Clinton St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Azasu

reviews.text: The place was great. Food was good. The hotpot was really good for cold nights. The mackerel dish was really awesome! We will definitely be back.
Such an amazing spot! Great prices too! Food was so yummy! I'll be back again!!
Very delicious. Ordered the chicken karage, BBQ pork belly, and the yakisoba.

Got the salt broth hotpot. The flavors are nice and subtle and not too overpowering. You grind your own sesame at the beginning of the meal and the leftover broth at the end is used to cook a rice meal. The food was great but the only downside is you have to wait maybe 10min for the hotpot to boil and the food to be cooked.
The location is very casual and easy, staff are friendly and helpful - the hot pot bowl is amazing!! Broth is good, the food is of excellent quality.. would highly recommend

formatted_address: 229 W 28th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Mission NYC

reviews.text: No problem getting in w my non asian friends. Bouncer let us in early cause it’s cold out. Awesome

One of the worst clubbing experiences in my life. Arrived at the club around 1am and it was absolutely empty outside. When we went in, the dance floor is almost half empty and all the tables were vacant. The DJ only played EDM the whole night and the overall vibe was not there because people were not dancing. There was no variation in music and servers were rather rude. 2 hours in and an Asian bouncer asked  my friend to leave because he was wearing sweatpants but he didn’t say anything when we went in. I was also wearing a cap and he told me that I had to check it in when a lot of people in the club are also wearing caps. We protested and asked if we could stay if we change but they kicked us out rudely. The Asian bouncer even threw our hats and jacket on the street while shouting. We saw the bouncer also kick other people out who were already in because of their “dress code”. Definitely would not recommended and really hope this place dies soon.
Never been here, but wanted to give them 1 star and write a review. Why? Cos I am bored and I have nothing to do. Based on the review I read, this place deserves it.
The worst place to hang out, Korean guys working there need to learn how to speak and learn to respect.....

Discriminates against ethnicities other than Oriental Asian. One of my friend got rejected for "dress code" because he was wearing a plaid shirt and another friend was charged double for cover charge even though I paid for 3 bottle service.

formatted_address: 557 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Hendriks

reviews.text: Great menu, nice and cozy place. Reasonably priced. The French onion soup was pretty good overall however I was expecting more cheese that covers the bowl rather than the bread.

Last night was our third time here and it was extremely disappointing. I doubt we’ll be back. The waiter was inattentive, and had no sense of urgency for our table or any others. While the appetizer (arancini) was tasty, the dinners were unimpressive. Our table was missing a fork and we had to ask for one and later a steak knife when we got our dinner. My husband was halfway through his steak before we finally got the knife. To top it off, the steak was ordered medium but came out well done and the potato was very dry. We got the impression that maybe they don’t sell a lot of the steak dishes. We appreciated the food runner, who was pleasant and seemed to genuinely take pride in his work. And for a restaurant that is trying to be a little more high end, I was surprised when they took our used forks off our appetizer plates and back on the table for our dinner instead of replacing them. Dirty glasses remained on the table even after ordering and receiving a second round of drinks. Truly disappointing.
Amazing food with a casual decor. A bit pricey but it's worth it.
Great restaurant for large and small group dinners. A great menu and the chef cooks to perfection.  Service is excellent too.  Highly recommend Hendricks if you're in the Big Apple. Cheers!

Excellent Experience. Went there recently for my sister-in-law's birthday. It was wonderful. Creative cocktails, attentive service, delicious food. The group was a mix of adventurous and pedestrian eaters, and there was something on the menu for everyone (all of it good!). I had the rosemary gnocchi and I'm definitely going back to have it again. Also wholeheartedly recommend the chai old-fashioned. Clever and delicious.  The space is beautiful (rustic chic) and they were busy, but the business just worked to create a lively and fun atmosphere without it feeling loud or intrusive. Loved it!

formatted_address: 147-129 Stewart Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11237, USA
name: The Kings Hall

reviews.text:
Big warehouse with no soul. Sounds system not A+.
Not enough bathrooms for the amount of people.
Drinks ridiculously over priced. $11 for Peroni $18 for a shot of Jager + tips. Plus party cover charge. They have a bracelet system or you can pay cash. Mandotory coat check!!
Coat check, bartenders and security staff were all friendly. Street parking only. Area looks shady. I was worried for my car. Would problably never return.

Their security runs the place like a bunch of Natzis

If I could give this place no stars I would!
Awesome venue

formatted_address: 964 Lexington Ave #5023, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: East Pole Fish

reviews.text: Friendly staff... atmosphere deluxe... lighting perfect..drinks and food combined for a wonderful experience...
Had a great impromptu business dinner here. The food and service were excellent. The space was a bit cramped - but not too bad for Manhattan I guess.
The service is constantly prompt, lovely vibes, kind staff members. Will visit again when I am nearby.

Came here on the 2nd day of service! It was packed. But the food and service was excellent! Booths are a bit small for a group but great for 2-3 people. They have tables in the front and back. Good place to have a fun romantic meal.
Nice space. Really had a great time with my friends. Thank you for great service!

formatted_address: 146 W 47th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: The Long Acre Tavern

reviews.text: The long acre burger is a must try, very delicious. Chef Lee, thank you for the great menu variety and great dishes. The staff are wonderful and friendly.

Surprised to find this place just around the corner. Just walked in with friends just to unwind after work. Well the food was really good, we has the cauliflower the soft pretzel with mustard,  so good.  The service was really good.

Came here to watch El clasico match last minute due to Smithfield Hall being full. I was not sure what to expect but to my surprise this place is very modern, tv galore and has ample seating options (bar, tables, booth, high tops). We sat at a table in the back room and had our own personal tv to watch the game which was amazing. We ordered the jumbo pretzel, BBQ boneless wings, BBQ regular chicken wings, and the loaded tater tots. The food was delicious BBQ on wings was on the sweet side which is my personal preference and meat was juicy and portion was more then enough for one person. Tater tots were my favorite nice golden crunchy exterior loaded with beer cheese bacon and scallions, great dish to share with 2-3 people. The pretzel looked good but tasted like cardboard and beer cheese was not hot enough, would skip. They had an extensive alcohol menu and service was very friendly and attentive. All together tab was fair for amount of food and quality and tip was included so make sure you read the receipt. Would come back with a group of friends to watch any sporting event, as for FC Barcelona games it definitely does not compare to Smithfield Hall when it comes to the vibe and can base but overall still a solid neutral bar to watch soccer and other sports.

The waiter was super attentive. Our drinks and appetizer (Sesame Cauliflower) were great. I had the Warm Winter Sangria and my friend had Polar Express-O. We didn't feel rushed to make a decision or to order more drinks, granted we were there on a Tuesday night. I would definitely go back.

Close enough to times Sq it’s convenient and far enough off the corner it’s hidden enough to not be overran with the bright yellow m&m bag toting tourists. 

I also get the feeling there are a lot of cooked reviews. That said the food is very good. Drinks are below average, they are not putting proper amounts of booze in their drinks. Very weak. That alone will keep me from coming back. My biggest thing is when price point doesn’t meet the experience. 

The place lacks its identity and being where it is - not in the best location, I sure hope it does okay. The buildout is nicely done and you can tell there is some decent money backing this bar. Unfortunately living 2 blocks west from it, I had no idea they existed until I happened to walk by. Judging by a 70% empty restaurant on a Friday night, i am not alone. 

I really want to love this spot. It’s missing something... not sure what it is. Maybe it’s brand identity- what is it that makes this place unique? Not sure. Kudos for being super super clean and tidy all around. Much appreciated.

formatted_address: 462 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Jin Ramen

reviews.text: On par with ramen I’ve had in Tokyo. Staff is exceptionally good as well. Highly recommended.
This ramen spot was delicious. All of the ramen that we ordered were super flavor and the broths were very rich. My favorite part was the pork. I would highly recommend coming here

Best Noodle Shop In All Of Manhattan

This is an awesome place. The food is amazing and the service is spectacular. The prices are also pretty decent for Manhattan. Our location is just down the road from them and we are regulars. We've been going here for years and have never had a disappointing experiences.
My first time at a real ramen place and it was delicious. My father took me here and has been to several and said this is right up there with the best. Good service and food recommend for sure

I often take my friends to this restaurant with my warmest recommendations. I go their often. This recommendation is always successful. The meals are yummy and the crew is generous and cooperative. Whenever we go to this place we pass a delightful evening.  highly recommended.

formatted_address: 53 W 21st St #3, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Midtown Karaoke Inc

formatted_address: 229 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Pomodoro Rosso

reviews.text:
I stumbled on this gem while exploring the streets around Central Park and I'm so happy I did. It's such a charming Italian restaurant with the taste of Nonna's cooking. 
The service was excellent as well.
Highly recommend to go and enjoy the wonderful atmosphere, paired with mouth watering food.

Impeccable service, wonderful ambiance, plates taste as they are supposed to. Beautiful house wine and homemade dessert. What a wonderful place to have an early dinner before your evening concert or show at the Lincoln Center.
Absolutely wonderful dinner! Although my cousin & I could've ordered just one dinner & split it, it was huge! The staff was amazing! So very friendly & welcoming.
Delicious Italian food. I had to force myself to eat the pasta because the chicken parmesan was that good! I didn't want to stop eating it. Great service and atmosphere.
Very Italian! Huge portions, delicious food, cozy atmosphere

formatted_address: 394 Court St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Fragole

reviews.text: I had occasion to dine at Fragole 15 years ago and it was so memorable that I recommended the place for a recent dinner with some friends. Food and wine selection and quality, charming atmosphere, friendly and efficient service and price all add up to great value.  Looking forward to my next terrific meal!

Loved the place from the moment we were seated. The whole staff was really nice and friendly, they did their best to make us feel welcomed and we did. The food was delicious and came out perfectly timed after appetizers. I found out that the bread and the pasta is all made from scratch there, and that itself speaks a lot about the height quality of the food here.  The ambiance overall is warm and homey, a must visit for anyone that lives close enough.

This is my favourite Italian restaurant in Downtown Brooklyn with a pasta dish that I'm convinced has crack in it, it is that good. 

Fragole is fairly new and if you were looking for an Italian restaurant in the Court St area, I so very recommend this place. The owner is hands on and takes so much pride in his restaurant. The vibe is rustic and homely, welcoming you like an Italian grandma. 

I have many a favorite dish here but the one I truly love, the one I get multiple times, the one I can eat seconds and thirds of is the Rigatoni Bolognese. There is something inside that just gives me all kinds of feels in my mouth I cannot describe it, you must try it for yourself. 

But if I were honest, every dish I've tried here has been phenomenal. A hidden gem would be exactly what I'd describe Fragole as. I do recommend their brunch menu too. Both, the sweet and savory options have been lovely. 

The prices are fair and if you're driving, there are metered spots right outside. Mmmm, now I'm hungry for some pasta.

Perfect neighborhood spot with fresh pasta and red sauce.

Highly recommend looking at the daily specials. When we last went was a spinach tagliatelle with meatballs. 

has a great spice to it if you are looking for spicy.

If you are looking for a fresh pasta tasty red sauce with service that makes you feel like a regular then you will love it!

Charming and quaint Italian restaurant in Carroll Gardens serving delicious food that has been consistent for the last 5 years.  They are back to serving wine after forgetting to renew their liquor license a year ago so this has become my new favorite neighborhood joint!   Just enjoyed a great lunch last week and was back for dinner yesterday.  The pasta with eggplant was delicious as was the mushroom polenta.  Go go go!

formatted_address: 135 W 41st St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Promtix

formatted_address: 211 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Distilled

reviews.text: Came for brunch while visiting a friend, he recommended it. Atmosphere is really cool, has really nice open layout too. Lot of interesting stuff on the menu, ended up getting the chicken and cornbread waffles. They were AWESOME. Didn't even take a pic because I was so hungry and they smelled so good. I was not disappointed. Drinks were on point too, service was quick and friendly. Overall great spot!
Delicious but small portions
Didn't try the food but Great service and nice wine. A little overpriced for my expectations but it is Tribeca I guess?

Ordered the chicken and waffles. Chicken was overly salty and had way too thick of breading. Waffles were okay but far too oily. Barely any maple syrup served with the dish. Bacon is thin and overly crispy. Other dishes might be good, but I don't recommend chicken and waffles here
This place make seriously crafted drinks. The two we selected we're delicious. It does get pretty noisy as there is no sound absorption.

formatted_address: 372 5th Ave, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: 372 5 Ave Owners Inc

reviews.text: Best karaoke bar in the city!  New owners but same great time!  The staff is attentive, fair and very friendly. The wait for a song can get long but the talent on the stage helps pass the time! Bring your cash, because you will want to stay awhile!

One block north of the Empire State Building, 372 Fifth Avenue can be seen as part of Murray Hill or as part of the Garment District / Fashion District.  The apartments are extremely unusual, many with huge sleeping lofts of 200 sq feet or more, some with private rooftop areas.  The value-for-the-money in this building is amazing.  The shopping, walk to Grand Central Terminal and Penn Station, parks, museums: Everything Manhattan has to offer is either walking distance or just a short subway ride away.

formatted_address: 300 W 43rd St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: promnightlife

formatted_address: 339 9th St, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Dram Shop

reviews.text: Great place for burger or brunch, kid friendly

Best no frills burger in Brooklyn and half price on Tuesdays is a dangerous combination.  Bartenders are nice, sports are on if you are into that. Music is 90's AF, pretty sure I have heard Alice in chains would every time I have been in there.

Good place to go and watch the game. Appetizers were decent, and the beer selection was good. Service was the high point, the staff were very attentive.

A good middle of the road sports bar in a neighborhood that doesn't seem to have many
Such a homely feel to this bar, staff was super friendly and burgers n beers were great! Highly recommend ♡

The food here is great. The drinks even better, string and well made. The vibe good. Definitely a great hangout spot. My only problem is that I made an obvious error filling out my cc receipt and when I contacted the bar to rectify it, they promised to call back and never did. I haven't been back since.there are too many bars in NYC to put up with stuff like that. It's the only reason I haven't been back.

formatted_address: 108 E 38th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Rossini's

reviews.text: Was craving Italian food mostly pasta, and came across this place just wandering around.  It didn't look busy from the outside but as you walk deeper into the restaurant the tables were all filled from the back.  The manager greeted us as soon as we walked in. The wait staff was attentive.  My pasta craving satisfied. I had a gnocchi and our table shared the artichoke appetizer and a bottle of wine. It was a Monday night, we didn't have a reservation and there was no wait.

I went there during festive season which means clouded people there. But our order came pretty fast. The atmosphere is very nice making me feel like in ‘God Father’ movie. Service is very professional but yet friendly. For the food, we order 3 starters and 3 main dishes. I ordered mussel  and seafood risotto. The seafood is so fresh and it tastes excellent.
Unexpectedly good Italian American restaurant.  The swordfish was excellent,  great service and the opera singers are a pleasant addition. Not cheap but worth the money.

Amazing authentic Italian cuisine in the heart of midtown. If you're looking for the old New York family style restaurant, you will love Rossini’s. The food is delicious and best part was the live opera music. Great service, and warm atmosphere.
Always great with an amazing processional staff.  Go to this locals spot in Murray Hill and you won't be disappointed.  Avoid the tourist spots that charge a lot and serve marginal food.

formatted_address: 145 S 4th St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Marcola’s House

formatted_address: 2867 Broadway, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: The Heights Bar & Grill

reviews.text: I came for happy hour with a group of folks on the weekend. We were seated pretty quickly and attended to shortly. There are various options depending on what you’re in the mood for. The food is definitely a bit over priced for what you get though. I got the tacos and it didn’t even come with a side of rice and beans, that was separate and it wasn’t very filling. Other folks got the nachos which seemed to be good. The drinks were also okay, the margaritas are delicious. If you go with a large party be mindful that they are only willing to accept 3 cards which was pretty annoying.
Really delicious food. The steak is always juicy and flavorful. The fries are crisp. Even the side salad is great.

You can’t beat their happy hour (4-7pm).  Delicious food - try the San Francisco sauce on the chicken tender (a mix of buffalo and honey mustard - yummmm). Close to Columbia and the rooftop is awesome in warmer months.

Great spot for American type cuisine. Perfect for Friday afternoon Happy Hour! We have been going here for years. The outdoor seating is pretty awesome. Great spot to celebrate parties and special events.

It’s an ok establishment with a decent menu , I think the service was very mediocre and could use some improvement. The food was delicious and portion size was spot on ! The drinks were blah at one point I swear I brought just a glass of tomato juice instead of an actual Bloody Mary . Would probably return as a last resort and didn’t want to travel too far south .

formatted_address: 452 Washington St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: GRECA

reviews.text: Great place. Atmosphere was good. Great services. My friend suggested this place. Staff were nice and greeted us very well. I went there for first time. Great experience.  Drinks was good.

Very nice place. 
Coffee was ok.  
And it was one of the best avocado toast I ever had. 
The decoration is very beautiful and original.  You can bring your laptop and work here.
Really cute cafe and lunch spot!  Love stopping here for coffee in the morning, everyone is so friendly. Great lunch options, my favorite are the fish tacos!

What a superb little find. Just drive by and stopped to grab a coffee but ended up chilling in the lounge to some great authentic Greek vibes and Greek coffee and some appetizers. Great friendly staff and really cool atmosphere
Great staff they were all attentive and quick the place is also so cute and cozy love coming here on weekends and just chill.

formatted_address: 5 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Boulton & Watt

reviews.text: Awesome brunch, tons of options! Really delicious food, great service. Likely one of the best brunches I have had in a while. Very vegetarian friendly, open, clean bathrooms! Their pancakes were yum, though I am not a pancake person usually. I would absolutely be back!
Went here on a Saturday for brunch. Luckily it was not crowded and we got a table immediately. The staff was warm and welcoming and very friendly. Food arrived promptly and was delicious.

Our server was AMAZING. Came on a crazy snow day and our group sat by the window. The vibes were great. Pickle back shots were good. Cocktails yummy. Especially the tequila Negroni style cocktail. Giving 4 stars because the fish & chips were very skimpy on the fish. Fries were good. Chicken pot pie was yummy, hot and HUGE.

Came here for brunch with some friends. The service was a bit slow and the food was ok - not my favorite but not bad. I got the eggs Benedict that came with potatoes, which was okay - not my favorite eggs Benedict I’ve ever had — I’m currently searching for the best benedict in NYC, and this would not rank in my top out of others I’ve had. Also, the Mimosas were sadly flat (not sure where the bubbles went?) 

I did like the ambiance, however, which was spacey and had large windows that can be opened giving a nice outside-inside vibe. 

Additionally, the waitress accidentally spilled water on my boyfriend when serving our water... 😪 not a huge deal but... the overall service was a bit slow and it was hard to get the attention of our waitress/other servers when asking for more syrup/ketchup/other condiments. Once we did tell them, it took a while to bring it out. 

Sadly will most likely not return.

Came in for dinner had the burrata and the "spaghetti with meat balls" all dishes were vegetarian and it was delicious. Both dishes were very tasty and fresh, my fabulous was that i was able to eat a meal and have no regrets.

formatted_address: 321 9th St, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Pitas and Sticks

reviews.text: Sooo glad we tried pitas and sticks .my boyfriend and I went the day after new years and enjoyed it very much .  Authentic style Greek / American food which was served fresh and tasty. The service was great  and the waitress was sweet .  The place is clean and very nicely styled.  Portions are decent sized , and the food was made to order.  All the ingredients were fresh as well.  They serve Greek beers , and American beers and wines , coffees teas and started our order with a nice glass bottle of water which I thought was a very nice touch .  Definitely a place worth going on a date night or just a quiet evening..we will definitely be  back . Thank you

This is excellent food, excellent service. The Spanikopita is fabulous, the lamb is a very high quality, and the pitas are well balanced and flavorful. Best Greek food in Brooklyn, hands down. Dine in is fun, too. We love it all, but the lamb sticks are a delicious bargain.
This place has fresh, delicious Greek food and friendly service.  I love the calamari and the octopus with a big Greek salad. Everything is made on demand,  so it's a lot like home cooking.

If i could, i would give this place 3.5 stars.  My lamb platter was pretty good, so i will round up.  My daughter had the chicken which she did not care for.  I would go here again, but you can do better if you go into the city.  Wife did like the lemon potatoes.  Like most small places, they don't give enough pita.

Real time Greek food for real time people. Pita and sticks is the truth when it comes to Greek cuisine. They ain’t gonna do you wrong. The tzechi (spelling) sauce is top 5 in NYC and made right. The staff - friendly. The food - amazing. The tables - standard. You go here they’re gonna make sure you leave happy. 

DIZZZZZURT. Dessert is clutch here too. Dunno if they have dessert on their normal menu, but they had it on a special and it was pretty dang amazin

formatted_address: 8 E 36th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Slattery's Midtown Pub

reviews.text: If you haven't visited Slattery's Pub in Midtown NYC, you haven't experienced true Irish hospitality!  Great atmosphere, staff and service!  The food and drinks are just as good.  I have had many group functions here and they take care of their customers.  Highly recommended if you want a private party or just to grab a bite in your busy day.  Lovely pub!

Typical Irish Bar in midtown. It’s my go to place for a drink or 2 when biz is slow. The $12 lunch special is a good deal considering the area. There are many TV’s on the wall with various sporting events. Is it my imagination or is there a soccer game being played somewhere in the world 24/7? 
In addition, Emma (the daytime bartender is great) fast efficient and friendly! John Taffer would be proud!

Large food portions. Tap and bottled beer list is unimaginative. Ambiance, particularly on the second floor balcony is amazing and makes the whole experience. Food was above average for a pub. Service was borderline atrocious. Initial server gave us menus and never came back. We had to then track down another server, who while very friendly, was almost nearly as unattentive as the first server. Food prices were reasonable, particularly for the large portions.
Service was excellent, friendly attentive bartender, prompt service, very happy staff. really good onion rings. good soups.  They have a nice balcony
I love this venue very much. It has a very nice ambiance. The cuisine is splendid. the service is powerful and the personel is well trained. The cost is honest. deeply recommend.

formatted_address: 335 Bowery, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: The Bowery Hotel

reviews.text: Went here with a group of friends to experience New York and see Hamilton. I have to say that I'm very impressed with the price for the amount of amenities that we got. I felt like I was staying in an upscale old fashioned speakeasy. The layout of the room was fun because I could be taking a bath while my wife was in bed and we could be chatting. We got our own little private balcony which we played the card games on and got a real authentic New York experience. if I ever go back I just want to stay here again because it felt so cool.

Just met some friends here for tea. Great place to do that . All class. Doorman on point with a cool vibe and big presence. 
Great relaxed decor with that old classic feel. Good drinks . Haven't stayed .Haven't dined . Nothing beats hanging out on  Bowery ave. I need to revisit. But so far I'm saying thumbs up.

A MUST STAY! I used to stay at the plaza, after my 4 day trip to NYC, this is the ONLY hotel I will ever stay at when visiting for work again! Andre is simply the epitome of customer service! Extremely detail oriented, Kyle was wonderful! From check-in to check-out, including Michael!!!
We loved the lobby bar and the room service menu is like eating in a boho chic restaurant late night. We also adored the manager who has been there for 15 years! Don’t stay anywhere else! Loved loved loved!

I actually live in the neighborhood, and face the backside of the hotel. I explored the hotel last week and it looks very posh, but I don’t really have a reason to stay there since I live so close by.
I came here with some friends and I loved it. The ambiance was great. Vintage Hotel, Good cocktails, spacious rooms and awesome food.

formatted_address: 154 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Surya

reviews.text: Delicious food, great lunch deal! Would definitely go back to try more dishes. Got too excited to take a picture of the entree, but managed to snap a pic of two of the appetizers.

I woke up craving biryani for a late lunch. After a quick search, I decided to try Surya and was pleased. The food was delicious with portion size just right for my party of 3. There was no wait for a table and the staff was friendly. Not pictured is the chicken biryani and spinach dish we order to go with the tandoori chicken (which is among the best I've had yet).

Solid all around Indian cuisine. My fiancé had a very nice tomato soup my mulligatawny soup was also quite nice. We liked the chili garlic shrimp starter as well as our main courses, the butter chicken and the lamb chettinad. The standout was the rich flavor of the tomato soup, other than that we were generally happy with the food but nothing else stood out considering the prices, which were a little above average I’d say for this cuisine.

Great Indian food.  And the naan is awesome.  Had a fantastic Christmas Eve dinner with family.  Portions were perfect, with little left over.  This is our go to Indian on the island and live way uptown.  Worth a trip.

Got a voucher for this place. The drinks were pretty well made. The service as well matched, nice people. The food although now a lot had good flavor. Would def recommend to anyone seeking an Indian restaurant in manhattan.

formatted_address: 207 W 14th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Coppelia

reviews.text:
A longtime favorite and mainstay of Mew York City. This is where I go when I want comfort food in a lively environment. 

Sometimes you have to wait for a table but it’s well worth it. The cocktails are good, the tequila list is probably the best diner menu ever, and the food is always consistent. The empanadas are one of my favorite starters (so crispy and flavorful) and everything I’ve tried there in the last few years had been consistently delightful. 

The waiters work hard and do a great job serving everyone in the place. Seeing them take care of everyone so quickly and seamlessly is inspiring.

One of my favorite restaurants in the city that I’ll always be coming back to. I’ve been coming here since 2018 and the food is always on point. It can get busy during the evenings but it’s well worth the wait. The hours are perfect if you’re out late at night and need something good to eat. I highly recommend!

Two days. Two different experiences as a first timer. 
When you go you want the service provided by Pedro [all day] He's attentive and detail oriented. Got the steak and eggs with beans and rice. I did not like the steak. I'd recommend getting eggs over medium. The coffee was good and I sat at a table.

The next day I went for Brunch again but I sat at the back counter. Roberto was my busy waiter. Hot tip don't sit at back counter where Roberto easily forgets about you as he serves cocktails shaken and not stirred.  I asked for coffee 3 times seeking a hot cup. Third time was a charm coupled with the fact the milk was also served Hot. That was a bonus.
Got plantain and the eggs Benedict which was good. Roberto being busy left me asking the collection of staff happily engaging with each other around the back counter for help. The competition for attention was slow and felt a little reluctant. But I worked it out.
Lesson learned I know how to navigate for a food related win the next time I come back
CHEERS

The interior is great, squished but intimate too. The food is delicious and there's always something new that's I've never had before. I highly recommend the pancakes, the ones I got had mango in them. They're not too fluffy either. I didn't like the syrup, it was definitely fake.

The food was tasty. I got the blue corn pancakes. Other people in my party said that their items were pretty good. If you were really hungry, I would recommend ordering 2 items off the menu because the portions are not the biggest. I'd also recommend going with 5 or less people because the seats are tight especially when youre wearing winter coats.

formatted_address: 85 10th Avenue Entrance on 15th St and, 11th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Toro NYC

reviews.text: Great place with some pretty unique tapas plates  - the workers are all very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu items. The cocktail options are pretty unique and creative as well. Overall was a great experience, definitely recommend if it fits your price range.
Kitchen bar is where you can see all the action. Staff are super friendly. Food is great. Perfect place for gathering and romantic dinner

We had our holiday party here and it did not disappoint. Huge menu and everything was delicious. The bottle list was very well done but the glass list was lacking. We went on a Thursday night after 8pm and we were all surprised at how quiet it was.

What a fantastic meal!  Great space accompanied by very good tapas.  The staff was exceptional at handling my gluten allergy.  I found many options to eat and they worked to make it the best experience possible.  The octopus was very good and the trotter was a definite must order.
Some food was spot on, while some missed slightly. Overall good with great service and a cool vibe. A nice fit for younger, pretty people.

formatted_address: 967 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: Bella Blu

reviews.text: I admire this restaurant! They give high class food, their menu is varied, The chef in that restaurant is a real pro, I like very much trying all their dishes. The dishes are consistently fresh, the service towards the visitors  is good. I often go to  this restaurant and I was never disappointed. Highly recommended.

Bella Blu is an excellent Italian restaurant with attention to detail, delicious food and an extensive wine menu. It's a little noisy but to be expected because it is very popular. A bit high priced but what you would anticipate for a restaurant of such high quality.

The whole experience was awesome.  From the quality of the food, to the professional European style service.  I was especially impressed that our waiter was knowledgeable about wine quality...and when I mentioned our first bottle was on the verge of being corked he checked it himself, verified I was correct and whisked it and our glasses away to replace it with a good bottle and clean glasses.  Such a great UES NYC experience.
Ingredients were fresh and cooked well. You get better attention if you speak Italian, one sure sign of authenticity. Expensive.

The whole experience was awesome.  From the quality of the food, to the professional European style service.  I was especially impressed that our waiter was knowledgeable about wine quality...and when I mentioned our first bottle was on the verge of being corked he checked it himself, verified I was correct and whisked it and our glasses away to replace it with a good bottle and clean glasses.  Such a great UES NYC experience.

formatted_address: 239 West 4th Street, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Fedora

reviews.text: What sold me on Fedora was the super cool bartender.  She had a great presence which made you feel at home.  And this restaurant has a neighborhood feel.  I arrived on an “off the menu” night and tried the pork belly with white beans.  It was more of a stew in the end.  Overall, the flavor was good.  The chef brought out a liver pate tostado which set a good tone.  Staff knew the wines and the entire experience was enjoyable.  Fedora is worth a visit.

4.5 rating. Additional pictures/video and commentary captured on our food blog on Instagram @FoodVibesNYC.

Solid comfort food plus with a very west village vibe.  Loud and proud, local, small menu but all options are tasty. Standout was the scallop crudo but daurade and chicken were tasty.  Cocktails are special. 
4.5 food
4.5 service 
4.5 atmosphere which is casual west village in small space feel. Down a few steps.  buzzy. Great option to eat at bar. 
4.5 menu options. 
Lot to do around the restaurant. Love walking this area before dinner.

Such a cool bar/restaurant! Really interesting cocktails and drinks menu, with a great selection of food that is very tasty and we'll prepared. The wait staff are excellent; making funny and interesting conversation, without being obtrusive. The setting is lovely too - low lighting and intimate, not too big, and not too loud. I really enjoyed it here, and highly recommend visiting.
Excellent food and staff went out of their way to make us feel “at home” very friendly, great spot
Awesome service and delicious food, small menu but hits the spot. Very energetic place, nicely decorated. Great for couples or small groups.

formatted_address: 505 St Marks Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11238, USA
name: Goose Lodge

reviews.text: Great venue.
Really funny

formatted_address: 773 Coney Island Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11218, USA
name: 773 Lounge

reviews.text: Great local bar. Prices are very reasonable. The chicken wings are great some of the best in Brooklyn. Crispy with great sauce. The atmosphere is really chill and welcoming.

Great place, good service, fair prices..

The honey mustered as seen on picture was the most delicious ever had.
Decent beer selection, but excellent, excellent wings. I grew up in Buffalo, and so did the lead cook. I would vouch for these wings as completely authentic.
Best bar to hangout with friends. Great drink specials and food. Weekly fun events as well.

Great wings, chill place and enough whiskey to drown out the karaoke night we walked into on Saturday. Prices are reasonable and compared to the nearby flower shop they're even cheap. Generally good music and they have live music some nights as well. Can get loud which can be good or bad depending on your mood and intention.

formatted_address: W 33rd St, New York, NY 10119, USA
name: Local NYC

reviews.text: Nice location for a drink with friends before or after an event nearby. The goat cheese salad was very tasty! The bar staff is friendly and fast. I’d recommend sitting at the bar if you are pressed for time. Although there are tables, the waitstaff seems limited.

Great food, friendly staff and good service. I love their selection of craft beers, on-tap beers and cocktails. The outdoor area is good, with views of the always busy Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. Always a good place to go for bar food and drinks with friends!
I LOVE THE ATMOSPHERE.  THE PRICES ARE REASONABLE.  THE ROOFTOP BAR IS GREAT.  I would give it a 5 but the tap beer on the rooftop is only lukewarm.
Great location. Prices are high. Food is ok. Drinks are actually reasonable

The Girl at the door was so welcoming.She stayed super friendly and helpful throughout our visit, checking on us and others even though it was really busy. The dink’s it was very good. Great place and awesomely visited. Parking is not easy. Nearby the Postal Office and the Penn Station , many chance the traveling far or the closer....

formatted_address: 130 W 47th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Tender Steak & Sushi

reviews.text: Really good food. Everyone in our party of 6 enjoyed their entrees which included pasta, sushi, steak and sandwiches. It was a business lunch and we weren't rushed either which was appreciated. Unfortunately for part of the 2 hours we were there with our client it was quite noisy and so conversations were strained. Also this place is really known for steak and sushi but if that's not your preference you can get fish or chicken or salads.

Overall, a delicious dinner. The wait staff was very attentive throughout the night. Cocktails were excellent. At first I thought a Caesar salad with a fried egg was strange, but I thought wrong. The Tender roll was incredible. Girlfriend had the filet which was tender and delicious. Topped everything off with a slice of cheesecake.

What an amazing meal, we took a chance stopped by and they definitely exceeded my expectations. We both had filets perfectly cooked how we asked. The sushi was delicious and truffle fries were great love when they're smaller shoe string cuts. Macaroni and cheese? Cooked hot and fresh what more can you ask for. The service was great and since we were staying at the hotel we even got 15% off so definitely was a pleasant night out. Thank you again.

I didn't make reservations but they accommodated me at their lounge area which was very mellow and and quiet. Staff was friendly and nice food was great 👍 chicken tenders & tender burger highly recommended it was delicious 😋
Chic interior, couldn't leave without a bunch of photos. Very helpful and kind staff, top-notch service. EVERYONE WAS DELIGHTED!

formatted_address: 48 E 23rd St, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: SPiN New York

reviews.text:
My boyfriend and I love playing ping pong in each city we travel to. New york is no different. We found this GEM! The entire atmosphere was amazing. Well lit areas so you could actually play ping pong. Great set up!
The employees were so friendly and helpful. Bar and bar food.
Loved all of their wall art. You have got to check it out for yourself!!!

Fun ping pong games with great foods+drinks in a cool place - that's something nice to do once in a while with your colleagues. Servers are very friendly, washrooms are clean, and just right next to train 6. Perfect place

Very cool place, very spacious with nice food and drinks! Cool option to hangout with friends. It is difficult to find a Ping pong table available so book it ahead online... unfortunately you can only book it for one hour, so my suggestion is: use two different accounts and reserve at least two hours!

My husband and I went to Spin in San Francisco during our honeymoon a few years ago and had an amazing time. This year, I decided to host his birthday party at Spin in NYC and boy, am I glad I did. First of all, Jenny M., the party coordinator, is an angel! She was so sweet and communicative! The original weekend we had planned for the party, it was snowing in the NJ county where my friends were coming from. Despite the fact that it was definitely not going to be bad in NYC, Jenny let us switch the weekend and was so understanding. 

The day of the party, the staff was super kind and attentive. They treated everybody in my party with kindness and respect. We chose to extend the party for another hour because everyone was having so much fun. The drinks were great, the music was great, and the ambiance is so cool. I can’t recommend Spin enough and I would host another party here in a heartbeat!!

Located in the basement. Very convenient since you don't have to walk around and pick up your balls. They had a basket full of ping pong balls next to each table. Staff also walks around and pick up the balls on the ground. I liked the inside decorations. They also had a bar.

formatted_address: 302 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: L'Accolade

reviews.text: We decided to stop by for the happy hour and enjoyed it enough to stay for dinner. The staff were welcoming and gave us some good recommendations - highlights include the Arctic char, gnocchi and duck. Paired with a well rounded selection of wines and desert made this a delicious meal! A great addition to the neighborhood and we'll be back!

Had a nice dinner here with a friend. The wine list is definitely worth exploring. They offer a generous happy hour which makes a visit very much worth it. Food was innovative but very much French, and flavorful! The cooks definitely know what they’re doing. Atmosphere is very cozy, you can hide in here from life in New York with a glass of wine and good French food.

I first time there and it is really good !! 
Don't have a lot on the menu because they don't want to have too much and want to focus on the quality. And they do it very well !
Gnocci are delicious, braised endives are tasty, chicken is tender all the way (with the really good aligot) and the duck was perfectly cooked with a crusty skin... Really good !! 
Wine list is good too ! You can try some of them before choosing.
And service is really great ! Well welcomed !
I totally recommend it !! 👍🏼

What a wonderful addition to the west village restaurant scene! Friendly staff, fast and attentive service. Most importantly, the food is AMAZING. Their menu is concise but everything we tried was cooked perfectly. Seared duck breast was to die for, monkfish dish was light, flavorful and I would actually recommend it for an appetizer rather than the main course. Chicken breast was so juicy and cheese mashed potatoes it came with was just decadent! I am so glad i got to try it before it becomes too popular and too crowded and too difficult to get a reservation at:))

From the food, to the service and passing by the drinks, l’Accolade does it right. The subtle hits of French are done just right, from the relatively newfound French passion for natural and orange wines, to the modern approach of the menu, this spot is a must-visit. And to make an even more convincing case: there’s a happy hour...on Saturday’s!

formatted_address: 225 W 39th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Times Square New Years Eve

reviews.text: Busy

Un lugar hermoso que sin duda alguna, vale la pena visitar si se tiene la oportunidad. 
Gran variedad de comercios al rededor de este y gente de todos lados en cantidad.

formatted_address: 1 Little W 12th St, New York, NY 10014, USA
