name: Velvet Rope NY

reviews.text: Great food. Awesome staff. Good music selection. Perfect location =D.

formatted_address: 100 Park Ave, New York, NY 10017, USA
name: 2beans

reviews.text: Solid spot for a coffee or drink. I usually get a latte, but the iced frappes are nice and light, too. I’ve also been here to get a box of fancy chocolates to give as a gift — they’re a bit expensive, but look beautiful and are tasty.
Had a great cup of maple cinnamon coffee while meeting briefly for work. Enjoyed the cozy upstairs area. Conveniently rt off Park Ave a block from Grand Central. Not crowded in mid-afternoon.

Beautifully presented latte in a nice white mug with little dark chocolate. However the taste was lacking. Also, on Saturday, when we visited, there was no milk out if you need to add extra. The place is beautiful with nice tables alongside the wall, by the windows and in upstairs area.
I’ve been to 2Beans on a few occasions to meet colleagues. Great location, central to most Midtown East businesses. Good selection of food and beverage.
Great coffee, strong Wifi yummy chocolates and there’s always a place to sit and chat upstairs. My Goto for biz and casual meetings

formatted_address: 48 E 7th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Via Della Pace

reviews.text: Beautiful quaint Italian restaurant in the east village... I didn’t speak to one staff that didn’t speak Italian which was amazing. The dishes were fantastic and certainly authentic... especially the portion sizes which did not result in you being rolled out of the restaurant! I sat at the bar solo which was a great atmosphere but if you aren’t a loner I recommend a reservation!

Quite possibly the best meal I've had in NYC so far. Stopped in for some late night food to get out of the rain and had some great drinks, amazing food, and enjoyed the atmosphere. Will absolutely return. Our waiter was very attentive and kind.
Cash only, so be prepared for that!
Best authentic lasagna anywhere. Taramasu is lusciously smooth and delicate. Atmosphere is definitely Italian...fun place.

My go to in the neighborhood! Great value, great food, great vibes. You will never go wrong with “VDP”.  Dates, family, or just a quick lunch or bowl of pasta...there simply isn’t a better choice when in the east village. Bring cash!

It was our first time at this restaurant and it was a terrible experience. We had an extremely inexperienced waitress.  We ordered  appetizers and entrees yet everything came out all at once with the exception of one dish that she completely forgot to order. 

When I inquired about it, I saw the manager roll his eyes and explain to her the mistake that she made at the computer. However, never once did this manager come over to our table to apologize or even speak to us. Instead, I was served my entree long after my partner finished his meal.I could tell that all around this place had a huge service problem.

The food was a mixed bag. The meatballs were decent, the eggplant was undercooked and not worth it at all, the codfish was tasty as were the asparagus. 

Perhaps this appeals to Lower East Siders looking for a bargain. If this restaurant were uptown it would not last a week.

formatted_address: 200 West End Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Bin 70 Wine

reviews.text: Most things...

A great place to pay $40 for a $20 bottle of wine. Aside from the prices, there's the poor-quality stock. I've twice bought bottles of astringent or oxidized wine. Once is an accident--twice is a pattern. Good thing there's a better store one block east.
Good neighborhood wine shop. Moderate pricing, friendly staff. Diverse selections overall with a handful of excellent finds.
Great wine shop! Customer service and prices are the best part of the experience.
Excellent costumer service! A great selection of wines and spirits! Love this place!!!

formatted_address: 7 9th Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Serafina

reviews.text: I really love dining at Serafina! The food is delicious! I've been to a few different branches and it's always worth it! I totally recommend that you try the Seafood Risotto! It might not be on the menu but they will prepare it for you. Also, the truffle risotto is fantastic!!

We sat upstairs because of our group size.  It was very dark and slightly warm.  Food is better than expected.  The parts seem a bit small but the price is fair so maybe that's the deal.  The service is very friendly and good They allow us to delay our booking also nice.  Probably better Italian in the city.

I stopped by for lunch with my kid who wanted pasta. The place seemed ideal for that. They were welcoming and let us in with the stroller, they have a kids menu and crayons for kids to draw with. I ordered a Serafina burger, medium cooked. I got a burger completely burnt. I sent It back and got a new one, but it was not much better. I reckon that an Italian restaurant is probably not the place to go for hamburger, but I still found it disappointing to get an overcooked piece of meat.

Childhood memories stayed in tact after returning to this amazing place 20+ years after moving away. I can't say better things about this incredibly delicious establishment. Every amazing thing I told my husband about I was able to finally show him, and nothing had changed. Can't wait to come back again and smell that familiar chowder smell
Good service. Chop salad was excellent. Home made Lasagna was good but not what I expected and portion was small

formatted_address: 14 Loisaida Ave, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: C lounge

formatted_address: 52 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Gottino Enoteca e Salumeria

reviews.text: Cute space and a friendly staff. If your like Italian wine you’ll love it here. I was surprised to see they have a little outdoor space in the back. Great place for a date or a girls night.
Delicious Italian innovative dishes served tapas style portions. great place and wonderful service. One of the many Hidden gems in NY

Came in to have a drink. There was a tall, light skinned gay man behind the bar. We asked for a cocktail and he sharply told us only beer and wine. After waiting 12 minutes, we asked if we could taste something and he said “when I have time.”
Two people were at the bar aside from us. We were ready to order a bottle, but decided to leave. Won’t be coming back.

We came to this restaurant for dinner. we heard about this place from quite a few people.  Well, we were not disappointed. The crew welcomed us with a smile and we had a fantastic feeling. The food was just great. We had a great time and we will visit this place again. We recommend this place to all.

One of my favourite places in the area. Italian small plates. There's a garden that you should sit in if you can. The winners here are the ricotta & fig toast and the anchovy and butter toast. The latter in particular is incredible if you like fish!

formatted_address: 32 Union Square E, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Planetnight.com

formatted_address: 201 W 95th St, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: Buceo 95

reviews.text: The food is always superb. It is a very small place, so can someone's be difficult to get into if you're doing with a large group or at peak dinner hours. But it's a great neighborhood spot. Nice wonder selection, great flan, wonderful seasonal dishes that change. Great for sharing and tasting as many things as possible.
Amazing service, food and SANGRIA with cava!  Nathan was incredible as usual!! Thanks

nick the host   nathan the bartender were excellent great service we stayed 5 hours  they found out it was my birthday doon and gave us pastry w chocate to dip it into   classy  great confortable beautiful place  .  we went on a sunday and had some red wines  that we learned about and will have again and again.mine was azumuti  organic  awesome thanks to buceo for making a sunday plan come to fruition
Always had to this food and amazing staff, especially the hostess and the bartender who always remembers exactly what kind of red wine I like!

Great tapas place on an UWS side street. Service is very good. Tapas were without exception delicious! They also have a nice selection of wines that match up with the variety of food nicely. Definitely a place to revisit more than once.

formatted_address: 311 Church St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Macao Trading Co

reviews.text: This places has a basement bar that I love. Been here for casual drinks and birthday celebrations. The cocktails are very strong here. Food is delicious and generous sizing. Seating upstairs during busy hours is difficult. I loved the basement as they have music after 10 and turns into a dance floor. Will be visiting here often !!

I loved the place and bartenders... question i had was: how do you mix water with that sink 😂😂😂😂😂😂 and get good water temperature on both hands. Any ways very much loved the place. Totally and 100000% recommended. Decent prices and good service. P.S. cocktails are lit 🔥

I went with a group of 6 for a birthday on a Saturday night, we had a reservation and there was a good amount of space for a group that size. They seated us right away with our reservation. 

We ordered the chicken and pork belly dumplings, mushroom and truffle croquets, and the octopus. All 3 were delicious. The cocktails were nicely crafted. I enjoyed one on the seasonal menu that included freshly crushed cranberries. Service was good overall. 

The atmosphere was very nice, a cozy ambiance, and very high ceilings and the tables are spread out enough so you’re not on top of the people next to you - a rarity in NYC. There is also a downstairs for even more space.

This place has really good prices. Some food is good and some is bad. Don't order the peanut dressing for the salad it's too thick. Do order the Tom Yum soup it's very flavorful. They carry a good selection of Asian beers. At the end they give you ice cream.
Loved the way this place is decked out - gives an old colonial vibe. The food and service was ok.

formatted_address: 141 W 38th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Arno

reviews.text: Arno Restaurant is a warm, inviting, and delicious restaurant. The service is gracious without being too stuffy and the menu is lovely.

I went there for the murder mystery dinner. I don't recommend this act for anyone under the age of 55. It was very boring but the older people seemed to enjoy themselves. The food provided was very blah I would have preferred to eat in the actual restaurant. The seating was very tight and uncomfortable to watch the show. However it was a night out with something to do. I wouldn't do it again!! They did include me in the show and they called me beautiful numerous amount of time compliments are fantastic but I still wanted entertainment not to be bored.

Absolutely delightful!  Wonderful service! Boris the bartender is outstanding! Carlos made sure our night was perfect! Very much appreciated!
Food was terrific, the tiramisu was heaven, steaks could not have been better. 
Very very good!

I came here today for my holiday lunch courtesy of my employers. I didn't know beforehand that this place is a "sister" restaurant to Delmonico's. This restaurant, just like Delmonico's is absolutely elegant and very clean. The food and drinks were pretty good as well. Everything came out pretty quickly after we finally ordered. The clam appetizer were a bit small where one person can eat the whole plate. My main course of red snapper was really tasty and my cheesecake was creamy.  The only issue (and I believe it is because of the holidays) is that the service was a tad slow. Waitstaff seem to disappear when you need them and nobody checks up to see if everyone is satisfied or if anyone needed anything. I would give this place another shot, only when it is less busy.

I had two friends visiting from Japan. It was Saturday night and most of the places were super crowded and we saw three empty stools at this bar, so we grabbed them. They have a good selection of wine. We didn't get any main dish but the appetizers were really good. Nice atmosphere for adults to have casual conversation. I recommend this place.

formatted_address: 2168 Frederick Douglass Blvd, New York, NY 10026, USA
name: Lido Harlem Restaurant

reviews.text: GREAT PLACE! I went during a Saturday brunch with my friends and it was so good. The food was DELICIOUS!!  The drinks were good and the waiter kept them going. He was very attentive and polite. It has such a great ambiance with nice staff members. I will definitely be attending again. I am grateful my friend introduced me to this establishment. She made reservations and everything went smoothly. I am not sure how it would be for walk-ins so I recommend reserving a table before going.

I've gone for both dinner and their Happy Hour (which runs through 8pm, making it a better option than many NYC venues). The cocktails are both strong and delicious! I do feel their dinner menu was better a year ago due to recent small tweaks. For example, the snapper option used to have a crust that was to die for. No longer.  They also recent converted their crab fritters into salmon fritters, and we much preferred the cod. Still, it's a must do when in Harlem.

A fine place with an outstanding vibe. The dishes are inviting and approachable, if you know what I mean (it means the food is not fussy). It gets full, so make a reservation, but the service still runs smoothly despite the crowds. Want to go there again for brunch.

My sister has special needs and the hostess was very accommodating which I really appreciated. As I went to park my car she seated my sister and treated her with the utmost respect.She even came over later to ask if all was well. The waiter service was good although the food wasn't as good as we expected. The red sangria I had was good.
My husband and I stopped in brunch, and it was a perfect way relax in this nyc heat wave. The food was excellent! And our server Connor, was most attentive👍. I'm sure we will be back!

formatted_address: 518 Metropolitan Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Kellogg's Diner

reviews.text: Wasn't happy with the service the manager gave. My waiter was great and very understanding. However  the manager only cared about making a sale. The grits that I ordered were disgusting. I showed my waiter the issue and she was understanding. However the manager refused to remove the item from my bill.  Eat here at your own risk.  Keep in mind I used to go all the time to this diner. Food was great at one time.

I love the classic diner aesthetic. Great prices too. Bathroom wasn't the best, but for New York, it was good. Even though the soap was in a spray bottle, at least there was soap, and a lot of it! And good is fantastic.

The only place we found open at new year's. We waited over 1.5 hours for a table for 8 while we watched others get tables faster. Finally got 2 tables for 4 on each extremes of the diner. Service was excellent, the food was good.  We got our check with 18% gratuity included for our 4-people table. Not that our server didn't deserve it, but that used to happen on groups of 7 or more.

A great diner at a great location. Parking was easy to find(but that WAS very early in the morning). Very clean interior and the decor is great. Our breakfast was great, the pancakes were fluffy and delicious.
Soooooooo good. And surprisingly enough for NYC it was very reasonably priced as well. Huge portions. And such a great atmosphere. Love the oldies vibe. We will definitely be back.

formatted_address: 242 Court St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Awash

reviews.text: Delicious, authentic Ethiopian food! They have great vegan/vegetarian and meat options. Cozy, comfortable interior with attentive staff. Enjoyed the honey wine

Incredible place, regardless of the exterior look and small size, get ready for the best treat you can have of the authentic Ethiopian cuisine!!!! Extremely tasty, can be spicy if you want! Loved it all 100 times I was there! They also have Ethiopian beer! And even with a note of caramel! Oh, and of course, the Ethiopian coffee with cardamon! Must try! Pleasant prices! Vegan and meat!)

Quite possibly the best Ethiopian place you can find, for more than one reason. First of all: It's not just authentic and tasty, it's also some of the bigger (and hence more fairly priced) portions I've had in any NYC Ethiopian restaurant. For some reason other places skimp out like crazy. Secondly: They have a wider selection of (again) authentic Ethiopian beers. Other places have few and widen the selection with trashy US beer. Third: The wine list is extremely well currated (with actual Ethiopian options) and fitted to the taste and range of a good menu. Awash gets extra points from this dude for having a balanced space with balanced lighting and music volume. Atmosphere! Brooklyn restaurants, it f###### counts! Many other restaurants could take a cue or two from this place. Staff is above and beyond, always nice and on point. Such a pleasant experience. Remember to get the house-made chili-paste/sauce side! Brilliant!

This place is legit! Such great flavors and the staff is really nice. There were three of us and we got both the vegan and meat samplers and that was plenty of food (plus we got to try almost everything, which was awesome). The beef and the red lentils were my faves but really enjoyed eating everything! Also, the frog tiles in their restroom are just adorable. Love this place, highly recommended!

This was the first time eating Ethiopian food and to my amazement it was absolutely amazing. The establishment shows the theme throughout with nice artwork and the drinks were really good. I tried the rough rider (although it came in a smaller glass then I expected it packed a punch.) The food was 9 out of 10.  I think I'm giving a 9 because I ordered the steak tartar which specified on the menu that u can get it raw medium or well done and the waitress never asked how we wanted it...and it totally slipped my mind. So we got raw ground steak which tasted lightly cooked but not enough. All in all I loved it and will be going back soon.

formatted_address: 444 10th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Hudson Bar Room

reviews.text: Super friendly staff. Amazing cocktails and great food. The muscles is a gigantic amount for the price. Keep up that great vibe.
The 2 bartenders here were awesome. We stopped in after Comic Con to have a couple drinks and to our delight the bartenders knew just what we wanted. Great atmosphere and really nice people.

Food is very tasty, generous portions. Cocktails were nice, but not particularly special. Service is good, and fast, but can be spotty if they're busier. Be prepared to explicitly request menus and checks.
Food here was delicious..the staff was super friendly.

All Wait staff and Bar Personnel were pleasant, attentive, and playful when initiated by us.    The food and cappuccino(s) and coffee were excellently made and tasty as well. I would HIGHLY recommend their restaurant and the attached Marriott hotel. 5+☆'s to both. I am a real customer, and strongly stand on my recommendations, so much so, that I will include my personal e- mail, for persons that have serious inquiries about said properties...: freespiritman@aol.com. Thank you.

formatted_address: 133 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Sons of Essex

reviews.text:
Great music, good service, and cute inside. If your looking for a quiet brunch spot this is not the place. We were turnt at 2pm! Food is average – I had crispy chicken sandwich with Truffle fries (nothing special) 

I would visit again.

I've been planning a New year's Eve get together for weeks and decided on The Sons of Essex as venue. Immediately upon meeting Emmy who is the biggest reason for me choosing this venue, I knew my friends and family would have a night to remember. When we arrived on new years Eve, we were treated with the best service imaginable. The food here is excellent. My favorite was the chicken sandwich. John is a bartender at The Sons of Essex and he knows how to keep people in a positive mood. He knows what he is doing behind the bar and knows how to serve drinks like a pro. The crowd was a very upbeat, good looking crowd. The DJ was excellent and played some of the best songs to keep everyone on the dance floor. The security staff kept everyone safe and allowed everyone to enjoy the evening with their professionalism. My friends and family truly had a night to remember thanks to Emmy, John and staff. In a city full of poorly ran establishments, The Sons of Essex is a gem! I have a another go to place to visit when I want to eat great food, unwind and relax to drinks and music, and to host group events. Emmy thank you
Food was delicious (I got a veggie burger) and reasonable priced. Staff was very friendly and answered my questions. Will definitely come back when I'm in the area.
This place has great vibes and gets super busy. Worth a visit if you're in the area, especially for food and drinks. My wife and I really wish we could have spent some more time at this spot.
Love this place for brunch. The chicken and waffles are prob the best I've had. The drinks are delicious and strong.  The atmosphere for brunch is lively, loud and so much fun.

formatted_address: 29 W 36th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Habanero Blues

reviews.text: We went for brunch on Saturday and the place is huge. Two floors with lots of TV's to watch sports. My steak and eggs were fine, the bloody Mary nice and spicy, everyone enjoyed their food. Good Mexican food.

Vibrant and fun atmosphere, great service, good beer on tap. Looking for something a little different in the hood? Skip the typical Irish pub and check out this joint. Get some nachos, a cold pint, and enjoy sharp service from the exceptional staff.

We went to Habanero Blues on Saturday the 23rd as my husband and his partner were in the City for the NY Toy Fair. The food, drinks and service was excellent. Our server (wish I knew his name) gave great suggestions and was very friendly. The most impressive part is that I left my backpack on the chair next to me. I called the next morning and they had kept it safe for me. It really has proven to me that whoever found it could have easily taken cash etc. Thank you staff at Habanero Blues for not only providing an enjoyable evening but proving that there are still kind and trusting people in the world that will take care of complete strangers.
Loved everything about this place. Great vibe, excellent food and service. It gets very loud in the evenings, more peaceful during the day.

All of the dishes we ordered were pretty bland and the pricing was not amazing Either. Rice & beans were flavourless and the pulled meat tacos were pretty dry & served without a nice sauce. Was not busy when we went and the service was also slow. Ordered a New York cheesecake for desert but they were sold out. Wouldn’t go here again.

formatted_address: 240 W 14th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Crispo

reviews.text:
Perfect for intimate couples date night or group of people (4 max). 
Pasta is house made and fresh. 

Came in on a special occasion between me and my girlfriend and were immediately seated. Took too long for our waiter to pass by and offer us water, after it took too long for him to come back and take our order for appetizers and the bottle of wine we requested. After that however the service was great from the presentation of the wine bottle to the food. At the end the ball was dropped as it took an extended duration to get our check. 

Would give it a second chance as the pasta was hands down some of the best we ever had. Portion is good that leaves space for dessert.
Solid spot with good Italian pasta dishes. Nice atmosphere especially in the back area. Both pasta entrees were delicious with good portion sizes. The service was great and would definitely go back

Pretty awesome. Delicious food, great service, nice atmosphere, although it is difficult for a group conversation due to the reverberation of voices and music. If I did not mention it, the food was fantastic with a large selection.
Delicious pasta, wine, and dessert. Makes for a wonderful night in the city!

Food is delicious and the service is reasonable. I was there with a large party (16) and they did a great job making that just work. The organizer had arranged a prixe fixe family style meal that had something for everyone.

formatted_address: 110 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Tompkins Square Bar

reviews.text: Nasty and arrogant people work here. An employee swung a door into me. I was with 9 other people. I asked for her to apologize and she refused; leading to awkwardness when some people left. She then had the rest of us removed by a bouncer. The manager claimed she is a long time employee and he trusted her. We just ran up a large tab at his bar and it wasn’t the first time. Never going back. We are long time East Village residents. Plenty of other places to go. I am writing this review 20 minutes after it went down, so obviously in a clear state of mind.

We stumbled upon this bar while walking near the park. It wasn't crowded and surprisingly drinks were pretty good. Music was great as well. It's a great place to hang with friends and talk as it's not too loud. 
Theme for the drinks is names of authors. They've hot drinks on the menu as well though they weren't available when we were there. Yes, they've real candles if that's a thing you're into.

Very weird vibes, we started playing pool and they were like oh the cues are outside. Then they kept the door open while they put stuff outside making it freezing in the back room. We said we didn’t need to play pool but the guy was like no it’s fine and then stared at us while we played, waiting for us to finish. Then a bunch of other people that worked there came back and told us to get out of the way. No one explained why they were closing off the back room or what they were doing, it was only 10 pm. Then the bouncer (who had given us the 3rd degree) was taking away a girls ID because he thought it was fake and they were waiting for the police so she could get it back.

A friend suggested I visit this bar for drinks. I regret going. The hostess, Tamara, was the nastiest, rudest, most impolite, arrogant and egotistical individual I ever had the dishonor of interacting with. I will not be going back. There are too many bars in this neighborhood and I can go to any one of them and spend my money and be treated much better. I found out that the owner also owns Lovers of Today and Niagara, so I wont be spending my money in those either! And I will definitely encourage others not to as well. Tamara is clearly inexperienced in the nuance of dealing with people or she simply doesn't care. Either way, train her properly or put her in a job where she doesn't interact with bar patrons. She is costing your establishment business!
Really cool spot to hang and have drinks. Small menu for eats but everything is really good. Pool table in the back!

formatted_address: 3456 Broadway, New York, NY 10031, USA
name: Harlem Cigar Room

reviews.text: A very good place to smoke and chill. Really friendly staff.  I love the place

I want to say that Felix and his crew is the best. I already knew about this place from a mutual friend. 
 But what I can say when I tried it again with my Significant other it is still outstanding. The customers that comes in and out is always Courteous to us and also the cigar workers like D  she is great among others that work there. I love their wine room and food is Exceptional (try their steak lol) thanks for always giving us a good time with outstanding customer service.. cigars are always fresh!
Best,
Keisha Green
Great place. Great environment. Good selection of cigars.

Enjoyed this spot and while there got to chance to see how Harlem is changing for the better. This spot has been around for a while but changed there name. The cigar selection is comparable to some of the bigger lounges. Staff is friendly and will go out of there way to make you comfortable. TVs to help you relax and sounds to mellow out to while smoking your favorite stick. To my #botl and #sotl stop by and check them out.

Its okay small place in Harlem parking is tight they offer "valet" parking went for the fact djninobrownnyc was playing for the event u buy 2 cigars from the selection which is ok the "house cigars" were dry and unraveling...😏its byobb get VERY standing room only crowded w/locals and others like myself looking for a cigar lounge to try out

formatted_address: 524 4th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Mamma Roma

reviews.text:
Best pizza in south slope. Can’t recommend this place strong enough. 10/5 stars. So damn good. This is the real deal.

Interior is unbelievable, service is great and damn that pizza is what I’m dreaming about each night

So excited to see a new place on 4th Avenue! The pizza and salads are great, the decor is amazing and the staff is very friendly. They have a large outdoor space that will open in the summer, can't wait!!
Just stopped in for a quick bite. Bread home made. Salad.. amazing.
An instant favorite spot, Unreal pizza and absolutely perfect espressos!
We loved this place, so sad to see it must be closed for good 😢

formatted_address: 1417 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: A la Turka

reviews.text: This spot sure knows how to satisfy their clients. Constantly with a super nice attitude. The food is fairly priced, regularly flavorful and clean.
Food quality is always good . Greets to Nati and Mine but not Suleyman abi 😀
Very elegant and welcoming restaurant. They provide big meals and for fair rates. I enjoyed the food a lot and the staff were super affable and informative. I recommend this place.
Good food at good prices! Mezzo was great. Brandi I was awesome. Noise level too high but otherwise a pleasant dining experience.

I came here New Years eve dinner and i was quite impressed! Let me start off by saying they have a very friendly and attentive staff, which definitely added to the experience. The live violinist, belly dancer was amazing! The food was super delish! I would definitely recommend if you are feeling for Mediterranean fare, with nice ambience & good service!

formatted_address: 199 Bowery Lower Level, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: VANDAL Nightclub

reviews.text: I really wish I had better things to say about this place, because it's honestly a great space and the music was not bad at all. Unfortunately, the staff did little to nothing to kick out a man who assaulted my friend, TWICE, even though four other women saw him do it. The manager seemed very sympathetic which was nice, but they said that because they did not see it for themselves, they could not do anything. This is not the makings of a safe space for women, or really for anyone other than men who like to assault and batter others. While they did individually go up and talk to the man (who of course denied what he did), they still did not do anything past that to resolve the situation. We felt so uncomfortable and unsafe we had to leave. I hope this issue gets better in the future.

formatted_address: 579 Broadway, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: House of Hunter

formatted_address: 329 Henry St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Henry Public

reviews.text: This is a great unassuming pub with a relaxed vibe. They have a small but delicious menu and some interesting offerings on tap. Feels like a local institution where patrons and staff alike are friendly and warm.

This spot is awesome little quaint pub vibes and the turkey leg sandwich is drool worthy. I took my grandfather here for a beer and he couldn’t have been happier. small but tasty menu, beers, cocktails and wine, highly recommend after a day of walking through Brooklyn bridge park

Food and cocktails were so good. The husband got the signature turkey sandwich (think pulled pork). I got oysters followed by the soup du jour....heritage bean soup. Absolutely delicious. One of the top meals I had in New York!
Cute, fun old school neighborhood bar with live music and a tasty, if limited food menu. Get there early on live music nights to get a seat!
I don’t know if they still have it but the Marrow Toast and the Turkey Sandwich are two of the best bar foods I have ever had. My friends and I still talk about those two items all the time

formatted_address: 97 Franklin St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Urban Fax Bar

formatted_address: 185 St Nicholas Ave, New York, NY 10026, USA
name: La Diagonal Agaveria

reviews.text: I celebrated my nomination this evening in this gorgeous place. Well we enjoyed a magnificent evening and the place was surely one of the reasons for that happy celebration. The waiters  cooperated in a sweet way, the cuisine was extremely good and my guests were very  cheerful. We shall no dout return for more joyful events. thanks very much.

The bar and restaurant was so hip and trendy. The place had a great ambiance and decor was beautiful. The cocktails were amazing and the Mexican food was outstanding. I had a fresh carrot and agave margarita, guacamole, camarones en chipotle. This is a great place to chill and eat. The menu is also affordable. A must visit. Will definitely be going back here.
Loved this restaurant! Decor of the establishment transports you to a seaside vacaction. Food was great. Drinks were delicious. Staff was attentive and polite. Will definitely be back!
Good Drinks, Good food, Not Expensive at all. I'm totally satisfied. I luv Anna thanks for great service.
The food was excellent the place was so cozy and warm. The Service was great. Will be going back again.

formatted_address: 168 1/2 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Kings County Imperial LES

reviews.text:
If you want good Chinese food in the LES side, this is the place to go. We went during happy hour and the dumplings was $1/each, we got 2 different types and they were both great.

Also ordered some Mapo Tofu, veggies, shrimp fried rice. All were excellent. Tofu was in big chunks, taste great for tofu lovers. Shrimp fried rice was my favorite. 

Servers was very friendly and love the Hawaii theme shirts. My Hawaiian friend felt at home.

Loved the brunch! Interesting, unique and flavorful dishes, nice presentation and decor, cozy atmosphere and friendly staff. Cocktails were good and fairly priced (except for the bourbon, pineapple and coffee concoction- though I'm sure to each their own!). Will definitely come back.

Positive:  very friendly staff and delicious food

Negative: took way too long to get our food (one dish came out, then had to wait 30 min for the rest when the place was not busy). Slightly expensive. 

I really think I would have gone with 4 stars if the food just came out consistently.  We ordered 5 dishes around 5:30 PM when the place only had two other tables filled. 

We got our 2 appetizers then received one of 3 main dish not too far after.  But then there was this long wait.  I saw many Togo orders being filled and being picked up.  30 minutes passed and our fried rice (mind you it’s just fried rice and only had 3 shrimps) and half chicken were still missing.  We almost wanted to cancel the order at that point.  

I would have been more understanding if the place was busy, but it really wasn’t either. Shrug

Food was delicious and staff was very friendly, so no complaint there! 

Maybe we’ll give it another try next time.
Soup dumplings are amazing.  Mock eel is another favorite.  All their food is really good.  Went to a dumpling making class also which I would recommend.

Dollar dumpling hour. Do you hear me? Friendly, helpful staff that will share their sauce knowledge if you ask (including deets about that in-house soy sauce 💦). You absolutely must order the soup dumplings. They’re not included in Dollar Dumpling Hour, but that’s because it would be a sin / cause a riot. Enjoy 🥟 !!

formatted_address: 221 9th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: London Terrace Liquor

reviews.text: Great customer service and they’re very patient when we’re taking our time choosing wine or liquor. If we have questions the staff seems to have great insight and are friendly yet professional. They even allow us to bring in our dogs which we love because we hate leaving them outside.
Nice place to buy wine, encapsulated in a great exterior building facade.
The staff are very helpful and knowledgeable. Store is cozy and seems packed but I'm always in and out in minutes and more times then not I've learned some things about alcohol
They have large inventory of wines.
Super nice staff & knowledgeable

formatted_address: 113 Jane St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: The Jane Ballroom

reviews.text: absolutely love this quaint hotel. Right out of early 20th century America and styled after a ship. This hotel is hostel style with shared bathrooms and the rooms are teeny tiny but it was just what I needed for a one night stay. I thought the room and decor were absolutely gorgeous. Staff were inviting and dressed in classic bellhop uniforms. I loved the old style feel and I will definitely be returning when given the opportunity. Lovely neighborhood too.

Came to the Jane Hotel Ballroom around 12am expecting a wait in a line. When we got to the front of the short line we were asked how many in our group - I said 7. The doorman told the bouncer no we were not allowed in. I explained it was for a birthday and we were prepared to buy drinks etc and was still told no. I asked if that was a no, we had to wait...or a no we would never get in. I was told we would never be let in. The doorman then let in a group of 6 people who never entered the line and 4 more after that.
Would never go here again and would warn others to avoid this club - clearly it’s a recurring issue as this is one of many similar experiences.

Hands down the worst place I have ever been to in my entire life. I NEVER write reviews but felt the need to add on to the MANY similar experiences below. Arrived at the Jane Hotel for a friends birthday. We had arrived no more then 10 minutes after them. We were told we had to wait in line ... mind you there was literally no line. We waited for about 15 minutes by ourselves until the man with a little hat and thick glasses confronted us. I told him I was joining a birthday party inside, he said the table didn't exist. I then clarified that they may not have a table but they just arrived moments before us. He told me there was no table there for me and he was glad I understood (...?) A member from the party came out to explain that there was a large party inside and we were part of it, only for the bouncer to then ban him from re-entering.

I literally never complain, even when I get denied from places - but it was the completely unprofessional, arrogant attitude of the employees here that will make me never come back and assure that no one I know will either. 

Based on the countless reviews of the same rude, racist encounters with the man at the door, I’d recommend the manager hire somebody new. It was Saturday night and we were the only 2 people standing on line so I‘d assume business isn’t great. You could probably thank the jerk-off at the door for that.
Love the music, great place to come dancing with friends. Expect a big crowd and expensive drinks. Shout out to Don Yoon at the hotel front desk for being super nice and accommodating!

The bouncers at this bar are awful. They were physically pushing people out the door that were doing nothing wrong and just trying to leave the venue.  Their behavior is just purposely malicious for absolutely no reason.

formatted_address: North Wing, 625 8th Ave 2nd floor, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: USO Center Times Square

reviews.text:
Check out their website and get their direct number - you can call any day of the week and ask if they’ve had any show tickets donated! I didn’t have any luck with it this past trip (mid August), but apparently they get more later in the year. 

This place has three large rooms - plenty of space to spread out! There are some super comfy couches right in front of a large TV. There’s a room with two large fridges filled with soda and a counter with coffee and snacks (cheez-its and animal crackers). 

All the volunteers I spoke with were super nice!

If you are active or retired this is a MUST stop.  You can get all the gouge on free places, tickets, and how to max your earned status as a defender of our nation in Manhattan.  Manhattan is not cheap, but this USO sure helps!

I was stressed because I moved to the Bronx and had to sign my DD214 but everywhere I tried to sign into NSIPS the network was not working and I even bought a card reader. Finally I found a USO in Manhattan that allowed me to accomplish what I needed to do! Thank you so much!
Does not allow veterans, unless you have a retired ID. The lady was nice though.
Is this place for homeless?  Don’t waste your time at USO

formatted_address: 271 Metropolitan Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: The Butcher's Daughter

reviews.text:
Contrary to what the name suggests, this well lit and soberly decorated restaurant is totally vegetarian! Both the dishes and the freshly made juices taste amazing! I would highly recommended to try the juice flight (the passion fruit was my favorite!) as well as the butcher's bowl. The food itself was really tasty and savory.
Not really knowing what to expect initially, I came out amazed by the quality and savors. I will definitely come back there in the future!

It's rare that I wouldn't give a veg place four or five stars but unfortunately,  this is one of those occasions when I would. Main reasons are:

Charges extra to make most items vegan and does not instead just allow for straight substitutions (e.g. dairy cheese for vegan cheese) without charging a considerable amount extra.

Charges extra to make most items gluten free. Also, the gluten free bread is not vegan (especially surprising given the plethora of vegan gluten free bread options out there now) and, does not note that on the menu.

The serving sizes are relatively small, especially for the cost (and even more, when you account for the cost of making a dish vegan).

On the plus side, the space is light and airy and,  reachable by public transport.

Super cozy, trendy spot for vegetarian/vegan eats. The vegan "crab cakes" are a must try, and the zucchini linguine is great with creamy cashew sauce and mushrooms. Had to get my food to-go, but will definitely be back to try the drinks and more of the interesting options.

Cute spot Vegan options, great date/brunch spot.  Clean dining area with light colors and plants.  Took my lady and we had $8 veg soup $15 avocado toast, total was $30 with tip.  Full meal would've been $50-$100. Nice selection of mimosas and cocktails.

Cute spot! Come on a nice day where you don’t mind the weather outside because the whole restaurant is essentially outside. No AC or fans (please please get some fans!!)

The drinks were outstanding. Great lemonade and cold hot toddy like potion (I forgot the name).

My friend and I split the vegetable sandwich which was alright. Honestly nothing special. I took one star away because of how expensive everything was for what we got. I felt like I could make it at home for less than a quarter of the price. 

The atmosphere is really nice. Totally a feel good place. Plants, fresh colors and the service was good. Again, make sure you go on a day with good weather so you can remain comfortable!!

formatted_address: 30 W 21st St, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Rudolf Piper

formatted_address: 245 W 38th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Black Iron Burger

reviews.text:
hey had a great time in this place!  the waiters  are wonderful and very helpful mainly the bartender!
 the hamburger I order is the special
 It was incredibly delicious and Super well cooked!
 The decoration of the dish was in detail well presented and stylish!

 Thank you so much it was an extraordinary service!
 And I will again enjoy a good experience I recommend this place to everyone !!

Phenomenal burgers and service. We came here for our 8th anniversary, and we're so glad we did. We sat at the bar because they were a bit busy. The bartender was doing double duty as a server and bartender, but he was on top of everything. We had the artichoke starter, which was a little small to share but was perfect regardless. I had the mushroom truffle burger (not sure if that's what it's called in the menu), and he had the black iron burger (first one on the menu). Absolutely amazing! Best burgers we've had in a long time. We got the loaded fries as a side, and we're so glad we did. You could easily split it amongst at least 3 people. Great atmosphere, clean, great service and amazing food.

This place is a fantastic spot to grab a quick dinner and have a few craft beers while watching the game. I didn't have to look long to find out what I wanted, The Mushroom Truffle Burger jumped at me right away. The flavor was out of this world! I'll revisit for sure!

Burgers were okay. The carmelized onions are pretty overpowering so if it comes with whatever burger you're ordering, expect to really only taste that. Sauces come on the side and not on the burger and also are an additional charge.
I also ordered the loaded fries which were delicious. Creamy and crispy but not hot. However, they were more of a star than the burger.
Service was quick but mediocre. One waitress seemed very unmotivated and in turn made me want to leave.

Easily the best burger I've had in NYC.  

I kept it basic by ordering the classic double with cheddar, lettuce, onion, pickle, tomato with mayo and mustard.  It was perfectly cooked to temperature (medium rare, my preference).  Skinny fries were crisp and not overly salted.  I'll definitely be back.

formatted_address: 1495 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10075, USA
name: Bar Coastal

reviews.text: It's a great sports bar.  They also have Atomic Wings, so the food is great too.  Their fries and fried onion dish was very good too.
Locals love it! Wings were perfectly cooked!  Sauce perfectly balanced.

Got some wings and onion fries to go. I got the Hot and BBQ wings which were delicious but I was a little surprised they used such a strong vinegar based hot sauce. Wings were enormous and juicy!  A small onion fry is definitely worth the value and absolutely delicious as well. I would definitely order for a group again.
Nice pubby atmosphere with friendly staff and delicious wings. Definitely in the Top 3 wing spots so far for NYC.
Great buffalo wings, some of the best I've had. Great selection of beers. locals and all around. Service is great too, the server was very engaging and helpful.

formatted_address: 1000 5th Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA
name: The Met Roof Garden Bar

reviews.text: Great views of the city and if you time it right you will see a spectacular sunset. Drinks are pricey so be prepared to pay.
Was amazing always a great time at the MET museum
Great rooftop to relax and see the city after visiting The Met.  No seating and little shade but an unbeatable view. You can get sandwiches and drinks at small counter serve locations.
Great views of Central Park from the rooftop bar of the Metropolitan Museum.
Super cool view of nyc skyline.

formatted_address: 473 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Lokal Mediterranean Kitchen

reviews.text:
I dined at Lokal Mediterranean Kitchen on a Saturday afternoon for brunch. 

My friend & I were able to try a few cold dips/small plates along with bread. I am a bit of a picky person but the ajvar dip (roasted red pepper and eggplant puree) and lentils patties definitely stood out to me. Both were full of flavor. 

I opted for their Eggs Benedict with Salmon and my friend chose Steak and Eggs, both dishes came with home fries. I’ve never had poached eggs prior to and I am very much an omelette girl but I loved it. The eggs went well over the salmon & English muffins. My friend also really enjoyed her steak & eggs meal. Their Mimosa’s & Bellini’s were on point too!

I am definitely looking forward to trying their pancakes/french toast and their omelettes. I hope to return soon.

Great food, great service and great view. Was served by Edgar who gave good recommendation on the food and drinks. Our first time here and fell in love already. The clam chowder are must try as they are very rich and a lot of seafood inside. Worth it!!
Great food at reasonable prices. Amazing services. Everything was well organised. Staff were professional and greeted us very well. Interior was beautiful. I liked the decor.
I loved the Lokal burger.. really worth the price. Very natural ingredients and rich flavor. Staff were super nice. Thanks Murat for the baklava, it was delicious
I got the salmon fillet it was medium sized and very good and my friend really enjoyed his lamb. the cocktail I got was kind of weak not my favorite. The waitress was very nice.

formatted_address: 428 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Crave Fishbar

reviews.text: The great thing about their kale salad is that it harmoniously mixes different ingredients while not giving up the kale base. I was surprised by how delicately goat cheese can be added to the salad. And there's no enough way to praise the squid ink spaghetti. It carries a novel spiciness--not the typical tongue-striking or nose-running way; and it's salty in a genuinely appetizing manner. The impeccable service of our server only took the dinner experience to the pinnacle of delight.

Came here for happy hour. 

Drink was strong and good, I had a Big Ben. 

It said oyster is $1/each during the happy hour but they charged $1.50. I don’t know why. 
The oyster taste was good so I still do t get it. 
Crab roll was too salty. I think they sugar coat and salt coat. 

Atmosphere is very nice and cozy. 

Waiters are nice and friendly.

Food: We mostly stuck to the Appetizers this time around, it allowed us to try many different items.  The Roasted Cauliflower Soup and the Salmon Sashimi Tostadas are absolutely amazing. They also have a good selection of oyster condiments with horseradish, cocktail sauce, lemon, etc. (happy hour oysters $1-1.50 per oyster between 5-7 pm on the weekdays)

Location / Service: The space is warm and inviting, as is the service.  The space is warm and inviting, as is the service.  All of the wait staff were helpful with recommendations and checked on us throughout the meal.  The price point is very reasonable for a delicious seafood restaurant. 

Recommend: Book reservation, this place can get really busy.

From the business:
“Crave Fishbar UWS is a vibrant, convivial restaurant serving an inspired seafood menu from chef Todd Mitgang. An eclectic mix of reclaimed materials and custom made chairs and tables lend a beachy, rustic feel to the space, which houses a 25-foot-long bar where guests can order from the full raw bar,dinner menu along with cocktails and wine from a mounted bottle display. Approachable, sophisticated dishes feature local seafood, crudos, and meat dishes that are thoughtfully prepared with both familiar and exotic ingredients. Home of the #oystergram happy hour, select from all east and west coast oysters, ranging from 12-20 different types, all at happy hour price. Crave Fishbar has taken its place as a neighborhood fixture, providing locals and newcomers alike with a elegant, inviting experience.“

Surprisingly kid unfriendly place for the UWS. But that's a nice change of pace for parents who want a date night alone. Lovely upscale casual decor, and an amazing happy hour oyster deal ($1 high quality oysters) with solid (though not amazing) cocktails and seafood small plates. Among their mains, we especially like the squid ink pasta.

Great happy hour oysters and other foods. Happy hour is 7 days a week.  Lots of variety on food and drinking.  I particularly liked the oyster shooters and the spicy margarita.  The cocktails are made wth heavy pours. Thumbs up for this place.

formatted_address: 389 Broome St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: GoldBar

reviews.text: Literally my favorite bar in NYC! I had a wonderful time celebrating 2020. The staff is always nice and well put together.

Terrible. Very rude bouncers. Very rude managers. Not recommended at all. There are way better places to go and have an amazing experience in NYC. Bouncers lie on who they ID & Do not ID. If you look upper echelon you are treated like you are perfection, otherwise they do not want to be affiliated. For such a “high class bar” the bouncers have very ghetto attitudes.

I love Goldbar. This is a true locals spot and the staff, venue and crowd are a reflection of the cool diversity of the surrounding neighborhoods and the warmth of the ownership. I never have a bad time here, I never have to deal with sloppy drunks or rude, pushy attitudes, the bar is full but not a wait, the gold skulls really are as cool as they seem, and I love that they play music that isnt top 40. It’s a good mix of crowds, music and energy. Low key, local Bar crowd meets understated model/celebrity crowd without a clash. Definitely an institution.

There are a lot of skulls on the wall, but fear not you are not in an indian jone's movie. I dig gold bar, had a stellar party there with stellar drinks. The place is on the smaller side for a venue, but it's on the great side for 'everything you need'. Bathrooms are also good, for what it counts. To me? That counts. 4/5. Solid place. Would go back.
Super cool vibe!

formatted_address: 343 W 46th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Don't Tell Mama

reviews.text: Wonderful place to go after any Broadway show etc. Cant review food cause didn’t eat but drinks were good, the staff was super friendly & attentive, & the cabaret was awesome. The help sing marvelously or you can sing as well with no judgement just fun!!

(Visited July 2019)
Great spot and great piano bar! The cocktails were amazing, staff a delight and the pianist was fantastic all night! Thoroughly recommend if you are in town 1 evening!
Great Happy hour specials. Finally a drink that wasn’t watered down. We could easily spend some time and money there as the pianist rocked.

The absolute BEST. A wonderful atmosphere. Be prepared to be crammed into the bar, but it’s worth it and contributes to everyone having a great time listening to the incredible talent. I had the “.... the latte boy” and it was wonderful. 

A must-do if you love broadway
A lot of fun. Everybody performing is fantastic. Drinks are reasonable for Manhattan, especially considering the live entertainment.

formatted_address: 407 E 88th St, New York, NY 10128, USA
name: NYPartyCruise

reviews.text:
If I can give IT 0 star I Will this was one of the worst Experience I ever had people so aggressive  the security were drunk and fight with others. Music was horrible and alot Of Marijuana smoking every where you go. NO FREAKING dress code a bunch of thugs and people dress horrible girls with sneaker so the email they send about dress code being enforced it is BS 100 percent. I will never recommend this party boat to anyone i couldn't wait until 4 am to get the out of this HELL boat wow a waste of money food horrible never again. The best thing was the view on top and seeing newyor at night that is it I will put some picture

Si puedo darle a IT 0 estrellas I Will, esta fue una de las peores experiencias que he tenido personas tan agresivas que la seguridad estaba borracha y peleaba con otros.  La música era horrible y mucha marihuana fumando donde quiera que vayas.  NINGÚN CÓDIGO de vestimenta un montón de matones y personas visten chicas horribles con zapatillas, por lo que el correo electrónico que envían sobre el cumplimiento del código de vestimenta es BS 100 por ciento.  Nunca recomendaré este bote de fiesta a nadie que no podía esperar hasta las 4 de la mañana para salir de este bote del INFIERNO wow un desperdicio de dinero comida horrible nunca más.  Lo mejor fue la vista en la parte superior y ver a Newyor por la noche, es decir, pondré una foto

Love this place. Staff is always very friendly, and there is a pleasant and lively ambiance in the small dining space. The food is well seasoned and suits both the Western and Asian taste. The only minor complaint is their reservation system -- can always get a reservation but your reserved table is often not ready when you show up. I suspect they book more than they can accommodate and if you end up waiting a long while for your reserved table, they just give you a free class of wine to "compensate".
NYPartyCruise

Well this cruise is not for everyone,  didn't like the atmosphere,  kind of cheap boat. But the best part is the second floor, there I felt more comfortable.  If your taste is hip hop this is your party,  didn't work for me!

My husband and I had so much fun on the Halloween cruise and I strongly recommend it to others for it truly was a wonderful experience and we’re looking forward to attending again next year ! Hopefully we get a picture in next year 😊
It was disorganized and people didn't mingle

formatted_address: 45 Downing St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Alger House in the Village

reviews.text:
We visited a few venues, and when we arrived at the Alger House, we just KNEW it was the one. It’s a space with so much character and personality; it is classy and sophisticated, and also quirky, unique and fun. We were on a budget, so we couldn’t spend money on decorations, and we definitely didn’t need it here, as the venue has plenty of decorative elements, from plants to statues, furniture, paintings, etc. We had a fairly small wedding, 66 guests total, as well as a 6 piece band, and the space was just perfect, just enough space for people to move around and dance, but small enough so that it didn’t seem empty.

Monika showed us the venue and she helped us throughout the whole process, right until the wedding day, she was there the whole day & evening coordinating the whole thing. She was friendly, helpful and clear the whole time, she always answered all our questions in a timely manner, and she was very accommodating and flexible – she was happy for us to visit the venue as much as we wanted prior to the wedding and she let us bring and keep our things the day before with no issues. We trusted her and felt very confident and reassured every step of the way. The venue was also pretty afordable, especially when you consider New York City prices, and the fact that it included food and an open bar!

The wedding run very smoothly. The whole staff was super friendly, kind and smiley. Monika was calm and made sure everything went ok and on time. She made sure to check with us throughout the night, and made sure we didn’t forget to eat! Oh, and the food was delicious, all our guests commented on it. The venue looked beautiful, they provided all the tables, cloths, candles, glasses, plates, etc, so that we didn’t have to worry about it. We also brought a couple of our own objects and also some sweets and our cake, and they were able to accommodate those with no problems. The extra room upstairs was a great place to get ready and spend some time with our bridesmaids & groomsmen, and it’s a great place to take photos, and also just an extra space for guests to go to.

We have THE best time at The Alger House, it was the perfect wedding venue for us in New York City. Thank you!!
Amazing place for an event with a great upstairs lounge and brilliant up stairs bathroom. Really cool decor that sets a nice mood.

My son and daughter-in-law had thier 30th Anniversary Party here.. The appetizers were fabulous, the entrees delicious, the staff was on top of everything..very alert and aware..the event planner was very amicable and available the evening of the event..

Ours was a gathering of 50ppl with music and everything went off as planned..having been a director of catering myself I know the anxieties of what could go wrong. 

Would recommend Alger house to any of my friends..pdoc
Unbelieveable food and customer service. staff was very Professional, Consultative, Competitive, Flexible, Outstanding hopeful attitude on top of horrible food.Thank you!!
Great place for photo shooting. Decor and service are fabulous. I highly recommend this place!

formatted_address: 2080 Frederick Douglass Blvd, New York, NY 10026, USA
name: Paint 'N Pour Studio New York

reviews.text: Went here last night. The setting was cool. There were multiple rooms with different paint themes. You have to create your painting from scratch. The FREE drinks were okay taste wise. All four of us had 3 drinks and no one was twisted. There is no going over on the time, your session is your session. They played music the vibes was good. They also had a bar with the top shelf liquor. The food was good, only issue was the meat in the chicken and waffle. It was dark meat and fatty. I never had chicken and waffle meat that texture. Only one bathroom, out of the 2 was working. Other wise then that it was all good.  Also they give a discount if you do a YELP review, BUT your YELP account have to be established prior.

Had a great time for my wife's birthday. We had a great time painting the drinks were good. The food was good. Some people in my party got their food late but the waitress was cool and letting us know the kitchen  was backed up. We had a great time and we were in the biggie studio I would definitely recommend it.

I had a awesome time when I went with my friends. We had an amazing instructor who was fun, and detailed, she made us feel so welcomed. She didn't have an original picture for us to look at, but she made the best of it. The kitchen was a little backed up but the food was delicious, the drinks were good, they could have been a little stronger. Our waitress was not the nicest, I guess because our group was very large she was overwhelmed, but overall my friends and I had a blast!!! Definitely coming back again and again!!!!

I must say it’s an amazing atmosphere a nice down to earth chill spot but what I don’t like is the service prey on the drunk and tipsy although the food is really good please watch your bill and what you pay. My server Jay was really nice And tried to keep up with the crowd but when it was time to pay she precisely told me and my guess you will not be charge tip on your card I’d rather cash and when you get the bill you notice she’s already charged tip and I think it’s unfair for her to get two generously tips and we where told otherwise.

Everything Was Amazing I just think timing can be a little better . Tell the guest to arrive 15 mins early so everyone can get settled in and seated .2 hours goes by really fast when you start letting people come in at 6. Our instructor E was very down to earth she’s amazing she had the crowd going dope music she had a mixture of old school new school . Drinks were just right because they definitely sneak up on you after the 3rd one

formatted_address: 37 W 26th St, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: The Flatiron Room

reviews.text:
Usual spot. Elegant ambience, great food and service.

Drinks: Good choices, great drinks.

Food: Not a lot of options, but, the food is amazing. Oysters are good quality. Potato with bravo sauce, delicious. Mac & Cheese is Heavenly! Planning to try more items on their menu. 

Service: Seamless and perfect. Extremely experienced staff. Service perfect matches the upscale ambience.

Ambience: Love the live music. Elegant and upscale vibe.

Definitely planning to visit it more often.

A great spot for jazz and conversation in a gorgeous setting. Stay for their handcrafted cocktails, extensive whisky selection, or some great small bites or full dinner menu. Reservations are HIGHLY recommended. Icon parking garage across street for those driving into the city.

Great venue for live music. Lots of blues and jazz throughout the whole night. You should definitely take a look if you’re in the city and looking for high quality music! Make sure you reserve in advance - there’s a very limited amount of front row seating near the musician(s) for the night.

This place is absolutely amazing I highly recommend this place for a romantic dinner or a night out to grab drinks. Atmosphere is like a 1920's speakeasy and great music and very friendly staff. My wife and I had dinner here and we had the pleasure of having Pierre as our server he was great, very knowledgeable about everything this place has to offer. We went back a second time and requested to have Pierre because he was such an amazing server. We definitely will be coming back to this amazing restaurant next time we return to New York.
Brilliant! A classic, jazz-fueled “speakeasy“ feel. Upscale clientele with bartenders as knowledgeable about spirits as you will find anywhere.  A dark, romantic interior—You must visit!

formatted_address: 709 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Panchita's Place

reviews.text: Lunch and brunch menus are both superb. Great drinks and nice little place. If you’re hungry after visiting Greenwood Cemetery don’t miss this spot!

The past few days I've been ordering a build your own salad from Panchitas for lunch. I ADORE IT! i could eat from here everyday. They have so many options and everyone in my office enjoyed their meals as well. It's rare we all like the food from one place and EXTRA rare that we eat from there two days in a row.

Speaking entirely from the delivery experience, this place is absolutely awesome.  Scrumptious Mexican digs full of flavor, beautiful sauces, everything arriving as it should (hot/crispy/on time) and you can really just taste the freshness.  These folks clearly take pride in what they do!

Great venue! Small restaurant but the food was delicious and the portions were great. I was still hungry eating at another nearby restaurant that has fairly small portions and discovered this little gem. Great place and I recommend that you stop by if you are in the area.

This is my favorite neighborhood spot. It has a quiet, relaxed atmosphere for dining in, but it's also a great delivery option. They have many tasty vegetarian options for me (I love the taco melt and burrito with sofritas) but my omnivorous spouse loves their food as well. Try all the salsas, they're phenomenal. They also have a great brunch menu. I'm a fan of the huevos divorciados.

formatted_address: 59 Grand St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Lucky Strike

reviews.text: A neighborhood classic! The steak and french fries are to die for. this is a really nice spot in Soho where most things are over commercialized and not local. I can recommend almost everything that I've eaten here and I think that the staff and the atmosphere are really a contribution to the neighborhood.

Very strong cocktails (good for post-Soho shopping) and the best (not seen here) shoe string French fries. The upfront bar section (shown) is more casual and good in the daytime for natural light. The space in the back is a bit more intimate but offers more space for larger groups. The menu never changes and the people are quite nice.

Not my first brunch here... it was a while since my last visit,  but I’m not coming back. I should have realized that when I walked in. The place was unusually empty... see picture. The service was awful. I give them 2 stars, because the food was eatable... bye bye “Lucky Strike” it was nice while it lasted.
Delicious food and friendly staff. Can be very noisy as it is such a small space.
I used to come here all the time when I lived in SoHo and it's still just as perfect.

formatted_address: 6403 11th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11219, USA
name: Parc Oasis Oyster Bar

reviews.text: Excellent seafood. Everything tastes very fresh. The raw bar selection is extensive and the size of the oysters are bigger than most other places. They offer lots of bubble tea options and seasonal drinks. The prices are reasonable considering the quality and size of the portions. They have quite a bit of pasta selections as well and steak options. If you're in the mood for seafood and some surf and turf. I would highly recommend this place.
$1.00 oyster/clam happy hour. Close to home, easy going place to hang with friends for a drink.

Very good Oysters and clams.
As others have said, its a little pricey, and slow service. Sometimes only 1 waiter for whole restaurant. But overall pretty good. 

The 1 star is for the smell. Its an open kitchen type of arrangement, and even though its in the back, and we sat in the front close to the fish tank, the entire restaurant stunk of cooking smells and garlic.
My buddies and mine clothing were completely saturated with garlic stink when we left.

Fix your goddammned ventilation!!!
The food is good, the place itself is nice and cozy. The service is a little slow however. You can also ask for one if the fish in the aquarium.
Food is good, service was OK they don't really check on you, waived at them for good couple mins for them to notice. On pricier side for a local gig.

formatted_address: 114 W 47th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Taco Dumbo

reviews.text: This place is nice, really nice. Price is reasonable compared to most places in the area. You can have a seat or order to go. Vegan dishes are filling even if you are not vegan. They are quick during the lunch rush and you can order online to speed up the in & out process. Decor is very impressive.

The margaritas were good. The chicken tortilla soup was good. The rest of the food we ordered was underwhelming, especially the street corn. The ambience was nice and a great getaway in the middle of the city.

Super nice spot with fairly reasonable prices! Looks a lot more expensive than it is and the food is reaaaally good, and I loved that they had so many vegan options. The servers were all super nice and cool and my friends and I all had a great experience!
Great food. Comparable to eating from a really good taco stand. Be prepared for a long line that may lead to outside, also standing room only which is good enough to eat and go.

One of my favorite places. This location is very roomy, and since it is in Times Square,  it's a bit bustling. The vibe is very fun and chill. The tacos and nachos are delicious and they have a ton of vegan options. The soft serve is great too, mostly because of their topnotch toppings! It's a great place to take vegans and non vegans, or just people with dairy sensitivities.  They don't use any dairy. They also have a bar with fun drinks. I'm so glad that this place is here!

formatted_address: 381 Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10027, USA
name: Harlem Hookah

reviews.text: Harlem hookah decor is pretty chic for it to be a hookah bar. Hookah was nice and the taste was pleasant. Tried the skittles flavor. Sweet and fruity. The triple H was my drink of choice; definitely can taste the Hennessy throughout. I would try this place on a Friday or Saturday. Ended coming on a Sunday, very chill atmosphere.

I came here on a random Saturday and it was a good vibe. We had to wait about 20 minutes to get in but once we were in the service for food was quick, drinks took a bit longer. We got quesadillas, wings and calamari which were all delicious. The drinks were also strong, the bar tender even made me something special. We also got hookah which lasted a while. Would definitely come back!
Very nice spot, the waitresses seem attentive. The hooka is what it is going too be. The price is steep, so don't go there on a budget. Go there expecting to pay for the experience.

I Decided to go this this spot last minute on a Friday after work and happy that I did. My coworker and I had a great time. First off- I love the decor and the staff was attentive and friendly. Amanda the bartender- was great and the drinks were on point. The options for happy hour food/drinks & hookah were also great. They greet you and check i.d upon arrival (for everyone). If you are looking for a spot to hit up on a Friday, this is it! The music is also banging- this may happen to be my after work spot on Friday's.

Good music, good hookah, happy hour, pleasant staff, good security, great decor, clean bathroom. It’s definitely more of an upbeat club like feel. I have been to hookah lounges that have a more of a laid back feel. But this one was more of a bar/club. Still had a great time.

formatted_address: 100 W 125th St, New York, NY 10027, USA
name: Olive Garden Italian Restaurant

reviews.text: The food was very delicious and succulent. The new dish I ordered was just a little bit salty but I had a glass of water next to me so I was OK. The drink was very good. I would definitely order the blue drink(I forgot the name) again. The waitress named Lucy was excellent, great, informative, and very friendly. Even though I would give my total rating for 4 stars because my dish was a little salty to me, Lucy's customer service was awesome, so I am giving 5 stars. I will definitely come back to this location.

The waiters are really rude, and the servers served clients that came after me and never took my order, when I moved to the bar the bartender/server was also being rude and not giving me his undivided. I was better off going to wholefooods. I use to like coming here but this place has become my least favorite restaurant in NYC. Olive garden manager needs to train their employees better to serve the clients as if it weren't for us they wouldn't have a job. Be and do better.

I truly think this is the best Olive Garden in our area. The Bay Plaza one in The Bronx and Forest Hills one have surly servers and the food is not as good as this one. The Times Square one is a weird experience. You are only a number and it feels that way. The Harlem location is by far and away the best of the four I have been to in the City

We came about 40 minutes before closing, but the service was still swift and polite. The serving sizes were substantial relative to the pricing, and the salad and bread sticks were good (though the bread sticks weren't as good as they were upstate). It was overall a very good experience, and I would definitely go here again!
Eating at the bar gave me fast friendly service. And the munch menus was absolutely  perfect even for the price.  Most definitely will be eating here again. Thank you Olive Garden

formatted_address: 163 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: La Bella Vita

reviews.text: Family oriented Italian restaurant. The food was delicious but the service from my male server needed to be much better. While ordering, he made me feel uncomfortable by his comments on one of my request for one of the six dishes that I ordered for me and my family. Basically I asked if the extra charge for one of my dishes could be waived since I was ordering six different dinner dishes. He stated that it was a restaurant and that only supermarket gives discounts. Right after that I noticed that my utensils were dirty. The hostess was really nice and helpful when seen us coming in from the rain. My each of my family members stated that they liked the food. I liked it too, but due to they way the waitress managed to served us, did not make my experience an excellent one. I will not return.

Decent food. High prices, NO FREE SOFT DRINK REFILLS. Plan accordingly. Good bread, but crust slightly burnt-tasting. VERY tight quarters. Had the chicken parm... Chicken was good, spaghetti could have been store bought. Tasty sauce.
Great food... Our server was friendly... Cute little restaurant in Little Italy!!

This is a MUST place to eat when in “little Italy”.  The owner is super friendly, staff very efficient and the food is absolutely amazing!!! We had the 10” Pepperoni Pizza to share (the wife and I) and it was packed with flavour!!!  Very clean and just a great place to take a load off and and enjoy the atmosphere.  Highly recommended.  You won’t regret it.

The food was decent however the host of the evening was AWFUL!!! We made a reservation(party of two) for 8pm which I realize the restaurant is busy since it’s Valentine’s Day but seriously this man decided to go based on who he saw fit to go inside rather than by reservation. Mind you we arrived 30 minutes early and let him know that our reservation was at 8pm so that he couldn’t claim we were late. As a person of color, he made me and my date feel uncomfortable as he figured a white couple (party of 2) who was there after us deserved to go in first. If it wasn’t for our white allies we would’ve still been outside in the 20 degree weather waiting past our reservation time. If you like subpar food with a sweet side of racism come to La Bella Vita on Mulberry St.

formatted_address: 171 Grand St, Brooklyn, NY 11249, USA
name: Salt + Charcoal

reviews.text: Everything was made to perfection. The A5 is very fulfilling and an 8oz can defiantly be a shared meal. The place gets really packed with a long waiting time so call in advance and make reservations. The hostess and waiter had excellent customer service and the Manager went out to greet every table.

Tried the porter house today. Parties bigger than 4 like ourselves had to sit outside sadly very good place! This place has been on my radar for a while and I went today for a friend's birthday

Update 12/23/19
went back tonight food still as good as I remembered it. Had the porter house fish of the day and duck tonight.

Went for a celebratory dinner and was impressed. I recommend trying some of the sushi rolls. The lamb was so good I picked it up and started eating it off the bone. The service was attentive and if you have a gluten allergy they are very accommodating.

Very nice restaurant with wonderful steaks and sushi. This one the best restaurants that has very flavorful sushi and extremely fresh steaks. I suggest a New York strip but ask them to slice it for you

My in laws came to visit and we took them here. We had some sushi appetizers, seaweed salad, and the porterhouse steak. The food was really food, but what really drove me to give them five stars was the service. We came in with my one and a half year old son. I always feel a bit nervous going to restaurants that are more elegant, since New York overall doesn’t seem to be very baby friendly. There are some restaurants that make it very clear (even on their website) that kids are not welcome. I really appreciated that the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcomed there. They brought my son a small plate of strawberries, and a little plastic water glass with a straw. It may be a small gesture, but it was really appreciated. Fantastic steak too!

formatted_address: 450 Park Ave S, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: PS 450

reviews.text: Carlos at the back bar was amazing! Made sure that me and my girlfriend were well taken care of the whole time we sat at the bar and had brunch! I HIGHLY recommend this place. Extremely happy that we picked this place and extremely excited to visit in the summer as well! Thank you Carlos and the rest of the staff! Can’t wait to see you all in the summer!
Great cocktail after work hours.  Nice atmosphere. Great service
Thanks to Kristen, my crew had a f ing blast! Drinks kept coming & food was deeeelicious!!
Very nice decor and chill vibe. Had some great drinks at the bar with friends. The cosmos made by our bartender Ana were perfect. Will for sure come back to this bar!

Fun place. Saturday brunch feels more like a Saturday night. Gets crowded and the service is not the best. Expect to mix your own drinks for a larger group with house champagne and juices. Food was better than expected.

formatted_address: 305 Smith St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Kittery

reviews.text: What an amazing dining experience! This was my second time here and I was fortunate enough to get Diana and Herbert as my servers.
