Regardless of who you get from management down to the kitchen staff, everyone is amazing.  The oysters, clams and shrimp for happy hour or not only an amazing deal but they are fresh and succulent. It’s a Great neighborhood restaurant that is very much kid friendly they caters to the seafood lover. I absolutely recommend this place any time of day. Enjoying
The food was absolutely DELICIOUS!!! Everything was so fresh and the service was impeccable!!!! Definitely a new go to for a bite in BK. ❤️

Starting out by saying we only experienced the appetizers here, but for what we experienced the overall feedback is we would come back again to see what else that have to offer. There are definitely things that could have been better, but you get what you pay for. Our total for two was around 70 dollars and we left stuffed. The mussels in white wine sauce were delicious and the extra bread that was provided dipped in the sauce was glorious. We also got the crab cake which was more bready than crabby, which was expected for the price of 13 dollars. Make sure you come here for happy hour, the oysters are small but in nyc you can’t beat dollar oysters🤘🤘All in all, it was definitely a great spot, great for large groups and families.

I ate at the bar indoors, but they do have an outdoor bar area. 

Happy hour seven days a week. Saturday and Sunday brunch 11-4. No reservations needed for parties of two, but taken for larger parties. Great raw bar specials happy hour $1 oysters, shrimp, clams; draft beers and house wines. I recommend you stay with draft beer or upgrade yourself to mixed drinks. 

Only street side parking. Not a family place; a great adult place. Cash, credit, debit accepted.

I don’t know why this place doesn’t have more than 4.9 rating.. it has a great atmosphere with great and friendly staff. Food was amazing. Definitely will come again and will recommend this place to others. It’s a 5 out of 5!!

formatted_address: 240 W 30th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: TAP

reviews.text: I used VenueTap to book my recent birthday.  I love the concept and the booking process could not be any easier.  I just went onto their site, entered what I was planning (a birthday party in this case), for how many people and which date.  The site then gave me a bunch of options, I selected the one that looked the best, filled out the information listed and someone contacted me within a few hours.  I booked at this awesome sports bar called The Royal and the party went off without a hitch.  Highly recommended!

I use venuetap all the time to schedule happy hours with friends and for work...the website offers great deals and even more of a discount for certain happy hours which we LOVED. 2 for 1 margaritas, 1/2 off specialty cocktails etc. As soon as I submitted my request I was contacted and the party was planned and set up in no time (and no hassle for me!)...could not be easier. Venuetap is especially helpful to me because I just moved to the city and it gives me an overview of what to expect, pictures, menus, drink prices etc for all the venues listed on the website. Great way to explore NYC online!

formatted_address: St James Pl, Brooklyn, NY 11238, USA
name: Temple Of Jesus

reviews.text: Amazing

formatted_address: 477 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Hi Life Bar & Grill

reviews.text: Good Service,  Nice selection of craft beers.  Even though bustling, place was quiet enough for a conversation.  Food was passable and the wine list was a bit weak.  But the desserts (sour cream apple pie) were delicious!

Cozy Retro UWS gem for unfussy service and well executed bar food including some really solid steaks. Raw bar consistently excellent (the happy hour deal is killer)

Hi-Life has a very solid Happy Hour 4-7 along with a great value Night Owl promo from 10 to close. Cheap domestics and well drinks along with some Appetizer deals.  Kitchens open LATE on Fridays and Saturdays.
This spot has amazing service and delightful menu. The best restaurant in the city. The food came out fast and the prices are fair. Highly recommended.

From the first moment  you arrive in that place  they give you a great feeling. Very warm team, it is a lovely restaurant to  enjoy with buddies or with your date. delicious  cuisine, professional  chef, comfortable  pay and courteous  service. Warmly recommended.

It was a good place to find a bagel and lox AND mimosa, tho it was a plain bagel and I prefer everything bagels. The vibe is weird, like a 50’s diner that’s trying to be hip, but not sure what it is. The food was relatively good, and the service was good, but the fact it couldn’t figure out a vibe kind of made it a weird experience. Overall I probably won go back... not a place I’d recommend, but I wouldn’t say it was bad either... solidly middle of the road

formatted_address: 345 E 6th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Tableside Italian Cook Shoppe

reviews.text: We love this place. We especially like having dinner at the bar because it feels cozy and we like talking with the bartender and the manager and other staff. We feel relaxed and connected. Great food which is obviously the most important thing. But also great people rates even higher with us.

I’m a local, and this is my favorite neighborhood restaurant. The service is excellent, food is to die for, and cocktail menu is exquisite. Ive been back more than 6x since finding it, and after the first time, Anthony, the owner, remembered me and my favorite cocktail. Absolute must visit for anyone looking for home cooked style Italian.

Such a cute, romantic date spot.  The atmosphere, the service and the food were all top notch.  I had the lasagna, it was huge and amazing and I ate the leftovers in the middle of the night.  Will definitely be back.
The food is incredible! Deciding what to order is difficult but you can’t go wrong. The complimentary bread and basil hummus is a lovely way to start your food journey 😍
Stumbled upon this restaurant and so glad we did. Sat at the bar and the staff here was so attentive and friendly. Food and drinks were amazing. What a great atmosphere! Highly recommend 👍🏼

formatted_address: 256 W 52nd St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Russian Samovar Restaurant and Piano Bar

reviews.text: Russian Samovar has every vodka infusion imaginable and they do it all in house. They have some funky ones like garlic but a good way to try them all is getting a vodka flight of 6 for $24, instead of $6 each. You can order a flight to be shared among friends. Have 4 or 5 (depending on your tolerance) vodka shots or vodka-infused shots and still feel functional the next morning. There is live music and piano playing on most evenings. It can get pretty lively later in the evening. Overall, it's good great food and excellent quality vodka. Love the atmosphere and crowd here. It's a real one of a kind experience in New York, and close to Times Square. However, it tends to end up being pretty pricey with food and drinks and the coat check is mandatory and not complimentary.

First time in a Russian bar and it was great, I'm only giving 4 stars as the tasting vodka was awful! But still it was a nice experience. It's a bar for the whole family, they have a band playing the piano and the violin, they were great and the vibe was is amazing. Totally worth a try.

Food here is okay, better places to get Russian food, but the piano was wonderful. Staff was great and the place was clean. The tables are a little close together. Flavored vodkas are worth a try. If you're in the area stop by.

It was absolutely fantastic. I've been coming here for over 20 years and had stopped because things had gone down hill. I came here for the first time in 3 years and was pleasantly surprised by both the exceptionally delicious food, the personalized service. It's great to see the legendary place really come into its own!
This place is just a pure fun! If you have guests from out of town don’t forget to come here. The music, the food and the infused vodka is just great! Ohh did I mention the cool white piano? Must go!

formatted_address: 527 W 51st St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: club undr

formatted_address: 69 Broadway, New York, NY 10006, USA
name: Alans Mum

formatted_address: 120 Bedford Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11249, USA
name: Kava Social

reviews.text: I had an iced kratom drink, and worked on my laptop for a few hours. Very relaxing place to sit for a few hours, super friendly staff and beautiful murals and furniture. Will absolutely return here again
Very unique cozy relaxing artistic place. Absolutely LOVE their super cool teas. This is something that you never experienced before. MUST go trust me!

Chiiiiiillll space. Lots of comfy chairs, mood lighting, and vibey playlists. Stopped by on a Sunday and most folks were meeting for casual conversation or working on their laptops (free WiFi is a plus). Barista acknowledged us right away and helped us pick our drinks. Highly recommend the vegan chai!

One of the best places I've found near Bedford to work and relax. The service was stupendous and the kava was a very nice find. The music selection was great and unobstrusive and there is actual space between tables so you don't feel like you're crammed in a cereal box like in most cafes in NYC. Definitely coming back.
Cool spot, comforting work space. 100 mbit wifi speeds, great for work.

formatted_address: 80 Grove St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Luis Gomez Presents SPUNK @ The Monster

reviews.text: Bel endroit pour tout le monde.  Personnel sympathique . Pavement per cash mais il ya des distributeur a linterieur. Cool
Passei em frente quando estava caçando Pokémon, tinha um Taurus logo adiante hahahaha

formatted_address: 97 St Marks Pl, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Yaffa Cafe

reviews.text: Love this place, if you catch it just right on a good day wont be as crowded and you can sit and chill with a book basking in the ambience. Sometimesthe staff seem uninterested but leave you alone for the most part. Wish i lived below 80th just so I could go more often.

This place is fantastic to work on the weekends or have a beer in that back yard. Is never busy, they always have good music, and it's just a cool hang out spot.

The food is not that great but it's not bad either, it just looks like diner food, good enough if you're hungry.
I like this place. Went to have a late night snack here with the most beautiful girl in the world, M. Shalina.

Yaffa Cafe is a good place to grab a steamed milk and late-night meal or coffee and post-event dessert. Its kitschy decor is fun (think Hedwig and the Angry Inch), and it has a good-sized outdoor patio in the back. I used to bring books there to study or just read (and eat) in peace -- the casual service in the off-hours gives you a lot of time to do both. Just make sure to tip your server well if you're squatting on a table for more than an hour or so!

Passed by today and discovered that it was closed due to health code violations. I read elsewhere that they changed management back in June 2014 (or so), and has since declined. :(

Even though it's not the greatest of places, they had good carrot dressing for salads, their Berber chicken was always tasty, and service was generally pretty good. Hope they get it together and clean up their act because it's an East Village institution, and I liked going there because it always gave me a homey feel.

formatted_address: 132 Montague St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Caffe Buon Gusto

reviews.text: I've been coming here for over 25 years and I am still in love. I am sorry they moved, but they are still on the same street. I took myself out for a meal last night and took pictures of everything I ate because it was so beautiful.

Beautiful little Italian spot. Home made pasta, white table clothes and the whole host of wonderful experiences. 

We booked for a date night on the 4th and walked down a few blocks to enjoy the fireworks. 

Food was delightful and appealed to all of your senses. High quality and reminiscent of our meals in Italy. Quite a pleasing selection and choices for pasta and non pasta lovers of Italian food.
Good, but nothing to write home about.  Prix Fixe menu is a good deal, though.
This spot is worth a try. They have big portions for affordable rates. Constantly neat and with awesome vibes. Will come visit again.
Atmosphere pleasant. Didnt care for the food was too bland.

formatted_address: 5 Front St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: GRAN ELÉCTRICA

reviews.text: Been waiting to try this place after seeing some decent reviews. This is definitely a bit of a tourist trap the prices are astronomical given the portions. Good vibe inside which is redeeming. Margarita was overly sweet. Wouldn’t rush back here unless the patio was open.
Great Tacos and a lovely portico where you can relax and enjoy their wide variety of drinks. Would definitely recommend for a lazy summer afternoon.

A great Mexican restaurant for brunch in the Brooklyn bridge area, a very nice patio setting. The brunch menu has a bit of everything and it would satisfy your desires for authentic Mexican flavors. Their variety of margaritas is just wonderful, staff is friendly and helpful. A real Mexican treat in the heart of Brooklyn.

We loved this small restaurant! The trendy vibe was in line with the DUMBO neighborhood, and the tin ceiling was amazing. There is a small bar, then two dining areas, both of which have lots of natural light. The interior is modern, and the wallpaper is themed, and continues even into the bathroom hand dryer (love the inclusive bathrooms!) . The food was good, and I really wish I'd gotten the ceviche (next table had it and said it was excellent).  We'll be back to try more!

The food was tasty but not worth the price tag, I paid $14 for tacos and $12 for empanadas when it really should've been $4 lower for both - you're more paying for atmosphere than anything else, but experience was average overall

formatted_address: 72 Guernsey St, Brooklyn, NY 11222, USA
name: Vintage

formatted_address: 59 W 21st St, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Doux

reviews.text: Worst experience as a New Yorker NYE denied me and my party because we were BLACK. At the door first they told us $200 a person, then $900 for two bottles at the bar and no tables were available. after 2 people left because they recognized the descrimination, 3 people we agreed to pay 600 for a bar spot and 1 bottle, they preceded to decline us, after we agreed with 3 people to pay 900 the original deal for twice the party, they then told us only tables were available for $2000. The run around was unnecessary and the racism couldn’t be more blatant if you don’t want us in you establishment make a dress code or put a swastica outside everybody got money nowadays
Great bar and not a frat location. The atmosphere is great and the bartenders are awesome. Well worth the 30 cover IF your planning on spending some time here.

Their mandatory coat check was simply a money grab. I wore a leather jacket that I was forced to check even after advising that it was a part of my outfit. Currently standing around in a tank top. Many other women were forced to remove any top layers of their outfits that were deemed “jackets” or coats. Furthermore the event I came to advertised drink specials til 6pm but the bartenders said 5pm (the doors only opened at 4). Never coming again for sure.

I was assaulted by one of the employees. As we were heading out the employee decided to insult my family. I was then choked against the wall and then the floor. After asking to speak to whoever was in charge (manager or owner) I was blatantly ignored by the staff at the entrance. After calling the police to report the assault, I was told this place has been closed down multiple times because of incidents like these. DO NOT COME HERE IF YOU WISH TO BE SAFE!

I was so excited first about this place! 
By the pictures,​ you could say that the club is upscale and trendy. But in reality,​ it's really dirty and partly even gross! Tables are sticky, bathrooms are just out of service and it's really nasty being inside. 
Prices are too high for such small portions. The music is too loud and heavy, we all had a headache after a few hours being there. 
The guards are extremely rude and they won't answer any of your questions. My friend's coat was lost, even though the place is not crowded. The manager refused our complaints and ask a security to make us walk away. We were just pissed!

formatted_address: 330 W 58th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: RedCork Food & Wine

reviews.text: Cool vibes while having steak, sushi, and sake
I love Jonathan. He always provides tip top service! Good food , good drinks !
I love the service. Wonderful place to be

Bit of a random menu, but everything prepared quite well.    They won my heart with an impossibly accurate version of carbonara, something that eludes nearly all American restaurants.   (No, there truly should never be cream.   Please believe me.) Sweet service, easy on the eyes.   Good prices, considering the location.    Intriguing wine list, worth exploring.
Very good sushi but service was a little slow.

formatted_address: 222 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Ed's Lobster Bar

reviews.text: Very friendly and welcoming staff to chat to. We had a great lobster pasta dish which my teenage son was the best pasta dish he'd ever had. I had a lobster role small size which was good and felt like an authentic NY treat. They get fresh lobsters in from Maine every day.

Food was excellent. The mini lobster rolls are the perfect sharing size if you're looking to appeal to your tastebuds. The lobster mac and cheese had the perfect combination of cheese and lobster in it. The fried pickles were crispy and had the perfect texture.

The food itself tasted pretty delicious. Really enjoyed the lobster roll!

Three stars because the portion size is relatively small on many dishes and on the high-end in terms of price for a tiny seafood shop. For example, fried clams  was $17 and it contained 5 clams?

In summary, it's a boughie little seafood place that has some good flavors going for it, but there isn't much room or much food to justify what they are charging.

I like this spot! They offer tasty food, they have a rich menu, The chief cook in that spot is an expert, I love very much tasting all their dishes. The dishes are consistently fresh, the attitude towards the customers  is nice. I often eat in this place and I not even once was unhappy. I recommend it to all my friends.

For years my twin sister and I have been going to Ed's Lobster Bar to celebrate our Birthday. Somehow, Aaron always recognizes us and always makes us feel at home. The lobster roll is sublime and the service is exquisite.Thank your Ed and Aaron!!!!

formatted_address: 177 Henry St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Les Enfants de Bohème

reviews.text: I LOVE this place! The food is always excellent and the menu changes regularly. Farm to table, fresh, organic. The cocktails are also delicious and seasonal. And on top of that it's a community. You'll always run into interesting people you might have already met there. Can't say enough good things about Les Enfants!

I just love these modern and young French restaurants when the food is simple but serious, the atmosphere sort of trendy but not really, and the staff is way cooler than you could ever been. Tartare was good. They have an interesting take on the burger. Setting is nice with fun drawings on the wall.

I am a Jersey girl currently living in the south of France. I used to love the old Les Enfants back in the day, so I was super psyched to find this new incarnation a few years back. I now make a point of having at least one meal there when I come to New York. The cocktails are delicious and not crazy expensive and the vegetarian option is always delicious. French cuisine is such a melange of flavors and cultures these days, and this restaurant certainly brings it all to New York.  Thanks you wonderful people, I look forward to the next delicious experience.

The food was great. But the service was less then pleasant. We had reservations for 5.45,restaurant was empty yet they waitress told me we are sold out tonight so we cannot sit you until all four of you are here. Restaurant is empty still
We sat down to dinner the waitress began to rush us out before we even ordered.
By the time we left there were still open tables.
Very upsetting to not be able too fully enjoy a good meal because we felt pushed out before we sat down.

I happened to work around the area and was looking for something different and found this place. I love it! The place is very cozy and I love the decor. It’s truly a cool place. Great vibe! I tried their bohemian burger and it was perfect! This place offers discounts for local workers so I am grateful for it. The server was polite but a little slow. Space is adequate. I would highly recommend this place.Happy eating! ❤️

formatted_address: 2128 Frederick Douglass Blvd, New York, NY 10026, USA
name: Row House

reviews.text: Stopped in on a busy rainy day and were pleasantly greeted and sat at a table.  We had a very attentive waiter and enjoyed the complimentary drinks that came with brunch. Mid-meal a DJ started playing music. All the food was great but the potatoes and vegetables that came with the omelet had a little too much heat for my wife. (I thought they were perfect.) As our son lives nearby, I’m sure we’ll be back.

The place is nice and food was good but it took forever to get our food. It’s a Saturday night so I get it but there were only two waiters servicing 10 tables and it’s super busy at the bar. I went here because last time the service was great. This time not so much. It was ok. Our waiter could tell I was getting annoyed because it took 45 minutes to get our food. I even saw people sit and then leave because of what I assume was long service. Hopefully it’s not like this all the time. 2 stars.

Loved the location and interior.  Very lively crowd.  Some dishes were excellent but the most disappointing was my short rib.  Biggest surprise was the bathrooms, waiting on a stall and a couple came out one-by-one (gross) and they could have been cleaned more regularly during the busy brunch shift.
Second time visiting. Food is a bit salty and the atmosphere is a bit noisy. Otherwise good.

Today was a great day...we said our last goodbye to Adrienne Braithwaite at the Row House....The shrimp and grits was on point, the burgers was a little dry but otherwise it was a good place.  The atmosphere was nice and friendly for the service.  I will have to go another time for a different occasion.

formatted_address: 450 W 131st St, New York, NY 10027, USA
name: New HipHop Artist

formatted_address: 760 8th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: 760 Club

reviews.text:
This place is horrible. They don’t honor the event tickets. They keep you outside till the tickets are invalid yet there is no one on the inside.
Depending on who find at the door, u might get away with wearing sneakers. They all have different definitions of sneakers is different. The inconsistency is really noticeable. Worst place to hang out
The music is pretty lame( this was the complaint I got when I asked the people who were leaving as I was getting in).

formatted_address: 347 Court St, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA
name: Enoteca

reviews.text: Warm ambiance, beautiful pizza oven and bar. Friendly and efficient service. We recommend the Apple Salad, crisp and fresh, the pizza, and the great wine selections (the Sangiovese treated us right).

Great pizza. I haven't had much else to try besides the pizza and salad. The restaurant is decent sized and there is a small bar area in the front. There is also outside seating in the back. The prices are fair and the staff is friendly. Definitely worth checking out.
Enjoyed a wonderful dinner here, great service and atmosphere.
This is my favorite restaurant ,I've been coming here for a few years now and not once have I been disappointed 😊
The best pizza 👌 in town, and the price is more than fair. Plenty of choices from the menu, excellent professional staff. Highly recommend for a brunch with friends

formatted_address: 3 E 52nd St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: La Grenouille

reviews.text: Simply put ....it is a dining experience. The food was exceptional, the ambiance incredible and the staff a sheer joy. Recommend the creamy chicken pot pie in the luncheon menu. It is unctuous, velvety comfort food with delicate, crispy pastry.
Absolutely amazing experience - ambiance, service, food, desert! Pricey, but worth it.

This chic restaurant literally makes you feel like you're eating at the most fabulous wedding with the most amount of flowers I have ever seen in one venue! Service was great, we sat at the bar and the bartender made us some really wonderful drinks and recommended the mussels with white wine and garlic. He was not wrong about the food or drink recommendations! Make sure you save some bread for the mussels, you're going to want every drop of that sauce. I promise. Highly recommend.

Great service,  enchanting decor, good food.
I am writing this review with great regret.  La Grenouille would be my once a month absolute treat if and only if they would stop spraying the entire place (especially the upholstered furniture) every morning with an absolutely disgusting, cloying scent.  I love this restaurant but I stopped going there because the scent makes me ill.  At most a restaurant should smell of food, not like a perfume shop.

La Grenouille is a superb restaurant. It is a marvelous restaurant with a excellent food prepared and served by a wonderful staff who are courteous, professional and attentive. This level of service has been forgotten in most restaurants today. The dining room is beautiful in its own right. Tony, the bartender, is very friendly and welcoming to all. In addition, he makes the very best Manhattan cocktail in all of New York City.

formatted_address: 939 8th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Guantanamera

reviews.text: The food was wonderful (we had never had Cuban cuisine before), but the real draw was the kind service. The waiter was great, the manager kindly found us a table even though our electronic reservation apparently didn't go through, and we saw a blind couple on a date kindly being guided to the door by the manager as they wanted to leave. This is a very welcoming place!

This place was amazing the food was good the drinks were okay  but the atmosphere was what you really go for. The live band, hand rolled cigars free with tip, and the very nice servers are what make the dining experience good. The food was delicious, I had their pork chop with their tasty sauce. The chop was a little on the chewy side but none the less it wasnt terrible and the sangria was okay but not worth the price. All in all it was a fun place to go to.

I love this spot. This was my 3rd time here, once at the bar and twice to sit and eat dinner. They play great music. When they have a band perform, they are fantastic. The service is amazing. The food is even better! I've eaten the shrimp in garlic sauce & the churrasco, both are so delicious! Even their fries are SO GOOD! It is a small location but it's worth it. I even enjoy the lighting and the decor. Great Ambiance!
Excellent music!! Such a great place to truly enjoy one's own culture and food. Service was not the best that night but nevertheless, I will definitely go again.. Que viva Cuba!

The food is amazing! Even the chicken soup and calamari seemed better than most. Food is on the pricier end, and the restaurant can be a bit drafty though. The music and vibes make up for it, and I'm sure even more so if you get to stay for the live band! Also note that happy hour is only at the bar.

formatted_address: 408 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Chela

reviews.text: Great Mexican restaurant in the heart of Park Slope. Good selection of drinks. Margaritas were well made. Menu was good. We had the shrimp and fish tacos and they were very good. The guacamole was also delicious.  We will be back.

I seldom give five star reviews but Chela blew me away. Immediately upon waking in I was impressed with the distinct ambiance and precise ornamentation of the resturant. The music was appropriate and at the perfect level to promote an intimate dining experience with my partner. Service was also excellent and there wasn't a moment where there wasn't a member of staff immediately available for assistance. 

Everything from the appetizers, entrees, and dessert were out of this world. Counting the days until we can be back and try out the rest of the menu!

This is obviously one of the coolest place in the area. Whenever I visit this place I am incredibly glad. They preserve their high  level service and the topmost level of meals  they give. You are always happy with this place. Highly  recommended.

Excellent food presentation and delicious options. I had the steak tacos and my husband had the chicken. They were both amazing and came with a side of rice and beans. The 3 tacos were quite filling. They look small but they are loaded. I was surprised how full I felt after 3 tacos. The decor is festive and the space is cozy. Would definitely recommend for a date night. They also have Happy Hour! Will be visiting again for that experience. 😉

Cant wait to go back here. I love Mexican food and this place is Mexican dining on another level. I was shocked on how amazing the flavors of the food and drinks were just special.  Take your friends and family on a taste bud trip

formatted_address: 424 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Caledonia Bar

reviews.text: Loved the bar from the beginning. Well decorated place, choice of drinks is phenomenal. Service is impeccable and bar tender is very friendly.
Any Scotch wiskey you could ask for and even more you couldn't. The staff is knowledgeable and the vibe is pleasant. Come for an awesome cocktail and stay for a great wiskey.
Really good for brown liquors, burboun, scotch. Bartender was quite good at helping us find some new faves. Small place so you may not get a seat, but worth trying!
Lovely and laid back no nonsense friendliness. Great whiskeys and cocktails.
Knowledge bartenders, relaxing atmosphere.

formatted_address: 244 W 56th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Joe G Pizza & Restaurant

reviews.text: Old School charming  Italian Restaurant located below a hotel a few walking blocks from the Time Square hustle and bustle.  Everything was delicious and savory. Not too crowded but busy. It was perfect. Great prices for being NYC and great ambiance. Highly recomended.

The service was pleasant, they were able to accommodate a large party rather quickly, and the food was delicious.  The menu has choices that made the whole family happy.  They were considerate that there were children in our party and made sure to put in their order quickly. The prices were good for Manhattan.

Outstanding food and great service. Don’t pressure you and are very friendly. 

The music is my only criticism. Wasn’t fitting the atmosphere. Other than that I highly recommend

Outstanding service and great food. We had just had a bad experience at another restaurant, and our waiter went over the top to make us forget all about it and have a great time. It made the whole experience so special. The food was excellent too!
Old-world, traditional Italian. Food was very good. Portions were generous. Prices very reasonable.

formatted_address: 239 W 14th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: La Nacional

reviews.text: I must say this place has a lot more potential and maybe I didn’t get a good experience but my review is based on how it went for us. The location is VERY nice. The ambiance is there, the atmosphere is chill, the music playing didn’t really match the place to be honest but that’s just my opinion. For a place this nice we expected a host or a little guidance to be seated but we kind of just had to look around and make eye contact with someone working before being told to seat ourselves. Admittedly after walking in the two of us felt a little underdressed and I’m not sure if that had something to do with it but we were seated our waitress was kind and beautiful, awesome accent and things felt like they could only go up from there. We ordered a small paella which teetered between reasonably priced and overpaying. For the price you’ll expect it to be really good. It was pretty average. Good flavors in the rice but the seafood was kind of just plopped on top and the presentation was kind of just bad. I’ve eaten a lot of paella and it just seemed a little weird that it wasn’t mixed into the dish or a little more abundant in seafood, or at least dressed up to look nicer. In our whole time there no one came to refill our drinks, see how we were doing, ask how our food was or anything. We were visited to have our order taken and to accept payment. Slightly better service would have gone a long way towards feeling good about this place but although the price points are comparable to competition in the area, it doesn’t feel like you get your money’s worth here.
Staff were friendly food was good and i liked the sangria. The lighting by the window was a bit to dark. (Booth seats)

Spanish dishes, a trendy crowd. A place for an evening cocktail with tapas or formal dinner. Avoid the "paella". It's overcooked and overpriced. Everything else is quite good. It can be noisy after 7:00 p.m.
One of the only two places to eat real paella in New York. Tapas are great. Service is charming. Love the happy hour.
The food is a little bit salty. But it tastes really good, the flavors are heavy and wonderful. I really love the desert. I will visit here again.

formatted_address: 79-81 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Dante NYC

reviews.text: Went to Dante NYC for Sunday brunch on a recommendation and had a great experience.  It's a good idea to make reservations, because this place filled up fast.  Great food, great coffee and a really unique cocktail offering.  Next time I'm in the village I'd love to go back and sit at the bar.  The restaurant had a European atmosphere and a very attentive staff.  Not sure if it's a regular occurrence, but on the day I was there the Specials included a handmade pasta dish, it was simply prepared, but excellent in every way.

What a great experience at this intimate cafe, located in Greenwich Village. 
A bustling place on weekends... 
The drink menu is amazing & above all it's the perfection in how the drink is made... 
Look for Eloy. Would like to thank you for the great great drinks... 
Will look forward to visit soon...

Super cute little cafe/restaurant/bar that also does to-go coffee. Their coasters are SUPER cute and everyone was friendly. I liked the hot chocolate (not to die for), but would go back for the vibe. My friends loved their coffees.

I'm impressed. I would give them six stars if I could.

We stopped by on a Friday afternoon. There was live music playing and very few open seats. Luckily we found a place at the bar. The drinks were heavenly, strong and full of flavor. Everything we ordered was made to perfection. The staff was attentive and very nice. Ashley made great suggestions for us. I am certainly coming back when I'm in the city.

One of my favorite places to visit in NY. Must make a reservation to be seated. So if you plan on coming, do so. Great cocktails and beer selection. Also the food was great. And great customer service

formatted_address: 1 Water St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: The River Café

reviews.text:
We had a gift card for this restaurant and booked a table via a third party seating app, which didn't mention anything about the dress code. Turns out our smart casual attire on the day we showed up wasn't good enough to get us in. The receptionists didn't turn us away, but offered a selection of coats to complete our attire. We walked inside and were instantly treated like pariah by the head wait staff. When we asked to be moved to a table by the window, he smugly refused, because it's only for 'appropriately dressed' guests. That really ruined it for us. We were so looking forward to a dinner with a view.

The rest of the wait staff were pleasant and attentive, and the food was delicious, though not exceptional. We ended our meal with a surprise treat they gave us in celebration of our anniversary. After the hefty value in our gift card was applied to the bill, we still had to pay almost $300.

Pretty sure we won't be back. We're not the dress-to-the-nines type, and in fact shun the pretentiousness of it all. I understand that they can set and enforce all the rules they want and appreciate the gesture of the receptionists to make us look 'presentable'. But if you're a restaurant that calls yourself a 'cafe' and is housed in an average-looking boat without any historic or cultural significance, that specific rule really sounds ridiculous.

Photo is of their signature dessert, the Chocolate Brooklyn Bridge! Delicious!
Came at the end of a delicious vegetarian fixed price meal. Expensive for the vegetarian meal however. Beautiful location, we were relocated to a table overlooking the bridge. Service was absolutely amazing, a must go to restaurant!!

Located in iconic and picturesque Dumbo, Brooklyn, The River Cafe has all of the makings of a truly upper class dining experience. They require reservations months in advance and formal dining attire. The staff were all pleasant and the service is top notch. Food was on par with most up scale restaurants. Though the overall ambience, service, and presentation was impressive, it's still  very difficult to justify the $$$$$ price tag

I celebrated my birthday today in this great restaurant. I am glad to say that we passed a enjoyable evening and the restaurant was evidently one of the reasons for the fruitful event. The stuff  helped in a splendid style, the cooking was yummy and my friends were so  happy. We shall no dout return for more joyful events. Thank you very much.

Amazing attention and location!!!! Reservations are suggested. Formal attire.
And money of course...
This is a fancy place, but a really good one.
The greetings, the attention, the politeness, everything on point. 
Yes is pricey but like I said, the view, the service and the food were amazing!!
A place you definitely want to go and enjoy with your friends or family.
Live piano concert, beautiful decorations, clean bathrooms, nothing to complain.
Believe me when I say, IT'S WORTHY!
And yes, the flowers are real. 👌🏻😍

formatted_address: 34 35th Street Bldg 4, Suite 04-1-B12, Brooklyn, NY 11232, USA
name: Sahadi's (@Industry City)

reviews.text: Excellent selection of cheeses, spices, dried foods (nuts, pastas, and beans). It was a little chaotic during the first weekend with what seemed to be many new employees still getting up to speed. I'd love to come back once they have everything running a little more normally.

The space is dreamy at Industry City. Pistachio nests, amazing cheeses, perfect party prep. Prices are mixed, so check against reason/desire. Service is always lovely. And yes, they have all the spices and Middle Eastern specialties you crave. And nuts. And bread. And...a place to sit and eat that sandwich. Dry goods haven with a really delicious deli.

Fabulous outpost of Sahadi's that's huge, with all the Mediterranean and global bites you could want. It's super clean, well-stocked and has a nice variety of fresh, ready to eat items like hummus and cheese as well as dry goods.

I am a huge fan of the original Sahadi's on Atlantic Avenue. That's why I was so disappointed when I found that their new place in Industry City totally like the charm and many of the products that you find at the original. It's still decent place to shop and find certain items you won't at many other places, but you're far better off going to the one and only original store. If you're already going to Industry City, which has a lot of nice places in it, no reason to pass this by. But no reason to go out of your way just for a reinvented Sahadi's.

I really like this place. I go there frequently for lunch and I love the Saj sandwich section. I had this bread once before in a trip to Jordan and I am glad I can have it here now. Thank you Sahadi’s! The lady who usually makes the sandwiches (Stephanie)is a master! Many times I ask her to dress the sandwich as she sees fit and it is almost always just perfect! She is kind and professional. 
I hope there is a way to warm up the food from the precooked section. However if you take it home and warm it up it will be excellent too.

formatted_address: 1034 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: Tartina

reviews.text: I had the grilled octopus, shrimp, and calamari.  It was excellent!  I had the crime brûlée for a desert and lemonade to drink.  It was all fantastic.  I paid $63 dollars for it.  It’s New York, so that’s the price range you’re in for good food.  It goes up from here.  I highly recommend this place!  They had some ravioli with mushroom sauce that I really wanted to try but I was stuffed already.
Great vibe. Excellent service. Would highly recommend the lava stone sirloin for two.

I live in Philadelphia and thought we had great brunch places, but this place supersedes them all. Our server, Alexey, was polite and encouraged us to split entrees as they are family style, and we were thankful that he recommended this. The food was delicious and proportions were extraordinary! Will definitely be back next time we visit. 5/5 highly recommend.

The food was AMAZING. The chef really cares about the quality of his ingredients, He told us everything is imported from Italy or made in their kitchen. They treated me and everyone at our table like family. Definitely adding it to my list of favorite places in NYC.

The food is good. I ordered the chicken leg which was stuffed with spinach and ham, it tasted really good. The price was fair as well, and I loved the atmosphere. There are plenty of wine list on the menu.

formatted_address: 119 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Char Sue

reviews.text: It's just really really good ... the food, the drinks, the service, the ambiance ... it's just really really good.  Everything on the menu is pretty much a "must try."  The imaginative combination of ingredients and cuisines results in such original creative flavors that at times you wonder why you didn't think of it or come across it much sooner.  Foodies beware ... you will get addicted.
Very good. Bit pricey, but I found it worth it. Beef tacos, awesome. Green beans, cooked well and tasty. Roast duck bowl, very flavorful. Great spice run.
You just have to come here... Food superrrrr, EXPLOSIVE flavors! Waitress super friendly. Coming back again.

This is my favorite asian restaurant in the Lower East Side. Get the crispy duck wings. the sauce that comes with the green papaya salad is outstanding, The lettuce wrap is full of high impact flavors. The Beef taco is good. The ramen here is incredibly good. The broth is silken, rich in pork flavor and smoky. There's a happy hour that runs from 5 - 7.3  that is totally worth the visit.
Love the pork belly buns and the Brussels sprouts and the tofu beef tacos. Pretty much everything. Also! They have a GREAT selection of beers and sake!

formatted_address: 251 E 31st St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Marchi's

reviews.text: This is a venerable New York institution, which will close December 28. Do not miss it. The food is memorable as is the ambience and the service.

It is a very unique historical place.   They do not have a menu, but pre-fixed course of food all the time.  I felt more likely to be in a restaurant in any rural area rather than being in NYC.  It is a delightful home style.
This spot is awesome! Convenient pricing, considerable portions and the staff are regularly nice.
Marchi's is am unbelievably excellent, interesting, beautiful place. It's been in business 90 years!  Every bite of food is perfect and I want to go back every day
Amazing place and food great all around...will be back here as soon as possible!...ciao!!

formatted_address: 135 E 62nd St, New York, NY 10065, USA
name: David Burke Tavern

reviews.text:
Beware of bar pricing! 
I honestly like the place and want to go back. I like the mood of the bar and the food is decent even if a bit pricey. 

That said I just had an experience at the bar that left a very bitter taste. I ordered a cocktail ($16) and asked them to use a specific liquor (we are talking Stoli vodka not Louis XIII) I was really shocked that they added an extra $8 to the cocktail for a total of $24!

When I mentioned that they chose just to shrug and say hey that’s what it is.
Having checked online to see if this is normal practice, it is not. Tell if I am mistaken.

I suspect that this was the action of one Barman and maybe not their usual policy.

It’s a shame that the actions of that specific Barman ruined what was a nice evening and what shaping up be a local place for me.

The food was good here. Quite delicious and nice presentation. Not knowing as a first time guest, there is actually an upper floor dining area, and the layout was like a home library.  It felt homey.  When we first got our table, the waiter who served us was not very friendly and welcoming. After some time, he got better and started smiling.  I ordered a burger with fries. The burger was done just right.  I am glad that we get to visit this restaurant for the restaurant week.

We ordered their signature "Clothesline sugar maple bacon" for starter an extra for the restaurant week menu which is thick, flavorful and nice presentation. Good portions and beautiful presentations. Service was really good too. Recommended to my friend and they also came.

The food was outstanding. I had the happy hour oysters. My client had the Caesar salad which was not a traditional Caesar salad and had the mushroom veggies. I had the pork chop which was incredible. It was served with clams and shrimp the most unique presentation I've seen.

I was very disappointed by the service at David Burke Tavern. I went for restaurant week dinner, and the food was fantastic. However, our waiter made an inappropriate, sexual joke to us soon upon sitting down. He was very slow to take our order and engage with us throughout our meal. The busboys consistently brought us food that wasn’t ours, or brought our food to another table. I was in a group of five, and one busboy brought two of our desserts to another table. We flagged him down and let him know, and when he came back to our table with the wrong dessert in hand, he rolled his eyes at us when we told him it was incorrect. At this point, the meal had taken so long that we asked for our check when they finally brought the correct desserts. We had to ask three times before they finally brought it to us. Similar situations were happening at the tables around us. For a restaurant at this price point, service like this is unacceptable. It completely overshadowed what was an incredible meal food-wise. For those who still look to eat here, I highly recommend the clothesline bacon, the duck, and the chocolate hazelnut cake.

formatted_address: 1 W 59th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Olma

reviews.text: Excellent  service. Huge selection of black caviar. My fav Beluga. This is a reason why it cost that  money, it’s so good. Must have spot if you are visiting NYC.
Champagne and Caviar served any time
Do it. One of my favorite spots in NYC. Visited again with a large group and was impressed with how well we were treated and the quality of the caviar. Price for champagne is really good.

After lunch rush, if you order coffees, they tell you it’s only to go.  All the chairs and tables were empty and they still tell you such. Isn’t it better to show traffic and interest in your place of business.  Guy behind me was told same thing.  “We can’t afford to have the seats filled.”  She said.  Guess they can afford to lose business.
Amazing place!!!

formatted_address: 245 W 16th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Café Riazor

reviews.text:
The food was good, and waiters very nice, and the place looks authentic.
We had a few tapas, fish fillet with lemon and paella negra.

Mostly, it was good. The fish was quite good.
The paella was a bit too salty, had a lot of squid ink (didn't like that much), and didn't have the smoky flavor I'm used to in paellas.
The tapas were good for the most part.

Service was very slow (we came in before the rush hour). We prepares for a 40 minutes paella preparation but it was closer to an hour and half. 

Overall, it was good, but I'm not going there again.
The food is excellent!! And the service can’t be better! We’ll be back soon!!

Honestly, the WORST food experience that I have had in my whole life. This restaurant offers not just expensive food but also terrible food quality.. You pay $9 for “bravas” that are reheating in the microwave and octopus that I can easily tell that was cooked a week ago.. Moreover, the waitress ignored us during the whole lunch but she wanted to charge us 20% obligatory gratuity.

An authentic disappointing experience.. 

Being all said, I am Spanish.
Romantic and also cozy great food and attentive staff
This is our go-to place whenever we have tickets at the Joyce. They are warm and friendly. The food is always tasty.

formatted_address: 123 W 45th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: The Perfect Pint

reviews.text: Irish pub and restaurant with several flat screen TVS showing basketball and variety of music playing. I came in there and picked my dining table. Limited menu selection since it was late. Had some buffalo wings and mozzarella sticks and a draft beer. The appetizers were tasty and draft beer refreshing. Need to check their full menu when I'm not getting out late from work. I recommend giving this place. Decent price considering it's within the Times Square area.
Nice place to just get away from time square and have a few drinks. They have TVs and a jukebox if you wanna see some sports or listen to some music. Great drinks at an affordable price.
The house beer on tap is amazing. A must stop for anyone wanting to enjoy great beer and good food near time square.
We visit this bar when in town. Always good, cold beer, nice people. Atmosphere is just what you expect. Bar on roof is generally crowded but sitting in is good.

My husband and I ate here while in NYC for lunch. The hostess was not super friendly. merely telling us to go all the way to the top for service. We had to walk up several flights of stairs to the rooftop bar to be seated. We ordered the perfect pint burger and it was just okay. They don't come with condiments. When we asked for Mayo we were given tiny mayo packets that were difficult to open. The service was okay but we weren't impressed with the food or the seating arrangements. To end on a positive note, the fries were good and the Christmas decorations were really nice.

formatted_address: 52 William St, New York, NY 10005, USA
name: The Bailey Pub & Brasserie

reviews.text: Very nice place to drink a brewed beer on a high chair at the bar or enjoy a delicious dish on one of its comfy tables. The saloon allows you to enjoy a good conversation even when it is crowdy. The prices are in-line with the quality of the dishes they serve and are not expensive at all, even been around the block from Wall Street.

This is a great pub/restaurant. The owner Joe really knows how to run a business. The servers and bartenders were friendly and efficient. Becca works there and is a very friendly server and bartender. They have a great happy hour with affordable and wide selection. It is located conveniently close to Wall Street and attached to the Radisson there on William/Pine Street. Highly recommend this pub and the staff that run it.

Food, service and ambience excellent - fun and convivial without being overbearing. The crowd is mostly wall street folks but I've been for ladies nights, happy hours and special events and it's always great. Wide menu selection, great wine and cocktails list, yummy desserts. Fun bar scene and also good enclaves for seating for a more romantic dinner or group dinner. Sometimes they have live music too! Definitely go when downtown.

Awesome food, awesome staff. Hefty portions so you are definitely getting what you pay for with this place.  I wasn't sure what to order, asked the cashier for some guidance and she hit the mark. Thanks!

Best lunch ever!! Stopped for a bite while walking around. Great service and superb food! Large quantities totally worth it!! The fried calamari were perfect. The chicken strips were juicy and tender. The Turkey burger was huge and cooked to perfection. Great food to start our NYC adventure!!

formatted_address: 129 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: La Lanterna di Vittorio

reviews.text: Such a lovely place, day or night. Parisian charm. There are three areas: the front cafe & bar, the veranda in the back of the place, and a huge basement with live music. The large menu has all sorts of Italian things (small plates, bruschetta of several kinds, pizza), a whole page of drinks like European coffee and tea, and half a page of delicious desserts. I went twice in one day - for a cup of an afternoon tea and evening wine and sweets with friends. The place is booming day and night. Friendly waiters, fast service, delicious food.

Awesome service in a classy Italian American style spot with a cozy garden/green house. The apple pie with pistachio ice cream was tasty. The warm malt wine was delish. Awesome date spot or spot for a classy group gathering. Enjoy it!

La Lanterna is a fantastic restaurant with a wonderful ambience, serving the best lasagna in the city. My girlfriend and I have been here 4 anniversary dinners in a row (as well as several other instances with friends and family) and plan to return for years to come. Pro tip: the pesto lasagna rivals the classic for best thing on the menu...

Pasta is really good here - but I must say, their tiramisu is delicious. Only thing is for me tiramisu should not be served like a slice of cake (which it does in this place) but nonetheless it is yummy. It is a great friends get together kind of place. Backyard seating is recommended - it is a nice ambience.

We had an unique experience here. We were sitted right away.  They had multiple floors with different experience, it was hard to choose which floor we should be in. Listen to jazz or sit in the green house ambient with low lights. Desert tasted great, definitely a place to come back to. Wish the waitress was a bit more friendly, otherwise great.

formatted_address: 54 N 11th St, Brooklyn, NY 11249, USA
name: Schimanski

reviews.text: This place is a joke and a scam. The worst designed venue I’ve ever been to. They oversell tickets by like 3x. Truly crazy dangerous. Wall to wall packed and you can’t get in or out. They had security guards standing in the middle of the dance floor mean mugging and looking angry. Totally killed the vibe. Worst venue I’ve ever been to in NYC. I can’t believe this place is still open. It needs to be shut down as a fire hazard and complete con job. Unbelievable that a place like this exists.

One of the worst night clubs I have ever been too. Only went because I am a fan of Bob Moses but this place takes advantage of the superficial people that go here. Be ready to pay 50 dollars for two drinks and sometimes 5 dollars for a bottled water. If you buy a mixed drink do not expect it to be strong. This club is a typical nightclub if you are a true music lover go else where. Staff is not very friendly nor provide good customer service.

Way too many people, you couldn't even move most of the night. Not even safe. Security staff was actually really friendly and helpful. Crowd is mostly early-mid 20s (I was there on Saturday night).

But seriously, you could not move.

They don't level sound so bring hearing protection. You will still be hurt the next day.

Water is $5.  Bartender said they don't have a way to serve cups of water.

Fog machine is OD. Enjoy choking half the time while trying to dance.

Do not recommend.
Easy to find and get to with lots of street parking late at night. Well ventilated and smelled clean as well.

formatted_address: 142 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: GMT Tavern

reviews.text:
Decent place. My fish tacos looked much better than it actually taste. 7/10 for the tacos. 

Steak fries are great with their home made sauce! 

Super cold beer was a plus!
Friendly service, nice venue, tasty food, diverse menu, well appointed and clean. A reasonably priced lunch within Walking distance to Washington Square Park and NYU.

Really like this bar. The decor is funky and gives of this vibe of being in a fancy old English library. Or something like that. 

The staff are so great and have always been so helpful with anything needed. They go out of there way to make sure you are happy. 

As an English person, missing a good Sunday roast. GMT so far is my go to fix. While I have others on the list so far from the few I have tried this is the outright winner. So if your passing by on a Sunday i would make sure you go in and eat your fill
Really enjoyed everything here. Shockingly good veggie burger that they make in-house. Lovely service. Very nice place to spend time in.
Lovely, stylish bar with a great cocktail list and what looked like excellent food. However, we gave up waiting to be served after 15 mins when the place wasn't even that busy

formatted_address: 115 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Chote Nawab

reviews.text: Best Indian food in Manhattan!  Ratings are not right! It’s so good! Sometimes a bit slow with service but the best food in nyc! Definitely try it. Best butter chicken around!
Their lunch is fantastic. Very flavorful and I didn't expect so much food!
Very good selection on lunch specials with large portions, especially their naan portions. A good and large place with nice ambience and helpful waiter staff. Will definitely be coming again soon.
Food was spot on. Samosas one of the best I've had in NYC. Took their time and brought out fresh hot ones. Good ambiance. Must try place.
One of the best Indian restaurants in New York!! Great food, great service..authentic Taste!!

formatted_address: 77 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Baby Shower Comedy

formatted_address: 89 South St, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: The Fulton

reviews.text:
Menu has moderate selection, excellent views
Service was better than expected. 
Food was good,  but could use a bit more delicate touch on the fish. 
We had the cod,  which was a bit overcooked and
The fish stew which had excellent broth but fish that was over.  
Would repeat

Pier 17 has really come back with a vigor. The Fulton offers incredible views, quaint atmosphere, and delicious food. My only complaint is that he service didn’t match the price or the atmosphere are servers weren’t very attentive. I would still recommend The Fulton for date nights, celebrations, or as a nice place to grab dinner with friends.

Spectacular view.  Beautiful restaurant and great food.  If you can get it sit on the second floor. The view can’t be matched. The seafood is delicious. The sword fish is lightly crusted and moist. Shrimp are flavorful. Nothing but good things to say.

The Fulton is an amazing seafood destination! The first time I went, I had the salmon. I honestly think their salmon is the best I’ve ever had. The herb-crust is unbelievable. When I came back again I convinced most of my party to also get the salmon and they loved it too. The mussels are good and so is the shrimp cocktail but the standout appetizer is the soft shell crab - it is phenomenal. And don’t miss the strawberry dessert!

One of the best meals I’ve had in a quite a while. I absolutely love seafood, and if you do to this place is for you. An absolutely spectacular room with views of both bridges and the water. Lovely and cozy warm lighting and a super friendly and cool waitstaff. The lobster dish, which comes with a hefty price tag, is so well worth it and delicious it blew my mind. Just go!

formatted_address: 53 Little W 12th St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: The Wild Son

reviews.text: I like the vibe of this place especially compared to some of the more pretentious places in the meat packing district. This place feels like Cheers. All the staff was very friendly and familiar. The food was good, fresh, and healthy if not inspired.The delicata squash was the best and most interesting dish! I did think the olives were way too salty.

We went for dinner our first night in town and for breakfast the next morning. Everything was delicious. The good morning sunshine sandwich was especially hearty and my personal favorite. The lobster was good, but I hadn't realized the broth would be spicy. Service was also great, very timely and friendly. My only complaint would be that in the evening it's fairly dark inside, and they provide tea candles for lighting which was a stark contrast and made it difficult to look at my husband. Otherwise great, and we may even go back for the sandwich again on our way out of town.
Perfect brunch, nice food, cool place, nice staff. Good Morning Sunshine sandwich is delicious. Nicely done Cappuccino!! The corn waffle is different than the usual, so expect it to be a bit heavier.
Total gem, with perfect local beers and proper creative (American) food. Great atmosphere and service on edge of meatpacking district. Music not too loud. Total recommendation.

One of the best kept secretes in the meat packing district. Small and intimate, this place has a real, ol’ skool NY vibe. Located in an old 2 story house on a cobble stone street you don’t more “Gangs of NY” than this. Food here is great, satisfying and even healthy. It’s not fancy but what makes it good are it’s ingredients and simplicity. The staff is efficient and friendly and move adeptly through the tight seating. I never get tired of this place.

formatted_address: downstairs, 529-1/2 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Decoy

reviews.text: At the beginning of the meal, it's pretty good especially it's condiments and the fresh uni salad. However, once the main course came in that's where it went downhill.  The duck is overly roast, dry and lack in fat causing a lack of duck taste.  The steak is average for a dry age steak.  The lobster was the same as the duck, dry and overcooked.  As for service, one of our waiter (Joe) has the lowest energy level I've came across with and lacking any sort of friendly demeanor.  Price wise, overprice overall.

This restaurant is my favorite site.  Of all restaurants I know I favor it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to visit this restaurant. Whenever  I want to go to a superb supper, this restaurant comes instantly to my mind. superb and all kinds of  food and a rich menu.generous staff members, and good atmosphere. Also, the cost is decent. I tell about this spot with great pleasure.

Best. Peking duck. Ever. It's not cheap, but oh so good! Very tiny restaurant with a communal table. We couldn't get reservations but made a point to get there before they opened so we could sit at a bar and get a duck. We highly recommend doing that. If you reserve seats, you'll sit at the communal table. If you reserve 5+ seats you're guaranteed 2 ducks, under 5 guarantees 1. If you can't get a reservation, do what we did and get there before they open so you can get a duck. If you show up later, you might be SOL! They have a sister restaurant upstairs.

Decoy although known for duck, should also be known for their sides! We had a party for two and was sat in the middle of the communal table.

We ordered the prix fixe menu and between the two of us were expected to consume a whole duck. In addition to appetizers and sides. The duck was nice but the wrapper is not my favorite. It was too thick. Closer to the texture of soft shell taco than Peking duck wrapper. 

The crab fried rice and dim sum on the other hand were spot on. Presentation all thumbs up.

Everyone was cheery and nice at the communal table. We had great conversations with fellow diners who were also traveling great lengths for good duck. 

A must try if you have time. But probably bring 4 instead of 2. This way you can try more food.

The only downside to sitting on a communal table in the middle is how hard it is to get out and use the restroom. So either sit at the end or on the outside and no one in your dinner party fights you for the nice seat.

Innovative and authentic Chinese cuisine. I've been eating Chinese food for over 20 years and am recently looking for something new. This place didn't disappoint me. Every course was nearly perfect. 

The appetizer set, including fresh mango, and Korean-style broccoli and pickled cucumbers, offered a light and delighting flavor. The beef had a great portion of fat, producing a melt-in-your-mouth, tender and flavorful taste. I've never heard or had fish bone/skin (?) chips before, but this one was  astonishingly good with the dipping sause. So were the rest of the dishes.

Of course, there were some improvements that could be made. First, we made a reservation but were surprised to find out there weren't a table for 2 for us. Every group has to share a long table. I wish we could have more space and more privacy (we had to unintentionally listen to the whole conversation from other customers…). Second, please consider using reusable chopsticks. Last, it seems the portion size of the fried rice was obviously too much for a party of two. The whole dinner included 2 small plates, 1 Peking duck and 1 rice.

formatted_address: 221 W 38th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Tagine

reviews.text: The best Morrocan place in NY! I always have the most amazing night every Friday and so much fun!!! It is such a cool vibe, waitress are awesome and the food is the best one! Come to join with me to dance all night every Fridays!
the 3.8 star average review is very inaccurate. the food here is amazing and the restaurant is honestly just cool

The best place ever! I went there to celebrate my bday. Great vibes & music, very nice staff, Hamid was taking care of our table.
The food was excellent!!!
Thank you guys for a lovely evening ☆
Food was good but hookah was not. Taking off stars because I saw a roach running on the seat
Relaxing Environment, Nice People, Fun To Sit Back And Chill, And Smoke Hookah!! Enjoyed My Self!

formatted_address: 2 Hilliard Ave, Edgewater, NJ 07020, USA
name: Emma Bistro

reviews.text: There charred octopus for appetizer is so tender and well seasoned even the string potato that comes with it is so flavorful! I also love their Emma burger it wasn't dry even tho I asked for medium well (cause of pregnancy) the doneness is on point and good flavor too and their fries is good even without ketchup. We're so glad Emma is back!

Best food.  Super fresh, tasty and nice presentation. The decor is
absolutely stunning. 
really good.  The owner, Danilo lovely, warm and accommodating.
Have to try the brunch menu very soon!   thank you for making us feel at home.

We visited Emma Bistro for the first time yesterday in Edgewater.  Restaurant opened a week ago and we were really pleased with the food. Their Argentinian skirt stake was tender, so well cooked and delicious!! 
The owners are very attentive and , the quality of the food is  amazing from  appetizers, main courses and desserts.  The restaurant is beautifully decorated and it has a really nice ambiance. Will highly recommend it and will definitely return.

I visited Emma Bistro on its first night after waiting excitedly for weeks for it to open and I was not disappointed. From the flavorful empanadas and charred octopus to the perfectly cooked seared tuna and skirt steak, the experience with the food couldn’t have been any better. To top it off, the meal was followed with wonderful Argentinian ice cream that put the cherry on top. Emma bistro is a place I cannot recommend enough. The two owners put together a lovely restaurant that not only offered great food, but a charming atmosphere that would make anyone want to come back for seconds.

AMAZING FRENCH TOAST. I was in heaven. Also amazing food in general, nice decor, very nice staff. Owner goes out of his way to make sure he is giving you the best. Very customer oriented which I appreciate.

formatted_address: 345 W 58th St # 11A, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Dinner Dancers Inc

formatted_address: 28 West St, New York, NY 10004, USA
name: Inatteso Pizzabar Casano

reviews.text:
Wonderful place.  You should try it ! 
The pizza was pretty good (one big /16 inch for two), every ingredient is fresh and tasty. I highly recommend the capriciosa.
As an antipasto you will get a delicious homemade pesto with some bread.
Tried this place for the first time, loved their lasagna so much (and also pizza)! Great service as well. I will definitely go back.

Inatteso is a nice pizzeria tucked away in Battery Park City, just far enough out of reach to avoid the usual crowded lunch scene in the neighboring area. 

They have a great selection of pizza available, but me and the rest of my table did notice that  both of our pizzas were noticeably under seasoned. 

I would still gladly give them another shot because the experience was still very positive overall.
Amazing pizza with great service and a wonderful ambient. I would highly recommend the tagliatelle with bolognese.

Great place with very friendly service. Good wine selection and superb food. Look into the daily specials. We had the garlic and potato soup, which isn't available all the time, it was awesome. All the other food is great as well.

formatted_address: 1375 6th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Pazza Notte Restaurant

reviews.text: First of all, I want to thank my beautiful friend Landa for introducing me to this lovely, upscale, and upbeat restaurant. I have never had truffle fries. Jesus, the sweet and salt their fries should be served at every last supper. I kid you not it’s that good. I loved the atmosphere lots of energy and hot delicious food. They have a 2 for 1 drink special after work hours. This is a great spot to meet and catch up with friends

Stopped here around 1030pm after seeing a show at Carnegie Hall.  Probably the best kalamari I've ever had. Just melted in your mouth without that chewy taste many places have.  Our pizza was also delicious.  They had 2 for 1 Martini's with at 10 to choose from.  So many more items we would love to go back and try.

Amazing food.  Stopped with my girl and enjoyed everything about this location. The food was tasty and tasted great, service was fast and friendly. If you're visiting the area, I recommend this location for a good pizza/Italian food

The mushroom soup was very good. Most people on the table liked their food. Atmosphere was nice. Not enough menu options for me. Not many pasta types available. One of the dishes came stone cold with hot shrimp pieces on top.

My favorite Happy Hour spot! 2-4-1 wine and affordable and delicious happy hour menu and kind bartenders always bring me back! They play old fashioned movies too so you’re never without entertainment!

formatted_address: 1081 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10065, USA
name: Tony's Di Napoli

reviews.text: I don’t really get it. The setting is smart in an old-fashioned way and the service is efficient. All the Italian-American classics are on the menu and served in frankly enormous portions (a half serving is enough for two people). But the marinara sauce is just ordinary. It’s an old-time experience but I’m not sure it justifies its price.

I made reservations and let them
Know it was for my husbands birthday. When I checked in with the hostess I told her I had a reservation and for some reason instead of asking me who’s birthday we were celebrating she asked my husband and blew the surprise. The food was good by our waiter had the personality of a wet sponge and the speed of a turtle. It took forever to get our food. So after a 2+ hour dining experience we were going to order dessert. Except it took over 20 minutes for the waiter to get around to take our order. At that point we decided to skip dessert and get the check. I got up to use the restroom and to my surprise, while I was gone, the waiter brought over a plate with a couple of cookies and sang happy birthday. He could not wait to do it until I was back at the table??? Just look and see if everyone is there. Now he was in a rush. So I missed out being there with my husband and kids. Not the way I wanted to celebrate his birthday. Was just looking to do something a little special and it blew up. Will not go back again, next time carmines. This is his wife writing the review

Generous portions. Authentic red sauce with fresh pasta. Great Italian atmosphere with fantastic service. Prices are reasonable especially considering the portions. Great for family style dining. Canolis were perfectly prepared. This place meets the hype.

I've been a customer for a long time. Love that they deliver constantly. I recently went for desserts a lot but used to have my birthday dinners hear. the black linguine is to die for. love the price, ambience the servers. Everything is great for the value.

The mixed seafood with lobster is delicious and so huge that the two of us had to take it home for another meal! Definitely worth your money. We also ordered the tiramisu based on a raving review but found it disappointing. The watery rum mixture soaked through the bottom layer and overpowered the rest of the cake, so I scrapped off the soaked mush and only ate the upper part. I peg it to an off day. They gave us prosciutto and bread on the house, a very nice touch. The service was up to par and the place is quiet, allowed you to stay and sit, and not as crowded (we did go at 2). This is indeed a special place in NYC that seem to give customers a excellent portion at a understandable price :)

formatted_address: 365 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Macchina

reviews.text: Went for brunch and really enjoyed the brunch pizza with avocado! At presentation it doesn’t look like much, but I really enjoyed this pizza. The place wasn’t very crowded, so could easily catch up with friends over brunch. I’d definitely go back, their menu had a lot of other good looking brunch foods.

This is nice brunch and pizza place in the Kips Bay-Murray Hill area. We've had reliably good service here each time we've been over; the staff are really nice and helpful. The pizzas are pretty good, but definitely not the greatest. They are famous for their burrata pizza, which is fine but is mostly a soggy rich mess. But their other pizzas are excellent. They have outstanding cocktails though.

Meeting my lovely friend we couldn't pick a better spot. The Aura of this place says Class and great food all over and very romantic one  as well. This is an excellent place to bring a date, family, or friends. Yes, indeed. It's an NY restaurant on 3rd Av. Just perfect.

The food is excellent in flavor with many healthy dishes on the menu.

Reasons for going: ♀️/♀️Date Night

Pros:
Great atmosphere
Rustic/clean look
Attentive/respectful staff
Delicious cocktails/food
Handicap accessible
Clean bathroom

Minor complaints:
None

Overall:
Great place for first date, quiet enough to have an intimate conversation, casual
Nicely decorated and good food. I had a great time. Thank you for the hospitality

📷@datasianjan

The garlic knots chicken parm sliders are amazing I would order a million of them. It's $15 and you get three and they are pretty small. I would definitely order again. The meatballs were very good as well. Lastly I had the fried Mac and cheese balls and they were decent.

formatted_address: 725 5th Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Trump Grill

reviews.text: Tried this spot before with a friend and I am addicted since then. I enjoy the excellent mood and delightful dishes and drinks. Great work.

The food was delicious! Presentation was beautiful and everything  was exceptional.  I ordered the lunch special which was a 3 course meal and it was perfect.  I had the swordfish  and it was the best swordfish I have ever had. I also enjoyed the atmosphere which was peaceful and calm.  The staff was super attentive and welcoming. This was our best service and actually come to think of it our best meal in NYC.  If you forget to make a reservation (It can be hard to get sometimes)  just stop and see if they have space because sometimes they do.
Eric Trump came and ate while we were here. Great bartender. Great drinks. Favorite is the French Martini.
I was surprised at the quality and amount of food served. It was a very enjoyable lunch.
Try the famous Taco bowl 😀

formatted_address: 625 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Trattoria iL Gusto Wine Bar

reviews.text: The food was fantastic. The bartender and the service staff is excellent. Our night was great from beginning to end. We will definitely be back. Thank you
We were given menues and our waiter patiently gave us as much time as we needed. A pasta soup was great, as well as a salmon and gnocci, delicious. Enjoyed my meal, seated outdoor.

I was originally introduced to this restaurant by a client, who shared the secret of its house limoncello. Since that night, I've come back several times with several guests, and always tipped generously as the food and service was good. With all this as prelude, I really hope yesterday was an anomaly. I had a pair of clients who wanted to meet in mid-afternoon to discuss a difficult, sensitive topic. Seeking an elegant place that I knew would be quiet at that time of day, I suggested Il Gusto. When I arrived at 3, the large dining room was empty. Not knowing if my guests wanted lunch or not at that in-between hour, I sat down at the table to which I was directed and accepted the offered menus. When my guests opted to just have cappuccinos, our server looked at me, rolled his eyes, and said "You should have told me you were just having coffee." He then made a big show of removing the silverware and plates from our table. Keep in mind: the dining room was completely empty. I was so shocked that I stammered our an apology, but also asked how I was supposed to know in advance what my guests wanted. After they left, I asked to speak to the server, Matt. He offered a perfunctory apology after much discussion. My guests had earlier remarked on how nice the menu looked, and their plans to come back. Now, I doubt they will return, and I don't think I will, either.

Had dinner with a friend who lives in the neighborhood. I had a big plate of spaghetti and meatballs. Great food, service and ambience. It was also not too loud, which made it easy to have a conversation. I'll be back!
A bit overpriced but average for neighborhood. Always delicious. Cozt atmosphere. Friendly staff.

formatted_address: 2331 12th Ave, New York, NY 10027, USA
name: Solomon & Kuff

reviews.text: This place has great vibes.  I went for Brunch on a Saturday. The ambience is beautiful. The staff is awesome.  The food was good.   I loved the music playing in the background.  I had a shot called pineapple upside down cake, that was delicious.   This place is great for groups.  The only negative is the parking.   But otherwise its a great place to go.
