This restaurant is unquestionably one of the most attractive place to eat in the neighborhood. Whenever I come there I am very happy. They manage their very high  standard service and the highest level of dishes  they serve. You always win with this restaurant. Warmly  recommended.

This place is the one I like best. I go to plenty of restaurants but to this restaurant I go the most. The team is very receptive and the cuisine they cook is so flavorful. I never miss an opportunity to have a good meal here. I highly recommend this place.

The food was very tasty, the portion sizes were more than expected. The menu had a nice variety of selections. They offer a Prix Fixe menu for brunch. The Caribbean music of Jamaica was very soothing. Very inviting atmosphere. The service was very good. You may have to park up the street.
This spot is worth giving a shot. They serve big portions for convenient prices. Consistently well organized and with good ambience. Highly recommended.

formatted_address: 556 Driggs Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Acqua Santa

reviews.text: I had an awesome time at this place. We enjoyed the first-rate atmosphere and the menu. The staff members are very amiable. I’m content we ultimately decided to try this restaurant.

Excellent attention, the food very tasty excelente cook of the meet and all was very fast and good service, the waitress very respectful and explain everything about the food the wines and all about the orders! Excellent place to go back! Recommended!
Celebrated my older brother bday party here and it was fantastic. Beautiful food, wine and atmosphere. I definitely plan on going back!
Amazing place. The food is some of the best Italian I've had in the city. Great service and beautiful setting. Highly recommend.
Waitress was Magnificant. Truly gave us an amazing time and food was also great. Great place for couples and dinners.

formatted_address: 20 Times Square, 701 7th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Paradise Club

reviews.text:
Very pretty decor and attentive service . Lovely creatures waking around 
But the food is truly the worst value for money I have seen in a while 
Quality is average. Uselessly overly spicy . (Fried chicken ... cauliflower...) weird , mushroom taco ( someone told me it was mushroom) 
Then you get to triple dip on a shared ice cream . Which is kind of refreshingly relax I’m those times of virus stress 
Pineapple. My neighbor tells me it is code for swinging ... I look around and hold my husband hand firmly 

Past 11 pm the disco starts and takes one hour to get going... the DJ not putting any effort into it
 ADVICE : Skip diner and show up at 11:45 pm . The creatures are still around. Fun .

One of the best spots to go in Manhattan. Show is really incredible and the party is super fun — great mix of people and very fun vibe. Doesn’t feel like you’re in Times Square. It’s the best parts of Studio 54 reinvented for 2019.

One of the coolest spots in Manhattan. The show is a mind blowing experience. Watching the flashing lights of Times Square, elevated above the crowds below...come here for a magical night - it won’t disappoint.

Spectacular place, food, music and show.  You want to have a taste of the nightlife of Studio 54 with a Michelin star chef? Go here.  Located on 7th floor of Times Square Edition Hotel.  Buy a ticket in advance and enter from 1st floor left elevator at about 8pm.  A guard is at the elevator and will let you in. By the end of the night, everyone is up and dancing with the performers and they are at the top of their game. Singing, dancing, eating and laughing.  It is a respite from the hassles of life and truly a club paradise.  Sometimes when you're a performer, each night can be just another programmed performance, not here.  They pour their heart into this and it shows, AND it is much appreciated.  Thanks to them and the great staff for a wonderful night.

Attended a comedy show recently and came to Paradise Club with high expectations after hearing about all the hype. Expectations were met if not exceeded. Food was excellent and the rye Manhattan drink stations were an excellent touch [we couldn't stop eating those black cherries!]. The comedy show had an incredible line-up to boot. Will return!

formatted_address: 621 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: Lucciola

reviews.text: This place looks great from the outside so we decided to try it.  Inside was so beautiful, we had great and personable waiters, go figure a. Italian restaurant with and Italian staff. All were very friendly, great atmosphere, food amazing, great wine choices and even 3 piece band of live music, not too loud/ just right. My daughter and I can't wait to go back. Well priced too.  Thanks to the staff. !!!
The place is warm and cozy with nice background music. My carbonara was excellent. Very fast and friendly service.
I’ve eaten here twice so far, the staff is delightful, and the food is impeccable. I’ve tried 5 dishes on the menu thus far, and I will certainly be coming back.
Great restaurant!!! The best to eat Italian food in NYC
This place is off the chart! The food is amazing and the staff are extremely friendly. I personally love their Caccio e Pepe and they tiramisu. They pizzas are delicious as well.

formatted_address: Times Square Studios, 1500 Broadway, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: NetSuite

formatted_address: New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Bethany Diamont's Place

formatted_address: 668 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
name: Talia's Steakhouse and Bar

reviews.text: I had very high hopes for this place but it disappointed me.the steak was not actually a prime rib as the menu suggested.  Perhaps it was ribeye that was then grilled. It was unfortunately tough. The french fries alongside we're good and the appetizer plate was outstanding. The wine was okay but there was only one choice. I was intrigued that it was a kosher restaurant. And I was hopeful that I would really enjoy it and be able to come back many times. But it didn't turn out to be good for me. The host was very gracious and hospitableI'm just sorry the food didn't work out to be better for me.

At the moment  you arrive in this place  the waiters give you an agreeable feeling. Very courteous hosts, it is a kind place to  enjoy with friends or with your date. enjoyable  cooking, professional  chief cook and stuff, honest  cost and nice  service. Highly recommended.
Fantastic food, welcoming staff, regularly excellent atmosphere. They charge reasonable pricing and the food quality is very good. Keep up the good work.
The place offers a large range of fresh food. I love dining here. The employees are always very nice, prices are affordable and the spot is always neat.

Talia's Steakhouse and Bar environment was great, food was excellent the ahí poke was so delicious the bar menu is very inviting  and open with perfect portions. Craig was very knowledgeable on the wines and we had a fantastic white wine for us (we usually drink reds) everything was perfect cannot wait to go back and become a regular!

formatted_address: 408 W 15th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Red Rabbit Club

reviews.text:
The venue is newly renovated,  the music and vibe was great. My friends had a lot of fun. From the door to the table, we had the best experience. Our waitress was the best but a few other waitresses also stopped by to check on us. 

For people complaining about $18 drinks, that’s standard for ANY NYC nightclubs/bar. You should probably stay home.
Small space but nice music !

Best spot in NYC! The vibe in the room was awesome.. everything from the music to the dancers and even a personalized magic show at my table was great! Waitresses went above and beyond to provide exceptional service! Would recommend this place to anyone:)

I paid for my tickets showed up and then waited in the line for 2 hours to get in. Line didn't even move a bit. All bouncers let anyone who are not dressed properly, not good looking, not have tickets..... all of them except people with tickets. That was the most insane night to went through almost ended up in emergency due to cold. I want my refund.

Shame on you!

This was formerly the Gilded Lily space, what an upgrade! From the look to the vibe, very impressive. High energy atmosphere and the waitresses were on point. Definitely check Red Rabbit out for a great night out.

formatted_address: 345 Grand St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: St. Mazie Bar & Supper Club

reviews.text: Since moving to NY I have visited St. Mazie many times for drinks and small bites with friends. The atmosphere is great and I often enjoyed the music. Tonight I decided to visit for dinner with my girlfriend on Sunday night. The food was unexpectedly disappointing. The gnocchi with truffle was spicy and sweet. The risotto with truffle was undercooked and you could barely smell or taste truffle. We decided to give a final chance to the dessert and selected a chocolate mousse with salted caramel and whipped cream. What we received was barely a step above jell-o pudding. Writing this review with hope that it will be constructive to the owners.
Have been here twice. Once on a Friday evening seated away from the stage (but could still hear the jazz--very nice), and once for Sunday jazz brunch. Good experiences both times.
Music, food and staff were all absolutely amazing! Definitely coming back again soon. Thanks again :-)

Wonderful time portal bringing you into the 1920s with Miss Maybell and then Baby Soda! No TVs, no indications of anything new (besides a few phones out here and there). All class and much better layout (not quite as pretty) as rivaling Maison Premiere.

I adore this place. It is a gem and our waitress was the most sweet and amazing server I ever had. The band was excelent, just a thought, I would rather pay for the band instead of the band asking for money at the end of their set. They were amazing. Overall the place is my favorite place to go now thank you.

formatted_address: 1372 Broadway, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Mr. Broadway

reviews.text: First time been to a kosher restaurant.   Amazing I can't tell the difference.  Food wise are good.  I ordered rib steak.  It was tasty but expect to be a little thicker when charging $41 during lunch time. Overall is good. Good experience.

The food was great! We had the "cheese burger" on a gluten free bun, that was much above our expectations. The service was very understanding and accommodating to our allergies, even on new years day! We highly recommend it!

This restaurant always displays the perfect balance between quality and price. The portions are very tasty and quite large.  While the prices, especially for a kosher establishment in Manhattan, are quite affordable. Everytime we go the place is jam packed which tells you that other people are enjoying it too!  This is a great option in the heart of NYC!
Good food and service for a quick down-scale kosher lunch.  Good selection of both "Jewish" and Chinese food.  Quick service but they don't try to rush you to turnover the table.

It's really amazing when a restaurant completely changes its nature. From its roots as a deli, Mr Broadway has become more of an upscale place. Gone is the 5 pages menu with too many choices. Now, a more respectable selection of somewhat more sophisticated choices abound. The service is good, although when they get very busy it feels like they don't have enough staff. The food is good, and reliable. For Thanksgiving 2019, the prix fixe menu was reasonably priced and offered several choices for all 3 courses. The appetizer pulled beef soft tacos was delicious, and the traditional turkey/stuffing/potatoes plate was very good - and very filling. If you walk out of M Broadway hungry, it's definitely on you - the servings are generous. Mr Broadway is a tradition in Manhattan and continues to satisfy.

formatted_address: 1838 Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd, New York, NY 10026, USA
name: Cantina Taqueria & Tequila Bar

reviews.text: I was celebrating my birthday. My family and I had a wonderful time. Our server was the sweet, attentive, and was always available if we needed something. I understand she is working for tips, but she made us feel comfortable. It is a small place, but I prefer this. The drinks were superb. I had the Blood Orange magarita with salted rim. My uncle had the Passion Fruit margarita. My uncle had a half salted rim to try. He never had a Margarita before. You can ask for a sugar rim if you dont like salt. We ordered mango-jerk chicken, Grilled Lime chicken, Al Pastor, fish, and Tijuana steak tacos. We also had chimichanga, mexican corn, and churros. I'll be back.

The tacos where amazing and so are the flavor margaritas specially the passion fruit. If you come here to celebrate a birthday do not expect a cake because they don't have one. The decor and ambience was conformable and the music was loud enough to have a conversation with someone. The bathroom decor was nice and it also seemed to be disabled friendly, however, there are stairs before you enter the place with no ramp. Overall my experience at cantina was great and I will come again.
I wasn't disappointed food was fast and very delicious.Had a passion fruit Margarita also very good. Excellent service Definitely will be back!

There are 2 locations of Cantina in Harlem. I prefer the low key lounge on Adam Clayton Powell Blvd. The staff are friendly and the food is great. If you are ever in the neighborhood - definitely stop by.
Closed too early and the staff was not helpful with providing a table. The drinks were okay and thanks to the group which celebrated their birthday there. They made the atmosphere unbelievable.

formatted_address: 253 5th Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: John Doe

reviews.text: Great little spot on the main drag that we stumbled into to have a pint. Bartender was super friendly, a lad fresh from the Eire with less than two years under how belt in America.. Made you feel welcome. Decor was great for the holidays. I went with a Sweet Tarts Cape Cod Cranberry sour, which wasn't as sour as I would have liked.

Ambiance is nice, and they were playing a soccer game on their TV, which my husband enjoyed. However, I ordered a regular burger and said I wanted it well done. The burger arrived and whatever the meat was certainly wasn’t beef. I’ve had enough burgers to know the difference. I asked for sweet potato fries and they gave me regular ones. When I sent it back, the plate took almost 15 minutes to be returned to me, and the food was cold. The burger was literally red inside; although I specifically ordered a well done burger because that redness disgusts me. I was extremely hungry so I ate most of it, but left it cut open in half on the plate to display the redness. Ended up paying $18 for a burger that was throughly disgusting. Very disappointing. The drinks were overpriced too. Only plus was my husband enjoyed the $1 oysters. His wings were overpriced too, six wings for $14? Ridiculous. Will not be returning.
Was searching for a happy hour and found it! Tuesday is $5 tacos, $5 tequila shots. Wednesday $1 wings $5 beers. $1 fresh blue point oysters all the time. Bar staff is top notch.
We want there because it was just round the corner from our hotel. It had a great atmosphere, great range of drinks and craft beer and good bar food. It isn't cheap but a fun night
I had the fish&chips, fish was tasty (including a delicious dill sauce) fries could have been a little crispier. The drinks were very nice!

formatted_address: 371 7th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Niles

reviews.text: It was a disappointing brunch. Not the way we wanted to end our festive weekend in the city. The muffin on my eggs Benedict were store bought and saggy. The salmon was fresh and poached eggs were well prepared.  We had junior pancakes, which  were tasteless and not very fluffy, plus no real maple syrup. My wife had the avocado toast and one almost needed a microscope to find the avocado. The environment was nice and the manager was responsive to our feedback.  Brunch included a complimentary beverage, which was a nice touch.

Came here a few times, its a Classy and spacious place, with friendly staff (Conner the bartender, Chelsey and Wendy the hostesses they were all nice and attentive). Large tv perfect for watching games. I had the “Chicken dinner”, grilled chicken and mashed potatoes, simple but very tasty

The service was excellent. The food was phenomenal. If you don't want to wait, go after 8:00 p.m. Juan was more than great waiter, he was very knowledgeable about the food and wine. For a fine dining experience without the luxury price, go to Niles!
Great food. The scallops were huge and delicious. Good sized portions. Great service by Akash and David. The place was interesting and not noisy. The prices and reasonable. Very enjoyable.
The service definitely was exceptional. Good and tasty food and nice portions. Fantastic location, good decoration and great ambiance.

formatted_address: 154 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Tzarevna

reviews.text:
Fusion Russian food! The waitress is so sweet she even remembered after weeks, and which dish I enjoyed! I believe all the food is delicious, if I don’t like one now, it’s because I have tried properly cooked ones. I personally don’t like beet much so I gave their beet salad a try. Superb! It’s refreshing, juicy, with the natural earthy taste but not overwhelming. It’s also nicely plated without being too extra.
Their Olivier salad is not the traditional one, but it’s good on its own and it’s nice to see something from a new perspective. Tasty Russian black bread that’s not dry. Salut was solid good.
I like Mari Vanna, but isn’t it sweet to also have such an intimate and romantic place to have Russian food?
Only been there at nights. Will check it out during the day(that skylight!) in the future and their honey cake.

We had a group of six and decided for The Feast. It was worth every penny coupled with excellent service. each dish was unique and offered new flavors I have never tasted. add to boost, 4 wines with the feast added to the overall 6 course experience. highly recommended.

Really good!!! I don't think you can go wrong with this place. The food is too flavorful for the price. 
We tried dumplings, mushroom tapas, black bread (just $4), chicken tapas and couple of cokctails. They were all great. Staff is great

HUGE downside is the slow service. Service staff is great, but the food never comes. We actually finished a cocktail before we got our tapas orders. And my friend finished his beer before I got my cocktail. Service is slow i was going to give 4*, but i understand they are a new setup
Best breakfast spot in town. The staff are always friendly and extremely helpful.  The food is amazing and you're guaranteed to get your $$$ worth.
We went there for brunch. We loved the food and special the cheese pancakes. Very nice atmosphere and cozy place.

formatted_address: 354 Metropolitan Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Fette Sau

reviews.text: Amazing BBQ restaurant! Tried as many of the available meats and everything was delicious! These guys know what they're doing! Great selection of Beers as well! Super well situated and perfect to start of a night in BK! Would recommend 100%!
I really loved their dishes. I always get great customer service there. The place is well kept and the employees are always nice. Highly recommended.

Outstanding! We got the pulled pork, brisket, and sausage with a side of potato salad, and baked beans. Holy cow!!! I grew up on BBQ and I have NEVER liked baked beans, but I saw them in the display and I knew I had to try them. They are UNREAL. Like, so good I brought home an extra for my roommates to try. The brisket (we immediately asked for fatty- no clue if they ask for your choice themselves but GET THE FATTY) was heavenly.  The fat was rendered so perfectly and the crust was so flavorful and not overly salted at all. Just perfection. I wished the sausage was a little spicier, but I'm a nut for a real spicy smoked sausage. And honestly I didn't adore the pulled pork. It was a little dry for me- but I also know how easily BBQ can dry out once it's cooked so I'm not about to knock off a star for an otherwise perfect meal.
This spot is fantastic and roomy, the food was yummy and the prices were very reasonable. quick, productive service and very affable staff members. Will definitely recommend this spot.

I adore this spot! They have excellent meals, their menu is nice, The chef in that spot is an expert, I love very much eating all their food. The dishes are consistently fresh, the service towards the customers  is friendly. I  go often to this place and I was never unsatisfied. I recommend it to all my friends.

formatted_address: 282 Atlantic Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: two8two Bar & Burger

reviews.text: The place was clean and nice.  The food portions were delicious a bit small for a 15 for a burger and fries.  Overall a very good experience.  The server assistants are awesome.  Drinks were filled quickly and never got lower than half a glass.  I would be back again.

I often take my friends to this place with my warmest recommendations. I visit this place often. This recommendation is always successful. The the cooking is delicious and the crew is efficient and cooperative. Whenever we eat in this place we have a lovely evening.  warmly recommended.
Solid neighborhood Burger bar. Delicious "two8two sauce". The chilies and other things (bacon!) In the burgers keep me coming back. That, and the decent draft selection!
Good and fast service.  A lot smaller than I assumed.  Wish it was bigger and with more fries.  It's enough to be full, but not sure how much better than a local deli burger.

When the best thing about your entire burger  driven meal, in a place that purportedly had one of the best burgers in Brooklyn, is the ketchup there's something very wrong. The burger was completely mediocre. From the under seasoned meat to the tasteless bacon -- I didn't even know that was possible-- to the bland, sad egg to the undercooked and under seasoned grilled onions, it was all bad. I couldn't even taste the special house sauce. I wish the fries, the onion rings or the Greek salad were any better. Everything was forgettable. It's half empty on a Friday night when all the other places with decent to very good burgers are slamming busy Moo Burger, Bareburger, Long Island Bar, etc. We should have walked to fort defiance in Red Hook. They have a killer burger!.

formatted_address: 101 Avenue A #1, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: The Pyramid Club NYC

reviews.text: This club was a lot of fun! At first, when I entered this club, the staff were very entertaining and friendly. Meanwhile, I decided to seat on their chairs, and I was amazed by the place. It was organized, clean, and cool. Besides, the foods and drinks taste very good. I like everything about their club. Honestly, it was a very good place to relax and feel comfortable. Till next time!

Crazy place. Definitely falls into the category of a 'dive bar'. But it's a very friendly place with a bunch of characters. It's not tiny, but on the smaller side. Still has a nice sized dance floor in the back. It's an 80's themed bar and plays mainly music from that decade (with some from the late 70s and early 90s). They have a loyal crowd and they seem to care about their customers. Went on a Saturday night. It got crowded, but never felt overcrowded. There was an $8 cover charge 🤷‍♂️. Drink prices were reasonable. Not the greatest beer selection, but they have all the liquors. Everything served in disposable cups or plastic "pint glasses".

I had a blast! This is my favorite dance bar in NYC. A true dive bar. A bunch of fellow weirdos reliving the 80s. Loud enough sound system and dj playing 80s some rarities and the hits while the downstairs dj played 70s disco and some punk. Downstairs bathrooms had recently been remodeled and were really clean. Decor is battered walls covered in fan tribute 80s paintings and flyers. Good standard drinks served in lil plastic cups. Average price drinks for Manhattan. The bartenders were all really nice especially Franchesca. My experience with the bouncer. When I entered the bar after I showed the bouncer my ID I was in line to pay the cashier and a woman cut in front of me and the bouncer saw this and spoke up for me to the cashier and said "hey she's next!"

Went here once before and was amazing. Tried to come again tonight and the security guard was so rude. He had a hat and just kept smoking while talking to us. Wouldn't let us in as a group, was sort of racist and then went on tinder after we refused to go in and left. Happy I didn't go there again and probably won't go back ever.

I've been here 2x now and I like this place. I will come and stay here to dance anything off. The music is great, totally awesome. I went to the madonnathon yesterday and danced and drank and was just so chill and didnt care if I danced good or not. I just had fun. How come I didnt know about this place before. Must, must check it out. It's all about the music. And the place too. ;)

formatted_address: 459 Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: HIPHOP KARAOKE DUBAI

formatted_address: 1065 Pacific St, Brooklyn, NY 11238, USA
name: Pagwah jouvert camp

formatted_address: 517 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: The Viand

reviews.text:
Liked it a lot! Honestly, was a default decision because we were running late for a concert. Turned out to be a great decision. 

We told hostess we were kind of in a hurry. No problem. Seated, immediately attended. Not attitude from anyone. It's a very comfy place. Liked the layout and the decor - contemporary but very comfy the way a diner should be.

Food was terrific (excellent burger), nice wine selection if you're into that, portions generous, service friendly and efficient. We liked it so much, we came back after the concert for desert.
Great for brunch. Casual and chill vibe.
Unbelievably great quality food, generous portion sizes and reasonably priced! Shame me and my partner found this on our last day in New York, little hidden diamond!

Great brunch spot. Was seated timely on a Saturday morning. 
Excellent kids menu. Silver dollar pancakes were super cute
There is an additional charge for maple syrup btw
The service was excellent 
Eggs Benedict with salmon was good
Chicken and waffles were good too
Good portions
Has orange juice and apple juice
Would recommend! Walking distance to the AMNH which is cool
A solid diner type restaurant with an extensive menu, good food  good service and good value. They have very good burgers and fries.

formatted_address: 260 W 40th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Boqueria

reviews.text:
Great casual cafe by Port Authority. Light, bright with diverse menu. Mediterranean bowl with seared tuna, Boqueria Burger, salad with grilled chicken were the items we ordered. All items were delicious. Service was 
quick and efficient. Reservations are a must especially during lunchtime. The only odd thing is all the seating is high off the ground. There are feet bars under all the chairs and booths.

The space is stunning, fresh bar ingredients spread though the space. I wish I liked it more. The burger was not the best. The meat although cooked well was tough. The onions were far too salty and the salad tasted dirty. I love a fresh garden salad, just you know, not tasting like dirt. 

It got a 3 because of the price. Wish I could give it 3.5
We came early then our reservation was set for, had no seat.  We were asked if we wanted the chef's seat,  by far was awesome experience watching professional cook.  Thank you for amazing food.

Love love this tapas place. The portion is very generous for a tapas place. We came on a sunday's night without a reservation and were seated right away. We love the ambient, the service was quick and beyond professional.
Really cute restaurant, nice ambiance and environment. The food was great and the waiter as well. Will definitely be back and introduce this place to all my guests.

formatted_address: 108 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10006, USA
name: Pendulum

reviews.text: This was a very intimate club, with a pretty much open floor plan and semi private rooms divided by thin sheer fabric. BYOB and a little smokers corner so you don't have to go all the way out the building. Staff were fun and great conversation, a great discreet place to play.
Nice place And friendly staff
The lady at the has a horrible attitude

formatted_address: 101 Liberty St floor 3, New York, NY 10007, USA
name: Osteria della Pace

reviews.text: I told my friends about this place with my warmest recommendations. I go their often. This recommendation is always successful. The the food there is great and the stuff is efficient and cooperative. Every time  we visit this place we enjoy a gorgeous evening.  warmly recommended.
Great option for a fancy lunch. The seafood pasta was delicious! A bit on the pricey side though.

Considering the location and the view, the price is acceptable.  Good for date night. 
Of course, the meal was very delicious!

My out-of-town family and I had a lovely meal here, but after we split the bill, BOTH credit card numbers that were used to pay the bill were stolen and subsequently used fraudulently. 

Though it's impossible to 100% prove that they were stolen at this restaurant, it's the only place both cards were used all year, and the fraudulent charges were for similar items on both cards. I'm really disappointed that I now feel like I can't trust Eataly anymore.
Food and service are on point. Some of the best flavors from Italy without being in Italy.

formatted_address: 125 W 26th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Bowery New York

formatted_address: 225 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Don Coqui

reviews.text: No parking anywhere. Hard to find.

formatted_address: 15 Stone St, New York, NY 10004, USA
name: Toro Loco

reviews.text: This is a new, cozy and quaint restaurant. It's packed at lunch. Go after 1:30 pm, if you want to avoid the crowds. There's also an upstairs if you don't mind climbing the stairs. I heard that on the weekend, the ground floor is turned into a dance floor. So, go grab a bite. Have fun with friends, co-workers or family.

Nice atmosphere, friendly staff. They had a second floor which is where we sat and a bar upstairs as well. You can even sit by the windows but I did want a chair with back support. Bar tender was very courteous and helpful with questions.
Food was amazing! Definitely loved my tacos and enjoyed my drink as well!
Fun place & the DJ was awesome. Nice decor & atmosphere. Food and service were good.  Decent prices for NYC.

I've been going here for a few years now and I can't find a single thing to dislike. They always have delicious food, a good atmosphere, great drinks and most importantly for NYC, great prices. Great for food & drinks at any time!

PS: Get the guacamole that s**t HITS

Great restaurant. The staff are very attentive and friendly.  Great environment. The food is very good. I have tried their guacamole and the burrito, It was delicious. Highly recommend the house margarita. Omar makes amazing drinks. You can't go wrong with anything he recommends.

formatted_address: 64 E 34th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Masala King

reviews.text: I wish I could give more than 5 stars.  I have now brought quite a few coworkers and friends.  All love the restaurant.  The food is fabulous!  The service is gracious.  I'm so glad to have discovered it.  Hard to see due to construction next door.  Be sure to check it out.

The ambience is Fine! The Food is Good! Clean restrooms. There is a Live Kitchen for the breads, which is a plus point for the customers who are new to the Indian Cuisine. The service is warm and nice. Although the lights at night are not good at all...they should change it ASAP. It was a blue lighting and it made the overall dining experience a bit lousy.
Absolutely a delight. Delicious, good service and great value. Give them a try if you haven't. Convenient location to Mid-town

The food is pretty good. The atmosphere is very calming. Good for quick buffet meal in the morning, the tandoor is really good at this place. I would give them a 5 star if they considered changing the flooring a bit. Overall, the place is pretty good including the staff. You would not regret getting a meal at this place. Try out Masala King.
Very elegant and accessible place. They serve generous portions and for economical prices. I liked the food very much and the staff were very personal and informative. Highly recommended.

formatted_address: 218 Court St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Lobo

reviews.text: Maybe it's just nostalgia, but Lobo is one of the best Tex-Mex restaurants I've ever been to. The service is great, the food is delicious, and the atmosphere is just right. It isn't fancy or mind-blowing, but if you're looking for a casual place to have dinner with friends or family, this is the place to go.
Great mexican food and drinks. The staff is very attentive and friendly. I will be back!

The best Tex Mex I’ve ever had. Cash only but absolutely worth it. I used to live down the block and regret not going there as often as possible. I often go back because in addition to the food they make awesome drinks. Possibly best chips and salsa I’ve ever had. Treat yourself to this amazing spot in one of the best parts of Brooklyn.
Delicious shrimp tacos and chicken fajita tacos. I also enjoyed the rice and beans. Family atmosphere.
Excellent food. Margaritas are great. Just remember it's cash only

formatted_address: 44 W 28th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Indayo group

formatted_address: 500 W 48th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: Fairytail Lounge

reviews.text: You have to pay to enter and it was total empty on Pride Sunday - that speaks for itself. The crowd is also strange and the lounge seems to be a very ‘special’ trans place.
Some of the dances are pretty hot, but some others can be really pushy. Two of them dragged me into the back despite me saying no thanks a couple of times. I directly went away after the second one.
The guys will get every dollar out of you that they can.  If you got money to blow well worth it. Otherwise be careful.

just stay out.
not a classical gay bar.
inform ahead, if this is the crowd you want.
They are NOT closed. Open and thriving.

formatted_address: 126 Front St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Superfine

reviews.text: This one of the coolest places I have been too. They usually have some funky band playing and the atmosphere is great. The food is good too. The weird thing is I always end up sitting at the same spot at the bar. The other thing is that it is just up the street from one of the best views in the world.
Great spot in Dumbo for food and cocktails. Urban, character and good music. Will certainly be back on our return to Brooklyn.
Took my husband to this place to celebrate his birthday. The food and drinks are great. The waiter is so nice and gave my husband a lemon pie for his birthday. So kind.
We had a really nice brunch here. I ordered the enchiladas suizas and they were delicious. The service was great.

Burger is out of this world. I'm giving it 5 stars just for that. Rest of the food I've tried has been more hit or miss -- some has been good to be fair. But aside from the burger I love the cool vibe, spacious feel, welcoming staff and fun communal pool table area. Definitely worth a visit if you are in the neighborhood.

formatted_address: 221 W 38th St #2, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Lazzara's Pizza Cafe

reviews.text:
Maybe it’s pizza that’s just right up my ally, maybe it was we had their first pie of the day.  This is one of my favorite places I tried when I visited NY specifically to tour pizza places.

It was excellent.  Their sauce had a great flavor for the simplicity of it.  They cheese they used was fantastic.  Their crust was thin, crispy and tasty.  For such a large square slice it supported all it was holding very well.

Great place, great atmosphere.  I highly recommend it.

The food was excellent. If you haven't ate here . You are missing out . I had the pizza and fried calamari.  Don't know what mozzarella they use but I never tasted anything like that. Very cozy . The staff are so great

We were visiting the city for my hubby’s work and didn’t have reservations for dinner. It was getting late, we were hungry and found this gem via open table. It’s now one of our favorites, the small and intimate setting makes for a great date night or any night out for a great meal. When we were there, it was past the dinner rush, so there was only a small handful of tables being used. The wine list is on the board so read it, if you want wine with your meal. We tried several items that night and each were top notch. We only ate here once during that trip, but still compared all the other restaurants to Lazzara’s. It’s on our NYC must eat at list. We recommend it to all our friends who travel to there as a must go cafe.

I can’t explain how there are a few people who rate this place poorly. I go a few times a year for the past 17 years and it remains terrific. Every dish is well prepared. The pizza continues to be stellar.

OK - it’s official.  The Dave Portnoy / Barstool hype has gotten out of control.  This pizza was good, but NOT anywhere near being worth the outrageous $22 price tag!  

We also had the pasta “special” which was the worst pasta I’ve ever had in my entire life.  The pasta was over cooked mush, the broccoli was a mushy mess and inedible, and it was also way overpriced at $16.  

The pizza was good, but it’s more of a flatbread pizza than anything and way overrated.  I would not go back here.

Also - they haven’t dusted or cleaned the place since it was opened.  There was about 2 inches of dust piled up on top of some of the pictures and light fixtures.  

This place needs some help from Gordon Ramsay’s kitchen nightmares...

formatted_address: 453 W 17th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: 1 OAK

reviews.text: Some of my friends Took me out here  it was my first time at one oak and I had so much fun! The music is great the drinks are delicious.
Great drinks, food, and serve. Super chill place. Great vibes!
It's one of the most interesting clubs in town to visit with a friend. You will never get bored. I just lost my vallet out there. If anyone gets it then please inform at the earliest.

I was there with a business group so we didn't have to wait in line but honestly I don't get the hype...! Music is average and the place is jammed with literally no room to move or dance and constant elbow jabbing.. You can drop $1000s for bottles but all you get is a spot at the bar, no table. As a matter of fact even after we switched to a table it didn't get any better as all booths are crowded with girls looking for free drinks and perched on top of couches. This place needs much better crowd control. 
Trust me you'd have a much better and enjoyable time in ANY of the less hyped clubs all over the city.

If I could rate this no stars I would. Bought a table here for NYE. Arrived at 11:30 PM and ordered bottles at 11:45 PM. We kept seeing bottles come out thinking it was ours, by the time 1 AM came around we still hadn’t received our bottles. We had spoken to management, but the service was the ABSOLUTE worst. Never got bottles or drinks so we left. WORST EXPERIENCE EVER. They have horrible service.

formatted_address: 181 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Benson's NYC

reviews.text: I stumbled upon this little gem after parking my car on Essex street. Let me just start by saying the bartender showed a stupendous welcoming. On top of the extreme professionalism displayed behind the bar, the beer was phenomenal along with the appetizers we ordered. Highly recommend!

Been meaning to check this spot out for a while based off the reviews of its burgers. The service was super friendly but unfortunately I found the bun the burger was served on to be dry and a little tough to chew. I also asked for it to be cooked medium but it was certainly well done. The image is of a classic burger. The fries were great!
Wow! One of the top 5 burgers I've ever had! Great local place featuring local artist's work at reasonable prices. Annie, the Aussie bartender, was awesome. Highly recommended!

Great selection of craft beers. The owner is super sweet and happy to share her reccomendations, really knows her stuff. Great vibe. Small bar quiet and friendly. Very relaxing afternoon and got to try some unique crafts

Incredible experience. Best restaurant/bar in NYC. The service was top notch, our bartender was simply put an excellent host. I ordered the original burger and a craft beer. I have got to admit that this has to be the best burger I have ever had. Overall, awesome experience and would definitely be back! Thanks Benson NYC, keep up the great work.

formatted_address: 818 10th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Sall Restaurant & Lounge

reviews.text: Do NOT buy Fever Sip N Paint tickets for Sall Lounge! Event is a total scam. It was supposed to go from noon to 2pm and it didn’t start until 1:05pm and we still got kicked out at 2pm! There is no lead instructor to paint along with, you just have to wing it on your own. The tables are tiny and impossible to paint on. There is no room for all of your supplies and drinks. Don’t even think about ordering food, there would be no place to put it. The color palette is very limited so you can’t even fully paint what you want. At the end they charge you tax and gratuity as some arbitrary number. I bought two tickets for $50 total. So 9% sales tax plus 18% gratuity comes out to $13.5, but they charged me $19.03. That just put the icing on the cake for how bad the overall experience was. Stay away from this place at all costs.
went for a sip & paint event. drinks were good. food smelled delicious. will go back for brunch

We came to Sall because we had a Pulse coupon. We came for brunch and we're told our unlimited mimosas were actually going to be 4 margaritas per person. 5 out of 6 of us got served our meals, which were delicious. However, one of us, who ordered the easiest meal didn't get served until long after the rest of us are our meals. And from where we were sitting, we could hear the guy from the kitchen stating they he didn't care because he had other orders. It was just a mess.
Awesome bartender! Always makes sure my friends have a good time. Mixes her drinks well and always has a good face. Come here if you wanna have a good time or just want to chill out!

This place is dirty.  Bad service.  When we went to the bathroom, we walked past the service area/kitchen and it was disgusting.  There were bottles of cleaning chemicals mixed in with the dirty food bottles.  The hookahs are mixed in with dirty power tools.  Took forever to get our food because the manager is also the host, and is also the cook.  The menu is over priced and staff is combative.  Save your money and your time- GO SOME WHERE ELSE!

formatted_address: 33 W 26th St, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: Cofesta

reviews.text: Truly a hidden gem of the neighborhood. I love it here. Now I just have to convince them to open on weekends and they’ll never be rid of me!

I love this place. I've been coming every single day for the past month or so ever since I discovered it. Their menu items are delightful, the ingredients are fresh from the farmer's market, and you can taste it! Their raspberry green tea, pistachio croissant, and Tokyo Egg Salad (especially with Lox) are my favorite. If you're in Midtown and looking for a quiet place to study, have a meeting, or grab coffee with a friend, I definitely recommend this place! The staff is the cherry on top; friendly, caring, and they remember your order which I love because I forget what I enjoy most of the time!
As others have shared previously... This cafe has SO much space! It's a wonderfully quiet space to take a stroll to in the middle of the day. Lovely staff each time I have been.
I wish the power plugs actually worked. Quiet space that would otherwise be ideal.

This place has zero customer loyalty. Was having a quick meeting with a friend (who ordered tea) but I was rudely kicked out for having "an outside beverage", even though I'm a near-weekly customer. I feel bad for the management as I'm sure they are stressed and struggling to pay rent, but taking it out on customers isn't a good business strategy. Have never been treated this way in an NYC establishment and will not be back. Also candidly, their coffee is overpriced.

formatted_address: 90 John St, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: Stout NYC ~ FiDi

reviews.text: Menu is basic does not cater to vegans. Nothing special about this place could. You are definitely not missing out on anything. Basic over priced food that you are better off cooking at home. Service could have been so much better. I honestly had better service at a Taco Bell believe me. Yes Taco Bell will be willing to cater to vegans. 0 starts for me.

App the food was good and flavorful but not the best we have had. This is not really a place that you would want to go with your family as the music was super loud and was hard to talk to each other. Service was quick and helpful.

The service was great!  The young women that took care of us was super attentive but not intrusive.  The food is usually pretty damn good but the salad with steak I ordered this time tasted not good at all.

Nice location with good beer and food. I ordered a pizza, which had an excellent taste! I definitely would return and eat a pizza in there again! Only the server could be a bit friendlier, apparently she was stressed in her job.
Love this place. Order delivery at least once a week. Delicious food, excellent staff. I highly recommend this restaurant (particularly if you like a good steak)

formatted_address: 68 Clinton St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Pig and Khao

reviews.text: I'm so mad I only now discovered this place. Had the baby octopus, mushroom salad, three way prawn and adobo pork, all fantastic. No complaints. The Halo Halo was an awesome end to the meal. Don't forget to try the cilantro soda!

My wife and I split the chef tasting about a month ago and I am still dreaming about the food. Perfect blend of sour and savoury. Had a couple noodle dishes, a couple rice dishes, the most tender piece of fish in a fish soup. The front of the house was a little loud so we asked to sit in the back and it was a lot better. Next time I'm in NYC I plan on going back.
Amazing food, is only the start. The music is perfect for the environment, the staff is amazing. Love the fact that it's an open kitchen. Flavors are just perfect. Can't wait to go back already.

Great food, awesome spot!! My friends and I went here for brunch and it’s was fantastic. Great manager/owner and the staff was attentive and understanding. Overall, I would definitely recommend this to everyone!!!

Family style restaurant that offers a wide array of Southeast Asian cuisine. 

Food is fantastic and I can't recommend it enough, though it can be a little tight at the 2 person tables. Great for groups 6 or under

formatted_address: 460 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Estancia 460

reviews.text:
Great food, great drinks, great service and people. 

The beers and mixed drinks are top quality. I loved the meat and chase plate, meat empanada, and caramel crepe dessert. Had a wonderful meal here. Will definitely come back. 

The service had a very personal touch as well, making the experience 5 stars overall.
Great drinks and food. Their bread is so good. Grilled Mozzarella appetizer was amazing. Will definitely go there again.
This place obviously knows how to treat their customers. Consistently with a very nice approach. The food is affordably priced, regularly fresh and clean.
Could you have a better neighborhood restaurant. Good food and service. Quiet, but convenient location in North Tribeca. And you can have good lunch, dinner and brunch. A gem!

This site is my preferable site.  Of all restaurants I know I favor it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to visit this place. when  I feel like having a special dinner, this is the place that comes straight to my head. good and all kinds of  food and a large list of dishes.trained staff members, and agreeable spirit. Also, the cost is modest. I recommend this spot with great pleasure.

formatted_address: 70 Eckford St, Brooklyn, NY 11222, USA
name: horti PLAY

reviews.text: Tremendous service! Great care in packaging and plants!! Love it!
Beautiful plant store in Greenpoint with subscription service. Friendly staff, too!
Picked up my first subscription this week and couldn't be more happier! Can't wait to start my plant journey with this AMAZING shop!

Horti is an amazing place to come get away from the hustle of the city.  I didn't appreciate how important it is to have a green space to retreat to until I stopped in randomly and ended up staying for an event.  Now I get a little green delivered every month.

Love this place! I came in with a succulent that I thought needed to be repotted but they were able to reposition it in the pot and it looks great. Also, i of course couldn’t leave without picking up two new house plants :)

formatted_address: 215 Chrystie St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Public Arts

reviews.text: This was the freshest, most captivating show we have seen in years! Thank you for giving us a once in a lifetime experience. We will for sure be back to show friends.

Lovely location, roof bar, small stage in the basement. Lovely view from the roof, perfect for pictures! The artist we saw is Taylor Bennet! Lovely music, great atmosphere. Would definitely come here again!

Stood in a line for 3 minutes, got yelled at, walked out. Lame experience. I was sent there to write an article on the venue...

The rooftop bar was boring as well. Bad quality cocktails. So many other fantastic places to go in NYC.
The hotel is pure luxury. GREAT place for groups if you're looking for a fun club atmosphere. Upstairs there is a lair for a more chill vibe. Night life you MUST experience while in NYC.

The downstairs venue, Public Arts, is pretty neat. Medium sized with very good sound. 

My gin & tonic in a rocks glass was 11 bucks with a heavy pour. All the male bartenders were ridiculously hot. *wink wink*

Now for the minuses... immediately after the show we were aggressively herded away from the stage to the bar. All that accomplished was me prematurely closing out my tab. I'm sure that's not what they intended, but I couldn't even say "Hi" to the band so I bounced like 80% of the crowd. 

Also they keep your ID with your card when you run a tab. It went well, but that took a hell of a lot of trust on my part. I guess they distract you with the smokin' hot bartenders into giving it up. It worked.

formatted_address: 325 E 41st St, New York, NY 10017, USA
name: Sid Mansion

reviews.text: Very Cool
Måtte snike meg litt unna Prinsessen, must say it was worth it!!

formatted_address: 457 3rd Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215, USA
name: Bar Tano

reviews.text:
I give two stars because when it finally did come it was pretty good. Cocktails are just okay. Probably won't go back.

Waited for over an hour to get our food which would have been "okay" if the waitress had better communicated the situation. Once the food did come out she offered us free wine which we didn't take but didn't compensate us in any other way for our time spent there waiting for the meals.
Good food and wine selection.

Good food and really nice outdoor seating. The pizza was delicious, but the hummus was store-bought, not made in the house. The truffle French fries are also really tasty - and I don’t normally find French fries appealing at all. Great for a night out with friends! Not crowded on Sunday night is a total plus

The only reason I am giving 3 stars and not less is because this place used to be great, for dining in and ordering from. Tonight was a totally different story.

Ordered the burger, which has always been delicious, but tonight NOTHING was cooked. The fries were soggy, they didn't look like they were even cooked and the burger was raw, it was supposed to be medium. We ordered 2 and both orders were a disaster. 

What a waste of $50, won't be ordering again.

Been here a dozen times and the food is consistently good. The pizza is better elsewhere but all the pastas, entrees, and salads are solid. My personal favorites are the Bolognese and the Cavolo salad. 

The bar is very well stocked, wines are hit or miss like most places. 

It's a small place typically with a single server so service can be a little wonky depending on who is working.

formatted_address: 237-275 W 33rd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Holidei

formatted_address: 627 W 51st St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Loft 51

reviews.text: I went to the Lost in the Loft party and it was amazing! The location was difficult to get to, so we had to take an uber to navigate. The bar is OVERPRICED, we paid $17 for ONE drink and $40 for Hookah... NOT WORTH IT!
really love this place! my friends & I always have an amazing experience when we come here

The bouncer was the most rudest man I ever met.  He had the nerve to look at my outfit up and down and say I wasnt dressed well enough for a party and next tine we wont let me in.  I never had a problem getting numbers dispite what style outfit i decide to where that night.  And to make things worse, admission and drinks are both 20+ each ...
Probably the club with one of the best atmospheres in New York City !!

This place is a trashy scam. Save yourself the money and grief because this place oversells on tickets online and then refuses to let you in. Here’s a suggestion to the owner, there’s this term called “sold out”. Use it. 

Several friends and I bought tickets online to attend another friend’s birthday party. We arrived at 12:00 AM and got on line expecting to wait a little for the bouncer to check IDs and move people along. But, all we heard was the bouncer screaming “We’re not letting anyone in right now”. Ok, fine, the birthday boy and other people in our group were already inside so we waited on line with the crowd of people growing every minute who keep in mind , all ALREADY bought tickets online. I know this because we were all pulling up tickets on our phone to show the bouncer thinking that maybe he meant he wasn’t letting people in who didn’t have tickets. Nope, that was just wishful thinking.

After about 20 minutes of seeing herds of people leaving Loft 51, several people including my group went up to ask the bouncer if we could go in only to be told “No one’s going in right now”. We would’ve left then and there but this was to celebrate someone’s birthday so we sucked it up and waited some more.
At 12:57 AM, almost an hour since we arrived, the owner joined the bouncer at the door to announce “We’re closing the door, no one’s going in anymore. Someone yelled out to the owner, are we getting a refund and he just shrugged it off. So much for celebrating a friend’s birthday, a crowd of us who spent money on tickets never even made it inside. 

Like any other club in the city, there’s almost always going to be some wait but this is the first time I’ve been to a club that SCAMMED so much money out of people only to then not let them in at all.

formatted_address: 1241 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10027, USA
name: Flat Top

reviews.text: Been here for brunch with my friends and we all simply loved the food!! Every dish on the table tasted great but my personal favorite was the Spinach Gruyere Egg White Omelette; Healthy, light and satisfying! I loved their organic tea collection too. Further, I could also feel the unadulterated wholeness in every sip of their freshly-squeezed orange juice.

Haven’t been here for brunch but their dinner options were amazing. Chose this place based of the reviews and it didn’t disappoint. The ambiance was low key and relax with very attentive service from the staff.

I had the Bahn Mi sandwich which came on its own was delicious and very filling. Highly recommend this place for a dinner date.

This is one of my favorite brunch spots in Harlem. The biscuits and gravy is incredible. It’s a full biscuit separated with a sausage patty on each side, covered in gravy and topped with a fried egg. The gravy is really the right consistency - it’s not too thick or salty. The whole dish really hits the spot.

Love it bc it's a few blocks from my work place & it's great food. I had the pancakes w lemon curd & so pleased, they were delicious! My son had the grilled cheese & tomato soup which also tasted great. Coffee was excellent, they had non dairy. It's bright, clean & cheery.

Great options and staff. 

I went for late lunch. 

The menu is multicultural. It has vegetarian options too. 

I recommend this place for sure. 

Staff were all friendly and attentive. 

Will come back for sure!!

formatted_address: 261 W 125th St, New York, NY 10027, USA
name: Red Lobster

reviews.text: Service was fast and efficient. The food was great. And the servers were super nice...like superb. I been to a lot of food places and these people are happy to help you. Also the vibe is calming on the second floor and joyful and loud on the first. So multiple options to choice from. Great dining experience overall 👌 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟

Not gonna lie I haven't been to a red lobster in 20 years, but the cheddar biscuits still taste like the cheddar biscuits, and red lobster still knows how to cook a shrimp to perfection. 

We stopped in for happy hour  which was pretty great with $4 beers $5 wines and $6 mid shelf liquors.

If you like poke. Dont get it here, it's not bad, but not great, for those who have never tried it, at $3.00 try it out. 

Happy hour is only till 6 which kinda sucks thou.
The food was delicious, well cooked and seasoned. The service was impeccable and fast. It was so good we almost forgot to take pictures!

EDIT: The manager Matt is excellent and got back to me promptly and was able to resolve the matter in a respectful, efficient and calm way.This location is lucky to have him. 

Original Review:
Upon myself and my mother arriving we were seated and then attended to by our waiter Jarett. I ordered a frozen drink and my mother ordered a soft drink. As we know that there is currently the straw ban that is currently in discussion in New York we are ALSO aware that we are still permitted a straw upon request. UPON REQUEST we were given the run around by our waiter Jarett who stated that the straws had been banned (a lie) but he would check to see what he could do. He never returned with an answer or a straw leaving us to ask a DIFFERENT waiter for said straw. EVERY OTHER WAITER had straws conveniently on their person and would hand one over without hesitation to their other customers. 

The service continued and we noticed very clear differences in treatment between our table and another table seated directly behind us which led to even FURTHER discomfort. 

Upon receiving our bill there was a section stating "Suggested Tip Included" MEANING that there is a SUGGESTED tip already included in your TOTAL BILL TO BE PAID. 

THIS IS NOT A MANDATORY TIP BUT THEY WRITE IT ON THE RECEIPT AS IF IT IS A PART OF WHAT NEEDS TO BE PAID. 

We spoke to the manager who confirmed this and stated we did not need to pay the suggested tip amount and were more than welcome to leave whatever amount we chose and would be charged accordingly. So imagine my surprise when I double check my account and see the FULL BILL WITH SUGGESTED TIP AMOUNT charged to my card. 

As somebody who has held a server position, this was by far one of the WORST experiences of my life.

The lobster dish looked as if they shaved little pieces  and soaked them in butter sauce... taste just awful! I haven't been in Red lobster in years, and thought they had improved... Boy, was I wrong.. never going back... The Star is for the waitress... she was embarrassed the fish looked aweful!!

formatted_address: 367 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: HandCraft Kitchen & Cocktails

reviews.text: HandCraft makes some of the best cocktails in the neighborhood. As the name implies, they don't just sloppily toss ingredients into a glass, they take care with it, and it shows. Plus they brand their ice cubes with their logo which doesn't effect how tasty the drink is, but is cool because I'm easily amused. If you're looking for something other than cocktails, they have a pretty great beer list with a few gems on it. The bartenders are super friendly too, so take care of them (and all bartenders for that matter).
Great food and cocktails, good service and well environment.
Good wine night on Mondays. Food is ok. Tater Tots were amazing. Bartender on Mon 2/10 was awesome!
What a great place to catch a drink and some apps. Try the “nachos” with tater tots to blow your mind. Solid happy hour rounds it out for after work.

Servers are great, drinks are good. I ordered the chicken potpie, I ended up sending it back after 2 bites. It tasted like frozen vegetables with chicken broth with a small puff pastry placed on top. It needed seasoning it lacked flavor. The burger and fries were decent. The atmosphere is nice for an after work meet up for drinks.

formatted_address: 93 1st Avenue #2, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Panna II Garden

reviews.text: The food and atmosphere is everything I expected and heard of. I highly recommend this place. Also, the mango ice cream is heavenly delicious. For even a better time, walk with your bottle wine to have that little buzz.  The sever is very friendly and kind; always refilling the glass. The lights on the ceiling is very instagram aesthetic. I rate this place 10 out of a 10.

This place was okay. I seen it on a few blogs due to decor. Appetizers took a while to come out, a long with main dishes. However, server was very kind. What I didn't like in particular was that they advertise it as an "Indian Restaurant" but there was Bengali food on the menu, along with Bengali servers. The food was a fusion of Bengali/Indian food. Which is fine, but as a Bengali myself, there's still very little representation of the Bengali culture, so it would've been nice if they advertised as a Bengali restaurant instead of Indian, and embraced more traditional Bengali food. But I guess advertising it as "Indian" sells more🤷🏼‍♀️

Food is really delicious , can’t say any bad word about it. Design of restaurant looks really nice, but unfortunately it’s really hard to keep it clean. I saw dust everywhere. You don’t want to eat when you now that dust can fall into your plate from lamps. Moreover, everything there was too fast. You can’t just wear a little and talk with your friends because you already ate, so waitress give to you a bill. I think people there should be more nicer.

Its not Indian but Bangladeshi food... misleading...closest to West Bengal...too rich.... wierd cheap lighting... dilapidated seating....  and no credit card payment option. Wouldn't choose to go again.
CASH ONLY + BYOB,. Pretty filling food. Vegetables sample as an appetizer and chicken curry! Staff is not as fast as expected for the amount of people that fit but.. decent food!

formatted_address: 20 Hudson Yards, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Wild Ink

reviews.text: Great food. Fast service. Cocktails were very good and enjoyed them. Lovely view of the vessel in Hudson yards while dining.

This place offers a menu full of interesting dishes that propose a fusion of eastern and western cuisine, the decor is elegant, somewhat minimalistic and warm. The staff is nothing short of impeccable. It's very good for a bite on the go, and considering its location, the prices are more than acceptable. Gluten free and vegetarian dishes are well marked on the menu. The dim sum is spot on, truly enjoyable. The view is fantastic, the large windows are right in front of The Vessel. And the coffee is good!

Picked this place in a hurry. To my pleasant surprise, it has an awesome view of the Vessel. Tables and chairs are comfortable and arranged spaciously. The bar area looked good, and the experience may be better, but we did not sit there. The food were tasty, a good Asian fusion taste as advertised. Be prepare, the prices are $$$$$. Modern style (small) serving portion. The opposite of Texas style portion.  The wait staff we had could use a little more training for the caliber this restaurant portrays. Go for the view, that’s about it, in my opinion.

The view is nice, good atmosphere. Dim sums are yummy, but small (you get 3 pieces). Wine selection is great. I had an Arctic char. The fish and potatoes were delicious, the sauce on the bottom was a touch too salty and since it was not on the side it was difficult not to get it on the rest of the food.

Went there for lunch, staff members were super friendly and attentive, the view by the window was very nice, pretty classy decor with Asian elements (not in an appropriating way), and the food was interesting and delicious! I would especially recommend the duck wrap on the brunch menu and the steak on the regular menu. The mapo tofu dumplings were interesting, (we thought it was going to be terrible, but it wasn't.) And the risotto was a bit too salty for my taste. 

9/10, would definitely come again!

formatted_address: 65 St Marks Pl, New York, NY 10003, USA
name: Jules Bistro

reviews.text: An excellent place for brunch, hearty tasty food as a main/entree plus unlimited mimosa/bellini (with the bubbles being of good quality) you cannot go wrong all in for $30. Also they have live music whilst you eat with a very authentic French feel atmosphere. Highly recommended.

Jules is a gem of a restaurant with great food, impressive live music, and an incredibly friendly staff. I was a bit hesitant about feeling like an outsider as you'll quickly realize the staff is largely expat, but they are welcoming and inviting. If you like French food or just a general French feel, Jules is a must

The atmosphere was very lively and welcoming. The staff was so friendly and the food was amazing. The jazz band was great. I really enjoyed. This is not the place for a quiet dinner. I highly recommend this place
Great French restaurant with Jazz on Mondays. For food get the escargot and the stakes, they Rae great. Waiters are super nice. A great experience and it doesn't get crowded which is even better.

Parisian experience in LES!! Come early and you might catch some old school piano players just happily jamming. 
The Cote de Beuf was astonishing.

formatted_address: 424 E 14th St #2, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Akina Sushi

reviews.text: Much higher quality than you'd expect at this price. Consistently good, and reasonably priced
Very nice place
Go-to Japanese spot for good, cheap neighborhood sushi.
Small place but very good food. I enjoyed it.

Overall five stars. The only minor thing is that the waitress as soon as one finish eating, if there are not many people, she wants to give you the check. 🙄🙄 Besides that the place is a 💎💎💎💎 even on delivery.

formatted_address: 200 Front St, New York, NY 10038, USA
name: 10 Corso Como Restaurant & Cafe

reviews.text: Very nice mix of an eclectic store and a coffee shop/cafe. The store has some great items and is a lot of fun to wander through. The cafe has a limited menu, but it is all good. It is pretty busy, but the seats turned over quickly. Valet parking as with every place in Seoul. On our visit we set next to a famous Korean tv/movie star for about an hour. Looked like we were the only people who recognized him as everyone ignored him. (Or maybe he is not that famous). Very nice place for a coffee/drink after a day of shopping.
airy, large place serving almost home food. just make sure they're not closed for a private event, a fear that always becomes a big turnoff everytime you want to come back.

A really nice space with artistic wall at the dining room great for photos. Food was really good, server was reliable and the food came out quite fast. We ordered lobster gnocchi, burrata and artichoke, and scallop with barley and truffle.What makes this place even better is the 2 floors of designers collection of lifestyle and fashion goods. Quite a decent number of cook books and foodies magazine are also on display for purchase.
Nice music and pretty atmosphere. Good for group and party. Not recommended for candle night dinner , because too noisy

Food was amazing.  Service best I have ever seen. Been to Italy 5x. Closest I have ever eaten in this country. Fantastic bar and wine list. Prosciutto was so fresh melted in your mouth. Iced tea with fresh mint very nice touch. Bronzino was super fresh great tasting. Swordfish  was very taste.

formatted_address: 44 W 63rd St., New York, NY 10023, USA
name: The Empire Hotel

reviews.text: A true classic in the heart of the upper west side. Staff was helpful and kind. Room was clean and the views of the Met Opera House were beautiful. Bathroom is small but clean and aesthetically pleasing. Older hotel but an emphasis has obviously been made to give it a modern touch. Would gladly stay there again.

This was such a wonderful experience! Everyday was a new adventure and such a pleasure stepping in and out of this hotel. From the moment we walked into this hotel we were greeted with the utmost perfect hospitality and it is such a rare thing to find in this world. 

Our room was clean and always well stocked with whatever we needed... whether it be fresh towels or the amazing aromatherapy toiletries they offered... this little city gem delivers! 
 And we were just steps away from the park, the juliard and any other proper NY cafe you can imagine. 

The rooftop bar is just perfect for a late night drink and the breakfast was spectacular! 

We cannot say enough about The Empire Hotel! 
Thank you to all of the people who helped us hail a cab, show us to our room, give us extra waters, give us breakfast tickets, and were just overall accommodating during our visit! Definitely coming back!

I have stayed here 3 times. Beautiful hotel, great value! Breakfast buffet is expensive for what it is.. but the rooftop view is worth it. Across the street from Lincoln Center for Performing Arts and a few blocks walk to Central Park. There is a Star Bucks and a French coffee place with amazing pastries nearby. There was a pharmacy on the same block, which was awesome because it saved me a lot of time when I ran out of the essentials, like hair gel and body lotion. Great location. Opt for the King upgraded room or suite... the small difference in price is worth the massive upgrade in room size and these rooms all seem to have better views from the widows as well.

Excellent location right next to the Lincoln Center where I was attending a conference. Central Park, Time Square, and the LDS Temple are all within walking distance. Service was excellent and the front desk provided daily bottles of Fiji Water. The rooms were clean and well kept, but a little on the small side. It worked really well for my wife and I and I would stay here again.

Great music and really nice staff. Stayed there for a week. Not massive amount of space for clothes but a very clean and comfortable room with a good TV and fairly adequate views. Free Fiji water at reception which is helpful for a day out in New York so overall a very good hotel.

formatted_address: 222 W 38th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Ronald McDonald's Funtime Playhouse

formatted_address: 76 FDR Dr, New York, NY 10010, USA
name: La Picina Manhattan

formatted_address: 155 Atlantic Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Brado Thin Crust Pizza

reviews.text: Great place for families. Pizza is awesome, great beer and wine list. Staff is friendly and super accommodating, although a little slow at times. But it is still one of my favorites for thin crust
Fantastic pizza! The crust was perfect and lots of options for vegetarians.

Be forewarned that their crunchy crust pizza is a distinct style from most of the thin crust pizza in the area. Not that that's necessarily a bad thing. Points for having happy hour specials even on weekends. Draws a lot of families in the evening.
Omg great food! Awsome happy hour bogo on whime & beer at happy hour, buy a bottle of wine & get a free pizza!

This place is wonderful. It has a cute and cozy design made up of mostly booths (my favorite!). They staff was super nice as well.

We came here for happy hour, where the purchase of any pitcher of beer or a bottle of wine came with a large thin- crusted, cheese pizza.

What more could a girls' night need?!?

formatted_address: 17 Avenue B, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Cornerstone Cafe

reviews.text: Loved brunching at this cafe despite our wait time of nearly an hour around Sunday noon. The place is small with few tables that adds to the crowd. You need to be at the place to put your names down and stick around until they call your name. Very friendly staff and quite a reasonable brunch. Pancakes were yummy. So was the toasted egg and sausage combo. Veg burgers were impressive, crepes OK

Excellent prices and open early for breakfast even on a week day.  I been coming here for years and it truly is a hidden gem.  The baked eggs dishes are delicious and different from your usual breakfast and brunch fare.

Cozy brunch spot. It's a small space so there's a wait time on the weekends. Their brunch plates are delicious and affordable! I'd give 5 stars if they offered bottomless mimosas with their brunch entrees

There $4 breakfast is great. They have amazing pancakes and french toast. The pitchers if sangria and mimosas are always good. Place is small and there are no substitutes without an additional 4-5 charge. There is free wifi
Pretty good food. Had Angus burger and it was not dry at all. Very fulfilling. Nice atmosphere

formatted_address: 360 9th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Hudson Yards Tavern

reviews.text: Here you are the perfect 0,44 pounds (0,200 kg)  hamburger. The waiters had been very kind. The kitchen worked fast. The space, although looks empty behind the bar, is warm.  The menu if the day is not expensive (10$). I recommend this place

This is more of a thank you than a review. My son and I just got finished doing the CNY halftime show at The Garden. We were famished.  We were about to grab the truck and head back upstate and hope something was open. Then I saw the Hudson Yards Tavern across the way from the parking lot.  A light shone down from heaven. Not really, but the lights were on and it looked right.  The man who greeted us and waited on us, was very kind and patient. I mention this because it was late and we were the only patrons at the time. There was no rush or anything. Just great food and great service. It was much appreciated and it topped off a special night for me and my son. Thank you!

One of the great restaurant I ever had food,
Specially avocado fried, and butter milk chicken,

A++ recommended, 👍👍👍

Great place, just opened clean and great service by Michael.
The food was great so happy we found it🍀
Food is delicious. Excellent place!

formatted_address: 66 Charlton St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: San Marino Ristorante SOHO

reviews.text: I love San Marino Restaurant! The food is extremely delicious, the service is phenomenal and the ambiance is perfect for any event. Such an easy and beautiful location to get to. I have been here many times and can’t wait to go back for that delicious food!
Great food, great atmosphere.  Amazing calamari, & chicken parm.  Easy to have conversations, not loud.
Really wonderful. Came pretty early (around 6) on MLK day (Monday) and the restaurant was mostly empty, but the staff were still super friendly. The lobster ravioli was amazing.

My husband and I went there for and early dinner on Friday. The service right away was so professional and very attentive. The staff was so informative about all the different foods they offer. Everything we ordered was amazing. I would highly suggest this restaurant for a nice quiet Italian dinner. To get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. I will certainly be returning when I come back to the city. Thanks again for a great dining experience. Marcie and Dominick Cingolani.
Delicious Prosciutto with Burrata for appetizer and Lobster Ravioli for dinner

formatted_address: 10 W 32nd St 4th floor, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Karaoke Wow!

reviews.text: Been here twice now, both times early on a week night after dinner. Drinks and song selection were good and the oppas up front were cool and nice. Clean bathrooms, too.

Expensive for outdated equipment and songs..
 $80 for one hour, food was low quality and soju was $20 per bottle. 18% gratuity was added without prior acknowledgement. There are better places to go in this area.

I had a great first time here. I found all the songs I wanted to sing right away. It’s a great place to just chill with your friends and hang out. Welcoming atmosphere.  I’ll come here again for sure.

Awful experience. The guy at the counter said a room would be $60. Each of us asked “that’s all? How long?” He said “one hour, you buy $60 of drinks.” We said “just $60 of drinks?!” So we decided to order our minimum $60 of drinks that he said would cover the room. We took some time pouring over the over priced drink list, but assumed the cost was higher because it was covering the room, right? We were shown to a private room, taught how to use the karaoke system, and brought our drinks. We had a great hour of karaoke. 
The problem was when we went to check out. First, they had more than doubled our bill. We had ordered just over $60 of drinks- so how was our bill now $160?! They said the room costs $60, and you have to buy $60 and then they added gratuity. We said no- you said the room was $60 covered by the drinks. The guy kept saying that he had told us the former “100%”. After arguing we were only able to get them to take the gratuity off and then let us split the $130 we actually “owed.” 
We asked to speak with a manager- the manager on duty got the manager on the phone but never let us speak with him. Then he took photos of the security feed. 
We would never go back anyway- but they tried to make us feel stupid by saying that everyone else got it why did we not understand? It’s not even just that there was a misunderstanding- there was no trying to talk to us or level as far as admitting any mistake. When we first got there we asked about the pricing for our room multiple times! Multiple times! And got the same answer- so when he said that was not what he had told us we knew we were being lied to. I hope you don’t go here. They are not good people.

My friends and I came here anticipating a night of fun and totally got ripped off. The employee told us we needed to order a minimum of 40 dollars' worth of drinks and pay 40 dollars for an hour of karaoke. We thought it was a bit too expensive but were willing to pay $80. But then they brought us a check for $105 and it turned out that they automatically charged us 18% gratuity without telling us in advance. They told us they would give us extra time to sing in exchange for the gratuity. They didn't even give us extra time -- never coming here again!!!

formatted_address: 286 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Guyer's

reviews.text: A nice neighbourhood wine bar with a fun bar staff and lovely caring chef
Excellent wine neighborhood bar, cozy and great service

Dina, Cavan, Javier!
