You guys rock, what a great neighborhood place. I loved hanging out and hope to do it again soon. I was told some people even fall in love at your place…
The great place for intimate Cocktails for Two or a party to have fun. The staff is great especially the bartender Ivaldo.
Very nice place to wine and dine.

formatted_address: 599 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Night Encounters New York

formatted_address: 245 E 33rd St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: The Compound

reviews.text: Must see
Crazy

formatted_address: 422 E 9th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
name: Good Beer

reviews.text: Delicious beer, great staff and Dave is the man. A 10/10 recommend if in the are. One of the Og’s in the game for sure.
Excellent place to take off beers.
Incredible beer selection.  Pick and choose to stay or to go.  They have ciders and ales I couldn't find in a lot of beer "specialty shops" and they're pretty knowledgeable and fun to talk to.
It's such a treasure house for beer-loving New Yorkers. The staffs are knowledgeable but not pretentious. Hope they keep it that way!
Great selection as one would expect  for NYC Only low note - 1 or 2 regulars orbiting the owner with a bit of a chip on their shoulders towards 'outsiders'

formatted_address: 60 E 41st St, New York, NY 10017, USA
name: Stout NYC ~ Grand Central

reviews.text: This is the closest bar to Grand Central that's not actually in Grand Central and there is a large Metro North departures screen on the front wall.  As such, it becomes the "cool kids" waiting area for people catching a train or deliberately trying to miss one.  And therefore during after-work and commuting hours it's very busy and noisy.  But there's a good selection of beers on tap, the bartenders do a decent job of keeping up with the traffic, and come on, you're not going to a bar after work to sit in an empty silent room...

I really love this place , love the location and the delicious food inside the grand central, so many people go and back and stop for a hamburger or a delicious coffe , love the building is super nice, police are everywhere and make us feel really good and comfortable, I highly recommend this place for the best hamburger in town and the best pastry’s. Price are very good too .

NYC’s premiere Packer bar. Though the 2019 NFC Championship didn’t turn out in our favor, Stout was a great place to watch the Packers game. Great fans, decent beer, and fantastic TVs. From beginning to end the staff was helpful and welcoming. Thanks, Stout, and Go Pack Go!

It was not difficult to find a table after work for 10 people. We shared a bunch of appetizers, that were actually all pretty delicious - especially the calamari, loaded fries, and southern fried chicken strips. I was let down a little by the beer list, it was nothing exciting, and my coworkers had assured me that it was a beer bar with a lot of selection.
Really enjoyed my time here. It’s a great Packers bar in the heart of Manhattan. Claire, my bartender from Ireland, was great. Good food, too.

formatted_address: 333 E 60th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Primal Cut Steakhouse

reviews.text: I really liked their food. I always get fantastic customer service here. The place is always clean and the staff members are always nice. Would recommend to others.
Absolutely delicious raw bar. The fish tacos are to die for!
I tried this place once with my friend and I am hooked since then. I like the awesome atmosphere and flavorful dishes and drinks. Highly recommended.
Service was excellent and attentive. Food was very delicious. loved it!
Great steak! Atmosphere was very nice.

formatted_address: 23 W 39th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Windfall

reviews.text: Windfall is always a good time. I have been here for multiple events from singles mixers to the monthly Goth and industrial parties that they host. I always have fun when I am here and always feel welcome. The drinks are USUALLY pretty good and the bartenders tend to have a pretty good attitude. Pretty easy walk here from Grand Central Terminal so that shouldn’t be a worry about getting there and back if you are taking public transportation to the area.
The service was great and the food was really good for bar type food. The bison burger was very tasty. The pretzel was very large and send to be made fresh.
Great, healthy food options. Excellent service and pleasant atmosphere.

I'd intended to go down the street to a different bar/pub, but this place looked inviting and was spacious. It was also quiet enough to sit down and catch up with an old coworker, which is what I was looking for. Prices were decent for the area and they gave out free chips and salsa which was a nice touch. I'll definitely be back - might suggest this as the next place for a work happy hour.
Great place and bartenders are super friendly and overall amazing people. One of the best in the city.

formatted_address: 32 W 37th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Frankie & Johnnie's Steakhouse

reviews.text: One of the best restaurants I’ve ever been too. While it does cost the $$$ you can taste it in every bite. The bone in sirloin was the greatest steak I’ve had the pleasure of eating. The veal melted in the mouth. The old world dark wood aesthetic is what I want my Manhattan steakhouse to look like. This is a once ever five year kind of restaurant that I will rave about until I go back again.

The odd thing is I was in a hotel down the street When the assistant at the front desk recommended this above the second name I gave him. I was unsure when I looked at the menu, it appeared simple. We ordered Shrimp, Salmon and a Sirloin. My 12yo and I both shared the steak and shrimp with smiles.  While my wife happily devoured the broiled Salmon. The sides were all prepared perfectly and generous. If I have a chance to return I won't think twice about a return visit. Our waiter was turning double duty and look forward to seeing him again also.

With restaurant week coming to a close, we took a trip over to Frankie and Johnnie’s steakhouse. We had a table for 4 with reservations and no wait (the place never really got full so I feel like we didn’t need reservations). 
Pro: I have no complaints about the food because everything we had was beautifully presented and delicious. (I had shrimp linguini but I tried the pork chop and steak from my friends’ plates) 
Con: After the appetizer and main course, our waiter just disappeared. We sat there for maybe half an hour waiting for dessert. We flagged down another guy who brought it out in less than 5 minutes.

Outstanding service w a family feel. Amazing quality and professionalism sans the  A typical NY pretentiousness. Forget the other steak houses- this is the place you need to be.  PS- ask to be seated In Adrian’s section!!!!

Great choice if you’re in for an excellent meal.  Recent visit included fabulous ribeye and lamb chops for our dinner.  Highly recommend!  Our excellent server Danny was good fun and definitely a great asset for the establishment.  All other staff were friendly and made our dinner so enjoyable.  Not our first visit - and won’t be our last!

formatted_address: 11 Cornelia St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Birthdays and Bottles

reviews.text: Josh is great! He worked with me on a very short notice and was very responsive to every message I sent him. He is detail-oriented and I've used him to host my birthday party in the city two years in a row. I would highly recommend Birthdays and Bottles!

I planned my birthday with Josh from Birthdays and Bottles and I had such a great experience! It was so easy to go through this service. Josh reached out to me via email and asked what vibe I was looking for and made a great unique suggestion. I had about 40 people join me for my birthday and we had a section all to ourselves towards the back of the dance floor at a bar called Ms. Yoo. This was exactly what I was looking for, thank you Birthdays and bottles!
Worked with Josh to set up a party. It was surprisingly easy process and it went super well, without any hitches. I'll definitely go to him again next time.

Joshua was such a great help with planning my birthday. He was extremely helpful, answered emails quickly and found the perfect venue to celebrate my birthday with my friends! I will be for sure using Joshua in the future when I need help finding different venues for all occasions. Highly recommend his help!

Working with Joshua to plan my event could not have been easier! All I did was tell him the type of party I wanted to have, our budget pp, how many I was expecting and the type of "vibe" we wanted at our venue. He did the rest of the work! He suggested a bar I had never been to before, but was a great fit for us. He responds to emails and questions very quickly, and made sure our party went smoothly. We had our own section at the bar just for us. Everyone who came had a great time! Will definitely be using Joshua's services again in the future to plan more parties. He's the best!

formatted_address: 100A 7th Ave S, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Boots & Saddle

reviews.text: I always have a great time here.   The performers are entertaining and the crowd always seems friendly.   Lots of interaction with the patrons, usually ending in funny jokes or insults which is why we come here...  drink prices are good and the serve food now (bar snacks and brunch on certain days).   Love it!!!
Great Place And Great People!!!

So bummed to hear the bar moved and even more to hear it is now closed. I worked there from 1994 to 96. Some of the best times of my life.  At least I've got a ton of pictures to remember the good times spent there both as a patron and employee. I'm very sad about this.😭

This is a fun little bar with drag shows from 9-11. The drinks aren't very expensive but not as cheap as the clubs in Hells Kitchen and the dance floor is small. I'd recommend it for the drag show though.

Had a wonderful time on a Friday night that when Saturday night came around we had to go back. The queens were sassy and throwing jabs at everyone all in the name of good fun. Several queens actually sang live and had fairly good voices plus chose great songs to sing along with. They also pulled patrons up on stage and had competitions with them or had them take off their shirts so everyone could enjoy their chests and stomachs. The drinks were tasty and reasonably priced as well.

formatted_address: 598 Grand Concourse, The Bronx, NY 10451, USA
name: Sam's

reviews.text: The food. The atmosphere. And, most of all, the people who come there and the people who work there. There are very few places nowadays that truly make you feel at home. And this is one of those places. Stop by. You won't forget or regret it.
Great service, Great Food, Great Atmosphere, Great Price, & Great Restaurant!!!  I absolutely love it!  If go from 11am to 4pm, they have the $6 menu specials and my Sage Steele of ESPN loves it!
Good old school rap/r&b music. Good food. Great vibe. Drinks are okay but pricey for simple drinks. Downside is the exits, one going in and out. Decor is outdated. Too hot. No AC.

The food is great! Music usually pretty good; but the staff is something else. Hit or miss. Sometimes you get the most pleasant and professional people, then some nights you get attitude and neglect. Tonight however I watched security (men) rush an empty table taking it from the young lady and her friends who were about to sit there. It was despicable.  Her and her friends took it in stride but I was disgusted.
Was excited to have soul food (we don't have soul restaurant near our home)..the price was higher than expected and service was quick..the food was great and filling

formatted_address: 80 58th St, Brooklyn, NY 11220, USA
name: The New Farm

reviews.text: the future incarnate.

formatted_address: 538 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Caviar Russe

reviews.text:
Excellent restaurant for Caviar and Seafood

Freshest ingredients, delicious mouthwatering taste

This is the first time I try caviar. As a restaurant that has “caviar” in its name, its tasting menu doesn’t have caviar LOL which is very funny. Our waiter kept recommending caviars to us, as it’s very expensive. When one dish was served, the waiter forgot to introduce it to us, as we didn’t know what we were eating. 
The food was just alright. I don’t think it justifies the Michelin one star and the price.
A magnificent experience. True class. Fantastic food, beyond imagination. Highly recommend.

I really liked the restaurant.  My only complaint would be the menu having Sake and the lead waiter saying that it is no longer maintaining it.  The 3 course selection is of high quality and warning split for 2.   It is too much food for one.  You will spend at least $500 here with drinks for two.  Beautiful ambiance.

The waiters that served us were so amazing and helped accommodate to our needs. The food is definitely on the pricier side but the quality, taste and presentation was definitely there to justify the cost. The Madeleines, cilantro and lychee sorbet and caviar were definitely the highlights of the night.  This restaurant definitely deserves the Michelin star it upholds and I would highly recommend to go here on a special occasion as a date or with the family!

formatted_address: 833 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10065, USA
name: Le Botaniste

reviews.text: If you ever have that feeling that healthy food is lacking in your life, Le Botaniste is the solution. I live in Queens and make the commute at least once a month to get this tasty fulfillment.  I love the feeling I get after eating here! The staff is as pleasant as anyone with high customer service standards would expect. Awesome spot!

Really unique place, love the plants and buffet style food! 
The bowl they gave me looked gorgeous and the spot they have in the back to sit is very beautiful.
A little pricey, but worth it.

I accidentally stumbled upon this place and fell in love with it from the first sight. I love its vibe and of course the food is amazing too. The portions are not so huge that you feel stuffed. All the staff are super nice and accommodating. It’s a self-service place but you don’t feel like no one is paying attention to you. Highly recommended.
Amazing place. They answered all of my questions. I love their display of their food, and if course the food is very nourishing and delicious. I’d eat there daily if I could!

Great food and speedy service! Workers are very polite and helpful! Everything was delicious! The portions are big enough to make you feel full but not stuffed! Will come back next time and will recommend to everyone.

formatted_address: 140 W 13th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Sotto 13

reviews.text: We had a party of 18 for a sweet sixteen.  The table set up and location was perfect.  It was in the atrium area between the main dining area and the bar area.  Isolated but still part of the action.  Servers were excellent,  attentive, and friendly.   Everything tasted good but the rigatoni pasta was mentioned by everyone.   We brought the cake and they served it for us but not before they put the trick candles to make everyone laugh.  We had a great time and I can certainly say we will be back.  This is a. Very good choice for a big group or party.
Decent food. Came here for a birthday. Probably wouldn't have picked it myself. The setting is a little strange for a group but, good food and strong drinks.
The food was delicious, the restaurant was really nice and all the staff were really polite, the waiter even helped me to match a drink with my dessert.

Weekend social brunch is the absolute best - $37/person for family-style entrees, plus one giant cocktail jar per 2 guests.
Chicken sausage side was amazing. Smoked salmon toast as well. Shroom pizza was too heavy on the ricotta imo.
Servers are very professional and careful, never knocking things over and moving slowly. Very good service for large groups. Would recommend this spot for birthday events.

Amazing service and delicious food. We went for the brunch and the amount of food was perfect for four people. We ended up going with the unlimited “Happy Hour” special rather than the two carafe option, which we felt was a better deal. Dominic was an amazing server and always attentive to refill our empty glasses!

formatted_address: 43 W 65th St, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Shun Lee West

reviews.text:
I’ve eaten high-end Chinese food in China, Taiwan, India, but never in the US, except here (at least a dozen times in a quarter-century). It’s the luxury version and pricing on food you know and love. Everything from the decor to the service to the portion is an upgrade from what most Americans are used to. It’s a special place and a visit every couple of years is something I look forward to. 

Three items stand out to me:
1.  Mapo Tofu, soft bean curd with pork is exquisite here. And I’ve asked for it at dozens of restaurants around the world. The kitchen staff often make it for themselves, so try asking for it even if it’s not on the menu elsewhere. 

2. Today, I noticed their credit card receipt/bill is in the biggest font I’ve ever seen at a restaurant. So good for aging eyes!  See in the photos (the bill says for two, but we had a third-person join). 

3. See all the celebs on the wall. I’ve been there when stars of Broadway, media, etc, have been present.

Check your coat at this classic, upscale (American style) Chinese restaurant, with cocktail menu. The well designed space is fancy, the diners casual. The menu lists your favorites and then some. The food quality (and prices) are a step up, each dish apparently made to order. Service with a smile. A fine place to eat with friends, or dine with that special someone.

Is the owner paying attention this restaurant is just going down? The staff are friends protecting each other while they are rude to customers. We called the manager thinking it would help fix the issue, but the manager didn't seem to care and didn't even apologize. It's a group just collecting money from unaware visitors. An entree is minimum $35, so we did not expect a rude service. Two starts because it has nice decor.

The food here is average, but the atmosphere for NYC is great. There are large booths and tables spaced nicely apart. There are sound absorbing decorations, so it's not loud and you feel like you have your own space. This is what you are paying for. The food is good, but not outstanding. Service is attentive but not overbearing.  If you want a relaxing meal to truly catch up with friends in deeper conversation, this is a place you can do it.
I thought it was good. But not great. The atmosphere was nice but the food left something to be desired. I feel like the prices were a bit high for the quality of food.

formatted_address: 341 Lenox Ave, New York, NY 10027, USA
name: Lenox Saphire Harlem

reviews.text: I would like to say that at first I was not impress with the service till a young lady came by name Judith who was such a people person and made me and my coworkers so comfortable that we decided to stay. Also would like to give the DJ a shout out cause he observes his crowd and plays his music with the flow

Monday night grown folks tight great great prices on the beers and food an the oldschool music was one of the greatest in many years I have heard playing that DJ is on the money with his music great time. The locals were cool friendly its a down to earth local Harlem spot so dress relax and enjoy the food and the music and relax. I had a great time.

I typically don't sit to eat.  It's always a pastry on the go but this time I decided to not only stay but I invited a friend to dine with me.

That will NEVER happen again. Do better people. I will say on a positive note, the Latino GM stepped in and attempted to make it better but he could only do so much.

Even with three other people on the floor he was doing most of the work alone because the rest of the staff was useless

The Chef was on point but the wait staff is another story! I have NEVER in my life felt like this before in a restaurant, the wait staff acts as if you are a bother to them to service you then, don’t dare to ask for a napkin or another round because it’s like what are you asking me for? I was so disappointed, I will NEVER SPEND MY MONEY THERE AGAIN! I use to love this place when it was under old management, they use to care about the customer and the wait staff was WONDERFUL now the wait staff there now don’t seem to care! So with that being said I don’t care to spend my HARD EARN MONEY in a restaurant that hires individuals whom feel like customers are a bother! Don’t get me wrong the FOOD IS ON POINT but I want the entire experience, that’s what I’m paying for!
The food is flavorful and delicious. The drinks are on point yet a little pricey. And the lounge atmosphere is lively. I have to stop by at least 1x a month.

formatted_address: 200 E 33rd St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: CLUB THEY

reviews.text: Come here to have fun. Good prices
Good times would come again

formatted_address: 87 Walker St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: 87 food | drink

reviews.text: Great drinks, incredible food, chill atmosphere. Love this spot. Staff were nice too. The bartender had a delicious infused tequila. Ask about it!
This spot was superb. The staff are extremely attentive and bartenders are on another level. Every drink is a tantalizing journey is taste and texture.
I went here every day for lunch when I served jury duty. What a find! Delicious BLT.
Great place for small bites; flatbreads are slightly more filling

Ahh 87 is a delectible experience. Superb in every way. Fantastic dranks, the tastiest comestibles and gracious hosts. Great for after work or a fun night out on your weekend. Stop by, unwind/chillax and enjoy yourself.

formatted_address: 1099 1st Avenue Ground Fl, New York, NY 10065, USA
name: Luscious Thai

reviews.text: We come here almost every week for its lunch specials. My favorites are the fried rice - Thai, pineapple and Basil. The tomyum soup and the Thai salad are also very good. I also love the Thai iced tea here. We have also tried catering here, everyone loves it.

Amazing food, great service, attentive staff. I had tom yom soup noodle, and my friend had green curry. We shared papaya salad. All of it was DELICIOUS and plentiful. Clean restaurant. I would definitely go back!!

I never write reviews, and I just had to leave one for the meal I'm having RIGHT NOW. As in, I'm pausing my lunch just to write this.

I ordered the Calamari Spice appetizer and the Crispy Duck Kra Prow Chef's Special (spicy). 
The duck dish is EXQUISITE. Perfect balance of spicy and sweet. The sauce/oil it sits in is very flavorful and goes very well with the rice. Th veggies are crisp and crunch, but not dry.

The calamari was cut in generously sized rings. The batter is thick, but not overwhelming. The Thai sweet chili sauce is amazing as well.

I ordered online and even though I was quoted 50 minutes, it arrived in 30! They get extra points for putting my cold soda in a separate bag from my hot food. No one does that. Everyone should. 
Will definitely be ordering from here again! :)

I would strongly recommend NOT using the bathroom here due to the filthy underground toilet paperless maze you will find yourself in... BUT aside from this small detail, the food is absolutely delicious,  portions are huge and very generously priced. Cocktails are not bad, staff is friendly and attentive. Will definitely be back.

Food was great, all of my family members from Puerto Rico loved every dish and Puertoricans are picky eaters. Bathroom seems a little sketchy but overall nice. Food came out extremely fast, very please with the service.

formatted_address: 1065 6th Ave #2400, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Bryant Park Café

reviews.text: This is a really fun place for after work drinks were you could sit and get a beautiful view of Bryant Park and enjoy the outdoors in the summer time. The drinks are reasonably price to, around $10-$15 for a wine or cocktail, and the servers are quite nice. It is a nice spot to relax in the summer, and it’s also dog friendly.

I really enjoy Bryant Park all year round. They change the activities on a seasonal basis and its a great place to enjoy lunch or dinner. The Cafe is a casual, umbrella canopied outdoor delight on a sunny afternoon. Good for drinks and sandwiches , burgers, salads, as well as other more elaborate dishes. Our starters were the watermelon w/ chili oil and the Grilled french bread with brie/ tomato ( $8.50 / 11.00) The water melon was not as sweet as I hoped but was fresh and juicy. It needed a bit more sweet to balance the chili oil. Interesting combination indeed. The bread was very good and just enough of 2 to share.
Very cosy place to eat lunch. Service could be a bit faster as we were forgotten a few times.
Nice view, but food is not worth the money, only wings was tasty.

Came here after work on a warm Friday afternoon. Gazpacho and a glass (or two) of Prosecco. Wonderful atmosphere, attentive waitstaff, appealing and tasty food in a location that allows you to pause and look out on the frenetic pace of city. No complaints.

formatted_address: 200 Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10027, USA
name: Barawine Harlem

reviews.text: Love this place! Staff is wonderful, food is amazing and don't get me started on the sangria..secret sauce. Do yourself a favor and try it out. Completely different feel during the day and night. Great ambiance, beautiful space, staff is always attentive and kind despite time of day. At night though, Saturdays specifically, the bar area changes a lot. Even the kind of customers do. Clearly a party/after party atmosphere. During the day, very chill and classy.

Such a great place, I wish I knew about it sooner! We had the salmon with mushroom risotto, the mussels, and truffle fries - everything was SO SO GOOD. Flavors were amazing and cooked perfectly. We also had the Sangria that I was pleasantly surprised by - more full bodied and tart than sweet and watery like some places. Service was excellent - highly recommend. Will absolutely be back and SOON!

I went here on a Monday night for happy hour. The location is a short walk from my job which is directly in front of the 2/3 trains, which is a plus. However, my friends came to meet me from uptown and it was also a short distance walk from the metro north and other subway lines which was convenient for them as well. 
The ambiance was lovely. It was dark, cozy, and quiet. The bar was large enough to fit guest comfortably without being too close to one another. Also, The happy hour deals were great! $7 glasses of wine and $10-15 dollar apps. The food was delicious. I was nervous going to a French themed restaurant, since I eat a vegan diet, but the menu had really tasty options and was accommodating to my diet. My non-vegan friends got the burger and escargot, with creme brûlée for dessert. Everything was super tasty, especially for the reasonable price. I cannot wait to go back!

I live near here and it’s an anchor of the neighborhood. Happy hour is a great value and the staff is friendly. The food is pretty good too. It has a great vibe and the countertop section isn’t a bad place to make a new friend. Also a great place for date night. I highly recommend the truffle fries.
Great for brunch and happy hour, service can be a bit slow at times. Love the burger!

formatted_address: 352 7th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
name: Unique Music Gift

formatted_address: 2210 Frederick Douglass Blvd, New York, NY 10026, USA
name: Moca Bar and Lounge

reviews.text: The place was nice and the food is amazing. Bbuuuttt the bartender was super super slow. It will take about 30min to just order the drink, and about 10min to get the drink and pay for it. I thought for the crowd that she had, there should have been 2 bartenders. I mean ive been to places where theres only one bartender and they were able to handle the big crowd, but im sorry, the lady at this bar is not ready for that.

Moca Lounge is a comfortable, nicely decorated place that offers a decent happy hour. The bartender was attentive, prompt, and friendly. The reason for my 3 star review is due to the quality of the food. My party ordered Catfish strips, mini turkey burgers, hot wings & almond crusted chicken strips, all came with fries. Tbh the fries were perfect, everything else was meh. Overall Moca is a solid bar/lounge to have an affordable happy hour.
Very good place for a book signing and even if you want to have a drink with your friends
The food was very good. The overall experience was OK. The drinks taste like pure juice...
Very cute.. vibe was mature and comfortable.

formatted_address: 306 Gold St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Pollo D'Oro

reviews.text: Peruvian here! Food was so accurate all around, flavors almost made me cry! I miss my homeland! You guys, keep it up and You should be famous!! Love you all. We enjoyed all the food and drinks. Worth the price

The food here was absolutely delicious. The portions are huge here. The empanadas were flavorful. The paella was really good filled with seafood. The Chilcano cocktail was tasty and strong. The ribeye was cooked to perfection and was so tender. The ribeye was huge. The ambiance is cute and somewhat dim. This made it more romantic. The service was good also. The only thing is this restaurant is kinda hidden but that makes it a hidden gem so it won’t be crowded.

Wow, what a great experience! I happened to be staying in the area on business a couple weeks ago, and stumbled across Pollo D'Oro purely by chance. The food was exceptional, the service was terrific, and I was made to feel welcome and appreciated. Manny, the owner, took the time to greet me and to chat with me and the other patrons. And Alejandra, the server for the section I was in, ensured everyone was taken care of. I look forward to visiting again soon.
Salmon, onion, and rice tasted delicious. Cocktail and donuts are ok. Friendly staff. Price a bit high.

This is the best food I've had in Downtown Brooklyn. It's a little hidden and out of the way, so it's often empty or has very few people but not because the food isn't good. If you're ever in the area and you see this restaurant empty, take it as a chance to eat some of the best food in Brooklyn in silence or with your group of friends alone. This place deserves more customers. Not only is the food fantastic, but the service is also great and the restaurant is clean. They have Spanish music playing over the speakers which is always catchy, and waiters and waitresses to make sure that your meal is up to par. This place is really a hidden gem I can't recommend it enough

formatted_address: 250 E 39th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: GKODB

reviews.text: Best night club ever. Me and my gals had a blast partying it up here. Bottle service is fantastic.
This place is cool but it’s very difficult to find. Keep looking, it’s worth it folks.
Great little hole in the wall place, had a ton of fun. Really looking forward to checking out their new location opening in Queens!

formatted_address: 20 Skillman Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
name: Kings County Imperial

reviews.text: We participated in their first ever pig roast. It was delicious. For only $50 per person, we got all you can drink beer and wine, chicken dumplings, cold sesame noodles, and make-your-own buns with the roasted pork. The food was great and the new backyard and event space was great. They also had a DJ during the event, which was fun. I will definitely plan on attending future pig roasts.

I ordered the Copper Well and the Shrimp toast. The food had a great portion and the copper well wasn't oily at all. I think the shrimp toast was an amazing appetizer. The people there were nice. I'll come back and try something new next time.

I love this place. Super solid. Super true to the flavor. Amazing interior. It's busy, but that's what you get when you have a bomb restaurant. Highly recommend.

I dream about the mock eel.

Portions are served family style and were large enough that two people split one soup and one entree and walked away full. 
Egg drop soup- excellent!
Sacha beef and Chinese broccoli- fantastic!
For the amount of patrons in the restaurant (near capacity) our meals came out quickly.

This place is awesome. The soup dumplings were delicious definitely a great appetizer. The Crispy Garlic Chicken was fresh tasty and delicious. The Angry Pork Fried rice was amazing. The Pineapple Tonic and the Shanghai Mule were great cocktails. Giving the restaurant a 5 star review.

formatted_address: 594 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
name: Pekarna NYC

reviews.text:
Pekarna NYC is a Slovenian-American Restaurant

Pekarna NYC will be a first-of-its-kind authentic Slovenian-American spot with multiple levels: “The venue will feature a restaurant and cocktail bar on the first floor and will also have seating in the basement and backyard. The basement will be able to accommodate events in 3 separate function rooms.” It will combine the now-vacant spaces of Papa John’s/Subway and Amsterdam 99¢ and plans to utilize a small outdoor area in the back. "

formatted_address: 140 Lawrence St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Koji Izakaya

reviews.text: Went here on a whim one night and the food was so good! All of the flavor combinations were spot on and they had some interesting menu items as well as a lot of the things you'd expect. Service was super fast and consistent (it was a Tuesday night so I can't speak to likely busier weekend nights). I took off one star mostly because there was a weird chemical smell inside the restaurant, sorta like you'd expect in a hair or nail salon, that was unappealing in a restaurant. I would also love to have more menu options just to try more tasty things. Overall a great choice, but if you're sensitive to smells, especially while eating, maybe see about takeout.

Definitely a 5 star restaurant. First of all, the food is amazing. I tried salmon sashimi, scallops, two different chicken wings, seafood soup, popcorn shrimp( big, whole shrimp!), fried fishes, sashimi plates... they are all 💯！ I can tell they have true love to foods, but only through the foods themselves ( the materials, the cooking process), but also through all the unique, well-designed and well-picked containers!
What surprise me is the price, almost all the small plates are under $10, super friendly price!
The service is excellent, the girls are super friendly, warm-kind and thoughtful. They are efficient and professional.
The environment is perfect and perfect for either yourself or with one or a couple of friends. It has music around with the just right volume, so you could enjoy the feeling and you could talk with your friends without shouting.

Overall, love this restaurant. Super nice place.

Chef was very accommodating, and added mango to a roll for my son who was excited for that, but found nothing on the menu.
Place is a bit loud, music wise, with a play list. It really suitable to a sushi restaurant.
Been here about 5 times and they never disappoint. The food is always flavorful and fresh.
Good quality food and relaxing atmosphere.

formatted_address: 69 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Villa Mosconi

reviews.text: Loved it!  It was a nice quieter place without the huge crowd other places had. Our server, Roger, was able to describe each and every dish, including the way each dish was prepared, for example, how the pasta is made fresh every day. He also let us know this restaurant has been around for over 40 years. I can definitely see why.

Danny was our server this evening, I was very unsure on what delicious thing to have for dinner since this was my first actual Italian restaurant.  He was very informative and and helped me pick some that ended up being OH MY GOODNESS DELICIOUS! all service was superb and very professional! Recommend 100%

It was Christmas Eve, yesterday, and this year  I didn't prepare my usual Italian-American extravaganza of the seven fishes.  We decided on Villa Mosconi, remembering the time we took my parents there for an anniversary: The atmosphere there was delightfully festive and calm at the same time; the waiters were professional and attentive; the food was fresh and artfully prepared.  Sometimes in a world filled with chaos, one need to step back and enjoy the continuity that a restaurant like this gives.  All is calm.  All is bright.  A wonderful experience, and we will be back.

The service was excellent! The food was delicious! 
The drinks were strong like bull! Lol

When one dines at an Italian restaurant, it's not just about the foods and drinks on the table but also largely about excellence of hospitality the place bears and presents. In that regards, the veteran staffs--every each of them--here at this place are pure treasures who takes an extra mile to make sure their customer's experience delightful and enjoyable.

formatted_address: 131 Chrystie St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Fig. 19

reviews.text:
Went to Fig. 19 for some drinks with my friends, and we were all so surprised and delighted by its presence. The secret entrance was awesome!! Definitely hiked up the enjoyment of our experience going here. I got a specialty cocktail ("The Prince") and my friends both got a French cider. Overall, the bar can be pricey, but based on the location, it's not that bad for a specialty cocktail bar.

I would bring more friends for a good time here. It's a fun place with a dark, but comfortable atmosphere, and the drinks are awesome!

Bizarre but cool experience to walk through the back of a art gallery to get in. 

Bar itself was great, good selection of cocktails and good music playing
Speakeasies styled bar behind an art gallery. Good music with specialty cocktails menu if your into something that's a bit more fun in your drink.
Great little bar with nice cocktails and good bartenders. It can get pretty dancy as well which is really nice in bars... But definitely not a cocktail bar for sitting around and chatting.
Beautiful speakeasy! Really stunning. Great date place.

formatted_address: 281 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10012, USA
name: Gospel

reviews.text: The Gospel is a beautiful little cafe tucked in the Soho area of NYC. I happened to be attending a special event so I was on the guest list. The whole place is beautiful from top to bottom, and the staff were very kind. There's a coat check that's only $3 and the ladies who were working that night were incredibly sweet. The upstairs has the bar as well as the actual cafe food service if I'm correct (didn't order food the night I visited). Then downstairs is like a club scene that's Egyptian themed with it's own bar, seating and stage area. The downstairs was pretty on theme and beautiful in its own right. It was truly a gorgeous place from top to bottom with great acoustics that filled the room size without overpowering things, excellent sight lines no matter the seating, and a nice calming yet energetic vibe that I hope to visit once again

We had a delicious, early dinner party to celebrate a friend's birthday. Sufficient, tasty family style vegetarian dishes. The staff broke down our two tables and BOOM we had bottle service at the club!
Really fun night for live shows. Should really rsvp before but staff as so nice considering a busy venue. Looking forward to going back.

Swanky ambience with ok/over priced drinks. They have a default 20% tip on one drink.
They have a top floor and a basement with live band.
We had a nice healthy, vegetarian dinner for a friend's birthday. They broke down the tables, boom it's a club!

formatted_address: 50 W 72nd St, New York, NY 10023, USA
name: Lilly's Cocktail and Wine

reviews.text: What's really great about this wine bar is that they have legitimately good foods, which isn't often the case for many others of similar kinds. I recommend trying their cauliflower gratin. It's like the best cauliflower-based dish I've ever had. Nice service and cute outdoor seating, they offer.
This spot is awesome. Delicious, very reasonably priced cocktails. Local crowd and low key vibe. Can't wait to come back!

My co-workers and I were going to go to the movies but decided on happy hour instead. It was a great choice. The staff was very sweet and welcoming, had our orders to us quickly and the atmosphere we very warm/inviting. The happy hour specials were great too, we'll definitely be back.

This is my absolute favorite place for our dinner and a movie nights!
The food is super affordable, service is fast and the ambiance is friendly!
My 2 go to dishes are the Penne Vodka and grill chicken and the muscles in tomato sauce.
Amazing!! They give you huge portions with bread. Super inexpensive fantastic date night dinner 😁 Highly recommend!

Hate doing this to a neighborhood place but criticism can make us better... so. Ran into my in laws having brunch here a few weeks ago and everything looked amazing so i had to give it a shot. As with before,  the presentation was great, however the eggs were burnt as was the French toast,  coffee was watered down. I have to believe that this was a REALLY off day for them. At least they were good about taking items off the bill which were inedible. Would love to give them another shot but not for sometime.

formatted_address: 241 W 14th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Norwood

reviews.text: Lovely membership club on 14th St with multiple event spaces, bars and great food. Also a 75-person theater/screening room. Really enjoyed hosting a workshop here.

I really enjoyed the space and the vibe here.  The decor and art displayed are amazing and the staff are courteous and attentive. A great space for an event, to meet with friends or for a business meeting.  I understand that there is a membership arrangement, but I have not investigated the terms.

Incredible! Great service, great decor, great location, great menu. I hope you get the idea this place is great. As a member of the Ivy Club in the UK I got to check out the Norwood while in NYC and it doesn't disappoint. 10/10
A beautifully decorated 5 floor brownstone located on 14th street. It is a great place to get a cocktail and find inspiration to reach your goals.
Absolutely exceptional. The service, the food, and oooh, the octopus! Our group had a wonderful time. So good, I would recommend for anyone trying to impress a client or future in-laws. ;-)

formatted_address: 3496 Broadway, New York, NY 10031, USA
name: Solace Bar & Grill

reviews.text: Wonderful service. Food and drinks were good. The DJ was great.

First off, the tables were dirty, but considering Sunday football I overlooked this. The menu reflected on their website does not reflect the menu they give you here. Our server was really nice, but had no idea what they even had in their kitchen. I ordered the calamari which was like warm, greasy, and the sauce came in a small paper condiment cup. Also, the manager sits at the corner of the bar smoking hookah. Would never recommend this place.
Came here on fathers day, was my first time and I really enjoyed it, food was great and waitress was very nice. Good prices
Visited this spot for the 1st time. Very nice, quaint spot. Pretty good.......had a good time and the friendly staff was a plus!

Bartender was super nice and attentive.. but the solace burger was not good at all!  With the posted menu description, you'd think it would be packed with flavor, but it really missed the mark.  $50 for 2 burgers and lava cake (cake was great)- wish I would have taken my money to the empanada spot across the street.

formatted_address: 800 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10017, USA
name: McFadden's Saloon

reviews.text: I celebrated my graduation earlier this evening in this fine place. Well we had a cool evening and the restaurant was unquestionably one of the reasons for the outstanding evening. The waiters  participated in a sweet way, the meals were delicious and my friends were very  delighted. We shall absolutely visit again for more joyful events. thanks very much.

I come here for lunch from time to time. Always good! Even at noon the beer is fresh.
Fish and chips (with prawns!) are always hot and crispy. Friendly staff.
Fantastic place to get something when in a hurry. The service is prompt, pricing is affordable, excellent atmosphere. I highly recommend this spot.

Dive bar with good music (mainly top 40 and 1980-2010 throwbacks). Crowd is mainly early/mid 20s. Fun place to go with a small group of friends. There’s usually some kind of open bar deal but its always hard to get to the actual bar with the crowd

Good solid NY sports bar with good food, excellent service.  If it got a makeover / update it would get 5 *****.  It actually deserves to be 5 stars.  Right on 42nd & 2nd across from the PIX 11 building and studios.  Recommended!!!

formatted_address: 144 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Trapizzino

reviews.text: I wasn't sure if the New York location would be able to live up to it's Roman counterpart. But I was pleasantly surprised! This place is just as good as the original. Great atmosphere, friendly service, tasty wine, and absolutely delicious Trapizzino's. I will be back (often).
I really liked this place. Everything was fresh and made from scratch. The service was lovely as well. I will definitely be back.

Surprising and offbeat Italian place with a unique menu. The main 'trapizzino' option is a sort of sandwich/pizza hybrid and perfect for someone who wants the flavor of a great pizza without the scale. They also have a deep-fried risotto option which is definitely worth trying. Great for sharing and very reasonably priced.
Awesome wine selection! JR was super helpful and friendly and gave us good recommendations. Cozy little spot that serves up what is basically gourmet hot pockets.
The namesake trapazzino is delish! We got the chicken one and it was so flavorful and fresh. The bread came out of the over right in front of. We also got the chocolate cake which was phenomenal.

formatted_address: 8 Park Pl, New York, NY 10007, USA
name: Five & Dime

reviews.text: The bartender, Angelika, is excellent. Every cocktail is prepared to perfection with care and balance. Do as I do and come here to write. Some nice conversation here and there but for the most part, peace.

Note: I’m reviewing Five & Dime as a cafe because I went there during the day. 

I wanted a nice neighborhood cafe with good coffee and Five & Dime delivered. Most guests sit around the bar and chat or read with an easy morning energy. There are also plenty of seats in the cafe itself. They have free WiFi, outlets, good coffee, and great pumpkin bread. 

Five & Dime’s traditional cafe feel truly I special (especially in this part of town). Enjoy the beauty of the place if you go.

This place is pretty unique as far as coffee shops go. The coffee is of course- amazing, but the atmosphere is what makes it special. It’s a classy 1920’s vibe with bright red coffee cups and shiny chrome and marble finishes. The bar is also pretty great, good selection of drinks. Fred makes the best latte I’ve ever had. 

Beware it’s card only. They won’t take cash.
Cozy horse sure bar. $9 happy hour for select drinks and friendly staff.
Great staff, coffee and drinks are amazing. Clean and comfortable. Great place if you our killing time between meetings, meeting a colleague for coffee, or a date. A great place!!

formatted_address: 305 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Suprema Provisions

reviews.text: Absolutely loved the menu, the quality of the food and the cozy ambiance. It was a tight and packed place but the staff managed to stay nice and friendly regardless. The food was great - tasty octopus and carbonara pasta. We didn’t get to try the burger, which we regretted because it did look amazing (it’s supposed to be one of the best in NYC)

It was the perfect summer weather in NYC. Luckily, the restaurant has nice open door that open to the street allow the breeze to flow through. Of course we came because we heard they served a killer burger and we were in a burger kind of mood.

Very friendly greeters and our server was really nice guy. Gave us time to look through the drink menu but of course we were on a mission. Went with the house salad because you need your greens folk! Burger and the grilled octopus because if we see that on a menu we are ordering it. The salad came out first. It was a good start. The fennel and apple worked really well and the reggiano gave it a nice salty bite.

The burger came out with a side of roasted Brussels sprouts. We ordered it medium and it perfectly medium. 

The melted cheese was perfect as was the soft bun with the juicy meat patty. What I thought was interesting is that they are in the no ketchup camp here and also lettuce/tomato. Here is it just pure cheese burger. Was it as good as its touted. I would say yes.

The grilled octopus had a nice char and tender. I like the olive puree and side of roasted tomatoes. Nice light summer dish.

Suprema Provision was a nice end to the Sunday. Lovely summer weather, relaxed atmosphere and the food we ordered was delicious.
Great happy hour drink prices. And the burger is one of the best I've ever had. Ryan was a very attentive bartender.

The burger was great! Great atmosphere to relax in and enjoy the burger. The patty was mad of quality meat and despite what it may seem like from the picture, there was not too much cheese sauce. The burger was also cooked to perfection. The roasted tomatoes, just added to the whole experience instead of distracting from the main attraction. The only reason for the 4 stars is that they didn't let us order happy hour drinks at the table; we had to be at the bar.

We came to try their famous Burger. It mostly lives up to the hype. Very good flavor. Well cooked (medium rare). The cheese takes it over a little, I'm normally not when to say a little less cheese would help it. The server was however quite rude. Wouldn't go back due to service.

formatted_address: 412 W 14th St, New York, NY 10014, USA
name: Intersect by Lexus

reviews.text: If you’re looking for a nice place to have coffee, get hot chocolate or chill out while shopping in the meat packing district this is the place to go.  The little treats were yummy!  Especially the hot chocolate,  you can put topping!!  The event space is also nice.  Space was welcoming and nice put together. For me the highlight is the bathroom.  Very fancy and the seats are heated.  You can go in comfort :)

Beautiful space with a lovely cafe downstairs and a bar + restaurant upstairs. The Lexus aspect is very subtle with a wall made of car parts. Have visited twice now with great experiences both times. Nice place to sit and hang out even for a bit (instead of a Starbucks) because it’s been very quiet both times I have been here (Wednesday afternoon and Sunday afternoon). Also, this is open to the public not just to owners.

Excellent !!  The new chef has very interesting dishes.  The Goan/Portuguese fusion was executed brilliantly.  Great selection of Portuguese wines with a few gems at very reasonable prices.  The cocktails we're a perfect match for the cuisine.    

The service was spot on (as always).  Highly recommend!

Very impressive modern design of entrance and ground floor. Coffee and sweets offerings in ground floor with very impressive automated bathrooms. Upper floor very roomy restaurant with a comfortable separate bar area. It used to be Japanese restaurant. Today has a chef with specialty in Goan dishes.
Super fun atmosphere! I was able to grab a seat and and outlet to get through some work for a few hours! Very cool concept by Lexus

formatted_address: New York, NY 10013, USA
name: tribeca

formatted_address: 101 Montague St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
name: Lantern

reviews.text: Great Pad Thai. Their lunch special comes with a free appetizer for 11 dollars, a good value for a filling and tasty lunch. I definitely reccomend one of their Thai iced teas. Also, very fast and friendly servers. Overall, a great place for hungry tourists.

My dish was quite dormant, it's called "volcano chicken." My boyfriend liked his though, nothing spectacular but I also thought it was fine. The Curry Puff wasn't anything to crazy about. I promised someone who had heard that they were really great because they were popular to head back and tell them if they should try it and I ensured I went back to tell them not to. Also, not the place to head for a long time of eating and conversation, it felt like the waiters needed to get people in and out, more than likely to ensure they have space for other patrons and not scare prospective ones away. This is fine but just don't head here for an evening out or a date, head here to grab some food... or not. The service was just alright. I'm probably not going to eat here again, the food is not worth the price.

Wanted to try a Thai restaurant in Brooklyn and this seemed like a safe bet. I was disappointed because I ordered a Turquoise Breeze drink expecting it to be the color turquoise but it was delivered to me as a neon green. Additionally I ordered the pineapple fried rice with shrimp. The presentation was nice but I found egg shells in the dish and was disappointed by this execution. They have outdoor seating but there was a drip, possibly from an air conditioner, that was hitting my guest so we had to move tables.
The food was excellent. My Crispy Basil Duck was crispy and tender. Of course the Curry Puffs were outstanding. Lantern never disappoints.

The place is conveniently located and can get to it using the subway. If you walk down the place, you will be treated to the best views of the Manhattan skyline. The food was good, as long as you don't compare with authentic Thai food, but still pretty scrumptious. If you are a group of 4 of more, 18% gratuity will be added to the bill, which is not a problem if the service is even remotely close to being good. But the our server had other plans in mind, the service is poor and unfriendly. This is not the first time for us at this place and they have consistently been poor when it comes to the ordering and the overall experience.  They get a three star for food, otherwise this would have been a 2 star review.

formatted_address: 135 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Tiny's & The Bar Upstairs

reviews.text: Went here after work with some colleagues.  Very, very cozy and charming, keeping to its namesake.  But once you pushed past the narrow aisles and stairs, you're welcomed with some delish home cooked comfort food.  We were a party of 6 or 7 and shared about 4 or 5 appetizers.   Not a dud amongst them.  And the main entrees were equally delicious.  If I'm in the neighborhood with my wife one day, this is one place I'd definitely take her.

This place is amazing!! The food is soooo good! Daniel was my server he is the best!! Loved all his recommendations. Thank you so much Daniel for taking care of me and my friend. You made my experience great. I'll definitely be back.
Sat in the Bar Upstairs and enjoyed a lovely evening of cocktails and food. Both things were delicious. The space is a bit tight, so be prepared to get cozy with your neighbors.

Very good food, but highly overpriced. With the prices per entree and the higher than average priced drinks I expected more from the service of the restaurant. While I absolutely loved the decor and atmosphere, there was literally vomit in the bathroom which made a nice date night out a not-so-nice end to the night. Not only that, but staff didn’t clean it after being made aware, and the waitress seemed rushed to pick up our check even though we were mid-conversation, & didn’t fill it out yet. Overall not the most pleased with the restaurant despite my having high hopes. The food was good but not astounding, although the drinks were quite good.
Good but seriously tiny. The bar gets packed real fast but they make good drinks. Lunch there was v good, if you can get there during the daytime.

formatted_address: 187 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
name: Blue Ribbon Sushi Izakaya

reviews.text:
It is delicious. 
Kinda price but delicious.
Service could get kinda slow for certain dishes. And they forget to present one dish.
Environment is nice or should I say the atmosphere. 
Definitely should visit here if you never been to a Blue Ribbon Sushi place.
But I am just wondering when my second time would be compared that here are just so many places or choices to compete with.
Keep moving buddy.

First time here!  Our server was amazing.
Every weird question we had; he answered!  And if he didn't know was the answer he came back with an answer and a sample.

We asked for recommendations,  he was candid and it's always best when server says he like something particular that your interested in and elaborates why he likes it.

Super fresh fish! Even from Japan!
Dont forget to check out their specials!

It’s pricey but really good. The ambiance is nice, too. 

We had several rolls and a few pieces of otoro sushi that were absolutely spectacular (but to be fair I feel like most of that credit goes to the tuna, not the restaurant...)
Nonetheless, definitely a worth a visit for excellent sushi and service in a nice, unusually spacious, restaurant in the LES.

Have long loved Blue Ribbon. Ever since starting out at the Bakery in the 1990s and having circled through all of their venues since then. The experience has always been a good one. Until I just waited over 45 minutes for sushi at the sushi bar here. Being polite clearly didn't work as someone either forgot the order, or lost it. Serious zero for service and a bitter taste now for Blue Ribbon. Had to leave to find a new reservation elsewhere after sitting for an hour.

The presentation was great, great service and the sushi and sashimi were really good too. It's quite a big place with a lot of tables, so it is great foe groups. 
The music was quite low, at least on a Monday, so it was great for talking. 
I would definitely repeat.

formatted_address: 132 W 44th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
name: The Lambs Club

reviews.text: One of the best restaurants I have ever been to!! Can't explain how great it was! Phenomenal food and exceptional service!!!! It's such an elegant place. Perfect for a date night or even a fancy dinner with friends and family!

Even though they put ice in the urinals they don’t have large format cubes at the bar for nice whiskies. Still, a good place to go in midtown for a nice experience. Bartenders wear white jackets. How do they stay so clean?

My girlfriend and I came here after seeing a Broadway show, we wanted to have a nice dinner to cap off our evening in New York. While our food was good, the service was mediocre. We had to flag our waiter down multiple times, the busboy was significantly more attentive than our waiter was. For a $180 dollar meal, I expected better service.

If you are headed to a broadway show this is a solid option for dinner beforehand. We sat around 5pm. They were understanding of our deadline and got us in and out the door quickly. The aged steak was delicious although quite expensive. Would recommend only for those who need eat in midtown for any reason. If you find yourself in that situation, give it a shot!

Nice spot to stop and have a drink at the bar. Civilized, but very pricey.  Bartender was attentive and friendly.
The cheese platter was about a total of 2 oz of cheese and wasn't worth the price at all. The bread it came with was delicious.  I wish I took a photo of it because it was laughable. 0 stars for that
By the way, when we came in to have drinks, they sent us upstairs and there was no room at the bar and no tables to be had (there were empty ones, but we were told they were being held for reservations). They are a little snooty there, so be prepared. So we went back down and sat at the bar at the entrance.

formatted_address: 319 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10013, USA
name: Salaam Bombay Indian Cuisine

reviews.text: This spot is my favorite. I eat in plenty of restaurants but to this one I keep coming back again and again. The stuff is very amicable and the cooking they offer is so delicious. I would always prefer to have a decent dinner in this restaurant. Highly recommended.

My past posts about this place were truthful and not very nice. But a waiter there on my last visit the other day made me a forgiving spirit. The food is awesome here. And it’s vegetarian friendly. I’m used to paying bargain prices at restaurants but the little more here is well worth it.
May be it's American style Indian food... But I thought it could be better.. Decor is old but nice. People are friendly and helpful

It is a buffet type restaurant so it is all you can eat but it has limited food options but it is enough to try Indian food. Plus, most of my Indian coworker told me that the good are pretty authentic and the price are reasonable..
Loved their afternoon buffet. It is small and has about a dozen selections, but I wasn't disappointed. Fresh made bread. Appears fresh and definitely worth going back.

formatted_address: 1252 St Nicholas Ave, New York, NY 10032, USA
name: Herbalife Nutrition /Manuel

formatted_address: 65 W 55th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
name: Tang Pavilion

reviews.text: We arrived at this place for dinner. my friend recommended this place.  Well, it was very successful. we were warmly welcomed by the staff members  and we felt excellent. The meal was tasty. We loved this place very much and we will definitely return to this restaurant. Keep it up.

I had a very enjoyable meal with coworkers. It feels authentic and the food is very tasty. The employees were very professional and the service was really quick. The place was quiet which made it easy to converse.

This is no doubt one of the coolest restaurants in the region. Every time I go there I am incredibly satisfied. They keep their very high  level service and the topmost level of dishes  they provide. You no doubt will love this place. Very  recommended.
They offer a great variety of fresh food. I enjoyed eating here. Employees are always friendly, pricing is convenient and the place is always neat.
Nice Chinese food. The tofu was excellently cooked, the aubergine in garlic sauce (鱼香茄子) was a little too sweet but texturally great. Plenty of good vegan options too, and friendly responsive staff

formatted_address: 778 Franklin Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11238, USA
name: 95 South Soul Food Restaurant

reviews.text: Had a great time for my B Day....but Im still wondering what happened to my platter of food when i went to the bathroom....smh it was still alot of food on it ....SMH
Food was excellent, a nice crowd and good music. Definitely going again.
Delicious food.nice place to drink and dance... nice after work spot... they closed down woodland and milk river.. let's hope the same doesnt happen to this hidden gem 🤔.

The crowd was good! The food taste ok.The drinks were all really good! I went to this place  on a couple of Friday nights and enjoyed it. Not sure about the other days of the week. I wish the staff were a bit more attentive. I rate it a 3.5 stars.

It's a nice spot to hang at. The vibes were good. It was crowded because pepole were celebrating birthday's and what not. The security by the bathroom is a little strict but, I guess he's just doing his job. I heard the drinks are iight, all I wanted to do is dance in the little space I had for the night.

formatted_address: Melrose Ave, The Bronx, NY 10451, USA
name: La Rincoeña

reviews.text: They are good people / great food

formatted_address: 16 W 36th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
name: Clinton Hall

reviews.text: I really enjoyed the atmosphere here; there were different games all around that were free to play. I thought that was definitely the best part, though. The service was pretty slow and inattentive, and the burgers were slightly above average at best. I also thought that the portions were pretty small given the prices. Overall it’s a pretty fun place, but I’d recommend eating before you come here because it’s not really worth it.

Cool atmosphere with games all around - appeared to be a college hang out. There’s a bouncer that checks ID when you come in. Very young crowd - pretty sure my husband and I were the only ones over 30. White claws everywhere. Would go back if it didn’t make me feel old.

The four of us shared the Clinton Hall Burger Challenge and it was delicious! The patties were juicy, the bacon was crispy and sweet, and it's on a potato bun! The fries were a little overcooked. We also shared their holiday special menu. The cubano was surprisingly really good and the Christmas waffle and ice cream was huge and fun to share. The service was a little slow because there were only two waitresses during a busy lunch time.
I love this place. You get good food all while having the option to playing giant size games with your friends or by yourself.
We just stopped there for a beer to cold us down, can’t go wrong with beer... but the place looks great. Plenty of space to seat and also they have some games

formatted_address: 57 S 5th St, Brooklyn, NY 11249, USA
name: Miss Favela

reviews.text: Great place to grab a bite and awesome carpirinhas. This place is not your common Brazilian place, this one is very lively where people drink and dance all night. Had a great time with my friends here.

I like to go with friends to this restaurant with my highest recommendations. I visit this restaurant often. This recommendation is always successful. The the cooking is appetizing and the team is welcoming and cooperative. always when we eat in this place we enjoy a pleasant evening.  I warmly recommend this restaurant.

I’ve heard great things about this place and have wanted to go since I moved back from Brazil. I was in the area on a Sunday and it was my first time here, so I came at 9:30pm for a quick drink. Even though they were supposed to close at 10pm, staff was rushing to leave and had prematurely stacked chairs. It wasn’t until I spoke Portuguese that they stopped trying to shoo me out and explained that they were just closing early. If you want to close early, just update your hours online so customers don’t have this type of unpleasant experience! Not a good first experience. I will come at a better time and hope to update this review with a more positive one.

The steaks are overpriced for the quality. Pretty dry and hard. Take a pass on steak + eggs and bife acebolado.

Service was so slow, too.
Vibe is very unique and you feel like you are in Brazil.
No cash, no air conditioning.
Deducting one star as I am not okay with them including 20% tip in the bill.

I told my friends about this place with my highest recommendations. I visit this place often. This recommendation is always successful. The meals are tasty and the stuff is very friendly and cooperative. always when we visit this place we have a lovely evening.  I warmly recommend this restaurant.

formatted_address: 64 W 10th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Alta

reviews.text: This tapas place is hidden in the residential blocks and no visible signage out there. When we walked in, there a long walkway with the bar on the right hand side. A decent size of dining room and also a mezzanine for a few more tables. Two of us arrived early and ordered two cocktails while waiting for the group. We ordered 6 appetizers to share to begin with, fair portion size but food are delicious. We also ordered 3 entrees to share plus desserts. Decent prices and average $55 per person not including cocktails. Great place to date!
Cute place with inviting atmosphere and great food.  Certain dishes were a bit on the salty side at times but was still delicious. The menu was even customized for my wife's birthday!

Took a large group of 15 people here for a business dinner. The group was challenging because there were a number of dietary restrictions - vegetarian, kosher, and gluten free. Our server did an excellent job keeping everyone satisfied, and the excellent cocktails kept flowing. Having a large party here was a great idea - there was something for everyone. Food, drinks, and service were all outstanding.

Love this tapas place hidden off tenth street with no more than a door with the health inspection "A" in the window. You walk in and there is a gorgeous long bar, and the rest of it is like a vaulted swiss chalet with little charming rooms to dine in. Natural wines and world tapas grace the menu and I've always had a good experience. Warning CASH ONLY

Loved Alta so much we had our wedding here. The tapas menu is a long list of delicious unique sharable dishes. It's got a very rustic feel to it with a fireplace and a high ceiling. Get the brussel sprouts.

formatted_address: 88 Broad St, New York, NY 10004, USA
name: Broadstone Bar & Kitchen

reviews.text:
We came here around 1PM on a Sunday with reservations for 7. We walked in, and were seated immediately in the upstairs eating area because there weren't that many customers at the time. 

The menu had both breakfast and lunch things since it was still brunch. The drinks were a little on the pricey side so we decided to stay away from those for a while. 

Since most of us were already so hungry and it was PM, we decided for a burger. We ordered a range from medium rare to well done. However, all of the burgers came to the table (6 in total) as a solid medium-well. However, the egg in mine and the avocado were able to moisten it up a bit. The fries were good as well. The only other dish that was ordered was some french toast which was WAY too sweet. 

Cute place, Food was Ok, Won't be back.

No they do not have an ocean view. The service is amazing over the top. Each employee greeted us and shook our hand like we are movie stars. We ordered the surf n turf with fillet Mignon  and shrimp. Small portions for sure and the food is just ok. Our drinks we had are very tasty coming from Seattle it's hard to compare fresh seafood to land lock areas the fillet was tiny but tasty

Great spot in the Battery Park / Financial District area to stop off, with drinks and plates to suit pretty much any appetite, palette, or budget. 

Plates ranging from the sub $15 range and up to around $25, with options for brunch, lunch, and of course, dinner. 

Nice location, setting, and friendly staff. A good calling point for local and tourist alike.

Had the garlic fries and a few rounds of Glen-12. I am happy with the price of the drinks. Though the fries were a bit steep, they sure were tasty.

The staff seemed happy about being there and eager to help.

Atmosphere was nice! Big, beautiful windows and phone chargers under the bar.

Friends and I had dinner here tonight. We had an issue with our food. Our server, Dana, was super accommodating and took care of our issue very quickly. The manager Ken ensured we were taken care of at the end. Thanks Dana & Ken!!

formatted_address: 98 Meserole Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11222, USA
name: Good Room

reviews.text: The best night out I've had in a while was here. One of the most painful days I've had in a while followed. We caught Ten Snake for his set on a Friday night. The place was crowded, but not painfully so. The crowd was respectful and the vibe was good. The drinks were strong. The lighting was dark in the best way. The sound was impressive. Not much more you can ask for. Will definitely be back!

One of the best dance spots in the city. If you don’t like the tunes in one of the rooms, then just go to the other one: guaranteed loveliness. The staff all embody the “built by music lovers for music lovers” mantra. Also, there’s a Chihuly. What??!!!!!! So beautiful.

My coat and several of my items were stolen from the employees of this venue. I paid to check my stuff in and they provided a ticket and instructed me to take a picture of the ticket in case something happens to the ticket. When I tried to retrieve my belongings, they couldn’t find my items and my stuff was gone. I got really upset and the manager, check-in guys, and security took no responsibility and had absolutely no empathy for my stuff getting stolen. They pretty much said it was my fault because I didn’t have my ticket... but I provided the picture that THEY instructed me to take. And I wasn’t the only one that this happened to. A couple of other people had their stuff missing as well. I will never go to this venue again and whatever you do, DO NOT support this establishment whose employees straight up rob you!!!
Spacious with lots of seating in the back, two dj booths, friendly staff, but a bit generic industrial inside.

Great place. Staff was friendly, pretty laid back. The atmosphere is one of my favorites. Disco ball is gorgeous with the lights and lasers bouncing off. The Bad Room is a nice place to cool off and relax for a bit. I'd say the icon is the sound system. Phenomenal sound here. Tight space, so it gets quite packed, but it's a good place to escape reality for a bit!

formatted_address: 300 E 76th St, New York, NY 10021, USA
name: Eat, Drink & Be Merry

reviews.text: Great place for a party. Great staff and great food. Had my son's first bday party at East Wing and it was great for the kids and the adults.

Okay, so I booked my brother's bachelor party with the girls of Eat Drink and be Merry and let me tell you how wonderful and accommodating they were and the services they provide. I can't remember all of the names but I believe there was a Brittany, Christine and I want to say Kate.

Our first part of the night we started off at the Gin Mill for dinner.  I got to be honest the food was a lot better than what I thought it was going to be.  Pasta, Chicken, Steak, potatoes, tator tots, all delicious.  Maggie, who was I guess the host of the party was excellent along with our bartender.  I cannot remember her name but she was blonde (sorry) and very on top of whatever drinks we needed. I rate everything at this place a 10

Our limo driver Steve who was flat out the man...enough said!!!!! He catered to us as best as he could and went above and beyond. I would definitely have him as a limo driver again.

formatted_address: 300 W 116th St, New York, NY 10026, USA
name: Silvana

reviews.text: Absolutely love this spot! From the delicious food and beautiful gift ideas in the charming cafe to the fancy cocktails and intimate musical performances downstairs. Highly recommended.

Had a lovely night at Silvana listening to live jazz provided by Walter Keno and his (Hispanic) band. I have come here many times but have never ordered any food, but the hummus looks good. Usually I down like 9-10 beers at the ‘van but that night the tap was running hot or something so I had a corona and probably the worst whiskey soda I’ve ever tasted. I don’t know what kind of well whiskey they have but the flavor is truly bizarre. Anyway, I’ll probably be back

I loved the quirkiness of this place, and the food was excellent! I had tabouleh salad and the chicken pita. The salad could have been a meal by itself (since I was alone), and the chicken pita was one of the best ones I've had out. I'd definitely revisit if I'm in the neighborhood again.
This spot gives superb service and delicious menu. One of the best restaurant in the area. The drinks and food arrived quick and the prices were affordable. Recommended.

I went for the entertainment, Pumpkin Escobar and friends. The comedians are hilarious and engaging. The food was delicious. The service was great. I've been back several times and will go again soon.

formatted_address: 178 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
name: Vezzo Thin Crust Pizza

reviews.text: The best thin crust I've had in NYC. Cheesy packed slice with the perfect crust. Huge menu and great lunch specials. The homemade lemonade is amazing and YOU control the sweetness! The facility is lovely and warm, the staff nice and attentive. Great for solo dining, dates, family. A joyful lunch.

The pizzas here are nice and crispy. They're able to do this because the crust is nice and thin.

The pizzas have flavorful sauce and they are generous with the toppings.

The most delicious wonderful fantastic pizza restaurant in all of New York. I love their pizza options as well as their versatile appetizers and pasta dish offerings. Delicious food and great service. Disappointed that they don’t take reservations but aside from that, not a single complaint. You pay for culinary excellence and the polite service staff. I’ve been coming here for years. Used to go with my parents, now I go with my husband. Love love love vezzo.

One of the best thin crust pizzas I’ve had. You’re able to split the pizza in half to get two different kinds. I split and got the chickpotle, which was amazing. I couldn’t stop eating it even when I got very full. The staff is also really nice. Highly recommend.

When they say thin crust - they mean THIN. Crispy pizzas with good sauce to cheese ratio. The meatball pie was very good. 
Six slices on a 9 inch personal and 8 on the 16 inch large

formatted_address: 125 E 54th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
name: Le Reve

reviews.text: The place is nice, food is good, and music was decent. However if you’re booking for your birthday please find somewhere else. Management is highly unprofessional, and unorganized. I paid for a birthday package I never received. When trying to speak to the manager about my concerns he was very dismissive, and rude. Also two of my guests had their coats misplaced, and instead of the staff doing all they could to find the coats they instead insisted we wait for everyone to leave and then look through the remainder coats. How ridiculous. Definitely would not go back here. Not worth the stress, and dissatisfaction on my big day.

Went for brunch, $45 for bottomless sangria's and rasta pasta (wild good), that DJ was playing all of the hits from the 90's to current, good vibes, nice crowd, staff from security, bouncers, bartenders, party promoters were very polite and accommodating. Overall a positive experience.
Nice scene. Music is always on point. No dress code so everybody's chill, if you know what I mean. Bouncers can be a little aggressive but good vibes otherwise

Nice location service unorganized even when reservation is made. Service is very slow drinks are good food was good. Only thing I did not like was the fact of once day party was over everyone was asked to leave lights turned on so that a different type of crowd can come in. I was a little confused as to why we had to leave.

Grits were really good 
Drinks not so much

formatted_address: 61 W 8th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
name: Būmu

reviews.text:
The food is horrible. Bland. 

We ordered a few dishes:
1 UNI - THE BLANDEST thing I’ve ever tasted in my life, absolutely no flavor other than the Uni. The murky soup that came with it tasted just like nothing.
2. Hamachi - not fresh fish with barely any flavor 
3. Miso eggplant - It was just salty.
4.  Surf and turf- they claim they had foies gras. Didn’t taste it. The lobster was over cooked, it was so chewy. 
5. Short rib fried rice - the fried rice was so salty. The short rib was great, though.

Food was overpriced for what it is. They do have a large choice of drinks though 

I wouldn’t recommend coming.. the rating on yelp was much more accurate than google — 3 stars

Wow, just had an amazing meal here.
Everything was excellent, but the Uni with kelp was really sublime.  Excellent cocktails.
A really enjoyable night out.

Overall was an ok dining experience. 
Food was between authentic Japanese yakitori and a little bit fusion Japanese food. Basically in pricey way. Most recommendation dish was spicy shrimp udon which was great portion and tasted pretty good!! Others were very tiny portion, especially skewers.

Couldn’t be more enthusiastic about our meal here...
From the moment we walked in (sans res, with a infant, and they were mostly full) the staff was warm, welcoming, accommodating and gracious.
The beverage selection and wines on target.
Menu was so hard to chose from and all we had was well executed with knock your socks as well  with sublime subtlety of flavors.
We really enjoyed the meal. We really enjoyed ourselves.  Can’t wait to go back.

My friend and I stopped by on Thursday night. 
Thinking it might be crowded, we decided to make a reservation (Resy). 

This place is supposed to be Izakaya, but from our experience there, it's not. Izakaya is where the prices are very reasonable and have many dishes to choose from. So if you hope to find Izakaya food here, you might be disappointed.

FOOD:
The food is good. It's not bad, and dishes look good.
But it's nothing fancy nor does it leave any mark. Couple of dishes tasted very average, and did not have a wow factor at all. 
For the price they are asking for (average around $15), we were expecting more. 

We chose 6 dishes (2 from RAW and YAKI & PLATES) and with a drink each, we were not full. The only thing that might be Izakaya is the portion. The portion is not a lot. 

DRINKS:
Being Izakaya, we wanted sake. This place was nice enough to let us try couple of them before ordering. Sadly, after trying few, I was not impressed at all. I would like to have them update or relook into sake because they lack that department.  But they do have a good list of wine.

SERVICE: 
The service was good, friendly and professional.

OVERALL:
For the price we paid, I think it's going to be awhile for us to revisit it any time soon.
